reviews.review: Book it, is totally worth it!. My husband and I did the round trip experience, and we enjoyed every second of it. The scenery, the service, the band, the staff is all worth it. My only suggestion is during the Machu Picchu Tour, make sure you tell your tour guide if you want to go to the Puerta del Sol...we had to inform our guide, and thank God we did cause we would have missed it, since it was not on his agenda, and trust me it is the best location for you to take pictures and enjoy the majestic beauty of Machu Picchu!

An experience!. Sadly we arrived at the station after a tiring day hiking in Machu Picchu so felt in the wrong attire for such a special journey. We were offered a lot of alcohol that really wasn't needed but we had obviously paid for it in our ticket. The food was good but not exceptional. The musical entertainment was great fun. But it soon became dark and we just wanted to arrive at our destination. I am sure that it was due to my mood that the experience didn't 'tick all the boxes'

Pretty great experience except for the problem we experienced.. The pre-boarding experience with entertainment and champagne in Puroy lived up to the Orient Express experience(I still don't know why they changed the name to Belmond). We were seated at a nice large table on the right side of the train and the adventure started. Drinks could be had at the table or the observation car, which was the next car. View were spectacular following the river A four course meal along with wine was served and the morning meal was incredible. Food was very nice. We were told we would have the same table on the return journey at the end of the day and that is were the problem began.Machu Pichu was as incredible as I hoped it would be. Our guide Angela was accommodating to customers who could not make the climb up the stays and came runnig back to join us. Nice to see it even took a toll on younger people. They take you from the train to Machu Pichu on a bus and offer a guided tour. Afterwards you have a nice tea with a lot of food and beverages at the Belmond hotel that is at the gates to Machu Pichu. You take the bus back and are again entertained while waiting to board and saved champagne. We were escorted to our seats and to my dismay we were switched to a smaller table on the other ride of the train. I was very upset. Apparently part of the problems was my partners ticket had him sitting at anther table. This is weird as we purchased our tickets 8 months earlier paying full price and you think someone would have noticed. I let them no how upset I was and it totally influenced the journey home. As it is dark on the journey we did not miss much interns of view but the table was definitely not as nice and I did not enjoy the food or service as much. The train was much more crowded so staff was pretty busy keeping up. They tried giving us an amenity gift at the end with things like a pen which was gesture but I was still upset. When I got to the hotel and told the concierge what happened he was upset also. He asked me to hold off on my review. He had worked for the Hiram Bingham and contacted the manger of the train service to let him know about this. The two of them met with me in my room the next day and we had a nice talk were I accepted the sincerity of the apology and believe they will try and prevent something like this from happening again. The problem had been we had been assured we would have the same table on the way back and they should have known that was not the case. After the talk and a dinner offer I realized it really was a magical experience I should not let it effect my review. I did let them know I would write about so people who read this would be sure it does not happen to them.

Amazing luxury train journey to Machu Picchu. I booked this train trip for my husband as I knew he would love it, I had no idea that I would love it even more! The beautiful old luxury train interior and exterior, the service, the food, the entertainment on board (never thought I would enjoy a jam session with a band and other passengers in the viewing cart as much as I did! a natural high!), and the scenery along the way was a crescendo to Machu Picchu. A must.

Stellar way to reach Machu Picchu. This is a luxury train of of rich walnut with brass and beautiful textile accents. A five star restaurant and incredibly efficient staff. It enhances the trip to Machu Picchu beyond my wildest expectations

Well worth the splurge. The welcome, the service, the food, drinks and the entertainment were as wonderful as described in other reviews. Everything is included in this trip even your tickets to Macchu Picchu, the bus ride to the entrance, tour guide and a buffet tea before you return back to the train on the bus. As amazing as the train ride, service and food was, the unexpected treasure was our tour guide, Nick. He completely took care of us. His talent as a story teller and passion for his subject made for a delightful learning experience. He calmed our nerves over our height anxiety. Our budget did not allow for a round trip on the Hiram Bingham. We booked the Vista dome for the ride back. Nick knew our scheduled return and he packed our time, covering the entire area and getting us back in time for the tea buffet that was included in the Hiram Bingham trip. What I thought was a splurge was the best value for making the most out of our visit.

The Only Way to Travel to Machu Picchu. I booked this train trip six months before we were to travel to Peru. It was even better than expected! We rode the train to and from Machu Picchu and it was worth every penny. I felt that I was stepping back in time as we boarded the train. The food was excellent and the staff was first class. The party in the bar car was fantastic for people of all ages! I was concerned about the dress code for the train prior to going because I worried that our attire for trekking the ruins would be too casual, but it was fine. Most people on the train were dressed the same way and the atmosphere very beautiful and casual at the same time.

A stylish 90 km trip. Cuzco to Aqua Calientes: 0930a to around 1300A.C back to Cuzco: around 5:40 to around 9:15So on the way TO Machu Picchu, it's daytime. The locomotive is at the Machu Picchu side of the train, followed by the kitchen car, then 2 dining cars and 1 bar/lounge car with an open platform on the back. The train takes 3.5 hours to do 90 km, so it's not mind-blowingly fast, and a main attraction is to stand on the back platform with the breeze in your hair and your pisco sour in your hand, waving to villagers as you pass them. At one point going into a canyon, the train does switchbacks, meaning that switches have to be thrown at the front and back of the train--interesting to watch.On the way BACK, the locomotive is on the Cuzco side, but the rest of the train has not been turned. So the locomotive is right in front of the bar car, and the platform doors are locked to prevent the diesel exhaust from wafting through the train. Not that there's much to see anyway, since it gets dark soon after the train leaves.There's of course food and alcohol, the lovely polished wood and brass fittings of the 1920 carriages, and the ability to pretend that you're part of history. It's a bit reminiscent of the Blue Train in South Africa, but not quite as good because the tracks are really badly maintained, so the train lurches quite a bit. Many other trains use this track since MP is not otherwise accessible. The Vistadome trains looked quite comfortable and I'm sure they were much cheaper, but despite the high price (USD 380/direction) I was very happy to have taken the HB.

The perfect end to the day at Machu Picchu. This elegant train ride was an unexpected treat. After a long day at Machu Picchu, we entered a beautiful dining car and ordered our meal. We then proceeded to the bar car where we were treated to drinks and wonderful music and dancing. We returned to our dining car for an elegant meal and wine while we traveled back to Cusco. The service was excellent and the ride most enjoyable.
The WAY to Machu Picchu. A beautiful way to travel to Machu Picchu. The food and staff were wonderful. The journey of a lifetime onboard a very unique train. Worth every penny!

The way to go.... We decided to travel from Cusco to Agua Calientas (Machu Pichhu) on the Hiram Bingham train. It was the best decision we could have made. The decor, food, service, entertainment--it was all exceptional.

If you fancy a splurge. If you want to treat yourself then this splurge is worth it. We did! The journey was super relaxed and since we were off season it was not busy. Great welcome reception and dance performance at station. Staff were fantastic as was the food and nibbles. The scenery was some of the best I've experienced in all my travels and to top it off....endless pisco sours served chilled at the back of the open train with a live band. A brilliant journey.it included a tour guide of the Machu Picchu citadel and a buffet style afternoon tea.... I didn't want the day to end.

Very special!. One of our best experiences ever! Going to Machu Pichu on the Hiram Bingham was a truly special experience. Machu Pichu had been on my bucket list for a long time but it appeared to be such a difficult place to get to and staying at Belmond Rio Sagrado, taking the Hiram Bingham and spending one night at Belmond Sanctuary made everything so easy and wonderful.Our train ride was very nice we had preferred seating I suspect due to our guests at the hotel as well. Everything was so beautiful, the live band and the views were the special highlights. On the way going we did not get seats in the bar carriage therefore on our return trip we made sure to secure seats. The service is immaculate, food is good but not great. Together with the tour at Machu Pichu, I feel the price is fair for what you get, especially considering the difficulties in this terrain to provide anything five star!

Highlight of Peru. From the minute you arrive at the station you know you are in for something special. We were staying at the Belmond Monasterio in Cusco so went from luxury to luxury. The morning train included a band that very quickly had the patrons dancing, singing and enjoying Pisco Sours. The 3 1/2 hour ride went quickly and included an outstanding brunch in the morning. We returned the following day and again had an excellent dinner in the evening which again was highlighted by the band and more pisco sours. The train is expensive but worth every penny. I would also recommend staying at the Belmond Sanctuary as the location at the entrance gates to Manchu Picchu is worth another big expense.

A Great End To Our Machu Picchu Adventure. Our family did the 4-day Inca Trail trek in June, staying at Belmond properties at either end of the trip (Nazarenas in Cusco before the hike, then the Sanctuary at Macchu Picchu after the hike, returning to the Nazarenas the next day) and Belmond made the transfers seamless, making sure our luggage made it up to Machu Picchu's Sanctuary Lodge for our dirty, tired arrival there and onto the Hiram Bingham for our journey back to Cusco. We were a little concerned about having so much luggage on the train because we had read that you are only allowed a small bag, but apparently there's an exception made for people who do the trek (and it probably helps to stay at a Belmond property) because no one made an issue of it at all. Our wardrobe for this trip was extremely casual so I was a little concerned about the Hiram Bingham being too fancy for our hiker-friendly dress code (my nicest shoes were my Keen sandals) but it wasn't an issue at all, most of the passengers were wearing casual attire. Our kids (ages 8 and 15) were so excited to ride an old-style train and the fine dining on board was a real treat for them (and us). Afterward, my husband and I had drinks and all four of us really enjoyed the live music. It was kind of a surreal experience listening to a Peruvian band rock out to the Stones' "I Can't Get No Satisfaction" in a train car rumbling down the Peruvian Andes.Overall, a great end to our Machu Picchu trip. If we hadn't done the hike, I would've loved to take the Hiram Bingham up the mountain, because the views were probably great during the day, but we didn't mind not having any views at night, as our previous 5 days had been full of them during the trek and the subsequent stay at the Sanctuary.

Amazing and spiritual train ride. I have never seen a mixture of passenger of 4 continents to have such a prty within 5 minutes, all mental borders are gone and the music and the atmosphere do everything.the food is excellent, service as well, not to be missed, if possible

Excellent band, great food, fun to share with friends. This train ride started with a fabulous afternoon tea at Sanctuary Lodge. We were then taken down the mountain in a bus and escorted to the check-in lobby where bubbly was served. Dinner was magnificent, with every detail thought out. The wine list is also excellent. Although quite expensive it is a once in a lifetime trip, and worth the experience if it is within your budget. The band was great fun, and we loved the Peruvian drum. You just need to remember to visit the bar carriage in between courses so that you can make the most of the band.

Very impressive train ride.. This is top notch service all the way. From the check in lobby to the cocktails to the exquisite dinner. We were still musty from our day of hiking and felt very comfortable among the elegance of our surroundings. The dancing and singing were so much fun. Very sorry our trip was cut short and bus rides were substituted because of local labor strikes.

Brilliant concept ... if it doesn't coincide with the regular strikes . A great Pullman that matches our other trips on Orient Express trains ( such a better Brand equity than the made-up Belmond Brand ) however , it can be shorter than usual ( stopping at Ollytetambo rather than Puroy ) if you happen to be travelling during one of numerous strikes that afflict this country. I know when these things happen it is no fault of the owners , but when you pay such a high price to get on board it really leaves you feeling short changed to only go 50% of the way and then finish your luxurious experience in a tourist bus for 1hour 45 minutes rattling your way to Cusco in the dark ! As for getting a discount when such incidents occur you would have thought there was a well documented process led by the operator to ensure the pain is softened but unfortunately you have to do most of the legwork here- we think we have secured a 25% refund but have yet to see the money back in our account! The experience itself is well documented and the staff led by Andy - the train manager are a fantastic , enthusiastic team who pull out all the stops to make it special , whatever the circumstances We thought the food was at the right level for such a short journey and the bar experience with the local band makes it all a bit more fun ( especially if you have some Aussies on board who just love a singalong )All in all to be recommend as a great way to get back from MP

Dissappointing train journey. After a night of luxury in the sanctuary lodge and a magnificent afternoon tea put on in the lodge of train passengers our expectations were high. Too high it seems.The service on the train was good but there were a number of major issues.The train was only 2/3 full and we were all invited to the bar for the entertainment. But there were only seats for half the people. After a long day wondering the ruins and a now bumpy train ride a seat was required. Thus we missed out on the entertainment. In the bar we noticed the mosquitos, many of them dancing around the lights. When we returned to out table they seemed to have followed up. By the end of dinner there were about 10 dead ones on my white tablecloth. At least they had a means of dealing with them but after spending days covered in DEET trying not to get bitten we thought we would be safe on the train.And then there was the food. We had eaten in a number of Belmond Hotels on this trip and expected a similar standard of food, particularly after the above mentioned afternoon tea. The food was ok not nothing special and not up to the hotel standards. Yes we were on a train but we expected more given the cost and the publicity about the train.

what a blast!. my son and I splurged and rode the Hiram Bingham back from Machu Picchu to Cuzco - what a blast! We had an incredible dinner, and so much fun in the dining car with live music, dancing, playing instruments and meeting new friends. it was expensive, but for us, an experience not to be missed.

Machu Pichu in style. The whole package is superb, we traveled both ways on the Hiram Bingham train and felt all aspects of the trip were perfect and well worth the additional cost.On arrival at Poroy station we were greeted with champagne on the station platform and Peruvian musicians and dancers performed for us. After this we were shown to our seats in the restaurant car we then went to the bar car and got aquainted with our fellow travellers. The 3 piece band began to play a very entertaining selection of Peruvian and international music and the included bar service commenced for the entire trip. after about an hour we were escorted to our tables and the food service began. All of the food was very good and the complimentary wines from Chile and Argentina were very reasonable quality. Service in all respects was friendly and very professional, I would like to say a special thank you to our waiter Paulo who looked after us very well. All through the trip we were being kept informed and made aware of local customs by our concierge Carlos who gain did a fantastic job. On our arrival at Agua Calientes we skipped the lines and took our Belmond bus up to the gates of Machu Pichu. Our guide for the tour of the breathtaking citadel was Carlos who was superb and made our visit perfect.Then we went to the Belmond Sanctary Hotel for a delicious afternoon tea followed by our bus back to the station. The return trip was much the same as the upward trip but includes a more substantial gourmet meal and people seemed more inclined to drink more alcohol and the party in the bar car began. The band handed out a variety of percussion instruments and we all got involved in the music making, it was seriously good fun had by all. When making the decision to pay the extra for this trip do the sums, All the food and drinks are included, the quality of service makes you feel special, the entry fees to Machu Pichu are included, You get a top notch private guide included, afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Hotel is included, live entertainment is included , bus transfers are included. Overall I think it was worth every penny and I would not hesitate to do this again, go on splash out you wont regret it.

The only way to go...and back. Traveling on the Hiram Bingham was definitely a highlight of our journey in Peru. The cars were beautiful. Service on board was top notch. Food was wonderful both in taste as well as presentation. We enjoyed the lovely scenery along the way to Machu Picchu. The entertainment at the bar car was quite entertaining, especially in the evening. We took the train from Cusco to Machu Picchu and also on our way back. Riding the train during daytime and in the evening were 2 totally different experiences and it was worth to try both. Being the guests of the Hiram Bingham, we were also invited to the afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Lodge.The only disappointment was the disorganized bus ride we experienced when we arrived Machu Picchu Station. We did not quite understand why the guides handled such a small group of guests so poorly once we got off the train when that was something they do everyday. The buses were also not there when we arrived the bus stop. We were all waiting on the street for about 10 minutes. A poor ending to a fantastic train ride experience.

Top Shelf Entertainment!. More than a train ride, this experience exceeded every expectation! From pre-boarding champagne and local entertainment with native dancers and music to the final good-byes, the service and staff were impeccable. White linen tables were adorned with candles and crystal goblets. The deep Mahagony paneling provided coziness for the ambience while brass accoutrement lent its upscale presence to an already wonderful decorating scheme. On the 4-hour journey to and from Machu Pichu, we sang and danced and partied with a dynamic local band in the bar car, either before or after savoring 4-star cuisine. A truly unforgettable experience through the beautiful Sacred Valley and Amazon areas of Peru.

Worth the splurge. By far the only way to see Machu Picchu! From the opening reception (dancers, music, cocktails), to the spacious dining cars, the friendly and accommodating staff, en route guide explaining the area/history along the way, NO LINES waiting for the bus nor into/out of Machu Picchu (we actually felt guilty seeing the long lines for everyone else but us), and the wonderful entertainment all the way back to Cusco. It was worth every penny. I would only recommend this train.
Luxurious and scenic. Interesting to see the landscape and way of life. Seeing fields worked with oxen was fascinating. Scenery was so varied.

Worth every penny (sole)!. Decided, since doing a once in a lifetime trip to Machu Picchu, we would do it right and ride the BHB up and down. Food, service, view, comfort....all first class. If you can do it...do it!

Terrific Train Ride. Feb.2015:We had a great time riding the train to Machu Picchu. Rode it both ways. Terrific food, wonderful service, and the cars are so beautifully refurbished, reminiscent of the old days. Well worth it.

Great Train trip.. Great experience, well worth the couple of extra dollars. Excellent food, service, ambience. Couldn't fault this trip. Our guide, Erick, who accompanied us on the train then was our guide around Machu Picchu was superb! Very knowledgeable and generally good guy! As for Machu Picchu. WOW.

Fabulous trip. We took the Hiram Bingham both ways, it was a fantastic birthday present from my wife. Yes, it is expensive, but it really can't be faulted. The food, the service, the scenery, all out of this world. As a railway enthusiast I have to say that nothing can top a trip through the Andes on a narrow gauge railway ( Metre Gauge) eating a 'silver service' meal in the luxury of days gone by!! Plus, on the return journey, the local group performing and getting everyone to join in the singing in the bar, fabulous.

Amazing, amazing - fabulous day on the Hiram Bingham train!. Oh my – this was sensational – what a way to travel to Machu Picchu! I booked this journey over the internet from Australia before travelling to South America. PeruRail couldn’t have been more helpful with responses to a couple of questions that I needed clarification on after reading the website. They processed payment and issued my tickets which I printed off and took with me. There is quite a cost differential between the other trains and the Hiram Bingham but this is an experience from the moment you see the Hiram Bingham backing into the station. For those who haven’t been to Poroy Station, there is a small café and water vendors at the entrance for last minute purchases. You don’t need to worry about any of that if you are travelling on the Hiram Bingham. Having arrived at Poroy Station early enough to see one of the other trains depart (thanks to CuscoShuttle service! – see that review) – after the mass of people left on the early train, there were only a couple of others waiting – so I wandered around and took some photos and watched the Belmond team set up for our departure. Starting with a Belmond branded check in counter and a tray of champagne to greet guests as they exit the station for the train – it was a bit early for champagne for me with a long journey ahead but there was another non-alcoholic option – I’d had some breakfast back at the hotel so happy to watch everything unfolding! Ticketing provides a dedicated seat in one of the carriages and Russell was allocated as my waiter. Shown to my seat in the carriage and in the meantime, some traditional dancing and singing was underway on the platform. Wonderful to watch and prime yourself for the trip ahead! Colourful, traditional and musical – everyone enjoying the spectacle. A few other travellers jostling for the best view and forgetting that others might be there first and taking photos – I was taking a quick movie on my iPhone when some woman, a late arrival, dashed in front of everyone so we all have her in our movies! A bit thoughtless, but hey, there’s lots of that as you travel the world. Not going to let that spoil my day! Dance show over, time to get underway – carriages are beautiful, so comfortable, big picture windows. As I was travelling alone, I didn’t have to share my seating so had a dedicated table – all white linen, beautiful little table lamps and branded glassware. This was going to be a great day! Trundling off from Poroy through the suburbs, towns and into the Sacred Valley. Easy photo opportunities without too much effort just through the picture window. Food, as expected was fantastic! A couple of Danish pastries and orange juice to whet the appetite and just couldn’t wait for the lunch menu! Lovely wines partnered with the meals with sparkling or still water on tap. The three-hour journey went smoothly and quickly. It was really relaxing. I was there to enjoy the scenery and the adventure. There was live music in one of the cars and I wandered through to see but it was really loud and noisy and I preferred the peace of my seat and the passing scenery – so headed back to my seat. I detected a look of envy from some travellers on train platforms as we moved through a couple of the stations. On arrival into Machu Picchu Station, the Hiram Bingham passengers have a dedicated waiting room – with bathrooms and tables and chairs. Took a little while to sort out who was going with which guide but once sorted we headed off through the market area across the river to the bus collection area for the trip up to Machu Picchu. Buses sorted and on our way. Not having to organise any of these connecting activities was a huge advantage – the whole day is organised including a very informative guide. The landing area at Machu Picchu entry is totally chaotic and is the last bathroom stop (take some Soles to pay for bathroom) before walking into the ruins. Guide was fantastic – although one criticism (and was commented on by another reviewer) – spent too long standing in the sun telling us history when all we wanted to do was walk around and take photos – then hear the history. I asked to move on and not waste time standing around – time for me was limited and Australia to Machu Picchu – yep, unlikely to do that again so I wanted to maximise my time there. Lucky we were a group of three plus guide, so it was easy to move around – advantage of being slightly off season. Followed the signage within the site and guide provided commentary on key sites, temples, etc. Not time to do high climbing nor across to the housing areas at the base of Huayna Picchu – but I was so happy just to be there that it didn’t matter and enough views to satisfy! The day was stunning so photos are glorious. Other advantage with the Hiram Bingham, is that with the later arrival time, many visitors have already left to start their return journey – so I have photos with no-one in them. Later in the day, headed across to the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge (included in he experience) for afternoon tea – our small group were a bit late getting there and didn’t really have time to enjoy the fabulous spread, but Machu Picchu was the focus – so afternoon tea was secondary! That was not before the ranger brought his troop of llamas back from their free-ranging - so what an escort out of the ruins! Back on the bus for the return trip down to the station. Assembling in the dedicated waiting room, everyone looked weary and ready for the return trip! Lovely to have somewhere to rest and collect yourself before the homeward journey. A few tired bodies on the return journey – it was getting dark and completely dark by the time back to Poroy. Dinner was a highlight – wonderful to experience five-star dining trundling slowly back to Poroy. There appeared some who did the one-way journey back to Poroy – who were so tired they just slumped on the table and didn’t really enjoy the experience. I was pampered with a pillow and rug as the evening was cool and the train carriage was a little chilly. On arrival back, there was my trusty cusco shuttle waiting for me to take me to my hotel – the end of a truly amazing day! One note for travellers, each table has a power point so take a charge cable/adaptor for your accessories - then your iPhone is fully charged ready for Machu Picchu.

Best way to get to Machu Picchu. We did a one way journey to Machu Pichu with Hiram Bingham train and came back with Vistadome. It was expensive but it is worth it! The one way trip includes morning tea, three course lunch, private tour guide and afternoon tea. The one way journey does not include the bus ride back down to Aguas Calientes but our tour guide is kind enough to give us a complimentary bus ride back to the train station for us to catch our return journey with Vistadome! The service is impeccable and the food is superb quality, we really enjoyed the tripvery much! Highly recommended!

From Cusco To Machu Picchu and Back. Took this railway to get to Machu Picchu and back.The service was outstanding and the ride wonderful.The Peruvian tracks are a bit wobbly, but the 4 hour excursion each way was definitely the way to go.First class staff with first class service.Fun, live entertainment in the bar car.Dining was first class also.No delays at all; everything was great. I'd do it again!

Unforgettable!!! . A short trip will remember for a long time!! Amazing views well trained staff and great ambience to make your trip to Aguas caliente and back to Cuzco unforgettable!! Highly recommend it

Not quite the Orieny Express but very good. After a day walking and climbing around Machu Picchu what better way to return to Cusco than by the Hiram Bingham Express. It is a magnificent old train with a fabulous interior. The first hour or so of the journey can be taken in the 'bar' carriage where a trio of musicians get everyone involved (if they want to) whilst enjoying a drink or two.Then dinner is served in the dining car. It is all silver service and very good too. Maybe not the best meal ever but not bad for a train. After dinner you can stay where you are or return to the bar for more entertainment.A great experience especially as we were in quite a big group so the atmosphere was very good.

Outstanding. The Hiram Bingham experience is without doubt a must do if wishing to visit Machu Picchu and budget permits.Looking purely at the economics, this option cannot be solely compared to the much lesser priced Vistadome - 10 times cheaper, the Vistadone is not 10 times worse... it is an excellent train with good service, a decent snack and some entertainment provided through a traditional dance and a small fashion show, awkwardly but sweetly done by the train's won crew... very fun. So for US$80 return, Vistadome is a great way to reach Machu Picchu in comfort.Why then pay US$800 for essentially the same journey - because with Hiram Bingham you get an entire end to end experience - on the way to Aguas Calientes a great lunch in the wonderful dinning car - also access to a bar and observation car with musicians.Upon arrival, you're assisted to a waiting room and then transferred to the entrance of the site via private buses whilst your luggage or bags are securely kept (or transferred directly to a hotel if staying overnight). There, guides are assigned in small groups (we actually had booked a private guide but our initially assigned group was only comprised of 2 more people besides us four). After the visit (3 to 4 hours) you reconvene in the Machu Picchu lodge for a high tea which is very comprehensive with lots of different delicacies. This is a well-thought program which allows a great visit as well as plenty of rest.For those staying overnight, it is then time to transfer to your hotel and for those returning to Cusco it's back on the train for dinner and a final transfer.The organization is precise, the guide and staff excellent and this is without a doubt the best way to visit the incredible Machu Picchu site.I would suggest two options: either doing this as a day trip, only using the Hiram Bingham train or if budget and availability permits, using the HB train but also staying one night in the Machu Picchu lodge (also operated by Belmond). This provides what I'd see as the ultimate way to experience this magnificent site.

Silver Service Rail. I had heard and read a lot about delays and disorganisation using the rail in Peru but we must have been lucky to score a good day.It's a real treat to get first class experience on the Hiram Bingham train after an overnight stay at Machu Picchu.Being on a 1920's train with white tablecloths, large comfortable arm chairs and fine dining was topped by a group of very entertaining musicians. They not only played music but worked the crowd with their wit, humour and enthusiasm which was very infectious.Despite the chaos we were expecting, the bus transfer from Machu Picchu was on time, we were quickly checked and processed onto the train where we were greeted with a glass of wine and entertained by the musicians till it was service time for dinner. Great atmosphere and beautiful train. Well worth it!

This is the best way to avoid Machu Picchu chaos. With Hiram Bingham, you are paying for a first class experience and mostly getting it. All visitors to Machu Picchu, whether going with Hiram Bingham on using regular services, should be prepared for some chaos. Late trains, lack of busses, huge crowds, general disorganization and lines. In addition to the great train experience and staff attention, you are paying to avoid some of the chaos. Generally Hiram Bingham does okay but it's not perfect. There were major bus delays on both ends of our tour, impacting the experience. The tour of the ruins was okay but also cut short. The staff did their best to help manage the guests through all of this but even the first-class service could not make up for some problems at Machu Picchu and along the way. The food - I'd characterize it as a slight step above Business Class airline food. Nice Peruvian flavors but not what you'd get at a top restaurant in Cusco. The Train, entertainment and onboard experience were top-notch - Five StarsThe Staff - Fantastic Great Pisco sours on board.
Fantastic trip. A really fantastic trip to Machu Picchu they catered for vegetarians and we were entertained by a group playing every one was happy and the staff were brilliant. Well worth the money.

Absolutely fabulous!. We seriously doubted that this trip would be worth the money but we are only visiting Machu Picchu once so what the hell. In fact the train almost stole the show over the sights. The staff, atmosphere on board and overall experience on board were wonderful and you beat all the horrendous lines waiting for buses. I would advise anyone not to take some travel agents advice and get off in the sacred valley on the way back. You would miss the whole experience in the bar before dinner! Travel back to Poroy.

Great experience. It was a great way to end our magical time at Machu Pichu. Great service and food. My only wish is that I had not been so tired coming down from Machu Pichu, but otherwise, it was a fabulous experience. Definitely worth it!

Luxury train. This train, although a bit touristy, is luxurious.Fast and professional check-in, with a glass of champagne at boarding.Entertainment (traditional Andean dancing and Andean live music) at boarding. Very punctual. Good service throughout the journey. Spanish and English-speaking guide during the journey and also the service of a guide included at Machu Pichu.Food and alcoholic drinks included ( it was a three course brunch served at 11 am). Some exquisite drinks (wines, champagne and spirits) were chargeable.The trip itself was very enjoyable, scenery was amazing and although in the morning it was very foggy, it turned out to be a superb day, with clear blue skies and lots of sunshine.The train had a few cars, including a bar car with live music.The train was nicely decorated and quite full.Trip took around 3 hours and 30 minutes, before arriving at Aguascalientes Station.The trip from there to Machu Pichu was another 20 minutes by bus ( the bus also included in the price ).

We Felt Like We Were In A Movie!. When we arrived at the train station we immediately started posting pictures on Facebook. By the time we got settle on the train friends were commenting on our posts that "it looks like you guys are in a movie". We didn't want the 4 hour train ride to Mach Picchu to ever end. It was so amazing that when we got off the train and sat down on the bus traveling a short distance to the ruins, I looked over at my wife and she was so happy there were tears in her eyes. I asked her if she was ok and she said' "I don't know how you will ever top this vacation". This was a dream come true for both of us. The service and food is amazing! I promise you will NOT be disappointed.

Once in a lifetime experience!. You are able to take this gloriously elegant train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes either as a one-way trip in either direction or as a return trip. Be sure to check train times if you are planning on observing the scenery as the evening train journeys afford no views due to the surrounding darkness. Certainly traveling by this train is like taking a jump back in time in terms of style and service but manages to do so without being shabby or tacky or inefficient. Service is world class, as one would expect. The four course meal that is provided with the ticket is classy, refined, and often has a Peruvian flare to it, which is very enjoyable and certainly unique, e.g. cream of quinoa soup. There is a wonderful bar car (drinks are included with your ticket, too - woohoo!) with live entertainment and we found ourselves dancing and laughing with the band for the entire duration of the journey. Epic fun! Other helpful tips for the keen train traveler - there is a separate platform and waiting lounge with cocktails for Belmond ticket holders. You may book ahead of time but booking in Peru is actually cheaper and we found there was reasonable availability when we did so about two days ahead of travel. I suppose that may depend on the season, however, so best ask a local tour guide. The dining car seats groups in tables of four or two persons - as we were a group of six, we requested seats opposite each other, instead of in line with each other, and the team was happy to accommodate our request. This was absolutely a highlight of our trip and we will remember this experience our whole lives. We saved a bit on cost, though, by taking up the Inca Dome train for the views, and then the Belmond Hiram Bingham down to Cusco so we could enjoy our meal and the experience as a whole instead of obsessing over taking pictures. Worked out brilliantly for seeing the valley on the way up and we did not break the bank accomplishing our 'bucket list' item!

A fabulous experience!. This train journey was one of the highlights of our trip. The observation car was fabulous. A great way to see the stunning scenery in a relaxed atmosphere with a pisco sour in hand! Plus we have some absolutely wonderful photos. Small downside is that the music in the bar car is very loud, but you can simply retreat to the dining car for some peace and quiet. The food was excellent. The service was friendly and professional. The train was comfortable.There is no getting away from the fact that it is an expensive way to make the journey but the train it is a fabulous experience in itself, notwithstanding you arrive at Machu Picchu! Our tour of Machu Picchu was excellent and very informative. The afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Lodge was a welcome opportunity to relax after the tour. The whole trip was very well organised and I would definitely recommend it.

A destination in its own right. If you have ever wanted to ride the rails in style this is your chance. The entire train was brought over from Asia and retrofitted to work on the Peruvian railroads. It was a great way to depart from Machu Picchu. Before you board the train you are treated to afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Lodge. You then board a bus that is exclusively for Hiram Bingham passengers. You are taken to a decidedly Colonial waiting room at the train station where drinks are served. After this each party is escorted by their steward to their seats on board where you are served a lovely three course meal. They even offered to bring items for my children that were off the menu.Admittedly, this is the most pricey option of transportation that can be chosen for this journey but if romantic train journeys are on your bucket list this is a great one to choose.

Is it really worth it?. I can't honestly say that the Hiram Bingham was worth it. That's partly because we paid as part of a package so never looked at the cost. It's also because I suspect that in cost per mile, or cost per quality of the food/drink it probably wouldn't compare very well.However, that's not the point at all. It's really an experience and an unforgettable one at that. The journey to Machu Picchu is full of anticipation - arriving just in time to have a tour of the ruins and afternoon tea at the hotel nearby. The next day we'd climbed Huayna Picchu and were tired out but enjoyed the party atmosphere as the train trundled back to Poroy in the dark. The two trips had a quite different feel but both were perfect bookends for the visit to Machu Picchu itself. The food and drink were good, the service excellent and the entertainment very enjoyable. Our guide at the ruins was superb and helped make the trip - he rambled on forever but he was so proud of his heritage that you couldn't help but admire his enthusiasm even if you didn't take it all in. All in all, whether on the daytime descent into the jungle to Machu Picchu or the party on the return, it was thoroughly enjoyable and, yes, probably worth every penny.

Fun, unique and fancy!. Despite the expense, the travel to and from Machu Picchu is considerably easier, guided and more delightful. After a long day of the mountain some entertainment and amazing food is just what you will need!

Good train ride. . The seats were comfortable and the staff friendly. The snack was a little anti-climactic. We took the vistadome which I recommend just to be able to fully appreciate your surroundings.

Well worth it!. We boarded the train in Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. We were surprised by the lovely table service, food and well-coordinated transfer to Machu Picchu, the tour, tea on the way there. We returned to Cusco and while a 4 hour journey at the end of a long day of hiking, it too exceeded our expectations.The food was good. The service impeccable.We took the trip with my 78 year old aunt who has 'pulmonary' issues and everything was so well co-ordinated!We were lucky enough to stay at the Sanctuary Lodge and I think the combination of the Hiram Bingham train and the stay at Machu Picchu was actually an excellent value!

Great, but value for cost not there. We were on a very high end trip through South America. I loved the Hiram Bingham - but when I look at the cost vs. value, next time I would just take the Vista Dome back to Cusco. Yes the HB is lovely and you have a great meal and free drinks and enthusiastic entertainment - but in the end it is just a train ride with good, but not great food and drinks. On our entire trip, this is the only thing I would not do next time. That said, I'm glad we did it and suggest that going one way on the HB is maybe worth trying.

More Than Just a Train. The Hiram Bingham is legendary and the experience from start to finish is that of royalty. It is like a dream as you are taken up the steps to the train and start your journey with a glass of champange and are escorted to your table. From there you are presented with you set menu for your journey to Machu Picchu. The staff is very accommodating with food allergies as my sister has a gluten allergy and cannot eat pineapple. The Pisco Sour I had on the HB was the best I had in my entire stay in Peru.Sadly the panoramic car was under maintenance that ride so we could not enjoy that but the view from our table was amazing. The staff anticipated the need for anything we could have asked for. Other than hiking directly to Machu Picchu, I could not think of any other way I would have enjoyed to get there.

Worth the price. We started out journey to Machu Pichu from Sacred Valley on the Vistadome, not aware there was another, far better choice.Fortunately we were able to change the return trip to Cusco so we could experience the Hiram Bingham - and what a great experience it was! Great service, elegant cars, good food and fabulous entertainment. Before dinner was served we sang and danced to oldies in the bar car - everyone enjoying the drinks, hors d'oeuvres, and the moment!! I would highly recommend this experience - though it comes at a cost - well worth it!

Fabulous. We booked this as a treat after visiting Machu Picchu. MP is definitely a massive highlight - but a journey on HB is such fun & a fabulous ending to a great experience. I had chosen to take the Vistadome morning train from Urubamba (hotel Rio Sagrado) and that was good because we enjoyed taking in the views of the countryside. But the journey back from Machu Picchu to Cusco is in the dark so it is all about the entertainment. I highly recommend that you head to the bar carriage as soon as it opens as it fills up fast. We were lucky to get a seat close to the band - the atmosphere was fantastic. The train staff were all joining in with the dancing & singing. After the band finished playing we returned to our seats to be served dinner. Best train journey we have ever had. I highly recommend. Not cheap but worth every penny.

Great Train ride. The whole experience was wonderful. Food couldn't have been better. Our guide at Machu Picchu was from Hiram Bingham, and she was the best, really knew her history.We would recommend it to anyone.

Luxury on Rails. Rode the Hiram Bingham both directions and had fabulous experience each way. The food was quite delicious and the service impeccable each way. It is an experience to put on your bucket list (if not there already). On the way to Macchu Picchu you get a great send off with a Peruvian Quartet and dancers giving you a show. There is a band in the bar car, which was very good but as everyone was looking out the widow the atmosphere was sort of staid. On the way back the bar car was really hopping, so come early and if you want to preserve your hearing sit at the back of the car (behind the band). The Pisco Sours and Chilean wines are excellent.

Just DO It!. My husband and I decided to splurge on the Belmond Hiram Bingham as we were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary and really wanted to have a memorable day...and we are SOOO glad we did! The service is absolutely exceptional - from the time of embarkation, when you are shown your seats and then given the opportunity to enjoy the live music, dancers, and drinks that bid you farewell from the station at Poroy, to the fabulous meals, drinks, and live music aboard the train. Although the train holds approximately 84 people, our train was only about 1/3 of that capacity which made it very easy to relax in the bar car and enjoy the music while watching the beautiful Sacred Valley roll by. At Machu Picchu we had a guide (part of the cost) that took five English-speakers around to see the sites for about two hours- very low-key and comfortable, not having to scramble to hear what was being said. Afterwards the afternoon tea in the lodge was plentiful and delicious. The trip back was a highlight as the performers entertained as dinner was being prepared and got the audience involved - dancing to the music as the train wended its way back to Poroy. We spent two wonderful weeks in Peru but this was a magical day and worth every penny!

A bucket list trip!. I can't say enough about the Hiram Bingham! I went with my dad and we had a blast. I wish the trip had lasted longer. Great food and drink, beautiful scenery though the Andes. Everyone on the train seemed to love it.The entertainment on the train was first class!

Great Way to end your Macchu Picchu experience!. After two days in Macchu Picchu, this was a fabulous way to end the experience. It is a great train with fabulous food and service. It is very expensive but we really enjoyed the luxurious setting, fine dinning experience, great bar cart. It was terrific

Worth It. Rated one of the top 10 train trips in Conde Nast magazine, I agree. We only took it back from Macchu Picchu, so you start with a fantastic large 4 pm English style tea with deserts at the Sanctuary Lodge just outside the ruins, then private bus to the train. Once your meal orders are taken at your table on the train, shoot for a stool at the bar of one of the 2 bar cars, sit, drink, and listen to the excellent entertainment for until it's time to return to the dinner car for dinner. All food and unlimited drinks included. One note, the train does not arrive in Cusco downtown anymore but outside of the city in another town. Make sure you make advance taxi reservations for pickup and transportation back to Cusco as there are no taxis waiting to pick up people!!!!!!

THE way to travel to Macchu Picchu. We opted to splurge on our train trip to Macchu Picchu and so glad we did. The Belmond Hiram Bingham is a fantastic way to spoil yourself on the way to MP and enjoy a four hour ride to the famous Incan site. You are greeted with Peruvian music and a cocktail as you board the train. The staff takes great care to attend to your needs and ensure you have every comfort available to you during the ride. We spent most of our time at our table drinking tea or cocktails before the lunch was served. The meal was also delicious, starting with smoked trout then on to a steak. We briefly went to the back car where the bar and band were playing. It was pretty packed, as other passengers enjoyed the spectacular view. The train would usually honk whenever we saw folks hiking the Incan trail. Once you get to MP, you can opt for a tour guide. We had Yrma who was absolutely fantastic and very knowledgeable about MP. She deftly navigated thru the large crowd at the entrance of MP and quickly moved us to the top of the mountain. This gave us an unbelievable introduction into MP and she graciously taught us about the history of MP throughout our three hour tour. Fun tip from Yrma: bring three coca leaves and when you get to the sun dial, make a wish, say the name of MP, HP and a peak in your country, and then place the leaves on the ground. Yrma told us the magic of MP should grant us travelers our wish. At the end of the tour, you are given tea at the Belmond's hotel at MP. We did not have enough time as we opted to take the Vistadome back to Cusco. All in all, it was a great way to get us to MP and start off that leg of our trip on a high note!
Really enjoyed . The service was excellent, we really enjoyed our ride to machupichu on this train. It's all very classy, the food was great, nice bar and live music.

Fantastic way to travel!. It was just like being in a classic movie on the Orient Express. I wish the ride had been longer. We had an amazing view and the service was spot on. The best way to relax and enjoy the view of the Sacred Valley. Do not miss this opportunity!!

Fabulous experience, worth the high price...but there IS a downside. We took the Hiram Bingham from the Sacred Valley (Ollententaybo) to Aguas Calientes, and then back from Aguas Calientes to Cuzco (Poroy Station). The train is absolutely beautiful and you can imagine yourself in the golden era of travel aboard the Orient Express (which this train used to be called). The service is great, the food is wonderful, and the entertainment in the bar car is really, really good. The only downside is that the trip back to Cuzco leaves at 5:50 pm and arrives in Poroy at about 9:30 pm. It is dark the whole trip, so there are no views at all...and it makes for a very long day by the time you get to your hotel in Cuzco. But, the late departure does allow you to stay up at Machu Picchu until the bus leaves the Belmond Sanctuary.Lodge to take you down to the train station at about 4:45 pm.

Great trip and experience. Took the HB train one way to Machu Picchu and really enjoyed the experience. From the moment you arrive at station they take great care of you. From champagne when you board to the great food and free drinks. Since we were touring MP that day, didn't drink very much. The train is beautiful and service is great. The trip also comes with a 2-3 tour of Machu Picchu and tea at Sanctuary Lodge. In addition to the dining cars, they have a bar and also observatory cars. Train is a bit rocky but I think it is all part of the experience. It is really a great experience and we are glad we did it as part of our trip.

Great, fun train journey to Machu Pichu.. We travelled on this lovely train to Machu Pichu, and back.On the way it was daytime, so beautiful,scenery to look at.We had brunch, which was in fact a full blown lunch at 11.30 am. We went into the bar and had music from local musicians which was fun.On the return, we had a very different experience.The music in the bar was loud, and fun. Lots of pisco sour, and dancing!!We had dinner, which was again delicious.More music and dancing, but we were so tired we just relaxed and chatted to fellow passengers till we reached our destination.The train is a great experience and on returning to the station, we didn't need to queue for about a hour, as we had a private shuttle bus back to the station. Definite bonus!

Once in a lifetime trip. Everything was exemplary from the moment you step up to the train. The interior is gorgeous and takes you back to a time of opulence from the last century. The endless drinks, live music, wonderfully attentive staff and superb meal were all excellent. The red trout (often mistaken for salmon) was well prepared. We feel it was worth the extravagant expense for a unique experience.

Wonderful experience. A truly fabulous experience from the time we left our hotel in Cusco until we were returned around 9.30pm. The Hiram Bingham service is exceptional, delicious food, wine etc and Peruvian music along the journey in the bar and observation car. Everything is taken care of, private bus to the gates of Machu Pichu, our guide German Perez was truly amazing with his knowledge of the area, he then escorted us to the Belmond Hotel for afternoon tea and then delivered us back down the mountain to the Train for an evening of fine food, wine and music.

You have to do this...... Firstly it's not for everyone, we paid around US$ 700 per person for a return trip to Machu Pichu and this includes everything. We were picked up from the hotel and escorted to the railway station around 20 mins from town. The train leaves daily from around 9 am except Sunday's. The trip to Machu Pichu is around 4 hours and you are in a train of very high quality and finish with a non stop supply of anything you needed to eat or drink by staff who were outstanding, including a three course meal, wine, beer etc. you are then escorted to up the mountain via coach to the entrance of Machu Pichu and your guide will look after you throughout. We had Carlos, brilliant. When the tour is over you are invited for afternoon tea and more food at the local cafe and then escorted back to the train for the four hour journey back to Cusco. This trip can be pretty loud as the alcohol flows and the Americans are not short of an opinion or two but it was all good fun. We got back to Cusco around 9.30 pm. It's a long day, you can of course stay overnight in Machu Pichu and break the trip up. At only 6000 ft above sea level I never suffered as much as I did in Cusco so it was also nice to breath air with a bit more oxygen. Overall quite expensive but everything is taken care of and when you overtake the other trains that are crammed full of people who tried to save a buck you get to appreciate the decision you made.

I Was Disappointed. First, I’d emphasize that value-received-for-dollar-spent never figured into my opinions. For excursions like this, it just isn’t done.From my Holland-America and other sources (Moon), I was expecting a true luxury experience. That didn’t happen. In effect, I wasted some valuable time getting to Machu Picchu. (On the return trip, that wasn’t a factor.)To start off, what was supposed to be a 15-minute ride to meet the train at Poroy station turned out to be a two-hour haul over the dreaded mountains and switchbacks to Ollantaytambo, or halfway to Machu Picchu.Ok, what I was expecting was a leisurely journey with my genteel, somewhat elderly Holland-America crowd in relaxed, roomy surroundings that the brochures spoke of. Instead, the train was packed with an equal sized complement of rowdy, boozing, hell-raising X-ers. In addition to the elevated noise level, one could hardly turn around, and the tavern / observation car was inaccessible because of the crowd.Dining service was variable. The brunch going down was excellent but too much for a midday meal – better suited for an evening meal. The ‘trout’ on the return dinner menu turned out to be salmon. There is a difference, you know. Another unmet expectation.On the positive side, the facilities and service provided were excellent.My only basis for comparison is Alaska Railroad’s “McKinley (now Denali ?) Explorer.” Less pretentious than the Bingham, it would still be my choice for a riding experience.

Fabulous Short Railway Journey. This was a wonderful experience in the fashion of the Orient Express inclusive of food and drink. The food was exceptional. Many people were enjoying champagne.Everything was presented perfectly. We sat in the dining car for most of the journey but the rear carriage was a bar and open backed with panoramic Windows. There was a Peruvian trio playing music. It was great fun until it got a bit crowded. We were only disappointed we only had a one way ticket and had to come back on another train. That was fun though as they had a traditional clown and a fashion show to entertain us and pass the time.

Family trip. I stayed with my family at the Belmond Palacio Nazarenas, near the Belmond Monasterio, both of them, amazing. I took a taxi from the hotel and in less than 45 minutes, I was in the train station, that receives you with welcome drinks and really beautiful dances typical from Cuzco, you can take pictures and even dance with them. Food and beverage was good quality, you can request beers, wine, water, sodas, all of them are included, their 3-parts-menu was delicious and they have special alternatives in case someone has special diet (my dad for example, he can't eat any meat, so the maitre offered us a vegetarian dish or some smoked trout). You can´t leave the train without drinking a pisco sour and listening to the show in the last part of the train, where you can see the amazing cusco landscape.

Amazing. This train was not only beautiful but all the staff were very friendly. The service was unbelievable and food to die for. I thoroughly recommend this form of transport to the mountain. It has style and class. Loved it

Good but not orient express . I have been lucky enough to travel on the real orient train and this one has all the trappings with a beautiful carriage and finely laid out trimmings but it left us underwhelmed. Food was just OK and wines were just about drinkable but it is more Peru Rail than Belmond. A silly charge for a G&T seemed unnecessary given the inclusions for everything else. I felt they are trying to get too much into a short journey. Overall just OK

Nice train, shaky and a overpriced. . I took this train back from Machu Picchu and expected much more for the price tag which is hundreds more than the Vistadome. There was nothing spectacular about the trip. The food was so-so. Service was incredibly rushed. I was asked to give up my seat so a group could be together. The train supposedly goes faster on this route because it's night time. But this made the train incredibly shaky. We couldn't walk up and down the aisles. Also, the curtains obstruct the view quite a bit.

Absolutely amazing!!. I had to come for business to Lima and decided last minute to extend my trip with a visit to Cusco and Machu Picchu. I've always been intrigued by the Orient Express style trains so booked a one way on the Hiram Bingham, direction Cusco to MP. The whole experience is amazing!! From the absolute meticulous service you receive each step of the way, the abundance of food and drinks (and tea), to an unforgettable train ride and visit of MP with a great guide. Given, it's expensive, i payed around 350$ one way but it's worth every cent. My thoughts: Stay one night in Aguas Calientes - go by HB and return by Vista train the day after (100$), there's no need to spend almost 700$ on a return ticket.

Great Family Experience. We took the Hiram Bingham train back to Cusco after two days of hiking the Inca Trail, visiting Machu Picchu, and climbing Machu Picchu Mt. We felt truly spoiled with drinks and live music in the waiting room which continued on our trip back to Cuzco. Even though we were tired they kept us well entertained and feed with lively music in the bar and restaurant cars. The Pisco Sours, champagne, and wine kept flowing throughout the ride. Dinner was excellent and service exceptional.
Choo choo to Machu Picchu. Loved the train! The food was excellent -the service was top notch and the music was wonderful! Definitely a stylish trip to MP! I would highly recommend !

Unforgettable and Magnificent . We were six adults and two young children and we were all pampered from the moment we stepped on to when we stepped off this beautiful train. If you want to be wined and dined with beautiful scenery passing by, this trip provides it all. It includes a gourmet lunch and dinner, open bar as well as tea at the SanctuaryLodge. The cost is all inclusive. We had a guide named Miss Breytzi Carrion. Kudos to her for her knowledge and style of explaining the history of Machu Picchu and her patience with our large family. Belmond is not inexpensive but it's a priceless memory.

Spectacular train ride! Not to be missed!. If you can afford it, the Hiram Bingham train from Cusco (Poroy Station) to Aguas Calientes / Machu Picchu is the most spectacular way to see the Incan ruins. The champagne, the music, the food and the antique elegance of the train cars makes for an unforgettable experience. This train ride is a once in a lifetime experience not to be missed. The ticket includes a bus ride from Poroy station to Belmond Sagrado station (value $50), gourmet food / drink (value $75), a round trip bus ride from Aguas Calientes to the MP ruins (value $24) and a guided tour of MP ruins (value ~$70). We took the Hiram Bighman to Machu Picchu ($345) and the cheaper Expedition train ($62) on the way back. We booked everything online and then collected our tickets during our flight transfer in Lima.

Hiram Bingham Orient Express Train, what to do if you get bumped. We had prepaid round trip Belmond Hiram Bingham Orient Express train tickets, in fact they are still in my possession. The operator, Peru Rail, chose the revenue of large groups in deference to our small group. What we suggest is the Inca Rail Presidential Car, a charter, which you must book in advance from Peru Rail's competitor. This car seats up to 8 passengers, in comfortable surroundings, wood paneling, banded yew wood tables, upholstered swivel club chairs, a private chef and wait staff. To charter this car costs $1250 one way, while the Hiram Bigham costs upwards of $300.00 per person. Do the math. Enjoy

Unforgettable experience. Expensive? yes. But worth the price in every way. We were so thoroughly taken care of on the train. When we arrived at the train station in Poroy, we were both struggling a bit with the altitude. It was such a relief to have everything taken care of by the attentive and kind staff. The food was excellent and locally sourced. The train was small and comfortable and the service was exemplary. The live music was high quality and an added bonus. The Hiram Bingham train is something that I would highly recommend. We will definitely be bringing our family on the next trip.
Luxury vacation . Had an amazing time. Staff was excellent: Hugo, Gorki, Maurice, Javier, Eric, Angela all were extremely helpful . Worth every penny. Everything arranged from pick up to drop off.

Unforgettable. Not cheap but worth every dollar. From the moment we arrived at the station till the time we departed the train every single detail was first rate. The entertainment was first rate, we danced and sang. The food was very well presented and the service was excellent. For us the single table was somewhat large making holding hands between course a little difficult. Every member of staff was very friendly and made you feel at home and welcome. A not to miss part of going to Machu Picchu.

Exceeded All Expectations. The experience we had on this luxury train was no doubt as cool as seeing Machu Picchu itself. The staff were impeccable and all spoke English. The band was lively and colorful and made the trip unforgettable. The food was well prepared, and the drinks were plentiful. All in all, I would highly recommend splurging a little for this experience for anyone who doesn't want to make the trek on foot.

Nice train ride. You'll get better food, drinks and music elsewhere on stationary ground, but the Hiram Bingham is an enjoyable ride between Machu Picchu and Cusco. I would recommend taking it only one way and using the vistadome train during the daytime. You don't need to listen to the same mariachi band twice unless you really like that kind of music. Service on the train was hospitable. There's a separate waiting area in Aguas Caliente station for the Hiram Bingham guests.

Wonderful experience!. We took the train on the way back from Machupicchu to Cuzco. It was truly a wonderful experience that we will always cherish. Before boarding, we had high tea at the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge. Desserts were so tasty! High tea is included with the train ticket as well. From arrival to departure, it was a first class experience. Food and drinks were excellent. Andy Montufar (Train Manager), Maia (Maitre D'), and our main server Paulo made sure we were well taken care of. They provided us excellent service during all our trip. There's also fun music during the ride which makes the trip even more memorable. Maia and Andy were kind enough to arrange my bday celebrations on board! They also gave me a beautiful bday gift! We highly recommend the Hiram Bingham train! We can't wait to be on board again!

Trip of a lifetime!. I was only in Peru for 5 days and I would highly recommend the Hiram Bingham train - a truly exceptional experience. After a restful night in Cusco getting used to the altitude I was taken to Poroy station by taxi. The entertainment at the train station was enchanting before boarding the train to begin our exciting adventure to reach Machu Picchu. The first part of the journey is spent in the last carriage where you are entertained by local musicians and can breakfast on cappuccinos and pasteries at the bar along with local fruit or sip on an early morning Pisco Sour. This is a fun part of the journey, then the scenery starts to get more beautiful and you move to the luxury dining carriage to be served lunch. It has a very oldy worldy feel to the whole experience a bit like being in an agatha christie 'who done it'. Absolutely loved the entire journey. Once we arrived in Aguas Calientes we were transferred to a luxury coach for another breath-taking scenic journey up to Machu Picchu. We stopped off at Sanctuary Lodge to check-in and be shown our rooms. Then our guide gave us our first glimpse of Machu Picchu. It was worth staying over night at the lodge so as to do more exploring of Machu Picchu at daybreak the next day. We were blessed with beautiful clear days both days. We were very well taken care of at the lodge with wonderful food and local pan pipes entertainment.

Old World Luxury. This train is a true luxury. One forgets they are on a train traveling through Peru. The trip started at the Sanctuary Hotel at the base of Macchu Picchu where we were served "tea time". The food was delicious and beautiful. We then rode a bus to the station in Aguas Calientes where we entered a waiting room with more drinks and snacks. The train was lovely, historical and truly the way to travel. We had dinner, listened to music and napped until we reached Cuzco. The service all along was friendly and professional, first class. A real treat!

Ups and downs. I was somewhat happy that we choose to take the luxury train to Machu Picchu. We went during rainy season and unfortunately had to take a bus to another train station further away. I wasn't thrilled with this since the bus was taking time away from the train ride. They did transport us in nice luxury buses though. The reception into the train was very nice, there was drinks, music and little snacks. The train is beautiful but seems a bit worn, one of the toilets barely worked. The open caboose was the best part. The live music was excellent and the bar was well set up. The meals were all gourmet but a few were not very tasty. The cheesecake was awful. Our waiter was barely anywhere. When we arrive, he did not greet us until 45 minutes to get our drink order. We kept asking for bread, and since he was too busy for us, the bread ran out. We paid 800 dollars per ticket and we could barely get bread or our drinks. When we arrived at Machu Picchu station we easily found our guide and headed into Machu Picchu. Our guide was excellent and knew a lot about the site. Afterwards the long tour, we were very happy to see the buffet lunch included in our package. The buffet was very good with desserts, pizza and sandwiches. Getting on board was a nightmare, they had no idea what they were doing and said we might get different seats. After getting on board, turns out they over booked a poor lady and her daughter. To sum up the trip, I was glad everything was all inclusive and convenient; the food, all transportation, tour of Machu Picchu, and the buffet lunch. But they need update their facilities, menu and embarkation process from Mach Picchu.

First class all the way. This train was one of the high points of the trip. Beautifully appointed cars, friendly and helpful staff, and delicious food. There was also music in the observation car that was fun and upbeat. Nice way to arrive into Machu Picchu Pueblo.
Must not miss this one!. A must do if you are going to Machu Picchu. Lovely lovely time. Food was great, staff was great, music was fab. We had a blast!

Full Belmond Experience. The HB was part of the itinerary, Peruvian Journey, 8 days in Peru exclusively handled by Belmond. Included was the train to Machu Picchu. Traveled on the Vista Dome train from the Sacred Valley to MP. This was 1 1/2 hour beautiful day trip and returned via the upgraded to the Hiram Bingham dinner trip which leaves at 5:50PM. The Vista Dome day trip was wisely suggested by the Belmond agent due to shortened duration from the Sacred Valley and window views. January is considered "rainy" season, the Hiram Bingham only goes as far as the Sacred Valley ending at the train station next to the Belmond Rio Sagrado Hotel, requiring another 1 hr 15 minute auto transport to Cusco. Belmond handled every aspect of the transfers with private guides each step of the way, no stress. Our Belmond tour guide accompanied our van transport to the train station in the town Aguas Calientes. When it was time to board the HB, the train steward came into the Belmond HB depot waiting area, greeted my wife and myself, and personally delivered us to our dining car seats. This indivividual was the primary person providing service throughout the trip. Many individuals attended to us assuring every detail of our needs were met. Full service china, multiple courses, Peruvian food and South American wine was enjoyable. Glad we had the experience. The only surprise was the rainy season shortened route. I believe they actually slow the train so we could have a 2 1/2 hour experience. Outside of rainy season you travel to a town much closer to Cusco, if that is your final destination, for a 3 to 3 1/2 hour trip. On a final note, don't let the rainy season in January fool you. We had 8 days of very good weather and little rain. Locals say we benefited from El Nino.

Not quite as hoped. It always is difficult to plead for something more, but this time we must. The train itself is an absolute classic, beautiful machine. The crew people are so energetic and hard working. The bar puts out some amazing drinks. and the chef team tires to make it enjoyable. So the criticism we have is about the menu and wine selection which was only average. After spending time in this part of Peru, one comes away with reasonable expectations at this price of a dinner train. It's a management problem. The dinner menu was not as good as expected period. High tea before the bus to the train was better than dinner. The reception with passed appetizers and champagne was better than the dinner. So there really was no reasonable excuse for the overpriced and poorly planned dinner exercise. We did not enjoy the amazing gazpacho from Peruvian sweet tomatoes - instead a tasteless potato soup.We did not enjoy the local wonderfully blended Peruvian white and red wines or even more champagne - instead cheap Argentinian and Chilean wines. Then it was a standard fare Peruvian trout filet and an underwhelming duck leg. Management has a problem, not the great staff or equipment as they were terrific. Very disappointing.

DeLuxe. Gorgeous trip, and a lot of fun writing on the luxurious train. The staff worked very hard to please finicky travelers. The food was surprisingly excellent in the service extremely conscientious. Our porter, Abel, was quite conscientious and ready to serve. Waiter Gorky was highly solicitous, and deserves recognition by management.We had little problem with making a connection, so the train manager personally helped us out.It is wonderful experience, and would welcome the opportunity to repeat the visit.

Exceptional experience you'll always remember for the rest of your life. Exceptional service started when we arrived at the station. In the train, it is luxurious, spacious with excellent peruvian food. The service is excellent. Along the way; live music is accompanied us; with people dancing and singing together. We were four (wife and to boys).

Royal treatment on Hiram Bingham. The Hiram Bingham train was a lovely experience. Personally thought it was worth every penny. The service from the minute you arrive at the train station in Poroy and back is fabulous. The food and drink is first class as well. We spent the night at the Sanctuary Lodge and had to bring an overnight bag. The Belmond provided us with duffel bags. We were a little unsure of what to wear on the train but everyone was very casual. Bring a sweater or a jacket, was a little chilly in the morning and evening on the train. The train stores your overnight bag for you then delivers it to the hotel. We did see several passengers with smaller sized suitcases but for the most part everyone had bags with just enough for one night. Not a problem to bring items on the train in a pack of some kind, plenty of room. The last car has a bar and open back for viewing. When you board in Cusco/Poroy the train then stops again in Ollantaytambo. Brunch is served after stop. The sightseeing along the way is fantastic just from your seat. When arriving in Aguas Calientes station Hiram Bingham has private buses to drive you up to Machu Picchu. They stop at the Sanctuary Lodge at base of Machu Picchu where you can get checked-in or get changed if you're just spending the day. At the end of day you meet the buses at the Sanctuary Lodge drive back to Aguas Calientes. The train station there has a private waiting area for the Hiram Bingham which has snacks, drinks and restroom. They really thought of everything, you're very well taken care of. The train ride back to Cusco/Poroy was so relaxing with a wonderful dinner and drinks. There is music in the back train car if you choose to go back to bar. Otherwise nice and quiet if you choose to stay at your table. The Poroy station is about 30 to 40 minutes from Cusco. We were worried about the logistics of spending the night, bringing bags, train ride but it was quite easy.

A train that will take you back in time.. The pace, service, accommodations and menu set this up as a truly luxurious way to travel to and from Machu Picchu, and it does feel like train travel from another generation. For most in our party, the trip from Machu Picchu to Cusco was amazing. But for a few, there was a desire for the meal not to have taken the full three hours so we could rest, walk around, etc. But the views, the bar car, live music and observation car made this a memorable journey and an integral part of our family's experience in Peru.

Marvelous experience. We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and then from Machu Picchu to Poroy. The trip was wonderful, the food was great and the staff was most efficient and friendly. The VIP areas at the train stations are wonderful.

One of the Best Experiences Ever!. I had originally booked the Vistadome from Cusco to Machu Pichu but received an upgrade offer to the Belmond Hiram Bingham so I decided what the heck. I was already spending a small fortune on this trip so why not a little more. I am so glad I did, this was one of my top 10 life experiences for sure. The elegance of the train and the level of customer service was something I had never experienced before. You for sure feel like a one-percenter. The food was incredible, the staff amazing, the beverages free flowing and the scenery gorgeous. I didn't want it to end but when it does, you are at Machu Picchu so you are okay with it.Besides the gourmet food and luxurious transportation, the Belmond Hiram Bingham also arranges your transportation to, entry into and a guide for Machu Picchu, afternoon tea at the lodge next to Machu Picchu and your return trip to Aquas Caliente. I figured all of the extras plus the convenience factor made the expense worth it. Did it ever! Everything was seamless and as close to perfection as I could imagine.I stayed at Machu Picchu a second day and ran into the manager from the train from the previous day. Despite no longer being a passenger or his responsibility he came over to say hi (he even remembered my name) and asked if he could assist me with anything. We chatted for a few minutes and I left feeling that he and this company REALLY cares about their passengers.
