The train ride just added to the experience. The cabins are beautiful and very elegant. The service and style of the entire experience was amazing. The brunch was delicious as was the dinner on the way to Cusco after the trip to Machu Picchu. Add on the wine choices and it was a great trip.

Great experience, but defintely a splurge. We took the Hiram Bingham between Urubamba and Aguas Calientes. After we booked the Hiram Bingham package (separate review for the Machu Picchu Sanctuary Lodge) we were informed that during rainy season the train between Cusco and Aguas Calientes was "bimodal" - which means that you have to take a bus or car from Cusco to the Rio Sagrado hotel in Urubama. At first I was annoyed that no one had told me this before I booked my 100% nonchangeable, nonrefundable package but really, there's nothing that Belmond (Orient Express) can do about it. The tracks are closed to passenger trains for part of the year. And don't let "bus" get to you too much: They are large, very comfortable upscale vans that are only used for Hiram Bingham passengers.We didn't take the Vistadome train either way, but it looks lovely and comfortable. I only mention that because if you're looking for any sort of "value" out of the Hiram Bingham you won't find it. It's definitely for people that want to splurge, and know that they're splurging on an overpriced service. That's fine - why not? We thought the food and wine was very good and loved the band in the bar car. Yes, it's touristy (3 piece Peruvian trio playing Gypsy Kings and Beatles while you drink a pisco sour) but so what? It was fun and indulgent, which is what it's supposed to be. Our package came with a guided tour of Machu Picchu - all the HB tickets may, not sure. Our guide, Camila, was wonderful. As you're approaching Aguas Calientes, your guide will come to your table on the train and introduce his/herself and explain logistics to you and help you navigate when you arrive. Some other folks have commented that when you stay at the Lodge, you have to check out at 11 but don't catch the shuttle to the train until 4:30. I swear - I don't get why that's a problem. You're at the footsteps of Machu Picchu. I think there might be a way to kill a few hours. Even if you didn't want to go back into the ruins, there's a nice hotel restaurant, showers, the "day room" with WiFi, jaccuzi and courtyard that are available to guests who have checked out and are taking the HB train home.

What A Great Time. We took the Vistadome up to Machu Picchu and the Hiram Bingham on the return. Two very different experiences and two very different prices. That being said we loved the Hiram Bingham. The train is beautiful and extremely comfortable with a fantastic staff. The bar car was the place to be and there was much fun music, singing, dancing, drinking and snacks. This was followed by a delightful dinner. Very interesting fellow passengers. And another benefit is that right now they are providing a bimodal system with the last half of the trip by bus into Cusco. Without this they would end in Poroy which would be over a 30 minute taxi ride back into Cusco. With the bimodal bus, we were taken right to our hotel in Cusco. The bus was much more comfortable than the one used by the Vistadome on the way up to MP. Overall we loved the Hiram Bingham and would definitely recommend it at least for one way.
return trip. Took the HB both ways and highly recommend the trip to Machu Picchu as an 'experience' albeit a bit loud. Would consider the Vistadome for the return trip to Cusco.

A fantastic way to see this World Heritage site. This train is a brilliant way to see Machu Picchu. The only downside if you are doing this from Cusco is the 1.5 hour bus trip to and from the actual departure station of the train. Having said that, the guide was very helpful throughout and they explain some interesting facts about the local area on the way.The food on board is very good. I couldn't bring myself to drink alcohol at 11:00am, however the brunch offers some nice food made from local produce. The cheesecake dessert was lovely.The tour which followed at Machu Picchu was very detailed and very enjoyable. Also, the afternoon tea was a nice way to relax before the bus ride down the hill.The evening meal was preceded by dancing and singing in the main bar car. The food was good quality, but I was slightly disappointed with the beef.I thought there would be an observation car, however this was not on our train. This train is thoroughly recommended.

Hiram Bingham Train overrated. We took the Hiram Bingham train from Machu Picchu to the Sacred Valley. It's a gilded age dining car with a nice set dinner with a couple of choices for entrees, but the food is nothing special. The train leaves at dark; so one doesn't have any view of the spectacular landscapes. And the $280 price is way too high. Instead, take an afternoon train, see the landscapes, and have dinner after you arrive. Also, if you stay at the Sanctuary Lodge in Machu Picchu and have to check out at 11 am, you are stuck with only a very crowded "day room" in which to stay until 4;30, when the bus to meet the Hiram Bingham train leaves for Agua Caliente. much better to leave earlier, as suggested above.

More transparency!. In general the service was very good in the Hiram Bingham train, but I would like to complain about one particular aspect: the lack of transparency in the advertisement. The advertisement mentions the existence of an observatory carriage with windows in the ceiling, but, at least in the day I have travelled, it was out of service. They did not mentioned anything about in the moment I bought the tickets, and I was informed this carriage was out of service for few days. It was disapointing for the kids, and unfair if you consider how expensive these tickets are!

Fabulous train ride. We took the Hiram Bingham train to Machu Picchu and it was the highlight of our two week tour to Ecquador and Peru. The train is gorgeous and the views are spectacular. The staff was friendly and the musicans were great fun!

A must do for any railfan. being a railfan I could not wait to ride this train, and after riding several others throughout the United States, my expectations were high. The Hiram Bingham exceeded those expectations and the energy and attention to service were exceptional. I totally recommend this train ride for anyone who enjoys the finer things in life!

great little train ride. love the train and the service, was like being back in the 1940s. Didn't like the fact that it was a set menu, there were somethings we didn't eat and seemed like a waste of food. The bar car was hopping, the musicians were awesome. would have liked the train to move alittle faster :-) but got some great pics.

Amazing views, Delicious food, Fun way to get to MP!. I traveled with my mom to Cusco, and as she didn't want to hike the trail to Machu Picchu, we decided to go in style and take the Hiram Bingham Train. It was excellent from beginning to end! We boarded the train and not long after were served a full, DELICIOUS three-course meal. After eating we wanted to explore the train, so we made our way back to the caboose, where we found a band playing, bottomless mimosas being served and the most beautiful view of the mountains from the back of the train. The staff was all very pleasant, the train itself was spotless and of course the free, bottomless drinks always help put a smile on anyone's face! I was honestly a little sad when we arrived, as I wanted the train journey to continue longer!

Trip of a lifetime!!!. If you are deciding to take the Hiram Bingham or some other type of transportation to the famed Manchu Picchu let me decide for you. This by far exceeded my expectations by ten fold! The staff, food, execution and scenery equal that of 5 star hotel in any country!!! I own two restaurants so I am very critical on the components of a well run restaurant and to do that while on wheels...get my two thumbs up. Albeit a bit pricy the experience is priceless. Without any hesitation book a trip on the Hiram Bingham for a trip of a life time!!!

Some Big Misses in a Highly Anticipated Experience. Traveling to Machu Picchu on the Orient Express has been on my bucket list for years so I was very excited to take this train ride with my husband and 6 year old son. Sadly, our trip fell in the wet season so we had to take the bi-modal trip (bus and train). While the staff tried to offer great service, the bus was very small and cramped, with no facilities. After approximately 90 minutes, we settled into our dining car on the train and were ready to experience the luxury of the Hiram Bingham. I'm not sure what the situation was with our table but it seemed to be in the invisible zone. Every other passenger was greeted with mimosas except for us. We had to hail down the wait staff to get our drinks while other tables seemed to have constant attention. During dinner, we noticed the other tables had their second courses cleared before we received our first. When we inquired about our dinner, we received a simple salad with avocado, not the traditional Peruvian pickled vegetables promised by the menu. We refused the basic salad and, eventually, we were brought the dinner we were supposed to receive. Given that we purchased an upcharge wine instead of the house wine given with dinner, I would have expected at least the same level of service as the rest of the diners. The staff was accommodating to our 6 year old by offering pasta for lunch and a plain steak with rice for dinner instead of the set menu but the misses in the dining room really left me disappointed with the experience.

The only way to travel. Hiram Bingham TrainThe first thing to say is that the train journey was excellent. The whole experience, the food, wine, Pisco Sours was absolutely great. The service from the train attendance as well as the station staff was as you would expect from Orient Express.The second thing to note is that this was part of an overall journey we took in Peru booked and arranged through Orient Express in Charleston USA. It should be noted that the train does not operate every day so itineraries may need to be planned around the trains schedule. We chose to depart from Cusco, although the station is now in the outskirts of the city as the line into the city itself had become too dangerous due to increased road traffic. We then travelled on the train all the way to the end point having lunch on board as we went. The train is mostly made up of dining cars and at the rear of the train is a bar and observation car. There is a band that plays in the bar and this may be too noisy for some.When we travelled the train was not particularly full and there was plenty of room to move around and to take one’s turn at the back of the train looking out on the scenery. The train does not run particularly quickly or smoothly but the relatively slow journey along the single track is accomplished at an appropriately leisurely pace.On arrival at the destination station travellers are then taken the last few miles up to the gates of the Machu Pichu site. Some travellers were just taking a daytrip and this seems to be entirely possible allowing for a few hours at the magnificent site before returning back to Cusco on the train.However we decided to spend a night at the Sanctury Lodge Hotel (see our trip advisor report) so were deposited at the hotel entrance and checked into the hotel. The next day in the afternoon we were collected and taken back to the train for the evening journey but as we had opted to stay in Sacred Valley at the hotel Rio Sagrado (see our trip advisor report) we departed the train at Ollie Tampa Bay Station. Again we were looked after well on this journey and as they knew we were departing the train before Cusco, the staff ensured that we were served first so that dinner was complete before our stop.It’s also worth noting that the Sanctuary Lodge Hotel is right outside the gates of the Machu Picchu Park and has a separate dining room for hotel guests and those using the Hirham Bingham train service. Even though the coach system limits to some extent visitors to the site, there are still considerable numbers waiting to get into the park and waiting for their return buses to the station – most people of course will be travelling on regular trains and other tourist trains. The use of the separate dining room does allow some comfort at the site if you are not staying in the hotel. The other restaurant is really a canteen and seems to be very very crowded.Please read my other trip advisor reviews of this trip: Hotel B Arts in Lima, The Machu Picchu Sanctuary Lodge, the Palacio Nazarenas and the Hotel Rio Sagrado.

Delightful ride. The train ride added to the experience of going to Machu PIcchu. The food was nice, not too filling. We experienced a costumed dancer and a fashion show on the 1-1/2 hour ride. The views through the Sacred Valley were amazing.

Pampered experience. Overall we were pampered on this trip! The experience was absolutely amazing. The staff, Javier, Erasmo and Carlos could not have been nicer or more accommodating. If you want a 1st class way to see Machupicchu this is it!

Confusing. I consider myself on the high-end of advance travel-planning, and this part of the Peru trip still has me baffled. From start to finish I was always questioning what was coming next. Mostly this was due to a very confusing e-mail from Orient-Express. I started by private car, then got on a bus for 1.5 hours (conveniently stopping at an Indian market filled with eager vendors...hmmm?), we then boarded the train for a mediocre lunch. At one point I commandeered my own hand luggage since I had no idea what was happening with that. I eventually landed at the Sanctuary Lodge. And here's the downside to the HB train/overnight package: you are out of your room at 11am and the bus down the mountain to board the train does not leave until 4:45pm. On the return "something" fell on the tracks and we were herded on to buses in the dark for yet another 1.5 hour spit and jerk drive. The whole adventure makes Mr. Toads Wild ride look lame.

Great time. Took the Hiram Bingham train from Cusco to Machu Picchu over the Christmas/New Year's holidays. Expensive but worth it. Nice entertainment, food, and pisco sours to help pass the time on your 3-4 hour journey. Elegant setting and great service. We also met some very interesting fellow travelers. Maybe not for everyone, but if you can afford it, do it!

Boozy and informative, but could be more comfortable. We stayed at el Rio Sagrado, so the train simply passed through the hotel. The train itself is a time warp as it is reminiscent of the original Orient Express. Service wise, everyone was very attentive and kind. Moreover, they explain the history of the sites BRIEFLY throughout the ride. One thing they should have notified us is that you need to bring your passport to Machu Picchu, which would have saved us lots of haggling at the entrance. The facilities are in the same vein as the façade, but if they could recline, they would be a lot better. Wi-fi somewhere in the train would be lovely too. My favorite part is the panoramic car in the back from which you can take great photos. Overall a great experience. Whatever you do, don't take a bus from Cusco to Machu Picchu.
Excellent service. Nothing to dislike at all. the tarin cars were in excellent conditions and the service was very good.

Total madness, but great fun!. As we sat playing along with the band, maracas and tambourine in hand, we reflected on where we were! How incredible to be sitting on a luxurious train, sipping a glass of chilled white wine whilst travelling in Peru and singing 'guantanamera' at the top of our voice!We'd been told to expect something special, but what we didn't expect was the whole 'experience' from beginning to end. Delightfully attentive staff, delicious food and such lively entertainment all contributed to an altogether memorable experience.We were just twelve passenger that evening, from Aguas Calientes to Rio Segrado. That made it all the more special. Expensive, but worth every sol!

Super High-end travel at its best. All inclusive, fun, great staff, vintage train by the Orient Express group. Was so much more than my expectations. During the rainy season it does not start in Cusco, but you are bussed part way. Spend the money!

fantastic experience. This is fantastic experience. It starts out at 7am with a presentation of Peruvian traditional music, with a little Peruvianized Bach mixed in. The train itself is very comfortable, although it is necessary to endure an hour and a half bus ride first to get to the train. The food and service onboard are fantastic. The rear open air observation car is an exceptional experience. The trip comes with a guided tour of Machu Picchu in Spanish or English. Unfortunately, the return is at night when it is too dark to appreciate the scenery, but the onboard musicians and dinner service make it worthwhile. Pisco sours and other drinks are included. The only drawback is the boring bus ride from the train back to Cusco.

Yes, it is worth the money. This was an unexpected surprise during our Peru adventure. Off the bat, yes it is pricey, but we did one-way which helps the with cost if needed (we did dinner). The train leaves directly from the Machu Picchu train station, which is nice and makes the experience a little easier. There is only one train a day to Cusco. Due to the rainy season part of the track was washed out and we had to take a bus the rest of the way- otherwise the train would have gone directly to Cusco, which is about 3 hours. The first class service starts at the door when you walk into the train station lobby; wet clothes to wash hands, free cocktails and other drinks, many comfortable places to sit. All the attendants and train staff were so kind and helpful. There is a bar car with live music and all you can drink cerveza and pisco-sours (yes, they are delicious-TRY ONE). We danced and drank for the first 45 minutes. Dinner was served in an elegantly decorate dining car (and your reserved seat) with fresh flowers and top notch place settings. The food was MUCH better than I expected for a train meal. The food was wonderful and paired with wines. Plenty off food, and I'm a hungry one. The train was a fantastic experience and if you have the capability to go, it's well worth it and so much fun.

So fabulous!!!!. We took the Vistadome train to Machu Picchu from the Sacred Valley. After staying at the Sanctuary Lodge, we took the Hiram Bingham train back to Cusco - or rather as far as we could. A landslide had taken out part of the tracks that precluded us from going the whole way. Hmmm, living in Southern California you get used to that sort of thing during rainy season. It was dark outside while we traveled on the Hiram Bingham, so it felt that much more romantic. The bar car was fantastic with live music, dancing and the best drink EVER, the Pisco Sour. Dinner was very good. The whole experience was so Agatha Christie. Loved it. Can't recommend it highly enough. And, of course, you cant overlook the wonderful staff. They were so attentive, and kind and fun. I find that the staff always adds that extra, intangible something to such a great experience.

Worth the price and we would do it all over again. We took the 6:50 pm train from Aguascalientes on February 1. What a joy. We were able to have our table moved from one of four to a table of two for just us. We got up right away when the bar car started and there was a fantastic trio that started with Peruvian and Mexican music and then to classic hits which had the audience dancing and having a ball. Around 7:45 pm we were summoned to dinner. Very nice food, four course meal which was delicious. Pisco sours and wine flowed freely. Staff were jumping to help and serve, rest rooms were spotless. What a joy. My only commentary. I did not know how to tip. All the stff were good and none in particular took care of is. All were nice and efifcient and frendly. I wish I had some type of envelope to do that. (Inkaterra did that but I tipped the staff who helped me directly. This was different - I had two barmen, 4 or 5 waiters, a captain, etc.)

Well Worth the Cost. Not the cheapest way to go through the Sacred Valley, but what an experience, from the reception, to the Restaurant car to the Bar car with the open platform at the back and the band playing. Meander through the valley at 15mph taking in the view and enjoying the service provided, great!

Travel in style. I didn't think I'd like this, as I thought it would be a bit cheesy. After a day walking around MP - there is no better way to get back to Cusco ......in absolute style. Champagne on arrival. The band in the bar cart was a lot of fun - service was exceptional and food/wine was great (for a train). It is an absolute experience and well worth the money.
Slow train ride to paradise!. Train ride going to Machu Picchu was pleasant. Enjoyed the scenery. Was not to fond of the food serve.

Macchu Picchu in luxury. Being in Cusco for only a few days we were looking for a well-organized and above-average quality way to do MP in a day. This undoubtedly qualifies. It does feel a bit over the top, but it's oh so comfortable and well arranged. The train is the last of the trains to leave Cusco, so you can sleep a little later, and (I believe) the last to leave MP. As has been mentioned, this means you'll be one of the last leaving MP, which hopefully gives you some breathing room as it can get quite crowded. From white cloth dining, to live music in the bar car, to well spoken guides (although I must point out that our guide just had it in for Hiram Bingham - the explorer. Constant railing on how he wasnt one thing or another.). Yes it costs more and yes it's a great way to see MP.

Absolutely delightful!. We took the Vistadome train in the morning to Machu Picchu and then the Hiram Bingham train back to the Sacred Valley in the evening after spending the night at the Machu Picchu Sanctuary Lodge. Though it was dark outside while we traveled on the Hiram Bingham, we had already enjoyed the views on the way out and we were able to focus on the wonderful experience of riding the train itself. What a beautiful experience! It began at the train station where we all waited in the private Orient-Express lounge. While waiting, three musicians played beautiful Andean music while champagne was served to the guests. The train itself is well maintained with polished wood and brass and lovely white table cloths and linens. We were seated at a beautiful table in the dining car, handed some delicious Pisco Sours, and then encouraged to enjoy the live music in the bar until dinner time. For those people who opted not to visit the bar, they were really missing out! The three musicians (guitar, vocals and drum) were truly delightful! They played the traditional Andean music, as well as everything from The Beatles to Elvis Presley! They loved having audience participation and encouraged everyone to clap and sing and dance. It was great fun! We loved seeing the waiters, the bar tenders and other staff members dancing along while serving the drinks. It really was so worth it!The dinner was delicious - several courses - served with great care and polish. Shortly after the end of our wonderful meal, we arrived back in the Sacred Valley. The time passed so quickly! I highly recommend the Hiram Bingham. It's a delightful experience!

The only way to Travel. Really this is the only way to travel to the foot of Machu Picchu. Early morning pick up from my Hotel & then straight onboard. Service on board was outstanding with morning Breakfast served on the train. Views from either side of the train were spectacular whilst the train moves down the scared Valley towards Machu Picchu. The train just feels of class & nice to have a little piece of Luxury.

Easy ride. Comfortable, clean, and easy ride after a long 4 day hike! They also serve complimentary beverages and snacks & have other food/drinks available for purchase. I think booking ahead of time is important- I did that.

Orient Express train to Machu Picchu. Terrific. All passengers are seated at dining car tables for the ride, and enjoy a nice meal served in European ambience. The train is equipped with two club cars, both with bars. The decor is consistent with the luxury of the European first class trains. Entertainment in the form of two guitarists and a singer added to the fun of the trip. The view of the countryside during the travel made for an interesting tour of the Peru terrain. I would highly recommend this over the standard pullman trains.

Overpriced. Yes, you travel in luxury but for what you are paying you don't get value for money with cheap Peruvian sparkling wine served instead of champagne. The Orient Express it ain't despite being owned by the Orient Express company!!!
Beautiful scenery. Met some really nice people on the train .. Everyone had fun,lots of drinks, food and beautiful scenery made for an awesome ride.

Culinary Delight. I took the train back from Machu Picchu and the service, food and wine were divine. The presentation was fantastic. After this experience, I want to take another luxury train trip in the future.

Wonderful train if you can afford it!. I went on the train with a friend. She loved it. She called it a party train. With the unlimited alcohol and great music, I agree. It was one of the best things we did on our trip!

Just fantastic allaround. I recommend taking Hiram Bingham but probably just one way unless money isn't an issue. If you take it one way, take it to Machu Picchu not from so you can see the beautiful landscapes.It was a first-class operation all around, from the sparkling wine offered as you board to the beautiful bar cars and the outstanding food and service.We took the Vistadome back. Sure it can't even compare, but it's perfectly comfortable, and given that the Hiram Bingham is about 6 times as expensive, perfectly adequate.

An absolute highlight of any vacation to Peru. Traveling this train in winter 2013, I cannot praise this experience enough. I have used many luxury trains in other countries, and this is not just a ride, but an experience. If you are taking a train to Machu Picchu, this is the one. Music, food, service....Excellence !!!Many Thanks

Leaving Machu Picchu in Style. So enjoyed the "luxury promotion" that Peru Rail was offering. We took the Vistadome train into Aguas Calientes - wonderful views from the windows on the ceiling and a lovely breakfast to get the day started. After two days at Machu Picchu including a stimulating climb up Huayna Picchu we finished the day by having tea and wonderful appetizer/dessert buffet at the Sancutuary Lodge. Then the bus took us to the train station where we enjoyed champagne or pisco sours in the first class lounge plus hot damp towels to freshen up. Then the biggest treat of all - boarding the Hiram Bingham Train - 3.5 hours of first class travel back to Cusco. The interior very elegant, the food wonderful, lots to drink and great live entertainment made for a top shelf experience. It was dark most of the way back so I would recommend the Vistadome going into Aguas Calientes but this is the only way out!!!

Awesome trip in HB. The food, entertainment, enviroment and people are world class. The crew of HB make you feel so good and confortable. Definetly I would recommend this trip and I would take it again.

This is a MUST DO!. We took the regular train from Cuzco (actually Poroy, 20 minutes from Cuzco by taxi) to Machu Picchu, and after a wonderful day touring the ancient lost city, came back via the Hiram Bingham train. This is absolutely the very best way one could experience this magical day. The Hiram Bingham is an older, restored train with beautiful, wood paneled cars, a spectacular dining car and a bar car that is as much fun as going out on the town. The 3 1/2 hour ride home seemed to fly by, as we had a delicious dinner, wine and drinks included, and then moved on to the party in the bar car, where a 3 piece band played for 2 hours. People were dancing, singing along and generally having a ball. The luxurious train and ambience was the perfect way to relax after a long day. I would never do it any other way

Is there any other way to travel?. Peruvian musicians and dancers great you as you board the Agatha Christie-styled train. Champagne with piscoe thrust into your hands as you board at 9:00am. Chardonnays at 10:00 as we wind our way through spectacular mountains and rivers eating a 5-star 3-course lunch. Is there any better way to travel to Macchu Picchu?

Great way to see the Sacred Valley. This was a great way to travel to Augua Caliente to catch the bus...got to see the countryside by train and the seats were quite comfortable, as you are seated in groups of 4, facing each other, so conversation with strangers starts easily. It is quite busy at the train stations, so be prepared. Often lines at the bathrooms, which there are only a couple, but they are very clean.

Beautiful ride, fun experience!. We loved our ride from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo (after our 7 day Lodge to Lodge trek and Machu Picchu). It's a modern domed train (we went 1st class) and very comfortable. We so enjoyed the upbeat Peruvian music and fashion show. Super!

A Must Do!. This train is an integral part of the experience of travelling from Cusco to Machu Picchu. Departing Cusco we were entertained, enjoyed fabulous views and had a wonderful lunch. On our return back to Cusco the next night we were treated fabulously by staff. The small band had everyone up dancing and playing maracas. Dinner was excellent. We felt like we had journeyed back to another magical time.

Wonderful .. simply wonderful!!. There's no better way to goto Machu Picchu than the train. It's a 2/3 hours journey too the base camp and the train snakes next to rivers, between mountains, Inca trails, ruins and forests .. very exciting!!The train itself is very clean with glass roofs, coffee and snacks are served too and things to shop would you're sitting. You get to meet people from all over the world, we met Indians, east Europeans, Australians .. Japanese. I'd definitely recommend this journey - it's worth every bit of money!!

Worth every penny. Many would perhaps consider the fare too high but if you are used to sophistication when travelling this is the way to get from Cusco to Machu Picchu or return.The carriages, the food, the fantastically well trained staff is Orient-Express at its best.In case you want to visit the citadel in the same day, go and return on the Hiram Bingham. In case you want to do it more relaxed ( I recomend it ) stay overnight in the Machu Picchu area ( down at Aguas Calientes or at the only hotel by the ruins up the mountain ). In this case you can either travel to and back with the Hiram Bingham or take the Vistadome train to go from Cusco or the Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu and return on the Hiram Bingham. You will save some money this way.You get a reserved seat at the dining carriage and you can move around to the saloon and bar carriage. Make sure ro specify your preference of a table for 2 or a table for 4. It depends on how keen you are on socializing.

Expensive but a luxurious way to travel. There is something magical about trains. If you don't believe that trains are magic, then this trip might be more expensive than the experience justifies. But if you like trains like we do, this is the only way to travel to Machu Picchu.The trip up to Machu Picchu starts with a brunch. It's a 3-course brunch with wine. You are seated at nice tables (for 2 or 4). The views are decent (at times stunning, at other times pedestrian). The service is fantastic. Make sure you walk to the back of the train to spend time in the viewing car. It features windows on the ceiling and you can stand on the back of the train. When we went, no one went back there but us. Seems silly to miss the chance.You arrive at a waiting room, which is just a holding spot until you get on the bus to Machu Picchu. It's a short walk with a few steps to get to the busses. You walk through a pretty horrid tourist sales area. Don't buy anything - it's all overpriced.The trip home is where the train really shines. You will take a bus back to Aguas Calientes and board the train after some time in the waiting room. They serve nice drinks while you wait. You will get a similar seat for a 4-course dinner. The food was good, not great. But after you drink your Pisco Sour, make sure you head back to the bar car. The musicians there were fantastic. Really amazing. They had a couple of guitarists and a drummer, and they are all vocalists. They ran through a bunch of Peruvean and Spanish songs. They had everyone clapping, playing instruments, drinking, and even dancing. It was a TON of fun. We spent an hour there, and the time flew.While you are in the bar car, you will get more drinks and some salty snacks along with some sushi and potato appetizers. Very good overall.The rest of the meal was a good meal. There was nothing remarkably great or bad about it. The dessert was noticeably good. The ride back is quite long. You are scheduled to arrive at 9:15p. If you spent the day in Machu Picchu, I would change into comfortably nice clothes before the train ride. There is a bathroom on the train, so no worries there. You will likely be sleeping at your table for a bit if your visit was like ours - everyone on the train was nodding off. Dress in layers as the train was warmer than we expected, but then got cooler throughout the night. Overall, this was worth it for us. It might be on the pricey side for many, but there is no better train to ride to Machu Picchu for sure.
You won't regret it as long as you join in the fun. Brilliant train journey. Great music. Great food. Yes we were late but did it matter? Staff so polite but with a twinkle.........

If you want the trip to match the Machu Picchu visit than this is the way to travel. The whole experience was well worth the money. From the reception to the comfort of the seating, the food, the service and the entertainment. But not only the train ride but the immediate availability of the transport buses for the transport up to Machu Picchu at the arrival of the train in Aguas Calentes, and the way the luggage was handled so that you find it back in the evening in the hotel at check in, was outstanding. The guide that Orient Express provided at Machu Picchu was also great, Alex made the afternoon very interesting and enjoyable. And the last part of the deal, the afternoon tea gave us the opportunity for a good rest after the visit.Very pleased with the whole package.We went both ways with the Hiram Bingham and we can only highly recommend it.

Worth the expense. We enjoyed the train ride, with the exception of the ugly American tourists who hogged the observation deck outside, not permitting any of the other passengers the ability to enjoy the same.The staff were. Dry attentive and the meal was good. The live entertainment was enjoyable.We returned on the Vistadome, there was a lack of leg room and it was very crowded.If we were to do it again we would take the Hiram Bingham both ways

Not up to the hype. This is by far the best train to Machu Picchu. It has only a dining car, lounge car and kitchen car. The food is good but by no means great. The staff needs to put more effort into keeping the only restroom clean. If I ever return to Machu Picchu I would most certainly use the train again.

Expensive but worth it. The Hiram Bingham train was a great way to travel. We had private seating in the dining car, a live band in the back bar car, and lots of space to relax. And, pretty much everything was compted. We came back on the Vistadome. It was a lot more crowded, expectedly, with much less leg room. But we had an Alpaca fashion show and everybody seemed to be enjoying themselves. In fact, the Vistadome offered better viewing of the local scenery because of the vista viewing. Still, the Hiram Bingham train made the trip painless.

A Pleasant way to Travel to Aquas Calientes. We enjoyed this train ride, but were disappointed to discover that our seats were on the wrong side of the train both ways! Make sure you are seated on the river side of the train (right side on the way to Machu Pichu) as that is where the view is. Service is excellent. They even included a little vase of fresh flowers on our table with the meal. A carnival dancer entertained us with his dancing in the aisle and we enjoyed a fashion show featuring the beautiful cashmere of the region..

Comfortable, amazing trip, amazing start and finish to Macchu Picchu. Great trip on an amazing train. Excellent operation with on time departure, on time arrival, comfortable seating and reasonable pricing for an AWESOME TRIP! Truly a MUST for the day trip traveler or the folks who plan to spend a few nights at the town of Macchu Picchu.

Comfortable, elegant and very enjoyable. This is definitely the way to go from Cusco to Machu Picchu if you want to travel in style and as comfortably as possible. The staff was very attentive, food was good, and the live music on the bar and observation car was quite enjoyable. Expensive but worth it

train ride. he service and the accomodations were outstanding! The food served was exquisite and tasty and the staff conducted a great fashion show. The scenery as we travelled set amood of the life of comfort and luxury! Devine!

Perfect end to the Machu Picchu experience. The service was exceptional and we truly enjoyed having one more marvelous experience to add to Machu Picchu. The food, Pisco sours and wine were all excellent. Highly recommend.

One of the best days of our lives!. My husband and I rode the Hiram Bingham from Cusco to Machu Picchu on October 21st. It was such an amazing experience from start to finish. The service was impeccable! The band was so much fun - they are all so incredibly talented and they clearly love what they do. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary, and they went to the trouble to find out what our "song" was before the trip - they learned it for us and played it for us on the train. This was such a special moment - it almost brought my husband to tears!!!! We will never forget this amazing day. The food and drinks were amazingb as well. Neither one of us wanted to get off the train! Sure, it is an expensive train ride, but it is NOTHING when you consider what you get for what you pay - an amazing, historic train ride on a beautiful train, fantastic entertainment, gourmet food and delicious drinks, entrance into Machu Picchu, guided tour of machu picchu, afternoon tea at the machu picchu sanctuary lodge, and round trip tickets up and down the mountain from Aguas Calientes to Machu Picchu, not to mention memories that will last you forever. It is absolutely worth EVERY penny. I would do it again and again and again. If you're going to go all the way to Machu Picchu, you might as well do it right and go on the Hiram Bingham! You will not regret it.

My Best Travel Decision. I booked my trip from Cuzco to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) online and am so happy I did. The trip included everything I could wish for: comfortable transportation, delicious ethnic dining, on time departure and arrival, arrangements for luggage, bus transportation up to Machu Picchu, a guided tour, and after-tour fancy tea, and return to the station. Train travellers such as I bypass the long lines of tourists and go right through to Machu Picchu, The online rep, Roberto, helped me so much in making my reservations. Do not miss this!

Above and beyond. Although I was not feeling well, I had ice in a drink at my hotel bar and was truly sick most of the trip. EVERYONE went well above the service I expected. From the moment I arrive when Javier personally greeted me. I can't tell you enough under the circumstance I had a great time even if I couldn't enjoy the amazing things food wise that you offer! I have already told all my friends they must take the Hiram.. The staff, service, organization was truly something I will forever remember.

Travel in excellence. The Hiram Bingham trip to Machu Picchu exceeded all my expectations. A pleasant bus ride to the station and we were received with music, tea, coffee and cakes till we boarded. Well appointed staff and a fabulous train. The atmosphere on board was jovial and the beverages and meals supplied endless and of top quality. The scenic route via rail is magnificent. On arrival expecting to wander aimlessly around Machu Picchu with my partner, we were surprised to be provided into a small group of 4 couples with our own guide who showed us around the site and was a wealth of information and a lot of fun. Do the Hiram Bingham it's a must! Purchasing tickets online was easy and the correspondence with the staff of Peru Rail made this trip a memorable one for us
Fabulous Journey. I have ridden the train 4 times and every time is wonderful. Beautiful scenery, good snacks, friendly people.

Its the Journey !. The Hiram Bingham Train is a luxury train on the route to Machu Picchu , a great train, but its the scenic journey that is the main attraction. Three different classes of train making the trip and you do not need to pay the premium price of the Hiram Bingham to have a great and comfortable trip. You pass small farms, tiny hamlets and follow a route only a few yards from a raging mountain river, all the time through a high walled canyon. A trip to remember.

Unforgetable. For our 20th wedding anniversary we decided to spend our week at Cusco, and my wife had a special gift for me, which was a trip to Machu Picchu on board of this great Hiram Bingham train, I had to tell it has been one of the best trips ever, very romantic and pleasant, all of the crew was fantastic, among the cars and obviously the trip itself, the landscapes are breathtaking! The crew had prepared our table with rose petals and champagne to celebrate our day. The panoramic car had a folkloric band on board playing beautiful music while we could enjoy an open bar, offering from hot beverages, snacks and all sort of spirits. After a while we had a 5 star restaurant lunch, amazing combinations of flavors. The service was amazing. Once we got to the final destination at Aguas Calientes we took a bus to Machu Picchu, which was a total complete experience (will write about it later), after the visit they were waiting for us with a buffet to wait for the bus to return to the train. The trip back to Cusco was even better, we enjoyed a romantic dinner at our table and then celebrated with the rest of the people enjoying live music on the panoramic car, everyone singing and playing an instrument, was amazing! If anyone who is looking for a special place to celebrate a great occasion like this I will completely recommend this experience.

Wonderful Travel. was my second trip on this train and it was again a pleasant and wonderful experience. The board is magnificent attention expected no less. I recommend this train to all who wish to have a beautiful journey, you can do as a couple, alone or with family, I assure you will be just as spectacular

A memory!. When my son booked this I initially thought he was a little off his rocker wanting to spend so much for a train ride. Alas, this is not a train ride.....this is an experience and one that I am happy to have had! After a long day at Machu Picchu pisco sours, live music , excellent food and the sounds of the train create a memory that everyone should have if they can make it happen.
Nice train. Good train, with windows in the sealing to see the mountains and the beautifull nature towards machu picchu.

Once in a lifetime experience. This is an expensive way to get to Machu Picchu. So why spend the extra money?? First, the enhanced scenery experience. The observation car at the end of the train was a fantastic place to take fantastic photos of the incredible scenery along the way. We took the Expedition train on the way back and were very frustrated to have to take pictures through windows and skylights. With the Hiram Bingham, the back of the observation car is open to the air and is a fantastic spot to take pictures from. Second, you get to experience the sort of train ride that our grandparents might have experienced on one of the fancy European trains in a bygone era - service impeccable, furnishings historic and beautiful, relaxed enjoyment of the scenery passing by. Third, if you take the train to MP, you get transportation from the train station up to Machu Picchu, which costs $18.50 per person just for the bus ride. Plus, you get a private tour of the ruins and tea at the Sanctuary Lodge. The private tour was fantastic. There were only six or eight of us on the tour, as they provided several guides for that day's train. There were tours in English and Spanish. The tour guide was knowledgeable and friendly and we definitely felt that when the three hour tour was over that it was well worth it.

A once in a lifetime memorable experience. You'd be following in the company of Bill Gates and Bono to take this train to Macchu Picchu.Firstly, our group had musicians that greeted us at the station with song and dance. Inside the train There were also musicians who played in the last car...this last car, had a balcony, glass ceilings, which made passing thru small towns, going thru farms, over and alongside rivers, a delight.One could wave at little children as the train took its 3-3 1/2 hour meandering ride to Macchu Picchu. I did see the local trains and they were quite crowded, not to mention the kind of fine dining we experienced. We even had vegetarian options for meals on ours. When some hot sleepy, the attendants provided blankets and pillows. The meals served on tablecloth lined tables, silver, roses, china were delicious.I am thrilled to have taken this once in a lifetime experience of riding this Orient Express train. It's quite special, and it affords a lot of picture taking opportunities.

Nice ride, great service. It's beats the other means of transportation to Cuzco hands down. Food was great. People sit around a share stories of all there worldly travels, trying to one up each which is funny to hear. Staff was friendly and well spoken. I'd do it again, if I ever decide to make this trip.

A very civilised way to travel back from Machu Picchu. This is a very luxurious way of returning from Machu Picchu and the comfort and very good food on board made up for the fact that we had to change our reservation at the last minute due to a strike.

Great way to relax in route to Machu Picchu. Lovely train, great service. It is a bit expensive, but how often to you go to Peru? We enjoyed the trip and great food. The food is far better than what is available at Machu Picchu.

Maybe I expected too much but was great nonetheless. We did a day trip to Machupicchu from Cusco. The train leaves the Poroy station (about 30 minute ride in a cab from Cusco) and takes you to Aguas Calientes station (30 minute shuttle ride to the Machupicchu entrance). The train ride takes about 3.5 hours each way.The fare included shuttle ride up to Machupicchu, entry ticket, tour guide, and brunch, tea buffet at the Lodge in Machupicchu, dinner and drinks. The way there was amusing with the train ride and all but the fun wore off on the way back. It was dark and couldn't see anything outside which made the train ride seem like an eternity. There was a group drinking at the bar car and seemed to have a great time as they were annoyingly rowdy. Maybe I should have too... but felt tired from the trip.Food was not too bad but I think it could have been better. Considering that it's done on a moving train, it's understandable. The decor was nice but the cars looked like they needed an update. The upholstery looked worn and dingy and didn't scream luxury. If you haven't done this trip, by all means do it. It's a unique experience and worth doing it but I'll find a cheaper/faster way to get there next time.

You Don't Want To Miss It!. We traveled on the Hiram Bingham on 9/24. It was a much anticipated trip and it met our expectations on every level. I was traveling with my sister and my 80 year old mother who has dreamed about visiting Machu Pichhu and traveling on the Orient Express. From the moment we arrived at the station it was a very special experience. We were greeted with Peruvian dancers in beautiful costumes and a warm reception from the HB staff. The food and attention to detail was top notch! You should head back to the bar car and observation car quickly, so you'll be able to snap some beautiful pictures of the country side and river canyon. I want to especially thank Jose who was a very passionate and knowledgeable tour guide both on the train and walking around the ruins. I wish we could have stayed longer at Machu Picchu - the time went by so quickly and after a quick high tea at the Sanctuary Lodge we were on our way back to the train for a wonderful dinner and more entertainment. Traveling on the Hiram Bingham is a splurge for sure, but it was worth every penny. Thank you HB Staff for a wonderful day that all three of us will remember for a long time.

Wonderful Experience. We splurged and took this train and had a wonderful experience. The cars were elegant, food & drink were fine and the tour guide was excellent. We enjoyed the bar car the next day (we stayed overnight) & sang along with a group from Spain. There were only a few English speaking pax on our train trip.

The perfect way to return to Cusco. The party started as soon as you get on the train...head for the bar as soon as you can, to get a good seat and the drinks ordered !We had a wonderful meal, and the train Manager was the perfect host...only time I have been on a train and hoped it would take hours to get to the destination, or not even get there!... It was sad to get off...
Travel like a queen. Gr8 service in a luxury environment with a trip to remember.The staff make the entire journey memorable with music and warmth

Lifetime Memory. I had heard that this was a "must" and I have to admit that I seriously hesitated as for a family of 5 it is a heafty price. Let me assure you that it was worth avery penny of the 2000 USD we paid. It was just an outstanding experience. A glass of Pisco/Champagne to start does help at 8.30 am. The musicians on board are magical and just make the whole "ambiente" take off. We even danced before brunching! Quite outstanding day that we will remember all our lives.

Hiram Bingham Train- A Ravishing Voyage. Deciding to hop on board this magnificent train is probably the best decision you can make in your entire lifetime. It is true that it isn't cheap but it is worth every single cent. The Hiram Bingham train will make of your long journey to the ancient ruins of Machu Picchu an incredible, unforgettable and above all, fun experience. Each wagon is loaded with a perfect combination of comfort and beauty in which you will enjoy a best-quality gourmet menu while you admire the pulchritudinous landscapes as you advance into the Peruvian jungle. When you finish pleasing your tongue you can head to the bar and enjoy some wonderful drinks or spectacular live entertainment in the last wagon which offers a better view of the valley. The musicians crew is formed by extremely talented people who play classical peruvian instruments and will entertain you throughout the whole journey. Totally worth it, no need to think twice!

Great trip to a great site. This train was a great surprise. We didn't expect it to be so posh. To be honest, I love train trips. The fact that you can move around freely, read a book or see the view, and not only endless clouds, leads me to prefere a train trip to a flight. Don't underestimate the merit of getting to the station only half an hour before the trip. So, no wonder I enjoyed this one so much. Let alone the unexpected breakfast , the fancy , first class style table setting . A grand way to get to the lascious green of Machu Pichu from the yellow baren dry flat lands of the sacred valley to the mountainous land of Machu Pichu. Enjoy it!

trip to Machu Picchu. we decided to take the Hiram Bingham as it was our anniversary trip and I am here to tell you it was the best idea we ever had. The great attention along with food and drinks was outstanding. They also provided us with a tour guide at Machu Picchu and Carlos was so much fun to listen to. I recommend this form of travel to anyone.
Great experience. The scenery from the train is breathtaking. The cars are clean, as are the restrooms. Seats are comfortable. Drinks and a snack are served. The staff is terrific!

Oh. My. Goodness!. What a great and fun way to travel to and from Machu Picchu!!! Great Pisco Sours, great food, good entertainment! It was such a treat to stand at the open end of the Observation Car and see the people going about their daily lives framed by the incredible countryside!
Awesome train. Great travel experience, wonderful accommodations, excellent food and staff. Would recommend for your return trip from Machu Picchu
Nice Train Ride. We booked tickets on the train with windows in the ceiling. Since your ride by the tall Andes, well worth the extra money and view. We even received a little food/drink on the way.

Far more fun than I expected. The views were not that great becasue the valley is so narrow. They completely entertained you on the way in and out with live music and drinks. Watch the booze on the way to MP. You are going to be sorry you drank so much -- I was.

What an experience.. My wife and I were celebrating her 50th birthday in Machu Picchu and I surprised her with this unique experience on our way back to Cusco September 4th. She was delighted. After you make your dinner selection you are asked to go to the bar car. That turned into such a fun party. The three man Peruvian band was fantastic. They played many Latin classics and the party was on. All of us were dancing the whole time as the champagne flowed. They ended with a Beatles sing along that had everyone singing and dancing. Afterwards we enjoyed a great gourmet dinner. We made many friends that we kept running into in Cusco at different hotels,shops and just walking in the streets. We will never forget this part of our trip. Carlos C

Unbelievable. What an experience! Great service, food and entertainment. And the scenery was breathtaking. The ride was over 3 hours each way but it felt much shorter than that. Even the trip back to Cusco without the scenery seemed to fly by. I would highly recommend this trip.

Luxury trip to Machu Picchu. The Hiram & Bingham train was a wonderful experience. The trip up was very relaxing. The trip back was so much fun. Live music in the bar car and dancing most of the way home. An experience it to be missed.
a must do. this was an extraordinary experience. the service, the food, the environment, and the staff are all superb. an elegant, old world experience like nothing else!!!

Don't eat the fish!. While we had a wonderful experience on the way to Machu Pichuu, the trip on the way back to Cusco did not fare as well. When our fish dinner was served, it immediately smelled fummy to me. I suggested my husband not eat it as well, but he insisted, and exactly 3 hours later was deathly ill. He totally missed Cusco as he could not be away from the bathroom. The train itself is lovely, and the atmosphere was fun, but we learned a hard lesson about the food.

It's worth the cost!. We had a lovely time. The greeting with champagne and dancers was very special. The food was very good. It was the service that made it stand out. Very attentive. We took the train in the morning and returned the same day. We were afraid the day would be too long however we found the ride back relaxing and enjoyable. The bar car entertainment that made the trip fly by. My only comment would, be that on trips where there are families with smaller children I would suggest they use both dining cars as to allows those of us who wish to dine without having children running down the train pulling on the table clothes etc. The management did the very best they could to encourage parents to monitor the behavior. Overall a terrific experience and the only way to go.

SO worth the extra cost. We went to Machu Picchu for part of our honeymoon so we decided to splurge on the Hiram Bingham train since our trip was more adventurous and we wanted one luxury experience. We absolutely loved this train! When you first arrive at the station in the morning you get tea or coffee and pastries. There while waiting to board there are musicians and dancers.The train itself is a fun first class experience. Many alcoholic drinks are complimentary. There are lots of delicious snacks. The drink car is a fun place to hang out and right next to the drink car is the caboose which has windows all around the sides and top for great views (and the views are spectacular heading up the mountains!) On the way up they have the very back of this car wide open so you can enjoy the fresh air and scenery.We LOVED the musicians aboard. Those of us who spent time in the last 2 cars had quite a dance party while the musicians played local music, and songs like La Bamba and Jail House Rock (in Spanish). Everyone took turns dancing; it was so fun!Our actual assigned seats and table were so beautiful. We had delicious 3 course meals on the journey there and back, we loved all the food. We got special champagne with hearts in the glasses for our honeymoon! They had amazing food (my husband enjoyed duck appetizers, fish dinners, etc) and wonderful vegetarian options I enjoyed (a nice change from usual vegetarian options of veggies and rice--these were first class meals!)It was such a wonderful experience--if you are considering taking the Hiram Bigham train to Machu PIcchu--do it! You will not regret spending a little extra to have a great time!!!!

Great experience!. We did the trip as social activity in a business meeting and everyone was very happy. Food and service on board is really great. By night during return very good ambience in the bar with live music. We enjoyed it very much.

Excellent. It's big bucks, but we hated to skip it. It is a 3 hr trip from Poroy-Cusco, but only 1 1/2 hrs from Ollantaytambo. Be sure to check out the "lounge" car, and the view off the back of the train. Take the Vistadome return trip to ease the pain in your wallet.

It doesn't get much better than this. It was a challenge to book because you had to make sure that the train journeys coincided with the days of the hotel you wanted to book. I really loved this journey. Whilst I had been ill from the night before, the train was old fashioned and wonderful. A formal lunch with white table clothes, wonderful waiters and great live music. I cannot recommend this journey highly enough.

My awesome Hiram Bingham Trip.. I have to tell you that two of your employees that I came into direct contact with were excellent.Franco our server on our trip Ollantaytambo-Macchu Picchu-Ollanyatambo August 16, 2013 was very attentive and extremely helpful as I have a special diet. Franco took great care to ensure that my diet was adhered to. I am so grateful for this. To me it meant that the Orient Express hires the best of the best.Jesus our tour guide was SUPER! He was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, fun, interesting, patient and kind. I over heard other guides and they could not even come close to his level of expertise. Macchu Picchu is beyond words but Jesus brought it to life for me. He is a great asset to your company. Arthur Grace

the ride of a lifetime. We rode from Ollantaytambo to Agua Caliente. How can you not love this train ride? The cars are comfortable and clean. The views are beyond description. We could have done without the fashion show on the return trip, but it was at least entertaining.

Fantastic. I chose to take this trip on my birthday and surprised my mother and husband. It was exciting to see how excited they both were. The staff were wonderfully attentive on August 15th on the ride to Macchu Pitcchu. They got the singers to perform some songs i love everyone sang happy birthday and qi was given a beautiful leatherbound jounal as a bithday giftfrom the company. This was a complete surprise for me and such an appropriate gift as I am a writer. The tour with Veronica was wonderful. We all missed the tea time as my mther rested in theroom and my husband and i stayed on at the citadel until closing.We spent a night in Sanctuary Lodge and the following night in Aguas Calientes returning on the Hiram Bingham train to Cusco. The return trip was no where near as good as the first. Perhaps the staff were more busy. I drank all four glasses of water at my table andhad to demand from a waiter that i begiven more. I was feeling as though I might feint, so was actually panicking when the water wasnot brought in a reasonable amount of time.Wenever met the maitre'd on the returntripwhereas on the way down the maitre'd introduced himself to each guest. It made me wish we had done our roundtrip in one day.As we returned twodays later,it would have suited us better to leave in the day. We had to be out of our hotel by 10 a.m. but the train doesn't leave until the evening. We became over tired and had to sleep but of course could not stretch out. I think if you don't doit all in one day, pyou might as well take a less expensive train for your return. Of course travelling by day affords you beautiful views you can't get at night.
made my life easier. very comfortable , pricy but worthy , very informative unbelievable sceneries ..food was good enough..

Incredible Experience. If you're looking to go to Machu Picchu in style this is the way to go. The staff are very friendly and really add to the atmosphere of the trip. We were well fed on the way there and on the way back and the music kept us entertained most of the way as well. Talk to Javier the train manager, he knows the definition of customer service and how to show people a good time.

fun train back from Machu Picchu. We were expecting just an ordinary train ride back after 4 days trekking. We were smelly and tired, and the staff were so friendly, gave us a beer, did a fashion show and a little dance, and got my husband up to model/dance. Fun diversion. Great views.

Travel in comfort to Macchu Picchu. This train is the way to travel if you like comfort and no nasty surprises. It was very stylish and very "Orient Express". The meal was decent but avoid the wines! The best thing is that the timing of the train means that travellers reach Macchu Picchu in the afternoon so the site is much less crowded than in the mornings. Passengers are also nannied so that everything is very smooth, from leaving the train to re-bording later, post-visit.One tip, we were advised to stay at the Inkaterra Hotel overnight but this was not really necessary as we had a very thorough tour of Macchu Picchu which lasted 3 hours. So, advice would be to do a return on the same day on the Hiram Bingham. Remember, the return trip is usually in the dark so no views.

Worth experiencing. Yes, it's pricey but it's a an enjoyable once-in-a-lifetime experience. The service is incredible, the food outstanding and they are generous with the drinks. Watching the scenery roll by while listening to live music in the exposed bar car was a highlight. The staff is knowledgable and personable.

A nice way to get up to Machu Picchu if you're not the overly adventurous type. Took this train up and back last week. It truly is a 5 star train ride and whilst not cheap, does allow for those who aren't inclined to hike up to Machu Picchu to do so in comfort and style. The service on board is impeccable and you aren't left wanting for more. From the departure festivities to the all inclusive tour and entertainment, I can't think of a better way to spend a day out and about.

overpriced but comfy tourist trap. I won't complain for enjoying the comforts in this glitzy tourist train after a long arduous trek on the Inca Trail, except to say that it was overpriced and unnecessarily cozy when you look outside the windows and see Peruvians are living in substandard settings.

Fun but...... The train was cool due to incredible scenery along the way, but there was zero leg room for someone that is 5'10''. I couldn't imagine being really tall. That made the ride seem alot longer than an hour
it was amazing. During the journey the take care of us about the food because my wife is alergic to fish, the barman prepared nice pisco sour and he showed us how to prepare it

the train to machu picchu. Typical elegant train travel with orient express. The seats were roomy and comfortable, the food service and quality was excellent and the bar car offered fabulous views from an outside platform, entertainment and snacks.

Stunning and highly enjoyable. This trip was included in our tour and I knew nothing about it and had no expectations. Also, we were lucky, as a mudslide had closed it down for several weeks, and it only re-opened two days earlier. Additionally, we had great weather, and the train was only 1/4 full. Perhaps this helped make it such an amazing experience, although I note that many others have had similarly good experiences. Standing in the open car at the back as it rolls slowly through the countryside makes you feel as though you are traveling in style as it was done 100 years ago. Additionally, all the food, music, drink, and entertainment is just superb. Coming back at night from Machu Picchu, however, was much less entertaining as it was dark and everyone was tired, so strongly suggest you get outward bound leg from Cusco and not just the return (as most of the passengers seemed to have done). A wonderful experience and strongly recommended.

Fun trip to Machu Picchu. Really fun train ride from Cusco to Machu Picchu and back. Peruvian fashion show by the steward and stewardesses on the leg back to Cusco. Really fun and we had the whole day in Machu Picchu.

Hiram Bingham Train from Cusco - Machu Picchu. Well no complaints from me this was an amazing experience. Travelling though the some amazing scenery. If you have the time to add this to part of you journey it is well worth it.

Memorable trip. We travelled to MP on the vistadome from the Sacred Valley so treated ourselves with the Hiram Bingham train on the trip back to Cusco as it was a longer trip! A lovely experience - great music from trio belting out songs which everyone joined in with (they even supplied maracas and several people danced!). Food was good as was wine. Enjoyed the complimentary pisco sours ( plus sparking wine on arrival). Everyone seemed to have a great time - although most fell asleep after dinner for the last 30 minutes! That's what good food and wine does for you :0)
Expensive but great. This is the train for the exclusive ride to Machu Picchu.If you can afford it, do not miss it.A one in a lifetime experience

Totally over-rated and over-priced. One can feel that Peru Rail holds the monopoly over this route. The customer service when buying the tickets is dreadful, very rude...and we speak Spanish fluently...so there is no excuse that they could not understand us. The staff on the train is nice, but do having to sit through a 'fashion show'...REALLY??? I felt like being a 'captured audience' who could literally not escape the 'show'. The only option would have been to hide in the toilet. Unfortunately if you are time-poor, the train is your ONLY option to Machu Picchu...so enjoy the rip-off.

Awesome transport from the Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu!. So, if I were basing this review solely on our personal experience with the HB train, I might give it 4*s based on a few issues we encountered the day before our trip: 1) the Cusco station was closed which meant the train actually left from the Sacred Valley. Buses were provided to get people to the Sacred Valley (about an hour and a half), but a bus isn't quite the same as the train, right? 2) We discovered that we couldn't bring our luggage on the train; only carry-ons that were around 8kg or less. This caused a few headaches as the train was one piece of a much bigger Peruvian puzzle that made up our honeymoon.Those two minor issues aside, this was a pretty awesome experience. You can take a public train to Machu Picchu for a fraction of the cost, I'm sure, but the Hiram Bingham transports you in style. It goes about 10mph, giving guests views of the scenery from Urubamba to Aguas Calientes. We had a three course lunch provided, complimentary wines, champagne, beer and pisco sours, plus live music from the observation cart.The service was great and staff delivered all messaging in Spanish and in English. The seats are comfy and in true Orient-Express fashion, every thing is done to the nines, delivering old world charm and a cozy environment. When we got off the train, we immediately jumped on buses that transported us up to the gates of Machu Picchu (seamless transition for which I have to give them props). In addition to transportation services, the trip included a guide for the park. Our guide, Nery, was incredible! Our trip to Machu Picchu wouldn't have been the same without her guidance and knowledge so the guide was a wonderful addition for us.All in all, it was a wonderful addition to our Peruvian excursion. If you just want to get from Point A to Point B, this isn't the train for you. If you want an experience in and of itself with great service, great food and an all around memorable time, this is hard to beat!

Great experience on the way to Machu Pichu. starting with the waiting room, the transportation to the initial station and following with the food inside the train and the live music, we had one of our best experiences traveling.If you are in Cusco and plan to visit Machu Pichu there is really no choice.It is not cheap, but it is worth every penny!

Old World Luxury. I felt like I had traveled back in time to when train travel was all one had. It was a divine and charming experience. Everything from the meals to the seats made me think of long-ago travelers. Make sure to visit the observation car - it is glassed in so that you get a fantastic view of the scenery.

Just as you'd dream about it. Excellent service from the departure lounge to the quality of the cars, the food, the music, the drinks.Do not remain seated: you can enjoy the bar car, or the little area with a lookout.It's indecently expensive, but a unique experience

Luxury way to see Machu Picchu. Fabulous trip on the Hiram Bingham train, with meals both ways, good wine, great views and excellent guides ensuring that we were met at hotels, and taken everywhere. An unforgettable experience.

Loved it. Even though the train station was closed at Poroy we still enjoyed our journey on board the luxurious Hiram Bingham train. The service, food and inclusive drinks made for a fabulous trip. If you can afford it , go for it.

The scenery from the train is easy to see.. The train is modern and well equipped. The food that we got was better than what you get on most airlines these days. The glass on the roof and side wall enhances the viewing experience.
Experience luxury. Outstanding, once in a lifetime experience, but pricey. We took Hiram Bingham up to Macchu Picchu, but took the Vistadome back to Cusco.

nice experience. yes, I strongly believe that one should try this kind of travelling (at least one way to or from MP) - the route is beautiful, the atmosphere of the train is nice , as well as their lunch. Sets the right mood.

Outstanding way to get to visit Machu Picchu. The experience on the train itself is splendid. Wonderful food, scenic route and live entertainment. The guided tour to Machu Picchu itself was a pleasant surprise as we had not understood it was included in the package.
Hands Down...the FINEST!!!. Splurge on this train... it's FINE FINE FINE and worth every extra dollar. If Machu Picchu is a once in a lifetime trip... do it!
One word: Excellent!. Memorable experience! The pre-boarding, the train, the entertainment, the food and service...superb!

Middle-of-the-road. This train might not be ideal for a solo traveler. You can be put to sit with a three-person group (on a 4-seat table). It was like you were intruding on a family dinner. It can be quite awkward and a nightmare when what you need is quiet time to rest. You will also be bombarded with a poor choice of tourist music through the journey. The staff members are attentive, sadly, especially to Caucasians. The ambience is animated and jolly, but not so refined. The food and the view are great, though. I wouldn't call it a first-class experience.
Either this or hike.. Good service, on time, and a snack. The fashion show on the way back is entertaining, but a tad pricey if you want to buy anything.
Luxury. I had one of the best trips ever! Everything was great, people, services, meals, etc!! Thank you very much for this experience!!

Best train in the world!. I have never traveled in a beautiful train like this before! Glass ceiling showed the sky and the mountains! Comfortable seats and very artistic walls. Staff were very friendly and I loved the warm cup of tea!

Old style luxury which only goes half way. We took the Hiram Bingham train back from Aguas Calientes (near Machu Picchu) to Cusco, but the snag was it could only take us half way. We had a wonderful dinner, and the train was very comfortable. But then near Ollytaytambo they stop and transfer you to a freezing van for the 90 minute drive to Cusco, because the rail line is under repair and has been for many months. Nobody knows when it will re-open. So if you plan to take this trip, check first whether you will get what you pay for, as it is a very expensive dinner on wheels.(written 6 July 2013)

Best way to get to Machu Picchu. This was a wonderful experience. We scheduled private transfers to and from the Hotel Monasterio by Orient Express. It was flawless. Our guide, Darwing, and our driver picked us up and drove us safely to the train station, about 1:20 hour drive. They got us on board where we were treated to Mimosas, champagne or pisco sours. We placed our brunch order and went to the observation car. So pretty. The train is very nice. You travel in style and eat delicous food served on white linens. You then get on a private bus and head up to Machu Picchu. No waiting in line for bus tickets or park tickets. All are included. What a drive. You are then met by your private guide who then tours you through the ruins. You cannot imagine how breath taking the views are. The guides will go slow if you are having trouble catching your breath. Wear sturdy shoes, sneakers or boots. Also, it was very hot and we had been cold everywhere else in South America. Try to dress in layers. You will get sun burned to take some sun screen. After our tour, we headed to the Sanctuary Lodge for tea. We had wonderful food. Then back to the bus to head down to the train. We had drinks in the waiting area of the train station, then got on board and ordered dinner. We then headed to the bar car for a festive time. Everyone on board was singing with the wonderful musicians and having a great time partying after their adventure. We then had a delicious meal and our escorts were waiting for us at the station. We were driven safely and comfortably back to our hotel. This is the best way to travel to Machu Picchu. In style and ultimate comfort. Orient Express is the best managed travel group that I have ever encountered. Everyone associated with them goes above and beyond to make sure you are safe and pampered. Everyone seems to really love their job and you can sense the pride they feel at being associated with such a fine company. You will thank yourself for having the good sense to book with Orient Express. Definitely the highlight of our South American trip.

Excellent way to travel to see Machu Picchu. The train goes to Aguas Caliente. Luxury travel. Clean. Good food and alcohol is all complimentary. Excellent live music. You can see the country side. Your own bus to Machu Picchu with tour. The guides are excellent. High tea at the Sanctuary. You can stay overnight if you wish. I suggest the Sanctuary as you can go to Machu for a final self tour (need to purchase a second ticket). The light is beautiful and there are not too many people. You can take the Hiram bus down. Your luggage is all handled. The hotel room is basic but it is an unique experience with excellent food (all included)', good wine (included).

Hiram Bingham Train between Cusco & Machu Picchu: Take a step back into the old world glory of a slow moving luxury train. It took me a while to settle down after we boarded the train; like most travelers, we were on a whirlwind tour of South America. But eventually, I slowed down and appreciated the elegant dining and bar cars. My favorite car was the open ended observation car where a trio of musicians provided the perfect soundtrack of Peruvian music. It is the best place to view the magical scenery, snow capped mountains and occasionally farms, villages and villagers. The food is Restaurant quality and the staff was surprisingly accommodating to special requests.
What an experience!. This was a sensational end to a wonderful trip to Macchu Picchu. The food and service were outstanding and the band just made the whole evening fantastic.

Another tick on the bucket list. Lovely old fashioned train with wonderful food and excellent service. Our every need was catered for. Great music on the way back had us all dancing in the aisles, a great experience.
Train Back From MP. The train was very clean organized and a nice way to travel back to Ollantaytambo from Machu Picchu.

one of the world's great train journeys. I wasn't quite sure if the experience would live up to my expectations since the rainy season had washed out part of the track so the journey started with a bus ride to the Sacred Valley. But there were only 3 of us on a luxury minibus and Javier made the journey memorable. He looked after me - and all of the other guests - in a five star manner for the rest of the trip. And the train was spectacular! Food, service and the chance to hang out in the bar car and snap photos in the open air. Once we got to Machu Picchu, we had a wonderful guide tour us around the site and then had a sumptuous afternoon tea. A lovely and stress-free way to see Machu Picchu!

First class all the way!. The Hiram Bingham train was the highlight of my trip to Peru. Everything about the train is truly first class - this is a MUST. The staff were incredibly helpful, knowledgable and fun. Its a magnificent way to begin and/or end your journey to Machu Picchu!

A journey worth the $$$. We took the train to Machu Picchu and were very impressed with the service, the food was good ( though not the greatest) and all the entertainment in the train and the station. The train speed is slow so you have the opportunity to take amazing pictures of the Sacred Valley. Everything was first class in this train!

Extortionate but fun. We only did the return half of the trip from Macchu Picchu.The service is pure decadence from afternoon tea at Sanctuary lodge, canapes at the station, pisco sours and dancing in the bar car to the wine and dining experience. A trip to do once if and when you are up to it.
