A train with a view!. Traveling here was an excellent choice, is the most expensive train to Aguas Calientes where you take the buses to visit Machu Pichu, but how many times in your life are you going to make this trip? So, if you want to go, do it in style and enjoy the splendid view!
Good trip to see the mountains. We returned from Machu Picchu on the train and loved the ride. Too bad it does not go all the way to Cusco.

A beautyful experience. A very nice old fashion train, a magnificent way to discover the Andes and to take a lot of outstanding pictures. An opportunity to drink a lot of "pisco sour", and a very nice dining experience. The dishes are served by waiters with white gloves, and the dishes are kept warm with silver dish-covers. "La grande classe" ! After lunch, some entraintments more in the panoramic bar wagon. Unforgetable !

Simply decadent. After a bad experience on Inka Rail coming from Cusco we decided to come back on the Hiram Bingham. If you want the best, you have it right here on this train. All the comforts are there, food excellent, service spectacular, entertainment super fun and the best way to go.

A great experience. Unfortunately we only travelled at night and because of a problem with the track instead of travelling four hours we only had two hours and finshed trip by bus. However it was lots of fun with live music and pisco sours. Food was average but the waiting service was excellent. Worth the experience.

Travel in luxury.. If you want a comfortable, luxurious voyage to Machu Picchu then nothing beats this train. The staff goes above and beyond. The food is AMAZING! The musicians keep you entertained so the hours just fly by. Highly recommended!

Exceptional service. The service and atmosphere on the Hiram Bingham were exceptional. My wife had gotten sick just before our planned depature, and they were able to accomodate her on the train the next day, and made sure that both of us felt welcome and were genuinly interested in her progress. Aside from that part, the atmosphere on e train was fun and lively, egged on by the energetic band. I highhly recommend taking this train.

Unique but not a must!. Enjoyable experience, nice scenery! The train ride was included in our 2 week tour package but I understand it is quite expensive so I don't know that the cost would be worth it since the thrill really is seeing Machu Picchu. I would have liked to spend more time at the ruins. We were on a guided tour, up and back, in one day and needed to abide by the train schedule.

Great train - but 1/2 train 1/2 bus was NOT good.. First, let me say the Hiram Bingham is a wonderful experience, and I would recommend anyone do it once. The train is beautiful, and meal, while not really restaurant quality, was certainly acceptable, and service was excellent. The train portion was exceptional, and we had a wonderful time.The problem is, during May & June, there was a problem with the tracks, and thus instead of the normal 4 hour ride, we got 2 hours on a train - 2 hours on a bus. We were emailed on this a month ago, but were told there would be no price adjustment, no refund option, and no exchange option. Basically it was accept it or loose the money. This is kind of like buying a 7 day cruise, and then being told (in advance) you will be spending 3 days at a Holiday Inn instead of the ship, and oh yes - sorry, no refund or no adjustment. Sorry, but I simply found that unacceptable.

Hiram Bingham up and Vistadome back. For cost considerations, we chose to take the Hiram Bingham up to Aguas Calientes and return the next day on the Vistadome. I was really glad we had made that decision. The excitement and anticipation of heading up to the marvel of Machu Picchu is heightened by the luxurious train ride. The service and food were spectacular. The music referred to was back in the observation car, and was especially fun on our trip because a large group of Portugese/Brazilian company executives/wives joined in the singing and dancing. We were disappointed to find out the week before travelling that part of the tracks were still not open after the rainy season and that the first hour and a half were on a bus. Though I must add that it was a very nice Mercedes van with only a few travelers from Cusco to Rio Sagrada where we boarded the train. The special touches begin as soon as check-in and continue right through with a guided tour of the ruins followed by afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Hotel. We were staying overnight, and our guide was very helpful to get us to our hotel and checked in before re-boarding the train with guests returning that evening. The next day, after hiking/climbing up the very steep Huayna Picchu, we took the afternoon Vistadome back to Cusco. It was certainly nice enough, and we were probably too tired to have fully enjoyed the Hiram Bingham experience on the return.

What music?. Way too expensive for a 2-hour train ride. The food was ok, but you pay through the nose for what you get - good and attentive service, good food and wine, and that's about it. There was no music when we were on board. And the 1 1/2 van ride is plain awful. Disappointing.
Amazing Train - great music and food. Very nice ride and a great staff. The music was a must and food was great and shows peruvian tastes. We loved it...Congratulations to Hiram staff..

Treat yourself to memorable train ride. We will always have very special memories of our trip aboard the Hiram Bingham train. The dining cars, along with the bar and observation cars were fitted with beautiful polished wood and brass. We were told that they were constructed in Malaysia.We found it difficult to believe that such delicious and beautifully prepared foods could be served on a train in rural Peru. We viewed the beautiful countryside pass outside of our window while we traveled in luxury to Aguas Calientes, near Machu Picchu. Although our trip was shortened a bit because of track repair, the two and one half hour trip of continuous pampering by the excellent staff was sufficient.If you choose not to take the round trip from Cusco to Aguas Calientes and back, treat yourself to at least a one way trip on this fabulous train.

See the Urubamba and Machu Picchu. The train was very comfortable, and a fun way to prepare ourselves to see Machu Picchu. They also serve snacks! On the way back from Machu Picchu they have a strange sort of entertainment. A type of clown dances down the aisle, and then there is a fashion show of alpaca products. And then you have the opportunity to buy these products. Odd to the American seeing this, but it is obviously lucrative. My husband was chosen to help model which was fun for everyone but him.

Absolutely loved it--biggest surprise of entire Peru trip. My husband and I took the Hiram Bingham train round-trip to Machu Picchu--up one morning from Rio Sagrado in the Sacred Valley and back 2 days later. Because of repair work on the tracks between Cusco and the Sacred Valley, they bussed people from Cusco to Hotel Rio Sagrado, but we already were staying at the Hotel Rio Sagrado, so that made it an easy start, indeed! On our return from Machu Picchu, the train ended again at Rio Sagrado, and we had a pleasant coach drive back to Cusco. The train, itself, made us feel like we were travelers in the 19th century. Definitely Orient-Express if ever we saw it! Very good meals both ways, extraordinary service, and very comfortable rides. The views are amazing on the way to Machu Picchu in the morning, but it is too dark on the return. Totally worth the money if you can afford it!

Elegant and fun. This trip was our so called "trip of a lifetime" so the one thing I wanted to do was take the Hiram Bingham Train. My husband loves trains and we decided to do the return Aguas Caliente to Cusco evening trip. It included dinner and drinks. Since we had stayed at the Sanctuary Lodge our bags were being delivered so we went down to town mrom Machu Picchu a little early to shop. We arrived at the train station a couple hours before the train was scheduled to leave. They proved a private lounge for passengers using the Orient Express trains. It was very clean and comfortable. We could come and go as we pleased and beverages were available. Dinner was fantastic and music was regional and beautiful. It was so much fun. Be aware that before June, the train does not go into Cusco. The last hour and a half you will be on a bus. That was disappointing. We did not know that. Otherwise, it was great.

This ride is a special treat!. We rode the Hiram Bingham up to Machu Picchu. It is rather pricey and you must book a ways in advance. The service was first rate. A lovely lunch with wine was served on the way up. There was live music that greeted us at the station and played on the train for most of the trip. We loved the dining car. There was an open observation platform on the rear of the train. After such a nice trip up on this train we had a dismal experience on the "plain" train (non-Hiram Bingham) we took on our return to Cusco.

train to the clouds. We had the back most seats. Best view possible. Watched as the world changed into the jungle.They sold Alpaca clothes on way back, gorgeous but pricey. They did put on a show with it, which made for some fun.

A Great Train Experience - but poorly managed.. We had been booked on the Hiram Bingham for at least 6 months prior to our trip but received no communication from either the Orient Express or the Hiram Bingham management team that, due to a landslide that had damaged the track close to Pisac, that the Hiram Bingham train would overcome this operational difficulty by departing/terminating at the Rio Salgrado Hotel rather than Poroy. This greatly reduces the trip to Machu Picchu on board this excellent train.We loved the train with its comfortable seats, wonderful atmosphere and high quality lunch/dinner. However, the boarding process was poor and we would warn future travellers to expect an element of inconvenience, discomfort and annoyance on the journey to and from Wanchaq Train Station and the Rio Salgrado until the Hiram Bingham management get to grips with their operational problems.We checked in at Wanchaq Train Station at 7:30am and were asked to retain our luggage. It was obviously a busy time for the staff as they were also trying to board and despatch the Andean Explorer at the same time. We found two comfortable seats in the well-decorated waiting room and enjoyed a cup of coffee while listening to an Andean Folk Group watching the departure of the Andean Explorer.This train departed at 8:00am leaving some 14 to 15 Hiram Bingham passengers waiting. We were given no further information until at around 8:30am it became obvious that the Hiram Bingham management staff had disappeared and a tour guide suddenly urged us all to hurry and board the bus - and bring our luggage.The bus was an ordinary tour van - not a luxury coach. We were sat at the back of this vehicle and were bounced around. There did not seem to be any AC working and as there was no microphone we could not hear any of the 20 minute briefing on Machu Picchu given by the guide. Half way to the Rio Salgrado we stopped for a drink at the viewpoint high above the Sacred Valley and here we discovered where the Hiram Bingham management were - they had all caught the first bus. This was a brief and hurried stop before we set off to reach the Rio Salgrado.Access to the hotel was limited by the Hiram Bingham Train being positioned at the entrance. Again we were told to hurry off the bus taking our luggage and form a queue to check-in - again. Here came the annoyance - waiting in the hot sun to check-in for a second time and seeing the check-in staff giving priority and allowing tour groups to push in ahead of the individual travellers. They seemed to be also dominating the seating allocation. To make it worse, we were asked to squash up against a wall to allow a tour bus to pass. We ended up in different seats and I had to insist on receiving baggage receipts for our luggage.If this first experience of the Hiram Bingham was frustrating and annoying, the next part was fantastic. The scenery as we passed up the Sacred Valley was terrific and everybody would appreciate the comfort; food and entertainment. This was the quality of the Orient Express.On arrival at Machu Picchu Town, we again witnessed the priority given to the tour groups as the individual travellers were held back and delayed. It seemed strange since it was these individuals who were to stay at the Orient Express Sanctuary Lodge overnight.It was a similar experience on the way back to Cuzco the next day. Everybody was told to be ready to leave from in front of the Sanctuary Lodge at 4:45pm. The Sanctuary Lodge staff had checked-in our luggage. It was a bit of a scrummage to get on one of the 4 coaches that transported everybody down the winding track from Machu Picchu to the town to board the Hiram Bingham with again the tour guide trying to organise in favour of their customers.At the train station, again there was a queue and the boarding staff giving preference to the tour groups. I was angered when, having reached the head of the queue, the manager i/c boarding reached over us and the couple behind to check in another passenger.Again the trip on the train back to the Rio Salgrado was excellent and a great experience but then it was collecting the luggage in darkness and a long trip back to the main rail station in Cuzco in a cramped bus with the luggage on our laps arriving after 10:00pm.My advice to the Orient Express is to review how it is managing their current operational problem and recognise that they should be offering a luxury experience from start to finish; that they should treat all their customers equally and the value of communicating to their customers.

A touch of luxury. Hiram Bingham lost our luggage en route to Machu Picchu - despite our many requests to label it, we were assured it would be okay. it wasn't. We were also on the train with two large tour groups, whose guides dominated the carriage and we certainly felt slightly ignored.however the return trip , without the tour groups and their guides was a delight, the dinner very good and the entertainment lively and interesting .

Fabulous!. I loved the Hiram Bingham Train! We saw the Vistadome Train pull up alongside us, and although it looked fine, it was no comparison to the Hiram Bingham! Very good lunch on board, and beautiful scenery as well. It is VERY expensive, but totally worth the money! We had a great experience!

Not so great experience. We travelled back from Machu Picchu on the 2nd May on the Hiram Bingham train. We were not told that the train doesn't go all the way to Cuzco now but stops half way and you then have to catch very cramped buses for the last hour and a half to Cuzco. No-one on the train knew about this and we were all surprised when we were told to get off and catch the buses. There was no offer of a refund and we only booked the trip a month before and we were not told then even though this has been the case since February. My advice is not to take this train back from Machu Picchu

Macchu Pichu return. The train is part of the Orient Express group. We have travelled on their train from Venice to London so it was interesting to compare. The train is very similar to the others in the group, however because we chose to go on it on our return from Macchu Pichu we unfortunately did not experience the glory of the scenery during out journey because it was dark ! Part of the thrill of using these trains is looking at the glorious scenery the train travels through, I would suggest if you want this use the train to go to MP not the return.The major problem for the train at the moment is that due to a landslide you only go for half the journey to Cusco, you have to leave the train halfway and continue your journey by road. This made service for dinner somewhat of a rush. They didn't start serving the meal until one hour into the journey and some people did not finish their meal before they were being asked to get off. One assumes this problem will disappear once they have cleared the line, however I would ckeck this before you book.
Great way to travel to Machu Picchu. Nice lunch on the way to Machu Picchu on a luxury train, while seeing the scenery of the Sacred Valley.

What a way to travel!. We took the Hiram Bingham train to Machu Picchu in April 2013 during our first trip to South America. It was just a great experience. It is not inexpensive but it includes everything. For people like us who were not familiar with the area it was a great way to make sure that we had all our bases covered and that nothing went wrong. Basically, once you make your reservation on line and get your boarding passes (again on line), all you have to do is to show up at the station in Cusco and the staff of the Hiram Bingham take over. The food and drink on the train and in the hotel near Machu Picchu are wonderful. The guides are just great - knowledgeable, helpful and professional - and Machu Picchu itself is unforgettable. The staff on the train couldn't have been more professional and just plain nice. When we returned to Cusco, they made sure there was a taxi waiting for us to take us back to our hotel. This is truly a luxury packaget. If you can afford it, do it - you won't be disappointed. And remember, everything is included.

A train journey like no other. We have travelled in a lot of trains in our life time and the Hiram Bingham express was amongst one of the best. There is a completely different feel to the whole experience, starting with the Andean Dancers at the check in to being treated like royalty during the entire journey. Fantastic lunch with loads of wine, while the train chugs along the beautiful country side and the flowing Urubamba river. The guides provided are excellent and we stayed overnight at Macchu Picchu but you can make it a round trip on the same day. We returned the next day and were treated to a gourmet dinner and alive band and dancing on the way back to Cusco. It is definitely worth the steep price you pay for the journeyPlease note that there is very little space for luggage so the company gives you a small hand luggage for you clothes .
The Orient Express in Peru. The Hiram Bingham Train was definitely as good as the European Orient Express but with even more spectacular scenery - what an experience.

Luxurious and fun.. The first time I went to Machu Picchu I went on the Vista Dome train (May 2011), but on my second time to Macchu Picchu (April 2013) I had the chance to go on the journey with HB train and there is no comparison. The service, the tables, the food, the bar, the musicians, everything is flawless! I have no idea how they manage to do it, but if you would like to rest from all the music and dancing going on the bar wagon, the noise does not even reach the nearest table to the bar.

Give yourself a treat. This train is five-star service from start to finish. At the station in the morning you are welcomed by musicians and dancers, before buses take you to the Hiram Bingham starting point (which due to a recent landslide was at Urabamba). On board, it's gourmet dining, delightful Peruvian wines, beers and sparkling wine, not to mention the Pisco Sours. In the observation car/bar at the rear of the train, more musicians entertain the travellers as the scenery of the Sacred Valley slides past at a leisurely pace.On arrival at Aguascalientes, buses and take you and your guides to Machu Picchu at a time when the main tourist hordes are leaving for the day. When you have had enough, it's high tea on top of the mountain before heading downhill for the very comfortable return journey with a five-course gourmet dinner, more entertainment, and wines.It's not cheap, but we loved it. A guilty pleasure?
Best train travel. The service the facilities even the train infrastructure is nice. Worth it the Price i loved it and the food is delicious.

Thank you for the great memories. If you are going to spend a little more while on holiday, this is one place to do it. After a strenuous day at Machu Picchu the train feltn like an oasis. Great Pisco sours amoung authentic music (we loved it so much we sought out the spanish tunes for our ipod upon arrival back in the states). All passangers cheering and dancing in unity in the bar car before an extremely pleasant, satisfying and delicious meal - what fun - this is what vacation is all about!

What a treat!. We took the Hiram Bingham Train on the way to Machu Picchu. This was such a treat and worth the splurge! I felt as if I went back in time traveling by train. We were served an amazing meal complete with wine. The service was excellent, catering to anything we needed (even my vegetarian request). The guides on the train were very helpful and were not annoying. The seats were comfortable and the views were spectacular. Upon arrival we were greeted with water and a refreshing towel. We had clean bathrooms to use before getting on the bus which took us up to Machu Picchu. Our guide explained everything very clearly and was great at giving us details. The whole process was seamless and was truly a treat!
best way to get to Machu Pichu. food, drinks, service, awesome sight seeing, comfortable, everything is top notch, very highly recommended

very nice and comfortable train. a mini fashion show and a mini dance.snacks and coke were provided.very comfortable.we went in the evening after our trek from MP and so couldnt really enjoy the scenery but heard great things about the scenery from the train.

Machu Picchu in Style!. What a great way to travel to, or from, Machu Picchu. This stylish train, run by Orient Express was the icing on the cake after exploring Machu Picchu. The station lounge was a cool oasis after our 2nd day climb up Huayna Picchu, and then the train itself was like a high class hotel on wheels. The staff were attentive, the food imaginative and delicious, and the bar where Pisco sours were on the house was lively and fun. We ended up jiving to the Peruvian band (nothing to do with the Pisco sours!) and then watching all the fantastic rugged peaks, fast flowing rivers and the Peruvian people from the open air carriage. Much more expensive than the Andean Express that we later took to Puno, but it is right up there on the "must do" list!

Trip NEVER to skip. When we were looking for the Train we thought this is a once in maybe a lifetime trip why not try the Hiram Bingham? Let me tell you nothing BUT THE BEST. From the minute you arrive they give you drinks, appetizers, VIP treatment and the music,wow it makes you want to be at the train more time. Its expensive but its worth every penny. Next time you plan your trip make it be the best train. We are already planning other Orient Express train trips.

Unforgettable!. Excellent service, Excellent Food and Excellent company. Everyone was very welcoming and very attentive. We had a great time. When we arrived we were greeted with some champagne and as soon as everyone was up and ready, we were able to walk around and tour the train. We immediately went to the last car and took some pictures as well as few drinks. While we were all talking pictures a trio set up and started a chain of reaction. Everyone had a drink in hand and singing. Some even started dancing. Oh, it was fun. Later we were called in to take a seat in the dinner, our lunch was ready. Exquisite. We made great memories and we couldn't have made these great memories without the staff of Hiram Bingham. Thank you.
Take the train. The Vistadome train was great. The staff were excellent and the train was impecable. We booked the mid level tickets. You get breakfast and a snack on the return trip. NA beverages.

The Best Way to Travel to Machu Picchu!. This is a First Class experience all the way. Right from the start with Mimosas and O.J and a Peruvian band playing and dancing,all at the station before we even board the train! The antique train becomes part of the adventure,with a bar rear observation car,fine dining, Pisco Sours,live music, and amazing views along the trip. Totally worth every penny. A trusted guide even takes the ride and safely guides your group the whole way,even ending up in a special cafeteria with snacks, food ,beverages for the HB Train travellers! I loved the whole experience and highly recommend making it part of your Peruvian adventure!

Unbelievable luxury experience. If you are going to resent the price, you shouldn't take this train. It's very expensive but worth every penny. It is truly a one-of-a-kind experience. The train is absolutely beautiful. You are assigned a dining table for either 2 or 4 people, and you can wander back to the bar cars or the observation car, where you can stand outside on the rear platform. The service is unbelievably good, food was excellent. Really unforgettable, as is the scenery. Note the warning that you cannot take your large luggage.

What a fun way to travel!. This was a fun and luxurious way to get to Aguas Calientes, the town closest to Machu Picchu. It was a great experience. The food was delicious and the staff were great. You felt pampered and very well looked after. Attached to the dining cart was the bar and viewing area. The band that played there was upbeat and got everyone involved. There was even some impromptu dancing!

Horrible ride,. Hiram Bingham is supposed to be a luxury train, I paid 1800$ for 3 of us up and down from Cusco to MacchuPicchu. This is what you get:-The train left late from another station 100Km away from Cusco (without advise), still we were charged the same.-Tourists aboard we're sold as "all included packs": The train was full of drunk young people screaming the whole way up and down (different days).-No privacy, you sit next to strangers.-Sevice excellent but the manager was arrogant and very unkind trying to make it look like it was our fault to think this train was luxury.CONCLUSION: CHOOSE A DIFFERENT TRAIN, THE SAME + LESS EXPENSES, HIRAM BINGHAM ISN'T A LUXURY TRAIN ANYMORE, THEY FILL EMPTY SEATS WITH ALL INCLUSIVE DRUNK TOURISTS.

CANT GET A BETTER RIDE!. even though is a short ride, just over an hour, it is the train ride of your life. The train is very conformable, the service is impeccable, the stewards are polite and well mannered, the snacks are excellent and the view through the mountains is just unbelievable. I couldn't pull my face off the window.The ride is very well organized, departure times are kept to seconds, the system is flawless. I rode trains in my life but never like this. True, this is not the Orient Express but is thousands time better that Canadian Via Rails! two thumbs up!
Great train ride to Machu Picchu. This is a luxury ride to Machu Picchu. This train journey is memorable. Great service, delicious food, fun entertainment and above all fascinating landscape of Peru.

best train ride to Machu Picchu. Working as a tour leader, I run trips for luxury groups, so we take the best train ride to Machu Picchu. The hiram bingham train experience is just memorable. Every single passenger enjoy not only the train ride itself but the delicious food, the excellent service and the great live show on board.I always get the best comments about this service and I can tell myself; it is defenitely the best and most enjoyable and comfortable way to get to Machu Picchu.

Train Ride!. The train runs on time and they provide good service. It was very relaxing after all the running around on the ruin all day. Would be great to have service to Cusco. I know I would prefer to over the crazy bus drivers and cabbies.

Everything!. I LOVED the personal and general narration of the field we were seeing, the statistics of Peruvian agriculture, identifying the crops we were passing -- I can now recognize quinoa, and artichokes. The menu is reflective of the culture in such a hospitable way. They understand enhancing our excitement of actually getting to Machu Picchu. After the site, the meal, and entertainment are perfect -- not so worried about dehydrating or getting sore feet -- and, if one would rather stay quiet (me) it's easy to go back to your spot. I appreciate the TACTFUL way staff is attentive to high-altitude sickness. If one is coming this far from the US, and you're not a college kid hiking the Inka trail, this is the way to go.

the fun we had!. dancing singing, eating and traveling what more could you ask for. The Pisco sours where wonderful, the meal was good and the service was great. What made our journey fun...the 3 musical entertainers. We sang and danced and since it was evening time there was no scenery to see....so how else do you make the time fly by....laugh, dance, and enjoy

Fantastic experience. I travelled on this train 2 days ago. Absolutely beautiful. I note that a recent reviewer took exception to the live band. For me, they made the trip. Excellent musicians and with a party from Cuba and Puerto Rico on board it turned into party time. The food was really good. The scenery is spectacular as the train makes its journey. Definitely a life time experience. Because the champagne flows on the train you might want to organise your guide to see you the next day and not immediately you get off the train. I wish I had done that. I am so glad that I booked to go on this train. I returned via Vistadome to Cusco and the difference was noticeable.

This is an Absolute Must!. The Hiram Bingham is a once in a lifetime experience! It is something we will never forget. It is very expensive, but boy was it money well spent! We had such an incredible time on this train. The train is very posh and elegant. It is very comfortable, too. The food was delicious, the drinks were delicious, the service was impeccable, and the views were to die for! You have brunch on the way up to Machu Picchu and dinner on the way back. There is a big party in the bar car on the way back to Cusco, and it was a blast! There is entertainment, dancing, singing, and Pisco Sours flowing. There are so many great photo opportunities, too. I really cannot say enough good things about the Hiram Bingham train. We have recommended the trip to Machu Picchu to everyone, just for the train experience itself. There are several other options for transportation to Machu Picchu, but the Hiram Bingham by far is the best way to go! If you weren't planning on taking the Hiram Bingham to Machu Picchu, do yourself a favor and set aside some extra money for this. You won't be disappointed!

Excellent way to visit Maccu Piccu. A luxury introduction to the Ancient City. Dining and wine options were excellent. The observation car was perfect. However, the live band with amp' and speakers was, at times overkill

Bingham train currently a shorter trip. Be aware that Peru Rail has currently shortened all of its trains to Machu PIcchu to include a long bus ride from Cusco due to track conditions. This has the most impact on the Bingham as it eliminates 1hr+ of quality time of the train (in our case after dinner coffee/drinks, socializing).We opted for the Bingham for our return from MP (took vistadome up which was just fine), probably not worth the big price premium given the short trip.

Wonderful trip to Macchu Picchu. The train is decorated in the old fashioned style of luxury and elegance. The seats are comfortable, and the staff could not do enough for us. The food is fantastic and we had a lovely brunch on the way up and a delicious dinner on the way back. There is unlimited wine although we were not drinking alcohol due to the altitude. You are probably only going to go once in your life. Do it in style!

rail ride of a life time!. I've always had a dream about being on the Orient Express. While this wasn't exactly the trans-Siberian Orient Express it was a most exchanting substitute. The Hiram Bingham Orient Express consisted of 4 cars: 2 dining cars, a bar car, and a viewing car. The train is a lovingly crafted Orient Exprews, with many fine details, linens, etc. We enjoyed a wonderful brunch on the way to Machu Picchu, and a lively Pisco Sour party (in the bar car) and lovely dinner on the return trip to Cusco. The scenery was magnificent along the way, the multi-course meals in both directions were to die for, with exellent accompaying wines. You can have a table for either two or four. It was a very romantic, dream ride - I felt like I was in a film! - and I cannot recommend it too highly to anyone who enjoys the romance of a train along with fine dining.
Great train ride!!. We opted for the 2nd most expensive train, and it was great! The 3 hour ride to Machu Picchu was beautiful.
Worth the extra $$. I splurged a little on this trip, and it was well worth it... the silver service was top notch and tour was fantastic.

The best way to Machu PIcchu. Although we considered the other options to get to Machu Picchu, what finally made us decide to take the Hiram Bingham train was that it left later than the other trains (9:05 a.m.) It turned out to be a luxurious- and expensive-choice. Upon arriving at the station which is about 20 minutes from Cusco, we were greeted by a troupe of local dancers in costumes doing traditional dancers. We were then escorted on to the train and shown to our table. The only caveat is that most likely someone in your group will be riding backwards since you are seated at tables rather than traditional forward-facing seats. As soon as the train started we were asked for our lunch order. Since I am a very picky eater, I was not happy with the standard choices, but was offered other simple dishes that were satisfactory. The train ride itself is pleasant enough; the scenery interesting but not spectacular. There was entertainment in the bar car, which was enjoyable. The 3 1/2 hour trip passed quickly. We were assigned to a young woman who would be our guide in Machu Picchu and she was fantastic. Her enthusiasm was contagious and her knowledge absolutely made the day for us. After the tour of Machu Picchu we were taken to the Sanctuary Hotel for a lovely late afternoon tea. The food was quite good. We then returned to Aguas Calientes to get the return train to Cusco. Unfortunately, on the return, there was a mud slide on the tracks and our train was delayed about 40 minutes before they could clear the tracks. This supposedly happens fairly frequently during the rainy season and is simply a force of Nature that can't be controlled. We happened to see some of the other trains during our ride and they were absolutely packed with passengers. Although the Backpacker and Expedition trains are much less expensive than the Hiram Bingham, they can't be nearly as comfortable or pleasant. The Hiram Bingham train is an experience in its own right, not just a way to get to Machu Picchu.
Stuck in the mud. Ok the train before us got stuck in the mud and we had to try again the next day. Plan extra time to get some where.

A great experience. We decided to travel from Cusco to Aguas Calientes on the Vistadome and to return on the Hiram Bingham which represented fair value for money for the combined round trip. The dining car and bar/lounge car are have been restored to the standard that you expect from the Orient Express Group. After boarding you have the choice of a cocktail at your seat or in the bar where a small band plays local and international music before dinner. The four course dinner was of a very good standard with the medallions of beef being the best meat that we ate in Peru. The Chilean and Argentinian wines served were perfectly acceptable. From boarding to arriving back in Cusco the service was very attentive and professional. A very enjoyable and relaxing way to end our day in Machu Picchu.

The best train to Machu Picchu. I have ridden on the Vistadome, the Andean Explorer, and the Hiram Bingham, and the Hiram Bingham train was by far the nicest. It was also the most expensive, but it was definitely worth it. From the minute we got on the train we were taken care of by the expert staff. My dad thought he left his passport in the exclusive Hiram Bingham lounge in the Aguas Calientes station, so they made calls back to the station to have someone check for it. For the rest of the ride we got excellent service, delicious food, and unlimited wine. Do not make the mistake of snacking before the trip like we did - there is plenty of food on board!

Nice. The cars are great, the food is good and the speed leisurely. On our trip the open car at the back was missing ("for repairs"), and on the return it was dark, so not much to see. Also, some rather drunk and very loud Americans made conversation difficult at the tables close to them - no fault of the train or its personell.

Super luxury train. It is expensive - but worth it. Going from Cusco to Aguas Calientes the train runs in the daytime, so you can see the scenery. Coming back much of it is in the dark. The staff were super, the dining experience and ambience very good.

A very pleasant way to travel to Machu Pichu. A fantastic service from the minute you set foot on the train to your arrival. The cuisine and wines and service excellent and the return service in the evening when you enjoy a wonderful dinner is a must for any traveller

Richards train trip to KM 88. Narrow guage train takes the back packer/hiker to KM 88, Aguas Caliente, or Machu Picchu depending on what you are there to do. KM 88 begins the Inca Trail, Aguas Caliente has natural hot baths for those wanting to relax at the end of a five day hike over the Inca Trail. For those not wanting to hike, continue on to the bus depot where you can take a bus up the switch-back gravel road to Machu Picchu.

A Trip back in Time. If you like trains, this one is a must. It feels like a train ride right out of the movies, just like the Orient Express should be. The service is incredible, the food delicious and the views stunning.Walking the Inca Trail is for some but the Hiram Bingham train is for me! Definitely one of the high liters of our Machu Picchu experience.
expensive. only game in town if don't need to eat on trip take backpackertake plenty of water before going to machu picchu water 5 times the price at site

Nice but expensive for what you actually get. Train is a bit stuffy, in Orient-Express kind of way , but otherwise not with modern comforts. Seats don't recline. No wifi. Open air area, for watching the beautiful way to MP, is extremely small. Food was good, as we're free drinks and music, but not sure they're worth the price.
Amazing experience. Great means to enjoy the landscape. Great service, entertainment - 2 bands with dancers, fashion show of local scarfes/gloves. Lunch and tea were both nice. Highly recommended.
Great experience, beautiful train and great service.. Great service, beautiful train. The best was we stayed at the park after everyone had to leave on the early train.

First Class All the Way. The train on the Hiram Bingham was included as part of our package. So glad it was.Truly first class. To Machi Picchu was served an excellent lunch to begin your exciting adventure.On the return and excellent dinner with drinks and wine a flowing in the Bar Car with excellent local songs and dancing.Truly an amazing add-on to such a beautiful city (Cusco) and adventure.

The way trains should be!. We took the Hiram Bingham train from Machu Picchu back to Cusco. It's the last train of the day - so you get to spend the longest time at the Citadel. We took the "Backpacker" train to Aguas Calientes the previous day which was just fine. We stayed the night at the Sanctuary Lodge next to Machu Picchu. The lodge serves afternoon tea prior to leaving for the Hiram Bingham train. The tea should not be missed - it is delicious. Then there is a special bus just for the folks taking this train to take you back down the hill to the train station. There is a separate lounge at the station for the folks taking this train as well. The sun was just setting as we got on the train. On the way to Machu Picchu the scenery is stunning, so what's inside the train is not so important -- we found the basic train to be just fine. On the way back - you really can't see much out of the windows which makes what's going on inside the train even more important. It is beautifully restored with gleaming polished wood and brass. Your dining tables are set with glass and place settings. A delicious meal is served - several choices available. The local tout and steak choices were perfectly cooked - better than most we've had in the nicer steakhouses in the US. The bar car had great, energetic music and dancing. We had great fun dancing, singing and drinking a few whiskey sours. The Peruvian band that played was incredible - really got everyone loosened up and talking. We met some great people from all over the world - even exchanged addresses with some. The staff on the train were exceptionally well-trained and accommodating. Definitely worth the price - especially on the way back!

The best. There are different train to reach Macchu Picchu, but this is the bestIts expensive but worth it, the experience is a must during this vacation.The service is magnificent, the food! They have live music inside the train!!!

Step Back in Time. Starting on the railway platform with champagne and nibbles and a band playing in the background the trend for the return journey from Machu Pichu was set in motion. All aboard and away we went. The carriages were all decked out for dinner and staff resplendent in their uniforms. During the course of the journey we were served drinks, entrees, mains and desert accompanied by a selection of wines. An impressive affair and a very pleasant way to spend a few hours travelling with family and friends. The band played on further down the train where you could join in and dance. As a finale farewell they meandered through the train playing as they went.All in all a very pleasant way to wind up a day in Machu Pichu.

Most amazing experience. We took the train one way from Machu Picchu to Cuzco. It was the quickest trip of my life. The ride was smooth, the food was amazing. Pisco sours were flowing effortlessly and the band a few cars down from us was unforgettable. It was a first class experience.Simple put: if you can get past the sticker shock, it will be one of the best experiences of your life.

A very enjoyable train ride. The Hiram Bingham Train to Machu Picchu is the only way to travel. The train was first class - from the staff, to the food, to the comfort of the train. The scenery during the trip was awesome.

Machu Picchu travel. True luxury. You are taken back to the early 20th century in this antiique brass and fine wood appointed train. Gourmet meals, attentive waiters and even oxygen available. I needed it!

Pleasant. The product is wonderful (clean, comfortable, what you would expect), wait staff were skilled and pleasant, the food is good (but not outstanding). We found the customer service manager (we assume this was his role), was rude and marred our first impressions of the train. Seating allocated on your ticket is not adhered to. Javier (the customer service manager) stated we could not have a table for two as the train was "fully" booked. We stood our ground, and after 10 minutes, were allowed to sit at a table for two. The train was not full as he had stated, and throughout the journey he made a point of ignoring us.Opting to take the Hiram Bingham is a once in a lifetime opportunity for some people. The experience would have been wonderful expect for this particular staff member. Perhaps travelling each day on the train, he has forgotten that for visitors, it is an experience that they have been looking forward to for a long time.

Must do it. I felt guilty once. As I lifted the glass of chilled Chablis to me lips having confirmed it was perfectly matched to the main course, I glanced outside to see a group of people walking the 4 day uphill climb to Matchu Pitchu. My guilt was fleeting.

5 stars train. The luxury train ,has lovely food, excellent service, entertainment and a very good bar. There is an excellent view of the flora & fauna of the way to and from Machu Pichu, the guests of the train cars are also lovely.

10 hours spent luxuriously...... Service is amazing, a lot of entertainment such as music, fashion show etc....Views are nice, overall a luxurious trip. The food was so-so, I ordered the fish which was extremely dry!

Memorable Experience. It was superb experience. We took this ride from cusco and took Vistadome while coming back.It is expensive but if offers great views, superb service, average food, complimentary bar, entrance tickets to machu pichu, guided tour in machu pichu, bus tickets etc. So for all that I think it is still expensive... but a great expereince. We loved it.BUT, if you want to hike any of the peaks....wayna pichu or machu pichu make sure you get the additional tickets from Hiram bingham itself, you cannot add it later at Aqua calientes. They are not at all flexible. We took the Hiram bingham train ans wanted to hike up Wayna pichu. We thought its only another $10...anybody should be able to add it to our existing tickets of $380. but NO.... we were not able to hike to wayna pichu. Only option was to buy another ticket to wayna pichu worth $60.Which is not to bad either.
nice experience. very good train, too small carriage for viewing, no need for music players...good food and excellent service

AMAZING! A MUST!. I took the Hiram Bingham train to Machu Picchu! In my opinion, this is the only way to travel to and from Machupicchu. They have musical parties to and from machupicchu. When boarding the train, they have dancers and greet you with champagne. They have some great food and coffee. You cannot miss this!!!!!

Very Fancy and Fun. We thought the train had a very Orient Express feel with lovely dining with tablecloths and good service. Fun bar car with a band too. Just VERY expensive so I'm not sure I could recommend it to all.

The Proposal. This is where i chose to propose to my husband it was so beautiful i thought it was the ideal setting.We all found the train and the journey to Machu Picchu so beautiful and being on the train you had time to take in the breathtaking sites.......and i also had time to calm the nerves for the proposal...

Unforgettable Train Ride. This is a unique experience for Americans, who rarely take trains. The Hiram Bingjham is a luxury train experience, w/ excellent dining, and comfortable seats. My family, including husband and 3 kids, really had a great time. It's not such a long ride that you would get bored, and there is a lot to see on the route while it is still light outside. I would absolutely recommend taking this train, you won't forget the experience.

Over-rated, but the only game in town. The train and route are beautiful by any standards. You can get the same view in another train for cheap, but this one will give you the pampering you may want. The meal and unlimited free drinks don't add up to the increase in price. Also, we had a bad experience and broke down late at night in a canyon. It took several hours to get another engine, and the conductor kept promising that it was right around the corner. I can understand the mechanical blunder, but the communications were terrible. Would we use it again...maybe, because we also stayed at the Sancturario Hotel up top in Machu Piccu, and the transition busses and baggage handling were seamless.

Toilet back up. The train ride was pleasent. I wished the train travelled a little faster. The toilet on our car was almost over flowing and the staff couldn't fix it but it made for great laughs watching people go into the bathroom and exit in a hurry with aa horrified look on their faces

An unforgettable train ride!. Everything about this train ride experience was superb! We took the Hiram binghman train round trip last week from the poroy station outside cusco to Manchu picchu and back. It was a five star experience: the service was exceptional the meals were outstanding and elegant. Everything was taken care of by their very professional staff. The only thing we had to do was show up with good cameras to try to capture the most extraordinary day of our lives. The route of the train took us through the sacred valley the urubambamba river and ultimately to the lost peak Machu Picchu! I highly recommend it.

Slendid way to get to Machu Picchu. The Hiram Bingham train is a delight to experience and makes the whole Machu Picchu experience that much more enjoyable and digestible. However my partner and I took the train both there and back on the same day, and so my recommendation would be to take it there only. The trip out is during the day with plenty to see as the scenery changes from urban to rural to mountainous. Also the back of the train has a cute balcony where you can take in the sights outdoors. Coming back they hook up the locomotive to the BACK of the train and so the balcony is out of use. Also the night trip affords very little by way of scenery due to the extreme darkness. The train moves really slowly, and other than the food and band, there's not that much to do on board. The food was decent but by no means the same standard as some of the wonderful restaurants we ate at in Peru. The guide was excellent. She was extremely patient and professional and knew so much about the Incas and the legends of Machu Picchu. It was without doubt the highlight of our trip.

wonderful ride!!!. food and mariachis as good as the incredible views. And knew every Mexican bolero that i knew-- and i lived in Mexico 4 months and have visited scores of times -- before the drug wars days. excellent service. wonderful experience

Awesome train!. The food was amazing on the train. It is a truly excellent experience. They also had live entertainment. It was something to remember. If you need a train, this should be your first choice. I can see why it is part of the Orient Express group. The view from the train was also spectacular. They also can cater to any dietary needs you have. Hiram Bingham is AWESOME!

Worth your time. Incredible experience! Beautiful train, full service with 2 meals and an afternoon tea. Made every passenger feel important. 2 dining cars and 2 bar cars. The whole staff was very accommodating. There were no lines at machu picchu. The guide wasn't that great but you could roam around alone if you wanted to.

This Very Expensive Train Was Very Disappointing.. After being told by our travel agent in Florida that we were booked on the Hiram Bingham Train (ran by the Orient Express), we were excited and our expectation was high. We got to the Poroy train station right around 7 AM on November 24, 2012 and we were not allowed on the train until past 8 AM. There was plenty of fanfare- music and dancing done by the locals in colorful costumes. We were assigned to table 18 on the car below the kitchen. We met a young lady next table who was traveling alone from Jakarta, Indonesia. She was an a software engineer and a writer (she said she had written two books lately). We got along well with her since my husband was, also, a computer engineer.She was sitting with a gentleman from Berlin, Germany who was going to Miami, Florida in 2 weeks. We were from Florida so we gave him some tips about Miami. We told the Indonesian lady that she was free to join us in Machu Picchu since we had a private guide assigned to us when we got there. We were told that brunch would be served around 11 AM. We picked a lot of passengers when the train stopped at the Ollantaytambo station. Twelve of those passengers sat by us in tables for 4 (total of 3 tables). They had a tour guide with them who talked very loudly in German and Spanish that it was difficult to carry on a conversation with my husband. We could not even hear the announcement on the train. Soon, they started serving drinks - juices, coffee, tea - then slices if bread with butter. Then, our entree came- some diced sweet potatoes and a rolled spinach filled with ground lamb. We both do not like lamb. When one of the waiters came around, we asked if we could possibly have something else like soup. He just waved his hand, walked away and said we could not have anything else. When we looked around, the Germans on the next 3 tables by us were having soup. We were not offered anything else to eat so we ate the diced sweet potatoes and pieces of bread with butter. That was our brunch! With the amount of money we paid, we felt that we should have been offered something else to eat. They were in a hurry and did not seem to care. We noticed that those in bigger groups were catered to. The waiters were always in a hurry. Some of them did not even make eye contact with us.Snacks and drinks were served at the Tampu restaurant outside Machu Picchu station on the way back. The food served there was better. We felt that we were treated well at Tampu Restaurant. When it was time to check in for the return trip, we were in line first. The Maitre D (Henry) checked my husband in and then me. I heard Henry said Table 12 (in Spanish) to the guide/waiter. I was expecting to be back in table 18 but since we were assigned to table 12, I kept quiet. We asked Jean Paul if he would allow us to sit with the Indonesian lady and he said that we could not sit with her. She would sit with a family of 3. We passed Table 12 and we kept on to the other car. After we were seated for a few minutes, he told us that we had to move to the next table. The lady he sat on our table (she was with a gentleman) said she was sorry that we had to move. My husband and I did not know the reason for us being moved. Shortly after that, we were told that we had to move again. That really got me irritated and asked why we were moving again. He said that he was trying to sit us near our Indonesian friend. Later, I looked for her and could not find her. She was seated with another lady towards the restaurant end. The appetizers were served and I did not feel like eating. However, the lady who served the appetizers was probably the friendliest among the staff members. She interacted with the passengers. She even offered second helping of the gazpacho. They served small slices of dark meat (duck) which my husband said did not taste good. We did not go to the bar or the observation car where the band was playing.Just before we got to Poroy Station where we got off, Henry came to our table to apologize and gave us a cap and a small brown journal. I took them just so he would not be embarrassed. My husband and I were both upset. We were very disappointed with the Hiram Bingham. Our tour guide in Machu Picchu said that we could have taken the Vistadome which was a lot cheaper and just as good.

Incredible experience. I've always wanted to travel on the Orient Express, and this was fantastic! Train was beautiful - dark wood, white linens, dining car, two bar cars and a fantastic scenic caboose (open air). This is traveling in luxury - food and drinks were very good, service was excellent, and the band they had playing in the bar/caboose area on the trip and back made for a very fun and lively time (especially on the ride back at night). The train moves slowly (a must for safety), but it gives you plenty of time to enjoy the incredible scenery from the comfort of the train. We loved the open air caboose - lots of great pictures of the valleys, little towns, mountains. Definitely worth the investment as this is a once in a lifetime trip!
peruvacationtours.com. The small track train looks like something from an earlier generation. The seats are comfortable. The service good. The views amazing. Sheer clifts, beutiful flowers & plants.
A special experience.. Outstanding experience. The food was excellent . Service perfect. The music and great sense of fun made for a wonderful experience

Wow. This is probably the one all across 5 star review I've given anything. Ever. The train really lived up to my expectations--and more so. The food was the best I've had while travelling in South America and I basically felt pampered and attended to the entire time. I had a great lively group and on the way back we all ended up dancing in the bar car. The amenities were all amazing. I really have nothing negative to say about the entire experience, not even a minor complain. I'm sure other reviewers have detailed the minute by minute account so I will spare repeating everything. Yes, it's expensive but worth it if you can splurge. I know I will remember it for the rest of my life. I realize that sounds dramatic, but it's true.
Amazing. It was an amazing experience!! We enjoyed every minute in the train! Froom de "5 o'clock tea" to the music in the bar car, and the excelent dinner. A perfect closure to a perfect day!

I wish all train journeys were this good. We travelled to Aguas Calientes on the Orient Express. There were only 10 of us on the train and the food, drink and overall experience surpassed expectations. The open air viewing platform at the back was a great spot to watch the amazing scenery. Our transfer to machu picchu was very comfortable and as the other 8 guests were all part of other tours, we were lucky enough to have the guide to ourselves for a 3 hour tour. I just wish we'd been able to do the return journey on the same train but unfortunately it was fully booked.

A trip to die for!. The atmosphere on the Hiram Bingham was brilliant - the hosts certainly know how to party!Throughout the journey to and from Machu Picchu our hosts were very attentive and met all of our needs - the service was impeccable and the food was first class. The on-board entertainment made the journey fly by with their mixture of traditional Spanish songs with a few English songs thrown in for good measure and delivered with much Gusto! especially on the return trip when our tiredness was setting in.The guide that took us around Machu Piccu was very knowledgeable and informative, making the rain a mere inconvenience.All in all a fantastic day and well worth the money.

Service Par Excellence. The Hiram Binham train, part of the Orient Express collection, provides not just transportation from Cusco to Macchu Picchu but an extraordinary experience from the moment of boarding this beautiful vintage train. One is transported back in time . The cabins are beautifully appointed and service very attentive. The scenery en route is breathtaking and the culinary experience rates high. I would highly recommend indulging as the train is costly but the memory everlasting,.

Really fun.. The train runs to the base jump off for the Machu Picchu ruins. The train trip itself is an adventure, and a step back in time. Doesn't take long, and is really fun. Run by Orient Express.

Majestic Macchu Picchu. Was very blessed to be in Peru this past week and quite frankly, it was one of the most special places I've visited. The Hiram Bingham train from Cusco to Macchu Picchu isn't just 'lux" as you would expect of any Orient Express train experience, it was truly special. Food and beverages are incredible, they will tailor the selections to any dietary or prefernce need. From the greeting of champagne with Inka dressed greeters to spacious cabins with massive windows, to live music and incredible service. I highly recommend that you take this path and explore one of the world's wonders as it is a very beautiful and relaxing way to go!

Vintage excellence!. The vintage train is a wonderful experience and a nice way to travel to and from Machu Picchu.The costs are high; however, the scenery was awe inspiring and included elegance and service levels rarely found today.Dining cars were beautiful and the bar car was excellent, with many top shelf brands to choose, entertainment and style.Spend the extra to do it right!

"Excellent to a point". The point in question was 8.30 pm on our return journey back to Cusco after a supurb day on the train and at Machu Picchu. The quality of the train, food, service, guide and afternoon tea at the Sanctuary Lodge Hotel were all first class, as one would expect from the Orient Express company.However, where they failed to come up to expectations was after dinner on the homeward trip when just over an hour away from Cuzco the train stopped and we were advised of a landslide ahead, with an estimated delay of an hour, or possibly less! Two hours later and without any further interim communications regarding progress we were told that for safety reasons, even though the track had been cleared, we were now going back to the station we had left approximately three hours earlier. Transport was to be organised from there to get us back to Cuzco by road.On arrival back at Ollantaytambo at around midnight and after being led to the carpark across the tracks by torchlight, as the train didn't actually stop at a platform, we were informed that it was our responsibility to arrange onward transport home. Following some tense moments and associated strong words from one of our fellow lady Australian travellers, taxis were eventually found. Five of us crammed into the car designed for four and one and a half uncomfortable hours later we arrived back at our Cuzco hotel at 1.45pm.Whilst one accepts problems such as the landslip can arise, not however an unusual occurrence in Peru, the lack of contigency planning by Orient Express and their very poor level of communications were more akin to British Rail on a bad day. Not the sort of experience you expect having paid around £1500 for a day out! As with many things you only find out how good a company really is when something goes wrong. Orient Express failed the test on this occasion and definately needs to improve.If you want an extremely good rail journey try Peru Rail's Andean Explorer to Lake Titicaca. Excellent value for money and with entertainment far better than the Hiram Bingham. Everything else is pretty good too, especially the food and service.
great train ride. great train very modern with glass windows in the roof so you can see the mountains as you travel along plus you get staff on the train bring tea and snacks
Nice clean train. The Hiram Bingham train is the way to go. The glass on the top of the roof allows you to see the tall mountains.

Riding in Elegance. Our trip to Machu Pichu on the Hiram Bingham train was the highlight of my trip to Peru. The dining car was so comfortable and the service could not have been better. All the serve staff were friendly and prompt with refills on our drinks. We thoroughly enjoyed the entertainment and the atmosphere in the observatory car.Our guide, Breytzi Astocaza, was so well-informed on Machu Pichu. She gave us a great tour of Machu Pichu, and we know so much more about the ruins now than before we went. She also let us go at our own pace. We never felt rushed.The personnel on the Hiram Bingham were so attentive to our needs. Breytzi made sure we didn't miss the entertainment in the observatory car on our way back to Cusco, and it was well worth it.The four-hour train ride went by so fast because we were enthralled by the elegance of the train and the friendliness and efficiency of its personnel.

The only way to travel back to Cusco. I didn't do much research before boarding this train as it was arranged as part of our Peru tour by our travel company, so I was blown away by the very stylish experience of the trip back to Cusco. The service felt truely first class, with silver service dishing up a 3-course meal and free wine/ champange and soft drinks. There were 2 bar carriages to the front, one with live Peruvian music, and other with a more quiet vibe. The seats are configured as a table of 4, next to a table of 2, seats are automatically booked to face each other - we were able to be moved to a table of 2 so we could enjoy a romantic dinner alone, the staff were very acommodating.The only shame was that we only got a small amount of sunlight before it got dark as we could have enjoyed the views!

A First Class experience. They do it right from start to finish. There is a separate reception area with live music and Champaign before boarding. The dining car is very comfortable and the table is wide by American standards so you are not bumping knees with the passenger across from you. The meal was good and the service was spot on. On the ride back to Poroy it was dark so I took the opportunity to enjoy a Cus Queña or three in the bar car. There was live music and the bar staff was fun. What a great way to travel to Machu Picchu. I recommend highly.

Trip to Machu Picchu. The train was fantastic. We really enjoyed it. There was a live music playing (three musicians) and all staff was taking care of us. Nothing left. I really recommend it to take this specific train to Machu Picchu.
Fine. Early get up but well worth it. Meals included. Return trip involved lots of entertainment + attempts to get us to buy alpaca products- a pleasant no thanks sufficed

Disappointing. No local people ride on this train. It is artificial and offers little sense of the culture, the people, the history. It is one of the most expensive train rides in the world, which explains the real priorities of the company.

Unforgetable. Before our embark, me and my wife were in different seats. But this problem was solve and we had a lovely journey side by side. The scenery, food and beverages were excellent. The train was clean and confortable.The staff were kindely and works very well.I recomended this train tour.

Sweet way to travel. We book the train as part of a package with the Sanctuary Lodge, and, while expensive, it is certainly the first class way to go. The food was interesting, the scenery beautiful, and the band was fun. If you have the resources, I can really recommend the whole Sanctuary Lodge package.
Best train ride ever. I did the transsibirian and many other train trips, this is outstanding and the right way to visit Machu Picchu

Travel in Style. A fabulous way to start your trip to Machu Pichu in style. The service at the train is excellent. Good food, good ambiance, spectacular views. The only problem was that they misplaced one of our luggage on our trip back to Cusco. We got it back and problem solved.

Nice experience. Just brilliant , food and service was just amazing !!! a bit expensive but worth it. The show before and during the journey was really nice. The 4 hours of the journey was just perfect.

The Best Train in the World. Very expensive but you get the best for your money. Excellent food, exquisite service, espectacular views, very good guide, wonderful acomodation. The very best experience in Perú!
Why walk? The only way to go.. The train is comfortable and well appointed with good service and there is even entertainment to help pass the time. Very professional and trouble-free
One of many highlights of our trip. Simply this: In the morning we climbed Huaynapichu, in the evening we danced on the train.Spectacular.

Yes it's expensive, but it's worth it!. Don't have a single complaint, a first class experience all the way. The accommodations on the train were of the highest order, as was the food. The ride itself is breathtaking. It was nice that all the logistics (park entrance ticket, transport, etc.) were all all included in the outbound ticket price.

Sheer luxury. We did a return trip to Machu Picchu on this luxurious train, putting in an overnight stop at Sanctuary Lodge. It is the most luxurious and gracious way to travel in Peru. The train is extremely comfortable, the carriage facilities first class and the service provided by all staff is attentive but unintrusive. Your luggage is taken care of from the minute you arrive at the station until you arrive at your hotel destination, and food and drinks are feely provided. Food is excellent - imaginative cuisine and well presented. Wine list is comprehensive . The observation car provides good views from which to take panoramic photos of the most beautiful countryside. Our outward bound journey was the best. The return journey was unfortunately spoiled by a few drunken younger folk who seem incapable of resisting free alcoholic drinks and whose raucous behaviour singing and dancing in the lounge and observation car was not inkeeping with the gracious image and services provided by the train. Staff looked on with disdain but no-one intervened !!! We felt the onboard musicians were unnecessary and perhaps their playing of western popular music , which was not inkeeping with the ambience, also contributed to the bad behaviour of the few. TIP- on the return journey ask to be seated in the carriage furthest away from the bar. Its an expensive way to travel but we thought it was worthwhile - a journey you do only once in your lifetime.

Hiram Bingham. The train is absolutely beautiful, service is great, attention given to detail.For my children they had different choices and were prepared to make whatever they wanted to order. On the return trip the next day they could chose what they wanted for dinner and they accommodated your wishes.Excellent.
Great Experience. Polite staff. Free coffee, tea or soda. The chairs are so comfortable. Train was always on time. A very nice experience.

If You Can, Take the HB Train.. What an experience! Beautifully furnished cars, wonderful service, good food, great music, knowledgeable, friendly guide, and spectacular views. This was truly awesome.

We liked PeruRail. Within the Peru Travel Books and travel documents it always warns you regarding the unpredictable rail schedules. We had two train rides one from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and our return from Aguas Calientes to Poroy. Both were on time and pleasant experiences. The train was clean and the attendants friendly. We especially enjoyed the ride back to Cuzco with Carlos, Jocelyn and Herbert. The fashion show was an unexpected surprise. Thank you Perurail - Bonnie and Sarah
Wonderful way to say goodbye to Machu Picchu. We did the return trip from Machu Picchu to Cusco. Great service, food, live music - just sit back, breath deep and relax on your way back to Cusco.

The only way to travel Cusco-M.P.. What an experience! Since travelling from Cusco to Machu Picchu takes around 3h (trains ride at 25km/h), you should definitely consider doing it with comfort and style! Service is excellent from check-in to arrival and so are the food and drinks (all inclusive). They have very good live music (good taste) and the whole atmosphere is incredible! Another orient-Express' strike! I had the opportunity to ride back from Machu Picchu to Sacred Valley with the Vistadome, which is not bad, but can't be compared at all to the Hiram Bingham - the trip took 1h30 and it seemed like much more without all the entertainment I had on my way to MP. Definitely worth it!
Great way to travel. A great way to get to Machu Pichu. The Vista Dome train makes the journey through the mountains a spectacular journey.

Travelling in style. An expensive option, but well worth it - excellent views and photo-opps from the train's open-carriage at the back (not sure if all the trains have this?), exquisite food and service, champagne included!

Great atmosphere, views, service, & food. This service may be on the very expensive side but if your spoiling yourself it is certainly worth it. It is a luxury train service to Machu Picchu which you will not forget too easily. The food and drinks on the train are very good and I recommend taking the service.

Beautiful and historic train ride down the valley. This is a very high-end luxurious experience in the Andes Mountains. We were expecting a nice ride with good service, but we were not expecting the historic and comfortable coaches. The rear coach with the seating area, the bar, and the open observation platform is an unbeatable combination.And then, in addition to the spectacular scenery, the open-air observation platform, the music, and the service, we had an incredible lunch.This is one experience that you must have. It really makes the Machu Picchu experience complete, and I have never really experienced anything like it in the world.

Magical way to end a trip to mythic Machu Picchu. What a treat ! From the welcome in the private salon at the station to discovering your private table in the train, to the first drink in the observatory bar . Stunning 3 course meal dinner with never ending drinks serving and nice live music. Everything makes you feel special. The ride is well worth the price but suggest only one way for the return and take the Vistadome train from Cuzco to Aqua Calientes

Extraordinary. If one is able to travel to Machu Picchu on this wonderful train, please do so. One of my memorable experiences while in Peru was standing off of the beautiful observation car, listening to local musicians and feeling Peru gently rush by me...so close to the mountains and people I could almost touch them from the train....but in exquisite comfort.
The best!. The attention to detail paid to each traveler is superb. The food was great and the choice of wines more than adequate. Of course, the scenery is out of this world :-)

Traveling Luxury in the heart of Peru. I was amazed at the level of luxury involved with this train ride. First you have a special waiting room with sparkling wine, appetizers and music by local musicians.The dinner train comes with white tablecloths and attention to detail. The food was gourmet and quite good. They had a party going in one of the other cars which made the whole experience quite a lot of fun.

its too hot. The train was very traditional and the service very good - food nice. However I was too hot for 10 hours and had to spend time in the observation car and and bar! Shame really - even with windows it was still too warm. Which affected our experience somewhat. Someone said the bus trip was ok and took pretty much the same time if not less. SO worth checking out.

Luxurious. After 10 days trekking up and down rugged Andes, the luxurious Hiram Bingham Machu Picchu train was wonderful. Staff was courteous. Seats were comfy. Train has roof windows so you can watch the beautiful Peruvian countryside as you travel.

What an experience!. What an experience! Ten hours of travel in comfort with no backache! Wonderful food and excellent service. The views were unparrellelled and left a lasting memory. Totally recommended.

Train ride from Hell. The Hiram Bingham Train was the biggest disappointment of our trip and I will never recommend this to anyone. After reviewing the many 5 star reviews here I was hoping that it would be a nice way to end our trip to Machu Picchu. Instead it was the train ride from hell. We got stuck next to two families with small children who proceeded to run up and down the aisle for about an hour until dinner was served. Then the crying began over the meal time and as desert was served the high pitch screaming began which was the last straw. We abandon our seats as did many in the car retreating to the club car for the remainder of the ride. The staff did nothing! In discussions with others we meant in the club car this was not an isolated incident they had a similar experienced on the train ride to Machu Picchu the day before. There was no value for money I wish I would have booked one of the late afternoon trains and had a nice dinner at one of the fine restaurants in the Plaza De Armas which is what I will recommending.

5 Star Train Ride. OMG! What a great experience taking the Orient Express from Aguas Calientes back to Cusco (Poroy). If you are thinking of visiting Machu Picchu, I would HIGHLY recommend taking the train back after your visit. It is like a cherry on top of the pie!5 Star dining, smooth comfortable ride, you get to really enjoy the folks you are traveling with and before you know it you are back!

Great journey!. It is a bit expensive, but worth every penny. It is very convenient, you don't have to worry about anything. When you buy the tickets they provide everything regarding your trip to Machu Picchu, from food, drinks, rides, tour guides, entrance, all the details to make your journey easier, comfortable and convenient.

Great experience- definitely worth it-. What a luxurious train! Great service and alot of fun. Good food. They had three musicians who played all kinds of Latin music and really livened up the crowd. Really liked our tour guide. She knew her stuff. And, of course, the centerpiece of the whole experience- seeing Machu Picchu. It was incredible. No words can describe it.And then tea at the Sanctuary Lodge and a 4-course dinner on the way back to Cusco. Who could ask for anything more?

Inca Trail - NO NEED. I know many go to experience the 3-4 day hikes to Machu Picchu, and I must admit I was feeling I was missing something beforehand. I simply did not have the time for the Trail hike, so instead opted to take the train and spend one day at MP with a guide. I revisited early the next day for hike up Machu Pichu mountain and it was TOTALLY the correct call. Comfortable train ride in ensures you are fresh for your visit. After my hike, I went into Aguas Calientes for a well deserved massage and shower, then hopped the train for my return to Cusco. Brilliant

Ridiculously expensive but worth every cent.. This train is really great. The staff is beyond excellent. Food is wonderful. There is a bar car/lounge where live music is played. It's a great ride to take photos from the windows, move around, mingle, and truly enjoy the 3-hour trip (each way!) to Machu Picchu. Once there, you are taken care of from beginning to end. The tour guides are part of the Hiram Bingham train personnel, and you can speak to them on the train. Extremely knowledgeable and professional from beginning to end. The Hiram Bingham Train is not a must on your way to Machu Picchu, but it's one of those things you'll remember fondly in five years. It is that pleasant.
a bit pricey, but worth it. the food was great, the musical trio was excellent. was it worth the extra money? Probably - even though the return trip on Peru Rail was a lot of fun!

A Wonderful Experience!. I reserved a round trip experience in July, 2012 for September 2012. It was a once in a lifetime trip and the Hiram Bingham and staff were great!The trip is about 12 hours, there, up to the ruins and back. We really liked how everything was included: train, bus to the top, ttickets to the ruins, the tour guide, afternoon tea, the bus down and the train back. We recommend it!Ivan - Thanks for being attentive....and for the extra butter on the way back.Nilo - You had a lot to deal with sickness and physical limitations of the group. You rolled with the people and came out shining!

Great, great, great !. At about 430$ each that's not a cheap ride...But overall, and for the unique experience, i may say it worth it.From Cuzco to Aguas Calientes, this luxury train makes time flying and with the Orient Express Team taking care of you, you almost forget the 3 and a half hour ride.To start with, at the rail station we got welcomed with Champagne, mimosas and a local dance troupe.The wagons have spacious and comfortable seating, where you will be served very well prepared dishes for lunchaccompanied by red and white peruvian wines.We spent some time on the last wagon, where there's a loung area, a bar and an observatory deck to take photos of the breathtaking scenery.They have a small band of musicians and singers that will entertain you with some of the classics from your respective countries.As we are italians, they sang for us O sole mio, And boy, to tell you how good these folks are....It was sung as good as an italian band would have...
