Rougher ride than Peru Rail, skimpy meal. Unlike most of the other reviewers, we actually took the Vistadome from Peru Rail to go from Ollanta to Aguas Calientes, then took the First Class trip on Inca Rail for their 7 PM dinner trip down, so I was able to make a direct comparison. Not that this return journey was terrible, it was just that the Vistadome experience was superior. First of all, getting the Inca Rail tickets is more troublesome than the Peru Rail tickets. Unlike PR, which has offices in the Lima and Cusco airports as well as in Cusco town, the IR offices are only at the train stations, and their hours are quite limited. In addition, they weren't even staffed during the posted hours (employees leaving early), although we were able to get our tickets for the return journey 90 minutes before the train left. The PR trains are built better than the IR trains, in that these have significantly more side-to-side sway than the Vistadome train did. This was especially bothersome when trying to get to the rest room. The seats were quite comfortable in both trains, though. My biggest complaint with the IR First Class service was the skimpy dinner. The only protein was thin slivers of trout carpaccio. The main dish was a light vegetarian dish with mushrooms and potatoes. After hiking around MP, we were hungry, and, for the large premium we payed from the First Class tickets, I felt ripped off. I guess with a vegetarian dish, they don't have to worry about being kosher, halal, or almost any other religious dietary restriction, but I wasn't happy. The service was friendly enough on both train services. None of the trains to Aguas Calientes accepts luggage, so my advice would be to spend 2 nights in Ollanta, take a morning Vistadome up and an evening PR train down.
Excellent. Beverages were excellent. Need to improve the snacks provided such biscuits, choclates or the sandwich. Those were not upto the mark tastewise.

Very good. It's the only way to get do Machu Picchu.In executive class the service was outstanding.The landscape is breathtaking.I think that Inca Rail and Peru Rail should take care of connections from Cusco to Poroi and Ollamtaytambo.I don't understand why there's not a direct train from Cusco to Machu Picchu.
Fun. It was fun and the staff very helpful and knowledgeable of area!The food was light but very nice and the ride beautiful!

Great Experience. I had such a great experience with Inca Rail. I didn't have any trouble checking in and all of the trains were prompt. The staff was great and I wasn't expecting beverages or snacks but they were a welcome surprise!

Excellent train and amazing views, though it skimps on food. Our experience travelling with Incarail was very good. We travelled one way by executive class and another by premium economy. While the premium economy wagon was a bit too industrial looking for us, we loved the executive class wagon which added to our experience of travelling to Machu Picchu. About the food service: The Andean cocktail, Tropical cocktail, Lemon grass ice tea and coffee were excellent. In addition, a small packet of bread sticks (in executive class) was ok, but I wish we were served something more substantial instead- like a sandwich. Overall a good experience. But it can be improved by a notch with better food.

Very good experience. It is a shame the train lines are all owed by the same company making the price for this trip of less then 2h almost 80 us dollars! The price us the same on all of them so can't really give a bad review because of that. It was clean and you got a free drink. But Peru rail has panorama windows and inca rail don't which is a shame.

Comfortable experience. Comfortable experience, with a free snack and good service to and from Macchu Pichu. Convenient schedules, and lower prices than other rail lines at the time (Aug 2016).Advise to book early as later bookings are not guaranteed to be seated together based on availability

I would use and recommend Inca Rail. I was VERY pleased with the service at Inca Rail but what i LOVED was the Inca tea that was available round trip and the cracker/cookie sticks which sadly, we only got on the was to Machu Picchu but not on the way back. Everybody wants to face forward instead of having 4 seat clusters sharing a center table. However, I guess that would be impossible because the train goes in one direction and then reverses directions.

Inca Rail To Aguas Calientes. Overall very nice ride. Very clean with comfortable seats. Beverage and snack was a plus. It could have been better if:- You were allowed to pick seats or were given a seating chart when purchasing tickets. We thought we purchased tickets together but because of the numbering were in different rows.- A more clear policy on baggage. The online details said you couldn't take a suitcase. We say many people with full suitcases on the train.
Impression. It was an immersion into Inca Atmosphere. I would do it again. I recommend Inca trail for the ones who want to go to Machu Picchu and experience a good traveling.
Good service. Good enough. Considering the high price we pay for the service, it is good. The snack are not that good, but not bad.

Poor service given abusive price. Hi, just after paying our tickets from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes at the Inca rail office counter in Cusco city, the staff printed our tickets and only informed us then with the luggage conditions. They highlighted on our printed tickets that we are not allowed to carry our luggage (2 backpacks and 1 small suitcase allowed as hand luggage in airport) with us. We were in shock as we are coming from Europe for a holiday and paid the most expensive train ticket ever in our lives. The staff took our email saying that they will try to find a solution but never got back to us. Terrible communication and service.

More comfortable than expected. Having traveled to Machu Picchu a little over ten years ago on a very uncomfortable and slow train, I was ready to have a not so great experience. The opposite was true, actually. The seats were very comfy (so comfy that our entire group fell asleep on the way back), the snacks were tasty (sweet crackers on the way up, trail mix on the way down), and the beverages varied and delicious (almond tea, herbal infused soft drinks, juices, etc.). Ticket purchases (online) and pick-ups (in person on the day of the trip) were quite simple. The only complication is the issue of seating. We were a group of four and, on the way there, we were split up (two in one row, two in the other) instead of grouped together, which seemed odd. On the way back, three of us were grouped together and one person was dropped into the middle of another group. We simply requested to trade seats with another guests and fixed the issue ourselves, but it seems like it would be an easy fix for the company itself to take care of. One would assume that groups would like to be seated together--especially on a special trip like this one. Otherwise, I was very happy with the train ride up. Note that the way up/down is winding and bumpy, but that has more to do with the terrain than the train.

Nice Experience. Traveling by train is always a pleasure, a relaxing experience.. a time to enjoy the ride, the scenery, nice views, rivers, mountains, and local people waiving good bye... Inca Rail is no exception, is a very nice way to get to one of the Wonders of the World, Machu Pichu... the adventure starts here.

My experience on first class with Inca Rail train was amazing!. I rided the train from Ollylantambo to Machu Picchu. They staff were very nice and helpful. They tried to explain the information of the place along the way. They spoke a good English. Food and beverage were excellent. Worth the price!
Inca Rail Feedback. The trip was great. Great landscape! The train was clean with comfortable seats and good food and beverage.

Comfortable ride, friendly staff. Inca Rail doesn't seem to fill up as fast as Peru Rail. Perhaps Peru Rail is fancier. I'm not sure if that's true, but it's the impression I got online. However IncaRail is more than sufficient and a lovely experience. My only feedback would be i didn't realize seats were actuallu assigned. It would have been nice to know that and been given some choices. Also, how do you not have hot water to serve? That was disappointing as well. These two issues were truly it. All else was great. Thank you!

Better price to take you from A to B. This train is cheaper than the competitor and takes you from A to B. The experience could have been better if we were seated with the view to the river but we can't choose seats and not everybody can have that view so not much can be done about that.
Good option. I have taken different trains in my two visits to MP, and all are nearly the same. For me, this is the most adecuate if you travel with kids because there are a cheaper tariff for them.
Amazing trip to Machu Picchu. Great on-time service on both trips to and from Aguascalientes. Friendly staff and very comfortable seating in the Executive class train. Definitely recommended!

Great service. Excellent equipment, staff, and service. Boarding signage and process could be improved at Aguas Calientes: the station does not make it clear which gates service PeruRail and which service InkaRail, leading to endless questioning of the agents manning the gates...

Inca Rail gives a unique experience when visiting Machu Picchu. Wanting to pamper myself a little, I booked the Executive Class and was particularly looking forward to this part of my trip to get to Machu Picchu. I boarded at Ollanta and reaching my assigned seat found that each of the four seats in this section were full. I pointed to my number on the wall and a woman across from me said "they are a couple and want to sit next to one another (referring to the two sitting closest to me with their backs to me). I replied that this is where I was assigned and if they are going to sit there then I have no seat (not seeing any seats that were open). I left to get the conductor to ask what I should do.When I came back with him the 4th person had disappeared and "my' seat was now open (on the aisle). The young girl had moved to the other window, next to what I assume was her mother. The young man sitting next to the other window has this giant dreadlock man bun and all three looked at me as if to say "what you do mean your seat has been taken"? So I sat down. The area under the common table had been all taken up with their belongings and no room was left for my camera bag (which is pretty large) and I scrunched it onto my lap. I was in the last table/section of the train and now facing backwards from the direction of travel. The only thing I could see if I looked straight ahead was the back of the train/bathroom and to my left the man bun mountain that eclipsed the window for the most part. The train got underway and I could catch glimpses of scenery going past but man bun was moving his head to block my view whenever he could with a twisted little smirk. So much for my being able to take any photos of this part of my journey or video (I specifically brought a separate video camera just for this part of the trip).The train rocked back and forth (side to side) much more than I expected. This was not exactly an issue for me but I point it out in case it may affect others with motion sickness. The staff was friendly and professional, and the food offered was very good, albeit similar to what is served on a plane; simple snacks and drinks but they were good.On my return trip I boarded the train to find a young girl in my seat, next to her obnoxious and arrogant little boyfriend. Really? They asked if they could sit together. I just grumbled and took the seat next to the window. It was dark and I wouldn't see much anyway. Then the train started; I would be riding backwards for the next 90 minutes again....................
Reliable Transport. Inca Rail was reliable and very nice - great service and drinks and snacks included. Also the least expensive option.
Great way to travel in Peru. Caught train from Ollytantambo to Machu Picchu and it was a great way to do the journey. Quite relaxing but a great way to see the scenery of the beautiful country.

It was.. The overall experience was ok. The ride itself was very bad. The ride wasn't smooth. It's moved side to side a lot.

inca rail. average service. the train was in time but not Very conformtable. we tried to sleep but was not very good. staff good

Inca Rail. The staff was friendly and helpful. The trains are clean and comfortables. An overall good experience.

Nice trip. Everything was very good except the fact that we didn't has seats next to eachother and we had to sit in different parts.
Not bad except for ticket purchase.. Purchasing tickets outside Peru from Internet should be a lot easier. I had to contact my cousin in Peru to purchase them for me.

A TRUE Mystic Experience. The train ride to Macchu Picchu was awesome! The breath taking views of the Peruvian countryside and the helpful staff were awesome. The only reason I am only giving 4 out of 5 is because of their office in Cuzco being closed due to a holiday. We knew the office would be closed the day OF of Peruvian independence (28th July) so we purposely scheduled to pick up our tickets the day after. However, the office was closed on the 29th as well forcing us to wake up very early to drive to their Ollantaytambo office. We were unable to leave from our original destination out of Cuzco as well as our original time. I wish that there was some sort of disclaimer to warn foreigners of their holiday office closures. I suggest that you do your research and make sure that the office will be open to pick up your tickets before you purchase your tickets. Other than that, the train ride and ticket pick up in Ollantaytambo was smooth!!

Train to machu picchu. The train to and from machu picchu was very good and very punctual, I would recommend this service to anyone

Very Good. My trip with Inca Rail was very good, and a Magic experience. I will recommend to other friends and in the future will come back to make another.

Inca Rail delivers, comfortably and on time. If possible, seat couples traveling together next to one another. Several couples in our car were one removed from their traveling companion because single or triple travelers were placed in the midst.

Very good service. When visiting Peru it goes without saying that you should visit Machu Picchu! From the train station in Cusco (Poroy) the train journey is a very pleasant and comfortable way to do this. Great scenery along the way and very good service on the train with drinks and food!

Challenges that make us better. I really enjoyed riding the Inca Rail. Inca Raill travel. The experiece of traveling with you was pretty good and we hope to travel with Inca Raill soon it was a amazing oportunity

Ease and convenience. The Inca Rail part of our trip was flawless. Thank you for your good service. Excellent!. The train was very nice and confortable. The boarding is very organized and trains left on time. I really recommend this company!
comfortable trains, beautiful setting, great service and snacks. Comfortable trains, beautiful setting, great service and snacks/beverages. Coffee was lovely! Will book through Inca Rail again!

Expensive and pretty.. For $250 AUD or $179 USD, it was like riding in a train for the 1960''s. Food and drinks were very average and for that amount of money for one adult and one child needs to be improved. It's really taking advantage of the tourist as its the only way to get to Macchu Picchu

Very good Trip. It was a pleasure to travel with Inca Rail. train is very confortable and personnel well trained, only bad experience was in Aguas Calientes Station, people didn't know how to trate all people that was waiting for the train.

Expected better from this service. The train is very slow and moves all the time. I dont like that the seats are in front of each other. We had seats 24 25 and we were not sitting next to each other. A faster and electric wagons would be really a big change for this whole machu picchu experience
a new experience. It was a great experience to travel by train because it is the first time doing it, it was like the trip, people very friendly.

Not good not bad. Premium economy train has very uncomfortable seat you should get premium business. None of the seats lean back so if you get the cheapest train to travel from Machu Picchu to Poroy you'll suffer..

Review. Excellent, The scenery was amazing and our trip to Machu Picchu was as well. The food on the trip was very good although something else other than the trout with sour cream might have been better

Machu Picchu trip during winter. Inca Rail has great customer service. One of my flights that I was planning to take from Cuzco back to Lima got canceled, and I needed to book an earlier one within the next day. Unfortunately, that meant that I would also have to rebook my Inca Rail train from Machu Picchu to Poroy earlier as well. Fearing that there would be no seats left, the attendant at the station in Machu Picchu was very understanding and gave me different options that I had. She not only informed me well but also showed me how to get a full refund for my other ticket (it was as easy as sending an email with my ticket number). Great customer service, would recommend to anyone!

To Machu Picchu. The Inca Rail felt over the top a bit. I mean it kinda functions like a plane, why? Strict entrance into the train, assigned seating, and a food cart wheeled up and down the aisle. But I assume they are trying to make it into a memorable experience so I won't complain. It was only an 1h 30 min trip.
inca experience. A good service in a middle of beautiful landscape. The only claim is the price... The music should be a little bit different.
Very expensive. It is a shame that it is the only way to get to the Machu Picchu and that the prices are so high. However the service was really good.

Good Value. My husband and I used Inca Rail to get from Ollantaytambo to Aguascalientes and back. The train was very comfortable and had lovely views. We were offered a drink and snacks each way, which was also very nice. We were not able to pick seats when we booked and were quite surprised when we picked up our tickets at the window and found out we were in completely different cars. That was disappointing. I enjoyed my ride and meeting other travelers around me, but was disappointed that I couldn't share the lovely train ride with my husband on our honeymoon.

Amazing. The trip was very good, the train and staff was very good. The service and food was good too. Punctuality good.

VERY GOOD. We were four members of a family with two young children, and the warmth reception from the staff make a good entertainment between the others visitors and we had a wonderful travel, and make a friend during the trip.

Great family trip. Inca Rail really provide a great service, everybody was very helpful. Employees always answer with kindness to any question or request. Strongly recommended.

Nice Trip to Aguas Calientes. Good experience on the trip to Aguas Calientes. Train was comfortable, clean and Drinks were o.k.

Good. Always book your tickets! They had train tickets to Machu Picchu but didn`t have return tickets, so we had to stay one night in Machu Picchu city. But it was fine, as it`s a nice city with a lot of hostels, restaurants and souvenir shops. The lady at ticket office was very polite and professional. Trains are clean and comfortable. On my way to Machu Picchu I forgot my jacket in the train, but the staff member found me in the crowd and returned it to me :) that was very nice. So I recommend this train company.

First time user.. We traveled in the executive class on the way to Macchu Picchu. We had a good experience, the train was comfortable and clean but nothing out of the extraordinary. Views are limited from this train. The staff was really friendly. It was on time and boarding process was really smooth. There isn't much difference between the premium and the executive train so think about that when booking. The price difference is due to times. The more convenient departure times, are usually more expensive. On the way back we traveled first class. The food was ok. I was expecting something much better for first class and for $198 a piece for one way ticket. The kids menu wasn't offered as promised, and the main course was only vegetarian. No protein choice at all. The drinks were not that big of a deal and it was very difficult to enjoy the meal since the train ride was REALLY shaking.

Inca Rail to Machu Picchu. We found the Inca Rail ticket office in Ollyantatombo and purchased our tickets and had a great train ride experience to Machu Picchu and back. Would highly recommend this train ride to everyone. Was a very pleasant experience.
lovely experience. Very good experience. Nice train and onboard service. Just observe to purchase your tickets in advance.
Inca Rail. Very good. Only complaint was that in first class we were not served the entire menu that I was provided prior to travel (the bread basket wasn't given). But other than that it was great.

Machu Picchu train trip. At USD 120 per person round trip, The Inca Rail train ride to Machu Picchu was extremely uncomfortable as train is old and not very well maintained. Service on board the train is non-existence other than a very limited offer of hot beverages and 'healthy' bread-sticks or nuts which were stale. The entire machu picchu experience is a big let down, as it has become nothing more than a tourist trap.
Good experience. Inca Rail serviço was great. We only found some linda of problem when buying the tickets on-line, but the little stress was worth it.
Great service. Had a fantastic time on Inca Rail. Very comfortable and friendly staff. I would recommend this company to anyone
Good trip. The train goes trought a beatiful nature sights. The best way to travel to Aguas Calientes to go to Machu Picchu.

Amazing trip!. It was my second time going to Aguas Calientes with Inca Rail. We were waiting to board the 11:15am train when an employee asked us for our tickets, he checked our names and told us to follow him because we would have been changed of wagon …. we were confuse …. two minutes later we were advised that we got upgraded to first class!!! It was a great surprise, my girlfriend could not believe it. We had lunch on the train: Pisco sour as welcome drink, then a three course gourmet lunch!!! This lunch was much better than the one we had on the airplane (flying in business) back to Lima few days later! Thank you Inca Rail and a special thanks to its employees for making our trip to Aguas Calientes unforgettable!

Oggscreek June 2016. Experience was one of the best while in Peru. Everything was well done from ticket to disembarking. The ECO friendly was what determined the train I picked, and I would recommend to anyone.Thanks for your concern for our future.

Very good. The train ride was comfortable with breathtaking scenery. The snacks and drinks provided were high quality. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They could at least provide a full meal or offer a discount to Machu Picchu entrance ticket.
Inca rail. Excellent service and unforgettable experience !!! Staff is exceptionally professional and kind!!! absolutely worth the price!
I had a good travel with IncaRail. I had a good travel with IncaRail. Although the seat are not that comfortable, I would recommend to anyone.
Snacks. I think the snacks could be higher , and that would be cool to put alcoholic beverages on the menu . The rest is great.
Excellent experience. We left on time and the service was great. The quality of the food and the drinks was excellent but I was very impressed by the service offered by the staff. Congratulations.
Machu Picchu. I had read on how to get to Machu Picchu from the Internet and one that appealed to me most was via train... I booked one that was the least expensive and still got there safely.
Pricy but nice.... A bit pricy for what it is....but overall good experience. Clean and comfortable cars and helpful staff.

Amazing experience. We got lucky and were upgraded to first class, that was AMAZING! The train itself is gorgeous and very spacious. The staff was incredibly kind and the views were astonishing. Very good experience!
Incredible visit. I absolutely loved the whole experience. Thank you! I will definitely tell everyone I know to take this trip

A spectacular ride to the ruins. Traveling on the IncaRail Executive Class was a spectacular way to travel to Agua Calientes. The ride was extremely comfortable and clean. We enjoyed the complimentary beverages and snacks provided by the friendly staff. The cost was also extremely reasonable.

Much better than Peru Rail. I used to use Peru Rail in the past to get to Machu Picchu and the trains were ok and service was average. This trip I used Inca Rail and was very impressed at much newer and more comfortable the trains are, as well as the level of service. Unlike Peru Rail, they offer you a breakfast and drinks. Staff are also very friendly. Will definitely use them as an alternative to Peru Rail next time I return.
Great experience it was like a step back in time. Beautiful trains and fantastic service. It was like stepping back in time with the appearance of the trains and the level of service!! Outstanding!!

Inca Rail. The train was way more comfortable than I had expected and the views were stunning! We lucked out both directions (to and from Aquas Calientes) and got to sit on the left side of the train up and the right side back.

One day trip from Cusco to Machu Pichu- Poroy- Aguas Calientes. The train and service is good for the money you pay. I found out that a day trip to Machu Pico is too short if you are planning to hike one of the mountains surrounding Machu Pichu and also visiting the Citadel. Taking the train in Poroy is much easier than in Aguas Calientes. Poroy is about 25 min from the center of Cusco and you need yo get there by taxi. To take the 4:16 PM train from Aguas Calientes back to Poroy , I recommend being at the bus stop in Machu Pichu about 1 hour and 15 minutes before the train departure, as long lines are formed at that time from people also trying to catch the same train. Next time I will stay one night in Aguas Calientes ton avoid the rush.

Good alternative to Peru Rail but not as comfortable. There are more IncaRail trains from Ollay and it was FAR easier to ticket online, as well as to change our reservation. The Executive class was a bit cheaper than the PeruRail Vistadome. However, the cars were older and you had no choice of seats, so many families were seated separately. You could not request a forward facing seat if you get motion sickness, and in our car the A/C constantly dripped on one poor pax despite staff's continuously stuffing it with towels. The snack was a small package of dried fruit and nuts and several non alcoholic drinks were offered, but you were only given one (prior reviewers have said one hot and one cold). The windows were MUCH smaller than Vistadome so view would have been greatly inferior, though after dark this makes no difference. During the day it would have been much more important. Glad we did Vistadome for the morning trip to AC. This was fine for return and it runs later.

Honey Moon vacations. Wonderful train and service to the people with great prices!!!!the personnel of the train was kind and gently. It was our first trip to Machu Picchu with the best option that Lima Tours give us!

Trip to Aguas Calientes in Style. First Class private table was beautifully decorated with authentic decor. Drinks included Pisco sour, and a choice of wines, and juices (pineapple one was definitely a fabulous option). A three-course meal included regional vegetables in a tasty sauce, trucha (local trout) and potato dish, and a fruit dessert. Service was professional, friendly and courteous. Fabulous views of local villages, the river and sections of the Inca trail. Questions were answered professionally and information about the surroundings, were provided thoroughly and informatively by the staff on board. Overall a highly-recommended experience of traveling with Inca rail in style.

Review procedure VERY carefully!. The trip itself was just fine. We had what we thought were the actual tickets and showed up to the station according to the time frame suggested and found that we still had to go to the ticket counter to get the actual physical tickets. They were loading 30 minutes prior. Be aware that you need reserve and purchase tickets (online or on site) to take a bus from Aguascalientes up to the Machu Picchu Ruins (~20 minute ride). We got to Aguascalientes about 9:00 a.m., walked through the market place, across the river to the waiting area for the bus and waited in line for approximately 20 minutes. Not a bad wait, but it was obvious that the bus ride portion of the trip was a surprise to some travelers.

Inca Rail To Machu Picchu Was Excellent. Inca Rail is not only a very economical way to travel to Machu Picchu, it also is fun and wonderful way to travel. The staff are all incredibly friendly. Reserving tickets online was easy. We later made a change at a local office with no problems at all. The service in the delux car - in both directions -was fantastic. We traveled very early in the morning, leaving from Cusco by bus to Ollantaytambo to connect with our train. Both Peru Rail and Inca Rail depart from that station, and all the trains are very timely. With Inca Rail, we had a great view in a comfortable car. There was a wonderful food and beverage service that allowed us to get some more hot mate de coca, which is supposed to help with the altitude. Overall, I highly recommend Inca Rail.
necessary. The train is required to reach Machu. The typical cost to monopoly is unjustified. Good the service.

First time. I travelled to Peru with my sisters and took the train to go to Machu Picchu. It was a great experience, the staff was really helpful both in Cusco and at the sation. The greatest part of it all was the landscap during the trip.. it was breathtaking!
Inca Rail. Inca Rail was a convenient way to get to MP. Our return trip was delayed for over an hour. No information was provided as to why it was delayed. Overall experience was good.

Trip to Machu Picchu. Excellent service. Wonderful experience. Service and food were superb. Very romantic. wonderful way to start our trip

Inca Rail. We decided to go with Inca Rail as the price for a round trip from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu was better than the competitor and the train was more modern. The service on board was great. We recommend Inca Rail for your Machu Picchu trip!
Amazing experience. A relax travel, calm, warn (but the end is cold). It is a amazing way ti go to Machu Picchu. One day i eill come back.
Not bad. It was great. I was comfortable the whole ride from Ollantantaymbo to Aguas Calientes and back. It was an experiene

Only way to get to MP. Inca Rail was punctual and clean. Unfortunately you can't really see the views on the way there due to the mist on the windows. Service was great and the drinks offered had a good selection. However Inca Rail only departs from Ollyantambo rather than Poroy which is closer to Cusco. Also we weren't given well enough info as to how to get to Olly at 4am. We ended up spending and extra 160soles on a taxi to get to the station on time. And these tickets are WAY overpriced for what it's worth.

Great Service. Inca Rail was easy to book online. We exchanged our voucher for our tickets in Cuzco. They have nice and efficient office right on Palza de Armes.Make sure you ask for seats together as whilst they will allocate you seats in numerical order, our seats were not 4 facing each other but one person was in the next row. You only need to get there 15 mins before departure if you have your allocated seat tickets (not 30min as advised) as they don't let you on the train until 5 mins before.
Good train service. Especially pleased with the staff at the ticket office in Ollantaytambo. We had lost the credit card used to purchase the tickets, and they accepted a photo of the card instead.

I'd like to have the option to have some alcoholic beverages, even if it's not free. Some sandwich with local cold cuts would be nice. Also, some options to have wine. Some description of the towns we are traveled nag through.

Big Scam. The train to MachPicicchu is rip off. For this price you can fly actually from Cusco to Lima. And here we are talking about a ~40 km train ride. I could not even choose a seat and was told by the 'lovely' staff that its bit possible to sit together with my wife, while in the end 50% of the train was empty. Average. For the price you could expect more food or drinks and some more comfortable seats, we pay the executive class and didn't feel the difference from the economy one
Comfortable but expensive. I felt the train was very comfortable but the price for the journey was to me, expensive. The staff was nice.
Ollayantambo to machu Picchu. Loved the trains and the scenery! Staff was nice, drinks were yummy, and ourseats were very comfortable.
Good but expensive. This experience is vert good but it's vert expensive 50€ ticket (Justine go) is too much. Service on board is vert good.

Amazing experience. Me and my group loved every bit of our journey with Inca Rail. We would like Incarail to send us the inca rail background music soundtrack. It was so soothing and we would love to know more about it. Thanks for the amazing journey.

Good, if overprised. Inca Rail offers a great experience. The wagons were clean and comfortable, the service was really good, too. If only it wasn't so costly...
Train to Machu Picchu. The train ride was extremely comfortable and the views were spectacular. The only problem was we were sitting on the wrong side and wasn't able to enjoy the full view.

This happened on Saturday July 2nd, 8:30 M. We are very upset because we had to pay twice.
Great service. The got a great service and the train has a perfect punctuality the wagon was very clean and comfortable

Inca Rail - Opening your Way to Machu Picchu!. If you do not want to do the Inca Trail (as the four-days-hike might seem a bit too challenging for you), do the Inca Rail! ;-)Seriously - it is a great way of getting from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, the village located at the bottom of Machu Picchu mountain, where the famous Inca citadel can be found!The fittings are of high quality, food and beverages are good and the staff is absolutely friendly and concerned about the passengers' welfare on board. However, being normal for Western oriented economies, the price is relatively above average for Peruvian standards.
Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and back.. Nice scenic trip by the river and through the mountains. Terrain changes from farm land to semi-jungle.

To much money. It is a good experience but we backpackers that will hike in Macchupicchu know that walking from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes will get us tired for the big hike. First Class is Awsome!. Somehow my friend and I got upgraded on the way to MachuPicchu and I must admit that the experience was outstanding!
Staff were great. I like the staff . There were super nuce. The y gave me more chocolates than they did to other people.

Clean and efficient train service. The service is punctual. The trains are clean and the staff friendly. Big windows to see the view. Great coffee...would have loved a small cookie to go with it. My husband and I were seated several seats away from each other even though we had consecutive numbered seats. Weird numbering on the seats.
Excellent experience!!!!!!. Excellent experience provided by Inka Rail. Timely and professional services includes a snack and drink.

A beautiful trip!. The facilities of the wagons are very comfortable. People who met us were very friendly !
The trip is really lovely ! We liked a lot!!

Genarally Good. I haven't experienced something not nice. All was fine!

Pleasant experience with Inka Rail. We traveled by Inka Rail with 2 small children. Seats arrangement is perfect for families (or 4 friends). Kids were enjoying drinks and snack. Overall experience was very pleasant and left good memories together with visiting MP.

Perfecto y excelente! Highly recommend Inca Rail.. Booked a roundtrip ticket on Inca Rail from Ollanta to Aguas Calientes. I would very much recommend Inca Rail for its service and comfort. The booking was easy and the customer service was fantastic and quick FYI - I needed to change the return ticket and so I emailed the request and it was straightened out ASAP. The train staff were polite and attentive and the scenery just can't be beat.
Meh. It was okay, but Peru rail was better. The food was pretty terrible but the scenery was nice. It was cheaper than Peru rail too.

i loved it!. The food was good and healthy too, i really enjoyed the tables we sat at because we wete able to communicate with the other passengers

Good. We took train back from Aguascalientes calientes to Ollantaytambo service food beverage was excellent ,seats so confortable,we want to stay,very happy experience
NIce trip. I really enjoyed the infraestructure of the train, and the service of them, but I think they could improve a little bit more the snacks and beverage offered.

conmfort OK, price very high. All in all was the jorney to Machu POicchu okay. But the very high price for 2 adaults and 1 child from Porrey to Machu Picchu reduced my satisfaction. Of course I was a tourist and on vacation but price to performance is much too expensive.

Good service. We took the Peru rail for Ollan to Agua Caliente and INCA Rail on the way back. We were very happy with Inca Rail. It had storage both in overhead and in side bins. Beverage service was better than what was offered in Peru rail. Cons:1. The ticket pick up center is open for fewer hours than Peru rail. So it is not very flexible.2. It took 10 mins for the person to retrieve the tickets as their system was slow.

Great, worried about boaring time. Everything was excellent. Although the boarding time and the office opening seemed a little delayed and it worried us a bit. It was still on time, though. Very good experience.

Very inflexible. We were 5 min late for our train (due to our flight into Cuzco being delayed) and missed our train. I understand that was our fault and punctuality of the train is important. But the ticketing staff were very inflexible and we were forced to buy new tickets with Peru Rail (which as it turns out is much better).

Great service, but too pricy for what it offers. The staff was nice and helpful, the snacks and drinks delicious and nutritious, but the actual train and wagons are very average. You pay much less for a similar service in Europe, but because it's one of the only options to go to Machu Picchu, they can afford to be overpriced.

Inca Rail. Travelling from Ollyantaytambo to Machu Picchu and back the journey was relaxing and the view amazing the only downside to the journey was the price, I believe this to be over inflated and if a more reasonable pricing be adopted to the trains alot more people would use them.

A Fun Experience. Although actually purchasing the tickets was a bit of a pain (problems with getting the tickets we wanted and a foreign credit card that would be accepted), the actual journey was great. We took the Executive class train on the way up, and everyone was very friendly, helpful, and the amenities were great for the price. Since Executive class tickets were sold out, we ended up taking First Class on the way home and the service was truly incredible. Do your research first, but I would definitely recommend taking Inca Rail again.

Easy to book and travel!. Inca rail was easy to book online and rebooking / canceling/ changing the tickets can be done over the phone with an agent for no added fee and full refund. Would recommend this company-- beverages and snacks provided. Affordable tickets as well.
awesome travel. we just had the best time we loved the whole experience, INCA RAIL was the best Idea for us, we would do it again in a heartbeat.

Prompt and helpful. While the service in Agua Caliente was hampered by the sheer volume of both Inca and Peru Rail customers there the staff were helpful efficient and their English was quite good. If I'd do anything differently I'd go for the higher end tickets for more seat comfort. I'm not a tall guy but even I felt a bit cramped.
Poor food quality. Food was not up to Peruvian standard, why trout? How about Ceviche or Beef? Paid a lot and had no choice on food?

Convenient but Average. Waiters/waitresses are very hospitible and the drink selection is good, but not worth what we paid. The seats are small for European size people and our windows were a bit dirty.

enjoyed it!. It was a nice trip, no major hangups! The drinks and snacks were a nice touch -- I hadn't really paid attention to those being included when I was ordering my ticket. There was ample room for luggage, which was also nice since I understand that many people take this as a daytrip instead of staying at Aguas Calientes.

Poor service! Very offensive personnel!. I recommend other company because the service by the personnel of Inca Rail was terrible. Very offensive! You should improve the service to customers. I arrived on time and the lady in front was so distracted, I missed the train. She could ask them to wait for us, but she did not do it. She sent us to catch the train in another stop, but the train did not wait for us. It was a very frustrating experience. I went back to her, to look for other options. She never apologized and she literally shut us down and told us we lost our money. I spent $150.00 in those tickets, and she cannot help us a little. I decided to buy from other company, and the service was a lot better.

Great experience!. We rode Inca Rail to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) from Poroy and back to Poroy. Great service, unexpected snack and drink service. My two 11 yr old boys enjoyed the Andean soda and the fruit drinks offered. Trains appeared new and seats were comfortable. Would definitely ride them again.
A marvelous experience. I loved the journey, seats, service and dinner! This was served with requint. Every thing was perfect, indeed! I recommend travelling with Inca Rail!

Pleasant train journey. It was a very pleasant and comfortable trip with nice scenery along the way. The choice of drinks on offer was fine. However, the snack provided was fairly basic. Enjoyed the experience.

Not very comfortable.. The problem with this and Peru rail is that they insist on making almost every seat a table seat. This means you are sat opposite complete strangers and leg room is very reduced and awkward unless you fancy crossing legs with a complete stranger. Why they cant just make it like an airplane so that you can use the space under the seats in front of you, I have no idea. Most people travelling were in couples so putting people on tables of four is a bad idea. Furthermore you cannot pick you seat. You are simply allocated a seat and this meant I was on one table with three complete strangers and my wife was on another table with three complete strangers behind me. My number was something like 24 and she was 25 but they were not next to each other. They badly need to address the seating plan. There should be more seats that are not table seats and there should be an option to chose what seat you want. Such simple things made what should have been an unforgettable journey a bit of a nightmare. If you look at my other reviews you will see that I'm not the complaining type and I hardly ever rate anything below three stars but this was such a disappointment I think it is justified.
Very good and comfortable!. Very good experience, but I think Inka Rail should allow the passengers to choose their seats when buying the tickects ...

The better of the two train companies going to Machu Picchu. I have been on both train services to Aguas Calientes now and I have to say I liked Inca Rail a lot better. There wasn't anything wrong with other company but (with the other company) I did feel a bit like a sheep being herded into the train, and was placed miles away from the rest of my group. With Inca Rail the whole process of booking tickets and collecting them from the Ticket Collection was easy and efficient. They gave my family and I a free upgrade to First Class on the way there which is always a great thing. I love Inca Rail's philosophy of having the seats face each other... it is so much nicer this way in my opinion as you can talk in a group more easily and this helps you engage more with the scenery. The staff are outstanding... whether it be taking photos for you, telling you in advance when highlights out the window are coming up, or assisting you onto the train and suggesting where to put your luggage. At the end of the trip to Aguas Calientes, they provided a complementary insect repellent which was a nice touch. As for the first class meals, they are just outstanding. All other things being equal, I'd choose Inka Rail just for the seating arrangement. However they are also cheaper and friendlier to deal with. As the newer company in the market they are obviously working hard to establish a good reputation, differentiate themselves from their competitor and increase market share. I am glad I took advantage of this on my second trip to Machu Picchu.
1. One ticket in our party was for the incorrect day and they attendants would not allow her to board even if there was an open seat. This ended in an extra train ticket cost.
most available rail trip. while the rail trips to Aguas Caliente are quite expensive, Inca Rail offers the most availble rates

Got us there and back. All trains to Aguas Calientes are more expensive than one would imagine. We chose Inca Rail for its prices as well as its attempt at supporting sustainable tourism. The seats were cushy, but more narrow than I would have imagined Executive Class to be. The beverages served on board were fantastic. Snacks were basic snacks. Gorgeous ride through the mountains.
Very nice train ride to Manchu Picchu. Nice train, on time ans clean. To see the mountains on the way to Manchu Picchu this choice was ideal.

Train trip to Machu Picchu. The train ride was bumpy and scenic. The seating arrangements make very little sense - three couples including ourselves worked things out so that we were sitting next to our partners, others were sitting at angles from each other or across the aisle. It seems that the assignments are made in numerical order without taking into account the actual placement. Otherwise, the ride is very beautiful and our ride up included a drink and snack which we enjoyed.
Inca dream. A smart approach to the settlement of Machu Picchu. A great and sensible experience by train in the Inca land

Scenic and comfortable w snacks. Scenic if your on the correct side of the train. Cuter looking train than Peru Rail, friendly service, comfortable chairs but limited legroom. Choice of cold or hot drinks included in fee, Inka tea (coca, eucalyptus, anise or something) was interesting. Small bag of tasty snacks as well. Overall, enjoyed the ride but pricey if you're a foreigner.
Pleasant Ride. It took 1 hour 40 minutes from Ollataytambo station to Aguas Calientes. Drinks (hot/cold/alcoholic) and snacks are served.

comfort. The lack of comfort and space in the train is the main problem. For the price it is a shame! And the kindness of the staff or the nice beverages cannot compensate a very uncomfortable travel of 4 hours.
Good way to get there. Used Inca Rail because I had trouble with the Peru Rail site. Was happy with the choice. Service ran on time and was comfortable.

Cusco - poroy to Machu Picchu. Despite the overall expense of getting to Machu Picchu the 3 plus hour journey includes complimentary drinks and snacks. The staff are helpful with information and accommodate service requests.
However it would have been better if there were additional facilities (such as charge points, on board entertainment, WiFi connection) and discount to the Machu Picchu site.

Does the Job. Inca Rail will get you there. They have great staff and their trains are very nice. They are very expensive, though, and the seats are narrow. If you have broad shoulders, you will crowd your neighbor.
Inca Rail Experience. It was just great! All the services and staff were kind and nice! It was a pleasant trip to Machu Picchu. I really recommend them!

Late train and no communication. Our train was late, which is fine because delays happen. But there was no communication until AFTER the scheduled departure time and this "communication" was one employee walking around and only responding to people who asked, rather than making an official announcement. I felt that the company did not respect the passengers' time.

Definitely a must do!. Train is spectacular! Service perfect and view out of this world!!!
I could not decide what the best part was!!! I loved every minute of the trip and I was served the best food I had in Peru!
Don’t forget your camera and sunblock and prepare to enjoy!

Traveling with kids. I loved the cleanliness and timelines of the train. It was perfect to travel with kids. We felt safe and we were able to catch all our connections because the train was always ontime. We were all comfortable and had awesome views as we traveled. The drinks were a little funky for our taste, but they were good enough.
Slow but relicabke. We took the train to Machu pichu and back. It was the upgraded train. People were really friendly and service good. Lots of good sights to see

Great experience!. We bought the executive seats which had a table and nice comfortable seats. We also had windows above us so we could see the beautiful mountains. Staff was friendly and was enjoyable.

Loss. I took a collectivo as suggested ad arrived just after my train left. Though my ticket said it could be annulled or returned for cash, the lady gave me the return ticket and told me to purchase at the rail station next door. I bought my tickets weeks ahead of time. I had an approved ticket to Machu Picchu that day. I came to Cusco with $20 for circumstances outside of my control until the next morning. I spent over a hundred dollars for an executive service to be disrespected by having no customer service provided and my money taken.
Too expensive. The trip was good and the staff very nice. The thing we did not like was the cost for the tickets over 130 dollars per person is just too much especially in a country like peru!

Excellent service and value. Great way to see the wonderful Machu Picchu, and stop over in the amazing Ollantaytambo too. Not a lot of room for big bags (which we didn't need), but other people got a bit squished.Also, my husband and I, and a lot of other people travelling in pairs were all mixed up and put in seats separate from each other. We swapped with the strangers who were also separated from their partners but it would be better to keep travellers together in the first place.

Hiking alternative. The Inca Rail exceeded expectations. The ride was bumpy, the views were great. There was snack service both ways included with our ride. The snack was seed biscuits on the way there and trail mix on the way back. You could also choose from hot or cold drink. The train has rest rooms.
Ollantaytambo train. The service is extremely good and the refreshments are a nice touch. Staff friendly and helpful and plenty of room on board
great trip. great expirience, was good to take this trip. train was good, right on time,wagons were clean everything went well. Since the time when you buy the ticket online, there was no hard time

Unable to keep couples together!. On our ride, incarail was unable to offer us seats next to - or even close to - each other. We had seats #24 and #25, but those seats were not even in the same square. Several couples had the same kind of trouble. Some of them managed to change their seats to seat next/in front of each other, but my husband and I had to stay apart. A shame, given the price you pay for the ticket!!!
Wonderfull!. Exceeded expectations. Good attendance and punctuality. Could improve board service. Improve the way of boarding the trains.

Only choice, paid accordingly. The train is very good, the experience and board service are great! But it's not worthy such expensive tickets! However, as this and Peru Rail (just as expensive) whoever wants to visit Machupicchu has to pay for it.
MACCHU PICCHU INCA RAIL EXPERIENCE. An enjoyable ride with good service and great scenery. Would recommend Inca Rail for a comfortable and affordable ride to Macchu Picchu.
Very good. Very nice trip with Incarail. We were upgrade to first class, good service, comfortable seat, nice service people!

Timely and Organized. Nice Experience. Staff could be a little more pleasant e.g. I asked for an extra coffee and staff abruptly said that only one drink per passenger. I was not asking to get the coffee for free and that I was willing to pay for it. His answer was: I'll give it to you for this time only
Took a trip. We took a trip from Ollantaytambo to machu picchu. We enjoyed it, and it was good. Oh yes indeed it was.

Very very good. I choose the most cheap option and it was very very good and worthy. The only complain is about the seats, they are close so I didnt have enought space for my legs and its a shared space with the people in front of you. But everything was great.

Best train to get to machu picchu/ aguas calientes. We booked incarail to get to machu picchu aguascalientes and came back with Peru rail. What a difference. We preferred incarail 10000 times over peru rail. And our incarail ticket was even a cheaper. The inca rail traject was really enjoyable and relaxing. While on our way back with peru rail, l it was a very commercial ride. ( loud music, a lot of aplaudding of the perurail people, while trying to sell sweaters ).

Comfort issues. I took the train from Machu Picchu to Poroy.The wagon I was in wasn't very comfortable. There were 4 of us seating around this table and we were so close to each other that we could not strech our legs.Also, each one of us had the option to pull up an aditional part of the table that would give us individual space to eat and drink. However, when the waiter served us our drinks and snacks he told us that we should keep all of them in the middle of the table, so they wouldn't fall on us. And, indeed, when I left a small piece of chocolate on the individual parte of the table, it fell down. What is the point of having said individual space if we can not use it to support cups or snacks? in the end, all 4 passengers had to use the same space and keep our cups in line, on a tight space. I heard there are better wagons than the one I was in, but this was my experience.

An unforgetable experience. The experience was amazing. The valley is very beautifull and all the crew was very plesant. The drinks were great, but the food was very poor. The company should offer some payed options, because the machu picchu day is very exausting!

Train to Aquas Calientes. The train was comfortable and clean with good service. The large windows provided great views of the beautiful scenery. Be sure to have a hat and sunnies as parts of the trip will be in full sun. No complaints.
Nice, but.... Rail was great, snacks and beverages were nice, but although purchased 2 tickets in advance, did not get to sit next to each other. We weren't even on the same train...

Inka Rail. The trains are good in general, but you have no option of choosing your seats and we were traveling in a couple and got separated seats (this happened to other people in our wagon), despite of the sequencial numbers of them. Numebering of seats is also confusing as the sequence is not realy a sequence, as you see, for instance, a seat with no. 13 and than, on the other side of the aisle you see a seat no. 41.

Much better than Inka Express. It's really worth spending the extra money for this outfit. Also the Windows were better ergo better pictures. They have luggage check where Inka doesn't. Someone is also always in an office. Inka has weird and inconvenient hours. Important if you want to change your ticket.
Excellent trip. Comfortable 3 hours with Inca Rail from Poroy to Aguascalientes, quality drinks served on board, kind personnel.

Ride to Aqua caliente. Comfortable seats, nice to be offered a snack and beverage, pleasant and helpful staff. Very expensive tickets. Had had time navigating the website while purchasing the ticket online. Very confusing pricing system. Overall nice, just wish was a little bit more affordable.

Pleasant ride. Pleasant ride from Ollantaytambo to marker 104KM to start our 1day Inca Trail hike and then back from Aguas Caliente to Ollantaytambo.
My group of 7 weren't able to get seats together. =(
We were in the executive class.
-Big windows to take in the great scenic views.
-Seats were comfortable.
-Bathrooms were clean.
-Table space.
-Beverages provided.

Good-be wise when you book. Both train lines (I and P) are very expensive without any kind of justification. On booking our tickets (I and P) they sat us in sequential numbers tricking us to believe we were next to each other (so double check). Make sure you book a train ride to Aguas Calientes and back as most train rides are booked while actually in Cusco and AC. There is an alternative if you're stranded in the expensive AC city via Santa Teresa FYI. Now concerning Inca Rail proper I traveled in the executive class, snack was very good but minimal and drink was ok. The view with the gigantic windows is pretty cool and the slow ride is kinda reminiscent of old times. All in all: good not great, it is what it is

Getting to and from Machu Picchu. In our purchased tour of Cusco and Machu Picchu, our travel to and from Machu Picchu was via Inca Rail. Luckily our method of rail travel was Vistadome, which is the picture attached. There are many adjectives that could describe this trip, beautiful, relaxing, smooth, wonderful, exciting. The carriages were extremely comfortable and the vistas absolutely eye-popping. Continuously, the Pruvian countryside never ceased to amaze. The trip down to Aguas Calientes (sometimes called Machu Picchu Pueblo) started at 6:30am from Poroy, north west of Cusco. Travelling down through the various valleys down to the Urabamba River, and then along to Aguas Caliente following the river. Seriously, what a wonderful way to travel, particularly when your expectations are sky high as to your final destination ..... Machu Picchu.Our return journey was the following day, leaving at 3:30pm. The thought of finally sitting down for a relaxing 3 hours return trip back to Poroy was wonderful, we had been on our feet from 6:00am that morning. The trip back was so relaxing that I slept for an hour. This was sorely needed. Not only did we spend 6 hours in the Citadel, we walked down to Aguas Caliente, just to be different, and we spent 2 hours shopping at the markets at the station.Without a doubt, the Inca Rail trip was the best way to travel, and our choice of Vistadome was also the right one.

Excellent service, decent ride. We enjoyed our ride. We were in 1st class, and Executive class. First was awesome, with large cushy seats, table space, clean bathroom, full course meal, free quality drinks, and super service. Executive definitely had much smaller seats, and less space, still had non-alcoholic drinks, and a mixed nut snack. I noticed the train shakes more compared to one's in the USA, but I got used to it. The staff were very nice. Pictures won't post, sorry.

Great experience . Our trip on Inca Rail was wonderful. I was debating between them and Peru Rail and ultimately chose them for their role in sustainable tourism and preservation of Peru's cultural heritage. I was also turned off by the idea of loud music and fashion shows on Peru Rail. We took an early train to Aguas Caliente at 6am. Everything went smoothly from entrance to boarding to the journey itself. The employees were all lovely. The service consisted of a locally made snack and a choice from a variety of drinks. We had the iced lemongrass tea which was delicious. The views were great and the ride was comfortable. I read some people complain about the "shaking" but that is to be expected...you're on a train! I highly recommend Inca Rail. We had a wonderful experience.

Worst train ever. Unfortunately you have to take the train to go to Machu Picchu, but the trip is wasting of time.The train is moving with like 25 km/h and shaking all the time. Paying that much money and that poor quality is just bad. Our guide told us that mainly a lot of this money get stolen, not sure if this is true. But if you see the quality of this trip and the money they make every day, for sure there is a big discrepancy. But as said before - if you want to see Machu Picchu you have to take it. What a pain.

Ok ride seats ok but super overpriced . Super overpriced for what it is. Food selection and drinks are just ok. But more so the seats are very tight and not much table space. The biggest problem is the Windows get glossed over and you can't really enjoy the view. Also it shakes allot. Overall prefer perurail As a train goes though it's not bad just a bit overpriced

Great service. It's cheaper than PeruRail with all the service you'd expect. You are fed a snack and choice of either hot or cold drinks. For the cold drinks they actually had cocktails. Everything was on time. When heading to Machu Piccu, try to get a seat on the west part of the train for the best view. Executive class seats can be for $58-$62 USD each way

Cool train ride!. We took the Inca Rail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Caliente and back. The train left on time, arrived in less than two hours. The ride was comfortable, pleasant, and included a snack and drink. Would definitely recommend!

Better than Peru rail. Comfortable ride with free beverage. Scenic views ;friendly service. The price was high relative to the distance, but cheap compared to Peru rail. No luggage storage in Ollantaytambo but we were allowed to bring our big packs.

Better value then Peru rail. Overall nice experience. Stayed in Executive part. Service good (like the juice and mini snacks). Train was clean and comfortable. Only complaints is that it was way too hot (first way only had lil air) and second time hostess put windows down but too hot and sunny. Seemed like a lot to pay to not have good AC. Also inca rail needs it own luggage storage at ollanytambo. We struggle to find a place but eventually found nice woman at a hostel.

We Rode The Inca Rail By Default. On Saturday, March 19th, we rode the Inca Rail Presidential Car from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. For us this was the booby prize of being bumped from the Belmond Hiram Bingham Orient Express train, for which we had purchased round trip tickets through our booking agent. Apparently, the business decision to bump a party of 6, in favor of larger groups, was just too enticing for the Peru Rail executives, who operate the Belmond train. Being devotees of PBS, Agatha Christie, Hercule Poirot, and David Suchet, this train was a critical piece of the Machu Picchu experience.The presidential car comfortably seats 8, and must be booked in advance, since it does not run every day, and it is a charter. Do the math, chartering the Presidential Car is $1250 for up to a party of 8, while the Bingham train can run between $300 and $400 per person, depending upon time of day.The Presidental Car has its own wonderful staff led by Hugo, who will meet you at the station and escort you to the Car. Your chef will prepare your meal, which you will enjoy from upholstered swivel club chairs, and polished banded yew wood tables. On warm sunny days, they open the sliding side doors so that you can view the countryside from the brass Juliet balcony. Very nice.Since we got bumped both ways, our return train was Inca Rail First Class. This was a dinner train, and very pleasant. While in my mind, we were definitely cheated, Inca Rail treated us very well.

Trip to Aguacalientes (Machu Picchu). Obtaining a ticket an unbelievable arduous task. Involves queues passports, yes passports and most unbelievable a fingerprint. You will need your passport throughout the journey, even though you have a ticket you can't get on the train without it. The carriage is pretty good and you also get a cup of coffee and a cake. But it's a bit of a bone shaker!

Great service. The ride takes about 1hr and 40 minutes and nice way to get to Macchu Picchu and take pictures on the way. A snack and a drink is included with the ticket.Service is great and promptly.

Pleasant travel . I was booked via a tour to go to Machu Picchu via inca rail. From the time the train pulled up, to the time we left the staff were great. The male Alfonso was great it making sure every aspect of the trip was good. Seats were comfortable, and drinks and snacks were provided. Four stars given, only due to the high cost of the train- this is due to private train company.

Easy ride to Machu Picchu. Great and efficient way to make your way to Machu Picchu. Not the most expensive but also didn't feel cheap. Offered drinks and a small snack with a great service. Very clean and you just can't beat the views along the way!

Sustainable Tourism, an introvert haven.. I chose Inca Rail over other rail choices because money goes back to locals. It has a goal of sustainable tourism. The ride is great for an introvert. No music or rah-rah.

Wonderful Train to Machu Picchu. This is one (two total) of the train companies that will take you from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Caliente for a visit to Machu Picchu. We purchased the executive class tickets that provided a snack and a drink during the 1.5 hour train ride. There are some great views of the countryside while traveling to Aguas Caliente. We met a few people on the train during our trip and had some great conversations that made the train seem even shorter than it already was. Our train to Aguas Caliente departed Ollantaytambo at 6:30 AM and departed from Aguas Caliente at 2:30 PM. This gave us enough time to view Machu Picchu without feeling rushed. The bus tickets to get to Machi Picchu are sold outside of the train station on the street just past the market.

Beautiful scenery. What a great train ride. A snack and a drink is included in your ticket. The views are wonderful. I hooked a GoPro to the window and got great pics and video. You can see the river and snow capped mountains and wild animals. Great photo ops at both stations.

so overpriced!. dont get me wrong, the scenery is nice but this train is so overpriced! you only get the good scenery if you sit on a specific side of the train. the other side is just bushes. they at least give you something to drink and a snack, but even that doesnt validate the price of this train. not worth the $100+ per person we spent. But its either this, trekking, or a 6 hour car ride.

Got me to my destination. I chose Inca Rail because it was the cheaper option. The train ride from Ollantaytambo was comfortable: I napped and the staff were polite. The snacks were a pleasant surprise however I enjoyed my snacks getting to MP better than the ones coming from MP. Just saying. Other than that, I got what I paid for. About the views though, I read about the views being magnificent but other than the fact that we drove through impressive mountain ranges and I saw a couple of ruins here and there, it was just ok.

disappointing train ride to machu picchu . we are pretty excited for this train ride up to machu picchu but we were left a bit disappointed. the train was included in the type we purchased so we didn't pick which rail line we were using. the tracks up to machu picchu are not great. the view is nice a couple of times, but mostly the track side is full of litter, or is also over grown with jungle so there is no view other than the litter. machu picchu is a premium priced tour even by global standards, the tourism industry needs to clean this up. the train itself was okay. nicer than a subway car but not as nice as a European train. the guide beverages from an airplane cart during the trip, but that doesn't make it seem much fancier.

Scenic train ride. Comfortable train ride, about 1 hour 20 minutes from Ollaytetambo to Machu Picchu Puebla. Two friendly staff persons provided our car with complimentary snacks and drinks, including the quite delicious 'tropical cocktail' (mango, passionfruit, coconut). We had to wait several hours past our planned return trip because an issue with another train (apparently it's a single-rail line most of the way, shared with another service), but as to the Inca Rail train and ride, we found it to be quite relaxing and enjoyable.

Disgusting! Abandonded in Aquas Calientes. This company abandoned all tourists yesterday in Aquas Calientes due to a government dispute. We missed our flights, had no hotel or hostel availability and there was zero communication!As it stands a third party has told us they 'may' run trains today at 6pm... Disgusting treatment! Already $1000 out of pocket due to their unprofessional isn in missed flights.

Inca Rail Tour. Took this train and loved it. The train crew actually put on a fashion show with some local products. Great site seeing vehicle as you are going through mountains so the need to have glass ceilings was important. Food was OK, it was the mountains and sites you see that made it outstanding. Alpacka herds grazing, sheep, llamas', were all pretty cool to see.

Fantastic Journey. We boarded Inca Rail first class cabin on Ollantaytambo and the ride was spectacular. The staff genuinely try to make our experience magical. The food was delicious and the cabin confort and decor exquisite. There's no better way for visiting Machu Picchu: for 1 hour and 45 minutes -each way- we were treated like Inca royalty!

Decent ride & service. We took Inca Rail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes aka Machu Picchu pueblo. It is a decent ride with service. They provided refreshments which consisted of crackers and a drink (coffee, tea, water). It's unfortunate that you can't pick your seats, I would prefer facing the way the train is moving. It is amazing the difference in the ride when between Inca Rail & Peru Rail. But if you want to save some money, just go with Inca Rail. It will get you there just fine, it'll be a bit of a bumpy ride. And watch your cups on the tables, the bumps will move them around! I would ride it again to cut costs.

Don't need other options to visit Macchu Pichu. This was just a spectacular, scenic 90 minute journey from Urubamba to Aguas Calientes (Macchu Pichu) town. Our departure was delayed by an hour due to a mechanical fault but they provided hot drinks and a sunny place to sit while we waited for the next train. Once on board we found the seating to be quite comfortable, the large windows, including the ones overhead just provided us with an amazing view all the way, running river on one side and snow capped Andes on the other. The staff on the train were great, not sure why, but about ten minutes after our coffee one of the staff came and apologised because the coffee wasn't hot enough, to be honest, we didn't notice.Return trip was animated with staff providing us with the ten ways to wear one of the wraps they had for sale, was really funny.

They even give you a snack!. It is an amazing feet to build a railway through the Andes Mountains to reach Machu Picchu. It was a comfortable and beautiful ride and probably the only way to get there if you are not hiking. They do serve you a snack and drink. The only negative thing I have to say is that we returned to the town of Urumbamba when it was dark, and you could hardly see the steps from the rail car to the floor.....so that part was kind of dangerous. They need to have lighting right by the steps as you exit the train. Peruvian Rail does not allow large luggage. Check their website for size requirements. If you want them to hold a bag because you came from a hotel to the train station, they will do that for you so that you don't have to lug your unneeded items at Machu Picchu.

Nice Train. Although the fare between Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes seemed a bit expensive, the train is quite new and the cars are of high quality and comfortable. Also, every employee we dealt with was personable and helpful. On the way back to Ollantaytambo on the last train of the day, we were upgraded to a dining car and served a complete formal dinner. It was as if we were magically transported to an Andean version of the Orient Express.

How can I give less than 4 stars?. Right, let me start by saying that if you calculate what you pay compared to what you get this doesn't seem to be a good deal. Tickets are very expensive and you don't get much on the train. Snack is very poor, as one perhaps would expect, and seats are not that comfortable. Having said that, the tickets were cheaper than the other option and for this we were glad. Also, taking into account that most people visit Machu Picchu only once in a lifetime, this is a price you pay without complaning much. For this reason, I don't think I can give less than 4 stars, even though I didn't feel it was a 4* service.

Too expensive, but there is no choice. All in all, the service is quite good : comfortable train, nice view (if you are on the good side on the train, i.e. left to MP, and right from MP), good snacks and tea.But honestly, this is way too expensive for 1H45 of train; even if the seats are comfy, the ride is not at all, you are shaken from left to right all the journey.There was still a good surprise : on the return journey, we were at the end of the queue, and when we got on the board, our seats were already taken; no problem, they upgraded us to the first class, now that was very good ! Wine, 3 dishes, tea, and juices, with even more comfy seats, and attentive staff!

All Natural Snacks and Beverages. Not only did we love the train ride with the scenic views and friendly staff, but we also loved the snacks and beverages. inca rail is dedicated to providing high quality snacks and Beverages with typical peruvian influences (delicious probably organic chocolate, organic coffee, delicious high quality peruvian teas, stevia, snacks with native grains etc). I so impressed expecially coming from America where the airlines give you highly processed cookies or pretzels and white sugar for your coffee.The train was also easy to use and understand. The seats were also super comfy! would definitely recommend this for anybody traveling to Machu Picchu!

Amazing and Fun Rail Journey. Though we had to make a decision about the Vistadome versus Inca Rail to Machu Picchu-the difference in cost was $72 RT, we chose the least expensive Inca Rail and were glad we did for the 1.5 hour journey to Agua Caliente- the base for MP. Inca Rail is an older train with comfy leatherette seating and windows along the top of the train. While the Vistadome travelers were served sandwiches, we had great snacks and drinks. It was fine! Each car has a bathroom which was reasonably clean. The scenic journey following the river as well as parts of the Inca Trail was a once in a lifetime experience!
Amazing. they have a great atention and made my day in cuzco... all the people that Works there is awesomw and friendly i had some bad experiences in cuzco but iwas happy to go with them

a necessary evil. If you are taking the train to the Mecca of Peruvian Tourism, you are forced to pay an outrageous price for a 45 min ticket in a developing country that has been overwhelmed by greed from tourism. The view is great if you have a set of headphones to drown out the noisy Anerican tourists. Yes, I'm American, and yes, that is an honest observation. Since it's one of the few places Americans aren't "afraid" to travel, the blue passport holders tend to overwhelm the atmosphere...
Wonderful train ride to Machu Picchu. A comfortable train with a nice snack each way. The train does not go fast and follows the river all the way to Machu Picchu. The views are wonderful.

Inca Rail - Ollantaytambo. I had to be in Machu Picchu at 10 AM, and going by Perurail it wasn’t possible. So, I hired a Van from Cusco to Ollantaytambo, leaving by 4:45 AM, and got to Ollanta about 7AM, The Inca Rail leaves 7:20, so I had to rush a little. The services are ok, it’s clean and keep there was no delays.

Train to Machu Picchu. Inca Rail's service to Machu Picchu we liked very much. Unlike their competitor; Children of 12 or less half price and windows in the coaches roof in the standard class. A lovely well maintained train and friendly and polite staff.

Sit in comfort and enjoy the view. The trip to/from Aguas Caliente was gracious and comfortable. The opportunity to sit and look at the country-side was great. The complimentary drinks and snack were a nice touch.

STUNNING VIEWS RIGHT AT YOUR SEAT. - Inca Rail was an amazing experience in itself. - Great views of the Andes mountains right outside your window.- Yummy snacks and beverages provided by the rail- TAKE LOTS OF PICTURES :D- Clean smooth but, long ride

This was Fun!. You won't get the same kind of service you might receive on Peru Rail, but it doesn't matter. The landscape speaks for itself and there is little time for eating and drinking when you are taking in the amazing scenery around you. You will be a little crowded on this journey - ours was to Machu Picchu from Cusco - but it hardly mattered. The train is clean, drinks are served, the staff is polite and you can travel in comfort, while saving a bit of money.

Wonderful train. I few weeks ago I had the opportunity to go in the Inca Princes train, I can certainly say it was the best train I had ever been, if you are looking to travel with style this is your train, amazing food, great service and comfort! We even had a Pisco tasting session, for sure you can find nothing better!Congratulations to all the Inca Rail team for such a great experience!

Beautiful train ride. Most trains to Machu Picchu only start from Ollantaytambo (and not Cusco) these days, except for the Vista Dome, so plan to leave your hotel early enough to allow plenty of time. We took the Expedition train, less expensive and yet very clean, comfortable and with plenty of view from either side. I suggest you ride on the left side seats for views along the river. On the day of our trip, this and other trains were an hour late. The station was unusually crowded, but the staff of Peru Rail was helpful, offering free hot coffee, tea or coca-leaf drinks, a welcome gesture on a very cool morning. The train ride itself was very comfortable, and scenic along the river all the way to Machu Picchu. There was a brief stop to let passengers off who wanted to hike the famed Inca trail. We loved the train ride. I suggest you to use the toilette in the train before reaching MP, so you can go straight to waiting buses for the 30 minute ride up to the top. As you can expect, sometimes the lines are long as the train brings in many tourists. Our tour guide was excellent and we all rode the same bus to the top.
