If you don't speak Spanish and arrive to Poroy after sunset you just wanna cry there! Zone isn't nice, all dark and you need to struggle to find a taxi to Cusco, being exhausted already by a long train journey.

Nice ride. We took the Vistadome from Cusco to Ollanta and then we took Expedition from Ollanta to Cusco on the way back....We enjoyed the Expedition service, the train has more luggage space behind the seats than the Vistadome. The Difference in price between Expedition and Vistadome varies, in regards to the difference in service is a snack. As a constructive criticism, the snack could be changed to an item that might represent the country more as far as flavor and ingredients.Peru is full of amazing flavors. The service from the train station to the train itself were great. When making a selection between Vistadome or Expedition i would base it on the train time. Get to the train on time (30 minutes prior to departure) so you can store your bags behind your chair if not you'll have to store it in a single rack which is used by all. Have fun!
amazing!. The ride was a great experience. The staff was very welcoming and very helpful, special thanks to Giuliana Esther and Yobana Alvarado for all the great service.
great train ride. Great journey wonderful scenery with machu picchu at the endwhat could be better staff were very friendly and helpful the journey was slow but definitely not boring.

Terrible service. I took a train from Aqua Calientes to Olllanta on 17/9. The train was delayed due to engine problem. None of this was communicated to passengers who were called into the boarding area in the baking heat and provided with no information whatsoever for half an hour. We were then told that we would board the train but that we would not be moving due to there being no engine. Once we had boarded the train Peru Rail provided absolutely no communication to us. Nothing. After an hour I asked a attendant to communicate with passengers about the problem and to provide information about how long the issue would take to get fixed. No information was provided. We sat in Aguas Calientes station for 3 hours until the train finally left. Considering the cost of the ticket - the most expensive I have paid for a train ever - this was inexcusable. I understand that problems happen however the lack of communication made everything 100 times worse. Most people on the train had just done a trek at Macchu pichu and were very tired. Additionally when we finally arrived at Ollanta Station over 3 hour late, no one bothered to apologise for the delay. I will never travel with Peru Rail again.

Monopolist can ask for high price. There is no other way of transport direct to Aguas Calientes, so you have to pay.. You do not get what you pay for, as everything else in the country is much cheaper. For the same price you can fly from Cusco to Lima. The train just travels a few km.

NICE, EXPENSIVE BUT ONLY WAY TO GET MP. very expensive for the services they offer; the trip its amazing due the landscapes you can see. the trails choices offer extra services .. (my trip vistadome was exact same trail than expedition), the difference an appetiazer.. just one.. extra cost about 20 usd)

Peru rail expedition. I loved the experience! Amazing ride from Cuzco to Machu Pichu. Loved Esther, Mary Carmen and Marlene. They gave amazing service. The view and the experience was out of this world

Access to Machu Picchu. We took Peru Rail from Ollanta to Machu Picchu. It was a nice ride but in all honesty rail travel through Europe was better. One the plus side the cars had sky lights so you could look out the top and enjoy the views. Also seats were reserved so you knew you had a seat and didn't have to move through cars to find it. They did offer simple drink service during the route. One word of warning. These trains do not move quickly. I would chose Peru Rail over Inca Rail for level of comfort / service.

Amazing. I traveled with my friend from USA , and we had an amazing trip with them , friendly and fun personal . Specially Mari carmen was such a lovely person and her partners as well . They recommended to us a lot places where to go . Excellent job guys we will miss you :)
Fabulous Train Trip. The train service from Ollantaytambo to Agua Calientes was scenic, fab service and on-time! Special thanks to Mary Carmen who made our trip such fun and outstanding service!

very disapointed. we are very disapointed by this journey. After few km we stocked for 5hours, locomotive has aproblem.. it happens ok, but the staff was useless, no explication. No english speaking. We saw all the more expensive trains passing away. we got the feeling that the "expedition train" has the worst equipment, machinery, staff etc.. once arrived in cuzco, miraculously we found a douzain of bus to dispatch tourist in cuzco, once again we got the feeling that is not the 1st time that this train is delayed. and naturaly for this range of service, the price is unacceptable. We regret to not have traveled by bus even though it s harder and longer, but in fact some of our friends arrived before us in cuzco by bus ! unacceptable. also the girls in the cuzco office are unfriendly and unpolite. Perurail has the monopole "sharing" with incarail, they what they want. we are more than upset, worst experience and souvenir from peru !
Really fun!. Get the Vistadom - it's worth it. Angel is the best model ever!! They have some fun entertainment - embrace it! Food/drink is not super great.

Expedition okay for money. The Vistadome was supposed to be an upgrade to Expedition. But in my opinion, there isn't much difference between the two trains. The Expedition is cheaper, and still has nearly the same features as the Vistadome. I would recommend just paying for the Expedition train. You're not getting much extra on the Vistadome. The Expedition did seem to have more stops for the one tracking. Maybe they give the other expensive trains more priority to continue their path. Not sure. The train ride did seem like it was pretty long. But we did end up getting to our destination as advertised.

Great experience. I was very impressed with our experience with PeruRail. We used them to travel to Macchu Picchu and they helped the trip go smoothly. Everything ran as scheduled and the staff was great. I would like to especially thank Paola Esquivel for her outstanding service. She was extremely kind and helpful and really made our train ride enjoyable by meeting our every need. Keep up the great work and attitude! David Enrique also gave us great service. The train ride back had a little bit of entertainment which was fun and unexpected. The only downside was that we seemed to get the last of the dinner serving and it was a bit cold but still satisfying.

Incredible experience!. My Dad and I went on an 9 day vacation to Peru. The PeruRail Expedition train ride was one of the most unique and exciting experiences during our trip. There was something new to see all the time. The landscape is breathtaking! The service onboard the train was incredible. Our attendants on July 19th traveling from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo (departing at 16:22) were Wilbert A. & Carolain. They both were kinda, generous,attentive, and spoke wonderful English. They both should be commended for their exceptional customer service! A fantastic experience!

I have never hated anything more than this. Long lines everywhere. Rude people. You have to book a bus ride up and down the mountain, but can only do that after you arrive by train. And the lines are easily a mile long. No way to buy in advance. So we missed our train back due to this ridiculous bus system. Then had to book a new train back. The next day. We're stuck here in town. Didn't get a refund for our missed train. Then come to find they issued new tickets to the wrong station. So walk back to the train depot once again to try to straighten this out. I swear it's almost like they go out of their way to make this an awful experience. It's not worth it. Just stay home. I'm wishing I did.

Good way for first sightings of sacred valley. . The train is currently the only way to access Aguascalientes and, therefore, Machu Picchu (though we saw they are in the process of building a road). It is a bit chaotic at Poroy station (Cusco) but it is organised chaos. A great means of introduction to the sacred valley as its glass roof panels let you appreciate the surrounding mountains. Not a huge amount of legroom (particularly for the 4 seats, 1 table combo) but comfortable enough.

Excellent carriage and views. This train journey was very pleasant, clean, and timely. The train goes very slowly which gives you ample time to look at the lovely views. But, since the sun set 1 hour into our journey I don't think you would need bigger windows.

OMG! Best Customer Service EVER!. Clean, comfortable, nice snack service, but what impressed me the most was the customer service. We stayed a night in the hotel at the Ollantaytambo station, and inadvertently left my husband's swim trunks hanging on the clothes line to dry. On the way back from Machu Picchu, we intended to get off the train and run in the hotel to retrieve them, but was informed by one of the porters, C. Eduardo Verastegui, that we would only be stopping for about 3 minutes and it would not be advisable. He took some information from me to see what could be worked out, but I lost all hope. About 2 minutes after we left the Ollantaytambo station, he walked up to our seat and delivered said swim trunks. I'm not really sure what kind of fancy footwork he had to do to get those delivered to us, but THAT is what I call good customer service. His colleague Nicky was sweet and helpful as well.
It could be better. The service to aguas calientes was great. The problem I had was with the service to come back to Ollantaytambo. Everything was a little more disorganized.

Nice Service. I wish we had taken this line up to Machu Picchu instead of when we came down since it was dark and could not see the views. A better value for the comfort on this train. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Boarding was a little confusing in Aguas Calientes but the staff at the station was very helpful when we asked questions.

Clean, efficient and good service. We travel on the Vistadome on the way to Machu Picchu and on the Expedition on the way back. The Vistadome has nicer seats and was less crowded than the Expedition but they were both clean and the personnel was very nice in both trains. On the Expedition we were offered a drink and a cookie and I particularly liked the cookie and Danissa and Elysabeth were very gracious and explained the origin of the cookie and told us were we could get them in Cusco. Both trains left on time and were great.

Much the same as Vistadome - Expensive train ride!. We purchased our tickets for the Expedition train from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo online through the Perurail website and paid with PayPal – a very quick and easy process. Our tickets were USD74 per person which were actually USD9 per person more expensive than our Vistadome tickets, (a better train with a better snack service & entertainment…) On Vistadome we received a small salad, a fruit and a juice whereas on the Expedition, we were given a cookie and a small glass of cola.The windows are pretty much the same as those on the Vistadome with the exception that some of the seats were windowless. The train line follows the river through much of the same surroundings, so it’s not the end of the world not to have a window right next to you, especially for the return trip, as you’ve basically seen it all already. There is no fashion show or entertainment in either direction on the Expedition (only on the return trip on the Vistadome).The seats were spacious and comfortable and they’re group together in fours (two groups of two people facing each other over a small table) – pretty much the same as the Vistadome. As we were staying two nights in Aguas Calientes, we needed to take luggage in excess of the allowed weight on the train, and it was very easy to get approval by Email prior to our trip. That said, no one checked or questioned our luggage… Announcements on the stations are only in Spanish (and not very audible) and there are no electronic arrival or departure boards, so we could not understand what was going on or where we had to go, but the staff were very friendly and helpful, so we just asked them and managed to get on the right train at the right time. I didn’t take any photos on the return trip…

Good views. We took the train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes. There are lots of great views. The staff was friendly and helpful. They served a "snack" that was closer to a full meal. The views were gorgeous and the rrain ride was smooth.

Cheaper but equally good as Vistadome!. Perurail's vistadome experience has been hyped so much on the web that we couldn't help but booking our onward journey (Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes) in Vistadome but, our return journey was in regular Expedition service. Both train services have the panoramic windows. So don't get carried away the only vistadome has it. Of course the vistadome windows were a little bit more luxurious, but the overall experience the same in both train services. Vista dome provides snacks (one croissant + one banana + coffee) in a glass plate and cup, whereas Expedition service provides a local biscuit and coffee in plastic cup. The seats are luxurious in both train services. All-in-all, if you are looking to spend more in insignificant luxury items, then opt for Vistadome, otherwise Expedition service is equally good and cheaper.

Train ride and staff on board were excellent. Ticketing staff were incompetent.. Ticketing staff were incompetent. PRINT your confirmation. I had my passports and the visa I used to purchase and they could not find my reservation. I had to walk a mile back to my hotel to get to a computer to print the confirmation. Then the ticket agent miraculously found it using my Visa. So frustrating! ALSO the website states there is an 11lb bag limit and we stored our bags at the previous nights hotel instead of taking on to Aguas Caliente. No one checked. Others had full size suitcases! Still this was an amazing train ride with friendly staff on board and scenery that was awesome. I'd recommend.

Very good service. Everything was perfect, the train is beautiful, clean, and full of windows to observe the sceneries.On the train, Bismark & Esther were just the perfect team, warm, welcoming and very professionnal. Bravo !
Nice transportation. Although it was the cheapest option but the service was good. The seat was comfortable, bathroom was clean, and staff members were kind too.

Tight . Great way to see the beautiful scenery. However, if you have long legs or are sore from hiking Macchu Picchu all day, it is a tight fit and not much room to stretch out. I am only 5'5" and it was hard to sit that long. It is hard to stand up since the train rocks quite a bit. Upgrade to the more comfortable trains. I think it would be worth the price.

Fantastic experience/Wonderful Service. We took the train from Poroy to Aguas Calientes on the way to Machu Picchu. The trip was very smooth both ways with excellent views. The train was very comfortable and was easy to have conversations with the people sitting across from us. The service was excellent as well, especially on the return trip to Poroy. Orja Villalba and Maria Dennis were extremely friendly and professional and provided excellent service. Orja VIllalba in particular was genuinely warm and friendly prior to the train boarding while we were standing in line. She made us feel like valued customers. Thank you for making the trip great!

Won't reply to any of my emails. I arrived at the train terminal no later than 55 minutes before the train departure time, and that was mostly due to the fact that i didn't realize you had to grab a ticket with a number before being called to the window. I was told that my ticket had already been cancelled due to the fact that I was not there 1 hour before. I pleaded my case, but to no avail. The lady at the counter said not to worry; I would have to purchase another ticket, but my original would be refunded 100 percent. She said I would receive a response no later 48 hours and my refund with 3 weeks time. I have emailed devolucionespax@perurail.com no less than 4 times and have not received not a single reply in over a months time. This is such a sleazy company. They will do anything to try and nickel dime their customers. It's already a rip off for the service you get, I don't see why they have to be so sleazy.

Awesome ride with amazing views!. I took the 7:30 am ride from Poroy (which is closer to the town than Ollantaytambo). Everything went smoothly. They offered us drinks and snacks. Overall the views were my favorite part, so I recommend taking the train during the morning. During the night, the lights are on and it is difficult to see anything outside the window.

Wonderful Trip!. We took the PeruRail to Machu Picchu from Ollantaytambo to Agua Calliente. It was a wonderful trip as you are able to see the countryside and as you travel down to the high jungle the change in the greenery.

Wonderful Experience, Amazing Service. Our group of 16 traveled on PeruRail from Cusco on May 8. Seats were comfortable, they offered complimentary snacks and beverages, and there were several points of interest explained throughout the 3 1/2 hour trip to Aguas Calientes.After hiking around Macchu Picchu for several hours, all we could think about was relaxing with a cold beer or two on the train ride home. Since we had a large group and they only had 8 beers stocked on the car, our awesome staff (Nestor and Danissa) borrowed from other cars and radioed ahead to the midway stop to have a few more cold ones ready for our group. Danissa showed and explained some traditional Inca music and dancing. These may seem like small things, but their concern for our comfort and making sure we had a relaxing trip home was a really nice gesture. I obviously recommend seeing Machu Picchu (absolutely awe inspiring - as expected) and since you have to be on a train for the 7-hour round trip, PeruRail was as comfortable and friendly as you can get. Thanks Nestor and Danissa for making our trip home fun!

Great service. this was the train my wife & I took to Machu Picchu. Very puntual. Great service & atention. We were going to loose ar train back, becouse we got confuse with the hour, and they came looking for Us. Special thanks to Esteban, Indra, & Karina, who atended us on the train.
Clean and pretty easy going. Train trips can so often be dirty and old but there was none of that feeling on these trains. Snack was a nice touch but it was the views that really made the trip.

Nice outward journey. rattly on the way back. Took this train to Machu Picchu as there was no alternative. It was very epensive and we would have had to consider walking the 30 odd kilometres were we not availing of a 2for1 promotion on their website. The website is reasonably well laid out, at first it may be unclear which number train you need but there is a pdf you can download with all of the times and numbers. You then send your request and an operator emails you back very promptly and from there you are in good hands. The train itself is very modern if not a little cramped. There is no space for large luggage but the station has a free storage service we could use. There are also luggage racks on-board for smaller bags. The journey to Machu Picchu was lovely, the train moving at a nice pace to take in the views out of the many windows on the sides and ceiling of the carriage. There was a free tea/coffee/water service with a small traditional cake as well as additional souvenirs for sale. The return journey was at night so the train driver put the pedal down which made the journey a little rockier. This did not stop the many tired explorers in our carriage from sleeping soundly. The gentleman accross from me sleeping unsoundly, his snoring almost louder than the train. We were offered the same tea service as on the outward journey, all included in the price of our ticket.All in all we were content with the service but still felt it was a little expensive given it is the budget train option (for tourists) and that there are very few alternatives to getting to Machu Picchu, a site everyone should be able to eñjoy.

so nice!. What an organisation! Early in the morning there is a professional and friendly check in. Bravo for the employees of PeruRail. Very friendly and helpful . Especially thank you to Carlos Ruben (supervisor). We had a little stress moment and thanks to him and his crew everything went ok. Thank you

Lovely journey from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. Clean, comfortable carriages. Reserved seating. Complimentary snacks. Helpful staff, well-organised. We took the cheapest option and it was great. Highly recommend.

Train to Machu Pichu. The booking process is a bit more confusing than it needs to be. There are almost too many different options and it is tough to really make the appropriate selection for yourself. There are also lots of changes that they make seasonally that you must be aware of. A huge plus was the service personnel. On the train, the people are friendly and multi-lingual. They will do what they can to help. We had to leave on an earlier train than scheduled. Generally they do NOT do this. Again, the human element here was superb. Jesus, the train supervisor and Johnathan helped us out in a big way, as we needed to get back to Cuzco earlier for a number of reasons. Thank you Jesus and Johnathan! You helped save the last leg of our Peru trip!

Expedition train Cusco - Machu Picchu (Peru). Quit a great experience to go by train from Cusco to Machu Picchu (Aguas Calientes).Moving true the valley parallel to the river side. Getting tea or coffee with a bisquet for free. Luxerous train compartements. Friendly people to serve you.

Smooth Ride. Train rides were always on schedule, so that's a big plus. Wagons were comfortable and clean which were very important because the trip from Cusco to Aguas Calientes and back is about 4 hours. It's a subtle trip and view was amazing. Snacks & drinks were served, too. Every aspect of our trip had gone smoothly, and a good train ride is another plus. I definitely recommend this just make sure you book your trip early.

Great!. This was the far more expensive trip we did in Peru, and only because of time limit. Was it worth it? I'd say yes. The landscape you pass trought is just amazing. And the train is really confortable, their service is good and professional, the seats comfy, the timing accurate. I'm really sorry however that it is such monopoly that only 2 companies get to drive this tour-hence the price.

Comfortable ride, fantastic view. We traveled from Pachar to Aguas Calientes on January 20 and back again on 21 with Peru Rail - Expedition. We can only recommend the Expedition Train. The wagons are clean, comfortable and light with windows in sides and roof which gives a tramendous view to the very dramatic and beautiful landscape. On board the train we especially will mention the very good and friendly service from the staff who on our trips were Deysi Fresia and Andrea. E & H, Dk

Very clean!. This rail was very clean and the atmosphere was light and fun! The complimentary beverages were what would be expected coffee tea and a small cookie of some sort. the journey is long and it was nice to have them explain the sites along the way.

Wonderful trip from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. The Expedition was plenty comfortable and the service was good. The trip itself is a beautiful journey through the Sacred Valley and beyond. We spent several days in the Sacred Valley and Ollantaytambo and were able to walk from our hotel to the train station the morning of our journey. If you have the time recommend the 90 min ride from Olly vs the 3 hr train from Cusco, less time on the train and allows for a manageable 1 day trip to Machu Picchu.

Fantastic view!!!. Expedition was comfortable and convenient. The view from the train is just amazing!!!!! I used vistadome on the way back, but I don't think it was worth paying the extra fee. Not much was upgraded. So, I recommend that you take expedition and save the extra money for some other activities!

Nice comfortable ride . You can either take the Expedition from Cusco or Ollantaytambo. We chose the latter. Ollantaytambo is located about 1h30 away ( it took us about 1h15) from Cusco so plan your departure accordingly. If you take the early morning train and haven't had breakfast, you can buy coffee and croissants / sandwiches at the train station / waiting room. When the train is ready to board, they make an announcement. The train is quite comfortable, it has Windows on the side and roof. Seats are blocks of 4 (2 facing each other). There are no rack on top of the seats but a main one as you enter the wagon. The journey can either be 1:15 or 3:30 depending on where you take it from ( Ollanta or Poroy). The taxi driver told me that 90% of people preferred departing from Ollantaytambo as the train journey was quicker. That makes sense as the Poroy station is about 20-30 mn from Cusco + the 3h30 train journey. During the journey you are served a coffee and a muffin, service is good but very basic.

Fantastic experience, comfortable ride with nice views and very good service.. We took the Expedition train for a round trip from Ollantaytambo station to Macchu Picchu town and this is really the way to get to the promised land.The train was clean and comfortable, beautiful sights and a better than expected service with nice drink options. Completely recommended, I wouldn't make this trip any other way.
Wonderful train ride from Agua Caliente back to Cusco.. Comfortable ride from Agua Caliente back to Cusco. Beautiful views too. Great service thanks to Isabel, Linda and Elvira! Thank you.

staff are simply incredible. I would like to share the the experience to take the return trip from machupichu back to cusco was simply amazing. Zelena, Enzo e Edison were SO PROFESSIONAL, test, SO FUNNY, SO SO NICE PEOPLE, that i had to report that

Amazing views. We travelled on the vistadome on the way to AC and the expedition train on the way back.We didn't really notice much difference. You use the same trainline and there were windows in the ceiling on both trains for great views. The main difference we saw was the quality of the snack given to you.It's without doubt a beautiful train ride, wonderful scenery especially on a clear day.Tip....1.book in advance to get the exact train you want!2. They do not take large items of luggage, so take a smaller bag/hand luggage for your trip and leave bulky items in your next hotel.

Exceptional Service and Experience. The Expedition train to Machu Picchu offers comfortable seating, stunning scenery viewed through glass windows and ceilings and the staff especially Isabel, provided great service!

Adventure. The train is clean and comfortable,the scenery is exhilarating,the steward Dennis and stewardess Milagros are wonderful and helpful and very friendly. Will not forget this adventure vacation.

The happiest train ride to Machu Picchu. For our journey by train to Machu Picchu we chose PeruRail. We booked the Expedition class which was great. They welcomed us in the early morning on the trainstation in Ollantaytambo with tea and cake. Professional and friendly check in. The trains are beautiful, clean and have comfortable leather seats, enough space for small luggage and lots of windows to enjoy the beautiful views. The best thing on our trip were the employees of PeruRail. Genuinely friendly, helpful and you could see they really love their job. We would like to thank Isabelle, Jorge, David and Esteban for make this trip one to remember. Thank you PeruRail for this wonderfull journey. Highly recommended!
Return from Agua Calientes to Poroy. Enjoyed a very smooth afternoon/evening ride with perfect service by Stewardess Sandra. She did the service all by herself for 48 passengers. Chapeau!

Great customer service. My boyfriend and I visited Machu Picchu this week. Our train ride to and from Poroy was more expensive than expected but worth the price. The train attendants were super friendly. They took care of our luggage while we focused on finding our seats. Unfortunately, my boyfriend had trouble during the train ride because of little leg room; we were seated in a table for four. Other than this disadvantage, the train ride was enjoyable. If you want exceptional customer service, you have it with Elizabeth L. and Brayan C.

Great trip to Machu Picchu. The train ride was very good. It was very comfortable and the staff went out of their way to make our trip a very pleasant experience. Blake not only took car of us from our train ride from Aqua Caliente to Ollantaytambo, but also gave us a list of great restaurants and museums to visit while we were in Cusco. It was a great trip.

Perurail trip was perfect . My travel to machupicchu was so good. The train was delayed but still a great time. There was a purvian named blake that entertained us and told us so much history of the area. Blake was the best i have seen and made the trip much more enjoyable. I would recommend them to everyone.

Superb vistadrome carriage with wonderful views. I travelled with a group from Cusco to Macchu Picchu on the Expedition Peru rail vistadrome train. The windows are huge both at the side of the carriage and in the roof and afford superb views on the journey to Macchu Picchu. Boarding is orderly and efficient with staff directing you to the correct door and a ticket and passport check is made before you board. The train travels quite slowly (just over 3 hours each way) so there's plenty of time to appreciate the surrounding countryside. The seats are comfortable and are numbered and allocated with your ticket; a table separates the seats and then once aboard you are offered a hot or cold drink and light snack both of which are included in the price of the ticket. The toilet facility on board is clean and can only be used whilst the train is moving. The stewards are friendly and helpful and on the return journey they bring merchandise round; books, cds, t shirts, scarves, ponchos etc. It's a lovely way to travel to Macchu Picchu.

Great Experience!. I rode today the Frecuencia 72, Coche B, 1713, the stewardess were Carolain and Mirko. The entire experience was nothing less than a pleasure. I was initially impressed by their appearance, their uniforms fit them perfectly, were clean and were very distinctive. Their service was just outstanding. Please, give a pay rise to whoever hired them!

Comfortable and scenic rail journey. Railcars have been upgraded and feature vista domes and excellent views of the valley and snow-topped mountains. The seats are comfortable and washrooms are available. If you are on your own you will likely end up at a table for four and have an opportunity to make new friends (unless it is an early morning run and they are still sleeping). Refreshments are served but they are not as good as they used to be. It seems that some things are being scaled down from what they used to be. There used to be a very entertaining fashion show on the return trip to market their upscale clothing but now it is just a rack with clothing going down the aisle. It is still a wonderful trip and worth the money.
Great experiance. Lovely team!! Thank you for your great service:Bengi CalderonRosmery CuevaZelena LawtaClaudia Pinedo

Old fashioned rail service. Took the Expedition from Cuzco to Machu Picchu. Comfortable seating, stunning scenery viewed through glass windows and ceilings, informative announcements made in English and Spanish. Rosa, and Carlos attentive, posh service included breakfast and afternoon snack complete with drinks menu, table cloths and proper cutlery. On the way back the servers provided a delightful fashion show featuring top quality Andean creations.

Pay to upgrade to the Vistadome. The Expedition does its job. It takes you to/from Machu Picchu. But that's all it offers. It is a cattle call of people rushing to get on and fight over limited luggage space. Limited options on drink/snack. Pay the minimal cost difference and go for the Vistadome.

A very relaxing yet scenic journey.. After trekking the "Inka Trail" and marvelling at "Machu Pichu" the train ride back to Ollyantaytambo aboard the "Expedition" was a relaxing way to end a magnificent experience. The train staff, Dalia and Wilbert were accommodating and friendly and would recommend it.
Excellent Service. Everything was great, specially the staff thanks Claudia and Gleem they made the trip awsome. Train was comfortable, great windows, nice view and good treats

Excellent service!. This is an extremely professional and reliable company. If you are riding in this train to Aguascalientes and back, consider yourself lucky! I had a very positive experience, and I was very ill. Two of the workers, Vera and Gleem, went above and beyond for me. As I checked in to the train they asked how I was feeling, I informed them that I felt sick and nauseated. They assured me that they would assist me if I needed anything. They immediately handed me supplies I needed to vomit, which I did, and they took care of me every step of the way. I had originally had plans to travel that night from Cuzco but I was too sick. Gleem, called the travel company himself, on his cell phone, I might add, and explained to them what had happened and the state I was in. Gleem, also called a hotel for me and booked a room where I wanted to stay. They continually kept checking up on me. Vera was very kind and concerned. Gleem also assisted me in getting a cab after the train ride! He called a co-worker, Estaban, to confirm that they could get a cab for me. Gleem also informed me that it was cold and to make sure I had my jacket on, when the train stopped, he helped me carry my things and escorted me to his very kind co-worker Estaban, who found a cab for me that would take care of me and wouldn't over charge me. They are amazing! I am so very grateful for them and all of their work and assistance, thank you a thousand times!

Regal Service. Visited Machu Picchu on the 13 and 14th of June 2015. Travelled on Peru Rail. What a great experience. The trip was very comfortable. The beautiful views from the train are not to be missed. As far as the staff I just want to say that we were treated regally by the staff members, among them Edgar, Mario and Linda. Great team, very helpful, cordial and very knowledgeable.

Great ride on PeruRail from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo. Beautiful scenery, great windows throughout the railcar. The PeruRail staff, Flor Susan and Gladys, were the best, too! A marvelous and magical train ride!

Scenic and comfortable train ride. We fully expected the train ride to just be a means from getting from point A to point B. However it was a very comfortable ride and the views all along the way are wonderful. Snow capped peaks, small villages, remote Inca ruins, wild llamas...there was always something to be seen. We were also given snacks and drinks, and all of the staff were very nice and the whole process was very organized.

Muy Buen Viaje. The train ride from Cusco to Aguas Calientes was wonderful, with incredible views of the white water river. The staff were very pleasant and gave excellent service, the train was clean and the snacks enjoyable. After spending the night and next day exploring Machu Picchu, our train ride back had excellent, very friendly service from Milagros and Efrain. It was too dark to enjoy the river view again, but it allowed us to relax after hiking much of the day. The train ride was a memorable part of our totally fantastic trip to Peru with Kaypi, and it's the perfect way to begin the journey to Machu Picchu. I recommend it to everyone. Cheryl Gross, Sarasota, FL

Train from Poroy to Aguas Calientes. It is always a nice experience to go by train! So this one was as well! You have to be at the station at least 30minutes before, we were leaving from Poroy (the closest station to Cusco - it takes about 30minutes to get there, taxi around 40soles), the train was on time, staff was friendly and when we told them it was very cold in our part of the train, they fixed it for us. They also offer you a snack (tasteless muffin or their traditional cookie wrapped and baked in paper so it was almost impossible to eat the cookie without paper) and drinks - inca cola, coke, teas, coffee, water etc. There is a storage in the train you can leave your backpacks (we didn´t know there was this storage in each train so we only took a small backpack but if we knew we would definitely take more staff with us!). The train looks new, nice seats but the tables make it a little bit uncomfortable. The ride is about 3.5hours and you will see amazing nature of Sacred Valley. We paid about 80 USD each way pp. It is overpriced but still the cheapest train to Aguas Calientes. Well, if you want to see Machu Picchu you have to pay the price for it! Overall, it was a good experience.

Transportation from Machu Picchu to Ollantaytambo. This was my first experience on a train. The station was very organized and efficient with boarding the amount of people using the rail system. In our car, Felipe and Zelena did a wonderful job of taking care of us. Felipe was very friendly, knowledgable, and helpful during service. Zelena had such a warm, welcoming smile. They both made the experience top notch!

Birthday surprise. The 20th may I was travelling with the train. Suddenly the birthday music started playing and the staff: Cesar, Jose Luis and Carolain came singing and gave me a applecake. It was a very nice surprise! Thank you

$65 worth of Perurail train experience. Once in Peru Machu Picchu is a must, isn't it? Well, the only way to go there from Cusco is by train.Here are photos of the train, the ticket, interior of the carriage and service aboard.
Not good service. They change 3 hrs the departure hour, we had to wait 2 hrs in the train without moving. They didn't give any possibility to change the train, told us to wait nothing more to do.

Almost messed-up experience saved by a great staff!. We went up and down on Peru Rail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. The train is extremely comfortable with great service. We had an incident during our return trip from Agaus Calientes (AC) that the peru Rail staff handled spectacularly.We had a 16:22 train from AC for which we were at the station at about 16:00-16:05. The lady staffing the gates into the platform didn't let us in saying that it was only Inca Rail passengers who were boarding now. This, we later found out, was entirely incorrect as our Peru Rail train was boarding at that moment! Peru Rail also failed to make a last call announcement (we checked with our co-passengers later and none of them had heard one, whereas they had heard last call announcements of other trains). So we chilled out at the station waiting to be called upon. When they opened the gates for the 16:43 train, we were let in and then told that our train had departed and we had missed our train. We panicked as we had to get to Cusco by 22:00 when we had an onward bus to Puno etc. The station manager (we forgot his name!) for Peru Rail was super patient and waited to see if there were any no-shows. He found a couple of seats and put us on the 16:43 train apologizing for any inconvenience caused.All this while we had to tell our tour operator who had sent a car to Ollantaytambo about all this (we didn't have local mobiles). Our wagon attendants, Zulema and Lidia, were spectacular in helping us out. They got the numbers and details from us, went up to the train engine, radioed the Tour operator and passed on instructions to our driver in Ollantaytambo. Both Zulema and Lidia were very very helpful and very gracious in their interactions. We were able to, enjoy the sights of the Expedition train and get in time to Cusco to make our train! All thanks to the great staff that Peru Rail has. Although, the confusion between Inca Rail and Peru Rail at the Aguas Calientes station should be sorted out to prevent any such occurence in the future!

Great expedition wagon. Everywhere I heard the "expedition" Is a train for backpackers, however I'm impressed with the nice seats and view that you can get in there. If you want to save money, take the expedition, highly recommended!

A must to use when going to Machu Picchu. This is the train people take to get to the town Machu Picchu. It is like a Swiss train in schedules. My train said to depart at 2:20 pm and exactly at that time, the train started to move. It takes around 1:40 to arrive to Aguas Calientes at the town of Machu Picchu. It comfortable and really ride.

Brilliant and efficient way to see the epic Machu Picchu from Cusco. We had four days in Cusco, so utilizing PeruRail to access Machu Picchu from Cusco was just perfect for us. This was rain seson, so PeruRail used bus instead of rail for the first part between Cusco and Aguas Calientes (approx. 2 hrs,) which was OK (safety first!). The train ride is not exactly fast, but punctual, and it gives you the chance to observe the wonderful nature, as the roof of the train has large windows. The personell from PeruRail was exceptionally friendly, and promoted a high level of service I'm not used to from my country (Norway). Thanks to Felipe for adding positives to a truly unforgettable trip, including the most astonishing place I've ever seen. :)

thank you!. thank you........... for your wonderful service while we were travelling peru rail back from Macchu Piccu to Cusco.Your attendance was full of humour, good mood, attentiveness. we felt so welcome!you made this journey a pure pleasure.Beate and Patric

Nice train. We used PeruRail to get to km 104 to begin the 2-day Inca Trail, and then returning from Aguas Calientes. It was comfortable and plenty roomy enough. The views are good with the windows along the sides and ceiling. Considering it's pretty much the only option to get to Machu Picchu, unless you hike, it's pretty nice. They do hand out free beverages and snacks, which is nice. I would book tickets in advance unless you want the very late train.

Nice trip. Get real other reviewers, your'e going to one of the wonders of the world! It doesn't come free! And it rains and gets foggy up there as well As!I was really impressed with PeruRail. Courteous, efficient service and bang on schedule.The crew were available and the snacks ok.We travelled from/to Ollantaytambo (which is my recommendation) and on the way back, the train made what appeared to be an emergency stop. We were stuck for about 10-15 minutes, then were on our way again.Great day.

PeruRail Vistadrome and Expedition. My husband and I took the PeruRail Expedition from the Sacred Valley to Aguas Calientes(Macchu Pichu) and it was okay. The seats face other people which can sometimes be a little awkward. It's not an uncomfortable trip but it is a little boring, so bring cards.On the way home we took the Vistadrome and it was amazing!! Definitely worth more money! You get a really good, authentic meal, and are constantly entertained by the wait staff. They have a fashion show and even a little cultural show with costumes! It may not be your style but it keeps you entertained the entire time!

Excellent and beautiful in any class. I traveled in Expedition class from ollantaytambo to Machupichu and let me tell you guys it's a really nice experience and in any way it's price it's worth it, Nice and comfortable seats, windows are really big for your experience, the staff are excellent and treats you really nice, the snack it's not that great, but it's not a long trip.If you can travel in the VISTADOME class for $20 dollars more it's great, but let me tell you in expedition class you will enjoy it as much. Beautiful attractions and the train it's very precise with the departure time. If you take the train from poroy to Machupichu I will recommend it as you avoid a 2 hour travel in carExpedition class it's around $68 -$70
Peru Rail- Good Food. The rail had good leg space , The food and service was very good in expedition. The all round glasses lets us see the path to Machu Picchu from all angles

Feel like purse. Unfortunately we found the price much too high for the train ticket, speed and service. The difference in price between local people and foreigners is enormous, it makes us feel like purse to bring money to Peru rail "vaches à lait".On the return trip of 86$ we had 30 minutes delay but no service offered. Snacks and drinks are cheap ones. The best snacks are for sale on board.We would recommend to use a bus to Aguas Calientes instead. We do regret that it was not mention in our lonely planet edition 2013.Thanks for your attention
Great Train Ride and Great Service. It's a great ride with beautiful scene. And thank you Yamil for your friendly service and good communication skills!

Great Train Ride and Great Service. This was a great ride, in a beautiful train. Thank you Wilbenth A. - for your great service. I have shared with my Manpower team here in the US how nice it was to meet you and the friendly service that you provided! :)
Mandatory train. Its not like you have any other choice to get to Aguas Calientes or Machu Picchu but I had no issues. Comfortable seats, clean bathroom, big windows, and a snack along the way.

Peru Rails Expedition Train. We booked our train trips from Ollantaytampu to Machu Pichu thru Peru Rail at the recommendation of a friend. He said Peru Rail had more trains running than Inca Train.We booked the Vistadome train for our early morning trip to MP and the Expedition train for our return trip which was the latest on in the evening. We agree with a lot of others that all of the trains seem to be charging fairly high prices for the length of the trip ( compared to a lot of other trains in many other countries) but sometimes you have to pay the price if you want to use the service. The Vistadome train was extremely good- excellent views of the scenery on route, fantastic service and information from the staff and overall a very enjoyable, relaxing journey to Aguas Calliente. We took the return trip on the Expedition because it was the latest train leaving Aguas Calliente and it was a bit cheaper but the ride was quite different from the Vistadome. The engineer seemed to be in a big hurry and the train bounced a rocked abit as thye seemed to trying to travel as fast as possible. The service was okay but far less that the Vistadome. Maybe if we wouldn't have been on the latest train of the day it might have been different but we couldn't recommend this train like we will for the Vistadome.

Bandits !!!!!!. They really take advantage of tourists looking to visit Mach Picchu,The price for a 2 hr ride is extreme also it makes the cost of stayingin Aguas Calientes very expensive.. Inka Rail is just as bad...But you have no choice if you want to go.....

Great scenery along the way with big windows.. The train staff was very friendly and the view were great on the Expedition train. We were able to converse with fellow travelers and the sun coming thru the windows felt great.

Anti-relaxing horns and music. Direct sunshine on the passengers. The music is repetitive and unnecessary, at least for the whole 3.5 hours trip. The train horns the whole time and that doesn't allow you to relax at all. The worst is the roof windows with simple glass (not darkened). This makes the sun hit on your head directly and you feel like in a microwave oven. I won't repeat the experience.

Beautiful adventure!. We traveled by Peru Rail the first week of November, and it was wonderful. The trains were clean, the service was professional, and the the scenery was spectacular. There were snacks and entertainment on board, just like in the old days of air travel. People were friendly and helpful, it was a positive experience for our small group. Tickets could have been simpler but all in all not a hassle.The only comment I have is make is that if you are going sight seeing, make sure you take the train during daylight hours. Once it is dark or rainy, the windows do not offer a view, just cooler temps inside the cars. Really enjoyed the trip, we are planning on our next trip already. We will take advantage of more of the stops the train makes and stay at more of the locations that the train stops at. Take your time and explore (hike/walk) more of the areas that Peru Rail offers. Really wonderful trip, and would recommend it to anyone considering Peru.

Terrible customer service. The lady that served us was chatting online while serving us.We had to ask in different ways the same question to understand what was the situation. (Was done in Spanish, so it has nothing to do with the langage barrier!!!)When we ask for time and date wanted, the only answer was: «The train is full.» No other option given.We almost missed our trek on Wayna Picchu (7h-8h am) We had to stay in Ollantaytanbo for the night before our admission in Machu Picchu. (We figure that one ourselves)The Poroy station is 30 minutes from Cusco in taxi.Knowing that I would compare with Inca rail before buying with them, wich option is best for me.And 150$ for the roundtrip.... for bad advices and terrible customer service.

Great experiece, great service!. Maybe because I was very excited about this trip, about traveling with my husband and parents, but actually this was the best..Price? Well maybe is high but its the only way to get there.. Or maybe walk for 4 days.. Your choice.. The service, punctuality and the chairs worth it.The amazing views during the trip, will keep you awake most of the time.Some people claims about the prices, the mosquito., but for me all that was part of the trip... You are not going to Disney.. You are in the middle of the jungle, with nice and proper services.. So I highly recommend it.. If you have more money maybe can upgrade to vista dome or take Hiram Bigan..

Relaxing, scenic and professional. Punctual timetable.Comfortable interior (A/C could be a bit cooler for sunny days since the sun streams in from the roof windows.)Tables are available for almost all seats, a very convenient detail.It seems a bit expensive to me, but the value is quite good.

The best staff!!. We rode on peru rail to leave Machu Picchu and had an excellent trip! The trail itself was a little Rocky but it had a nice bathroom for a transport car that even had toilet paper, the seats were comfortable and the complementary snacks were great! Somehow (which is still a mystery to me) one of the men on the train found out that it was my boyfriend's birthday and surprised us with chocolate cover fruit and made the whole train sing for him. The train staff was incredibly sweet and I regret not being able to remember their names because they were awesome!! Thanks again!!!

Good service, friendly staff and beautiful train. I took this train to go back to Cusco from Aguas Callientes after an awesome day visiting Machu Picchu. The train left the station on time, the interior is very pretty, but the main point about the Expedition is the friendly staff. Mr. Blake Gallardo and Jhonatan Chacón were very helpful giving me very good tips about nice restaurants in Cusco. Besides that they asked me how I intended to leave the train station to go to my hostel, demonstrating concern and one more time being very nice to me. My only complaining about the Expedition are the insects inside the train at the end of the day, but since we were in the forest it is understandable.

Terrible frontdesk employee. The train to MP, the prices, the lines...it's all all in the (wonderful) game. But the lady at the frontdesk in Cusco (Diana) is exeptionally bad. She refuses to make any eyecontact, snores an answer to your question en couldn't care less about the excursion you are going to make. She should change her attitude of be fired.

Be careful with online ordering..... Bought our tickets from the states 6 months in advance. Within 2 hours our cc was being used to buy stuff in the US 3K miles away... Also, the ticket seat numbers they gave us didn't match the train so when we looked for our seats in the car they assigned us the seat numbers were not even there. Not a good feeling. They found us some different seats after a little stress. They said we were going to get a small show on the way back from Machu Pichu but never did. Cars smelled a little bit but overall we were so mesmerized by the views and the Machu Pichu experience that we were overall happy. We used the expedition ( cheaper train) and we would use it again. Tip- they only accept back packs on the train- NO suitcases. Also, ONLY bring PERFECT US dollars- no marks, no tears, no fading, etc.. Only get bring brand new US bills to Peru- banks nor exchange houses will take even the slightest of dollar blemishes. Found this out the hard way.

Scenic ride. Scenic ride from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. We find the fare is overpriced.The train station in Aguas Calientes is quite difficult to find. Had wonderful experience on our train ride back to Ollantaytambo.
great. all service was great and you can just enjoy the view or simply rest during the trip, absolutely recommended to travel with Peru Rail

Good value, nice train. This is the best alternative for travelers that want to go to Machu Picchu without spending a fortune on the train trip. The service is always very punctual and the staff on board is helpful.

Breath taking ride. A little overpriced, and more of just a means to get to Machu Picchu than an attraction itself. This was my first time on a train, wow was it memorable. It was a breathtaking ride through the Sacred Valley and along the roiling Urubamba river. Just awesome. All I can say

Nice staff and pretty inside.. Everyone was nice and helpful. Only downside was the bathroom smelled on the way back.The train moves kind of slow, but it has to apparently. They serve drinks and a snack going and coming from.

Just incredible!. We took the train from Poroy to Aguas Calientes as we didn't have enough time to do the Inca Trail on our travels.Great service, comfortable seats, lovely staff, brilliant views and fab snacks.Make sure when booking you pick the correct station - there is no train from Cusco so you need to pick Poroy or Ollantaytambo, both of which are a cheap taxi ride away.Tickets to Machu Picchu are not included in the train fare so make sure you buy them well in advance. There is a other half hour bus journey to get to MP once off the train, something the website does not explain so be aware of that.Would recommend getting the train up early morning, staying in Aguas Calientes overnight and have two days to explore Machu Picchu.Loved the train journey and would definitely do it again!!
Terrible experience. Sway too much and feel uncomfortable.Delay on both two ways.But staff are all friendly and good drink service on the train.

Rip-off. Perurail is owned by a public company that's traded on the NYSE. Conveniently (for the company), there is no road that leads directly to Machu Picchu. The actual ride was pleasant but its hard to enjoy when you know they are taking advantage of tourists. Here is another option that a cab driver told us about: take a cab or colectivo to the hydroelectric plant and hike the rest of the way (2.5hrs) or catch the train from that point.

I've been on worse!. For the fare, this is a good way to travel on a budget to and from Agua Calientes (near Maccu Picchu). The seats were comfortable and the train was air conditioned and clean. I cannot speak to the restrooms as I did nap most of the way. You will sit four at a table so if there are not four of you traveling, prepare to meet or ignore your neighbors! Our traveling companions had a great conversation with some traveling ladies while my husband and I opted to snore our way to town. We were offered drinks and muffins, but opted out of that as well. Would do it again and recommend it to friends.
Totally professional. Service provided and information from all staff was top class. A wonderful trip to Machu Pichu which was made possible by Perurail staff

Expedition. It's not an attraction. It's a means of transportation to/from Machu Picchu. It was part of the package of our 6-day trek, not my choice. The seating is tight, not much room to stretch your legs. They serve you a drink and snack.
Luggage. Be careful taking too big or more than two bags... They will retain them until you come back... Bring a small back pack. Everything else is OK.

Nice train ride. I actually prefer this train over the Vistadome. We rode the Vistadome to Aguas Calientes facing backwards. All of the seats on this train face forward, plus there is no weird fashion show on the way back into town. The food isn't as good as what is served on Vistadome, but that's okay I can survive a 90 minute ride without something to eat.

Trip to Machu Picchu via Peru Rail. My daughter and I decided to travel from Cuzco to Machu Picchu via Peru Rail and it was definitely a great decision. The trip back to Cuzco was even better because of the wonderful Peru Rail crew. A big shout out to Juan Carlos, Lisbeth and Oscar Silva, who helped make our trip even more special.

Perurail failed me on this one.... We had the Expedition from Aguas Calientes back to Ollan, and we were promptly boarded and ready to go. The train's whistles blew. But then we didn't move. Five minutes passed, then fifteen... then an announcement that something was wrong. At this point people were getting anxious. Workers were communicating. We just sat there. No bathrooms on the train. An hour later we were told something was wrong with the engine. No one spoke enough English to tell us what would happen. Would we be stuck in Aguas Calientes for the night? Would we get a new train? No one knew. Bottom line is we were on the train 3 hours before we departed, and at no point did any one have any idea what was going on or why we weren't leaving. Horrible. Once we started moving, it was pleasant enough. Communication just really had to be better.

Can't help but feeling ripped off.. Since it is the only 'direct' way to get to Aguas Calientes from Cusco (Porroy) or vice versa, you can't help but feel that without competition you are literally being taken for a ride! I kind of expected a nice slap up meal to be included in the price of the ticket. It is the scenery that makes this journey worthwhile.

Gorgeous scenery through remote territory! It's an adventure! Unique train, expect the unexpected.. We enjoyed out ride into Aguas Caliente through farmland, small towns, and ruinshe along the river. The seats were very comfortable for the 3+ hour train ride.There were plenty of windows to be able to take in the views. As the train gets started there is a definite rocking of the train due to the narrow tracks, but it smooths out after it gets going. We wound through farmlands, small towns, and small homesteads that were refreshingly totally self sufficient while at the same time very humble. There was obvious poverty but at the same time very homey. Donkeys, pigs, chickens, horses, and cattle rounded out the landscape. Some children were leaving for school, all in their matching uniforms as nice as any exclusive private school uniform, and so clearly well taken care of. An interesting contrast from their humble homes. The tracks run next to the river that cuts through high granite canyons and eucalyptus groves. Saw breathtaking cliff hanging pods for mountain climbers to rest. There were a few ruins visible from the train. While rolling along we did jerky to an abrupt stop twice due to brake issues which were quickly solved. Remember, and repeat-it's an ADVENTURE! Deep breath, patience, and we were on our way again served a light snack and drinks. Enjoyed their unique way of backing and going forward to negotiate going down hill. The scenery became more lush, and soon we pulled into Aguas Caliente. We met new friends on the train and loved the scenery and our adventure. Congratulations to the lucky ones who get to experience this! Enjoy your trip!

Go for vistadome only. Just did the train trip from MP to Olly yesterday by the expedition train and couldn't wait to get this review across!!! People please choose the vistadome train and do yourself a favor. Whilst going to MP from Olly we were lucky enough to get that train for $60 per person and we really enjoyed the views and made lovely friends on our way (due to the seating). In contrast to this, yesterday's ticket cost us $86 per person and the windows weren't as big, food was just one muffin and there wasn't even milk with the coffee so you'd be forced to drink americano even if you don't like it!!! Seriously disgusting to know that after charging such high prices the train authorities can't offer milk with coffee. Unfortunately, this was the only train that fitted with our schedule so we had to go with it. DO NOT TRAVEL BY EXPEDITION unless you want to waste your money. The only thing I liked was the seats and the staff was polite. There was no fashion or dance show as mentioned in some reviews.... so once again WASTE OF MONEY.

perfect service on a perfect location. The service on board of the train was excellent, in particular because of Miss Lisbeth and Mr Victor Martinez, which were polite, attentive and helpful in any respect.

Good Experience. We have recently taken the train to MP, the scenery is amazing, while traveling the train made an sudden stop (an animal was crossing the rail road) so the coffee that I just got served was spilled on me. Enzo and Sherli did provide a good service on board and help me to clean the mess. On the flip side it takes over 3 hrs to get to MP from Cusco for a 90 km ride, if you are seating in a 4 people table the room for legs is really limited and there is no overhead compartments to store your back pack or bags, so plan your day carefully to make the most of it.

Good service. I went to Machu Picchu from Ollanta by Perurail.It is a good experience and in first class serve tea and a cupcake.Journey is comfortable and stations and trains are clean.And this is they best way to go to Machu Picchu.Malay

Amazing scenery. The train journey to Machu Picchu was part of the enjoyment of the day. The views are spectacular but best if you are lucky enough to be on the left hand side of the train on your way there. Drinks and snacks were served, and the train, including the bathroom, was very clean. The one negative was that we were part of a tour group and no attention was paid to last names when assigning seats - it was totally random, often next to total strangers.

Expedition to Macchu Picchu. We took the expedition train service from Poroy station (Cusco) to MP. Note that trains no longer leave from Cusco central station. You have to take a 20min taxi ride to the next town of Poroy. Very nice and clean compartments on the train. It also has windows on the roof to view the scenery as it passes by. On time departure and arrival. You can get a nice snack and drink on the way which is included in the price of your ticket. Staff were courteous and helpful. I felt the train was much better than Amtrak in the US. The scenery along the way is just awesome and a fitting introduction to the wonders that await you at MP.

Comfortable Travel to MP from Poroy. Travelled on Expedition Train to AC as part of our 2Day/1Night Tour package to MP (from Llamapath). We went by private taxi (organized by tour company) to Poroy. Went on Expedition train. Family of Four (2 adults, 2 boys ages 16 & 11). We were lucky to have assigned seats in one row: 2 seats on right-side, and another 2 seats on left-side of aisle. Clean bathrooms on board, and snacks offered (crackers, cookies) along with simple drinks (water, juice, soda). FYI: Some seats are arranged facing another row. Our seats did not, just lined up to the backs of another row.Seats were very comfortable and restful (I wish airplane coach seats were as nice:-)From what I understand by asking others (including a taxi driver)...train service does not go to Cusco, but rather passengers would need to depart from either Ollantaytambo or Poroy stations.

Nice way to get to MP.. It's a nice way to get to Machu Picchu. My friends and I choose the expedition because we were short on budget, but for it being the "coach" the seats are really good and with good space between.They served snacks and drinks during the journey.

Choo Choo. Choo choo... here comes the train to Machu Picchu! This is the cheapest choice and the best value by far, in my opinion. The trains are nice and new. The food is gross and weird (BYO). The train is PAINFULLY SLOW... but, then again, so it the expedition, and the difference for the H.B. does not compensate for the price hike.
pricey. way overprice for distance 90km from cusco to machu-picchu, but unfortunately there is no other way to get there, unless you want to walk for four days.

Excellent experience. I travelled some days ago from Machu Picchu with a group of Greek tourist by PeruRail Expedition train. The trip was enjoyable and our attendants Sergio Luis and Sherli real professionals.I hope in my next tour to Machu Picchu to travel with them.Apostolos

For the money you pay - you better get good service!. I don't really know what to say - for a train ride it was fine... I like the fact you get a small snack... it's better than the Eurostar for sure haha. Ummm yeah - I can't think of what to say I mean... it's not like you get a choice to NOT take this train. It's either train or trek for 4 days....Make sure you book your train ride at least a couple of days in advance!!!

ok, but disappointing after vistadome. We took this back because it fit in our time frame. It was the last train of the day and we were tired and it was very loud. I would try to book the vistadome both ways.

Wonderful trip. A great way of seeing the magnificent countryside and ice-capped mountains - scenery is amazing and even without going to Machu Picchu is worth the trip alone. A word of warning - try and get seats that face the forward journey, not looking backwards.

Bring ear plugs and bug spray. Okay, Perurail is clean and convenient. We totally enjoyed the ride to our final destination of Aquas Calientes. However, on our 4 hour ride back we got bitten up inside the train, the whole way back. And, it could only be me, but the music piped into the train really drove me insane. I can still hear the pan flute when I close my eyes at night....my tip to you, apply bug spray before the train ride and bring ear plugs if the music brings you to the brink of insanity....

Fun experience . I always say a traveler's enjoyment of any activity or accommodation depends heavily upon 3 factors: -your preferences-your expectations-the company you keepThat being said, I took the Expedition train back from Aguas Calientes while traveling with a friend and we were in awe of everything we saw and did there, bearing in mind the fact that we understood that this foreign country is DIFFERENT than the US and does not always offer the same basic comforts to which we are accustomed in the US. . .Here are my thoughts:Pros:-extremely fun and friendly staff-scenic trip with large Windows-we sat in the very front of the train and were able to see the best of the scenery - the staff was friendly and chatted with us, particularly Paola and Rogelio. -Later, during the fashion show, they pulled me "backstage" to be part of the fashion show, modeling an alpaca serape. It was fun. Cons:-It is expensive. I reserved on-line and the economy Peru Rail train was sold out. I bought the tix ahead of time, worried that they'd be sold out when we got there, as is the current thinking... However, there were plenty of tix available the day of, and cheaper prices. Bummer. -The train was stopped to accommodate roadside peddlers, and the on-board "fashion show" - a frivolous attempt to infuse a bit of culture into a soft sell approach to peddling expensive fine alpaca clothing items. If you are in a hurry, book the cheapest train to avoid this 30 min delay. In short, any of the trains suffice. Take the cheapest. But if a better window view and friendly staff are important to you, take Expedition. If first class service and dining is your preference, take the Hiram Bingham train for 3 times the price. *Recommendation:Go in off-peak times. 1. Off season is summer - June, July, August (winter in Peru). This is the DRY season in Cusco and much more conducive to hiking and other activities. It is very cold at night, though. (With alpaca blankets in the hotels/motels, it's no problem sleeping) 2. Go TO Aguas Calientes (base of M.P.) in the late afternoon/night, stay the night in AC and head out to MP early (6am) before the first trains, rife with tourists, arrive. You will have gorgeous pictures without hoardes of people in the back AND foreground. 3. Return to Ollantaytumbao (Sacred Valley) early the next morning or before noon. Tickets will be easily available at those times as most tourists try to make MP a one-day event. * MP tickets ARE available the day of...However, they are no cheaper than they are on-line, so if you are sure of the date you wish to visit, I recommend buying them on-line. They are not cheap. . . Something like...$130 US dollars...can't remember exactly...** If you like a short (1.5 - 3 hr) adventurous hike with an exceptional view looking down at MP, buy the Huayna Picchu tickets on-line (at least 4-5 months in advance, due to limited access -only 400 people per day vs the 2,000+ that visit MP daily...). Bear in mind these tix sell for a separate, more expensive price. But...they SAY one day, in the near 20-year future, MP will only be viewed from a glass observatory as tourists will no longer be allowed to trample and degrade the site. Go now. While you still can. I was unable to secure any HP tickets, as the website had been hacked and was subsequently shut down for 3 months prior to my visit. Total BUMMER. 2nd option: Putucusi's Ladder It's free, and located at the edge of the town, Aguas Calientes. I also missed out on this because it had rained recently and parts of the ladders were washed out. Double bummer. Please do these activities for me. I will live vicariously through you . . .Happy travels.

Poor on the way back. On the way to Machu Picchu the train was looking good as advertised and the view along the way wa beautiful. If you pay enough attention you can see ruin fort of ancient people. On the way back the train was another story. It looked pretty much like very simple and the cheapest one. I was so disappointed, cause what I paid for was for the best one not for the simple one.

Fun experience. I was not sure whether to take the Expedition or Vistadome train but settled on the Expedition after reading the reviews. I was very pleased with the experience. The train was clean and comfortable and the workers very friendly and helpful. Waiting to board early in the cool of the morning with a cup of the complementary coca tea warming me was exciting and pleasant. The view from the large windows was awesome on our way to Machu Picchu. Complementary beverages and cookies were served and, on the return trip, a chance to buy souvenirs. I would recommend the Expedition train.

Nice train, lousy customer service. Travelled on the vistadome service on 1st of june, return of course. The train was very nice and service was very good going to machu picchu. The scenery was obviously beautiful but the train trip was slow, but we didnt mind, Had a wonderful day at machu picchu, and got to the station to catch the 1540 train. According to our tickets we had seats in carriage F, but there was no carriage F, so I was seated in C and my wife in F. Being a once in a lifetime journey, this is totally unacceptable. Till today, I am still waiting for a reply to a complaint I sent on 3 June. Hopeless customer service when things go wrong !

Better than expected. Took this 6:45 PM train, like most trekkers, from Aguas Calientes/Machu Picchu Pueblo back to Ollantaytambo. Seats were comfy, luggage racks were provided, and some snacks and drinks were also given out during the 2 hour ride.
Inca Trail. After 4 days trekking the Inca Trail, this train home was a luxury. Very comfortable. Great service throughout. Panoramic views were an added bonus. Highly recommend.

Comfortable but slow. The train is quite comfortable from Cusco (which leaves from a station on outskirts Porvoy) however it is incredibly slow. The views and terrain are lovely. Take some food and drink for your self on the trip. The train up to Aguas Callientes from where you catch the bus up to Machu Picchu takes up much of your day. The return trains don't leave until late afternoon so it is good to bear in mind when planning especially if time poor. Aquas Callientes is a very cute place but when you are sitting around waiting for a train with luggage/backpacks it is annoying. Staying in Callientes is one option but the same applies except the hotel will look after your bags. One way of avoiding the long train trip is to get to Ollantaytambo by road and catch the train from there. Be aware that is seems most people get up early to get to the top before sunrise so there are long ques for the bus from 5.30am.

Great service!. I was very impressed with my experience on Perurail when my family and I traveled from Cusco to Aguas Calientes. The train was clean and looked up to date aesthetically. The skylight windows at the top of the car showed all the wonderful scenes of snow covered mountain tops as you ride to and from the destination. We did not have any trouble boarding the train and someone was there to assist us with our larger luggage. We were provided with a meal on both trips which was an added surprise. Our car staff members (Oscar, Wendy and Christian) were wonderful. They were helpful, professional and very personable. I would certainly recommend Perurail as a fantastic means of traveling to Machu Picchu.

Captivating views. With limited means to reach Machu Picchu from Cusco (we caught the train in Ollantaytambo) the train is perhaps the most enjoyable option. The route parallels the Urubamba River - the view of the majestic mountains, small farms and communities along the way are captivating.

To expensive!. I wish that i could have take this train. But for a student the prices are way to high! $160 for a return ticket.. if you travel on a budget you have to take public transport, that is a possibilty, but it takes a lot of time. 1 day per Direction

Great train ride; no need for pricer options. This was a great rail experience. On time. Organized. Comfortable. Complimentary drinks and snacks offered each way. Wine and beer can be purchased, along with some other snacks. Each train car has its own restroom. Seats are assigned, so no frenzy to get to seats. Very attentive staff. Oh, and the views are spectacular. Windows in ceiling like vistadome option.

Great services. Thank you Wendy, Wilbert and Domingo!. Train was a little slow and parts of the cabin had an unpleasant smell. Beyond that it was quite a pleasant experience. The services were great. The entertainment was a great idea too. We would like to commend service staff Wendy, Wilbert and Domingo for their patience, their hard work and most of all for their great smiles.

Bonitas vistas y servicio muy bueno
Beautiful views and great service. Fui en el expedition trén desde Machu Picchu hasta Ollantaytambo y todo era muy buena. Las vistas eran increíbles y el servicio de los trabajadores sean excelente, especialmente Blake. Él era muy amable y atentivo de todo que hemos necesitado. I traveled in the Expedition train from Machu Picchu to Ollantaytambo and everything was very nice. The views were incredible and the service of the workers was excellent, especially Blake who served us a snack and was very friendly and attentive to everything we needed.

Great scenic rail trip. Really nice way to finish the Inca Trail and a day at Machu Picchu. The staff were particularly lovely, Roxana was very generous in doling out the complimentary treats and coffee!

Great experance. Awesome ride threw the mountains. They mostly are not on time BUT you better be in case they are and you will miss them. They give you a snack and drink, and you can buy others. The stations are nice with nice cafes to wait in, but they can get crowed.

Mixed feelings... but mostly positive. So let me just inform anyone thinking about taking Peru Rail... MAKE SURE YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY CLEAR ABOUT WHAT YOU WANT!!!I speak Spanish pretty decently, and even with the ticket agent knowing a bit of English, the confusion that ensued was a total fiasco.Long story short, I went to a Perurail office in Cusco to have a friend added to my trip and change the dates. Sounds painless but when we got to the train station and were just about to board the train with the passes we had, which I was under the impression was for 2 people, we were told we only had a pass for one person. All despite the fact I specifically asked more than twice for a ticket for TWO people. Of course i take partial blame for not paying closer attention to the ticket upon purchase, which is why I say, be 100% sure you get what you're asking for upon purchase. Everyone is so quick to want to please and get your money, they'll say yes to anything that they think makes you happy. On the bright side, the train ride itself was more than pleasant, clean, and the staff was extremely helpful, courteous and professional at helping us sort out all the confusion with the ticket issue and got us to our final destination on a high note. :)Definitely use Peru Rail!!!

Reliable transportation to Machupicchu. This train runs on time and is a comfortable ride to the base of Machupicchu. Seats are assigned.Suggestions: Drink a lot of water to help with the altitude, at the same time use the opportunities for clean restrooms when you have the opportunities. Use the one in the train stations, not the ones on your way to the station. The trains are clean and you get a drink and a snack. The trains take you to Aqua Caliante where you can hike the rest of the way, or take a bus. The trip is steep so decide if you have the energy to hike to the base and explore Machupicchu. Remember to consider a wait to catch a bus if you have a time certain time to catch a train out.

Friendly staff and pleasant journey. We took the Expedition 83 from Agua Calietes to Ollantaytambo on 22 May 2014. It was a very plesant journey. Comfortable and spacious leather seats facing one another. Friendly staff Manuel Delgado and Oscar Silva made sure we were served on the train. We were offered free drinks to start with, followed by beer with friends (7 soles per bottle, the bottle cap with machu picchu picture is good souvenir to keep). We also bought some Sol Alpaca products from the two staff, who looked incredibly good wearing the clothings from Sol Alpaca. The journey took about 1.5 hours and after that we boarded the mini bus to Cuzco from Ollantaytambo. The journey was quite swift we hardly realised time passed.
