The most expensive. Perurail is very good, with good service and punctuality, but it's the most expensive company. If you are travelling from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu, you should check prices at Inca Rail. Same type of service and lower rates.

Relaxing Trip. We took this train from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and were surprised by the service on the trip. Fresh coffee or beverages plus a sandwich were offered along with a piece of fruit for dessert. Seats are roomy and comfortable. Try to get seats 1 and 2 since they are in the very front of the train and offer panoramic view of the countryside of oncoming views. We were fortunate enough to score these and have great pictures and videos of our trip.

Great experience. The train ride on Perurail to Machu Picchu was incredibly beautiful, comfy and a wonderful experience. In addition, the manager, Alfredo del Castillo, was very helpful in getting me on an earlier train than the one I had reserved, meaning I could arrive back at Cusco before midnight. Thank you Alfredo.

Great trip excellent service!. I traveled on the expedition train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes in May. I was a little nervous about the trip but the staff of Peru Rail were extremely helpful! They answered all my questions and were very professional and kind. The train was very comfortable and the sights where amazing! There was one steward named Victor who was especially helpful. He was able to answer all my questions and had a very pleasant attitude. It was nice to travel with a steward who enjoys their work and takes pride in it! I would certainly recommend Peru Rail to anyone traveling to Machu Picchu or other locations in Peru! The expedition train was very nice- so I imagine the vistadome train is even better.

Comfortable. The ride itself was nice. The views were great. Great service. For some reason, my husband and I were booked sitting separately, but we switched with the person next to us so we could sit together. I didn't realize that in the rainy season, you have to take a bus back to Cusco. That was kind of scary.

Expedition 33 to Machu Picchu. We wanted to travel on the Vistadome and did this on the return trip. I preferred the Expedition 33 train, it features 2 leather reclining seats side by side facing forward. The ceiling features perspex/glass lookouts so it's truly spectacular ride. They offer you coffee/tea and a snack on the way. Loved this experience. I think it's much cheaper than the Vistadome and well the saving too.

Comfortable and Convenient. We took the train back from Machu Picchu after the Inca Trail hike. The train was comfortable, had great views and included complimentary beverages and snacks. Lots of windows. Our tickets were booked through our tour company (G Adventures) so I cannot comment on the booking process. I found the train station in Aqua Calientes to be very busy and crowded and the whole process of boarding the train to be rushed, as people are very pushy and don't seem to follow line-ups very well, but I guess that's jsut tourists for you. The train itself was great. My only complaint was that it was too cold, I think they were blasting the AC.

super nice and helpful employee. We ran into some problems regarding credit card companies issuing new cards and couldnt remember the original credit card number used to buy the train ticket. The woman employee who helped us was awesome andhelped us in a pinch. Her name was vanessa castro and found a way to get my friend his ticket and had contacts on the other side at macchu picchu who printed out his return ticket. She was a lifesaver!!! Without her help, my friend may not have made it to maachu picchu with us.this review is only intended for the employee. The company has a funny way of doing things both online and the way you redeem tickets. They need to update their electronic system. It is the reason why we ran into these problems in the first place.

The best customer service you´ll find. Great ride and great services that (almost) match the price. We managed to miss our train by waiting at the wrong station at Aguas Calientes. Despite this being no fault of Peru Rail the staff made every effort to get us onto the next train - free of charge. I´ve never encountered such kind-hearted and helpful staff on any travel service ANYWHERE in the world, and I was shocked by how genuine their concern was that we made our onward journey. Thanks to everyone, and a special mention to supervisor Carlos Ruben...you guys are great!

Excellent customer service from PeruRail. We were given great help by Alfredo del Castillo Cuba, Service Supervisor at Ollantaytambo station. We had a problem with incorrectly issued rail tickets which meant we were not allowed to board our train. Of course we got rather "stressed" by this but Alfredo, who speaks excellent English, immediately called our tour agents and was able to secure new tickets on a following train. Whilst we were delayed by 2 hours we were still able to have a late afternoon trip to Machu Pichu. The help from PeruRail personnel was excellent and "saved the day".

Excelent option to Machupichu. My childhood dream was visit Machupicchu, so I did it. Little trip to peru a few days ago. I organize my trip alone, (without travel agency, because is more expensive), I had spoken highly of the trains going to Machupicchu. When I bought my tickets I obtained information on the two railway companies at plaza de armas in Cusco. In the end I decided to buy my train tickets in Perurail because Estela helped me a lot, she gave me all important information to make my trip on myself. The staff on the train was so kindly, roof windows to see the beautiful landscape, meals was only thing I didn´t like. I recommend Perurail service and staff for the professional way to help the tourists to Machupicchu, thank you to help me make my dream come true!

Very scenic train ride. Having to take a bus for almost an hour outside Cusco to the temporary Ollantambo station is a nuisance but once you reach the train it is excellent. Views of mountains, ruins, foliage and a river of spectacular rapids are all iimpressive. The train is comfortable. The staff is attentive. Truly the best way to get to Machu Picchu!

Amazing Experience & Great Staff. We went to Macchu Picchu with PeruRail, who were amazingly well organised. The experieince from buying our ticket in Cusco was suberb. On our return trainmy friend and I discovered we weren´t sitting together, which wasn´t a relaly big issue but we thought we would see if they could put us together on the off chance. We were helped by Alonso Saaugaka (I think that´s the spelling of his name) and he couldn´t have been more kidn to us. He looked pretty busy but still managed to find us seats together - thank you. Included in your ticket is a drink and snack, which were weren`t expecting so this was a little treat. All in all an excellent service which I would reccomend.

Expedition PeruRail. I enjoyed journey with PeruRail from Machu Picchu to Ollantaytambo. The nature views with mountain and landscapes were amazing and unforgettable. The service from PeruRail was fabulous! I would like to thank you to Wilbert Aparicio and Luis Alderio who provided me kindness and beautiful smiles! These guys truly made my trip full of joy and fun!

Clean and comfortable, but only a view on one side. By far the best way to end your trek to Machu Piccu, and a great way to get there for those who can't trek. My mother took the train both ways and it is very relaxing and fast.
Only way to go. Relaxing. Don't miss you train as seats are assigned and there is little leeway. Buy seats well in advance.

Clean and comfortable - Cusco to Aguas Calientes. We started our journey from Cusco and were told via several emails that we would travel via bus for the first part of the trip because of the rainy season. The bus station was within walking distance of our hotel so we walked and were greeted by a couple gentlemen directing people through a gate to the station. It was early morning, still dark out, but the station was well lit and the employees were very friendly. They checked our tickets and passports before we boarded and again after we boarded. The buses were clean and comfortable and they handed out bottled water during the ride. The bus ride to the train station was fine, the intermediate train station was okay. We had to wait a bit to board the train but once on board and en route to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) the journey went quickly. Service on the train was excellent, they serve drinks and a snack which is enough to call a meal IMO. Bathrooms in each car. Comfortable seating, and some of the best views of the region. Keep your camera out and ready! The station at our destination was very well kept, including the bathrooms. Make sure you make use of them before wandering out into the markets or going up Machu Picchu where you'll have to pay to use a clean restroom. Our journey back was just the reverse. You can purchase snacks and drinks at the station in A.C but they again served a large snack and drinks on the train. During our return, they played a folklore story on the intercom and one of the service employees came out in costume and danced. This was followed by a fashion show and an attempt to sell the merchandise. I enjoyed the dance but not the overpriced merchandise. They weren't pushy at all, I just don't think it's necessary.I would ride the Expedition with PeruRail again with no hesitation. Comfortable, great service, great views along the way.

Needs Improvement. We were in Cusco and arranged the PeruRail bio-modal transport which is a bus from Cusco to Pachar station and then train to Machu Picchu. We had heard that there was a strike pending so we visited the PeruRail office around 5pm to find out its potential effects on our travel plans for the next day and were told it would not affect us at all. At 7pm we received an email advising the bus portion of our trip was cancelled but if we could find our own way to any of the train stations (about 90 minutes normal travel) we could still avail of the train portion of our journey. Or we could just post-pone our visit by two days instead! Both PeruRail offices in Cusco were closed for the entire duration of the two-day strike. When we visited another of their offices we were just handed a leaflet and told to phone or email about our refund request. We did make it to Machu Picchu as planned, at considerable extra cost, but are still waiting for the refund.

Train to and from Machu Picchu. Amazingly efficient and clean. We were part of a group, and I found both the train and the train stations very comfortable and reliable. Watching the landscape change into a tropical mountain paradise was worth the trip alone.

Expedition Train. This was a relaxing, comfortable train ride from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. Service on the train was excellent and the train itself was comfortable with beautiful scenery the whole way. We paralleled the Inca Trail part of the way and could see the hikers on the trail.
Peru Rail not good compay. e when I take my seat on the train the ticket were down we had to duplicate the two passengers to rectify the service tiket very wrong with your system

Peru Rail Expedition service from Cusco to Machhu Pichuu. Great views through the ride. very helpful staff- Miguel Angel and Pablo Idona who told us when to get our cameras ready for spectacular shots.Due to the train not being full,they recommended other seats with better views!

Great service!. My friend and I missed our evening train from Aguas Calientes back to Ollantaytambo. We were frantic because we had a flight to catch early the next morning. Despite some language barriers, we were ably assisted by Mr Jose Lui in securing places on the next train available, which was supposed to be full. Apart from reassuring us that our travel plans would not be disrupted, Mr Lui and his staff also went the extra mile in seating my friend and I together. All in all, our experience has given us a very good impression of PeruRail, especially the kind staff at Aguas Calientes.

Memorable trip. The train is quite clean and neat. I had taken this train from Aguas Calientes to Poroy. The view is quite good. The servers were good and smiling. Snacks and Drinks were served onboard. One could buy wine or beer or souvenirs as well.

Very Good. it was an unforgetable trip. The train is very nice and clean. Mr Rogelio Accostupa and Mis Karina Choque, have grat customer service skills. Both were there for us, when ever we needed them. They made us feel special an welcome at all times.The reason I don't give you an excellent, it because my friend's and my sits weren't next to eachoter. We had to negociate with some passengers in order to sit towether. So do some other passengers too, went though the same problem.I'll still recomend you and would love to come back, one day.Thank youTupananchiskama!

Rail damage, bad seats, overpriced.. As the line had been washed-out/damaged at some point we were loaded on coaches in Cusco and driven to Ollantaytambo as we could no longer depart from Poroy - although no discount was offered.We were also told we could only take on 5kg of luggage and so left behind a lot of things we wanted to bring, yet when we got on board plenty of people had large suitcases they were placing up front. We ended up in the only seats on the carriage which faced backwards, straight into another couple. It was extremely uncomfortable as our knees were hitting the couple in front and we both had to sit slightly sideways.Hugely expensive journey for the amount of time spent travelling - next time I'll be avoiding PeruRail and taking one of the back ways into Macchu Picchu.

Travel the rail to the past!. As I stepped on the train to Machu Picchu in Peru, I did not know what to expect. The staff was friendly and smiling from start to finish. We started our travel from Poroy, Cusco. The views were magnificent. The mountains, forest, farming, villages and countryside were great views for my camera. We had a nice meal and great conversation with our other train mates. I would highly recommend Peru Rail for travel to Machu Picchu!

Pretty Good. I recently did a tour of Peru and travelled via train from Ollanta to Machu Picchu, and from Machu Picchu to Poroy.Train was on time with good customer service.Not very fast but good views via sky windows.Served a snack.Good journey in a clean and comfortable train.

10/07 Expedition Train: From Denver to Mapi. I was very surprised of how the train service has improved over the years. Took the train @ Ollantaytambo station, quick boarding, friendly crew, clean and confortable wagon. They served a light snack and had a great trip to Machupicchu. Please don't expect the Bullet Train, this is Peru! Aguas Calientes station was nice clean and luv the free storage service. Perurail even open it earlier for us, because we arrived before 9am. Thanks for that! Trip back to Ollanta, was very nice as well. Cold Inca Kola after hours walking @ MachuPicchu was perfect!. Keep it up PeruRail ! Una Peruana en USA ;)

Slow but scenic and comfortable. We took the Expedition train from Cusco to Machu Picchu (Aguas Calientes) Seats were large and comfortable (and were also reversible if you wanted to face the other way) The ride is slow- three and a half hours for 57 miles - but very scenic as you travel through the gorge and along the river. Service was good and friendly throughout and we were given drinks and snacks. There was the opportunity to buy souvenirs but no hard sell. The carriage roof has large glass panels for an all round vista.Overall a very comfortable ride.

Nothing to complain. The trip was enjoyable, nothing fancy but also nothing bad. The only noticeable difference with the vistadome is that you don't get a sandwich. But I didn't eat the sandwich anyway so for me no difference.It's still one of the most expensive train rides in the world...

PeruRail baseball cap. We took this journey in February this year and enjoyed the trip (but not so much the entertainment !!). My husband bought a PeruRail baseball cap on the train and has worn it almost non stop since then. However, he has now lost or mislaid it - HELP - can anyone tell me where to buy another one ?We spent 2 weeks touring Peru and it is a lovely country full of friendly people. Thank you Peru.J

World class. I took this journey with my new dashing wife and it was amazing. The greeting and service was first class and the food and drink was second to none. I highly recommend the Pisco sours and head to the rear of the train to get down with the colourful party vibes.Cant recommend this trip enough to anyone contemplating it. Added to my Peruvian experience in a big way.

Great Service. This trip was an enjoyable one because it was comfortable, the service was great and the scenery was beautiful. On my ride to Machu Picchu, I was greeted and tended to by Edison Quispe and Victor Miguel. Both of these gentlemen had warm smiles and were polite and courteous. On my way back Roly Alcca joined the group and boy did he have a lot of energy. He danced around and made the entire train laugh and join in on his clapping. I had a lot of fun and got some good pictures as well. My only complaint is that on the ride back, the same song was on repeat for three hours. I was not mad. My family and I made a joke of it and started singing and whistling along to it. We still know how it goes. All in all, we had a great experience and I would recommend Peru Rail to anyone going to Machu Picchu.

Good rail service with limited availability.. A good rail service that I took from Cusco to Machu Picchu where they offered a light meal both to and from the two locations. My biggest complaint is that the first train to leave from Machu Picchu to Cusco is a good 5 hours after the last train to arrive from Cusco to Machu Picchu.

Pretty decent. The Expedition is the cheaper tourist car on Perurail. It was included with our trek package we purchased, but I didn't see a need to upgrade. The seats were comfortable, but be aware that half of them are backwards (shared tables). This may be unsettling for some. Luggage space was only on racks at one end of the car...no space above your head or under the seats. The Expedition has large roof windows, but it was useless for the trip to MP since it was dark. Free snacks are provided, but aren't much. Some drinks and more snacks are available to purchase. Staff was very courteous.

Better than walking. There's not much to compare Perurail to in the area. The trains are comfortable, but don't have a huge amount of luggage room. Stations are very crowded with tourists and locals alike. Get there on time, listen for your train to be announced, and you'll be fine. Just be aware that the train currently does NOT start or end at Cusco!

Least expensive option is the best. The train is currently not running from Cusco, so we had to take a bus about half way (this is included in the train ticket). The least expensive Expedition train has comfortable seats, great views, and provides the passengers with snacks and drinks onboard. They also sell additional food to the complimentary snack box. There is no point in spending more unless one of the the other trains schedule suits you better.
comfortable and warm. comfortable and warm train, was the only place I was while in Cusco that had heat.... im typing more because trip advisor wont let me post with out 50 characters

What did I pay for?. It is very disappointing that I spent $150 round trip per person on this train. The only thing included is transportation, nothing more. The seats are acceptable, the views are spectacular but that’s no thanks to Perurail. The windows are scratched and dirty so you can forget trying to take pictures. The bathrooms are nasty, dirty, stink, and very small. The stops in between are not long enough to use the restrooms or buy food. The food they served on the train was terrible. The sad part: unless you’re going to take the bus you don’t have any other option.

slow trip. train was clean, comfortable seats, offer complimentary snacks. you can purchase merchandise but there is no pressure to buy. train component of trip to Machu Picchu is very slow but scenery is beautiful.

Take the Vistadome. We took the Vistadome to AC and took the Expedition back, as it fit better into our schedule. If it fits well into your schedule, I suggest paying the extra money for the VistaDome- although the views are exactly the same, the upgraded train car and service are worth the extra. I think there was a difference of only $12 when I used the service at the end of April.

fun, but short train ride. I got a chance to ride the Expedition from Ollantaytanbo to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu station).The train big windows filled the cart with lots of light and the opportunity to enjoy the scenic route.The train goes at a leisurely pace where one can enjoy traveling along the valley. The best side is on the left heading up. At first great views on both side, then the right side is just rock while the left side offers a great river view.The staff on the train are polite and service good.A small snack and drink is offered. They also offer books and music CD's.The only fault is due to train track condition if you are staying in Cusco you can't catch the train from there. Peru rail will bus you to the Pachar station. This results in 1.5 hours of your train ride on a bus instead of the train. I rode the Vistadome on the return trip and to me there was really no difference on the ride, food or service.

Expedition train. I have mixed feelings about this train ride. It is not very organized for boarding, everyone seems to be worried they will miss their train, and the luggage issues - also it is not a real comfortable train. But, the experience is worth it - although if you can afford one of the more expensive options, in this case I would say go for it. Also, the view, as ever in Peru, is outstanding.

Email about the tracks before deciding. We bought tickets to Machu Picchu. The ride was fine. It was beautiful and offered lovely views. The meal was similar to one you would receive on the airplane. Why I give it a poor review is this. They emailed us a week before we were to set off telling us in the raining season they take a bus half way and then we pick up the train.Buses are fine, but that is not what we paid for. I would simply recommend contacting the company so you know what you are getting into and maybe ask if there is a price difference?

Decent train, but poor operation & communication. The train service was adequate, but the operation & communication was extremely poor for the price paid. Our train from Ollantaytambo was supposed to leave at 7am, and only one of the three cars showed up. There was no announcement or any information available at the station, and only after waiting an hour with many confused passengers did we finally depart.When we didn't arrive in Aguas Calientes as scheduled, our guide called PeruRail & the company did not know about the change in schedule, causing further confusion for our trip. Luckily, all of the locals we discussed this with expect this from PeruRail, so they were able to adapt to the mess.Poroy train station outside Cusco was not accessible due to heavy rains, but the company did provide a seamless bus service back to Cusco, which helped make the return trip less frustrating.

beautyful vies. our vaction package included roundtrip from costco to machupichu.
trainride was great and all facilities met our expectations.
light snacks were provided and were good.(try almond tea)
staff was helpful.

Only Way to get to Machu Picchu. Our TA in Cusco booked the train for us. We could have done it on line ourselves.The stations were fine with seating, bathrooms and food for purchase.Seats on the train are comfortable. The snacks served are just as bad as those on the airlines.We picked up sandwiches for the trip back from MP (Aguas Caliente).The fashion show on the later in the day trip back was fun. Prices for the goods were high.My husband insisted I buy an Alpaca scrarf and it is very nice.

The most helpful staff we have ever met !!!!!!. Myself and four friends were traveling from Aquas Calientes to Cusco during one of the most intense rainy periods in the area. The river was extremely fierce and trains were being canceled and the town of Aquas Calientes (Machu Picchu) was evacuated. We managed to finally get on a train after a 6 hour wait in the station. Once on the train we met Geraldo, Aliceman, and Sandro who worked for Peru rail. They made sure we were taken care of and really helped calm our nerves about the raging river. The train could only stop at Pacha due to river conditions and we had no means of getting to Cusco. Sandro, Aliceman, and Geraldo not only got us a ride to Cusco, but Sandro personally walked us many blocks in the pouring rain to our Hostel, we were then sent to another location and Sandro again personally walked us to our final location. We have never experienced such extraordinary kindness before anywhere! I have traveled a lot and I have to say that Peruvians are The most sincere and empathetic people ive ever met. And these 3 new friends went above and beyond any employee duty for us.

Passable, but Vistadome is much better. Upgrade to the Vistadome. Better seats, some semblance of real food, and a MUCH smoother ride. This train was slow and rickety for the entirety of the 3+ hour trip. You still get the scenic windows, but it simply wasn't as comfortable. For the marginal increase in price, the Vistadome is a far better choice.

Rail great - office staff not!. After three days of deliberating which company to use for our trip to Machu Picchu we chose to book with PeruRail.We visited the office on the main square three times and each time were met by surky Yacquline (can't rememebr the exact spelling). Extremely rude and a poor example of a Perurail employee. Not only would she not make eye contact, she alughed with her colleague when we could not understand her Spanish though she was able to speak English. She gave us inaccurate information which cost us and was a bit of a joke amongst travellers we met along the way.On the other hand the staff on the train and at the station were nothing but courteous and helpful. We had dleays of hours both in and out but they remained pleasant and professional at all times.I would recommend using this comapny but book on ine rather than meet with the unpleasant girl in the office.

Amazing trip on the Vistasdome... My boyfriend and I took the Vistadome from Cusco to Aguas Calientes on Feb 3 2013. We took the 6am train there and the 3pm return on the same day. The only difference I could see from the Vistadome and Expedition is that Vistadome serves a small breakfast on the way and refreshments and snacks on the way back. It was a bout a 3 hr train ride each way and is very comfortable and clean. The views are beautiful… best part of the trip. The service team “Gerardo, Kateren and Sandro” were very polite, attentive and provided excellent service and attention. On the way they performed a mini fashion show and other entertainment (which travelers are made part of). Very fun and funny!! The only downfall was our return trip where we were stuck about 1.5hr because the rain caused a landslide. The team kept us informed as to the progress in clearing it up and provided us with more refreshments and snacks. This is definitely the best way to travel to Machu Picchu.

Has panoramic windows, comfort, relatevely cheaper than others, four passenger seats. There are three types of train from Cusco - Ollantaytambo - Macchu Picchu (Aguas Caliente); Expedition, Vistadome, Hiram Bingham. Expedition is more economical that two trains. If you don't reserve trian ticket well in advance, you don't have chocie. you have to buy whatever available ticket. We bought ticket at Ollantaytambo one day advance, almost ticket were sold on off season of January. The train has panoramic windows and snack, refreshment is provided during the journey

A little pricey, but the staff was kind and helpful and the sights are unreal.. Probably one of the most scenic train rides I have ever been on less the Tiego del Fuego train ride in Ushuaia, Argentina.I stayed a week in Peru and a couple days in Aguas Calientes near Machu Picchu. I jumped on the Peru Rail from Ollantayambo to Aguas Calientes. It cost $117 round trip and I left Tuesday at 1:30p and returned Friday at 4:30p. By the way the later you travel the cheaper it is, I gues because you can't see anything at night.Other than the cost being a little high, everything else was pleasant. There aren't any outlets on the train for the passengers and my iPhone 5 was at 3%, one of the attendants plugged it in the back without even thinking twice. Very nice gesture as I was full before I got to Aguas. The train looked newer and clean running on gasoline. The weather was perfect at 64 degrees and a little rain. The scenery was lush green mountains and a river of brown water from the rain from Cusco which played a beautiful ambience for the ride.They served a snack which was soda or water with a cinnamon roll and a tiny ham and cheese sandwich that was good.They tried to sell you some shirts, hats, photos, and maps but weren't to persistent when you said no thank you. Didn't bother me, others might call this a tourist trap. All in all very decent. If they had this train rhnning on solar power, free wifi on board, outlets for customers and a little cheaper they would have got a top rating in all categories. My photos should give you a better idea of the ride. Enjoy! Safe travels!

Excellent transportation option for getting to Aguas Calientes. PeruRail is very convenient and easy to use. I recommend purchasing the tickets online, then picking them up at the Peru Rail office located in the Lima airport when you land. If you are flying straight to Cusco via Lima you can still do this as the Peru Rail office is located right near the domestic gates.As far as the type of trains to take, we took the Expedition there and Autovagon back - it mostly depends on your timing needs but we personally found no significant difference between the trains. It's short ride and extra expense doesn't seem worth it for the Vistadome. The snacks they give are quite tasty.

Clean and adequate. We took the Expedition to go to Aguas Calientes and the Hiram Bingham back. WE were pleasantly suprised! The view from the train is remarkable no matter which train you take - it is clean and bright with big windows. No fancy food - but we had just had breakfast at the hotel so we didn't need that. This is the cheapest option -- and just fine for the ride out to MP.

No complaints. We took the Vistadome to AC and the Expedition back to Cuzco. If you're on a budget don't worry that you are going to miss out, the view is the same on either train.For some reason on trains in Peru even if you book together your tickets are not beside each other, for us it was ok as the people beside us all did a switch around and everyone was happy. Something for Peru Rail to note with their booking system. This is a good service, you get soft drinks and snacks included.

Good service. I travelled to Machu Picchu on the expedition and came back on the vistadome. The only real difference is the vistadome has leather seats and a little more leg room.If your on a budget, then you can't go wrong with the expedition class. It was comfy, spacious (I'm 6ft) and the onboard service was good.The best thing about the journey were the views.

Worthless customer service. After seeing machu picchu, we returned to aguas caliente. Our guide booked us tickets to return to cusco, but made them for 930pm, leaving us 8 hrs to kill. We went to the train terminal to see if we could get on an earlier train. While in line, a man behind me asked if I was trying to change my reservation. When I confirmed, he said good luck, he had tried earlier and they wouldn't let him. Not only that, they told him they didn't have any space on another train. He went back to his hotel, went online and easily bought 2 tickets to the train he wanted. Now he has 4 tickets, 2 for a train that he is not going on and they will not refund him.  After my pointless attempt to change my train, we noticed the tickets that the man werent using, were for a train that we could use. We both go to the ticket counter and explain that he is not using his tickets, there will be 2 empty available seats, and we would like to exchange. No dice. The workers are worthless. They can't make any changes within 24 hrs of the departure. They just get their money and have no customer service, making people make double purchases and leaving open, paid for, seats.

We liked PeruRail. We took PeruRail from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo. We took Inca Rail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. On both you are not allowed to bring luggage. Only an overnight bag that has to weigh less than 11 lbs. We took the Vistadome train. On board they served a snack, I think it was a small serving of pasta salad and corn bread with a small drink, and had a small fashion show. They cranked up the music, the type of flute mucic we heard in many places in Peru, and had somebody dressed in some kind of costume that maybe was an Incan medicine man or something. They had a couple of crew members model alpaca clothing and offered them for sale. We did not get this on the Inca Rail train. This did make the time go by faster but I certainly would not make my decision to take PeruRail just to see this show. In my opinion the scenery was nice but not fantastic but you have no choice if you want to get to Machu Picchu without hiking the Inca Trail. I would give a slight edge to PeruRail over Inca Rail but it is so small that I would probably go with the train that I could save the most money on these overpriced rides.

NO BIG SUITCASES! Booking problems. Altitude strategies.. Based on my recent trip to Peru, I have divided my comments and thoughts about Perurail into various topics below. I hope this is helpful!LUGGAGE:At some point, I’m sure I was told that we wouldn’t be able to bring our big suitcases on the train to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu). Unfortunately, I had forgotten that little detail, and we had to scramble at the last-minute to repack our luggage and move clothes and gear for 2 days into our day-packs. We booked an evening train, and during the day we had a private guide taking us around the Sacred Valley. He dropped us off at the train station in the evening, and that’s when he told us we couldn’t take the big suitcases. He said that after dropping us off at the train, he was going to take our big suitcases to the hotel in Cusco where we would be going in a couple days. That worked out fine, and a couple of days later when we eventually got to Cusco, our luggage was there, as planned. I’m not sure what you are supposed to do if you don’t have someone to take your luggage for you. Anyway, it was a big pain and caused us some last-minute stress, but it all worked out. Interestingly, I met several other people who also “didn’t get the memo”, and had to scramble at the last minute. (And see the end of this review for a funny story.)So, my obvious recommendation is to plan ahead, and gracefully solve your luggage problem before the last minute!! DON’T FORGET: The trains just have a couple little shelves that will hold everyone’s little day-packs. There’s no room for big suitcases.BUYING TICKETS:Another challenge we faced was making the reservation and buying the tickets. The Peru Rail website looks easy, but it’s not! The site isn’t set up very well, and it doesn’t work very well. It also requires information like passport numbers, which usually aren’t handy. The worst part is that I would finally get all the way through this very long process of entering all the information, and on the final screen my credit card would not be accepted! AAAAHHHRRRGGG!!! I was pulling my hair out.I tried several cards. I believe the official explanation is that they only accept cards with “Verified by Visa” or “Mastercard SecureCode”. However, I couldn’t make any of my cards work, including one that were a “Verified by Visa” card. (Later I heard other people had the same problem.)This was a HUGE pain, and I spent a ton of time screwing around with that website, trying to make it work. At one point, it wasn’t clear to me whether or not my transaction had gone through, which was even worse, since I didn’t want to end up buying two sets of tickets accidentally! Finally, my wife actually called them up on the phone, and she was able to get it done. She speaks Spanish, so this was a reasonable approach, except for the high cost of the long international call.In hindsight, I should have just let our tour company book the train tickets. I figured I would save a few bucks by doing it myself, but in this case that was a big mistake!! For this vacation, I booked some things myself, but I used the Peru For Less tour company to book other things which would be harder for me to do (e.g. private tours). In general, I liked doing some of the bookings myself, and that probably saved me a little money. However, I should have let the tour company book the Peru Rail tickets. Trying to book it myself was a nightmare! The tour company offered to book the train for me, but I foolishly declined. Live and learn.Booking the train through a tour company has the added advantage that they should help you deal with your extra luggage (e.g. take it to your future hotel for storage). We got lucky in the sense that even though the tour company didn’t book the train tickets, we did have them drop us off at the train station after taking us on a private all-day tour around the Sacred Valley. So, the tour company was involved with getting us to the train station, and they helped us handle the luggage issue. I don’t know what we would have done if we had gotten to the train station on our own.Anyway, use a tour company to book your Peru Rail tickets! We used Peru For Less for quite a few things on our trip, and we were always very happy with their service, guides, and arrangements. I can definitely recommend Peru For Less because I had such a good experience with them, but I’m sure there are countless other good tour companies, too.PICKING THE TRAIN:The only way to get to Aguas Calientes (the town by Machu Picchu) is by train, so in that sense you don’t have a choice. However, you do have a choice with respect to which train you take. There are cheaper options like the Expedition, more expensive options like the Vistadome, and insanely expensive options like the Hiram Bingam. There are also different package options which include various things like meals. The Hiram Bingam package not only includes meals, but also the Machu Picchu tickets, guides, and entertainment. I believe that option is for people who just want to go to Aguas Calientes and Machu Picchu for the day, and don’t want to worry about any arrangements. Personally, that seems like a waste of money because it’s really expensive. Also, I think try to do Machu Picchu as a day trip from the Sacred Valley would be too rushed.Another option that I can’t recommend is to get a package that includes a buffet lunch at the Sanctuary lodge. We had the buffet lunch at the Sanctuary Lodge (although not part of a train package), and in our opinion it was not worth the cost. The food was not that good, and it’s pretty expensive. There are snack-bar options nearby which would have been just fine, and would certainly have been a better value.In our case, we picked the cheapest Expedition train, primarily because of the schedule. The seats were comfortable, and the ride was fine. I’m not sure it would have been worth more money for a “nicer” train. The ride was bumpy at times, so it’s possible that a different train might have had a smoother ride, but I don’t know. And I’m not sure I would have paid more for a smoother ride anyway. Both the ride and the view on the Expedition were fine.If you can select your seats, consider that most of the time the tracks follow the river, which is on the left side going to Aguas Calientes, and the right side coming back. Our train was configured with groups of 4 seats around a table, so half the people were riding backwards, which is another consideration.ITINERARY:We did this:Tuesday day: Sacred Valley tourTuesday evening: Train to Aguas CalientesWednesday day: Sunrise at Machu Picchu, and all day exploring the ruinsWednesday evening: hot springs and nice dinner in Aguas CalientesThursday morning: Train back to Sacred ValleyWe wanted to go to Aguas Calientes in the evening, so we could do Machu Picchu at sunrise. That worked out great, and I would recommend this approach. The ruins get more and more crowded during the day, and by afternoon there were hundreds of people everywhere. The first hours of the morning were the best.So, we went to Aguas Calientes on Tuesday evening, did the ruins first thing Wednesday morning with our Peru For Less guide, and stayed at the ruins most of the day. Then we spent Wednesday night in Aguas Calientes, and took the train back mid-morning on Thursday. This worked out perfectly for us. It was nice to have the entire day to enjoy the ruins without doing any traveling on that same day, and we went to the hot springs and had a nice dinner Wednesday evening after the long day hiking around the ruins.Note that taking the train to Aguas Calientes in the evening meant that it was dark. That turned out to be fine. We got to see the sights on the way back. ALTITUDE CONSIDERATIONS:This is one aspect of our trip that I would have done differently. We flew from Lima to Cusco, and then immediately went down to Urubamba, which is much lower that Cusco. (It’s better to go up in altitude gradually over several days.) However, Urubamba is still very high compared to Lima, so we were a little bothered by the altitude.I had the right idea by immediately heading lower from Cusco, but I didn’t realize when I was planning the trip that Aguas Calientes and Machu Picchu are actually lower than Urubamba. It would have been better to go directly to Aguas Calientes, and do the Sacred Valley sights after Machu Picchu.Here’s what I wish we had done:Monday morning: fly to CuscoMonday afternoon: train from Cusco to Aguas CalientesTuesday: Machu PicchuWednesday: train to Ollantaytambo, and begin Sacred Valley sightseeingAfter touring Sacred Valley, continue to Cusco (higher) and then Puno/Lake Titicaca (highest).This itinerary has the added advantage that you get to take the train down from Cusco into the Sacred Valley, which is supposed to be a very scenic trip with switchbacks, etc.When you are looking at train schedules, keep in mind that the Cusco train station is called Poroy. I read somewhere that it is about a half hour taxi ride from the Cusco airport, but I would allow plenty of time in case of flight delay or traffic.When you arrive in Ollantaytambo, there is a nice little pizza place on the right immediately after you exit the train station gate. This is a tasty and efficient option. Also, if you are going to the Ollantaytambo ruins, they are pretty close to the train station. It would be a reasonable walk.In the Sacred Valley, I would highly recommend the Maras salt ponds, Awana Kancha Llama/Alpaca farm, and the Pisac market. The Pisac market was the best shopping we found on our whole trip. Allow half a day, at least. Feel free to skip the Pisac ruins if you are tight on time. After Machu Picchu, they might be very unremarkable.DON’T FORGET:As I said before, you need to pack a small day-pack or overnight bag for your train trip to Aguas Calientes. We had to scramble at the last minute to re-pack our luggage and extract what we thought we would need. In our haste, we successfully got most of what we needed, but we missed a few things. We remembered all the clothes, hiking gear, hats, sunscreen, cameras, toiletries, tickets/passports/etc. However, we forgot our bathing suits for the hot springs, and mosquito repellant. (Yes, there were some mosquitos at Machu Picchu.)FUNNY STORY:We were chatting with other travelers about the fact that you can’t take your big luggage on the train, and a guy named Brian told us his funny story. Brian was with a large tour group that was traveling around for many days by bus with a guide. All the arrangements were part of the tour, so he didn’t worry about the details. The night before they caught the train to Aguas Calientes, they stayed in a hotel in Ollantaytambo. Brian remembered the guide telling them something about leaving their luggage at the hotel the following morning when they took the train, but he didn’t really hear all the detailed instructions. So, the next morning, he left all his luggage in his room, grabbed his camera and headed out the door for a nice day trip to Machu Picchu. As it turned out, he had missed the part of the instructions about packing an overnight bag for the overnight trip to Aguas Calientes. Not a day trip! Oops! So, here he was spending the night in Aguas Calientes, and literally all he brought with him was his camera. No change of clothes, no pajamas, and no toothbrush. I felt bad for him, but he was laughing about it. At least it made a good story to talk about later!

PeruRail Expedition - nice service at the lowest fare category. Our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teens) used the Expedition from Ollantaytambo and then from Aquas Calientes back. On time service and courteous personnel. Seats were clean and comfortable and freshments (coffee, tea, soda, water, a small snack like chocolate/candy and small package of dried beans/nuts of some sort) were served. Readng that this was once referred to as the backpacker class, we were concerned about the comfort level especially travelig during the high season and were thinking of going on a different class. We were glad we didn't spend the money as the Expedition was plenty comfortable for us. Seat assigments were somewhat random, but it worked out ok as most folks are willing to switch seats so you and your travel companions may sit together.

Nice Service on PeruRail Expedition. Our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teens) used the Expedition from Ollantaytambo and then from Aquas Calientes back. On time service and courteous personnel. Seats were clean and comfortable and freshments (coffee, tea, soda, water, a small snack like chocolate/candy and small package of dried beans/nuts of some sort) were served. Readng that this was once referred to as the backpacker class, we were concerned about the comfort level especially travelig during the high season and were thinking of going on a different class. We glad we didn't spend the money as the Expedition was plenty comfortable for us. Seat assigments were somewhat random, but it worked out ok as most folks are willing to switch seats so you and your travel companions may sit together.

One of my favorite Train Rides.. My friends though it a bit silly but I absolutely LOVED this train ride from Valle Sacrado to Aguas Calientes! The return trip, however, is what put it over the top. The train attendants clearly loved their jobs, sold the heck out of goods to us after their "fashion show" and they even allowed me up front to film parts of the trains movement with the majesty of the snow capped peaks ahead. Being the end of a long trip most of my friends napped and I simply could not take my eyes off the scenery. Do yourself the favor and take this trip.Yes you can spend more and take the Hiram Bingham. We were already fairly well wined and dined throughout our trip and this was not a necessary expense so the price of the Vistadome was fine.Note the return trip was longer due to the sales pitch which as I mentioned I thoroughly enjoyed.

Vistadome trip was great. We really enjoyed the 2 hour trip from Ollyantambo to Agua Calientes. The views are great and Peru Rail provides a light lunch (included). The train was clean and the service was excellent. On the way back, the staff even provided some entertainment with a "dancer" and a fashion show of products that they sell on the train. They were right on time both trips.

Expedition service to Aguas Calientes. Perurail has different levels of service. We took an Expedition train from Ollaytantambo to Aguas Calientes and had an enjoyable trip. Windows are everywhere including overhead so you get a nice view of the changing forest growth and the river. The trip to Aguas Calientes was great but our evening trip back to Ollaytantambo was somewhat chaotic. It was raining when we arrived at the station and there was a crazy stampede of passengers running for the buses that would carry us back to Cusco. Perurail's buses got us back to Cusco but some folks were separated from their parties in the rush. I really enjoy train travel and this is a special experience that can't found anywhere else.

Peru rail Vistadome to/from Machu Picchu. It was very easy to buy tickets on-line. When we contacted Peru rail re extra baggage, they answered promptly and gave us the go-ahead with very clear instructions. Buying the tickets at the ticket laes office at Aguas Calientes/Machu Picchu for the return journey was simple except if you choose early evening when there is a long queue. The train is ideal for seeing the countryside and for feasting one's eyes on the fantastic views/mountains. The music is ideal for such a journey;the staff have excellent customer service and the snacks are not bad. The seats are very comfortable and the journey ends all too soon. I have nothing but praise for Vistadome and I would invite future travellers to Machu Picchu to choose this train. It has everything going for it except the price which I found a bit steep. Otherwise Bravo Vistadome, Keep it up!!

Excellent experience. Beautiful smooth journey in style, with top quality food, service and facilities. We were surprised and delighted by the fashion show and commend our team: Manuel, Daniel, Mary Corman and Saul.

Pleasant Ride on the Vistadome!. We took the Vistadome from the Scared Valley to Aguas Caliente. The train was lovely with beautiful vistas along the river. We have recently lived in Switzerland. We did not find the train expensive comparatively. The two hour ride provided great views and service. The staff was very attentive and ready to serve their customers their passion and care (our staff members included Angel, Janet and Jose).Thank you for the wonderful ride!

A wonderful experience!. Booked in advance for this wonderful 10 hour train trip from Machu Picchu to Puno. Excellent comfort and the feeling of a quality trip. Passing through amazing countryside and, yet, passing close to the locals carry out their trading in such poor circumstances which left with the thought of how lucky we are in our own country.Food was really nice, and well presented.It was great being able to go to the rear of the train to take photos and be educated how to make pisco sours!
Overpriced . Train is greatly overpriced. Still some 68 usd even when it is dark out. Supposedly the most expensive train per km in the world

Beautiful train. We took the train from Poroy to Aguas Caliente and back. Great view on the way to Aguas Caliente and perfect service both ways. We were lucky to get front facing seats both ways. Got served a small breakfast with coffee and tea option on the way there and a slice of pizza on the way back. On the way back the staff had a fashion show with some clothes you could buy after. Train was clean and had comfortable seats also was on time both ways. Bying the tickets online was no problem and I picked them up at Cusco airport where Perurail has a counter in the arrival hall. Perfect thing to do when waiting for luggage to come on the belt. If you choose not to pick your ticket up at the airport there are other options availeble, all easy to find. Tickets are not cheap but I guess they are worth it. We would choose Perurail again and recommend you try if you are visiting MachuPicchu and dont want to walk the Inkatrail.

Fantastic but a bit slow. Lovely comfortable train. Lovely food and very pleasant staff onboard. It just took forever to get from Poroy to Aguas Calientes stations! If you are planning this trip to Machu Picchu in one day, ensure you book one of the earlier trains to go and later trains back otherwise you won't have time to enjoyband explore Machu Picchu fully.
Such a relaxed travel mode. A great way to travel, very comfortable and relaxing ... and the views through the Andes- amazing!!!

On Our Way to Machu Picchu. Nice way to travel to MP. Beware that some seats face the rear of the train. Was able to sleep on the train on the way to MP. Food was not good. Eat before you board. There was a loud fashion show on the way back from MP that I could have done without. On a positive note, they sell items you might need at MP on the train. I bought a hat to keep off the sun.

On our way to Machu Picchu. The waiting room was very clean with a shop selling drinks etc. The toilets were spotless. The journey was pleasant with great views over the countryside. Good snacks were served on board. The train was busy, full of excited tourists. A very good way to travel. The locals tried to sell flowers along the way!

Excellent service we received at Peru Rail Vistadome. Very satisfied with the service provided by Peru Rail Vistadome round trip from Cuzco to Machu Picchu last week. Nestor, Zuleimy, Julio and Alan have been excellent hosts. On return trip, there was derailment of an Inca Rail (another train service) and we were delayed by 3+ hours and we could see that they did their best to make us feel better including serving us hot drinks and informing us periodically.
Machu Picchu trip. We had a great experience with PeruRail, the staff was very professional and helpful. The train exceeded our expectations

Great views. This train to Machu Picchu offers paniramic views, however it is a long trip and if you´re planning on taking a nap on the way after waking up super early to get to the station, your plan might not result the way you expect as the glass roof doesn´t provide any protection for the sun. Also, the train lacks of air conditioning. The service was great from the attendants but they should work on the way they communicate with their passengers at the station. Just like everything else in Peru, bureaucracy rules. Definitely the views were the best part.
Great train. Beautiful train and ride. Only complaint is the entertainment, I feel it detracts from the experience but perhaps others enjoy it.

Horrible communication to passengers. The staff on the train are lovely, very gracious and focused on customer service. The snacks were nice and a great view with the large windows. However, while we were waiting for our return ride home, we found out that two Peru Rail trains had a collision with a few injuries that required medical attention. The problem is that we were sitting in the train station for over four hours with no idea if the trains would run that day. There is no communication except for an announcement that says "we're working on this and will get back to you". We finally arrived in Poroy at 2 am in the morning, raining, with a shortage of taxis. I highly recommend that you do not plan any travel arrangements immediately after a train ride and make sure that you have a taxi waiting for you in Poroy.

Avery entertaining train ride!!. This was most certainly a train ride to be remembered! The staff was so friendly, warm with lots of smiles and so kind. They gave us drinks and sandwiches or a desert...it depended on the time of day! But the most delightful part of the return from Machu Pichu was the fashion show. A complete surprise and afterwards you could buy the items which they had in a variety of sizes. And the quality was very very nice!!! I can highly recommend the Vistadome and staff, especially Indira, Jeseth, Juset and Carima.....they were so lovely!!!

Love the Train Experience - Perurail is Outstanding. Going my train with Perurail is always a pleasant experience. My second Perurail train was excellent. The service and food is outstanding. It's a great way to see the countryside of Peru

See the Andes from Top to Bottom. We travbeled down the Sacred Valley from our hotel to Machu Picchu by PeruRail Vistadome. It was wonderful. When you return, there is even a fashion show. But, during daylight hours the scenes are magnificent with peaks at 21,000 feet, a roaring river, and hikers along the Inca Trail.
Peru Rail Dome train was great!. The views are a wonder from the train, especially if you get seats 1 and 2 looking right out at the tracks and front window. The snack was good, too.
Beautiful train. Vistadome trains are comfortable and the views you see are espectacular! It's worth paying a little more for this train.

Fun trip to Machu Pichu. We took the vista dome train both ways to and from Aguas calientes Peru on way to Machu Pichu. The trip was very nice. There train had wide windows with good views. There was good cultural dance and programs performed by the train host Floor karen and Dennis did a wonderful job. We did buy alpaca clothing on the train. It was of good quality.
Service. We took PeruRail at AguasCalientes to Ollantaytambo on Thursday October 27/16 at 6:20pm and we got an excellent service by Vanessa, very sweet, and friendly.Grace GomezCharlotte, NC

Little expensive but still amazing. You can't go to Macchu Pichu and lose the opportunity to catch this train. As I mentioned in to the title the price is a bit high (around 60$) for a relative short trip but I have to give 5 stars as well since the experience is absolutely worthy.

Big racist rip off. The train is actually quite nice, clean and well made.However, since racism is spelled in all capital letters by them, I go for absolute minimum points. Peruvian tourists pay a maximum of 10 soles, so about 3$ for the ride.But they are not allowed in the regular section. They are being herded like cattle in their section. Other tourists have to pay at least 50$ to take the train but are not allowed to take the cheaper option, even if they want. So almost 2000% price increase for foreigners.Big fat no go from me

Don't think Twice Suck it up and pay!. By far the best experience ever! Vistadone PeruRail staff for our trip was Lisbeth Fredy and Uriel they where phenomenal! Very polite and attentive on bringing us a great service!This train might be a bit more expensive than the other lines but it is totaly worth it! The views are amazing you will not regret it! The do a show and also serve food and drinks which are very good as well!Highly recommend it!

Great Trip. Seats have plenty of room. Most face each other, a few rows with only a table. Great views, although I really don't think you need the vista part. Big seats though. Train was always on time. Food was bad, but wasn't expecting any. Room for airline roll on at end of each car.

Beautiful train ride. I do wish the trains started in Cusco and not rely on tourists to get taxis up the hill to Poro. However it's all worth it as the scenery is spectacular. Peru rail are well organised with great staff. The vistadome you get more to eat than if you travel on the expedition but the food you get doesn't warrant the price difference. We travelled to Machu Picchu on the expedition and returned in the vistadome both services were impressive.

awesome. Had a great trip on the vistadome train ride to Machu Picchu. Service was first rate, nice snacks and very friendly. Loved the return trip with the fashion show and music was great. Beautiful views. Highly recommended

Abusive, prohibited and without the service attached. the most expensive train in the world, without the whole service it would be provided (no coffee or tea as it was shown on the menu), food in few quantity, even a little bird would be hungry after the meal; the whole service for 125 euros for 42 kms !!!Scandalous !!!!!!!!!!

Open aired high visible train carriage option. 10 hrs on a train made amazingly bearable snd even enjoyable by the diversity of scenery visible from the gloating Island reed beds of Puno to higher Andes Mountains, busy market towns and vast scenery you pass through on the Peru Rail journey. The ultimate car is open to the elements at the back end has large windows in the sides and curve of the roof giving a great view of the big scenery that you pass through. There's a bar for drinks ^snacks out ode of the 3 course commentary l7nch and afternoon tea served at your table & plenty of space to stand, sit & socialise or just look at what is unfolding before you. What a great way to really see what this fabulous country had to offer - gave you picked up my Peru bias?? Have taken 7.5hr road journey Puno to Cusco but not a patch on this....

Chose the Vistadome over the Explorer and am glad i did.. We travelled from Cusco to Machu Picchu on Peru Rail Vistadome and we had a great experience. The staff: Nestor, Deisy, Renee, and Zara were very attentive and friendly. The train was too packed and goes at a gradual space with great views. The train ride is about two hours.

Magical Train Experience.. Our Group took the Vistadome in both directions to do our 1 day hike to Machu Picchu. Our Vistadome Experience was AWESOME. Our ride up was early. The staff on board greeted us warmly, served yummy bites and made us feel right at home. Much needed before our hike as we did not completely know what to expect. Our return on the Vistadome was an even better experience. Angel, Mori Carmen, and Marco served us yummy treats and were very friendly. They then performed a fashion show for us. Very cool Alpaca Clothing to view and purchase if desired. They were fun and enjoyed giving the show. The clothing was so soft and very trendy. I ended up buying a sweater Angel had on. It was a great experience. Purchasing the sweater was effortless and quick. All of the staff on the train was exceptional. I have to give a shoutout to Angel. Great personality, great service, and fun to be around. He is a true asset to Vistadome. Thanks for a super experience.

a great way to get closer to Machu Picchu. The PeruRail train from Ollntaytambo to Aguas Calientes was very scenic and a great way to travel. It took just over 1 1/2 hours for the trip. Mountains on one side, jungle on the other. Staff were friendly, we got snacks and drinks, more could be purchased.
Wonderful way to travel to Machu Picchu. The on-board team were very friendly and polite. The journey went smoothly. It was a very elegant and luxurious experience.

Perurail vistadome experience. Excellent experience which added to enhance our trip to Machupicchu. Staff and service was very good, no delays were experienced. Beautiful train ride through the Andes.
Awesome views spectacular shows. The view was awesome, the drinks better than I expected, the service was fantastic the shows were wonderful

Way too expensive and NOT Peruvian . We took this company because we didn't really have a choice as only 2 go to Aguas Calientes from Ollantaytambo. The prices are so stupidly high and we were so disappointed to find out that the companies a British and not Peruvian, therefore the profit they make on all the tourists back don't even go to the locals! But what can you do, it still is the most practical and fastest way to get to Aguas. Wish they just wouldn't take advantage of tourists like that. Also wish they would clean the windows regularly so you could actually enjoy the so-called panoramic views through their windows!!
We enjoyed the ride . We travelled from Cusco to Machu Pichu return. Great views, beverages and snack offered we had entertainment as well.

Fantastic scenery. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes on our way to Machu Picchu and the train was very comfortable and the views fantastic. We were served drinks and a snack and there were toilets on the train (although I don't know what they were like as I did not use them). The toilets in the waiting room were OK.

Very Scenic Trip, Friendly Staff. Please keep in mind that they have "trains for tourist and trains for locals." Of course the tourist trains are a bit more comfortable, with food and beverage service and higher level of service, but the cost is significantly higher. Overall, we had a very favorable experience traveling from Cusco To Machu Picchu on the train. A very scenic ride. Please note that the sun comes through the roof and can get a bit warm, so you should take a hat or visor. The staff is very friendly. Keep in mind that you can book on line and probably get a better rate than at the ticket booth. Also note that trains get totally sold out so it is advisable to book in advance.

A great way to travel. My husband and I chose the VistaDome train over the standard train for our ride from Cusco to Aquas Clients. The Vistadome is more spacious than the regular train, offers a light snack, and even mini performances along the way. It is an excellent way to see country side and other parts of the Inca trail. I would definitely recommend giving it a shot.

Amazing Experience. Clean, Accurate timing, Helpful team, Safe, Very nice live show in the train, Just amazing train Our trip was from Aguas to Cusco in the evening, We have nice dinner, The strip was very soft and relaxing

Awesome trip!. A few days me and my partner took the train from Ollanta to Machu Picchu. It has been always a dream of us visiting this historic place. The trip especially in this train was amazing with wonderful views out of the large windows. The staff was friendly and professional. Especially Smick took care of us and the other passengers very well!!! I could say that he anticipated someone's 'every' wish. If we take this train again in future we would be happy to have Smick again in your service team who will take care of us. Great!

Beautiful Vistas with great Entertainment. I took the Perurail from Aguas Calientes to Machu Picchu and the windows on the train are very large and dome-shaped, great for taking panoramas. The food was enjoyable and the entertainment was a nice surprise for such a short train ride. The seats were very comfortable and there was one shared table for every 4 passengers. Rumor was that you could only take a bag with you that weighed a maximum of 7 kg but that was not true. They did not weigh any bags but it is better to take a bag the size of a small rolling luggage bag or smaller. I would enjoy taking the Perurail again!

The best way to travel to Machu Picchu!. Yes - this is one of the most expensive train journeys in the world on a 'per-mile' basis, but the demand is there and they supply it. However, they have really worked hard to make the whole experience a pleasurable one. Firstly, the online booking system is very user friendly and well designed so it won't be a hassle or ordeal booking your journey(s).I travelled from Ollantaytambo (90 soles by taxi from Cusco, or around 15 soles by colectivo). They have managed to capture that mood of train travel from the classic days. The seats are large with plenty of legroom. Drinks and a snack (a quinoa and pastry dish) were served by very friendly crew, and bottles of Cusquena beer are available for 10 soles each. The journey was 90 minutes along the Urubamba River on a single track for most of the route.I was lucky enough to have seat number 1, which was right at the very front of the first carriage (adjacent to the drivers compartment) so the view couldn't be better.But yes - it is a very expensive train journey. But apart from the Inca Trail, it's the only way you'll get to that coveted Inca city!
Great experence. The Vistadome journey from Poroy Station to Machu Picchu was spectacular as was the service. Arrived at Aguas Calientes relaxed ready to explore Machu Picchu the following day.

Awesome Staff. I would strongly recommend taking the vistadome on PeruRail to and from Aguas Calientes. Last week my girlfriend and I were traveling through the Sacred Valley for a few days with our final stop being Ollantaytambo before heading to Aguas Calientes via rail. Even though we ran into a few issues, the staff smoothed things over and ensured a pleasurable experience. We arrived at the Ollantaytambo station early in the morning with the intention of dropping off our luggages prior to a day of touring the local ruins. When we arrived to "check" our bags for the train we were informed of the weight limitations (11lbs per person) and were forced to consolidate bags. Essentially you cannot take large luggages on the train to Aguas Calientes-- make sure you are prepared for this. To make matters worse, the attendant was extremely confused on what to do since we didn't fill out the required forms or make prior arrangements. After a 20 minute exchange in 1st grade-level spanish we mutually agreed to leave one of the bags (mine of course and not my girlfriends) at the Ollantaytambo station and that during the 5 minute stop off on the way back from AC to Poroy, I would jump off the train, find the right person, retrieve my bag and make it safely back onto the Poroy-bound train. Easy, right? I was even more excited to learn that this is something completely unconventional which required supervisor approval and a bunch back and forth radio conversations which I could not translate for the life of me.As you can imagine I was a tiny bit nervous on the return train thinking about the five minute stop-over and the uncertainty that my bag was even there at the station. With it being pitch black outside I felt even more confident... Thankfully we had an AWESOME train crew who offered to make the right calls, confirm the pickup, successfully locate the bag, and bring it into our cabin. Nestor, Alan and Maritza were extremely helpful and made it a seamless experience.Aside from securing my bag they also went above and beyond in making the return trip a memorable one. What were just a standard food/beverage serving and clothing/gift sale on the first train turned into an all-out party on the return trip. Our train aisle became the center of fun with music, dancing, costumes and a fashion show. Sounds crazy, but this is exactly what it was. The staff made it a very enjoyable time as we cruised toward Poroy. I would highly recommend the vistadome on PeruRail if you decide to travel via rail. The staff made it a fantastic trip and saved my luggage from what could have been a completely failed rendezvous.

expensive but worth it. We took the Vistadome for our return trip from Aguas Callientes to Cusco. The train was very comfortable and clean. We were served a lovely snack and there was entertainment including a fashion show. The windows allowed for great viewing.
Coming home from the climb. . Clean friendly clear English speaking people. The train station was clearly marked for our section. The snacks were good and the Windows in the train were large.

Excellent Service & Beautiful Views. Great train ride with exceptional views! My husband fell ill on the trip ride home from Machu Picchu and we received excellent service from Samuel Alegria who showed a great level of care, attention, and concern for my husband! He recovered the next day but we'll always remember the service Samuel gave us ! :) Thank you! We can't wait to come back!

very nice train ride - but entertainment overdone. the scenery along the urabamba river and the sacred valley is very pretty, and the train is very nice, so it's a nice ride. however, we could have done without the entertainment (fashion shows, sales pitches, local dances, etc) - let the scenery work for itself

Great views on the way to Machu Picchu. Took the train from ollanta to ag calientes and then back to Cusco in the evening. Seeing the other trains this is the way to go, good service and reasonable snack. Crew were helpful and cheery. Great views from the train with the extra big windows. On the way back there is a half hour "show" to try to sell souvenirs but it isn't a hard sell and is quite entertaining and passes the time after it gets dark.

Dangerous to the passengers!!. Day 3 October 2016 on the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes 19hs wagon B seat 10, the stationmaster gave way to a locomotive while passengers were waiting in the narrow aisle between the first track and the second track where our train stood in blatant threat to our security as passengers. We were a group of passengers of about thirty people in my car and as many in the other. This happened to worse at night. When I saw that this Lord Chief was giving way to a locomotive danger to passengers, I said him to stop it, he said I was right, but did not stop the march of the locomotive that happened to feet from where we were standing. Claim to the Company number 5062 whitout response.

Great way to get to Machu Picchu. My wife and I took this train to go from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and back during a trip to Peru. The train is nice, with top windows that improve the view of the beautiful Sacred Valley. They serve a snack and drinks during the trip, which was unexpected. On the way back from Machu Picchu we had a nice dance and fashion show: Smick, Elizabeth Llancay and Efrain were super nice and did not push their products, but put a nice show for us. We enjoyed our stay in the Vistadome.

A fantastic train ride!. We did 2 trips on the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Callientes & from Aguas Callientes to Cusco. The first trip was absolutely magical through the Sacred Valley running beside the Urubamba River through deep gorges & fertile fields. We were served a snack & soft drinks & they sold guide books.The return trip to Cusco was about 4hrs & mainly in the dark but they put on a great show modelling male & female alpaca clothes for sale & there were also dancers in fantastic costumes. We were served a light meal & there was also a bar service.The fare is quite expensive but worth it for the fantastic viewing possibilities with the glass roofed carriages, the excellent service & the punctuality of the trains.

Organized... clean...good services. Surprisingly one of the very good service in Peru!! The train is well organized and very clean.The ticket is quite expensive...but it includs cookie and a drink (coffee/ tea/ water) also some explanation of the scenic you are passing...which is really nice.The toilet is also clean (even for a women)All in all would give a 5 stars

Great experience!. Myself and my two companions had an extremely enjoyable trip on the Andean Explorer train from Puno to Cusco on the 3rd of October. The carriage was very comfortable, the food was great and the service provided by Jose Manuel, Bernardo and Lisbet was excellent. Thank you! I thoroughly recommend taking the trip. Luisa
A Great Trip. Everything was handled beautifully, and the food was excellent. I enjoyed the entertainment, music, and fashion show. Gorgeousl scenery, of course.

Peter Pei. Machu Pichu is so impressive for visiting. But the rail is too old so train could not run fast. And tourists spend extra time on the slow train to Machu Pichu. That is not good for tourists, neither for Peru Tour industry.

A whole new experience on a train. We just got back from our vacation and I need to say a train ride was a attraction in itslef. Normally those are really boring but aside from the views, crew working there was great. They did a fashion show, played instruments and overall were very polite, smiling and helpful. I asked for their names to make sure they get recognized Maritza V. Edson and Miguel Anghelo. Well done!

Incredible!. Us 4 adults & a 5 & 2 year old had the best trips to Machu Picchu and back to Cusco. The vistadome carriages are huge, very comfy and staff obviously love what they do.Toilets were very clean & well serviced, views were incredible & staff helpful and willing to answer questions about areas we travelled through.On the return to Cusco leg the staff dressing up in traditional costumes, & playing before a fashion show to promote what we could buy was from funny and the kids loved it.For what you pay this is a great service and experience, very well run. We loved it!

Bad service selling tickets in Cusco. The girl at the countor in Cusco shown no interest what s so ever in selling me a ticket and was tipping on computer while I was asking the schedule and prices, she said while carried on looking at her computer screen that all infirmations ar on a paper on the table ! I asked should I come later since she shown no interest and she replied "do you intend to buy a ticket ?" Not from you in such conditions and I left ! She and her colleague did not care at all although there was nobody else ! Rude service !!!

Great Experience. I was surprised at how nice the Vistadome train was. The seats were very comfortable with two side by side and two more across a table from you. The service was very good...much like airline service used to be years ago. You fold down the sides of the table and they put a table cloth on the expanded table for food service. When the meal is completed you can fold back the sides for a nice smaller surface. The views from the train are wonderful. On the way back there was a "fashion show" that resulted in the "sell". I could have done without that, however it did not harm the overall great experience of the train ride.

Fabulous Ride to Machu Pichu. We used the VistaDome to and from Machu Pichu. The views of the surrounds and mountains are just spectacular as you relax in total comfort. A light snack and beverage are offered during the trip. For me the highlight was the staff. Checkin was fast and efficient. On my first trip, the young attendant checked to see that the toilet was clean before I could use it. I really appreciated this as the train was full. On our return trip I noticed that the train had to stop to allow another trains to pass in the opposite direction. During this time the staff treated us to a Peruvian cultural dance and fashion show. They were fabulous and made the journey memorable. Thank you Indira, Abel and Efrain. You are brilliant ambassadors of your company. I would recommend the VistaDome strongly for the excellent service we received, the spectacular views and the efficiency of this service.

Train. Not that you have much choice travelling from Cusco to Machu Picchu but this train runs on time, has a complimentary drink and is comfortable. Pity it doesn't leave from San Pedro in Cusco but from Poroy instead.

Alpaca goods on the train!. Perurail offers goods to purchase on the train. Nay Ruth and Efrain enthralled us with beautiful discounted baby alpaca garments. Nay Ruth is such a beauty, she modeled the items for us until I caved and purchased a beautiful shawl/ scarf. Such entertainment!

Don't expect any assistance if things go wrong!!. The train is expensive ($US99 each way) but comfortable. The trip from Poroy (Cusco) to Aguas Calientes went well and the service was good. The train was on schedule and we received the service we expected. However the return journey the following day did not go well. We purchased two tickets for the return journey (at $US99 per ticket) that was to take me from Aguas Calientes to Poroy but due to strike action we were off boarded at Ollantaytambo.
