A refund of $9 was promised; that's a 10% refund for being taken for only 50% of the journey, but I would have to apply for that refund after the trip was complete and it would not be sent to me automatically I'm still waiting for the refund). We were offered no assistance at Ollantaytambo and were told it was our responsibility to find transport back to Cusco. I find both the value of the refund and the lack of assistance entirely unreasonable and unacceptable. It was not a good experience and I was extremely disappointed with the treatment we received. It spoilt what would otherwise have been a very good experience.
good way to go fast to Aguas Calientes. this is a reasonable alternative to all transport option to Machu Picchu, good service, clean, on time, niche atmosphere
Excellent service. Very nice cabin with comfortable seats (leather). The staff were friendly and accommodated us when we wanted to play cards as a large group.
Excellent choice. It was really a good experience. No rush, clean, enjoyable views, comfortable seats, very good option to travel.

And we thught it was just a train...w. We had just come back from a 4 day hike along the Inca Trail and booked our return on the PeruRail. Tired, ready to get back to our hotel. We were just looking for transportationWe were shown to our seats in the Vista Cruser and knew we were in for. Great ride. Food and drinks were quickly served and we started up the beautiful valley. Steep mountains, a river and Incan ruins along the route...then the show begins!Fun, clean, scenery. Don't miss this adventure!

Nice and smooth. Very relaxing travel up to Aguas Calientes. Comfortable train, they should put more options of food and drinks for purchase, in spite of these options should actually be part of the regular menu, included in the ticket price.Undoubtedly worth it, anyway.
Vistadome - the way to go. We travelled from Machu Picchu Pueblo on the Vistadome - everything was well done and the staff, MayRuth, Jack Paul and Fernando were awesome - highly recommend!

Comfortable way to reach Agua Caliente. Great way to travel from Poroy to Machu Picchu town, seeing the mountain scenery, with some announcements about the towns you pass through. Comfy seats with all round views and great service of food and small meal (on fancy woven design mats). Phillipe and Carlos V in our carriage were very helpful and friendly - even recognising us the next day in town the next day and stopping for a chat on their way to work. One tip for tourists is that because of the amount of glazing, the carriage can get hot when in the sun for a long time as the aircon takes a while to react, but also cold when it goes into the shady side of a valley so bring a layer or two to help!

Fab service on trip to Macchu Pichu. The trip up the valley is very scenic and a nice leisurely pace.Small meal was provided on both ways. Seemed to have 3 staff per coach and provided greats service. On return we even had a mini fashion show (albeit to try and sell us some of them alpaca clothing!)

The Little Extra. We travelled from Cusco to Aguas Caliente on the 16 September 2016. We thought it was just another scenic train journey to get us to our ultimate goal, Machu Picchu. But travelling on the Vistadome we were very pleasantly surprised by the extra attention paid by the "crew" to us the "guests". I have never travelled on the Orient Express, but I got an imaginary feeling that I was actually on this legendary train. This was in a large part due to the crew in our coach, more than the luxury associated with the Orient. Special thanks to Nicky, Fredy, Carlos and Carolain. A great memory and a moment in time.

Nice break from trekking!. Caught this train from the Hydro Electric station to Agias Calientes (Machu Picchu Town) after 4 heavy days trekking, then again from the same town to Ollantaytambo after seeing Machu Picchu. Lovely scenic ride, very comfortable seats and immaculately dressed staff who serve tea / cold drinks as part of the trip. A little on the expensive side at $29 one - way for a one - stop journey, but our feet and legs appreciated the rest!

Vistadome Peru rail ride to Machu Picchu. Peri rail vistadome was a terrific way to travel from pororoy to Machu Picchu. Booking process was easy online, boarding & disembarking an easy orderly process, staff were helpful & friendly serving breakfast & dinner along the way & the show interesting & fashion parade good fun. The ride was breathtaking through the countryside & mountains.
Amazing. This jorney was aamazing and thanks to blake for the help and the service and tips!!!Will be back soon

Good way to reach base of Macha Pichu and back. Booked as a part of a package trip.Great viewsMorning trip great with good viewsEvening trip after 5PM -no views [dark]However interesting fashion show by crew who try to sell local Jumpers/dress/shawl etc.Nevertheless unique train trip [light snack included]

A Zoom With A View. The trip is a charming experience, heightened by the breathtaking setting of the Urubamba Valley. Having an unrestricted view of the mountains and the farming communities along the route is a major plus.

Travel the Vistadome for a Breathtaking View. This Vistadome Train Ride to Machu Picchu is a Dream Comes True!You travel along the sacred river on one side & the mountains surrounding Machu Picchu on the other.In the midst of the journey they come & serve you free snack & a drink!The Views are just magnificent!The Great Beauty of Mother Nature!Trees & Birds & wild flowers & mountains & a beautiful roaring river!A wonderful trip leading the way to Machu Picchu!A Must See!
Old fashioned. Can imagine it could be long and tedious. ... but the views are interesting changing scenery and has a fab staff which put on a fashion show to pass the time. Fun times.

Cuzco vacation. Excellent service from Juliana and coworker. Love the positive attitude and attention to their customers.clean environment on train Beautiful views of the mountains and river. Absolutely a awesome experience. Gracias Perurail. Excellent job.

Traveling to and from Machu Picchu on the Vistadome was a great ride!. We took the Vistadome round-trip from Cusco to Machu Picchu. It was a lovely experience. The vistas are breath-taking and the large windows make the trip, so best to have your camera in hand. The light meals were refreshing and the train car is clean and comfortable. On our ride back to Cusco, we enjoyed the fashion show provided by the staff - Hilary, Carlos V., and Rozy - We purchased 2 alpaca pieces on their recommendations and the prices were commensurate with our visits to other Peruvian shops. It is a long trip (4 hours) but the staff and the scenery make it all worthwhile.

Wonderful Views!. The staff was courteous and entertaining. The snacks were more than we expected and were really good. The chairs were comfortable and clean and so was the restroom.We would use PeruRail again!!!
A bit pricey but good service. This train service is a bit pricey , more expensive than private taxi for the same route. One way is about $100 by train from Cusco to agus caliente.

Well worth the money. The Vistadome is very comfortable and relaxing. On the way to Machu Picchu and on the return you are provided a light drink and local snack. They were both different yet excellent. They are very efficient. Going up you are provided with things you can buy that may help you in Machu Picchu. On the way back there is a little show and then a fashion show. The items are expensive but looking back the alpaca cover is what I wish I had bought.

Vistadome is well worth the money. At first Vistadome seemed a bit expensive, but after reading reviews that the "dome" was great to see what was above while traveling along, I booked a seat. I took Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, and again from A.C. to Cuzco, and was able to see the peaks rising above the beautiful Sacred Vallley. That alone was worth the price! Additionally, this train was quite attractive inside, comfortable, and there was narration throughout the journey, in both Spanish and English, describing various sites along the way. The service was very friendly and efficient, and I was served a nice little lite meal on the longer trip which was 4 hours. Also, on that trip, the staff performed a "fashion" show for us modelling some beautiful clothing made of Peruvian alpaca. It was very entertaining and each piece was more beautiful than the last! I ended up buying a beautiful, knee length, reversible coat, for a great price and duty-free! I had seen a similar one in Lima for $600 USD. This one was $285. Sold! I would definitely book travel on Peru Rail's Vistadome again. It was a great experience!
Nice Ride. Smaller train (the one I had was one cart only)' the staff were friendly and nice, the ride is a long the river, comfortable and smooth.

Amazing view. Took the train early morning from Poroy station to Aguas Callientes. The view along the way is beautiful, have your camera ready because there will be some wonderful surprises!There was a problem with the locomotive on the way back, which caused a delay of +1,5h on the way back to Cusco, so I recommend not scheduling anything critical right after your return.
Awesome. There's nothing more convenient than riding the train to Aguas Calientes to see Machu Picchu. The service is good! The train ride is very comfortable.

A fun and amazingly beautiful train ride. The views are amazing and the service very good. We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Aquas Callientes in September- the ride is a few hours but the change in scenery was amazing from arid to green in a few minutes- Comfortable seats and the train's large windows including on the roof allow you to see the tall mountains from the valley. The staff speak english ( Wilson, Rosario and Fredy)- They serve a drink and light snack on the way there and back- On the way they sell guide books and on the return they had a fun Fashion Show and sale- we found this fun and entertaining- and in fact bought a sweater we liked. Our ticket also included lunch in Machu Picchu which was well worth it.The only issue we had is there was a local transportation strike and we were in the middle of it. When we got off in Ollantaytambo- no one told us that we could not get transportation from there to Urabamba because of the strike- We finally found a taxis we was willing to "Attempt" taking us but at a very inflated price- On the short 30 minute trip we released why- with large stones and logs on the road.

Nice service! . The views are amazing. We took the service from Ollantaytambo to Machu and back. You get a drink and a nice pastry/snack. There isn't much room for too much luggage. The train is clean and the service is great. The only thing I never like is the "selling" portion; which is understandable. Service departing Machu comes with a fashion show which makes it fun.

Beautiful train ride through the country. Took this train from Cuzco to Machu Picchu pueblo and I enjoyed it thoroughly! The staff Spoke English and were very knowledgable about the area. The views from the train were phenomenal and there was even an audio guide informing the passengers of places of interest like villages, ruins etc. the coolest part of the whole trip was a descent down the side of a mountain. The train stopped, reversed down a track then continued ahead on a lower track. It was like a vertical Z. Definitely worth the price, a wonderful, exciting journey!

Great communication and help. I am regularly on this service as I travel with several guests. On days like the last ones we traveled - a strike day - the team of VTD203 (Sep 13 2016) to go to Machupicchu and to come back on VTD302 (Sep 15 2016) made my day and the one of my guests. On both days I had birthdays and without any problem supervisor Giulissa and her team had birthday cakes and a song for them to celebrate. They are also always extremely helpful with carrying luggage etc. The three staff members on each of the train were very professional and it is a pleasure traveling with you.

Excellent Train Service. We took the Vistadome from Machu Picchu to Cusco. Very comfy seats and smooth ride. Food service is OK. Great Windows to sightsee but also not shaded for sun. A must for all Peru travelers. No WIFI service.
Beautiful!!!!. Very good, the place is very calm, Indicated to travel family and friends.Its a oportunity to learn other culture

Relaxed and happy train trips. These were relaxed and happy train trips. Everything was clean and efficient and ran like clock work. The sun shone down on us through the sky light windows and we watched the views as the train wound along. Happy days. The music, traditional table covers and refreshments and service were all great. There was much laughter during the show/ fashion parade. Peruvian service great as usual.

A beautiful and fun ride. We took the Vistadome train from Olly to Machu Picchu and from MP to Poroy. It’s a beautiful trip, following the river through the mountains. There is plenty of amazing scenery along the way. Seating is comfortable, with large windows for a nice view. They also provide an included snack on board. On the trip from MP to Poroy, they had a fashion show, with various alpaca clothing. Also, music and antics from a costumed entertainer. It was a fun trip.For the best views of the river and scenery, sit on the left side when heading toward MP and the right side when returning. Also note that there are forward and rear facing seats. If you have a preference.

Edgar's service was amazing. We booked our visit on the vistadome for a nice ride to aguas calientes from cusco (poroy station) on sept 18th. When we get our seats, we realize that my husband cant really fit since hes 6'6 and his knees would be touching (and i mean like all up on him not just a little bit close) the other passenger in front of him, so we asked if once everyone is boarded if we could try and sit in another seat. Edgar was SO nice and accommodating, he didnt make us wait and ensured we would have a seat in another car with space to fit. He was so genuine and helpful and really made us feel like we had the most personalized service and truly elevated my view of perurail. The nice view on the way over and comfort of the train ride was amazing as well, and the whole experience was definitely great

It's the Journey... not the Destination. OK... let's face it... Machu Picchu is not easy to get to. For most it's two planes and a train and ground transportation.But the Vistadome is a very GOOD part of that journey. The Andes are magnificent... and what better way to see it than with 360 degree views.

A very pleasant ride. No need to ride the expensive Hiram when you have this nice on-time train that has windows everywhere. It's comfortable, you meet nice folks, and it's a very nice diversion from Ollytatambo to Agua Caliente.On the way back the stewards and stewardesses will try and sell you alpaca goods. The pricing is much better than Cuzco airport in case you are wondering, and have forgotten someone at home. There is also no pressure.
Great experience. I have travelled a lot on trains, but this was a unique & memorable experience. Great infrastructure , excellent customer service. I loved it. They even offer basic meals.

Entertaining and Learning Experience. Really pleased with the ride, the nonstop beautiful views, and the attendants of my car, Daniela, Alan, and specially Isaac who took the time to answer our questions. Isaac was informative at certain historical details that we did not learn in Machu Picchu or Cusco. He brough to our attention the hotel sleeping capsules hanging from the mountain. We would have missed it without his guidance. We traveled on September 8, 2016 on the aprox. 3:20 train going back to Poroy. Thank you, guys!

Great train terrible customer service. Due to protests along the train line we were advised about a week before our trip that the Vistadome would not operate from Poroy station and would only be able to make the trip from Ollataytambo to Machu Pichu. While I understand the safety concerns of operating through a dangerous route what was underwhelming was the lack of support from Peru Rail in getting us from Cusco to Ollataytambo for this trip. It was simply left to us to figure out a private transport to arrive at the appropriate station.This ended up costing us around $100US to charter ourselves, we asked for suggestions of transport companies after it was clear Peru Rail was making no effort to take care of customers who had paid up front months in advance. Even then they simply said on 3 different occasions "ask your hotel to figure it out"Eventually we arrived safely no thanks to them and yes the train and service was beautiful however I couldn't get the sour taste out of my mouth from their nonchalant attitude to helping us have the best experience possible in our short stay in Peru. We clearly have very different bench marks of what appropriate customer service is.

Excellent service!!! . Our experience on the vista some on our way back from aguas calientes to Cusco was amazing. The landscapes are breathtaking, the food and service are amazing and the seats are very comfortable. The staff we had servicing us made all possible for us to be 100% happy. They attended all our needs with all our request and they made sure we were taken care off during the whole trip. Solange, Luis Miguel, Constantino and Victor were the best!! From serving drink to modelling and entertaining us with Peruvian dances, they made our trip and once and a lifetime experience. Thank you!

If you want a fantastic train ride this is it.. Cusco to Machu Picchu and back. Numbered seats, clean, comfortable, staff very well dressed and professional with a drinks service and snacks. The speed of train just right to capture the scenery and the amazing river. On way back the costume dancer performance followed by the very excellent fashion show of local products performed by the staff made the 3 1/2 hour journey seem much shorter. Congratulations.
Great ride. Definitely the best and most picturesque way to get to Machu Picchu .Very comfortable and they served a snack on the way.You sit at tables on the train.

An experience you have to see and then believe. We were expecting a quite ordinary train ride from Machu Picchu City to Cusco but what a surprise!! On this excursion, we were given assigned seats and shortly after the train started, the conductor folks came through with drinks and we even were served dinner which was very good. After dinner was when the excitement started. One of the staff was dressed in a multicolored costume and an animal mask. We surmised in was some mix of Incan tradition and religious meaning. This was really entertaining. Following this floor show, there was a fashion show of alpaca goods modeled by the male and female conductor. We were then given the opportunity to purchase the items modeled.  All in all, it was a remarkable journey and the Peruvian scenery was unmatched.
Lindisimo!. Excelente paisaje, gran vista de 4 horas de paisaje precioso! The crewmembers were awsome! Ask to Ronal for advises and Inca HIstory, great guy with big knowledge

Fantastic Views - and Entertaining. Our group of 4 hiked the 4 Day Inka Trail and decided to splurge a bit at the end of an arduous hike. The train station at Aquas Calientes was a mad house so ask questions and give yourself some time.The view for the train was fantastic. A light meal was served followed by costumed dancer and then a fashion show be the train staff showing PeruRail Alpaca clothing. Entertaining.The only draw back was that from there on there was little service and the car got quite warm. Overall a great trip though - about 3.5 hrs.

Nice but Way Overpriced!. Really nice view, kind staff and tasty included drinks and snack.Relatively comfy seats.Poor ventilation however, many mosquitos and severely overpriced.Sadly it is the only way to get to Aguas Cliente other than walking.

Great 3 hour ride. We made a day trip out of Machu Picchu and used the Vistadome. We took the earliest train out and last one back and had an hour or 2 to spare in Aguas Calientes. Make sure you have prearranged entrance and bus tickets upon arrival.

Card denied on website, but great customer service and incredible experience . Here's what to know if you're trying to pay with a Visa online from abroad. I learned that most cards nowadays are already preregistered with "verified by visa", and that Perurail experiences frequent website glitches. So if your card is being repeatedly denied, it's probably a website maintenance issue. There are basically 3 options to resolving this : 1) wait and keep trying 2) buy tickets through a travel agency and pay the commission 3) contact Perurail via phone and have them process the payment for you. I went with this third option and it entailed sending trip dates, copies of identifications of travelers, and copies of the visa you're using. Kind of a hassle but it takes care of things, especially if you're running short on time like I was! The vistadome was an incredible experience. The views were absolutely breathtaking, the staff incredibly friendly, and they even put on a little show on the way back to Poroy from MP. They provide snacks and drinks. I'd take the direct train from Poroy (Cusco) to MP, it was totally worth it and not too expensive (94 usd one way, 99 back).

Best option for trip to Aguas Calientes. We were staying in Ollantaytambo (probably the wisest bet when visiting MP), and we took this train (Vistadome) up and the Inca Rail first class voyage for the trip back in the evening. This train was significantly better built and therefore more comfortable, with much less side-to-side sway than the Inca Rail train. We took the 8:53 AM train from Ollanta, which gave us plenty of time to visit MP. We already had breakfast at our hotel, but this service gave us a sandwich as well, plus a hot and cold beverage. Having the glass windows on top was a neat way to see some of the mountains and trees we were passing. The meal for the dinner service on the Inca Rail trip on the way back was skimpy, and we wished we had taken this train both ways (although the extra view from the ceiling windows in the evening is not needed since it's dark). The other reason I preferred this service is that getting the tickets was easier, since PeruRail has offices at the Lima and Cusco airports (and in Cusco), and their hours are much better. For reasons unclear to me, none of the trains to Aguas Calientes/MP takes luggage. So my advice would be to stay two nights in Ollantaytambo, and take the Vistadome up and down.

Excellent experience — Other countries should learn from these guys. We took the vistadome to cusco and I think our overall experience was great. The snacks and drinks offered during our trip were good. The staff was super sweet and welcoming and entertained us with a fashion show and a little performance. We will highly recommend this train. Special thanks to the staff members, Brydm, Hillary, and Freedy.
Amazing. Comfortable train with amazing staff (Edson, Victor and Roxana) that did their best to entertain us and provide a good service.

Machu Picchu Trip. This was a good experience. Was traveling with a friend and their family. We had originally wanted the expedition train, which is the cheapest option for train, but it was full and we had to take the Vistadome. I am glad we did. It was very comfortable with great views. Not a bad seat in the place. And there were snacks and drinks served as well. Overall it was a fantastic experience.

More than I expected!!. Not only do you get an in paralleled view, this ride from Aquascalliente to Paroy was one of the many highlights of our trip! I don't want to give it all away, but there are some fun surprises on PeruRail!!!

Great experience. My husband and I took the Vistadome. It was an excellente experience. We even met lovely people that were also going to Machupicchu.The service was outstanding. We are grateful to Isaac, Daniela and Max for the assitance they gave us. We definitely recommend taking the Vistadome.

Great way to see the country side. We did the trip from Cusco to Puno on PeruRail and it was a great experience. The service from end to end was wonderful and it made a 10hr journey a very pleasant experience.

The way to travel to Machu Picchu. The middle option to travel to Machu Picchu. More comfortable than Peru Rail and much less expensive than the Hiram Bingham this train service offers amazing views with comfortable seats and great 'airline type' food & beverage service. Very limited with baggage, however - since no overhead storage. We were hiking the Inca Trail via KM104, so this seemed the most efficient way to get there - and it was.

Fun that makes the journey pass fast. Although not of the standard or comfort of the Andean Explorer, the Vistadom trains are a good way to travel from Cusco to Aguas Calientas. Depending upon the time of day you receive a sandwich, snack or small meal with drinks. There is also entertainment provided whether a fashion show, jesters or sales trolley filled with useful guides and a small selection of clothing.The staff are exceptionally friendly and professional and never stop working during the whole trip - they provide both service and entertainment!
Train ride. Not was expensive as the Bingham, do not take it if you doze off, xD many people on the train sleep the whole way xDGood service could use a better breakfast menu...

Vista Dome runs sometimes on regular routed.. The train service is very nice, and very well done. This nice thing with the Vistadome is they offer some food and beverage service with the ride. The cars, themselves, do have an area at the top that lets in more light. Oddly, the same cars were used on non-Vistadome routes, too.The service up the Aguas Calientes is a feast for the eyes, following along the river that a portion of the Inca trail follows.

Pleasant Journey to Machu Picchu. Enjoyed the comfort and scenery on the ride from Olleyentabow to Machu Picchu. Staff were very friendly and Milagros, Ronny, and Walter provided entertainment on the return journey which was on the two car diesel unit.

Awesome trip with a show. We took it on our way to/from aguascalientes. First class has the vistadome which allows you to see through the roof and admire the scenery.Also, we had a short show of typical dances and a fashion catwalk when they were selling alpaca products.

Fun ride to Aguas Calientes and back. Even though I missed my train leaving from Poroy, I was still able to make it to Ollantaytambo in time to pick up the Vistadome there. The staff was understanding and I was served a little snack plate upon being seated. The staff was helpful with offering items to purchase and information about locations along the way. The cost for the train is high but so is the reward. The views were simply magnificent; a wonderful transition from the quaint city of Cuzco to the natural wonder that is Machu Picchu.

Really liked the Vistadome ride to MP. It is worth traveling with the Vistadome at least for one leg of the journey to MP. The scenery is fantastic and I really liked the audio guides explaining some of the villages you could see popping out during the travel.

Poroy- Machu Picchu Round Trip. Excellent train. Comfortable seats.Snacks provided. On time. Service is good. We purchased the tickes online. I emailes 2 times customer service with several questions and they replies super quickly very friendly. I would highly recommend them if you are traveling to Machu Picchu.

Fabulous views. The journey on this train to the town nearest to Machu Picchu was lovely. The scenery is beautiful and the train is extremely comfortable. Breakfast is served on the outward train and a snack on the return. There is even a fashion show on the return journey.

Wonderfully relaxing way to travel to/from Machu Picchu. When you board this train, you instantly relax, taking in the comfortable seats and the high level roof windows giving you the most magnificent views of the countryside. Your carriage is clean and spacious, the staff attentive with drinks and food and your journey also includes a fashion show and entertainment. I would recommend this to those that don't fancy the trek to Machu Picchu and simply want a few hours of luxury. Big thanks to Manitza, Alfredo and Deisy who work tirelessly in our carriage on our journey from Adnes Calienties to Poroy.

Easiest way to get from Sacred Valley to Agua Caliente.. Narrow gauge railroad that takes 1:45 to make the transit 1 way. Executive level seats are plush but a little narrow. Think cars rock more than normal because wheels are not widely spaced.

Machu Picchu visit. The thing to do here is stop at the railway station (it's a fabulous small hotel and quiet with an amazing restaurant - see separate review!). You get on the train at Ollyantaytambo and try to get a seat on the left side of the train when booking (facing going out) as you will get the best views as the windows look out on to the river, which the tracks follow. It's okay on the right side of the train but the view is not quite as good. The journey is about an hour and a half but passes relatively quickly, there are soft drinks served with a small snack (a lovely fresh small baguette). The sandwich on the way out was far nicer than the one on the return journey which was very bland and dry. The train is a fabulous experience as it winds it's way alongside the river at a very gentle pace until arriving at the station in Aguascalientes. The seats are very comfortable with large windows for good views but the train does not have an observation car. On the return journey we were treated to a small fashion show, featuring alpaca garments which are then for sale after the show. All in all a fabulous trip not to be missed and saves walking for 4 days (unless of course that's what floats your boat!).

Comfortable, great views, good old fashioned rail experience. Perurail thought this service through quite nicely. There's room to put your luggage behind or between seats, the seats are comfortable, there are bathrooms readily available, the views from the train are a unique experience. We took the train to Macchu Picchu, about 90 minutes each way. On the way back, they put on a pretty cool folklore show, which was actually enjoyable. Good tunes, tasteful, we really liked it. They also put on a fashion show, which we thought was very nicely done and certainly helped pass the time.Though one adage is true: As trains get faster, communication among passengers is no longer a thing. Lots of passengers, including us, ended up striking up good conversations. An enjoyable way to travel.
Rail . Comfortable seats, food and drinks in the train. Great customer service. Washroom on board, a convenient location for carry on luggage.

Incas AND a fashion show. Comfortable vista dome cars enable terrific views when approaching and departing Machu Picchu. Decent beverage and snack service included in price if ticket. Doubt there were any special individual orders available. Upon departure from MP we were surprised with a costumed dancer who also hosted a Peruvian fashion show. Cute.

Wow . The PeruRail vistadome was a favorite part of our family trip. The train was clean, comfortable, and had great views of the passing scenery. Free entertainment and paid snacks available onboard.

Pleasant . The Train ride was wonderful, the staff were lovely, the food served was tasty and a good variety of drinks were also offered, the train and bathroom facilities were well maintained and comfortable. The view out the window during the day is stunning. Just a tip if you are travelling at night you can't see anything out the window so make you have a book to read.

Beautiful Ride!. Felipe was our host on this train ride and it was a blast. When taking it, be sure to sit on the river side of the train for the best views. There is food on board!! They had an adorable fashion show. The train is slow but truly allows you to enjoy the scenery.

PeruRail Vistadome Okay. The Vistadome train by PeruRail was just okay. I wasn't blown away by anything. The food service was just a simple turkey sandwich with either juice, soda, coffee, or tea. The train was not very impressive, as I've been on many trains in other countries. It has lot's of windows to see the outside views. The one tracking on parts of the route was annoying. They should have 2 tracks all the way through. But I guess, they don't want to interrupt mother nature's landscape. The train was clean, and well kept. Workers were nice and friendly. They could use new trains in the coming years though.

Great experience and good customer service. We took a family vacation and include the vistadome to and from Machu Picchu. The train ride is a couple hours with a sandwich each way. The service is very friendly and stored our small bags behind the seats. There is a waiting area at each train station that made the wait easy. Some of the trains that we passed on the way were packed. I was happy to have a reserved seat.

Great way to travel. Took the train to Machu Picchu area. The dome gives you a great view of the Andes, and surrounding towns, farms and Inca trail hikers. Service was fair. A small variety of beverages, cheese sandwich and some simple side items.

TRAIN TO MACHU PICCHU. The train trip from Poroy to Machu Picchu Pueblo is an awesome experience. The station in Poroy is clean an efficiently operated. The check in is accomplished in an outstanding manner. The scenery of the trip is nothing less than outstanding.I recommend taking this train instead of the Expedition train. On the return trip from Aquas Calientes to Poroy the boarding process, in contrast to the experience in Poroy, was very disorganized. There was a fashion show presented by the Peru Rail employees in an effort to sell items. The items for sale were of very high quality, but at tourist prices.

High quality interior, upscale ambiance, service, entertainment . This is a very nice experience to and from Macchu pichu. The food and beverage service is very professional, the audio explanations are interesting and the show on the way back is highly entertaining for all ages.

An Experience on Its Own. We just assumed we were using the train for transportation. What a delight. Our family of 5 booked well ahead (as advised). We were surprised and pleased to realize that PeruRail really makes the train trip part of the Machu Picchu/Sacred Valley experience. We even wondered about just taking the train for the fun of it. The trip from Aqua Calientes to Cusco (Poroy) was particularly fun. The food was good, the staff was very accommodating and helped with luggage, and we were even treated to a "fashion show" and some costumed dancing.

A Train Ride with a Twist. I must say I have never experienced a train ride like this. Not only because of the Windows on the ceiling so I can enjoy the view, not only because the slightly wider than normal window on the train side. Not because of the super clean lavatories. But because of their staff. Their staff were nice, friendly and funny. We were entertained by fashion show (it was actually a show for on board shopping). The whole train passenger were such a good sport. We were clapping and supporting the fashion show. I saw the staff was friendly to children too. They were given playing card.

Amazing train ride!. We took the round trip from Cusco to Aguascalientes. It was an amazing experience with an amazing view due to the glass ceiling and windows. Personnel was extremely friendly and helpful. They serve food during the trip but do not except a lot from that, it is basically a sandwich and some fruits/cakes. Definitely recommend this, absolutely worth the money!

Entertainment. The options for travel to and from Machu Picchu are a four day trek or the train. Therefore for the old and unacclimatised only one choice. However this journey is part of the adventure. A slow and twisting journey through astounding scenery with perfect time keeping and very attentive staff. The toilets in train and station were new and very clean. The carriages comfortable and surprisingly spacious. The staff are efficient and friendly. On the return journey darkness fell so there was little to see but the service team provided in train ethnic dancing and a fashion show. Make this a major part of your journey but be sure to arrive on time as there are rarely spare seats and no practical alternative means of transport.

A beautiful ride. This is well worth the cost - make sure you sit on the right hand side of the train up to MaPi and on the left leaving MaPi.Service was great, everyone spoke english and it was the most organized moment of the whole train station experience. The train stations are chaotic and more like a kicked over ant hill than any train station I have ever been too - BUT PeruRail does their best to impose order and calm.

Lovely trip back to cusco. After 4 days on the inca trail you will feel like world beaters, so a little bit of luxury to while away the trip back to cusco is well worth it. Fantastic scenery given what you will have seen in the previous 4 days and very friendly and welcoming staff on board. An experience you really have to do. They say is the journey, not the destination that counts, so this is really all part of the experience
1st Wonder visited. OMG omg omg!You ! Yesss you!! Will have to go and experience it yourself!!! Going on this train will make your heart beat as fast as the chuchu motor goes!!

Interesting ride into Machu Picchu. You have basically two ways to get into Machu Picchu: rail it or hike it... We decided on the second and took the Vistadome in from Ollantaytambo. We were originally booked to leave from the Poroy train station but protests along the line made that portion of the trip impossible. The ride itself is interesting as you get to see some very beautiful passages and experience how the climate and surrounding habitat changes from the drier higher altitude terrain to that of a sub-tropical high rainforest. Worth the trip. Agree that it may be a bit high priced through.

Premium experience!. I took the July 20th Vistadome at 16:22 from Aquas Calientes to Ollantaytambo. The experience was absolutely phenomenal! I had taken the Expedition the day before and was expecting the two trains were going to be similar experiences. The Vistadome truly is a more luxury experience.You will love it!

Aguas Calientes to Ollantytambo. A little bit weary after the Inca Trail we boarded the vistadome train from Aguas Calientes the day after we finished our hike. With more knowledge than when we arrived we were able to thoroughly enjoy the ride in the Vistadome. Although a little expensive, it was well worth the money. We had bright blue skies and we were able to spot the inca sites out of the window and enjoy the mountains towering above us. Highly recommend the journey.

Superior service. . Great views from inside the cart. But after a while it all seems to look the same. Mountains to your left and right. With the Vistadome, you get free meal that is included with the ticket. The attendants speak fluent English so the language barrier was gone. They provide excellent service and are happy to help out with any special request. I was part of a tour group and there was an issue with my ticket being separate from the rest of the tour group but the people from PeruRail took care of everything. They contacted the touring company and made sure I got to my destination on time. Excellent service.

Overpriced. We had a train ticket included in a hike we did, that ended at Machu Picchu. From the ticket we could read that the value was $90, which is crazy expensive for a 1,5 hour train ride and the view wasn't even astonishingly breathtaking. Consider walking out of Aguas Calientes to catch a bus.

Most unique train ever. . Great service, we got a nice small sandwich, we also had the modt unique performance of a dancer. An alpaca clothing fashion show, and great help knowing the area we were passing by, good service for refills. I highly recommend this place.

Train from MP to Cuzco. This was by far the most entertaining train ride I have been on and perfect after a long day of hiking. The workers on the train (Phillippe, Linda, and one other) were hysterical and very accommodating. They showed off the latest alpaca wear and we even had a crazy dancer. As for the organization of the company, we felt it was adequate.

Great trip, hard to get tickets. The train was clean and efficient, and the service was great. Big downside was the availability of regular tickets. We could only buy 1st class because they reserve a certain number of seats as first class. The view was very good and the food was good.

Bitter Sweet Ride. We found the trains with excellent accommodations. It was a 5 star ride. Our only concern was that when we made the initial reservation for the trip on line, the way to buy the ticket is not understood clearly. We bought the tickets in reverse because the way it is formatted its not clearly understood. For example: if we are in Ollantaytampu we would buy for Machu Picchu. Then on the way back we would by for Ollantaytampu. That's not how it works you have to buy Ollantaytampu to go to go to Machu Picchu and to return from Machu Picchu you buy Machu Picchu bc that is where your are not where your going. Due to that misunderstanding we lost a day in Aguas Calientes bc the trains were full due to a work strike that would occur in 2 days. All trains were packed. We lost one day reservation in one hotel, we were stranded in Ollantaytampu we had to stay a night in a hotel, and another hotel did not want to reimbursed for that lost day. It was a domino effect.PeruRail charged us a fee for that mixed up to leave the next day bc they didn't have space on that day's trains. We didn't check Inca Trail (less fancy), which is their competitor, for availability of space. The money we lost in hotels would have been less then buying tickets on the Inca Trail one way. Lesson learned!!

Great experience! . We had our train ticket booked through our travel agent for the Salkantay trek so had no idea what to expect from our 2 hour train journey.Station staff were very helpful and boarding was relatively easy. The journey itself was amazing! Free hot drink and sandwich served by friendly staff. Comfortable seats and large windows to enjoy the view. Entertainment was rather amusing - fashion show from the waiting staff and crazy show from the "dancing devil".

Wonderful experience. Our tour got most of a single car, and the others who joined us fit in with our nonsense. I met a young lady from Holland and an expat living in Germany. The views from the car are wonderful. You can see the river most of the way. They offer a snack (sandwich) and drink - you have to try Inca Cola (tastes like bubblegum!) which was plenty for me for lunch but our tour didn't think so and took us to lunch later! Anyway, on the way back the staff put on a fashion show! It was fun and we later found the store in Cusco where the items came from. We clapped and cheered each time they came out in a new outfit. Then when one of us came back from the restroom, we clapped for him or her, too! It was very amiable. We stopped a couple of times for other trains to pass but we got where we were going on time. We also saw some ruins from the windows. Very enjoyable experience. Oh! We also saw others taking the weeklong trek on the Inca Trail. Didn't envy them at all. :)

What a ride. We have so much to learn, comfortable air con coaches, food and drink served every trip and on the return there was a fashion show and entertainment. They sell exclusive clothing and some guide books. This journey rates as one of the best rail trips in th he world.

Best train ride with stunning views. Took a 4 hour train ride from Cusco to Aguas Caliente. The roof had glass windows to see the most beautiful mountains, river and villages. Soft drinks and small snacks (muffins and local cookies) were offered for free. Beer could be purchased.
Best way to get to Machu Picchu. Clean, comfortable train to Machu Picchu, but frequently subject to delays. On a regular basis the 30 mile ride thakes 1 1/2 hours.

Fun & Eduacational. What a great way to see Peru heading to MachuPicchu. The Vistadome was comfy and accommodating. On the way back (5 Aug 16) Aydé, Enrique, & Saul took great care of us passengers. They served us well & entertained us. Thank you!

Ttrain ride through terrain of unforgettable beauty. The Vistadome train experience is truly unforgettable. Weather was sunny and cool but bring sunblock and a hat since the ceiling glass panels allow for great upward views but also makes it bright and shadeless for the 3+ hour journey.Our train departed Poroy Station (30 minute taxi from Cusco) and stopped once in Ollantaytambo for additional passengers. TIP: try to get seats on the left side of the train for maximum views as you follow the Urubamba river along its right toward Machu Picchu Village AKA Aguas Calientes.The morning 8:25 train serves a snack and beverages (included) and each train car is served by sweet.0, attentive staff. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

unforgetable trip, good service, nice view!. Wagon has a dome to improve your view, the service is very good, the crew is excellent. Do not ever go by car to Machu Picchu. If you have budget constraints, there are more economical trips.
I wish the ride was longer!. So beautiful, so comfortable- relaxing! They even had complimentary snacks and beverages! So genteel the river valley is very scenic!

Entertainment Included. The afternoon train trip from Macchu Pichu to Cusco was first class. The cabins were clean and comfortable. Complimentary food and drink with very helpful staff. Much to our surprise our wonderful staff turned into fashion models and treated us to a fashion parade like nothing I have ever seen. The alpaca clothing was beautiful and the models were professional, amusing and highly entertaining. The views were spectacular and I would highly recommend this trip.

Cool views. Comfortable train ride from Cusco to Machu Picchu! About three hours long. Fairly decent price---but since my online purchase of the trip included a free lunch at the uber fancy Belmond Sanctuary Lodge, it made the price absolutely worth it! THAT lunch was delicious! Seriously! A total luxury after hiking around Machu Picchu all morning! Absolutely recommend getting a little luxury now and then...

Good service. On time performance clean cabin and washroom. Good service while on the train light snack is serve with hot or cold beverage . Not much talking from the cabin crew . A little information will be a nice touch while on the train about the history of the area we are traveling through otherwise it was good .

Fab service!. After 4 days to Machu Picchu, a lovely comfy train journey was just what we needed! We were even treated to a bit of entertainment and a fashion show with alpaca garments while enjoying a complimentary drink and delicious sandwich. On top of this unexpected show, the views were amazing and we would have no hesitation in booking again.
Fashion show on train. Great fun to have a fashion show while traveling on the Vistadome Train, We had snacks and a drink included in the ticket price which was welcome on the long journey.

Worst experience ever. Just don't do it. Missed train by 5 minutes and then we're stuck in town for the night. They wouldn't give a refund for the train tickets. And the second tickets they issued were for the wrong station. Long lines everywhere. I mean epic long. Busses up and down the mountain are 3 plus hour waits so include that timing in your visit. There's no other way out of this disgusting place other than train so don't miss your train.

Perfect trip! Best service on a train ever! I always do appreciate well trained stuff.. A trip to Maccu Piccho is a must. The best way to travel there is by train. Vistadome is definetely a really good choice! Always again.

Worked for us. PeruRail from Poroy to Machu Picchu. We used the Vistadome service. The cars are clean and comfortable although many seats face each other which makes for little leg room,especially if you are on the tall side. There are three porters per car and a snack and one drink is served. There is a clean restroom in each car as well. They make a big deal about only one back pack size piece of luggage but there did not seem to be any enforcement of the rule. The scenery is great but after an hour you have seen all the variation you will see until you are about 45 mins from the MachuPicchu station, So bring a book or plan a nap to pass the 3.5 hours. On the way back the crew did a fashion show to sell some Peruvian clothes along with someone dressed as a bird doing a native dance. It did help pass the timeTrain was on time getting their but 20 mins late returning. A long but necessary trip unless you want to hike the Inka Trail to MachuPicchu

Wow! Wish it could have been longer! . What a way to end our Inca Trail trek - this train was comfortable to the max AND included free (included with the price of our tickets) snacks and drinks. The views were great and the staff was friendly, we just wished it could have taken us all the way back to Cusco! That said, though, the "dome" part of the name is kinda misleading. We were all expecting a true glass DOME over our heads, but found skylights instead! They turned out to be fine, though, and between them and the big windows, we were able to appreciate the beautiful sights!If you want to treat yourself, I think the Vistadome train is a nice way to do it!

If you can afford it, it's worthy.. From the two companies doing the Ollantaytambo-Machupichu trip, everybody says Peru Rail is better than Inca Rail. I don't know if that is true, but Peru Rail has 4 different class services for that trip, the Vistadome being the third bottom to top, or the second best, they way you like it better. The on board service (really nice) include drinks and a sandwich, what comes handy after the MachuPichu experience, and the views from the semi glass top roof are really nice too. Is comfortable, clean, perfectly serviced and although it's just one and a half hour trip, it's worth it.
Great Scenery. Enjoyed the train ride very much. A hint for travelers is to sit on the far side of the carriage to take advantage of the passing views.

spectacular scenery. I am a seasoned traveler and I consider this train trip to be a must do. Spectacularscenery almost does not do it justice as a description. Moments that take your breath away. That is what I think when I think about this trip. The Andes mountain range is inthe same category as the Swiss Alps, or Alaska, or Norway.

Train trip to Machu Picchu. A very nice train trip to Machu Picchu. Excellent carriage with big viewing windows and roof windows. Clean toilet and baggage storage area for small luggage. Some seats face backwards but this didnt detract from the view. I think there are different classes of carriage where food can be purchased but many people took their own snacks in my carriage.A drink and cookie was included in our fare.

Smoothly run, but falsely advertised. My family of 4 (kids age 8 and 10) took the Vistadome to Machu Micchu. The scenery was breathtaking and the audio tour interesting. We are served a sandwich and beverage for breakfast and upon our return. The staff was courteous and friendly and the trip ran very smoothly. At the same time, the website advertises “entertainment” which consisted of staff walking up and down the aisle selling Vistadome products on the way there. On the return we were put in the awkward situation of a drawn out “fashion show” in which staff modeled clothing for sale. I found this insulting and certainly an example of false advertising. I would not chose this train again.

Ok journey. We took the Hiram Bingham train to Machu Picchu but on our way back couldn't find any tickets so had to take PeruRail. The boarding was very swift, the train left on time.Of course, the whole experience wasn't as enjoyable or luxurious as the one on the Belmond train. But he price wasn't the same, either. PeruRail was ten times cheaper.It was too crowded, all the cars were full.There was no place for hand luggage and the space between the seats and the table is almost inexistent, also not enough legroom.The food they served was just ok. The fact that was irritating was that, instead of providing some chargeable drink a service onboard (I would have liked a Pisco Sour or at least some water), all the attendants did was presenting and trying to sell to the passengers some local wool-made clothes. (I do understand that they try to encourage the local crafts, but still...They should have had one waiter selling drinks, at least some water...)

Engine Breakdown - 3 hour delay. I'm sure the trip would have been wonderful if the engine on the train had been properly maintained. Unfortunately we spent an EXTRA 3 hours (total of 6) moving very slowly forward, then coasting backwards, stopping for a period of time with workers running around outside in the dark, moving forward again, backing up... you get the picture. Peru Rail staff, while kind, were less than informative. No PA announcements about updates on the situation. Staff would tell one or 2 people in the car what they felt was happening then travelers would talk amongst themselves to try and figure out what was going on. Not very effective PR and it lead to increased anxiety for many passengers. My husband and I were some of the lucky ones in that we did not have firm plans after our return to the Poroy station. Others missed checking in to their hotel and prearranged evening plans. To their credit the staff spoke to each group and worked to contact hotels, friends or prearranged transportation to inform them of our extended delay. My husband and I kept focusing on the positive. We had had a great day exploring Machu Picchu. We had access to a clean bathroom. We had packed extra snacks. We had purchased 2 tablecloths which we used for pillows and blankets. We weren't in danger just very very very late. :) PeruRail offered to bus us to another station in Cuzco after we finally arrived at Poroy (then we would arrange for a taxi), but my husband and I opted to take a taxi directly from Poroy to our hotel in Cuzco to eliminate any more delay. No discounts or refunds were offered. I'm just so grateful that the breakdown happened AFTER we had enjoyed a fabulous day at Machu Picchu and not on the way there!

The train to Machu Picchu. Going to Machu Picchu takes you a lot of time and energy. So it is very good and important to have moments to relax. I had those in the Vistadom (train) with the great Team: Victor, Linda and David. They were courteous and fit. I enjoyed the trip especially at the way back, because I was tired and they cared for us passengers.

Great way to get to macchu picchu dying the day. We took the vistadome to Aguascalientes and it was a fantastic ride. Awesome views! Do recommend getting an earlier train so you don't miss the sights in the dark. Friendly and professional staff and a decent snack!

Fashion Show. On the way back from Machu Picchu we were privileged to have entertainment. First a dancer in costume and then a fashion show of the local attire for men and women. They looked fabulous but it was a little pricey.

Wonderful ride to Machu Picchu. Wonderful ride, great service, informative. We took the 6:40 train from Poroy to MP, the train ride really set the mood for the MP visit. Vistadome has skylight, which expedition doesn't.

Awesome experience !. The vista dome was perfect. Our Family sat together. The service and light food was great. We paid the extra for the sanctuary buffet. That was well worth the money!!!! The employees have a delightful presence. Their uniforms, grooming, personalities, looks, and professionalism is at the top of the charts. I would love to have this company run all hospitality travel in the world!!!! This truly was a delightful experience. The return trip with the dancers and modeling of clothes was great! We should have bought the things we wanted on the train. They are unique to Peru rail and we never found anything we liked better.
Nice , reasonable price , fun !!. Comfortable , food service and clean restrooms available. Comfortable. The train system seems very well organized and we never experienced any inconvenience.

AWESOME RIDE!. We took the luxury train PeruRail Vistadome from Ollantaytambo station to Aguas Calientes, Machu Picchu. It was a most epic adventure! The numerous panoramic windows afforded each of us in our party of 4 sufficient views of the incredible scenery! There was even a light snack with beverages included. And the bathroom is huge for public transport! On our incoming journey to Machu Picchu the only snack was a ham and cheese sandwich so us being vegetarians, we had nothing to eat. However, on the outgoing trip to Ollantaytambo, there was a delicious spinach, tomato and cheese sandwich which even my child devoured! On this trip, there was quite the show with someone dressed in typical cultural dress and there was music and dancing! Such joy! The attendants also modeled different articles of clothing they had on sale (100% alpaca). We enjoyed going through tunnels, seeing snow capped mountains, a pack of donkeys, amongst so much more! Definitely a great way to travel! You arrive feeling refreshed and ready for the journey ahead of you (Machu Picchu)!
Gorgeous views. Absolutely mesmerising views out the windows of the mountains and river - spent a lot of time guessing where lost Inca cities might be amongst the peaks. Great fun!
Wonderful trip to Machu Picchu. Great train ride to and from Machu Picchu. Well organized, great service, very nice staff. The ride was beautiful and comfortable.

Terrific!. First of all I must admit I am a train-trip lover so I loved the experience, the sits are highly comfortable and its panoramic views are just amazing, it takes so many time to go from Cuzco to Machupichu but it worths every penny!

Check out Peru Rail. The Vistadome was OK, although I curiously wonder is it worth the extra money above the normal backpackers train. Certainly not as exciting as promoted. it pays to check the prices on the rail as we managed to pick up a special offer by being at the ticket office early. The scenery is great although as mentioned probably just as good from the much cheaper train.

Great experience. Travelled to and from Machu Pichu on this train and enjoyed greatlyOn return journey had seat no 1 which is beside the driver looking along the rails.Service is old fashioned and delightful with friendly staff who obviously enjoy their job part of which is a fashion show of locally made clothing for sale. They did this with panache and such fun for all. Seats comfortable and drink and filled roll included

Be Careful When Booking Buffet with Them!. I booked PeruRail - Vistadome from Ollaytantambo to Machu Picchu Station and then from Machu Picchu Station to Poroy Station.Both trips were on time, clean and enjoyable. From Ollay to Machu, I was assigned to the back of the train, so I had an amazing view, but the sun was really harsh! From MP to Poroy, they gave everyone a slice of pizza, a cookie, apple sauce and berries and also put on a show! It was entertaining, but half of the train was trying to sleep so it only kept people awake.Overall, great experience, but be careful if you decide to book the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge Buffet with them. I was under the impression that when I got to Machu Picchu Station, I could eat at the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge, but the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge and the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge Buffet are in TWO DIFFERENT LOCATIONS. Belmond Sanctuary Lodge is located at Machu Picchu Train Station, Belmond Sanctuary Lodge Buffet is located AT Machu Picchu (outside of entrance, you have to take the bus there). The Buffet is only open from 11am-3pm, keep that in mind as I thought I booked it for Saturday, but arrived at 4pm and was required to use the voucher the following day.
train travel in peru vistadome Inca rail. this was a very very enjoyable travel the views the service with snacks and drinks that are included beauiful views and relaxing, very helpful staff

Extraordinary views! . This train ride through the Peruvian countryside was spectacular! I took Peru Rail twice during my Peruvian vacation and loved both trips. Not only was there excellent food provided, but the entertainment, including a fashion show, were amazing!

A Must Do!. PeruRail provided such a delightful experience when journeying to Machu Picchu. This train has wonderful accommodations, great service, and exciting entertainment. The layout of the train allows for all customers to see the stunning scenery throughout the entire ride.
Better than expected. Didn't think the train would be upto much but I was wrong was comfy, modern and you get a bite to eat on the journey and the views are great nice staff aswell.

Fun! . My partner and I did the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Poroy. We were sweaty and tired from finishing a 4 day tour. Perurail was just what we needed. The staff was great and the scenery was amazing! Worth the extra money to up grade!
Scenic train trip to Machu Pichu. Excellent- much more comfortable than I expected- even with a (limited) trolley service!!About an hour through lovely scenery made better with the glass roof-sides.

Best Entertainment Even. So, we took the vistadome to Macchu Picchu. On our way back we were treated to a folkloric Sagra dance and then a fashion show. It was hysterical, and the staff really performed. A high recommend for entertainment after a long day of hiking around Macchu Picchu.

Pleasant Train Ride to Machu Picchu. Beats the heck out of a “train ride from hell” we had in Europe several years ago!This was pleasant, comfortable and uneventful – which is what you want from a train ride!

Scenic train. It's a great ride to Machu Picchu. You travel for about 4 hours through a wonderful valley, on a comfortable ride. You get a nice meal and the service is great. I took the vistadome I the way there and the expedition the way back. The main difference is the food. The only downside is the prices, as you are traveling to a massive touristic site, they charge you as they please.

Expensive but Pleasant, Relaxing Ride to Machu Picchu. We purchased our tickets on Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes online through the Perurail website and paid with PayPal – a very quick and easy process. Our tickets were USD65 per person which is quite expensive in comparison for what it is; basically a 90 minute train ride with a small snack and a drink included. (We received a very tiny vegetable salad – about half a cup size– a fruit and a juice). The nice big windows are great. The landscape was interesting, but if there was any other way to get to Machu Picchu, you wouldn’t miss out. We were excitedly anticipating the fashion show and Andean dancers, but only realized afterwards that those only happen on the return trip from Machu Picchu and not on the trip TO Machu Picchu. If I knew that, I would have booked it the other way around (although, when I checked their website afterwards, it does state that in the small print at the bottom…) The seats were spacious and comfortable and they’re group together in fours (two groups of two people facing each other over a small table). We met a lovely and very interesting young Brazilian couple and we chatted all the way to Aguas Calientes! As we were staying two nights in Aguas Calientes, we needed to take luggage in excess of the allowed weight on the train, and it was very easy to get approval by Email prior to our trip. That said, no one checked or questioned our luggage… Announcements on the stations are only in Spanish (and not very audible) and there are no electronic arrival or departure boards, so we could not understand what was going on or where we had to go, but the staff were very friendly and helpful, so we just asked them and managed to get on the right train at the right time.

Great way to see the country. What a great train ride and the organic coffee is really amazing. You are transported along the tracks besides the river all the way to the bottom of Machu Picchu, friendly porters and comfortable leather seats. Try get the forward facing seats.

Nice way to see the country side. . The service on the Vistadome was great. The peddling of goods is a little annoying. The food was good and the scenery was even better. Only bad parts: it's goes SLOW, they play music which gets a little old and when they peddle the playing cards and 3D views of MP, that was a bit much (the fashion show on the way back was entertaining though). We met people who also rode the Expedition and they said it was terrible. So pay the extra $ and go Vistadome.

Beautiful ride to Machu Picchu, excellent attention. We just returned from our unforgettable vacation to Peru. There were six people on our party including my 78 year old father who needed extra help getting around. We took the vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and after two days in Machu Picchu we took the train back to Poroy. The PeruRail staff was very professional and attentive, specially Alfredo Del Castillo, who went out of his way to make our trip as pleasant, comfortable and, as a bonus, informative. We were fortunate that he was also working on our way back. Mr. Del Castillo periodically made his rounds and made sure every ones needs were being met. We were left to sit back and enjoy the beautiful scenery. I would definitely recommend using PeruRail again. I'm planning to come back to Macchu Pichu in a couple of years, this time with my wife and daughters, and I will definitely look for Mr. Del Castillo and the rest of the staff.

Machu Picchu . Great service, amazing views, good snacks!!! Positive experience!!!! Cute fashion show and shows in general!! Thanks!! You just have to change the way to pay for tickets, it was a nightmare!!!
Nice ride with overlooking scenery.. Good ride in mountains with lots of views. In train service was good. The staff was friendly. Nice entertainment with shopping.

Stunning scenery and lovely staff. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and after our day in Machu Picchu back to Poroy. PeruRail made the trip an unforgettable experience. The train itself is wonderful, clean, lots of space, great views and the staff is ever so friendly. Everything is well organised. The scenery is truly spectacular and this is by far one of the best train journeys we ever had. Golden memory.

Buy your own tickets online - don't pay agency fees to do it for you!. In June a group of friends and I went to Machu Picchu and we decided to go via PeruRail's VistaDome train. I purchased our train tickets (x4) for the VistaDome train about two months ahead of time online. I paid for the tickets and received a confirmation and also instructions for how to pick them up from one of PeruRail's official stands/locations. The tickets were each about $100 (one-way). You do not need any travel agency's help to reserve or to purchase these tickets. Super easy to accomplish. The train ride was very nice, scenic, and comfortable. That said, I do have a few comments/critiques:1) There is no vegetarian "main" snack option - only meat. Seems basic - why not have a vegetarian snack option available?2) If the person sitting behind you with their back to you just happens to lean back their seat all the way before you do, you will not be able to lean back your seat at all, and it will be stuck in a fully upright position.3) If you can reserve and pay for your PeruRail VistaDome train ticket all online...why cannot you just print up your actual ticket as well? Not having a printed up ticket, and having to find the PeruRail kiosk in the Lima airport in between connecting flights (or having to go early to the train station) was not a simple task, and considering everything else we had going on, it was one more thing to worry about doing. Make it so you can print you ticket out after paying for it online. Simple. 4) Offer passengers beer and wine immediately upon boarding...don't wait until there are 25 minutes left in the train ride to bring out the liquor cart and try to sell a few drinks! This one is elementary! We were so disappointed to see the cart come out when it did. (On our way back from Aguas Calientes we made sure to ask right away for the drink options...)Note - the Cusco train station (named: Poroy Station) is about a 30 minute cab ride from the central square area of Cusco. Make sure to give yourself enough time to make your train departure!

Forced tourism . First of all you need to fork out $94 USD, all about, for the cheapest ticket to get to Machu Picchu. Then the train is slow and I was very tired from leaving Lima so early. The staff are lovely and the food was mediocre (baby banana, mandarin, stale cake and semi toasted roll). The views are nice but for that price... And it's the only and cheapest way. Great
Tren. Its a beautiful ride through the mountains of Peru, we rode it for 3 n half hrs from Puroy to Machu Picchu. Good service from staff and snacks a drinks as well.

Slow but nice!. We traveled from Aguas Calientas to Cusco.Yes it took a while as we sometimes had to wait for other trains to pass but is was a comfortable and very pleasant ride.We got coffee, tea and snacks. The service was very friendly! and we enjoyed the lovely view!

We really enjoyed the views from the windows. We took the vistadome train from Poroy to Aguas Caliente to visit Machu Picchu. We caught the first train of the day leaving at 6:40. The train journey takes nearly 4 hours, but we enjoyed the journey very much. The seating is comfortable and there is a WC at the end of the carriage. The staffing ratio to passengers is very good and the staff look very professional in their uniform. The journey is not cheap our seats cost $82 each for the journey to Aguas Caliente and $86 for the return. Costs vary depending on day and time of day. We were served a light meal on both legs of our journey and a drink. The staff did come round with souvenirs to buy on the outward journey and held a fashion show with Alpaca clothing, which was also for sale, on the return journey. There was also a dancer in each carriage on the return journey. This was lots of fun. The main highlight of the journey though was the scenery we passed through and the amazing views we had through the large picture windows both at the side and in the roof of the train. Passengers who were facing forwards seemed to have better views and found it easier to take photos of some of the scenery. Our return journey was only partly in daylight, because we just had a day trip to Machu Picchu. For anybody who stays longer try and book a train which travels in daylight hours, or perhaps save some money by booking the cheaper Expedition train if travelling in darkness. Be aware that some dates sell out quickly so you will need to book in advance. We did feel the train ride added to what was a very special day visiting Machu Picchu.

The only way to travel to MACHU Picchu. Enjoyed the scenery for two hours with glass surrounding our train. Breakfast and dinner included. It was worth it. Music, dancing and a fashion show. Saved energy for the Machu Picchu hike tour which took us three hours.

Train to MP. We took PeruRail to MP. Although it is three hours there and back from Cuzco, the time went by rather quickly. The train is very clean and nice. The views on the way to MP are great (was dark on the way back) and the crew does a great job entertaining you onboard. They offer a snack both ways which is simple but nice. Best way to MP!

'Certainly not Amtrak. The panoramic views are memorable, the coaches are spotless, and the service is great. And, during the trip, there are little pluses that make time fly by like live music and a fashion show. The clothing can be purchased on the train and, if they run out of an item (which they did), they tell you exactly where you can purchase it in town (which we did). Fun!

Great way to travel. We recently stayed in the Sacred Valley for a few days and then took the train to Cusco. It was a great way to travel up to Machu Picchu. Scenery was beautiful, staff very attentive and train was clean and comfortable. It was a nice way to break up the trip to Machu Picchu by coming from the Sacred Valley (shorter train ride). Then we took the train back from Machu Picchu to Cusco (which is about 3 hours). The fun part about the ride back, was the fashion show by the train staff. The sweaters were beautiful and the staff really did a great job. Be sure to buy then as we couldn't find the sweaters they wore in the stores when we got to Cusco. Overall, highly recommend

Terrible experience, waste of money. They blared Andean music the entire 5 hour trip. This was maddening. I was horrified by the dancing clown and fashion show. For this portion they blared the music so loud I could hear it through headphones. I just wanted to relax and get some rest after Machu Picchu but I felt that I was disturbed the entire trip.I could not believe that we paid so much for this train that has the same seating type and leg room as the Expedition train. For 5 hours my knees were bumping against a complete stranger's. I surely thought for that much money we would have more comfortable accommodations. I even had an aisle seat but I could not stretch my legs because the staff were CONSTANTLY in the aisles trying to sell things. The snack was barely edible, and we left it largely uneaten. The air condition was so poorly managed that we couldn't see out the vistadome because the cabin temperature created so much fog on the windows. This is the whole point of Vistadome. Ultimately, I just wanted to relax on this 5 hour journey, and it was impossible for me to do so because of the awful seating conditions and constant interruptions and disturbances. What a terrible waste of money. I wish we had taken another train and then the combi back to Cusco. At least my knees would have been against a seat and not a stranger's, and it would have been much much faster.
Excellent service. Elma, Begonia and Alfredo were very courteous and friendly, giving us the best service. They take care of our needs and went beyond to make our trip pleasant.

Best way from Ollanta Station to Machu Picchu. When we were young, hiking the trail to Machu Picchu would have been the best way hands down. Fast forward to this senior age and the Vistadome was the best way! The ride travels through the foggy peaks and valleys seeing the actual trail weave in and around. Service was better on the train than it is in most US airlines...no kidding!

Semi-Luxurious Experience!. Perurail's vistadome experience has been hyped so much on the web that we couldn't help but booking our onward journey (Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes) in Vistadome but, our return journey was in regular Expedition service. Both train services have the panoramic windows. So don't get carried away the only vistadome has it. Of course the vistadome windows were a little bit more luxurious, but the overall experience the same in both train services. Vista dome provides snacks (one croissant + one banana + coffee) in a glass plate and cup, whereas Expedition service provides a local biscuit and coffee in plastic cup. The seats are luxurious in both train services. All-in-all, if you are looking to spend more in insignificant luxury items, then opt for Vistadome, otherwise Expedition service is equally good and cheaper.
Great experiences.. Lovely ride thru Peru. Slow but u get a good service while u take pictures and enjoying the view. Very comfortable and also luxurious.

Peru trains. Well thus us old style travel, guys with near frock coats, seeing you at check in through to some riding the reins. Lake titi caca to Cusco , ten hours, great food, entertainment and that glass carriage. A must do on your trip

Worth taking to Machu Picchu!. Perurail provided timely & systematic service for the approx. 3 hour long trip, including a lovely light snack & souvenir shopping opportunity. Impressive views and comfortable ride along with 2 stops for trekkers going on the Incan Trail and at Ollyantaytambo.

Vistadome train schedule from MP. My wife and I wanted to change our tickets back from Aguascalientes to Cusco but could not find a schedule on line for the life of us. I took a photo at the station and posted it in here for your viewing pleasure- Good Luck!

Graciousness, 5 stars. Vivian, Enrique and Saul treated us like royalty on the ride from Machu Pichu back to Cuzco. They were friendly, gracious, kind and made the experience special. They did a great job with the fashion show and in ride entertainment, which was a special treat. Thank you so much.

Nice comfortable ride to AC to visit MP. Very comfortable ride on this train. Journey takes about 1.5 hrs from Ollantaytambo to AC and you are served a snack along the way. On the ride there, they bring out different Peruvian goods for you to look at and purchase if you want to and on the return, they had a fashion show with different Alpaca woven items. There is no obligation to purchase anything, so that was good. Since this is a Vistadome train, it has large windows on the ceiling for a better view of the surround areas. The Vistadome had the times we were looking for, so I chose this type of train, but not sure the price for this type of car is really worth it. I will say that the seats were comfortable.

Machu Picchu to Cusco. We traveled with Peru Rail - Vistadome from Machu Picchu to Cusco. We were hesitant in paying the extra for this service as the previous expedition service was nice enough, clean and the staff lovely but this was definitely worth the extra money. The staff went above and beyond for us in our carriage, some delicious food and drink was served and the carriage itself was excellent, with large windows on the roof to take in the landscape and very comfortable seats.

the best train ride of my life. on our way back from machu picchu, was suprised by this amazing staff and great atmosphere. fashion show was un expected but totally worth it, they really know how to make a train ride fun at peru rail. Felipe is the man
Good views. We took this train to Machu pichu and backThe service was good and they entertained us with a fashion show and some local dance

Transportation to Machu Piccu. . Great way to travel from Cusco to Machu Piccu. The cars were very comfortable with tables. Great Air conditioned and very clean environment. The staff was more than helpful.

Comfort with a view . We enjoyed the ride. But could do without the airline style sales pitches for silly trinkets and duty free goods. The staff is courteous and served us with a smile. But then they changed their airline style uniforms and donned silly hats and travel vests to peddle souvenirs and alcohol. I guess when every other inch of the country is selling tourist trinkets then the railroad has to try and get in on the action too. :)

Great service . We used this train service June 10 from poroy station to Aguas Calientes. And June 14 again from Aguas Calientes to poroy station. Overall...the ride takes about 3.30 hrs each way.
