They provided a lunch each way. Great food. And of course...nice service. No...complains here. Keep up the good work Perurail.
Pleasant surprise. Like riding 1st class. Meal included even though not listed. The staff friendly and helpful. The seats reclined and were comfortable. Bring sunglasses!

Great Service and Beautiful Views. The Visatadome train is a great way to travel between Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes or whatever your route may be. The service was excellent, the food tasty and the views were spectacular. It is pricey but worth it in my opinion and a very luxurious way to ride there. I would say that you could save money and take the normal expedition train back though--it is sort of a novelty that I didn't feel I needed more than once.

Worthwhile train ride!. We definitely enjoyed this train ride! I've ridden the Backpacker wagon before and this Vistadome wagon was definitely worth the extra money. We had a comfortable ride with excellent service. The staff was top notch! You can't find this great a service even in one of the most fancy restaurants. I can't say enough to praise the staff's training. The views from the train were also very good. The only point for improvement is perhaps the ventilation system, which at times lets a little too much engine smoke into the cabin. But once alerted to that the staff seemed to take care of it. Overall, a great ride!

Nice trip to Aguas Calientes. I had the experience going from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes with Vistadome and returning to Ollantaytambo with Expedition and for me, Vistadome is better ( expedition it's fine but small wagons that moves so bad!). Have good service, ok snacks, and wonderful views from windows. I bought tickets from their website without any problem. I will pick them for sure on my next trip to Cusco.

The train ride back from Machu Picchu. On 26/04/16, we took the Vistadome train back to our car so that we could travel on to Cusco. Our tour guide made the travel arrangements. After riding the Hiram Bingham train up to Machu Picchu, we were a little disappointed that we wouldn't be taking that lovely train back. However, the train we were on, Train #VTD302, was really lovely. The staff could not have been more attentive, especially Giulissa, who took great pains to see that we were in a roomy car and not sitting on the extremely sunny side of the car! I would recommend this way of travel to anyone making this trip back off the mountain!

Excellent. Good organised, excellent service on boardvery clean , you just have to sit down and relax it take some time but changing scenery makes it interesting, there are some suprises there on the back ride so you havo to prepare your cameras!

Fun, Comfortable. This is how travel used to be. Wonderful staff with big smiles. They served us beverages and fruit on the way up and a slice of pizza and a glass of wine on the way back. Sit on the left side as that is where the excellent ruins are. What a fun way to get to Machu Picchu.One the way back, the attendants put on a wonderful fashion show.The train is narrow gauge track, with some seats facing forward and others backward. Our assignments were sitting 'backwards' and although I worried I might get sick, I was very comfortable.

Good but not Great. We caught the train to and from Machu Picchu as almost everyone does. The window panels in the roof of the train and high window line give it it's name. The issue is that half the seats face backwards and also if your on the side of the train that's against the hills/mountains you don't really see the best views.If you're going to Machu Picchu it's part of the package and you just have to accept whatever luck comes your way. If you want to go just for the train trip I would say other train trips are better.Having said that the service is good and the seats comfortable.On the way back the staff put on a show and then a fashion parade after which they try to sell you the clothes.

If you enjoy rail travel, then this is for you!. After staying in Cusco and then travelling to the Sacred Valley,( where we stayed one night near Ollantaytambo), we took the Vista train from the station at Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes (for Machu Picchu).Our return train was booked on our behalf by Condor Travel, who arranged the pick up to the station where we were met by a Condor Travel guide, who made sure that we had our tickets stamped - you have to arrive at the station at least half an hour before departure to get your tickets stamped. We met someone in Cusco who had arrived too late at the station and hadn't been able to board the train....It is a surprisingly well run operation, the train left on time, the seats are allocated for you, although we didn't get a choice - there was a clear boarding protocol, with the carriages being called individually, plenty of announcements, the staff were polite, spoke good English and were very smartly dressed (a little like airline crew). The train was clean and tidy, there are big windows to look out at the beautiful passing scenery and you get served a light snack (no choice) and drink. There is also on the two hour train journey the inevitable opportunity to buy scarves and gifts, although no pressure to buy.The train pulls into the station, where the hotel staff from our hotel met us and took our overnight bag - something we didn't realise is that you can only take an overnight bag (carry on suitcase / pack pack) on the train, there is no room for large luggage on the train, so we left our main luggage at the hotel where we stayed the previous night near Ollantaytambo and Condor travel arranged to collect it on our behalf and transfer it to our next hotel (after Machu Picchu) - it all worked very well. Our guide then met us at the station and took us immediately to Machu Picchu.We stayed the night at the Inkatera hotel right by the train station and then returned the next day on the Vista train, which returns to a station called Poroy (for Cusco), it was a 15 minute taxi transfer to get to our hotel in the centre of Cusco - the train back takes much longer, three and a half hours, it's a slow pace of travel, there is the inevitable opportunity to buy more woollen jumpers and capes on the way back when you are entertained by a 'fashion show' - there was a complimentary light snack and drinks served.It's worth factoring the three and a half hour return journey into your day, our train left at 5.00 pm, so by the time we arrived in Cusco, checked into our hotel, it was later in the evening before we had chance to get dinner.

Worth the money!. Peru rail offers Vistadome service from Poroy to Machu Picchu Pueblo/ Agua Calientes. (Both names are used for the little hamlet near the great Inka ruins). Although you can take the cheaper expedition or the much more expensive Hiram Bingham, this is the train to take! On the train they will serve you a light meal, followed by a beverage service and also some souvenir shopping. On the return trip they actually conducted a Fashion show and a dance show in the aisles that you could watch from your rather comfortable seats.During the daytime, the views from the train are quite spectacular and will give you a very good understanding of several climate zones that you go through as you approach Machu Picchu.Overall, very enjoyable experience.

Very nice ride. We arrived in Cusco at 4:30am on a Cruz Del Sur bus from Puno. We were concerned there would not be enough time to find a taxi at the Cusco bus station and drive the 30 minutes to Poroy. The train tickets are non refundable within 24 hours. There was no problem. We booked the Vistadome train from Poroy, Peru to Agua Calientes. Our train left early in the morning, at 6:40 am. The staff is extremely polite and well dressed. All speak English.As we planned to stay in Agua Calientes overnight it was necessary for us to take our luggage on the train. I contacted Peru rail baggage department and given permission to transport baggage on the Vistadome.As our train tickets were purchased online we had no opportunity to select our seats. We were given tickets in the A car, or first car. The staff, seeing the train was rather empty, put us in the D car. This was advantageous to us, as we did not suffer the 3-4 hours of diesel fumes.The ride is lovely in the morning. The Vistadome is very comfortable. They serve a small snack.
Lovely Slow Train _ Peru Rail. its a slow enjoying journey passing through peruvians towns. one of the best train journeys you'll take

Spectacular views. We took the train to and from Machu Picchu. The seating is set up that there are 2 seats facing a small table and 2 more seats facing the same table. Thereby, you may make the entire train ride face to face with strangers. It's kind of weird and off-putting, but we survived. They provide a lunch consisting of a small banana, a small piece of sheet cake and a sandwich. There isn't much room at your seat for luggage, but behind your seat, accessible from the aisle, you can usually store a backpack or duffle bag. The train was clean and had a bathroom conveniently located.
Not worth the money . Very expensive for what they offer also considering it's the only way to get to macchu picchu. I didn't like the fashion show. You just want to rest or enjoy the landscape.

Great views, great staff, great entertainment!. Travelled on the Vistadome train from Machu Picchu to Ollytaytambo, spectacular views but what made the trip even more memorable were the staff, they entertained us all the way. Firstly with a snack then with a hilarious dance by one of the crew in traditional dress. Finally with a fashion show of alpaca wear performed by two of the staff, this was very proffessional and although the garments were for sale there was no pressure put on the travellers

Beautiful scenery ok train. Buying tickets on the web from overseas is relatively simple but then they require a personal pickup of the train tickets at their Rail office - unless you are wandering all over town in Lima, not the easiest place to get to, but if you are flying into Cusco, don't forget to pick it up at the airport near the baggage carousel - else, find the office at the main square in Cusco - bottom line, one more item to do administratively.The train is comfortable, either 4 seats around a table or 2 seater. The scenery is beautiful on the way out from Poroy to Agua Calientes. Cost about 40 soles to catch a cab from Cusco to Poroy - and might as well arrange with the same cab to pick you up on the way back if you are coming back that evening. The train heater system is wonky - seems like they turn it on till gets warm, then turn it off till it gets cold, and repeat... nothing in between.... and sitting in the first carriage behind the engine, the ac sucked some of the diesel smoke into the cabin - we could smell the smoke. We left early in the morning, so the windows outside were cold, and with the heat blasting in the cabin, the windows fogged up quickly - we had to clean it often to see outside, but the windows seem to be dusty as the cleaning seems to smudge the window, making taking photos thru the windows a chore.The trains are on narrow tracks so the swaying is more pronounced than on the wider tracked trains. Loud but not too noisy, we can hear the train clacking away. Service was good - we were served food and drinks, and on the way back, the crew put on a mini fashion show to sell their alpaca sweaters, etc.It is a long journey to AC, mainly because the train travels at a moderate speed. The other option is to go from Ollantaytambo but that meant an over 1 hr taxi ride from Cusco to Ollantaytambo - it is either a combination of a longer train ride + shorter taxi ride to Poroy (<30 mins) vs a shorter train ride + longer taxi ride to Ollantaytambo (>1 hr) ... cost aside, given the road conditions, probably the shorter the car ride the better, I suppose.
Return trip from Machu Picchu . Great experience. The crew did performances to entertain us. And the food served was quality. The views were amazing. For sure with the extra for the comfort

"Amazing landscape". The Vistadome is a comfortable way to see the amazing landscape between Cusco and Machu Picchu. Assuming the weather is good and there isn't too much condensation on the train windows, it's great for taking pictures. It is important to note that this train is expensive and relatively slow, but the point is to see the sights and to learn about them, not to get to your destination as quickly as possible. The announcements in English and Spanish explain the significance of the towns and other locations as you pass through them, which makes the journey even more interesting. On our trip, the employees in our car, Zelena, Marco Antonio, and Saul, were especially helpful. They were friendly and happy to answer our questions. Zelena seemed very informed and gave us a lot of suggestions on hiking Machu Picchu and on tourism in Peru in general. I would highly recommend Vistadome. It's well worth the money for the views and the service.

Super train ride with beautiful views. It's a relatively long train ride from Cusco to Agua Calientes (for Machu Picchu) and the Vistadome train enables one to make the most of it with wonderful views - the river on one side and mountain range on the other. Both sides offer great views and it really is personal taste as to whether one side is better than the other.From our experience we observe two important aspects. The early morning cold air can leave the windows misted and therefore obscure the view - those in the know brought a towel to wipe the windows. Our seats were booked by our agent so I don't know whether one has any say on the seats allocated but both times we were seated at the first table in the carriage so could not really get a glimpse of what was to come which made it difficult to prepare for any specific photo opportunities. A seat towards the middle of the carriage might be better for that. There still seems to be a great deal of doubt over what one can take on board in the way of luggage with the expectation being one small bag or rucksack each. There is a small space for large luggage at the end of the carriage so assuming only a few people bring something larger it can be accommodated. I have a small rucksack for camera equipment so took that plus a small rucksack with my overnight stuff. There was no problem taking those two items on board. Such baggage can fit between the seats or under one's seat.Service was great and the fashion show fun too. So not just the best way to get where one is going but a great experience too.

Nice train but super slow and horribly expensive. A monopoly by Peru rail to visit the much coveted Machu Pichu the experience is not even close to the amount it costs. Try sitting in direction of travel.

Vista dome train to Aguas Calliente. Very nice ride. The train track is in good repair judging from the smooth ride. Windows were clean in upper ceiling corners to provide for optimal viewing. Scenery of mountains and river are spectacular. Snack was served at round half way point. It was tasty and professionally prepared. The train was spotless inside and out, kind of pretty actually. Staff were polite and helpful.

Good views and comfortable. We did the journey from poroy to Machu Picchu pueblo and back. Stunning views on the way there with a nice train p, making the journey comfortable. Breakfast a bit disappointing but dinner on the way back was better. Could be offered a few more drinks or snacks for the money. Staff were very friendly and attentive with fun entertainment provided by Fernando, Felipe and Veronica on the way back with their fashion show and bird dance. Overall a comfortable way to get there but very expensive.

The Vistadome. A beautiful ride to Machu Picchu. The train staff Nestor, Adriana, and Jhon were friendly, and a lot of fun. We even had a fashion show. They served a snack and drinks, the train is clean and the view during the ride is beautiful.

Vistadome worth it. On our trip up to Aguas Calientes we took the Vistadome car with Peru Rail and were impressed with not just the sites, but especially the service. The attendants were very attentive and brought us very tasty food to drink. On the way back from 2 days at Machu Picchu we opted to take the Expedition class car vs the Vistadome. It was interesting because the Expedition car itself had the same 'vista' windows as the Vistadome. The difference was in the decor - with the Expedition being a more basic version vs the Vistadome had been a more upscale decor. The other difference was the service or, in particular the food offerings. On the Expedition they brought the standard cracker/carb option prepackaged items, whereas on the Vistadome it was not packaged items, but plated. We were tired on the way back, and had a lovely time visiting with a couple from England, so the differences weren't that big a deal to us, but if that kind of thing is important to you, this may give you an idea of the difference between Vistadome and Expedition.
Lots of fun. Took the train from Agua Calientes to Poroy. Great service, kept us entertained with dancers and a fashion show. That and a great view (until it got dark)

A good option. The vistadome leaving Ollataytambo has a good schedule and it has better service and slightly better views than the cheaper trains. The alpaca fashions that they sell returning from Aguas Calientes turn out to be very competitively priced--much to my surprise.

Vista Dome VIP Seats!!. Comfortable seat, amazing views, fun entertainment by (3) crew members and a fashion show, it was fun having to see them change from one outfit to another, 1minute bellman, next server and the fashion shows stars.Our booking was made thru Alpaca expeditions for all 5 of us. Thank you so much!

Nice view. However it is expensive for what it offers, it's a nice experience, we traveled from Ollantaytambo (90km) far away from Cusco after the Valle Sagrado visit and we caught The train to Águas calientes 7 pm The night before to The visit to The city and we returned in The morning after our visit to Machu Picchu, The view during The day is amazing and very nice. I enjoyed The ride.

Great way to travel. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and the return to Cusco. Tickets were easy to buy online. We picked them up at Lorcamar mall in Lima. The ride was comfortable with food and drink just like an airplane. There are a lot of comments about how little luggage you are allowed online. We saw some pretty big suitcases and didn't see anyone charged or turned away. Maybe it's different in the peak season. The views are amazing, as if you've entered Jurassic Park. On the train to Cusco there were people costumed as Inca deities and a fashion show with the crew showing off goods that can be bought there. We had a really good time as the staff were very friendly and relaxed.

Great tour. The train is super clean as well as the stations. Boarding is a little disorganized but it is not so bad. Be sure to book your seats together. The service is good, attention on the train is as good as you will get anywhere. Be sure to bring your passport - you need it in Machu Pichu.

You haven't seen mountains until now!. The only way to the Machu Piichu site is by train and it is well-worth choosing the more expensive Vistadome version and the views are outstanding. It is a slow train but there is a snack and drinks service incorporated in the price.The route from Cusco to Machu Piichu is downhill and follows the river most of the way, with spectacular views of mountains and river rapids.The return journey (for us) was mostly in the dark and it was pretty obviously uphill from the tone of the labouring engine!

Great experience. Good organization, even though they gave us tickets on separate cars, the employees helped us great and we ended together (4 members). Very nice personel, specially Linda and Fernando, had a blast time on the train, sharp schedule and very comfortable. Our experience in the Vistadome was awesome.Try to get the left side on your way to Aguascalientes since has a nicer view. Get at the train station at least 30min before departure.

Scenic Train Ride. We stayed in Ollyantambo and took the train to Aguas Callientes to visit Machu Picchu. The train ride was comfortable and on time...absolutely beautiful views of the mountains and valley.The train ride was fun...they provide a snack and also an entertaining fashion show. Once you arrive in Aguas Callentes, it is a 25 minute bus ride to the entrance of Machu Picchu.
Wow. Love that train trip, the train wagons were really comfortable, the crew amazing. .....love them, al the most important thing. ...the view.....wow....definitely a must see..
Pleasant ride. PeruRail is like being in a plane...on land. Comfortable train ride. Amazing views. Lots of storage space. I have zero qualms with this specific mode of transportation.

Great views of Sacred Valley on the way to Machu Picchu. I had a misconception that you could take the train all the way to Machu Picchu. That is not true. The train takes you to the town of Aguas Calientes which is in the valley below Machu Picchu. Then you take a bus from Aguas Calientes to get to Machu Picchu. The buses run every 10 minutes during operating hours, and the trip to/from Machu Picchu takes about 23 minutes on the switchbacks up and down the mountain.There are several classes of train service, each a little nicer and more expensive. You can take a local train, the Expedition train (akin to second class), the Vistadome train (akin to first class), or the Hiram Bingham train (luxury train, runs on a limited schedule). My wife and I took the Vistadome train from the Ollantaytambo station to Aguas Calientes, and back (several days later).Our travel agent in the US arranged for tickets with pre-reserved seats. If you can, sit in the "A" car, because you have unobstructed views in the direction of the train. You can see out the sides and top of each car. There are some magnificent views in the Sacred Valley! We were served a snack on each trip. Some tour groups pre-arranged for special snacks. On our return trip, we were treated to a mini-fashion show and some costumed entertainers. Plan to arrive 30 minutes before your train is scheduled to leave. You can start boarding 10-15 minutes in advance. When you leave Machu Picchu, our travel agent told us to allow about 1.5 hours to get from Machu Picchu to the train station at Aguas Calientes. That gives you plenty of time in case of minor, unforeseen delays. It is possible to change your train tickets to a different time, if there are still available seats (or you can take the local train or the Expedition train, which have no pre-reserved seats).PeruRail personnel take care of your big luggage pieces on each train. You give the luggage to them outside your train car, and they take care of loading and securing the luggage on the train. When you arrive, they take the bags off, and you pick them up on the platform outside the train car. (Be sure to tip for their helpful service!). There are places behind the seats where you can stow your smaller bags. There are generally tables on each side of the train, with 4 passengers at a table, 2 facing forwards, and 2 facing backwards. At the very front of the train car, there is a space for just 2 passengers. There are restrooms at one end of each train car. The Vistadome train is a pleasant and relaxing way to get transported to the special place known as Machu Picchu.

Beautiful views, very entertaining, but slow. Our first trip on Vistadome was from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. It was about an hour and a half and included a snack and a drink. We had a front-row view of the mountains, streams and local villages, and it was gorgeous! Despite what other people told us, they had plenty of room for our suitcases (we each had a purse, a carry-on and a large suitcase). So that shouldn't be a problem.On the train back from AC to Cusco, which is about 4 hours, they fed us again, allowed us to open our own bottle of wine, and they even held a fashion show that lasted about 15-20 minutes! The staff were very sassy and they showed off some beautiful alpaca sweaters and coats. While I didn't buy them, it was actually a ton of fun, we all laughed and applauded, and it helped pass the time! The only small annoyance is how slow the train goes (about 20mph) - while it's great for scenic viewing, if you're looking to save time and get from point A to point B quickly, you might want to find a different mode of transportation.
Great train journey.. This was a lovely way to start our journey to Machu Pichu. The scenery was spectacular and the large windows made it even better.

Great experience from Cusco to Machu Picchu. We took the PeruRail Vistadome from Poroy to Machu Picchu (Aguas Calientes) on May 26 at 8:25AM. We purchased the tickets online on April 4th. The online ticket purchase was painless. Only thing is that they automatically assign seats. We were assigned seats A1 and A2 and I was very excited based on other tripadvisor reviews (alas!). A taxi picked us up from our hotel on Av El Sole at 7:30AM and we reached the Poroy station at 7:53am. Pory is about 8 miles from Ave El Sole in historic Cusco. The taxi fare was 35 Soles. There was already a line to enter the platform when we reached the Poroy station. After entering the platform, the attendants guided us to our compartment A, which was the first compartment after the engine. The attendants checked our passports and tickets. They also loaded our luggage at this time and put it on the luggage racks. Here is an interesting variation from what I was expecting. Based on Tripadvisor reviews of Vistadome, I was expecting to sit at the front of the train next to the driver. Our seats numbers were A1 and A2. Other tripadvisor reviewers mentioned that seats A1 and A2 are the best. But for our trains (both outbound and inbound) the seats are not so great. The trains have engines in front of them and seats A1 and A2 are at the back of the compartment with walls limiting visibility. By the way, I did see trains passing us where the seats A1 and A2 are next to the drivers (engine numbers 222, 221). I am not sure which trains are those. Anyway, the view from the trains are spectacular! The best seats would be in the middle of the compartment, on the left side outbound and on the right side inbound. They do provide "snacks" within the first hour of the journey. And it is "Snacks", as mentioned in Peru Rail website. They did not say it is lunch or dinner and please do not complain that it is not a big meal. The train reached Machu Picchu station at 12:25PM. Our inbound train was at 3:20PM in the afternoon and our seat numbers were 17 ann 18. These seats are in better positions, but you face the back of the train. It got dark within two hours but you still see a lot.

Classy train ride to Machu Picchu. A fun ride on a newer, clean & comfortable train car. Four passengers facing each other on 2 bench seats, share a folding table. It's a nice way to meet fellow travelers. Colorful locally woven mats are placed on the table. The attendants then serve a snack and beverage. The train tracks follow the picturesque Urubamba river bed to the quaint town of Aguas Calientes. Ancient terraces and a bridge abutment can be seen on the banks. On our return trip, we were entertained with music & dancing and a fashion show. A memorable train ride!

Train journeys to remember. We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu on Perurail and then back to Cusco . Separately we travelled from Cusco to Puno on Perurail a 10 1/2 hour journey. The trains were comfortable the staff on the trains and indeed at the stations were very efficient and very professional. This was quite an experience as train travel is usually an endurance! The staff cannot be praised highly enough for their care and attention to detail.

Great views, extremely friendly staff. I took the train roundtrip ~ Pachar station/Aguas Calientes ~ and it was an excellent experience all around. The train itself has huge windows that allow for scenic views on both sides. Very clean with comfortable seats with plenty of storage space for bags. A great snack is served on both trips. The staff were very helpful and friendly. A special thank you to Blake who helped me with some ideas of places to see in Cusco that were off the typical tourist routes as well as making sure my taxi was there to pick me up at Pachar. Exemplary customer service! Highly recommended.
Train. Loved the train ride... Soo much to see. Beautiful mountains and tons of ruins. Snack was delicious. Waiters were very nice

Great views from Aguas Calientas to Cusco. This trip is all about the views. The train itself is good enough because of its large picture windows. You sit at a table either by yourself or facing another couple. We were lucky to be seated by ourselves. You're served a drink and a snack, and then later on there is entertainment by costumed performers and then a fashion show of alpaca knits that you're asked to purchase. The bathroom is adequate, but rather barebones. The one suggestion I have is not to take the last train leaving from Aquas Calientas because it gets dark rather early and you would miss the gorgeous views. I would also try to sit on the right side of the train on the way to Cusco for the best views of the river and the surrounding mountains.

Ceiling widows needed to view towering mountains!. We took the train in a relaxed journey from (near) Cusco to Aguascalientes. Very scenic and good service from the attendants.My only hint would be to suggest to try and book a seat facing forward rather than backwards as we had. We tended to miss the photogenic scenes unless we constantly turned around, which was annoying after a while.

Reliable and fun service. Clean, ran on time, with fashion show and entertainment on return to Sacred Valley. Cost not too bad. Train stewards all speak really good English. Also the train made a brief stop at our hotel (Belmond Sacred Valley) and picked us up. Talk about convenient.

A relaxing trip from Machu Picchu to Cusco. Ok, so the train had a fault and ran even slower than scheduled, and it stops at Poroy which is not quite Cusco- but it was still an enjoyable way to do the trip.Scheduled at 3.5 hours it actually took 4 to cover 57 miles. But you get reserved comfortable seats, snacks, drinks and even a fashion show!  And the point of the vistadome (or glass windows in the roof) is so that you can see the mountains towering above the train. Spectacular.

Amazing rail trip through Peruvian mointains. My wife and I took the Vistadome trip to Aguascalientes (Machu Picchu town) on our wedding anniversary and received a great service from the train staff. The view throughout the mountains is beautiful and worth seeing. You get a traditional snack included in your ticket and are able to relax during your trip. I would like to give a special thanks to Linda, Marco and Jack, who made memorable our trip back to Cusco the day after our anniversary.
A Spectacular Train ride. The carriages are beautifully appointed with comfortable seats, the staff are fun, the views spectacular, it runs on time

Nice views but slow. We took PeruRail back from Machu Picchu and it was 30 minutes slower than the way there. They also had a fashion show and a cultural dance piece that lasted over 30 minutes. The majority of the cabin was fast asleep and then they turned the lights on and turned the music super loud and"entertained" us for 30 minutes. This was even in first class. Then they try to sell you some of the pieces from the fashion show and will keep insisting, not leaving you alone. We took IncaRail on the way there and it was much more professional.They did offer us a snack and a beverage. However, the second beverage was going to be 5 soles. Not very impressed. However, the scenery is gorgeous.

Scenic and entertaining ride. Firstly, logistics: I booked my tickets from Cusco to Aguas Calientes well in advance (weeks) and I assume you have to be relatively organised about it in the high season. The tickets did seem quite pricey (I think is was roughly $500 AUD return for two) but the carriage is quite spacious and built for good views of the surrounding mountains. There is commentary on the way - in Spanish and English - and you are served a snack and drink. Don't get your hopes up about the snack - we had very dry cake on the way there! The staff are very organised, friendly and professional which made the train trip particularly pleasant. On our return to Cusco, we had Mario, Rosa and Deaner serving in our carriage. They put on an Andean show and a fashion show. Obviously it was quite commercialised, selling us some nice alpaca items but they really got into the spirit of it and it made for a fun and entertaining ride back after our big day on the mountain. I did not try any other methods as I travelled on PR return but I can recommend them as a professional and reliable company.

Scenic way to reach Machu Picchu. Ok, this is not the way to get to the Machu Picchu for the purist or the true traveller who will hike up there. This is a tourist route for sure but for those of us less adventurous, or who have a time constraint it is a good way to journey up there from Ollantaytambo. It isn't cheap either but what does one expect when there are not going to be multiple train lines to the top? You need to make reservations since you get assigned seating and can't just show up on the day - I guess you could if you wanted to risk it but again, if you are on a schedule you can't do so and be certain to get up and back expeditiously.The trains are comfortable and the views up spectacular as the scenery and vegetation changes on the way to the site. They serve a snack and drink on the way up and back that is included in the ticket price and there is a short fashion show on the way back encouraging you to buy Peruvian items (and we did - tourists that we are).The journey out is easier, but go early as it is busy. On the return the train was much longer and the station is chaotic. It all works fine just don't freak out if you find yourself in a hugely crowded departure area waiting for the train to board. It works efficiently once they get the doors open and you follow your steward with a coach sign (we were in coach E for example). Again, it's Machu Picchu so it's going to be crowded, right? The return journey was much longer at nearly 2 hours. A good way to get there in my opinion.

The View. This train ride will be good for people who never got on a train before. I would suggest people to get to the train before you visit Machu Pichu not after because you are too tired to look at the scenery. The activities in the train are pretty commercial not worth it. You can take the expedition which is cheaper(I traveled in both). The view is the same from both there not nothing very spectacular about vista dome.

Best option- beware booking. Both train lines (I and P) are very expensive without any kind of justification. On booking our tickets (I and P) they sat us in sequential numbers tricking us to believe we were next to each other (so double check). Make sure you book a train ride to Aguas Calientes and back as most train rides are booked while actually in Cusco and AC. There is an alternative if you're stranded in the expensive AC city via Santa Teresa FYI. Now concerning Peru Rail proper I found it to be the better choice even if it was more expensive that the IRail counterpart. First of all the staff was much more welcoming. Inside the train the feel was more quaint. Snack wise I Rail was definitely better (as here it was bigger but not as good in quality). But what really did it for us was the show they have in PeruRail that involves Andean dancing and Andean music.All in all: don't get your hopes up, both train lines are overpriced and a tourist trap. So choose based on availability and price ... Even though PR was a bit superior for me based in staff and entertainment

PeruRail: fun & entertaining ride!. I took both Peru Rail and InkaRail and have to say that PeruRail is definitely superior. They had a "dance show" of sorts and a fashion show (mostly to model the alpaca clothes for you to purchase). While it is kind of annoying that the whole trip they are trying to sell you something it was more entertaining.The food was a small sandwhich and free drinks (tea, coffee, water), and you can purchase additional beverages if you want.I suppose if you simply wanted to sleep the entire ride; perhaps PeruRail isn't for you.Otherwise the staff was very sweet and helpful & much enjoyable ride! Price: more expensive than InkaRail but by $10 or so.

Spacious seating and friendly service . The attendants were friendly and helpful, the train itself was quite comfortable and very clean. They even offered beverages and snacks. The only thing I could have done without was the music performance towards the end of the ride, it may have been entertaining on the way to Machu Picchu but on a late ride back I was just looking forward to sleeping and relaxing it was quite unexpected.

Great View. The train ride is from Ollentaytambo to Aguas Caliente and takes about 40 minute. The scenery was awesome so try to see on the opposite of the train on the return trip. The ride is comfortable, we were served a light lunch on the way up. On the ride back we were treated to a fashion show.

Awesome!!. Beautiful views. Wonderful staff. They put on a fashion show (seriously), and they really did have a great time doing it. Alejandro, Deisy, and Bryam were positively wonderful and so much fun!
Pleasant ride, maddening details. Quickly:To go to Machu Picchu you must book train tix, then book bus tix to go up the hill, and also pay admission.Pick up train tix at PeruRail office in person.

Don't pay extra for the Vistadome!~. I had the opportunity of riding the Vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, and the return trip on the Expedition train. The Vistadome cost more and was much less comfortable. The seat was not as comfortable as the seat on the Expedition. There is a table that separates the passengers and it limits your ability to move. The Expedition was much more roomy! Save your money! They both have windows that allow you to view from the roof, so don't be sold that visibility is better on the Vistadome!
Great way to travel to Machu Picchu . Excellent views, comfortable seats, prompt departure and efficient service. Couldn't ask for more. And there was the coffee and chocolate croissants!

Good comfortable train, spectacular views. I took the train from Aguas Caliente to Poroy (Cusco). The train was comfortable and clean and the ride was smooth with spectacular views of the mountains and the river on the way.There was a alpaca garments show in the middle which was fine. I recommend for a comfortable ride.

Good train for Machu Picchu visit.. Took 703 am train from Ollantaytambo. "2 car train clearly for the foreign tourist. Nice coffee service in am. Service was efficient and staff were very pleasant.Vistadome provides more glass for viewing passing scenery.

Train to machu picchu. Great train ride. I took this train from Machu Picchu village to Olytaytambo. $102 usd. Train goes all the way to Cusco but it is cheaper and faster to get off at Olytaytambo and get a cab to go the balance of the way.Train served a snack, and had a fashion show of alpaca garments for sale enroute to break up the two hour ride.Nice views along the way. Spotless train cars and comfortable.
Good trip . Very efficient and pleasant way to travel to Aguas Calientes before the final run up to Machu Picchu.Snack on board. Snow covered mountain top scenery through glass roof spectacular.
Beautiful. The ride is absolutely incredible to be a part of. The most beautiful sites enjoyed while relaxing from the comfort of your seat. They provide a nice snack as well.

Amazing landscape experience. The main reason we travelled to Peru was to admire the landscape. If trekking is not a possibility for you, then the next best thing is this train. You get to lay back and enjoy the landscape with Andean music on the background. The meal offered is rather simple, but we were offered as much coffee/tea/soda as we wanted. Staff was friendly and they all spoke English.At certain locations throughout the journey, a recording provides information on the types of vegetation or animals you can expect to see. On our trip we got to see orchids, yet this depends on the season.A bit of advice: I would not recommend this ride after sunset. It is expensive, and worth every penny when you are able to see the landscape, yet after sunset everything is pitch black out there and you can't see a thing, so keep that in mind when booking.

Great Transportation . We travelled round trip from Ollanta to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) on PeruRail. The Vistadome car allowed for a wonderful view of the Sacred Valley en route. The seats were reserved and comfortable. A drink and snack were also served during the trip.

Great staff. The train is clean and always on time, the staff always helpful and charming. Cecilia Alzamora and Jose Luis Palominio were amazing! Both were so enthusiastic about my husband’s birthday that they even put the Happy Birthday song on the speaker s on the train and sang along with a cake just for him, it was really sweet how personalized the service was. We highly recommend this service and these amazing staff.

Enjoyable views & entertaining staff!. We enjoyed the views on the way up to Machu Picchu/Aguascalientes and after an exhausting day at Machu Picchu, the fashion show and traditional folkloric dance that the train staff put on were a enjoyable distraction. Previous reviewers have complained that the items being modeled/sold are overpriced, but no one forces the train riders to purchase anything. The snacks are just that "snacks". They are not advertised as meals, so don't expect a full course meal, they are snacks. Just something to tide you over until you get to your destination and you can purchase a complete meal. We enjoyed the roundtrip train ride.

A unique train ride !. After the Inka trail, we took the train to Poroy where we would transfer to a bus to bring us to our Cusco hotel.  This train ride's seat was comfortable but the leg room was a bit cramped. But I was really entertained the whole time because of the train attendants who after serving our tasty snack had become fashion models for the sol alpaca line of apparel. It was fascinating that I was convinced to buy a shawl/wrap!  The train had skylights which gave a really beautiful window to watch the Andes mountains and the Urubamba river as they are passed by!  One has to experience Peru rail before leaving Cusco or one's experience will not be complete !!!

Must . I think it is worth to pay a little more to get in the Vistadome, the views are spectacular and all the fashion show and the dancing was great, they gave us a very nice snack, coffee and tea, sits are comfortable too

Decent...do 1st Class Inca Rail instead. The experience is similar to being on a Carnival Cruise. Attendants trying to sell you stuff, some sort of weird circus act thrown in. Food was bad. If you can get Inca 1st Class transportation to your destination, take it. I paid similar price to Vistadome on way to Picchu with Inca...better food, and they leave you alone until it's eat/drink time.

Cuzco to Machu Pichu. The train between the two takes about 3 hours - the station is about a 25 minute can ride outside of Cuzco - have your hotel arrange a taxi to Poroy. The journey is stunningly beautiful - the train is clean and comfortable and the staff very accommodating. The ticket is not particularly inexpensive - like $165.00 each. Book very early as trains fill up fast and even when we booked 6 months our could not get a return to Cuzco and had to take the train to Ollantaytambo which is about 1:45 from Cuzco and costs about $30.00.
Good but overpriced . Wish there was another alternative which does not require a trek. For the price you pay, you get only a non refillable coffee/tea and a bread. The route is nice though.

Nice train, but slow. Great views, good food, but it seemed so slow. It took us much longer to return to Cusco from Machu Picchu than it took us to get to Machu Picchu from Cusco. The views are fabulous for the first hour, but it did not matter after that. We would not do it again.

Expensive but worth it. Poroy train station is about 25-30 mins away from Central Cusco and the taxi ride cost 35 sols each way. The train cost us 130 dollars each with the added buffet at the Belmond to get to Machu pichu and 90 dollars each to get back to cusco. They provided a light lunch during the train trip and a fashion show on the way back. My advice is if your booking the train don't go for the Belmond buffet option as my partner and my self did not think it was worth it, the food was average and for 30 dollars each we would have preferred to eat at the restaurant at Machu Pichu as it offers food and drinks with amazing views. Train definitely worth it but the added buffet option not. The views of the train is just amazing.

Too many shows . We went in both classes and the increase amount in visibility is not worth the additional price. On top of that it is clearly targeted at older people. They put om a fashion show for you to buy over priced alpaca jumpers

Very family friendly! . We took the Vistadome train from Cusco to Aguacalientes and it was the perfect 3-hour ride to Machu Picchu. The staff (Mary Carmen, Bernardo & Rony) were very attentive and were extra accommodating to our 2 kids. They gave our 4-year-old son a huge lollipop when we got onboard, then another one about halfway through. They also loved playing with our 4-month-old daughter, which was very sweet! Seats are assigned, but the staff helps people sit in the seats with the best views if they are open. The views are truly spectacular and you would miss a lot of incredible mountaintop views without the roof windows. The snack was lovely: slice of prickly pear, sweet banana, nuts & and a large cornbread - everything was served on beautifully woven Peruvian placemats. They provided complimentary drinks throughout the ride. The only negative was that there was really no room with the diaper bag, purse, husband's backpack & son's backpack. There's a storage area for large bags, but we wanted to keep those items to hand. Luckily, the 4th seat in our section remained open so we used that and under the table, but we were still a little crowded. Everything was well-run & spotless - even the restroom was the cleanest I've seen on a train! All-in-all, a fabulous experience.

Vistadome train to/from Ollyantambo - Aguascalientes Callentes. The train to and from Ollyantatambo to Aguascalientes Calletes was wonderful -the change of scenery and the service wa impeccable. However, this review is to compliment the staff on the return journey (Maritza, who personally deliver an item I had purchased on the train to my hotel in Cuzco - unbelievable service!) Maritza, Deynis and Enrique were attentive and curtiouse while serving our snacks. They also entertained us in costume and fashion show. Can not say how much I appreciated the Vistadome ride and the service of the staff - in particular those I have mentioned in this review. Sibylle

Beautiful Views. The train ride was part of our tour to Macho Picchu. It was an enjoyable, relaxing, and comfortable 1 1/2 hr ride with beautiful views. We were given a snack and on the return trip there was even a fashion show with lovely alpaca wool items that are for sale.

Amazing scenic railway. Our trip back from Aguas Calientes to Poroy was a lot of fun. The service was very friendly and the fashion show put on by Arturo Fernando and Ayoli was a hoot. The trip out to A.C. was amazing as we were in the front car which has a forward view window in addition to the roof and side and the scenery is stunning. The only negative point was the pushing and shoving on the very narrow platform at ollyantambo. Other stations are very good and well organised.

Train great but nightmare getting to Ollyantambo . The train ride to/from Ollyantambo - Aguas Calientes was great. The staff attentive, train spotless, and on schedule. They even served a snack!!! The only complaint was the lack of options and information to get from Cusco to Ollyantambo. Because it was April, the train was not running the full journey. We landed in Cusco in the morning. Everything we read was to easily hire a driver to Ollyantambo from the airport. This turned into a nightmare with the driver taking us into town and making us change cars and drivers. We have both traveled extensively and found this a bit scary. For the return, we contacted our Cusco hotel to send a car to pick us up in Ollyantambo.

Beautiful Views. The train car was very clean and comfortable. The views all the way to the bus station were amazing. Lots of great picture opportunities (especially if you are seated on the "river side" of the train. Be aware that half the seats face backwards so if that is a problem (motion sickness) ask for a forward facing seat. There were great drinks offered on board and were part of your ticket price. We loved the train!! BTW, we were told there were restroom facilities on-board but none of our group went to check them out.

Great way to travel to Aguas Calientes. We decided to take the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and were very glad we did. After an hour and 45 min drive from Cusco to Ollantaytambo the train was a very relaxing ride. They served us a good peruvian salad on the way there and a type of empanada on the way back. It's neat that they give you facts about the region as you're going through it. On the return trip it was a bit silly because they do a "fashion show" of a bunch of alpaca clothing that they try and get you to buy. But other than that, very nice way to travel

Amazing view, good service . Beautiful views throughout this whole journey and very comfortable experience. Totally punctual and they even give you drinks and snacks on board.Can't comment on value for money as was part of a package bought through a travel provider.
Scenic wonderland. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Caliente and back. Worth the extra few dollars for the glass top viewing. The vista's are awesome.
Fantastic. Well worth the extra cost of the Vistadome. The views were excellentDavid served us very well and had excellent English.

Good experience, on time but expensive. I must say that the service is really good, they leave right on time and are very organized. We took the expedition train and the cars were really comfortable and pretty, they have windows on the ceiling to view most of the landscape. Staff is very friendly and they give you a snack service, a soda, coffee or tea and a pastry. I would say it is worth the price but it is the only alternative you have as this is the only way to get to Aguas Calientes. The other company is Inka rail but they are practically the same. I wish there were more alternatives and cheaper.

Classy way to get to Machu Picchu. Loved the view windows, the service and the staff. We started in Urubamba with few passengers and felt like we received first class service in our car. Coffee and a croissant first thing, and comfortable seating, ample room to move around and clean restroom. The staff on the return trip were fun and energetic with their fashion show and antics. We realized we were not really as tired as we thought we were!!!

Vista dome train trip to Machu Picchu via Aquas Caliente. Excellent way to see the countryside from a comfortable vista dome train. They provided snacks and beverages which was perfect for the early morning ride to Aquas Caliente (from there you need to take a bus to Machu Picchu) and the return trip. The crew, Maritza V, Samuel and Enrique were great. Though I could have done without the fashion show and sales pitch.
Very nice. Very nice way to travel to Aguas Calientes. Very good service. Made the mistake of booking return trip at night so couldn't enjoy the scenery round trip!

Over priced! . What a racket! Ridiculous prices for a train ride and then there is a dancing person dressed as a bird for half the ride. Avoid taking the train if at all possible. The employees were great except when we tried to buy a ticket at the hidroeléctrica. First they don't accept credit cards there. Second, they wouldn't accept my $20 bill because it had a very small tear so it almost didn't make the train. Hogwash

Great way to travel to Machu Picchu!. I was very impressed with this train service. The service, decor, and restrooms on this train are excellent. The skylights with almost panoramic views of the Sacred Valley are wonderful too. Each carriage has 40-50 seats and 2-3 attendants. On our way back from MP, we had Linda, Edison, and Enriquez as our attendants. They did a phenomenal job of attending to us. In addition to serving a light meal of pumpkin pie and refreshments, they entertained us with a folk dance and an alpaca garments fashion show. We were confused as to whether we should disembark at Olanta or Pachar, and Linda helped us out by calling our tour guide and confirming our stop with him. Awesome way to travel!
Machu Pichhu Visit. Took the Inca Rail Executivo class from Urubamba to Machu Pichhu.Very clean.Good meals and drinks.Beautiful scenery.Unforgettable Rail journey.

Train to Aguas Caliente . This is the train that takes you from olly to AG. Try to get a seat on the left side of the train. Great ride until a landslide stopped the train for 1.5 hours. Nice ride Vista dome serves complimentary drinks.

The most gorgeous train journey on earth. The views from the train during the two hour train journey from Ollanta to Aqua Calientes at the foot of Machu Picchu were utterly breathtaking. I cannot convey enough how beautiful the scenery was, and the train is perfectly designed to allow you to admire it through the partially glazed roof and large windows.There is, however, as strange fashion show and catwalk during the journey - where the train crew dress in Alpaca wool clothing and ask you to purchase it(!)
Wonderful Views. We went to MachuPicchu in the Vistadome train ,it was fantastic ,we enjoy the convenience and the panoramic views . I recommended it. Its the best way to go to Machu Picchu ...

Expensive but necessary train ride. Vistadome is definitely nicer than the other options. Overall is an expensive 90 minute train ride but beats hiking to Machu Picchu. Some nice views. Could do without the sales pitches on each route.

Comfortable way to travel. The vistadome is the best way to travel to Aguascalientes Calientes to/from the Macchu Picchu area. It has big windows and roof glass to enjoy the scenery of the river, the Andes, the ruins along the way and the picturesque towns and villages. The trains is on time, you have seat assignments, a/c, and snacks/drinks are included in your ticket. I would like to bring special recognition to our servers Marcia, Daniel and Ronald. They where very attentive, and keep us entertained during our trip, thank you for a job well done!

Stunning views on the way to Machu Pichu. The skylights in the roof of the train offer stunning views of the mountains on the way to Machu Pichu. The Seats are comfortable and they even offer beverage service and a light snack. On the return trip they have a cultural dance show as well.

Fantastic from start to end!. Now this is how you do rail travel!The journey from Pachar temporary station to Machu Picchu takes just over 2 hours and allows you to sit back & enjoy the beautiful surroundings in a touch of class & comfort.The stations themselves are very clean with good facilities and the rail staff are friendly, helpful & professional.Service on board the train is very good & the drinks/snack they give you is good with a mix of hot & cold. Don't be fooled into thinking you will be able to sleep on the return journey - you will be entertained with a taste of one of the traditional dances & a fashion show put on by the staff in your carriage. Overall a fabulous experience with a company that really does know how to do rail travel. Definitely recommend- a great way to do Machu Picchu! Remember your passport!!

Nice excursion train. Well maintained excursion train with lots of viewing windows. Recommend this train over the much more expensive Hiram Bingham train because of the view windows in the ceiling, allowing much better views of the steep and impressive mountains that tower over the valley where the train operates.

View. Since we didn't book directly, I'm not exactly sure what the price difference is compared to the regular car, but the large windows offer a spectacular view. The car is luxurious and the snack service is very good. Try to sit on the side of the car that has a river view.
Transport for our Machu Picchu trip. . Organised, clean, nice snack and drink. On time and good view through windows! Fun return trip with song dance and Alpaca wear fashion show!

Short Ride Pleasant Trip. As part of our day trip to Manchu Picchu, my friend and I got to ride to and from on this delightful train. The to trip was a awash with scenery, pleasant conversation and a nice little breakfast snack. The from trip also had a snack as well as a dance and fashion show. The staff was super friendly and professional and for such a short trip it was quite the journey.

Peru trip . We took the vista dome to mile 104, were we disimbarked for our trek to Machu Picchu. While on board the crew gave us a fashion show and a traditional dance by one of the crew in costume, very intertaining and fun to watch, prices were reasonable on the items they sold on board.

Take this over the expedition train. For not much more you get a comfortable ride, and a faster travel time. We took the vistadome out to machu picchu and the expedition back. Really, really eish we took the vistadome again.

Rail travel done right!. Peru Rail knows how to do rail travel! After finishing the Inca Trail and visiting Machu Picchu our group road the train from Aquis Calientes to Ollantaytambo. The seats were very comfortable and attendants brought complimentary snacks. The bathrooms were clean in our rail car and the views were amazing. I have to admit the views were somewhat anti-climatic after actually hiking the Inca Trail, but still were beautiful from another perspective. Peru Rail is an excellent way to travel from and to Machu Picchu.

Peru Rail saved us! Amazing story.. We left Machu Picchu in the late afternoon and we arrived outside of Cusco at a small town and station since the train doesn't go all the way and our arranged driver didn't show up to pick us up. We didn't know what do to. A Peru Rail supervisor saw we were the only ones left in the parking lot (and it was dark) so he asked us who he could calls for us. He made a number of calls for us and found out that our driver wasn't coming for some reason. So he helped us and came with us on their Peru Rail bus that he had wait for us -- and he made sure we got a ride from the next station. His name Carlos Ruben and we went beyond the call of duty to save us from being lost in the middle of nowhere. An amazing rail company to say the least! Plus we loved to food service on the train. Unlike some countries, Peru has 3-4 different train companies to choose from.

The ride back was very entertaining!. Get food, lovely views, amazing staff, I can't say enough about how great this journey to Machu Picchu and back was. The views of the mountains are great. The food both ways was small, but good.What I loved the most was the fashion show on the way back from Machu Picchu! If that didn't want to make you buy any of their clothes, I don't know what will.

Brilliant . Peru Rail staff made each person feel special . Their attention and care was quite exceptional. We enjoyed rail trip from the Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu town. refreshments provided..table set nicely. Fun fashion display of Alpaca design clothing on our return trip. Amazing views especially with the panoramic windows overhead.

Great ride. After a long trek to Machu Picchu, I had lost my tickets to ride back to Ollantambo. Thankfully this company was awesome on promptly printing new tickets for free and ensuring I got on the ride. The inside is beautiful. I am prone for motion sickness and had no issues. Highly recommend.

relaxing way to get to Machu piccu . the train ride is lovely, and the views are nice, and the price is pretty close to the same so I would recommend this as the best option. the crew might put on a fashion show and you will arrive relaxed. the food served is a nice refreshment but don't expect something substantial.

Great - except the dancing and loud show on the train on the return.... After a magical tour of MP, most of us want to reflect, rest and enjoy a peaceful trip back. We don't need a show! Need peace and rest.

Amazing service! (Rogelio Accostupa, Lucia Navarro, Cesar Sallo). We took the Vistadome train from Aguas Calientes back to Urubamba and were lucky enough to have Rogelio, Lucia and Cesar in our train car. The service was amazing, and then we were treated to a fashion show and performance. The kids loved it! We were the final stop and had the car to ourselves, and Lucia was gracious enough to play hide-and-seek with our children. I'd highly recommend Vistadome, and if you find yourself in a car with Rogelio, Lucia and Cesar, you're in luck!

Great experience!. We took the Vistadome train from Paschar station to Agua Calientes and two days later, from Agua Calientes to Ollantaytambo. Clean, organized, easy to book. We were able to change our itinerary at no extra cost while staying in Agua Calientes. A snack on both routes and fun entertainment too! Beautiful scenery along the way.We did need to get "special permission" to take our luggage -- a roll-a-board carry on and a backpack apiece (daypack size). My husband was able to do this via email before our departure. Easy to do -- just be aware that it may be needed.

The attention from the crew (Samuel Alegria, Cecilia Rua, Rogelio Cutipa). The crew gave us an extraordinary fashion show while the train was in movement. The attention was enjoyable and the trip unforgettable. Thank you for the great experience of our Machu Picchu trip.
Nice ride. Lovely views on train, take in the scenery, on the way back they even have a fashion show with evil spirits [you'll see]. There is plenty of room for luggage

A great ride to and from Aguas Calientes. You have to pay a premium to ride this train, but the expanded views are well worth the price for this once in a lifetime trio up to Machu Picchu and back. The train staff were helpful and friendly (finding and returning another passenger's dropped Visa card) and we were treated to a bit of a fashion show as they attempted to sell some lovely alpaca woolen clothing. Fun and entertaining if the view out the windows grew old.
Vista dome. Found this to be a very pleasant train ride, with spectacular views, good snack, good entertainment, and comfort all around.

Excellent . The train was absolutely phenomenal. The staff specially prepared food for us to fit our dietary needs, and was very welcoming in general. The views from the train were unrealistic and something we have never seen before. Overall it was a great ride and a great experience.

Pleasant surprise! . It was a comfortable ride! Great seats, great view to see up and out. I didn't know I had booked the more expensive train. So I was surprised to see I treated myself! They offer beverages hot and cold, and snacks on the train ride :) Even if it's a little more, after trekking 4 days in a row, I found it relaxing :)

Beautiful Views a Bit overpriced . The ride has amazing views really stunning the seats are comfortable though if you are traveling against the sun it will be more than a bit uncomfortable. The food and drink options very limited and bit overpriced the ticket for it includes. The amateur fashion show with loud music could be skipped and allow one to enjoy the view or quiet conversation. The seats much more comfortable than jnca. I would take vistadome one way

Very good experience. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. First of all, booking online with PeruRail is a breeze, so definitely do it in advance. Then FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS on the confirmation about picking up your ticket. In Ollantaytambo, make your way thru the sea of vendors to the ticket-takers. Then there is a decent little waiting area with large, clean bathrooms and a small snack bar. The train was about 3 or 4 cars long, with first class being up front. I'm not sure that all the cars had the same service or large windows. The seats are set up so that you share a table with two other passengers so two of you are facing forward and two are facing backward. It was almost humorous that there were nicely dressed attendants on such a tiny train, but they wheeled the cart down the aisle, giving us a complementary drink and snack. Then they came back with a "duty free" type cart, selling alpaca shawls, hats, etc! There is also a tiny bathroom in the car, where they ask (as in most of Peru) that you throw your soiled toilet paper in the trashcan. The views are nice, but not spectacular.

Superb Service. The only way, but a fantastic way to reach Machu Picchu. The train is amazing with glass roof panels to view the mountains. The staff are great giving great service with food/drinks. Note that in the rainy season the service does not start or end at Cusco which means a 2 hour bus journey as well for which that that would only be 25 mins

Vistadome allows for Great Views of Mountain Peaks. We had to leave from Cuzco in a van to get to the train station in Olly. That ride was very interesting. Apparently, in the rainy season, the Vistadome does not leave out of Cuzco.The train is really pleasant with tables. It runs along side a river with tough rapids, I think we were on the left hand side to see the river. The staff was professional and warm, it was, well I said it above, "Excellent". And to boot we scored a 2 for 1 ticket price.

Gluten free food. There wasn't any provisions for gluten free food for me as we traveled! Very disappointing! Take your own if you do this rail trip. The Staff weren't sure what gluten free was all about unfortunately.Nadie me dio comida que fuera sin gluten, a sí que lleven su propia comida. Y los jóvenes sirviendo no sabían que era ' sin gluten'!

Great affordable train with excellent views. . I took this train directly from my hotel, Tambo Del Inka, and it was a nice ride to Machu Picchu. Seats were relatively comfortable, though I was a little squished by the man sitting next to me. Great for groups!
Ok. I wouldn't get too excited about the journey. It's nice but the audio is a bit out of date. Best seats are on the left heading to Machu Picchu but you can see well from any side.

Great train ride. We rode on Peru rail while returning from macchu picchu. The trains are very well designed and offered stunning views. They offer snacks during the trip as well as some drinks. The only con is that the seats don't recline much. I would highly recommend the ride which had stunning views.

Perfect train ride. This is such a great way to travel by train to fully experience the train ride to MP.
We got front seats, right next to the driver.
Amazing ride. Awesome scenic rail trip to Aquas Calientes and the entrance to Machu Picchu. Friendly service as you travel to and from a magical place.

Great ride!. Smooth, guided and entertaining ride!
You won't regret paying the extra $. Meals and drinks included! The ride back has a dancing/modeling show, which is very cool!

Train to Cusco. Fantastic train ride!! Well worth it from Aguas Caliente. But you will still have a bus ride hour to Cusco from the last stop.
The fashion show is part of the fun of the ride. The views are fantastic as you go past many Inca ruins. Would i do it again, absolutely.

Nice train ride. The train ride from Agua Caliente to Ollytaytambo was beautiful and enjoyable. We were served drinks and snacks. We were not that happy with a little fashion show and attempt to sell us alpaca sweaters though.

It's alright. The hard selling of merchandise was very irritating,. First off, if you are booking make sure you get the left hand side of the train, you would be really annoyed to book on one of the most expensive train rides in the world and not get the view. Which in fairness is very similar to going through the sacred valley by bus. We had got half price tickets and even at that the right hand side of the train was a bit overpriced. The snacks are meager and they don't even give you a full mug of tea. Plus they try sell you books and t-shirts at inflated prices on the way there and on the way back there is a fashion show- which is quite fun but then they really try push you to buy the knitwear (the same brand is located off the Plaza del Armas in Cusco- they have a sale on at the moment too). Apart from the hard sell the staff are very nice though but overall we came away feeling a bit "meh" about the whole experience. Plus the train was delayed by 30 minutes, so with their check in time we had to wait an hour.

Great. Not what I expected from a train journey. We were served a snack and drink and the staff came around with some items of clothing and books about Machu Picchu. The scenery was fantastic. On our return journey from Machu Picchu we were entertained by the staff and also got a fashion show of garments made of alpaca in Peru. Thoroughly enjoyed the journey

Luxury train travel in the highlands . We were not sure what to expect, but this trip - although pricey - was so much worth it!! This is travelling in olden days style and you won't tire gazing out the panoramic windows at the ever changing scenery! I would highly recommend blowing the budget (if yours is a bit steam rapped like ours) and enjoying the experience wholeheartedly!

Fantastic!. They literally held the train for us!! The streets of Olly were backed up - we had to run a mile with luggage on cobblestones -we sent our teenager ahead - they not only held the train but grabbed our luggage and got us situated! We souls have missed Machu Picchu of it weren't for them!

Spectacular and comfortable . As part of our prepaid tour, we were reserved on PeruRail. The seats are comfortable. The greeters make sure you get to where you need to be. The ticket included a light snack and a beverage. The views from the large windows are spectacular. There's air conditioning for those that are interested.

Worth the extra bucks. We got a 1 day tour package to Macchu Picchu and asked the agency to upgrade the train to the Vistadome. The trains arrived and departed on time. The platform had a nice café with a live music performer and quality snacks.Once inside the train, the view was incredible. There were large window panes on all sides and in the roof. The train was spotless clean and the staff was great. We were given a chocolate croissants and tea on the way to Aguas Calientes and on the way back a light meal consisting of a veggie pastry, salad, corn and gooseberries. The train staff went on to dress up in locally made alpaca wool apparel and gave us a small fashion show. They later offered the apparel for sale.At the platform we always felt safe. It is actually a good place to esplcape from most of the desperate street vendors, if that disturbs you.

The customer service we received from PeruRail was exceptional. We wanted to switch our return from Aguas Calientes to a later time with a friend's who we ran into. PeruRail was more than accommodating in this. They worked closely with us and checked up on us constantly to see whether the switch went smoothly. Rony Trujillo helped us greatly at the ticket office to make sure that the switch happened. Alfredo Del Castillo Cuba who was the supervisor at the time personally checked up on us in the train to see whether we were doing ok. Never met people who cared so personally for their customers. I would highly recommend booking the Vista Dome option. The views you get to see are incredible and service that goes along with it is exceptional. We had a very memorable experience traveling to Machu Picchu and PeruRail - Vista Dome played a huge part in it.
Great views . We enjoyed the ride to Macchu Picchu. Beautiful views and the servers were so nice. Highly recommended!

Best way to go to Machu Picchu . "Not the cheapest way but for sure the best and comfortable way to travel between Cusco to Machu Picchu, comfortable sits, best views and also they offered service on board nice show!!

Great train experience. We took the Vistadome for our Machu Picchu visit. The train provides excellent viewing of the amazing scenery and dramatic mountains on the trip. We had the train stop especially for our group so we could disembark at mile,rakers 104, to do the inca trail trek to Machu Picchu!

Nice Experience . It's a 2 hr ride at 40km/hr, from Pachar Train Station to Aguas Calientes. The seats are confortable, and they serve a very lite breakfast and a drink on the way up. There's Andean music being played all the way and some explanations given. Large windows allover and around to enjoy the mountain view, the archeological sites and hiker paths to Machupicchu. On the way down they offer a nice show and pasarella to sell first quality Alpaca wear.

Round trip to Machu Picchu. We rode up on there high en carriage with full food service. The ride is 2 hours and 50 min and make sure to be on time these guy role on time. If traveling with kids take there iPad or cards play as a family.

A Great panoramic experience trait travels you through time.. We took the Vistadome train to Aguascalientes for our Macchu Picchu experience, since it's the only way to get there without having to walk for 4 days through the Inca Trail.It's a magical experience since it makes you travel though time, because the wagons are vintage style, but with the modern accommodations for the pampered traveler. The booths are very comfortable with great panoramic views, and along the way, they give you several explanations in Spanish and English of what you are seeing.There's a complementary breakfast and dinner with different beverages that makes you feel in a first class cabin. Before the final stop on the return way, there's a fashion walkway, showing you the different types of apparel in Alpaca and Vicuña textiles.
Comfy yet pricey . The train was comfy, had a great view, was easy to find and ran on time. Suggestion: Don't upgrade to business or premium seats - it's not worth the added cost!

Very relaxing ride. Ride was lovely with a light snack served,along the way. The doom let in plenty of light. Our servers were very nice, in particular, Bernardo was very helpful and friendly. Seats were assigned. My only negative comment was that we faced backwards. If we had forward seats I would give 5 stars.

Landscape View. We were riding the Vistadome going back to Cusco, and it was really a comfortable ride all the way. After spending the whole day hiking the Machu Picchu and going around the town of Aguas Calientes, the train ride back gave us an easy rest of our worn out feet. There's enough leg room to stretch. The view on this train was better than the Expedition, you'll totally get the landscape. Snacks & drinks are, of course, provided. It's a good spend of money.

Excellent train trip from Cusco to Machu Picchu. An extremely scenic train trip, the carriage was very clean and the staff very polite and friendly. We were even entertained on the way back with a Dance and a fashion show! Thanks to Veronica, Haydn and Ronny G for their hospitality and service.
Rail journey . Awesome rail journey from Cuzco to Michu Picchu. Train with glass roof to see the fantastic scenery,spotlessly clean and you even get a free drink and snack. The staff are wonderful.
Fine rail trip. Trains are clean and comfortable. Tables for every four seats, and nonalcoholic drinks and a light snack is served shortly after departure. Staff is friendly.

Nice. Travel up to Vista Calientes and Machu Picchu via the Purerail Vista Dome Train. There is another option that is to take a four day hike along the Inca trail to get to Machu Picchu. The trains are clean, comfortable and well maintained. They offer a snack both up and back. The views are fantastic. The train station is quaint and clean. An overall very good experience.

Cool!. Nice view, drinks and a dessert included, a little fashion show, even some cultural input about Peruvian carnival and relatively on time. Only flaw: the diesel machine was very very loud and made unpleasant vibrations. They should invest on better machines or electrical locomotives.

Relaxing. We boarded the train in Ollantaytambo at the very small and bustling station for the 1 1/2 hr. ride through the Urubamba Valley to the town of Aguas Calientes (now known as Machu Picchu). The cars were clean and comfortable with a snack served en route. Rolling along the narrow-gauge track was relaxing as we wound our way up the mountain with plenty to see - beautiful country, an ever-raging river, the start of the Inca Trail. Well worth the trip.

Expensive, not worth it at all. It was really expensive and not adventurous or special at all. Plus if you leave macchu picchu at 4pm, later on until you get to close to cusco it is dark. And then it does Not even drop you in Cusco so you need to take a cab. Of you need to go back from macchu picchu ro cusco, rather Take a bus and save 100 usd doing so.

Beautiful train - loved the fashion show!!. Yes - fashion show.First any train going through the sacred valley along the Rio Segrado is going to be memorable and beautiful. This train, as the name implies, has windows in the ceiling to allow for a more expansive viewing. The train takes about 1.5 hours from pichay however the time flies. The views are spectacular, and the service was excellent, which includes a light meal service and soft drinks (beer, wine extra).There is only one track so the trains coming and going need to coordinate, which means that the trains need to stop at times to let one another pass by. We were surprised when the announcement came that the train stewards were going to put on a fashion show! They were selling Sol Alpaca (which you can buy anywhere, including the airport), however they played Peruvian music, and the stewards tried their best at waking the catwalks in their alpaca sweaters, scarves etc. Well it worked, and we ended up buying a scarf and sweater.

Great train experience. We took the Vistadome to and from Machu Picchu a few days ago. The train left on time from both Cusco and Aguascalientes and arrived on time. The seats are comfortable; the food and beverage service is basic but fine; the views are magnificent.
The best way to machu picchu. It has an open view to the hole trip, is the best show, food and also gives you food. Its a three hour ride from cusco but it goes fast. The view is unique.

Interesting train ride. Just got off the train to Machu Picchu. The ride was very comfortable and the staff friendly. The bathrooms were very clean.
