The served small snack sandwich in china plates and a drink of your choosing. The ride back was a interesting but fun fashion show. They did try to sell some very pricey clothing items. It did help pass the slow train ride back.

Lovely way to get to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome was great. We got to gaze at the scenery through the roof on the way to and from MP. Worth the extra price, I think. They did a fashion show on the way back though, which was strange. I'd rather relax and enjoy the view, rather than be predicted to buy something. Snack served on board, but not very tasty. Rather like airplane food.
Best way to travel to Machu Picchu. The Vista Dome Train was well worth the extra $. Took the train from the Ollantaytambo station to Aquas Calientes. and the view along the river valley was great.

Very comfortable experience!. I feel that the cost seems a bit high for a brief train ride (Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes) but they do provide comfortable trains with food and drink service. The staff are friendly and spoke English pretty well. The views along the Urubamba River making its way through the mountains is spectacular but what we enjoyed even more was the conversation with fellow travelers. We sat across from Canadians on the way out and Chileans on the way back. Sharing stories and learning each other's languages was the most fun part of the experience.

The monopoly of Machu Picchu. My wife and I took a beautiful trip to Peru. We visited Cusco, and Ollantaytambo. The trip was breath taking, and great people. I have visited more then 15 countries around the world, and defiantly Machu Picchu is a very different from all the places I have been to.Why did I give 2 stars and why do I say The Monopoly of Machu Picchu. My wife and I took the PeruRail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Caliente. (The service from Felipe and Elizabet in the train was great and they were very sweet and helpful ), but PeruRail is the ONLY company that will take passengers from and to Machu Picchu. PeruRail is not owned by the government and they can charge as much as they want. If your from Peru you will pay more then 50% less then a tourist . This trip was very expansive for me and my wife because of PeruRail. I spoke with a lot of local people in Ollataytambo and they fell the same way.If you have time please take different ways to Machu Picchu. Machu Picchu biggest and only revenue is tourist . Why do they have to over charge us tourist a ridiculous amount to ride a very short train ride.Ways to get to Machu Picchu. You could take the Over PRICE PeruRail or you could hike. First Cuzco to Santa Maria, Santa Maria to the Hydroelectric Plant of Santa Teresa, then you hike from Hydroelectric Plant to Aguas Calientes about 3.5 hrs hike. I hope this help

Best way of travel . I suggest anybody considering visiting Machu Picchu to take the Vistadome. It's the most relaxing way to go with food provided. The staff are also very friendly. I went in March which was the rainy season so the Poroy station was closed but they provided a free shuttle van to the next train station. On the way back the shuttle broke down but they were quick to provide another shuttle to transport us back to our starting destination. The shuttle was a bit smaller so most of the employees riding with us stayed back allowing the passengers to return to our destination in time to connect with taxis.

Pleasant trip, good service. We loved everything about our rail experience from Ollantaytambo to Aguascalientes and back with one exception. The attendants were polite and helpful, but on our return trip the attendant was borderline aggressive in repeatedly asking me (on four separate occasions) to leave a recommendation on trip advisor. He also pointedly gave me his name, twice, when asking for a recommendation, making me think that he is tipped by Peru Rail if he is mentioned by name. Unfortunately that was a sour note in what otherwise was a lovely trip.
Even better than expected. Beautiful views on a clean train with great service. Drinks and snacks served at our seats by very pleasant staff. Very comfortable. Unbelievable scenery!

We really lucked out. We took this train twice, once on our way to Aguas Calientes and once on our way back. On our way there, we really lucked out. The front carriage had the compartment for the train driver and right beside this compartment were seats 1 and 2 with a picture window showing the same view that the driver was seeing. We got seats 1 and 2. Why? I have no idea. I don't know if our agent requested these seats, if we paid for these seats or if we were just really lucky. Whatever the reason, if you can get these seats then take them. They are fantastic. There is no better view of the journey than from these seats.On our way back we had regular seats. From the open ceiling, the views of the Andes are good and worth the cost of the tickets (versus the cost of the regular train). What made the trip back so special was that we were sat beside a couple we had met briefly while at Machu Picchu. They made the trip down particularly enjoyable.What I will say is that the train is not convenient for Cusco. On our way to Aguas Client we took a tour through the Sacred Valley so didn't realize how far from Cusco we had come. On the way back, it was a 2 1/2 hour car ride from the train station to our hotel in Cusco.

Amazing Scenery - Friendly. We booked our Vistadome round-trip tickets from Poroy (Cusco) to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) online. There is also the Hiram Bingham train which is way more expensive and there is a one level down called the Expedition. I spoke to someone who took the Hiram Bingham last year and she suggested that the Vistadome would be a great alternative if you did not want to pay the significant difference in price. Once you finalized your purchase online, you still need to pick up the actual tickets upon arrival in Peru. They sent us an email with confirmation booking number and list of places where we can pick up the actual train tickets from. If you plan to fly into Cusco airport, there is a Peru Rail counter next to the baggage collection on the lower floor. Bring a copy of your confirmation number and show them your passport as identification. You will then get prints of your tickets with bar-codes on it. We spotted another Peru Rail counter in Miraflores, Lima in Larcormar Shopping near the JW Marriot and I believe there is one in Lima Airport and downtown Cusco.Peru Rail also suspended partial of our journey from Cusco (Poroy station) to Pachar (near Ollantaytambo) due to the rainy season. They provided shuttle buses from and to Pachar from Poroy. Once you get to Poroy, then you hop on the train to Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu). Make sure to check the schedule during the rainy season. Bear in mind that if you stay in Cusco, you need to take a cab to Poroy which is about 15 minutes outside of Cusco. You can also take a cab from your hotel to Pachar which is about 1.5 scenic drive. We decided to abandon the free shuttle and took a private car and paid 35 USD each way.The train journey from Pachar to Machu Picchu and back was just absolutely breathtaking. The railroad track runs along the Urubamba river and the sacred valley. Vistadome's multiple skylights on each car allow all passengers to admire the beautiful scenery along the way. They also serve snacks, cookies, selection of drinks and a bag of inca corn. The bathroom on the train is clean and quiet spacious. You can just relax and enjoy the view. They make announcement every so often about the history of the surrounding valleys as well as several notable spots where you can see some Inca terraces along the trip. Yes, you can see them prior on the side of the river given the daylight. if your schedule is flexible, make sure to be on the train during the day. On our return journey from Aguas Calientes, Peru Rail orchestrated a fashion show on the train; featuring Alpaca products. The scarves, coats and other accesories are being modeled by the attendance of the train. It was really fun and some of the merchandise was exclusively made for Peru Rail. We thought it was a nice entertainment for everybody. They also did a one-man folk-local dance prior to the fashion show wearing indigenous costumes ans mask.

Spectacular views and charming staff.. We rode the Vistadome from Tambo del Inka (Urubamba) to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) and back, and had a great experience. The trains were on time, clean, had friendly staff and good food and drinks. The views, of course, were spectacular. I had expected great views of the mountains, forests and valley - but the roaring Urubamba river (it was the wet season) was spellbinding. All in all, the experience was as smooth as any in Peru. There were some minor glitches, like with the credit card machine at the train station (phone lines were down for an hour.) On the outgoing trip, I thought the crew was a little too persistent trying to move the overpriced items on the souvenir cart. But, on the return trip, I really enjoyed the fashion show / Andean dance put on by the crew. Jenkins was outstanding in his role as the Saqra dancer. After the crowds got off at Ollantaytambo, we had a really nice chat with our steward, Bernardo. Vistadome is very lucky to have such a charming employee.

Perfect entertaining train to/from Machu Picchu!. We rode Vistadome on the way back from Machu Picchu to Ollaytan Tambo! It isn't like the normal train experience. They served some snacks, the crews entertained us with Andean culture introduction and some fashion show. I was drifting off to sleep but was actually kept me awake with their interactive performances. The train was luxurious with the temperature optimized for the weather! Recommended!

Quite a VIEW!!. This train is wonderful...there are large windows all around, including above...the light is good....amazing sights! The soaring Andes and the roaring Urubamba River right beside the train tracks most of the way!! Beautiful. The staff is very professional and the train is clean and quiet. There is a toilet onboard every train car.During the rainy season this train departs from Pachar Station to Machu Picchu (however this decision is not made until late in the previous year). We had bought our tickets months in advance, so we were issued bus tickets from Poroy to Pachar (what they refer to as bimodal). We decided to take a taxi van from our hotel (JW Marriott in Cusco) both ways. It was quicker but obviously cost more. Our driver stopped along the way and acted as a tour guide...a nice aside!Another option...You might want to consider buying your train ticket from Ollyantatambo r/t and taking a taxi to and from Cusco if you are staying there.

Great train trip. Caught this fabulous train yesterday. The trip was amazing. The train has a glass ceiling and great large glass windows along the sides for uninterrupted views. The trip is around an hr and half with a simple nice snack served. There is a more expensive train that you can take, which I contemplated. Having done this trip, I would book this one again.

Awesome views, but let us enjoy them in peace. We went up one morning, and back the next afternoon. The train is nice, clean, comfortable. The staff is nice, and the snacks were fine. The views are amazing, so definitely go during the daytime. My main complaint is on the return trip, the staff did a native dance thing, then a fashion show, then went through the train car selling the items that were worn during the fashion show. The dance and fashion show took about 30 minutes, and the music was extremely loud the whole time. I thought it would never end. Honestly, I just wanted to enjoy the view and some peace and quiet.

Better during the day. We took a round trip on 2/18 in the vistadome.The train was on time, clean and the view was spectacular. They have a snack service that was really good, we had a corn cake, little cookie, some nuts and beverages.After this experience, I know that the full potential of all those windows are appreciated more during the day :), when you can see the whole valley.On the way back there is also snack service included,a fashion show of the sweaters they sale during the trip and some folk peruvian music. I would love to experience the next level up by for a two hour trip I think the vistadome is worth it!

Sit Back, Relax and Enjoy the View. There are several rail options that will deliver you to Macchu Picchu but if you want to get the most out of the experience I recommend the VistaDome cars. The interiors are comfortable with small tables in front of generously sized seats but the major attraction is in the large side and ceiling windows. The tracks follow the river so being able to look out, and up, allows you to take in the massive mountains towering above. Glimpses of ruins, the raging river, fields of gladiolas and farms dot the route.Beverages and snacks are offered during the trip as are souvenirs and guide books. VistaDome cars have a luggage rack at each end and a lavatory where you can hone your balance while rocking to the rhythm of the rails. Your VistaDome seat will whet your appetite for what lies ahead in Macchu Picchu.

Easy way to get to Machu Picchu. Unless you wish to spend four / five days doing the Inca trail, Vistadome is the way to get to Machu Picchu. Please ensure that you travel light as there's not much luggage storage space in the train. Journey is comfortable and the view is amazing. Steep valleys, mountains equal if not excel those in Austria and Switzerland and fast moving river with a few inca ruins and a waterfall as bonus.

Great way to get to Machu Picchu. Very comfortable journey, passing through some amazing countryside. Steep valleys, fast flowing rivers and Inca constructions. A light snack was served both in the morning and afternoon. It is preferable to be facing forwards.

Great staff, only ok experience on train. We took the VistaDome at the end of our day at Machu Picchu. The train itself was quite comfortable. The table settings are very nice. All staff members were very kind and attentive. The snacks provided, however, were somewhat strange. The staff performed a traditional cultural dance for entertainment, and then conducted a fashion show. Of course, they want you to purchase the items worn during the show.I would have preferred to enjoy the view and the company of my travel companion rather than be disturbed by the entertainment.Biggest disappointment - the huge windows fogged up multiple times during the trip and you could not see out. No one seemed concerned about fixing the problem. I think I figured out why there were so many smear marks on the windows - previous riders had most likely tried to de-fog the windows. Also, we took the train at the end of the day and it got dark. It's not worth spending the extra money for the night time leg of the trip.If you take this train, do so in the morning.

PeruRail . I don't know if this is the best way to get to Aguascalientes. However, we enjoyed the ride. I'd recommend sitting so you are facing forward. I was facing backwards and got a little motion sickness. The seats are assigned so you don't have much control over that. It takes several hours to get from Cusco to Aguascalientes.

Scenic Experience. Riding these trains is the comfortable way to Aguas Calientes on the way to Machu Pichu, and back to Cusco. The cars panoramic windows provide total enjoyment of the Urubamba Valley countryside. The scenery is magnificent: tall peaks, big sky, green pastures, colorful potato fields, rushing river rapids, and quaint indigenous communities.On-board service is personable and well organized with tasty local meals and beverages. On the return ride, we were treated to a small taste of native culture by members of the service crew who danced in local customs to andean songs. A few of us even participated!! A shout out to that crew: Linda, John, and Carlos for the entertainment and fashion show!!

If you don't want to walk you have to pay.. Do the train was nice ! Good seats , good service . Food was ok ,they really try and push their retail items on you as well. It was a comfortable ride and enjoyable. All the rail companies hold you for ransom for the tickets. The process of getting the tickets on line was a disaster . Very difficult .

Beautiful trip to Aquas Calientes. This was my second Vistadome trip and I lived seeing the scenery on our way to Machu Picchu. Well organized and comfortable, you can feel assured of the experience. Book ahead so you can request good seats. We boarded at Ollentayambo and the 1 hour 45 minute trip was a comstantly changing National Geographic experience!

Great way to arrive & depart to&from Machu Picchu. Vistadome train offers a great service inside , good food and beverages. Highlights:• Large panoramic windows offering wonderful views of the surrounding countryside.• Excellent opportunities for taking photographs en route.• Comfortable, modern carriages.• Back in Cusco by 19:00 – in time for a night out!• Snacks, hot drinks and refreshments served on the Cusco – Machu Picchu route
Stunning view. No doubt why this rail is declared one of the most beautiful views in the world. From the mountains in Cusco to the Jungle

Beautiful views of the countryside. Relaxing ride back from machu pichu.Food and beverages availableComfortable seatingBeautiful viewsWe booked everything thru GoToPeru.They arranged tickets and deluvered us to the station on time. Vistadome has huge windows with panoramic views no matter where you sit.There is even a fashion show with entertainment.
Service with a Smile!. Not only was the train confortable and the views gorgeous. The Service was so pleasant and very attentive. Yes a bit warm but over all Great!

Amazing train ride! Worth paying extra for Vistadome!. We used Vistadome both routes to and from Cusco! During our visit, we had to catch a Peru Rail bus from Poroy to Pachar station due to the rail being closed between these stations. That journey is around 1 hour 30 minutes. Provided us with water. It would have been nice to catch the train the whole way but couldnt be helped. The journey from Pachar to MP is just under 2hours! Very good service, comfortable, included food and beverages were nice! Views were amazing! The vistadome has windows the entire way around the roof which is very handy! Dont take too large bags as if you have people sitting opposite you there isnt alot of room.

enjoyable trip. Loved this train ride! Seats are very comfortable and the train was very clean, including the restrooms. Having the snack (which I didn't eat as were soon to have a full lunch) and beverages was a pleasant addition. The scenery between Ollanta and Aguas Calientes is spectacular with several Inca ruins visible from the train. We also took the train back to Ollanta and on the return ride the staff put on a fashion show of Peruvian garments. While it was blatant sales to a captive audience, it was fun (and the quality of the merchandise was excellent). Altogether an enjoyable experience.

Nice although somewhat warm. Nice large windows, but climate control could do with some improvement. It got very hot with the sun overhead. They serve a light snack on board but the staff do a full table service -adding runners to the table and providing hot drinks. The staff were very polite and accommodating.

Good. Beautiful views and vistas! Very sunny and hot though (we put on sunblock). Cooled off a little once we started moving. Train was clean. Not very spacious.Food was mediocre, basically snacks--- consisted of nuts, corn cake, small banana, and small quinoa cookie with chocolate drizzle, and a drink of your choice. It's basically similar to airline food.They try to sell you stuff on the train.Music was good... Traditional Peruvian, relaxing, kinda puts you to sleep.We took the vistadome from ollataytambo to agua calientes, and the expedition back. Both were comparable, not much of a difference. The views are the same from both (expedition also has large side and top windows). Wasn't worth the extra money for the vistadome.... Would recommend saving your money and just taking the expedition.

Peru Rail. I had a excellent experience using the rail. Has excellent accommodations and view.However one of my friends lost his documents at the station and another lost the return ticket from Machu Picchu.I believe security is week at the stations placing the travelers in unnecessary stressfull situations.

Wonderful journey. It is wonderful experience , good organized, you get food like in airplane , excellent service by stuard and stuardess with smile,allthe way with local music and explanations about towns you are passing by. First in spanish then in English language.Scenery is changing all the way and majestetic mountains as well as tropical flora doesnt let you take eyes of the windowand windows are big and there are some above heads of passangers. On the way back staff turnes to models and they offer some good entertainment with show and possibility to buy some good quality items made of baby alpaca wool. Excellent alltogether!

Excellent train trip to Machu Picchu!. I took the train from the private station at the Tambo del Inka Hotel (which is excellent) and headed to Machu Picchu. For the first hour the train is just for hotel guests before picking up other passengers almost halfway to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome cars are very nice with plenty of window space to see. A tea/coffee service is provided for the first hour, and then once the other passengers board there is a further service including a snack. The seats are typically a 4 set around a table facing the others opposite, but seats 1 and 2 are the best at the very front of the train with stunning views. The trip is very relaxing and the staff was great on the way there and on the way back. On the return trip the staff do a little fashion show selling some local items done by PeruRail with Roxanna, Juan Manuel, and Fredy doing an amazing job. Great trip and would highly recommend the train and the hotel. The last hour of the train trip back I had the entire car to myself for the sunset return.

Best service I had in Peru!. I Had a marvellous experience! I was very well served and assisted by John Michell, Marcia and Carlos Ruben. Great service, great food and very clean and well conserved train.

Lovely train ride.... ...to a terrifying bus ride to the top of the mountain !! These trains are luxurious (we traveled Ollanta to Machu Picchu)...with tapestry-covered tables, and panoramic views with the vistadome windows. Very enjoyable adventure on our way to visit Machu Picchu !!

Great journey to Machu Picchu. This is a fun and relaxing way to go to/from Machu Picchu. The views along the way of the river and mountains are memorable. The staff are friendly and you get a nice snack and decent coffee. The train is clean as are the facilities. On the way back there is entertainment in the form of a fashion show which is fun until you look at the price tags - but you don't have to buy of course. The Vistadome train definitely added to the Machu Picchu experience.

Super experience!. This was a great train journey getting to and from MP. There was a complementary snack, and the return journey included a costumed dance and fashion show. Quality of products were excellent, but very overpriced. I would take the train again, for the views and comfort of the train itself. Felipe was very nice - staff on board.
Great. My boyfriend and I had a lovely experience on the train to Machu Picchu thanks to three employees that really stuck out. Giulianne, Erick, and Marco.

Beautiful scenery. This was a great train journey and "the only way" to travel to Machu Picchu. Fabulous train. The staff were pleasant, but everything on board was overpriced. There was a complementary snack, which was average to poor quality. The return journey included a costumed dance, but which had little to no traditional or historical value. Costumes were shabby and poor quality. The fashion show was okay and quality of products were excellent, but again very overpriced. I would take the train again, but only for the views and comfort of the train itself.

On the way to Machu Picchu . Let's start from the beginning. The booking is online, and we got our tickets in Lima. Since the part of rail is under construction, the train station in Cusco was temporaly closed. To take the train to Machu Pichhu, we had to take taxi and one our drive from Cusco to the nearest available train station. That was maybe only minus, because this company doesn't provide any transportation from Cusco. Everything else was perfect. Upon reaching the station in Pachar, staff took our heavy lagguages and assisted us with boarding. Staff speak English and are very kind and pleasant.Enterior of the train is cosy and nice with glass roof, so passengers can enjoy amazing scenary.The tables are for four people, so you can not enjoy privacy. Snacks and hot and cold beverages are served onboard, too.Strongly recommended since we tried on return other company. These one was much better.

Just magical. Before I say anything, I just want to thank Jonathan S, Victor M, Gladys and Ivonne for such memorable service. They made the journey informative, entertaining and fun. Not only did they provide information, served refreshments with a smile, but also put on one of the best fashion shows and traditional dancing.That aside, we took a return trip on the vistadome to Aguas Calientes at the foothills of MP. The journey was spectacular as we wove through the foothills of the most glorious mountains. I think the vistadome is the perfect middle option for the journey, very comfortable but not over the top. Thank you so much for such a memorable experience. :-)

Amazing staff and service. We were extremely positively surprised by this train service. First the waiting areas are clean and fully equipped with what you might need. Then the staff on the train is extremely cordial, speaks English and is genuinely service oriented. They even do a small fashion show to sell local products. Trains hand been on time and the panorama is awesome.
Beautiful ride. The ride using PeruRail was breath taking, and the attention we got from Ronald. O. , Nori, and Rogelio was amazing. I'm overall very pleased with PeruRails.

Beautiful ride. The Vistadome is a great way to see all the surrounding beauty as you go to Aguas Calientes. It's comfortable for the quick 1.5 hour ride from Ollantaytambo to Aguas. Sometimes you'll get a fashion show.. sometimes a traditional Peruvian dance other times just a cart with local wares for sale. Every time you get a great view and friendly staff.

Good one way bad the other. This is the main way to get to Machu Picchu and they know it, it is hectic yet well organised chaos. Expect a sales pitch on the way back and do t book the Vista-done if you travel at night. Stunning views and scenery to enjoy, just make sure you book one side of the train going one way and the other going back to enjoy both views.

Gentle trip along magnifficent scenery. This trip was one of those that will stay with us forever. The slow moving comfortable train moves along a most magnifficent awesome, wild river with a backdrop of fabulous mountains. The staff is pleasant and friendly. Along the journey one gets served soft drinks and snacks. Included also on the way back from Machu Picchu we had a fashion show. It was done with much grace and charm. The models that also doubled as train assistants were Deynis, Sandra and John Michell... They were fantastic.. Most enjoyable experience...
Vista dome. Used the train at end of the Inca trail. Do not miss this awesome experience back to cusco. Just do it.
Peru Inc's trail. Used the train on return from the classic inca trail fantastic a great end to the Inca trail .travelled by vista dome.

Ride to Machu Picchu in style.... A round trip on the vista dome will add to your visit to Machu Picchu in style.. The one and a half hour ride from Aguascalientes is a sheer pleasure..the afternoon ride back will be enhanced by the staff presenting a fashion show and a Peruvian dancer...

Fabulous vista. Travelled both ways to/fro Machu Piccu and thoroughly enjoyed the trips.Strictly on time departing so ensure you are checked 30 mins before.Great seats with good side and top Windows.Snack and drinks included and a free pantomime plus fashion show on the way back.Service by the staff excellent.

Wonderful experience!. My husband and I took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes to take the day trip to Machu Picchu.The train ride was truly pleasant, calm, and very smooth. There were no issues with nausea, dizziness or headaches. It was a very soothing train ride, overlooking the river and mountains. The train had ample leg space, comfortable seats, and large windows to look at the natural beauty. Very clean and the bathrooms were well maintained.The attendants on the train came by and provided you with drinks and snacks, and they even performed a traditional Inka dance and a fashion show on the return trip!On our return trip back to Ollantaytambo, our three train attendants, JAIME, JUAN MANUEL and VERONICA, were so lovely, polite, and provided excellent service. I was impressed to find out that our young train attendants attended University and attained degrees in the tourism business. They were very knowledgeable of their country, it's culture, and the geography

Fun ride to Machu Picchu. Very scenic train ride to get from Cusco to Machu Picchu. You get a beverage and snack, and on the way back they did a fun dance / fashion show for entertainment for us. They do sell their wares, souvenir books, the clothes from the fashion show, but it isn't pushy. I enjoyed the ride

Picturesque trip to Cusco. Train departed on time, I was able to take fun pictures throughout the trip. You will not need a book to read, or games the scenery is absolutely gorgeous. I am planning a trip again real soon.

GREAT SERVICE!. We took the 0800 AM Vistadome train on 29 JAN 2016. it was a notable experience. Although the food provided was sub par, it was more than made up by Train Attendant Joanna. I had left my glasses at the Ollataytambo station. Joanna used her phone to call the station and ask for them. She also called my tour company on her phone to see if they were in the bus. Thanks to her, I was able to retrieve my glases on the way back. Great service was provided!

Great ride. Wonderful ride just feet from the river. The staff do a wonderful and attentive service including entertainment , food service, and answering every possible question to eliminate your travel anxiety. Clean and comfortable.
Amazing ride and even better service! . Nancy, Alejandro, and Elmer made our trip perfect and memorable- we will recommend this rail because of their hospitality!

Expensive ! Not really worth but no option !. This is a very expensive service for rather basic service for short train ride.. I took it from Machu Picchu to ollantaytambo which is about one and a half hours..No fresh food.. Few tasteless cookies ! But a nice dance and a modelling show for alpaca clothing.. Target wealthy old travellers..For budget travellers with enough time - Don't Take The Train - there are other options..but for those who doesn't have much time really no options !Comfortable ride though.. Good seats and friendly staff who gives more attention to wealthy old tourists rather than backpacking budget travellers..But it really doesn't matter because it's very short ride !

Beautiful views . The trip was much faster than anticipated as we arrived an hour after leaving Ollyanta. Coca Cola, Inca cola and water were served with an orange and small salad. The window view out to the majestic mountains are what makes this trip so special. The pipe music can get a little tiring after awhile so pack headphones if music like this bothers you.

Great Scenery, and a Fashion Show!. A lovely train ride wit a vistadome and excellent service. First class has a snack service and drinks available. On the way back to Cusco, we were entertained by a dancer in a black mask, who got some audience participation happening and that introduced an alpaca fashion show. The servers doubled as models and it was very much enjoyed by all. No high pressure sales either!

Peru Rail - Aguas Calientes - Machupicchu. I would like to say some words about the excellent service of Peru Rail on the train 204 from Machupicchu to Ollantaytambo. The Staff is outstanding and specifically JAIME. He was very kind with my passengers on board and he is an asset for Peru Rail. Treatment, patience, smiling all the time! Really good professional. Thank you Peru Rail.Fernando Bordallo
great relaxing ride. for those relaxing on their way to Macchu Picchu, highly recommend the vistadome train, camera happy tourisits should definately get a window seat.
Best View Train!. Its a must to take the PeruTrain VistaDome!!! We loved it! Amazing view all the way to Machu Picchu!We also liked a lot the good service on board!

Cheaper 1 way prices than InkaRail! . This train ride is nice and comfortable, but still as all train rides to Machu Picchu overprised! We payed 62dollars one way to Ollantaytambo (where you still have to take a minibus to Cuzco (8soles, 1,5-2h), the chepest ticket is 50usd. They try to make it a luxury ride by giving you a drink and snack. The locals travel in a worse department for 20soles. Feels like colonial times!The cheaper way (about 30-45soles) is taking a bus from Cusco to Hidroelectrico (6h) which involves a 3h walk on a railway. One way is fine, two ways maybe boring. Busses leave at 2-3pm from Hidroelectrico.

Train makes the trek pleasant. In order to reach Machu Picchu, you take the Peru Rail from the Sacred Valley Valle Sagrada to the town of Agua Caliente at the base of the mountain of Machu Picchu.This is a fun ride with plenty of sights to see in the Urubamba River valley and gorge.
Excellent train journey !. I have always enjoyed travelling by train, this particular journey was magical ! Nothing to fault ! The service & scenery was outstanding !

Take This One. It's so bright and nice. They do come by with free snacks like small ham sandwiches and hot/cold drinks so you don't really need to take anything for breakfast on the early trains. We didn't get the clothing show and had heard that can be a bit annoying although sort of fun.

Incredible Train Service . Worth every penny.The service is to the detail. The crew is professional. Blake Wenshe took time off his busy schedule in the train to go above and beyond and gave me tips of restaurants and places to visit in Cusco. He is a true PeruRail team player. On your next visit to Machu-Picchu without a doubt choose PeruRail.

Great service, hospitable. I had a great trip with Vistadome on 1/16/15. While waiting for our train to arrive, a very pleasant young man by the name of Mario Asto made sure to answer all our questions and even bring us some nice hot drinks! The train was comfortable with a great view (windows everywhere). Highly recommended.

Fantastic!. Despite the early departure for Machu Picchu on this train the experience was smooth thanks to clear information and helpful staff. You should be aware that luggage is restricted so pack carefully. Anyway, the trip itself winds though a series of amazing views, mountain and riverside. You will be assualted by opportunities to buy local dress on and off, nonetheless this is a journey not to be missed and is fairly comfortable and for part-time railway geeks (including me) is even more worth the trip for engines on 3' gauge tracks and manually operated points. In fairness I probably cannot do justice to the experience but certainly recommend the trip...the staff, the stations (they are unique in such subtle ways), the trains and the range of people you will meet from backpackers to executives seizing the moment.

Amazing train. We picked reis train do go to matchupitchu! To return from aguas calientes to ollantaytambo and this trip was amazing!The team was so friendly and fun: Enrique, Juan Manuel, Giulianne!!They served us a great snack and the dance and they show as the clothes (typical ones) in a fashion show in the train!Everyone was so happy so the trip was done in seconds!!!;) Thanks! Everyone should take this!!!!

Best way to get to Machu Picchu. If you are not doing Inca Trail, catching a PeruRail Vistadome train is the best way to get to Machu Picchu. The train goes past mountains and rivers and it's a very scenic 2 hour ride. I would do it again.

Exceeeded Expectations. When we booked our tickets we were uncertain whether to choose Vistadome or Belmond Hiram Bingham which was more expensive. After doing the trip from Poroy to Aguascalientes and back I'd say pick the Vistadome and spend the extra money somewhere else. The train seats are very comfortable, we got light breakfast on the way to Aguascalientes. A snack on the way back. Even some Live entertainment by the staff.We were very concerned by the 5kg bag rule so we traveled very light. Once we were there we noticed that it was not very well enforced. We saw people with backpack that were clearly more than 5kg.The only complain I'd have is that train ride from Aguascalientes back to Poroy was more than an hour longer than Poroy to Aguascalientes. They did not explain why.

Great ride, great service!. I highly recommend the Vistadome train. We took it from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo after having taken the Hiram Bingham train up the prior morning and stayed overnight at the Belmond Sanctuary Lodge. The Vistadome was a totally different experience than the Hiram Bingham, but it was a lot of fun and the time flew by. The staff (Elma, Ronal and Fredy) were super friendly and provided great service and entertainment, including a fun little fashion show of Sol Alpaca products (available for purchase at great prices afterwards) and a cultural show (consisting of a slightly zany, dancing dog-faced devil of some sort that scared the bejeezus out of a Chinese lady, and totally made my day).If you're considering the Hiram Bingham, I'd say it is definitely worth doing it one-way (while expensive, it does include transportation, brunch, a guided tour of Machu Picchu and an excellent afternoon tea (with lots of food--not just typical tea fare)), but take the Vistadome on the way back. It's a LOT less expensive than the Hiram Bingham, and overall a more fun ride, and the views from the large Vistadome windows are fantastic too.

Too expensive for provided services. Lets be real: all you want is to get from one point to another in a comfortable fashion. PeruRail provides a good quality train, but way too overpriced. Expect to pay the same in an air ticket, but receive a service below European train standards. If you are on a budget, research InkaRail and other options. Only go with PeruRail if you can afford wasting USD 160+ on a roundtrip.

Comfortable trip to Machu Picchu. It would be difficult not to enjoy the views you get aboard this train of the Sacred Valley's astonishing landscape. The service is terrific—we had Renzo, Indira, and Jose Luis, a charming trio. It's easy to pass right through Ollantaytambo to get to the station, with the anticipation of Machu Picchu foremost in mind, but I recommend against it. Ollantaytambo's Inka ruins are magnificent, and visiting them provides a sense of the Inka Empire's political and economic structure and strategy, fleshing out the Machu Picchu and Sacred Valley experience. Also, there are great restaurants and inns in town, with Inka structures and foundations of the usual fantastic craftsmanship scattered among them.

Rosie Millar. The Vistadome was great. Staff were attentive and the view from the windows was really impressive. My only negative was the cost. As we stayed at El Albergue, the train stopped right at our door. How fabulous was that! Especially for our early an trip to Macchu Picchu.

Comfortable train to Machu Pucchu. Great train ride from the Sacred Valley to Aguas Calientas near Mach Picchu. The Vistas are amazing. They serve snacks, had a fashion show and an Inca cultural show. Very organized company with lovely service.

A magical trip!. We used the PeruRail Vistadome between Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes. What a wonderful experience! Beautiful views - great service - terrific ambience. The traditional music they play over the speakers while you're riding through the jungle really was quite magical. We also liked that the seating had you facing other passengers across the table. We had a great conversation with complete strangers! Awesome train ride!

Exceeded my expectations - brilliant. The vistadrome is a lovely way to get to aguas calientes or ollayanta - brilliant service and so well organised it shames other commuter and tourist routes in the world. If you need to take luggage you can apply online in advance (there is limited space). Staff are very impressive and a lot of fun - the evening return route includes a bit of a show which they seem to enjoy as much as the passengers - can't recommend highly enough.

Great views! Excellent service!. Comfortable train with large panoramic windows. The views are incredible. Nice snack service aboard. Great staff - professional, caring and fun! Thanks for everything Marita, Domingos, Roselyn and Frank!

Wonderful Experience. A wonderful experience, the train was very comfortable, and he team - Maritza, Domingo, Roselyn and Frank - were extraordinary. We particularly enjoyed the collection of articles, a very entertaining time during the trip!

Ignore the 5 kg luggage limit!! Not needed, not enforced, but caused consternation.. Nice train to/from Aguas Calientas, the base of Machu Picchu. But travelling with my wife and 3 teenage daughters to hike and then overnight there meant a lot of consternation about the published "1 bag only, max 5kg" restriction.The 5kg limit is rubbish, and was totally ignored by the staff and other passengers. The 1 bag rule though was rightfully generally followed, as there is no baggage car, no overhead storage because of the overhead vista windows, and only limited storage at the end of each car and between some seats. Everyone can readily take up to 1 conventional airline carry-on backpack/roll-aboard/wheelie, and throw the weight limit away!! Just put hiking gear and overnight clothes and personal affects in one carry-on.FYI - there is nowhere to really put another small personal bag, except in one's lap or at one's feet.The service and overall condition of the Vistadome was Very Good. The views out the windows where amazing. Only other issue we had was the staff not being able to balance coming out of Poroy station early in the morning in a cold train the level of warmth with accompanying fogged up windows, versus very cold air and a cleared up view. All balanced once past Ollantaytambo, when the serious views begin.

Loved the Vistadome train-best viewing. We considered the explorer train, but with steep canyons and a middle seat you can only see out the side window. The vistadome seat allow you to comfortably gaze up and out at the same time. Very professional service, nice snacks (no beer-bummer) very comfortable seats. Would surely ride again.
Machu Picchu. Professional and well dressed staff. They served coffee and snacks on board in comfortable seats. Overall, very happy with our entire experience!

Nice views, but rather uncomfortable and with limited luggage capacity. The Vistadome service offers very nice views, but is rather uncomfortable for the length of the ride. Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes is not too bad, but Aguas Calientes to Cusco makes for a very long ride on this train.The issues with comfort are:1. The back-to-back seats are not recline limited, so some seats recline, while others don't at all. 2. Very limited legroom3. Very limited under-seat space for luggage (no overhead racks, since that's where the Vistadome windows go)4. Limited luggage rack space. Although you are supposed to take only a small backpack, some inconsiderate tourists bring along large, heavy bags which promptly fill the luggage racks.All in all, not too bad if you come with the right attitude, don't schlep along more than a small backpack, and don't need to share your leg space with a long-legged fellow traveler.

One of the most professional rail services i have encounterd. Although due to the time of year it is difficult to get to Macchu Picchu the team at Peru Rail are a credit, from the staff at Poroy Station, to Pachar and to Macchu Picchu they are all brilliant.The service on the Vistadome and the Expedition is very very good and the team are so professional. Would highly reccomend.

A perfect example of why monopoly sucks. PeruRail together with InkaRail are the only companies that can offer a direct trip to Aguas Calientes (Where you must go in order to visit Machu Picchu). Because of that, they are allowed to charge whatever they want while also having a terrible service. When I went to Aguas Calientes, I went by the cheapest option, and on my way back to Ollataytanbo I was in the Vistadome first class, and they were both the same thing. The meal was bad, the railroad condition is terrible, with the train shaking and making weird noises the whole time.I don't recommend this company to anyone but unfortunately there aren't too much options.

Uncomfortable seats and slow. I can understand the train is snail slow because of the infrastructure they have. But the seats were very uncomfortable for almost 4 hour ride. You have to seat and face strangers, which is fine, but you can't stretch your legs at all.The name Vista Dome looks very attractive, but not much you can see through the Dome. If you look for better trains, there are ones with restaurant in it. I just found it there.
Fun comfortable ride. Nice trip down by the river. It was very entertaining on the ride back where there was a unique show of fashion and a culture.

Lovely Service. Had a great family experience on the Vistadome to Machu Picchu. Decent food and beverage service included with our ticket....even had a tablecloth placed on our table. Nestor provided friendly service and was very kind to my son who is learning to speak Spanish. Mario and Juan Carlos also provided good service to us on that trip.
Travel to Machu Picchu . Fun way to travel. Loved the views during the day heading to Machu Picchu. Coming back at night not much to see since it's completely dark outside

Extra cost for less added-value things. I tried expedition and vistadome. The difference in price was about 15-20 usd for one way, I think. What you get in vistadome is a piece of bread which is slightly better than the one from expedition (tomato, cheese and pesto sauce but nothing special) and there will be a show(?) of a guy who performed a traditional dance for 5-10 mins. The seats are wider, which was a plus, but expedition was already comfortable. So, not sure if the extra fee I paid was worth it... At any rate, the view from the train is just amazing!

The best train ride ever!. Loved this train ride and wished it was longer! Although 1.5 hrs is a decent amount of time, the views were amazing start to finish and I didn't want the ride to end. The crew and service were top-notch, couldn't have asked for a more pleasant experience. The appetizers were delicious. And Soraya and Sihy were especially superb with making me feel welcome and comfortable. Thanks PeruRail for all the magnificent photo ops and pleasant experience :)

Amazing Experience. To go to Macchu Picchu, I selected this Vistadome Train option. It was just amazing. The whole 1hour and 30minutes ride is spectacular. There issuch a great view from the train. The staff on the train is very warm and approchable. They also do very inspiring service. To enhace the experience, the staff also do a cultural dance and a fashion show representing local clothes. I was served by staff members Smick, Indira, FreddySihui and Luis. They were the best. Very professional and helpful team. They made you feel very comfortable.

Mostly a good experience but more info needed on the website. We enjoyed our trip from Ollantaytambo to Aquas Calliente very much. The train is very comfortable and the views amazing. On the way back from Machu Picchu the train stopped over an hour and a half outside of Cusco and we took a bus the rest of the way. From what I have read, they do this every year from January 1st through the rainy season. They did email me several weeks before the trip to let me know this was going to happen. My only issue is, if this happens every year, please let people know before booking. In our case, it would have changed our plans as it is very easy to just stay in Ollantaytambo and then use a tour company to transport you back and forth to Cusco and see the sights along the way. Overall good and friendly service but a little more info before booking would be helpful.

6 years ago was better. I traveled in the vistadome train back in 2009 and it was better. I had the same problem with the online booking, I didn`t get the tickets but the money was charged to my credit card. Same story than 6 years ago.What is good:The views are amazing. ScheduleThe train is in a good shape, was on time and boarding is well organized.What needs to improve:Food was much better 6 years ago. I knew is a snack, but this time food wasn´t bad, was horrible. I understand they want to serve typical food, but it has to be well prepared. Actually, we talked with a person from Peru and we told him about the food that we received in the train, and he said it was not a typical dish. Anyway, it was horrible. I would have preferred a potato chips bag or a sandwich. Very, very, very bad. And we saw lots of people not eating that.Another thing to improve is the air conditioning. It was not set up in a temperature, people said was cold, so they turn on heat, then, they move it to 23C. Didn't feel comfortable.They sale shirts and books and alpaca things but they all very pricey. In our way to Cusco, there is like a fashion show held by the "crew" of the train, which we disagree with because they are not models and you can see they didn´t feel good doing that. One of the men had to wear a woman dress and a mask! that was pathetic. Another suggestion is to have the chance to choose the chairs, because, to us was very uncomfortable to travel in the direction opposite the train, but there was nothing to do because the train was full. Also, on our way back, we had seats in a place of two instead of four which was much better.

on rails through the andean valley .... If you love trains like I do, you want to get on one any chance you get ... Great ride but may feel more like an organized tour as you and most of the passengers are headed to the same location ... They try to make this a bit luxurious with refreshments and a personal touch, however, its all a bit overdone ... otherwise, a nice ride, great views...Way too expensive then it should be !!!

The way to go to/from Machu Picchu. We had a great time on the Vista Dome. It was reasonably priced compared to the Bingham, and the views are sensational! The food they serve (included in the price) is a joke.....and the fashion show on the way home is worth the price of admission alone! Spend a few dollars more and take the Vista Dome vs the Expedition train.
Just do this!. The ride up in the Vistadome is best, by the time you're heading back you're wiped and the excursion class is just fine.

Much better than expected . The Vistadome was excellent. Although I read positive reviews, I was still apprehensive. The service and quality was much better than I ever imagined. The train is incredibly clean, the seats are comfortable enough to sleep and the view is lovely. Try to get a seat facing the river to enhance your view. The staff are friendly and very well trainer. And the service comes with a complementary snack and bar service with a smile. I used the service twice. Once wile traveling from Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu. Then again from Machu Picchu to Cusco. During the ride to Cusco the staff put on a fashion show to sell clothing made from alpaca. I would have preferred a ride without the show, as it woke me up from a much needed nap, but I suppose it added to the experience of the journey.

Great experience.. It was interesting going on this train to Machu Pichu. We were given a meal and then we had entertainment. They put on a fashion show for us all to see. The scenery was lovely.The train was very comfortable.
The train to Machu Piccu. Although a little expensive for what it is, this is the train option to Maccu Piccu, the trains are clean, comfortable, and the staff are friendly.

Amazing. I traveled three weeks ago to the 7 new wonders. The nature was the most exciting I've ever seen mixed with the human work. At the moment of return I was very tired, but satisfied that I got to know Machu Picchu. It wasn't a reason to enjoy the gentle service of Domingo, Ahyde, who never stopped smiling. I have to give my greatest congratulations to Apu, because I really enjoyed the dance "Saqra" and the conversations about culture and spirituality. I definitely can recommend him. I hope to return with my family next year.

Scenic way to a Modern Wonder . Even though it rained most of the trip down to Machu Picchu the ride was still scenic. I said down because Machu Picchu is much lower than the rest of the Sacred Valley. We left from the station on the grounds of the Tamba del Inka where we had spent two nights touring the valley while based at the Urambamba. Ride was comfortable scenic traveling along the river of the same name which parallels the Inka trail. At my age it sure beats a 4 day hike along a bug infested trail. On the return trip the porters even put on a fashion show with native clothing for sale.

A good way to Travel. I bought the Vistadom ticket after recommendation of my travel agent! It really is much better then the regular one, it has nice and big windows, on board service, a nice staff and good schedule times!

Very comfortable journey and great service. In terms of comfort, There's a slight difference with the expedition train. The seats and tables are slightly bigger (just slightly). The windows are much bigger and offer everyone a good view - although pretty much the same throughout the whole journey.The service is much better on the vistadome than on the expedition. They set the tables with cutlery & table cloth and the food although simple is better than what you get on the expedition.  they also have alcohol for sale (8 soles for a beer & 35 for a small bottle of red wine so quite reasonable). They also have an entertainment in the form of a small dance and a fashion show showcasing Perurail's Apaca wool clothes collection. The train journey from Agua calientes to Ollantaytambo is 1h30 mn and to Cusco 3h30 mn. The configuration is 4 seats together (2 facing) but there are also a few seats seating only 2.

Amazing way to travel. An amazing way to travel to Mach Picchu! We traveled from Ollyantaytambo to MP in about an hour and a half and were treated with incredible views of the valley. Highly recommend!!
Enjoyable experience. Trains left on time, clean, excellent service. Not a lot of leg room of seated facing other two passengers. Other than that, staff were outstanding, friendly, helpful.
Fantastic views and service . Stunning views along the way and the service by Henry and Cecilia was brilliant. Was a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Super expensive train ride to Machu Picchu. Getting to Machu Pichhu is expensive period. The Peruvian government will milk visitors for every sol to visit the ruins. One way is the tourist ticket as well as the train ticket there and back. If you wish to get there without the train is via the Inca trail that limits the number of people to 200. Hence the train is a monopoly controlled by the government. Paid $170 from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu's last stop for the return journey. The locals have to sit in another carriage and the tourist pay the high fares to get a free cup of soft drink and cushioned seats with heating. Though the train ride is certainly good (sit at the left of the train and book the front facing seats) , I don't particular enjoy the high fares.

Scenic Ride - Good Value. If you travel during the day it is worth purchasing tickets on the Vistadome. I caught a glimpse of the Hiram Bingham going up to Aguas Calientes and feel this train is a better value. I think the Hiram Bingham self selects people that enjoy luxury, is it necessary no, it may be nice if have the extra cash to spend. My only negative comment would be the website could be better for people that have not been to Peru before - thankfully we have TripAdvisor! I rode the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. The train station can be accessed via the road, I was cheap and walked to the station from the main square instead of paying for a taxi. This train is kid friendly with comfortable seats, enjoy the trek and scenery. Happy Travels.

Pleasant train journey, nice to see the countryside. Leisurely train journey up to Agua Caliente is a nice opportunity to see the countryside all around, which is pretty spectacular. Book as early as possible though, these trains are full!

Slow train ride. My friend and I took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and then back to Poroy.The trip on the way to Machu Picchu was quite pleasant as we had the very front seats so enjoyed some great changing scenery. The snack service was quite good, showcasing some local treats. I don't think I would do this again by choice on the way back though as it was a bit drawn out and too commercial for my liking. We caught a late train so we only had about 40 minutes worth of scenery before it was pitch black outside and then we didn't have anything to do or look at for most of the trip. There was a 'performance' the staff put on for us, one performed a dance around the carriage in a costume representing a local myth and then after all of the staff modeled rather expensive (compared to what you would pay in town) alpaca garments before making their sales pitches.

Spectacular . The journey up to Machu Picchu must be on of the great railway journeys of the world.And it is best done in the vistadome train, because the valley is narrow and many of the views above you.You see the progression from mountain scenery to jungle, Inca ruins every couple of miles, river rapids and spectacular mountain views.An absolute must.

Delightful trip. What a beautiful and fun ride from the city of Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. Two hours of amazing vistas, good service going up, and two hours of fun and entertainment on the way down. Don't miss this experience.

Nice scenery along the route. I took Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Agua Cliente and from Agua Cliente to Poroy. I consider it worth to take the train as the scenery along the route is so beautiful, and the big window allows you to have full view of the scenery. They also serve snack during the trip, but the food was so so. Otherwise, services are good. Highly recommended.

Birthday trip. I went on Peru Rail (Vistadome) the day of my birthday, back and forth the same day from Poroy to MachiPicchu. Very entertaining ride, the 3 hours went by quickly. Loved the detail on the ride back, the waiters found out it was my birthday and out of a sudden birthday music was playing and I was invited a Cusqueña beer and apple pie! Very nice detail, unforgettable day with lots of love and charisma. Giulianne, Alejandro & Kevin are very attentive and caring.

The best train experience . This train ride was unusual. We were coming back from 3nights 4 days of Inca Trail hike to Mach Picchu. And we were met with incredibly friendly people. Milagros and Glen were friendly and even gave us a fashion show. Jonathan S. gave us great performance. I have never seen anything like that on the train! On top of it, train was very clean and comfortable. And I was surrounded by good people and my friends. I enjoyed the ride to the full. Definitely 5 stars experience!!!!

Magical Journey. Boarded the train at Ollentaytambo for the hour 30 minute journey to Aguas Calientes. Luxury from start to finish - seating was very comfortable and views breathtaking. Staff were very attentive, service not to be faulted and entertainment was great. Return journey the next day was delightful being looked after by Danesa, Dennis and Jesus. Definitely up there with many highlights of our Peruvian holiday.

Things happen, but better customer attention would have been nice. We did a one day trip to Machu Picchu and had round tickets on the Vistadome. From Poroy was amazing. It was a very long ride but we were able to see such beautiful scenery that we really didn't mind. The snack service was unexpectedly great and the staff was very friendly. The return, however, was not so pleasant. About an hour and a half out there was a landslide that covered the tracks and we were informed there were several others after it so we would be having to wait for a bus to pick us up and take us back to Cuzco. As you can imagine, everyone on that last train is absolutely exhausted. We sucked it up because it was the safest option. The buses took about an hour and a half to arrive and the staff tried their best to entertain everyone while we waited. Once we were loaded onto a very tightly packed bus we made the drive back to Cuzco. It was the most HORRID bus ride of my life. Buses pass each other on very thin roads with zero regard for passenger safety. The bus ahead of us, which was part of our convoy, got into a collision because the driver miscalculated his timing in passing someone. There is absolutely no way anyone can get rest on that bus because it's not only so bumpy, but it's downright scary to shut your eyes. We arrived in Cuzco 3 hours after our scheduled time and the staff did nothing to compensate for the nightmare. The people waiting for passengers in Poroy were informed the buses would be arriving in Cuzco but somehow our driver missed the memo and we were left having to take a taxi. One of the train attendants was nice enough to help us get a safe taxi and even rode with us to ensure we would get to our hotel safely but PeruRail did nothing to apologize or compensate for the horrific ride. I get that landslides are out of their control but they should work on getting safer transportation for those occasions. It is unacceptable to me that the bus ride was so unsafe and scary after such an exhausting day.

The only way to travel to Macchu Picchu. You can travel via rail between Cuzco and Aguas Calientes for less but you'd be penny-wise and pound-foolish. The Vista Dome has glass ceilings which will allow you a full view of some truly breathtaking/spectacular scenery. Also, the car service is superb and you will be served some nice Peruvian cuisine. We had a fashion show and other live entertainment on the way back. This rail trip is not the time to go cheap. The Vista Dome is only $20-30 more each way compared to the basic train service.

Why We Love Trains. We had forward-facing seats at the front of the first car. Lovely views all around and above. Nice snacks and beverages included in ticket. It was exciting to descend through gorges next to the Urumbamba River to Aguas Calientes.

Vistadome from Urubamba. We were staying in Urubamba and caught the 6.50am train to Aguas Calientas, due to arrive at 9.40am.It is a lovely journey, quite slow but steady. The ticket price includes light refreshments and many of the staff speak english. We had a delay of approx 30 minutes due to 'mechanical problems' when quite close to Aguas Calientas but some of the time was made up so we got in at 10am. They offer a very good and secure complimentary luggage storage at the AC station that is open until 7pm daily which we used to allow us to get to Machu Picchu more quickly.Good way to travel.

Nice experience. The vista dome is a bit expensive, but a great snack is served and the experience is comfortable. On the ride back, be prepared for on train entertainment (fashion show) where the expensive goods are offered for sale afterwards.
Great. I was amazing for my trip was so nice not noticed how time fly and the view along was incredible. ..I definitely recommend take ot

Our Favorite Train Journey in Peru. During our trip to Peru we went on three trains - the first was The Orient Express - so expensive and although lovely not worth the money, the Andrean Explorer again quiet luxurious but on it for 10 hours...far too long - and the Vistadome - not luxurious but by far the best views and the best entertainment on board... going through the Sacred Valley and taking in the amazing scenery was just lovely... 10/10 for this trip.

Amazing views while seating down. The views were amazing depending from where you are seating on the train. If you want the view of the river book on the left side and if you want the forest and mountains pick the right side (this is if you are facing toward the engine). You are provided with a couple of snacks, coffee, soda, or coca tea. I do recommend you eat well before the train. Keep your camera ready as you don't know when you will have a amazing landscape. The only downside is the infamous fashion show, specially after your awesome peaceful experience in Machu Picchu, I wish they either make it shorter or get rid of it lol.

Great to relax . Get a seat facing the back of the trail so you get the benefit of the large Windows and views. They do several performances along the trip from Machu Picchu which was a little frustrating as we were tired and wanted to rest. But good over all.

Incredible efficiency and friendliness of staff and comfortable clean carriages. The views were outstanding. Road travel can not compare. The 3 members of staff per carriage were very attentive, Victor Martinez, Ahyde Quich and Enrique Huillco. Snacks were served with aplomb and we ere made to feel very special. Peru Rail could mention the fact that the rail journey included a switchback.
Comfortable!. We took PeruRail Vistadome from Cusco to Machu Picchu. The train was clean. The comfortable seats and the amazing views made it worthwhile.

The best train experience!. Luxurious. Great customer service. Served food and drink. Played indigenous music which added to the ambience when looking at the beautiful scenery out of the windows. Seats were comfortable. I was in a state of bliss.

Fun but hot!. The vistadome is awesome, I mean lets be honest, trains rock and this particular train ride through rural Cusco is breathtaking and the vistadome allows you to get a panoramic view. It's a must. The only unexpected down was that all that glass made it extremely hot and whilst we did ask them to crank up the ac it either wasn't effective or sufficient enough which made for a bit of an uncomfortable 3.5 hour ride. Also found it a bit weird that you're only allowed one beverage so if you wanted a glass of water with your coffee you couldn't have it.

Great way to get to Machu Picchu. Not cheap. This is a very popular way to get to Machu Picchu. Service is quite good. For some reason, it is quite expensive if you are a foreigner. But, it is safe and well patrolled by government. The usual attempts to sell their traditional stuff was slightly annoying. But, overall, its another positive to visiting the country. Many seats for 4 people around the table. You may get lucky and meet some interesting travelers too.

At least you can see everything.... The Vistadome train slowly takes you on the two hour journey from Cusco to Machupicchu. With windows surrounding you on all sides as well as above your head, you see the extraordinarily beautiful scenery going through the river canyon that runs between the two termini of the train. The train is very well run by Perurail.

Train Staff Par Excellence. I have traveled on trains all through Europe. Never have I been treated as royally as I was on PeruRail-Vistadome. Its staff was attentive to my every need. Moreover they were dressed impeccably, polite, knowledgeable, and always smiling. I particularly wish to compliment Roberto and Odelia, Enrique and Ivan. How blessed Perurail is to have persons of their high calibre on your staff!

Good experience.. It's a very nice train. The breakfast they give you is not that great, but having windows all over the place is pretty fun. The only problem is fog covers them sometimes, so you have to ask people to open all the little windows.I didn't like how they didn't get my attention to ask me if everything was okay, or if I needed anything... but when it comes to donations, they asked me twice! Even though I was obviously not looking at them.I think it's impolite to ask for donations when we're just having fun. And even if they do, they should go to the people that call them, not asking every single person in the train. That was very annoying, specially because in front of us, there were these 2 foreigner that bought some expensive scarves on the train, and they "acted" like they were sleeping when they started talking about donations.I donate to the people that need it, not to the companies, because I know how's the deal.Also, I have to complain about the breakfast because I saw every single foreigner didn't like the corn cake that peruvian people usually like. I think they should give something that most people like.And I have to say that the lady in the trip going back to Cusco was very nice and gave us more coca tea because we were feeling sick. And told us to move to other seat if we wanted because people were going to leave the train.We got the seat facing the back (both trips), you miss a lot of things and can make you sick. Sadly, this is randomized when you buy the ticket.

Pay the little bit extra for this lovely train . This train cost approximately $10 more than the regular Peru rail train. It was clean, the service was very good and even the little hot breakfast they served was very tasty. They provided commentary in English and Spanish so we were well aware of our surroundings. The ride passed quickly with beautiful views. The early train out and the later train back provided more than adequate time for a one day trip to Machu Picchu

exotic , great views. We loved the Quaint Poroy Station . the train staff was wonderful , friendly. the Toilets were clean . I loved the fact that they had beautiful local textile placemats that they put on our tables - before serving us breakfast. the breakfast was very nice . we were served beverages in glasses and tea cups. overall lovely experience

The best!"!. Every single thing was great! Linda, Rocio, Roberto, Ivan and Jaime are a pleasure to be with. The trip is really beautiful, the landscape is breathtaking and just thinking that we were going to Matchu Pitchu was a great thought.
Great scenery!. Awesome ride to machupicchu !Friendly helpful staff! We recommend without reservation! An experience you will not soon forget

Perurail tourist activity value. In terms of Pervian tourist values....Perurail Visadome is an expensive mode of travel.... $95 US (Aguas Caliente-Cuzco) and Tourist Class of $65 (Ollanytambo-Aguas Calientes) compare to other modes of travel/tourist activity in Peru. The Visadome car's ceiling is not totally clear as I expected and the Tourist car actually does have some clear panels in the ceiling.Seating was such that most seats are divided into pods of four with two seats facing each other per side and a table in the center. It would have been nice to be able to decide if this is where we want to be seated. An older gentleman sitting across from us decided he could not sit without extending his legs straight....almost underneath his compartment mates seat. I felt bad for the young fellow in that seat. It is nice to have some refreshment served. In the Vista dome we were served on colourful placemats. There were announcements made during the trip but it was difficult to hear and understand......? all in Spanish.

Nice and slow experience. . Amazing trip beginning in Poroy (cozy station) with amazing views, service and staff. The huge Windows make everything greater. Caution if you have motion sickness, they only know your position (back or forward) in the train. But they solved my problem immediately. The only bad thing is the time. Three and a half hours to come and another 3:30 to come. Very slow.
Great Service Aboard!!!!. My brother, parents and I loved our time aboard! We got great service from Marcia, Ronal and Mirko! They made our ride to Aguascalientes very comfortable and entertaining!!

Sunning river valley. The comfortable train has large lateral windows and glass skylights over head. The tracks drop from the station near Cusco to the Urubamba River and thence along the river to the village below Machu Picchu. The mountain views along the way are great.

Excellent! Best train ride ever. We booked this on line at home in the States. Didn't really know what to expect or how it was going to work out. The online experience is easy and when I emailed with a question about my tickets they responded and addressed my question promptly. The experience from Cusco to Aguascalientes Calientes, in one word: outstanding! It takes you back to a more nostalgic and less tech-freak era. The trains are immaculate. The route is awesome and the people of Perurail are fantastic. It was my wife's birthday. I told them casually while they were providing snacks. About half an hour later there was happy birthday music coming from the speakers and the attendants came out with an improvised birthday cake. Candle and everything thing. As the commercial used to say: priceless!! There's only two ways to make it to Machu Picchu from Cusco: walking or the Perurail Vistadome. Particular thanks to: Felipe, Veronica and Emer. gracias mil!

Machu Picchu. We actually went in October 2014 it was very very nice the train ride was very smooth love the windows up top I would not go with the most expensive package this is the best one to get . The food was awesome the fashion show is real nice at the end .

Comfortable ride, great vistas, poor booking. We booked our train on line weeks before our trip. Once paid, you get an email requesting that you check in with at a local outlet to get your tickets and seat assignments. We sent PeruRail an email requesting seat assignment. No answer.Once in Cusco, we went to the local PR office and again asked for a seat assignment on the left side, the lady told us that the train was empty and we could switch. The train was full to the last seat and we had an assignment on the right side.Seat assignments: the train to Machu Picchu essentially hugs the Urubamba river from Poroy to Aguas Calientes. Seated on the left, you can enjoy vistas of the rushing river. Seated to the right, you get a rock wall most of the journey. Seat assignments are essential! On the return trip, you want to sit on the right side of the train.We had a surprise fashion show and traditional dancer on the return trip as well. Quite cute.

Worth the Extra Cash. The trip MP is AMAZING!!! You will want the domed roof or your neck will be sore. Make sure to take some pictures. We were so mesmerized, I took one of the meal but no other photos. On the way back toward Cusco, there was a fashion show and dancer. The attendants are first rate, the train is clean, the views are amazing. Make sure and look for the hanging hotel, they will point it out.

Take the Train after Machu Picchu. After visiting Machu Picchu - and especially after hiking in take the Vistadome train back to Cusco. It is relaxing, luxurious and has great service. A surprise was the fashion show of alpaca wear. Do not hesitate to buy something if you like it. We found the prices as good as anywhere.

The Best Train Ride of our Lives. Our train from Ollantaytamb to Aguas Calientes was less than impressive, but on our way home we switched our tickets to the 15:20 from Aguas to Poroy (Cusco). We expected much of the same as our previous trip the night before, but were pleasantly surprised by the fashion show Felipe, and Dayhana put on, as well as an interesting surprise from Elmer...This was definitely not a sleeper train! There was a gourmet snack and two refreshment sessions. It made the 4 hours go by quick. The icing on the cake was how nice the toilet was. We were pleasantly surprised by how amazing this train was and how nice our hosts were.

Good Service, Good Staff, so the best train. Amazing train to visit one of the wonders of the world - Machupicchu. The train itself has spectacular windows in order to appreciate fantastic views from the train. The staff is so friendly, helpfull and with the big smile, ready to make your day.A big thank you to Cesar Sanchez, as second manager, he is always travelling on board to assist the passengers. Alfredo del Castillo, supervisor who is always looking after of everyone, everywhere on the train. At the same time, thank you, to Esteban and Ronald for the unique and spectacular service offered on Board to us. Make sure to dance the Saqra dancing with the staff on board, as it is so fascinating.

Wow...again!!. This was an amazing experience. Personal and friendly service from the moment I got to the carriage door till getting off. The journey to Machu Pichu is incredible anyway and the glazed roof brings the amazing scenery right to you. The happy genuinely friendly and helpful staff serve you at the table with refreshments and souvenirs. I wish I had more time to go on some of the other PeruRail journeys available

Interesting, Relaxing Trail Ride. We rode the Vistadome from Aguas Caliente to a suburb of Cusco. The views were amazing, and the mountains were high, so it was a great idea to have windows over most of the train car's ceiling to see the magnificent views. The stewards in our cabin were Susy, Edison, Jesús, and Fredy, and they were magnificent. There was a light snack and drink service, after which there was a traditional dancing show, which was great. I would recommend it to anyone who's making the trip anyways.

Great ride with friendly staff . Can't say much, but this is a well organized machine. They served light lunch going to Machu Picchu and on the return to Cusco. We really loved it and the dome roof offered some great views. However, bring a hat because it does get bright.

comfy, clean, on time. ive taken clients on this train several times and its always been fun. the snacks they give you are great and you are allowed to drink external purchases on board. grab a few drinks from the market before you leave and enjoy the ride.cheapest time to travel is at night which defies the point but just saying in case people are short on money.if you are exhausted then the dance and song programs, combined with a random fashion show can be a bit tedious. if you are in the right mood they are a lot of fun.

Unfortunately your only choice.... It's a shame that the only mechanical way to get to MP is train. These guys have it all sewn up as this is really your only choice. If I were to do MP again, I would take the cheapest train option from Ollantaytambo.The website makes the vistadome train look awesome, but (and maybe I didn't look at the site properly) the pictures didn't match the reality! I think they snuck in photos of the Hiram Bingham train! The seats are cramped, and ventilation poor.The tickets are expensive.
