The audio commentary explaining the sights was sparse, and when it was heard, the English was well after the sight has passed.Also, some blogs claim that all seats get a full window view with no obstructions. Nope, seats 3 and 4 have a window frame.Service on the train was good, with the staff friendly and polite.Unfortunately, you will get utterly smashed in the pocket for a trip to MP, especially in on PeruRail.
Delightful train. Clean, quiet, pleasant complementary service with small meal and choice of beverage going to Aguas Caliente and snack with fashion show on return, very fun.
Peru Rail-Vistadome. We took the Vistadome to machu Pichu, wonderful experience and the service was the best, Edgar, Indira and Ronal, they were very nice with us....love it and would do it again....
Relax and enjoy the view. It was a good experience to go to Machu Picchu in the Vistadome. it's not fancy but the seats are comfortable and the train is well maintained. It has a great view!

A pleasant ride in Peru. I really liked my Vistadome experience overall. I felt the trains were clean, on-time and very comfortable. It can get a little tricky knowing when to line up and exactly what train to get on, unless you are aware the each train has a name - and that name corresponds to announcements made about it. Since there are so many trains going to the same location, the naming convention really works, but you have to look at your ticket carefully to know, and the follow signs and announcements accordingly.

How good is this!. Well organised, comfortable, efficient staff and food!The Vistadome left on time, was clean and comfortable and the food service was a nice surprise. The ONLY way to get to Aguas Calientes to visit Machu Picchu.

Lovely viewing. We took the train back as part of our inca trail trip. It was great to see everything from a different perspective but I note its extremely expensive and its a shame the rail has been privatised!

Beautiful views. Took this trail back from Machu Picchu and thoroughly enjoyed the trip. The views were amazing and it was very relaxing. We were served drinks during the trip and they even had a little fashion show.The seats were very comfortable and the large windows made for a spectacular view of the mountains and other sites. It was a lovely way to end our Machu Picchu trek.

Great way to travel to Macchu Picchu. The only ways of accessing Macchu Picchu town (aka Aguas Calientes) - the gateway to Macchu Picchu itself - is by rail or foot. PeruRail's Vistadome train offers probably the most pleasant option. Seating is a little cramped for a person of my size (tall and wide) but it is reasonably comfortable. We joined the train at Urubamba on the way to Macchu Picchu and, on the return journey got off at Ollantaytambo. In following the path of a river, the train passes through some spectacular country and views of the Andean peaks are facilitated by the 'vistadome' windows. If lucky, the traveller may see an Andean condor riding the mountain thermals. The train service provides basic light refreshments as part of the ticket cost and, airline style, sets up a trolley with local goods to sell to interested passengers.
1st class luxury. I enjoyed it even the kitchy entertainment. Fed about every hour or so. Very attentive wait staff. More comfy than the winding bus journeys.

A wonderful way to travel to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome Train is great. The service is wonderful--first class. The breakfast we had on the train was tasty and well presented. The seats are comfortable and the windows and dome are great for viewing the scenery. We arrived at Aguas Calientes refreshed and ready for our visit to Machu Picchu.

Nice views. The train to Micchu picchu offers a nice view of the country but you have to be sitting on the left side of the train, else you will see only the mountain side.One should be careful as there are 3 categories of trains. The two upper categories are very good.Employees are very friendly and willing to help.

Vistadome kicked butt!. Had a great experience. Friendly staff VERY helpful. A little pricey but your price gets your so much. I took the Vistadome Poroy-Manchu Pichu and return. Was only going to take it one way but it was amazing so took it both ways. Great ceiling windows lets you see the Andes Mountains in all there beauty.

Nice trip to the mountain. I have taken this a few times. The train is clean and the staff is great. They serve a snack and coffee. Get a ticket on the left side of the Train if you want a view if you sit on the right its just a cliff.

staff friendly, is speaking english,but price is very, very expensive. I could go by bus from Cuzco to Ollantayambo a than by train- it could be cheaper and quicker, the most interesting view is in this part of way.

Great views, but pricey and uncomfortable. Perurail is the only way for most tourists to get to Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome between Cusco (Poroy station) and Aguas Calientes (base town for Machu Picchu). The Peru countryside is beautiful, and we appreciate a few pointers from the train staff about major stops and the history of certain locations. The seating could use some improvement though. Most of the seats are four to a table (two facing the other two) so there is really no room to stretch your legs while seated without kicking the person in front of you. Legs do get cramped after a few hours. This could be remedied by making the seats all front facing and using table trays just like on a plane (at least you can stretch your legs without kicking somebody). The snack is decent (at least it includes vegetarian options) and the staff courteous. As others have mentioned, the ride back to Cusco included a costumed show, which was to promote/sell their products. This ride would be worth it if the seating wasn't so uncomfortable, and for that, I have to give it a lower rating than I would have.

Expensive but worth it! . I took this today for me to spend my birthday in Machu Picchu. I opted for vistadome to ensure good views. I wish PeruRail serves better and more portion of food though. Overall, the 3 1/2 hours ride from Poroy to Aguas Calientes was astonishing and definitely worth the money.

Great experience. The views on this trip are amazing and, you can't peel yourself away from the window. The food and snack service is very good and on the return trip they had a bit of a fashion show and strange costumed fox dancing, which was entertaining. It is the only way to get to Agua Calientes, but having a monopoly hasn't stoppped them from delivering a quality experience.

a real experience. nice train with a view, it travels at a speed you have the opportunity to explore the sacred valley. also good shows and included meals, it´s probably the best way to go from/to aguas c calientes/ollantaytambo/urubamba.

A most enjoyable round trip, from Cusco to Machu Picchu, on the unique Vistadome train. Earlier this month we took a most enjoyable round trip, from Cusco to Machu Picchu, on the unique Vistadome train. The view of the villages, mountains, vegetation and rivers along the way, which were so perfectly seen through the mostly glassed walls and roof of the train cars, is magical. We also enjoyed tremendously the spacious seats the thorough overheard explanations, the beautiful Peruvian music and the delicious food. However, above all, it was the wonderful crew who made this trip so special. We were somehow lucky to have the three crew members, Rosario, Luis Flores and Enrique on both directions of our round trip, which were held three days apart. Each of them has a million dollars smile and a genuine desire to accommodate the passengers with any of their needs or requests. On the trip back from Machu Picchu, at night, the three of them surprised the passengers with a very unique show which we do not want to spoil for future passengers on this train. Needless to say, it was a most pleasant train ride which we very much hope to experience again in the future.

Great day trip from Cusco (Poroy) to Aguas Calientes. This was a very comfortable and interesting train ride that descended from the Poroy train station at about 12,000 feet to Aguas Calientes at less than 8,000 feet. It included negotiating at least one interesting manually operated train track switchback because of the dramatic grade, and the uphill return trip was considerably slower than the descent. Tables were set and a light breakfast was served on the trip out; this was repeated for a light afternoon snack on the return. We also had some entertainment and a fashion show involving baby alpaca products on the return leg. The views from the train were spectacular and the glass dome roof was helpful as we passed through some deep valleys. The cars were modern and clean. The cars do not connect so groups need to ensure they book assigned seats in the same train car if they want to be together. The staff in our car were very friendly and efficient hosts (Maritz V., Abdon, and Thon). They were also effective salespeople as I bought some of their baby alpaca shawls (which proved to be a great gift hit when I got home). This day trip by PeruRail train to visit Machu Picchu (connecting by bus between Aguas Calientes and the archeological site) is a great way to travel; would not recommend driving the tentative looking roads or getting eaten alive by the sandflies (that transmit Leishmania) on the 4 day march option.

Worst train experience ever. Yesterday we took the Vistadome train to Machu Pichu and had a horrible experience. There was an derailment 2 trains ahead of us. Supposed to arrive in MP at noon. No information over the speakers, we had to try to elicit it from staff. They either knew nothing or wouldn't share it. "Be patient, we're working on the problem" is what we heard for nearly 2 1/2 hours. Then we were removed from the train (so little planning for an emergency that you had to jump from the train or be physically picked up by staff, not even a small emergency step ladder). Then we had to walk next to the train on the tracks for about 200 yards where we boarded another train. Finally arrived at train station at 3pm.We're told to be sure to return for our 5:30pm train on time (although we knew they were already delayed due to the derailment and there were already several hundred people at the station waiting to leave). Didn't get out of the station till 9pm, waited over 4 hours. We weren't even offered water and again very little information provided. This company clearly had no contingency or emergency plan except to just tell riders to be patient. Adding insult to injury, on the return trip we were fed a sandwich in old, dry bread with a single slice of cheese. We arrived at our hotel at 1:30am, exhausted and so very disappointed. Too bad they have no competition, maybe they would care more about the service they are supposed to provide. Their slogan is something akin to "we create unforgettable experiences". They're right, horrible and unforgettable.

If you close your eyes, you might imagine you are on a steam engine. Rather than put up with buses and the sometimes erratic driving of SOME South American drivers, we thought we would sit back, relax and take the Peru Rail Vista dome from Cusco to Machu Picchu. It turned out to be a brilliant idea. Just on 3 hours of comfortable rail travel, a light snack is provided and you can also buy some wine or beer if so inclined. The views are stunning and we had a good time chatting to a German couple who were also wandering around South America.It is the only way to travel, you can get up and wander to the toilet at any time, without worrying about turbulence. The seats are surprisingly adjustable and the table in the middle of each group of 4 seats expands to give you some decent room to eat your snack.Avoid the bus, take the train....

Unexpected Highlight of Machu Picchu was PeruRail Trip. We took the VistaDome train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes to see Machu Picchu and it was an unexpected highlight of the trip. Our guide suggested I sit on the left side of the train going out there for better photo opportunities. I had the best success holding my camera directly on the glass windows to avoid glare. Other on the train had success taking pictures out the dome ceiling glass (look for the climbing camps attached to mountainside shaped like pods). The ride through the Sacred Valley was scenic with changing landscapes and many Inca ruins. The food service was pleasant and professional even including table cloths (so your plates don't slip around). On the trip back as dusk set, the crew turned into performers and entertained us with a mythological character dance and fashion show. I even bought one of the fashions from the show, a line of finely crafted alpaca travel-wear designed specifically for PeruRail. Thank you to our service staff Felippe, Odelia, and Jesus for a great trip.

Panaromic Scenery by Rail. I travelled from Peroy, Lima to Cuzco by Vistadome. We have had a great experience and can view the scenery along the trip with clear and panoramic view. You may have to put on sun-tanned lotion before the ride. We returned on the following evening to Lima and we had an unexpected surprise party in the train. You want to know what, try it yourself...

Beautiful train to Aguas C- Manchu P. This is a luxury train...I started my ride in ollatatamboy and was amazed by the exceptional ride...On the way to Aguas, I was very lucky since I was in seat no. 1 and had all the views in the world...going back from Aguas to Poroy, it was a 4 hrs full of entertainments, fun and adventure. I was chosen to dance with the mascot and my friend participated in the runway Alpaca clothes inside the train. food was good and the views were amazing...The only problems were, I need to picked up the tickets in lima peru airport prior to my flight which was unbelievable and there is only one 0830am morning train leaving from poroy. From the airport my flight arrived 0730am and I need to travel to ollatamboy just to ride the train. So convenient wise, they need to fixed their website. Some passengers claimed they were given their tickets via email while others like me need to pick it up through the airport...Great job worth it!

Find a good seat!. The Vistadome trip is truly a wonderful experience. We went from Ollanta station to Machu Pichhu (formerly Agua Caliente station) in September 2015. The sights are superlative, and they even throw in a fashion/variety show on the return trip in order to stimulate sales of alpaca shawls, sweaters, and such. Recommend you seek a seat facing forward and to left when going to MP (i.e., facing the engine direction) and on the right on the return. The river-side scenery is better although on the other side you have a better view of the mountains. Depending on how you book your tickets you may or may not have a choice, though.

The best way to get to Machu Picchu!. Was so glad that we were able to take the train into Machu Picchu. It gave us the opportunity to sit back and view the Andes Mountains, the rivers and all the villages along the way. The staff were so friendly and courteous and the food served was really tasty. I would recommend the PeruRail, VistaDome to anyone who asks.

The Dessert On A Trip Of A Lifetime . Vistadome a must when traveling to and from Machu Picchu. Picturesque views of the andes Mountains and valleys of Peru. My round trip Started at PorRoy to Aguascalientes For a couple of days at Machu Picchu. The icing on the cake was the service we received from Deysi Roberto and Benji. The fashion show with them had the entire car spontaneously laughing , clapping, and cheering. Thank you Deysi, Roberto and Benji for making a simple train ride one of the most memorable parts of a great trip.

Good but pricey.... The staff were professional, the trains were all on time and super clean, and they even let us make a last minute change.It's just so expensive... we are students and couldn't get anything cheaper than 61USD!

A train ride into the jungle . This was a most pleasant experience. I have traveled by train in many countries around the world. Some are great and some are less than could ever be desired. The Vistadome was an excellent experience with nice food, drink, music, and incredible scenery to and from Macchu Piccu. On our way back we were entertained by a strange character and the staff performed a fashion show where you were than offered to buy some of the items displayed. A great time and I must when traveling to and from Macchu Piccu

One of the Best!. My wife and I rode the vistadome to Agauas Calientes and back for a trip to Machu Picchu, amlong with some companions. We've ridden trains all over the world and this was one of the best standard/coach class experiences ever.

Excellent trip choice to Machu Picchu. This was an incredible experience in our way to Machu Picchu, the friendly people on board the train made our journey an unforgettable one. Maritza, Carlos Rubén y Josepth are very kind and always smile giving their best all the way through out the trip.

Great train experience. We rode the Peru Rail Vistadone from Ollaytatambo station to Aguas Calientes and back again two days later. It was a wonderful way to travel. We had the first class car and it was very comfortable. We were served a couple of pastries and a drink in the morning and a sandwich and drink on our return trip later in the day. Very nice staff. They try to sell books and postcards on the morning trip and they put on a fashion show and sell the clothing on the return trip. Also, they put on a short costumed dance on the return trip. We had a good time and I would highly recommend.

Poroy to Aguas Calientes. Took Vistadome round trip from Poroy to Aguas Calientes and it was so worth it. My thanks to Deysi, Roberto and Benji. They took such good care of us and provided excellent service throughout!

Save Your Money - The Expedition is Just As Good for This Journey. When I booked the Vistadome online, the PeruRail website said that a buffet lunch was offered at Machu Picchu as a promotion for booking online. When we inquired at the restaurant after a gruelling Montana climb, they said that we were not on the list for the lunch. After about a 1/2 hour argument surmounting a pretty serious language barrier, we were told that we should have paid something like US$40 extra apiece to have the privilege of the buffet lunch. How can a hefty $40 per person extra be a promotion? There are many restaurants in North America where US$40 will fetch you a pretty decent a la carte dinner. Also, there must be almost a legal requirement that, if an attraction is soliciting a large clientele from North America and many other countries where English is commonly spoken, the people in customer service be adequately trained in spoken English. The scenery along the way being not much more scenic than, say, on a tour across the Scottish Highlands, being in the Vistadome is not a whole lot better than being in the Expedition. The attendants on Vistadome, however, spoke pretty good English and scored an A+ in my book for customer service.

Comfortable, enjoyable trip. We took the Vistadome train from Ollantaytamo to Aguas Calientes and from Aguas Calientes to Cusco, the following day.Both trips were comfortable and we enjoyed the drink/snack and the views along the way.

very enjoyable. Fabulous senery!. We had two trips on PeruRail. One from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and the other from Machu Picchu to Poroy, both were excellent. The journey up to Machu Picchu was breathtaking and a train journey to remember. The return was equally as interesting but a little long. The onboard show and fashion parade were great fun. A very interesting and relaxing way to see this wonderful countryside.

Awful fashion show and dancing. We took the Vistadome from Aguascalientes to Ollantaytambo and would not necessarily recommend the experience. The views were nice from the windows and we appreciated the drinks/snacks, but that was about it. After we had been on the train for 30 minutes or so, we were “treated” to a fashion show of alpaca sweaters and other items, followed by various local dances. Both were incredibly intrusive, loud, and not particularly representative of the local culture. We actually felt bad for the train’s stewardesses as they were forced to parade up and down the aisles in one poorly fitting alpaca sweater after another. We would have much preferred to simply enjoy the beautiful scenery as it passed by.

Quite a long trip. . There are around 4 hours each way between poroy and machu Picchu. I would recommend to take the train on ollantaytambo better than poroy. From ollantaytambo there are more options rather than Peru rail. The service is good, the staff is amazing but considering the price I would expect better service and more comfortable seating. Definitely next time I will take train from ollantaytambo to machu Picchu either Peru rail or Inca train. It's a 1:30 trip.

Classy, comfortable trip to Machu Picchu. We stayed at Wayras Hostal (****) just five minutes from the train station in Ollantaytambo (*****). We had planned to travel via the "backpacker" train but it was filled when I was ready to book so we opted for the Vistadome. It was a beautiful, clean train, very comfortable, and the staff were very attentive. The drinks and snacks were minimal and the entertainment by the staff was fun. It costs a bit more but how many times are you going to Machu Picchu. By the way, we booked the train that provides a buffet lunch at the hotel for about $20 more. That was a real bargain and the food was very good and plentiful. Go for it!

Excellent trip. I took the vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and return from Aguas calientes to Cusco. Excellent ride, detailed attention and they give you a snack and on the 3 hour ride to Cusco a meal, the hostess were really helpful and the train is very punctual.. I will recommend take the Vistadome train, I booked it online and no problem at all ...

Great experience.... The Vistadome train was a fun experience. We took it a night, so we didn't get to experience the scenery. The seats were comfortable and the service was excellent. Felipe and Veronica put on a great fashion show that kept us all entertained.

Relaxing Ride After Machu Picchu. After a couple of days in Machu Picchu, this train is a relaxing, scenic way to get to Cuzco. The staff of Indira, Enzo, and Daniel make this both a pleasant and entertaining journey. They meet you needs but also put on a fashion show as well as some surprises. Seats are comfortable and the Vistadome provides wonderful views of the mountains and other sights along the way.

Train from Machu Picchu to Ollatlanta . This train ride was very enjoyable. You were provided with many drinks and snacks. We got a complimentary drink, granola bar, and candy bar. The seats were fairly comfortable and the scenery was good.

The best way to get to Machu Picchu. We had a fantastic trip with the Vistadome crew. In fact, our trip to MP was so fun that we upgraded to take the Vistadome back after a long day of excursions. The night time crew was Veronica, Daniela, Daniel, and Enzo and they put on a spectacular show with dancing and music. I was so impressed with this train and recommend it to anybody who travels in the area.

Bueno Vista Indeed!. We took the train from Cusco to Machu Pichu. The views were amazing and having the sun roofs gave a really panoramic view. The train ride was really comfortable and the seats were good. Except that leg space if you facing somebody else can be a bit awkward. The seat on our return, did not have easy access to a window! (Thankfully it was only on our return). Food was nothing to write home about - could do with some more choice for what you pay.

Unforgettable train ride to Aguas Calientes. We took the Vistadome train to Aguas Calientes on our way to Machu Picchu. The experience is rather unique as the train winds through the Sacred Valley to its destination. Scenery is inspiring. The Vistadome service includes a continental breakfasting the morning and a light lunch/dinner in the early evening , followed by entertainment and fashion show displaying alpaca garments for men and women. Very comfortable seats.

Good train experience, but pushy sellers. We took the Vistadome from Poroy to Machu Picchu Pueblo and back. The train is beautiful and the snacks are good, though quantity could be improved :)On our return trip, the fashion show really made the difference. The crew really appeared like professional models!The only negative point, which is the only reason I rate this as 4 stars instead of a well-deserved 5 stars, is because the crew is really pushy when selling their over-priced stuff.
A GREAT train ride with a view!. Just good fun all the way around. The food was good and the service was better! The views from this train ride are priceless.

Vistadome Fun!. After 7 days of trekking through the Andes, riding the Vistadome train was such a sweet treat and so well worth the extra few bucks. We had eight people in our group and we were all well taken care of by Rosario, Denis R, and Enzo D. They were the best crew on the train, by far. We had a beautiful snack, lots to drink, and were entertained to the fullest degree. The dancing wolf was very entertaining, as he picked up dancing partners from the passengers on the train. The fashion show was a blast and we now have beautiful alpaca sweaters and scarves as mementos of our trip. Thankyou Rosario, Denis R, and Enzo D for making our Vistadome trip one we will remember for years to come!Natasha B.Sarnia, Ontario, Canada

Train to Machu Pichu. The scenery is incredible to the town of Machu Pichu. Cruise slowly down the rails following the river. The train is clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly. On the trip back, they did a fashion show, trying to sell local fashions. On a side note, if you are traveling to Machu Pichu, stay an additional night there. Wish we had......

Vistadome trip. Wow just wow - so glad we booked this. The vista was amazing and the staff attentive and friendly with an inpromptu fashion show and entertainment on the way home to ease the pain of having to leave the most spectacular place on Earth.

Great train experience!. What a fun and beautiful experience I had with my friends on the train! The 2 hours trip was great since the team who took care of us (Daniela C., Freddy Q. and Freddy S.) did a great job. The exclusive Alpaca Clothes that are sold are amazing... I bought a black and white piece! Don't miss this great moment and choose traveling during the day, because you will be able to enjoy the beauty of the landscape.

Machu Pichu. Very comfortable way to travel. Service was excellent, train was very clean and they even served free snacks and drinks(non-alcoholic). Scenery was truly awe inspiring and Machu Pichu is a magical place!
Amazing back in time train tavel. Great vistas,good service. Could be better if it ran from Cusco to Macchu Pichu. Crew were courteous and very entertaining.
Vista Dome Ride. It was an incredible ride, the show that the train staff out for us in the ride back to Poroy made the trip worth every penny!!!

Vista dome Fun Ride. The Vistadome is a spacious,comfortable and enjoyable ride from Aquas Caliente to Machu Picchu. They provide complimentary snacks and a fun fashion show highlighting the alpaca sweaters and coats. It is a great way to see the landscape that is farmland and the Inca trial. We were able to see hikers on their way to Machu Picchu.

very enjoyable ride. Train ride was a lot of fun. Complimentary snacks and beverages were served (non-alcoholic). They even had the "fashion show" of alpaca garments! Roxana, Balbino and Luis Miguel were extremely personable!
try for front row. If you have time it's worth it to arrive early enough to be the first in line and get the front row of the first car for the best views.

Great ride. My fiancee and I took this train from Aguas Calientes back to Cusco. We had taken Inca Rail down, so we were able to make a comparison. This is a really nice rail with huge windows. The seats recline nicely. They provide food and refreshments, which was nice as well. They also sell items on the train, alpaca clothing & accessories. They do a fashion show to sell you the goods, which did create a fun vibe in our car. Unfortunately, it is like a fashion show that won't end & it carried on a bit too long. They also have a local folklore character that dresses up & dances. The train does make a difference on the tracks, we took the executive on the Inca Rail and it was a lot bumpier. My fiancee was joking about how it could not be the same tracks. We went on one of the later trains and spent some time riding in the dark. Unfortunately our train had to back up some distance because we took the wrong track that wouldn't allow us to cross. This caused us to arrive later than planned but we arrived. You will need a taxi to & from the station if you are departing/arriving to Cusco. Remember to bargain your taxi ride! The reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because the fashion show went on way too long, in my opinion.

Beautiful views. Taking the Vistadome from the Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu was great! There were many windows that provided wonderful views on our journey. While the train was full, the seats were large and we had ample leg room. On our way to Machu Picchu, Mario, Emerson and Carolain (the staff on Vistadome) provided us with fabulous service. The bathroom on the train and the train itself were very clean. I recommend taking the Vistadome. It is a nice way to travel.

Wonderful staff. Indeed the station was crowded with tourists but the organization and expediency of the staff helped things go very smoothly. The train was very comfortable, the food good, scenery incredible.

Amazing travel experience.. We travelled from Cusco to Machu Picchu by Vistadome, Wow, what an amazing experience? Just stunning views of the mountains as the train glides from valley to valley. One of the highlights of our visit. Great friendly staff who do every thing to engage with travellers. Do not miss it.

Amazing scenery. We really enjoyed our 90 min journey from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. The train was full, however every seat had an amazing view of the mountains.The staff were friendly and a small snack and drink were served on the journey.Not much difference between this and the Expedition train, apart from the snack. So it the few dollars difference don't bother you, then just book the most convenient train for you.Tip....1.book in advance to get the exact train you want!2. They do not take large items of luggage, so take a smaller bag/hand luggage for your trip and leave bulky items in your next hotel.
Convenient and great scenery. A great way to travel and see the landscape of the country. Friendly staff serve snacks and drinks and help with loading baggage.

A nice end to a fantastic day. We paid for the upgrade to the Vistadome for the return trip after our trek and were not disappointed. The train is clean and comfortable and the overhead windows give a clear view of the mountains towering above. The complementary snack with traditional cookies and Inka Cola might help to keep you from falling asleep in the comfortable seats. Note that the train station entrance is thru the sprawling flea market and your hotel may have missed the cue to deliver your luggage there, so arrive 10+ minutes early to avoid last minute sprinting back for your bags.

Great experience with breathtaking views!. We recently did a return trip from Cusco to Machu Picchu and had been very pleased with the efficiency of the staff, the comfort of the train, the eats and also the fashion show. Thanks again to Maritza, Balbino and Benji for a wonderful relaxed and entertained trip! I may add that we found the Peruvian people very helpful and courteous in general.

Excellent service and entertainment. We took PeruRail's Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Poroy last week. We absolutely loved the experience! The train had large sky lights across the entire ceiling that allowed for breathtaking views of the towering mountains as we sailed through the valley. The music over the speakers was pleasant and enchanting and added to the experience. Our servers were FANTASTIC! Claudia, Jenkins and Balbino went above and beyond to make us comfortable and keep our drinks filled. They put on a very entertaining (and unexpected) show and fashion event halfway through the trip which was a nice way to break-up the 3+ hour ride. Everyone in my party loved the entertainment. I would recommend PeruRail Vistadome to anyone traveling to Machu Picchu. Definitely worth the money! Thank you PeruRail & Claudia, Jenkins and Balbino!

A good trip, nice staff, but expensive. The trip from Aguas Calientes to Cuzco was really nice: the landscape, the glass ceiling, the snack and, above all, the staff: Felipe, Karen and Jesus, along with the personnel at the station. They all were very supportive and kind. The train staff run also a show with Vicuña products, and a guy dancing with a tribal mask. We really apprecited the effort for a relaxed break, after so many days trekking up and down. The only objection is about logistics: since this is the only possible way to reach Aguas Calientes without being killed by a crazy driver along the twisted road (7 hours of torture and stupid risk in a mini-van), PeruRail charges too much for any trip, if you are a foreigner. I understand the fund-raising purpose of any business but not if this comes from a off-shore company with little impact to the region and their locals (PeruRail is NOT from Peru but a foreigner company). Besides this stick-up moment, all along was nice and advice-able. Ro & Daniel

If you're not doing the trek, or paying for the Hiram Bingam, Vistadome is the way to go.. Alright experience. We chose the seats that were not facing another two seats, which was nice. They also serve a snack and water/soda as part of your ticket price. Also, since there are large windows all around, your ride could be pretty exposed to the sun. When I went, my seat was positioned on the eastern side and I think we had the 11AM train, so the sun was on me for four hours. Luckily I brought a hat, sunscreen, and my water bottle with me.

Averaged out. The ride to Machu Picchu was quit pleasant with complimentary snacks and beverages. The ride back, however, was a different story. After a long day of touring Machu Picchu, all we wanted to do was rest but couldn't due to the ridiculous show put on by the crew. One member dressed up like a lion and made cooing noises throughout the car and then they put on a fashion show to try and push their alpaca products off. I would suggest it for the ride to Machu Picchu, but go with the cheaper train for the ride back.
Amazing experience!!!. Beautiful train ride - the staff was WONDERFUL!lovely views from big windows, fun fashion show, yummy snacks!Many thanks to Indira, Nestor, Leslie and Jhon Alex
Excellent view, worth the price.. I didn't expect such big Windows, I felt I was going through the mountains myself. Excellent view and great service. Even had delicious vegetarian food.

smooth ride great view. We took inca rail up to machu pichu and the peru rail vista dome back to Aguas.. I would say the ride is nicer and windows larger on the Vistadome so I preferred it overall. However they do a goofy dance and fashion show which was fun but if they do it both ways it would be annoying as the scenery is so gorgeous - better to look at that. If you are trying to take photos the inca rail may be better as the windows open to where you can inch a camera out.. Either way a fun trip and pretty countryside.

Lovely way to travel to Machu Picchcu. Definitly book early as tickets sell out. Many windows, including the roofs in the train. Snacks and drinks served. Staff are very friendly. Strangely our tickets indicate a 5kg limit but we saw passengers with huge luggage. Didn't like the Perurail staff at Larcomar when we picked up our tickets and were told by them we couldn't bring more than 5kg. Would suggest Perurail take into consideration travel needs of passengers, perhaps giving passengers the option to pay to bring more luggage. We felt silky that we followed the 'rules' and others didn't and had to buy some essentials at Aguas Calientes.

Superb!. A very well organised train trip from Poroy to Machu Picchu, scenic beauty, great snacks with coffee. Return journey was very entertaining with local dance, fashion show and the staff were very polite. Odelia, Edison, Benjamin were excellent.

Smuoth trip to Aqua Calientes and Machu Picchu. The Vistadome train made the trip to Aqua Calientes smooth, comfortable and easy. We boarded the train in Ollantaytambo. Make sure you have your passport accessible as you will need it out to board. The seats are assigned and reversed on the return trip (ie if you were backwards going, you will be facing front on the return). They provide a light snack on each of the trips and a local dance on the return. It all made the trip go very quickly. It was easy to see the river and parts of the Inca trail as you journeyed. The seats are comfortable, bathrooms clean, staff friendly and helpful. They tell you there is a limit on the size of the suitcases allowed, however we did see some large full size ones on the luggage racks and did not notice anyone having to leave the train because their bag was too big. So, if you have nowhere to store your luggage while you make this part of the journey, it is probably OK to bring with you.

Trip to Machupicchu. We had a wonderful time on the trip to and from Machupicchu...the staff, who I will name as they deserve recognition, in ´Carro´ D, Manuel Delgado, Maritza, Daniel and Jerias-really made us feel welcome. They went out of their way to help us enjoy the trip and made the trip an additional ´tour´ for us which was very enjoyable. In addition, we mentioned that we were celebrating our 34th wedding anniversary and they went out of their way to make this a special celebration. Thank you PeruRail for your dedication in making our trip very organized and fun!!

One of the best train trips in the world!. Can you imagine going back to the 18th century, in a train with all the luxuries and details that you can imagine? Can you imagine leaving the dry grass of the Andes, and suddenly from nowhere appearing in the middle of the Amazon jungle? Can you imagine deep canyons so narrow that only the train and the river can pass through? Wonderful food and service second to none. True smiles, both from the passengers and the staff. Something you don´t see too often these days.Do it! It´s more than what I can say in words. That´s the Hiram Bingham Peru Rail train. Unique!

Much, much better than expected!. I had no idea how wonderful this train ride to Machu Picchu would be. The seats were comfortable and the views along the way were incredible. The large windows in the Vistadome train made viewing extremely easy. The train went at a reasonable speed to enjoy the scenery. On the way back, it was night time with no views. However, the staff kept things enjoyable with some traditional dances and a fashion show. The food was good (a little less comparable to airline food). The temperature inside the train was comfortable (a bit chilly in the morning until we departed the train station).
Amazing trip!!. It was an amazing trip to Aguas Calientes. The staff (Indira, Marco Antonio and Enzo) entertained us and provided an excellent service! Food was nice as well!

Exceeded expectations. My husband and I took the Vistadome morning train to Aguas Calientes, and it was even better than we expected. Boarding happened on time and efficiently, and we sat across from another couple from the US who were great company. The music and occasional announcements/tour notes were great, and the staff were very attentive. A vegetarian-friendly breakfast was included, and the views from the train were amazing.

Lovely train jorney. We travelled to and from Aguas Calientes to Cusco and Ollantaytambo. Both jorneys were amazing. The train goes slow so we were able to fully contemplate and take pictures of the landscape. Half the way through a nice snack meal and drinks were served. The train was cute, oldstyle decoration which made you feel like you were in the oriental express. Very confortable, Clean wc. The staff was nice and funny expecially Roxane Leslie, Ronald Porros and Jenkis. They dressed up, danced tranditional dances and made the travel even more pleasant and fun!

Very enjoyable train ride to Machu Picchu. Our tour of Peru and Bolivia with Gate 1 Travel included the Peru Rail Vistadome train ride to Machu Picchu. The train was very comfortable. We sat at tables for four, and were served snacks and drinks during both going and returning trips. The scenery was beautiful and the Vistadome ride made the experience even more enjoyable.

Relax and enjoy the ride to Machu Picchu. This ride is a relaxing and an enjoyable way to get to Aguas Calientas the transfer point before taking the bus ride to Machu Picchu. It leaves from Ollyantaytambo.The trip is made interesting by a small show put on by staff, and a fashion parade of knitted alpaca clothes for men and women, which can be bought on board.The views are exceptional and scenery change to jungle as you near the end of the ride.
Great choice . We lived this trip. The cheaper train looked really crowded and the Hirim was just to expensive. Odelia, Jose Paraviaro, and Blake were great entertainers on the way back to Cusco.
Awsome service!!!!. Indira, Edison and Borgio were exceptional! Clean,, lovely trip! Spacious, good AC. Food was delicious. Caring crew.! Highly recommend.

Scenic and relaxing ride to/from Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome PeruRail from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and back to Cusco the following day. Both trips were highly enjoyable. Would recommend planning at least one leg of the trip during the day or early afternoon, as the views are well worth seeing in daylight. The service was exceptional. Complementary snacks and drinks were provided during the journey. We enjoyed the fashion show put on by the employees - Indird, Ulorco Antonio, and Enzo. Very entertaining!
Scenic Views. Pretty easy to board and I enjoyed the views and the healthy snacks they provided on board. Pretty comfy ride.

What a trip!. I never expected to have such fun on a train.Three employees of Perurail were assigned to my car.They handled the luggage, served a snack, and then presented a dance and a fashion show.They all deserve a raise.

Scenic Travel to Machu Picchu!. We took the Vistadome PeruRail train from Ollantetambo to Aguas Calientes. Great three hour trip with shopping on board, great snacks, and three wonderful staff serving our car. Great sights along the way as the train follows the river through the Sacred Valley. Would recommend this train anytime. Took the return Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Cusco.

A pleasant surprise!. On my way back from seeing Machu Pichu and Aguas Calientes, I was delighted to find myself on the Vistadrome instead of the Expedition train. Although the Expedition train was adequate for the trip from Cusco to Aguas Calientes, my return trip from Aquas Calientes to Ollanta was a world of improvement. The train, seats and tables were more spacious and comfortable with leather-like seats and a nice knit tablecloths and napkins. The coffee was delicious and the food much better than on the Expedition train. Not only was the a big improvement, but the staff consisting of Yulianna, Irvian and Sergio was superior. They not only served us food and drinks, but put on a dance performance and fashion show! We were treated to a fashion show of genuine alpaca sweaters and ponchos and the most amazing variety of coats, scarfs and other knitwear by Sol Alpaca. I was so impressed at how the women's knitwear could be transformed into so many different outfits. For example a simple scarf could become a poncho and be worn in 7 different ways. One poncho style knit was turned into a dress in 2 seconds. Amazing! It was so much fun and so comfortable that I barely noticed the time passing. The men's sweaters were also impressive and very tasteful. Luckily the items were available for purchase and I just had to buy one. However, there was no sales pressure at all.

GREAT TRAIN FOR VIEWING THE SCENERY WITH EXCELLENT SERVICE. Excellent, not only for views from the train but for the comfort and service on the journey itself. We travelled on two Vistadome trains: one from Ollanta to Machu Picchu and the return from Machu Picchu to Poroy. I'd say the choice of seat (if you can choose) is quite important; my wife and I had rear facing seats so you don't get to see what's coming. I would have preferred forward facing seats. The windows in the ceiling are only on the edges so the view upwards is limited but it's still very good. The service on board is excellent with a snack and drinks being served during the journey, dancing and entertainment and a fashion show all put on by the Perurail staff!Journeys of 3 - 4 hours seemed to whiz by.

One of a kind Andees experience best way to Machu Pichu. Great train ride with light breakfast and afternoon snack. Stellar views of the approach to Machu Pichu and smooth gradual ride. some goods for sale on train as part of experience and bathroom aboard

Unbelievable experience. One of the most memorable things we have done. From start to finish you are treated to a luxury experience with good food, nice music and fantastic scenery. Worth every penny!

Amazing servicio! . I loved the peru rail trip. Linda, fredy, and Apu were very helpful and entertaining. Linda even got my friend a seperate snack when she could not eat the peanuts. I highly recommend!!!

Great experience. Had a lovely train ride back from MP - good food, great service (Jorge David, the purser on the train was super friendly and we had a great conversation). Added advantage that the train comes all the way back to Urubamba to the SPG property we were staying at.

Worth every penny, beautiful and relaxing way to machu-picchu . Our staff Rosario, Victor Hugo and Euzo where excellent and really made everyone feel welcome and we'll looked after. The vistadome is well worth the extra money for the increased view, seeing the mountains tower over the train through the sunrooves is stunning.Was initially going to drive the route/walk but very very pleased to have experienced this train. The perfect complement to Machu Pichu.

Peaceful pace through the countryside. The views are amazing and allows insights into the way Peruvians live. The train is clean, but slow, if you are in a hurry take a station closer to MP. We left and returned to the Cusco station which takes a long time.The staff is very friendly and professional.

Amazing Journey & Service on the Vistadome. We had a great trip on the Vistadome from Urubamba to Aguas Calientes. The train was clean, spacious and the high windows offered amazing views of the Andes. Perhaps the best part of the journey was the impeccable service, especially by Jorge David. He made us feel so welcome, accommodating all our needs on the journey. Would definitely utilize this rail service again!

Nice views. Took Vistadome train from Ollanta to Aguas Callientes and then back all the way to Cusco. Lovely views on the way over because it was daylight and you can see mountain ranges and the mighty Urubamba river - pretty amazing really. On the way back entertainment put on by staff was a good laugh, especially that it takes over 3 hours on the way back and you can't see much because its dark. Great way to get to Machu Picchu, so relaxing. They serve nice refreshments and snacks too. Thanks:)

Stunning comfort en route to Maccu Picchu. What a relaxing way to see the bio diversity of the Sacred Valley and get up close to the Urubamba river. If you sit in the back or front car there is an even more fabulous view. Sites along the way are pointed out. The food and snacks leave a lot to be desired so bring your own on board if you think you'll be hungry. On the trip back from MP, the train conductors do double duty and put on an odd fashion show complete with a clown like character that makes you dance with him. No, this isn't a weird dream, this really happens! But it's all part of the fun,

Great way to end a trip to Machu Picchu!. My friends and I hiked the Inca Trail for 4 days and rode the Vistadome to Urumbamba after our tip. The train was very comfortable, spacious, and offered excellent views! There is a small (and entertaining) fashion show and complementary snack/beverage service during the trip. The staff are very friendly! One of the fellows, Apu, was fascinating to talk with, and treated us very well. Highly recommended!
Great train experience!. This is a new way of traveling, enjoy of the view, a typical snack, and most importantly Felipe, Vera and Jonatan!

Amazing!. Maritza and Domingo did an amazing job with food and drink service, followed by a very entertaining fashion show of alpaca clothing. They made us feel welcome, and kept us entertained all through the three and a half hour ride.

Great experience!. My husband, mom and I had the opportunity to travel via the Vistadome last week when traveling in Peru. It was great! The staff was great (Maritza, Erick Leonel & Jonathon), and went the extra mile to make us feel special, since it was my husband's birthday!
excellent service. Attention to details, comfort, excellent customer service during the whole journey.Althought Still too expensive in terms of value for money
WE ENJOY TRAVEL W YOULL. we enjoy travel w youll and thank u for provide good service Carlos, Dayhana and especially Enzo i think u was very polite understanding and helpfull

Amazing experience and they even found my lost bag!!! 😍 . I can't even begin to describe how amazing the whole experience of traveling with Vistadome to Machu Picchu is...they do go the extra mile in making you feel welcomed and in a way special! I won't go in to much detail because I don't want to spoil the experience but they even had some little "shows" during the journey! It's definitely worth your time and money!!! I can only imagine how the Hiram Bigham coach is... hehe That said I also have high praises for the Peru Rail staff... in special for Celia Figueroa and Victor Velande (supervisor abordo)... I've lost my backpack on the way back to Cusco... it had something like $800 dollars worth in gear... I've realized that I've lost it like 30 minutes after I left the station in Poroy... heading back there nothing was to be found but Celia got our contact info and in the very next day they found it (with every single thing on it) and returned to us... and even gave us (me and my girlfriend) some nice Peru Rail water bottles! Once again I couldn't be more grateful for the journey and for Celia and Victor !!!!

Review of Vistadome. My husband and I had a wonderful experience on Peru Rail. The crew was fantastic. We traveled from Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu and then to Cuzco. On one leg, we met our crew Roxona Leslie, Roberto Tuppyachi and Apu Carendas. What a Iwonderful group.. service focused, charming and fun.. They made the experience! I even got to dance in the aisle on the Cuzco leg!

It was a great experience.. It was a great experience. Everything was fine. All services inside the train was very good, with an excellent crew. Specially Mr. Benji Calderón performance as Sacra Inka which was a very nice and unforgatable surprise returning from Machu Picchu to Poroy.

Choose the correct side :-). We traveled on this train from aguas caliente for 2 hours. We had just 4 days trek on the Inca trail. The views are best on the left side travelling forward. Booking in advance is essential. Seats are allocated.

wonderful sites in route to Machupiccu. Took the peru rail from Puroy station. Bought the tickets on line before the trip. There are ticket offices in Cusco, but they sell out fast. enjoyed a views, so interesting to see the changes of topography as the train moved. The seating was very comfortable and service of snack and drink offered.

More then just a train ride. This was more than expected. Snack was OK, nothing exceptional. The scenery on the way out was outstanding. On the way back it was dark but there was a little cultural show (not much that you can do in a train isle) and there was a fashion show. Both keep us entertained and made the trip go by

Great way to travel to Machu Pichu . Really enjoyed the comfort and service of this train. They gave us great insites to the areas we were passing. On the way back it was dark so they provided entertainment with a weird clown guy and an alpaca clothing fashion show which was fun. I highly recommend it!

a nice trip in the jungle of cuzco. its a beautifull train with a nice view where ever you turn around. the atention its amazing. the prices inside the train are realy high. dont recomend to buy nothing inside because there is a moment when the waiters of the car are trying to sell you worthless things that you can buy anywhere with a lower price. in a moment they can be realy bothersome.

They do a great job. PeruRail is the only train that runs from Cusco to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome experience is lovely. On the way to Machu Picchu, you can admire the landscape from the large windows. The staff also offer a few souvenirs on sale, like jackets & caps and guide books. The train is clean, comfortable, the snack is average, nothing great, but you don't really care as the thrill of going to Machu Picchu is far too high to worry about little things like good food. On the return journey, we were tired, and as it got dark, there was nothing to admire outside the window. After serving the snack, the staff surprised us by putting on some entertainment, particularly a fashion show with alpaca-wool garments that were later available for sale. It was a great effort, and they were able to re-energize the entire coach. The train was delayed by 30 minutes on the way back, which was a bit of a bummer.

Amazing view, worth your money ride.. We took the vista dome train from Cusco to Machu Picchu , about 3 .5 hours of ride with breathtaking views of the Andes mountain and the Urbamba river flowing along side the track. I couldn't get enough of the beautiful river, the scenery,just breathtaking.The staff on the train was very polite, excellent service, they served breakfast one way and a snack the other way. The staff even entertained us with a fashion show to sell their duty free items. If you are not going to hike the Inca trail , then the train is a must see attraction . The only down side is you can't take heavy luggage on the train , they only allow you backpacks and small suitcases such as carryons.

Fabulous experience . The train was clean and comfortable and most importantly ran on time. The service wAs excelled and friendly. Food was very good. Domingo, Emerson and maritza did an outstanding job.

Not worth it!. We took the regular train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, then the Vistadome on the way back. What a waste of money! We should have taken the regular car. This is what you get in the Vistadome : a stale sandwich, one local dance by a train attendant in a costume and a fashion show of overpriced clothes "exclusive" to Peru Rail (in a hope that you will buy something). The rest of our trip was great. But I would certainly skip this part if I was to do it again.

Want to go to Narnia?. That's what this felt like; a train to Narnia. Stunningly beautiful views. Even in the dry season. Dont take a bus. If you are not walking the Inca Trail, take the train. Talk to the people you sit across from because you will likely see them in Machu Picchu and on the train back. Everyone starts getting excited on this train ride and starts figuring out what they are in for.

PERURAIL to Machu Picchu. My wife and I rode the train to Machu Picchu last week and were completely impressed with the comfort of the train and the view through the windows on the roof!But the best part was our incredible attendants of our cabin, Nilagros and Esteban were so friendly and accommodating. They made the ride fun and gave me an "Indiana" name tag to wear on my new adventure vest that matched my "Indiana Jones" hat.We will always remember and cherish our ride to Machu Picchu.

Train from Machu Pichu. the train was very confortable. The snack food was very good. Maritza, Balbino and Bernardo who attended our cabin were very courteous and they presented a fashion show of alpaca sweters with music and a dancer with a mask that made us be very happy. Kids were having a lot of fun.

Great service, amazing views.. We highly recommend taking the Vistadome to Machu Picchu. The service is well organized, seats and tables comfortable, and the all around views are amazing. On the way back from Machu Picchu, the fashion show was fun. Special thanks to Roxana, Edson and Jorge for their service and modeling!

Comfort, good service and great view!. Great experience with an amazing view! The service was even better because of the attention and kindness of the attendants Linda, Daniel and Benji.Highly recommended!

Unforgettable! . What a great rail line! Went from Cusco in the morning and the service was great, really polite, friendly and offering a great service. On the way back in the afternoon it was even better. With Erik, Danesa and Roberto giving again a great friendly service but also a great fashion show and fun jester, it was thee most unforgettable train ride ever. Well done Peru Rail and a must for everyone going to Machu Picchu!

Great. This was the most relaxing part of my trip since it was go go go. It was comfortable and clean and the music was nice. I saw the backpacker train out the side door, it looked much bumpier. I loved the vistadome, I'd do it again in a minute! My friend bought some of the nice clothes they modeled at the end. Very nice quality.

Scenic train and a really nice ride. Really nice and scenic view from the train. With this train you can go to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu village) and pass throught the jungle. If the prices were a bit lower that would be perfect!

Couple . We traveled from MachuPicchu to Cusco on Vistadome train. It was awesome. The staff was incredible. They deserve commendation. They are:MaritzaBernardo DanielIt was a memorable experience worth every penny.

Spectacular!. I enjoyed my trip so much! Best train ride ever! The views were amazing and the staff even better. I just traveled from Aguascalientes back to Cuzco and since it was night time it was hard to see, but the staff was able to entertain! Thank you Maritza, Daniel, Bernardo! You guys were amazing!!!!

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!. The view from the train was spectacular! The service from the staff (Maritza, Daniel, and Bernardo) was top class!! Supreme comfort! THE BEST way to travel from Cusco to Machupicchu!! Highly recommended!

Best train ride ever! . Great and beautiful train ride from ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. Views were amazing, staff was friendly. I have traveled all over Europe in trains but never had this service or food served.
The trains were beautiful and staff gracious and helpful

Fabulous views. The Vistadome was lovely overall, the views were stupendous and the overall ride very comfortable. The service was very good. However the loudspeaker announcements were too loud, and reminiscent of soviet style propaganda. The one thing Perurail could do to improve the experience would be to tone down the audio. Also the "fashion show" was pretty sad, the clothing was fine but watching the stewardess try to do a dramatic Parisian runway strut was ridiculous. Simply walking the aisle with a smile would have been so much better.

Beautiful leisurely trip. Only 43Km from Ollataytambo to Aguas Calientes (for Machu Picchu) but trip takes about 90 minutes and passes through spectacular scenery - beautifully kept fields followed by spectacular mountain views and an everchanging river.

Happy Rails!. PeruRail offers three levels of rail services between Cuzco to Machu Picchu. Expedition is the "trekker" bare-bones service. Hiram Bingham is the "ultra-expensive" service. Vistadome is the "best value" service in my opinion. As the name implies, the Vistadome has very large windows on the sides and on the ROOF of the train. Be sure to take the train during daylight hours, so that you can enjoy the view beside you AND above you! Starting from the heights of sky-high Cuzco, the train rolls downhill and the climate changes every hour. First you will see Cuzco city and suburbs. Then beautiful evergreen-covered mountaintops. Then the cliffs are so steep, the train cannot do s-curves, so it uses Z-shaped switch-backs instead. In other words, the train rolls backwards-then-forwards 4 times to get down to the valley below. The valley is very narrow and the mountains go straight up 2,000 feet above you, so LOOK UP and watch for snow-covered peaks! The valley below is beautifully dotted with small, terraced farms. As the train rolls along the river, the climate changes to sub-tropical. If you watch closely, you will see orchids, heleconias, bromiliads, and other plants that are common to South Florida. (I live at sea-level in Fort Lauderdale, FL,so I certainly was not expecting to see those in the Andes Mountains!) You will be served a light but satisfying Peruvian breakfast along the way. Most of the Vistadome seating is euro-train style, meaning 4 people gathered around a table. We sat across from a wonderful couple for Los Angeles and had a terrificconversation! But for taller people (we are both over 6 ft. tall), the legroom in this configuration was cramped. Now let's talk about the luggage limit. Your PeruRail ticket will say there is a very serious weight limitation (approx. 15 lbs per person). Don't believe it! We went through all the hassle of downsizing our stuff to meet the weight limit, storing the rest of our luggage at our Cuzco hotel, then retrieving our luggage from that hotel and re-packing everything for our flight back to Lima. What a waste! At to Cuzco train station, several Vistadome passengers had very large suitcases and the PerRail porters gladly stowed their stuff for them on the train. In addition, each car has space at the exits to store your own bags. And there was no extra charge for either option. So why not take everything with you? (When we got to our hotel in MP, we asked the front desk staff about PeruRail's luggage weight limit, and they said, "Everyone ignores it. We have never heard of a single time when it was enforced." Oh, yes, you and store a very small bag under your seat, but there is no overhead storage. Remember on the Vistadome, you have a glass ceiling to enjoy to overhead views. Happy rails!

Relatively comfy ride, so-so scenery. We took the VistaDome train with large windows expecting to see pretty countryside and interesting sights on the way to Machu Picchu. Sorry folks, not much to see. A few sections by the river had some fauna, but nothing too majestic. Given the early departure time, its a bit of a blessing to have 2 hours to nap on the journey, but the windows mean you have to sleep in full sun light. The train seats were comfortable, however it was a bit awkward navigating legs with your neighbors while sleeping, getting up or eating meals. There is quite a bit of rocking as the train rattles along the railways. If you suffer from motion-sickness, be warned.I was pleased to find they served a full meal, even though the tickets refer to them as "snacks". On the night train, there is a "fashion show" to sell pricey wool garments. This entailed 15-20 minutes of clapping along to music as the staff performed dances and catwalked. this is your only entertainment, however, as the night renders the windows useless. Again, there is some opportune nap time before the show.TIPS: bring ear plugs/eye mask/sweater to help you sleep. dress in layers: its cool on the train, HOT on the mountains! negotiate a ride back from the train station to Cusco with the driver who drops you off. guides are at the entrance at Machu; if you can grab a party of 4 its worth it to have your own personal guide take you around the site. the guides wouldn't bargain with us for a party of 2, so make some new friends.
Vistadome was a great way to see Peru. There are three ways to get to Machu Picchu and I chose Vistadome for one way. It was clean,comfortable, friendly and spacious. Highly recommend this option.

Scary Clown and Playing Footsies. it's the only way to Aguacalientes to get to Machu Picchu...not bad.. beautiful scenery.. bring a good book.. your journal... your knitting.. your unfinished screenplay, etc.. smooth ride.. The seats were awkward because we were forced to share a space with strangers... (each couple FACES each other) They kicked their feet a lot and there was no way to avoid them. 3+ hours of travel and this became annoying quickly. And if they are loud, relaxing and sleeping are out of the question. I wish they offered a vegetarian option...we were not able to eat the food which was a shame since it's a long trip & included in the price. The cups are small too but the coffee and tea are good and you can ask for refills.. the staff are very accommodating. We didn't like the fashion show since all we wanted to do was sleep. We noticed lots of guests enjoyed them. I wish they offered carriages where we are not awakened by a multi-colored purring clown, wielding a staff.. it was quite disturbing.

Excellent Train Journey. We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and then two days later on the reverse journey. The staff seemed to be very organised, our bags were taken from us and stored in a section of the carriage. The staff in our carriage were very friendly and polite welcoming all as we boarded. The chairs were very comfortable and there was a small table which had a placemat on it and small plant. A light breakfast was served going down, this was a selection of pastries and hot drink, the return journey we had served a local dish made of corn meal and wrapped in corn husks, and two other small savoury bites. The scenery was stunning as it winds its way down the valley, plant life along the track was also very beautiful. After the staff cleaned up the meals on the way down they had a trolley of merchandise they pushed through the carriage for sale, the return journey we had a fashion parade showing off alpaca wool garments which was lovely, music and all. Overall I would highly recommend this train, very comfortable and time soon passed.

Excelent. REALLY EXPENSIVE.. About train> puntual, clean, safe and excelent. The people great with show include. But about tourism the price is extremely expensive> USD 300.00 two tickets ( ollantaytambo/aguas calientes) .... EXACTLY by air> LIMA/CUZCO... vistadome is the good option, better than the other trainReally is expensive. Service good as many trains around the world. But the price ...

Amazing service on this train! Benjamin saved me!. I had been on a trip with many people, all with similar looking bags. About 15 minutes before departure, I realized that I had accidentally taken someone else's bag. This meant that my own bag was still at the hotel, about an 8 minute walk away from the train station. I was taking the train to Cusco, where I would fly Cusco -> Lima -> Fort Lauderdale, Florida, USA -> JFK, New York, USA. I knew that if I missed this train I would then miss all of my connecting flights. Benjamin, who was working in the A section of the train, ran all the way back with me to my hotel to change the bags. We were running so fast across town and weren't sure that we would make it back in time. It was so incredibly kind of him and without his help I would not have made any of my flights or made it home. He truly exemplifies the selfless, caring culture in Peru. I cannot thank him enough!

Excellent Train Ride. My family and I really enjoyed the train ride which was during the day light hours. We saw lots of nice things along the way and the roof which was see through was great as we got a chance to see more things above us. I would not recommend the Vistadome during night hours as you will not be able to take advantage of the see through roof. The service was excellent and have no complaints. My family and I loved the train ride.

Disappointed. With the great reviews I have read here, I tried the Vistadome ride from aguas calientes to Ollantaytambo. We were a bit early for our 1337 ride so one of their staff, Freddy, offered an earlier ride at 1055. I told them we can go as long as we will be seated together. I repeat that several times. We waited and they asked us to board only to find out that seats are apart. I told the staff, Juliana, that we will just wait for our original timing as we are not in a hurry but to my surprise they tore our tickets and did not open the door leaving us to endure the train ride apart. Why do they have to force people just to sell more tickets?!! I did not expect this kind of service with the value of the ticket.What a way to end our anniversary trip!!!

Beautiful trip and great service . The main reason why I am posting this review is because of the super hero train attendant Felipe who went far out of his way to find me and return to me an important document I lost while riding to Aguas Calientes. Thank you so much!!! The ride was splendid and taking the Vista dome from Poroy was an excellent choice.

Well run train service. I did the 4 day trek to get to Machu Picchu but the train back to Ollantaytambo both were scenic but the train was so much more comfortable! The trip started with us grouping in a crowded waiting room but it was well organised. The transfer to the train was orderly as everyone had assigned seats - and they were very relaxing.Arrival is well into the evening and dark so make sure you have pre-arranged onward travel or a place to stay.

A great trip to Machu Picchu. The choice of Vistadome with the glass roof was a good one. Not cheap but a great experience - the views, the food and the performance on board put on by the staff. We took the train both ways to and from Cusco to Machu Picchu and it was seamless from boarding to disembarkation. While the basic train looked OK think this is a better experience for not much extra!

Beauty At A Glance!. I encourage everyone to take a train ride in the vistadome car. You won't regret such a marvelous choice. The panoramic views and photo opps that you get are exhilarating.The seating was comfortable and the train car was very clean. You can tell that the staff takes pride in what they are doing. They are friendly, courteous and humorous. The on board fashion show was an unexpected treat. It made the train trip even more memorable. The snacks provided were satisfying and hit the spot!

An excellent trip to an excellent destination. We took the VistaDome to and from Machu Picchu as a part of a trip around Peru, Bolivia, Chile and the Easter Island. On both the outward trip and the return trip (in our case a day later) the carriages were extremely comfortable and clean and refreshments were served. They also have partly glassed roofs to make it easier to take photographs, and there is plenty of great scenery to photograph. If you can, leave your main luggage in Cusco and just take what you need while you are in Machu Picchu. We just took hand luggage (small day rucksack each). The station is in the middle of the town, close to the hotels and also the buses that go up to Machu Picchu every few minutes.On the return trip, there was a small "show" by the staff as well as the sale of various souvenirs. On our particular trip, we were looked after by Dalia, Carlos Ruben and Erick Mayer and they all bent over backwards to make sure we had an enjoyable trip.
Lovely Train To Machu Picchu. My family and I had a great experience on PeruRail Vistadome. The views were beautiful and the service excellent- thank you to Maribel, Edison, and Benji C!

We loved this train ride. We took the train from Urubamba to Aquas Calientes. No regrets. The train is VERY slow. (Around 5 MPH), but we did not mind because the service is first class, the seats are comfy, and the sights are outstanding. Almost worth going just for the train ride.

First class to Machu Picchu. What a great way to reach town at base of Machu Picchu. Definitely worth the upgrade. Professional crew. Complimentary snack & beverage. On the return trip we enjoyed the entertainment of cultural dance and Alpaca fashion show. First class travel!

good views comfotable seats, nice snack. Clean train, large comfortable seats, nice views. From Ollantaytambo riding on the left side and coming back on the right side, I think gives much better views. NIce narration of sites on the way to Ollantaytambo and on the way back a show of sorts to entertain. Nice snack on the way and coming. Station is very clean with lots of bathrooms in Agua caliente and fairly easy to get to the buses going up to Manchu picchu- cross the bridge in front of the station then down the street to the bus station. Coming back the buses will let you out at the bridge. Or you can choose to walk thru the market and cross over to the buses.

Excellent way to get to Machu Picchu. This is definitely a tourist train. It's high end, clean and comfortable. They treat you well and serve nice snacks. In the morning, they're good about letting you sleep and on the way back, we got a treat of dancing and a fashion show. Enjoyable!

Pay for the upgraded experience. The Visitadome is $10 more than the Expedition and worth every cent. There is minimal difference in the windows (which in theory is what you think you are paying for). But a world of a difference in service and options.Visitadome has staff to help with luggage and stores it for you. Vistadome serves snacks on tabeclothes and the meal of dishes with regular drink service. The Expedition offered a small plastic cup of soda/water and a packaged cookie.Pay the minimal price difference for not only better windows, but better service and snack.

Good option for traveling to Machu Picchu. The PeruRail train is somewhat expensive, but it's a good option for traveling to and from Machu Picchu. The trains are nice, clean and provide great views of the journey to and from MP.The staff was friendly on our trip, the service was excellent, the overall experience was terrific.Just as an FYI, the trip from Cusco to Poroy Station, where the train leaves, takes about 25-30 minutes and costs approximately 40-50 Soles. The Poroy Station waiting area has some food/drinks for sale as well, but I'd recommend bringing a bottle of water (or two or three) with you.

Great service. Great train. Definitely the way to go. Comfortable seats and there was enough storage for luggage. The view is stunning. The service was terrific. One employee, Edgar Curen Ivan Taluvera, was very helpful with helping my family navigate the train for the first time. Plus, he helped me practice my Spanish (I asked him to).

A Very Civilized Mode of Transportation. In our three week tour of parts of Peru and Ecuador we utilized many forms of transportation. Some were fast; some were slow. But it seemed we were always being awoken early to catch a plane or a van and always in a hurry to get to the next conveyance. This is not true when speaking of the train ride to Macchu Picchu. This is a very civilized way to spend a morning or afternoon, watching the Peruvian countryside roll by. The train is comfortable and the onboard service is great. The train leaves on time and, usually, it arrives on time at your destination. Food is served and you can purchase a glass of wine or a beer. The restroom is generally pretty clean. We even had a fashion show on the way back to Cusco on the evening schedule. There are a couple of fascinating aspects as well. There's a road being built along the way. At one point the train backs up; it's a means of changing elevation. And there's one place where you can see SkyLodge, the hotel rooms that are hanging 400 feet up the side of a sheer cliff. In sum, taking the train is a very comfortable, civilized way to travel.

Great service to get to Machu Picchu.. The booking process was easy and straightforward. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and they offered a snack and drink each way. The views were nice and the ride was quick. Seats were assigned but I do wish we had the option to choose our own seats and to see beforehand if the seats were forward facing or rear facing. On the way back from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo, there was a "fashion show" and an opportunity to buy Andean sweaters and wraps. Storage space is limited on the train, so if you're carrying an extra large bag/luggage, you may have to leave some of it at the train station.

NOT YOUR AVERAGE TRAIN RIDE. The 90 minute train ride from Agues Calientes to Machu Picchu ranks among the best I have ever experienced to include Durango-Silvertown, Grand Canyon, Flam Railway. Following a tributary river to Mach Picchu, you are treated to a view of Peru's natural beautiful and rural farm life. Water falls, glacier topped mountains, and pastural scenery glide by while you're served coffee/tea and light snakes by courteous staff. A fitting preview for the grandeur of Machu Picchu.

No ordinary train ride. The trip from Cusco to Aguas Caliente was made much more enjoyable compliments of the train. Before our ride was broken with beautiful scenery that differs along the trail. Followed by entertainment that differs each direction of travel. And the classy touch of a tablecloth on each table as a meal was served. This is the way to go!

Smooth and Quick. Riding from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Clients on the Vistadome was a relaxing ride on our way to Macchu Pichu. This train runs on time, travels through a canyon next to a river that provide wonderful views on the way to the "main event". Modest food and beverage is on offer and brought to your seat. It's a quick ride (1 1/2 hours) on the way down to the destination. Service to/from Cusco is closer to 3 hours.

Best way to travel through Peru!!!. We took the Vistadome to Machu Picchu and the Hiram Bingham back. And there is no question that, for the money, the Vistadome was a far better experience.To begin, there are a TON of service people both on the platform as well as in each car itself. Our single car had four people alone. On top of that, each of them was friendly, helpful, spoke fluent English (great for someone like me who's Spanish is still improving!), and professional dressed. Completely different from trains in North America.The train itself was beautiful, with huge windows, comfortable seats, tables and one of the largest (and cleanest) bathrooms I've even seen on any mode of transportation. Announcements were clear and easy to understand. The snack was light, but tasty and not simply some bag of chips.And then there is the scenery. It was truly breathtaking and having all of those additional windows/larger windows clearly made all of the difference. Even for scenes that were on the other side of the train, the windows were so larger than it made no difference because no single person could possible block a window.
