That being said, if you're traveling into MP, get a seat on the left side of the train...you'll look out on the river the entire trip!Best way to travel in Peru and I look forward to taking it again!

Outstanding train ride to Maccu Picchu. Very nice and clean train to MP. Our train departed outside the Sacred Valley area about 1 hr 30 min drive from Cusco. The train ride was 1 hr 30 min. Its a beautiful trak through the Andes along a rocky river with gorgeous views. The vistadome makes it easy to take photos as do the large clean windows. Snack is served as well as entertainment.

Entertaining both inside the train and outside.. We caught this train at Ollantaytambo to the town of Aguas Calientes which is where you catch a bus up to Machu Picchu. The scenery is stunning and you can see lots of it through the large windows in the roof. Food is served and you will also be entertained by the waiting staff in a variety of ways. On our return we went all the way back to Cusco.

Train ride back from Machu Picchu. We had a wonderful train ride back from Machu Picchu aboard the vistadome. Thank you to our three stewards, Domungo, Gladys and Joseht, who offered a warm, exciting and pleasant trip. We had a great experience in the Vistadome!

Great views and easy trip to Aguas Calientes/Machu Picchu. The train was easy and right on time. Because of the times we wanted, we took the Expedition to Aguas Calientes (which is cheaper) and the Vistadome to return to Cuzco (more expensive ticket). Both were great--the more expensive ticket had a newer looking train and fancier snack, but other than that there wasn't too much difference between the two.I have to say a special thank you to Felipe, Indira and Eric Mayer who were the staff on the Vistadome train returning to Cuzco the evening of July 5th--they went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience and were so outgoing.

Great train ride from Machu Picchu. Well, many reviews before this will tell you about the magnificent scenery etc. All that is true. The Perurail system could go head to head with the Swiss rail network. If you are late, you lose. The service to Machu Micchu was ok, but the return leg from MP to Olliantaytambu was amazing. On our return trip, the team of Roxana, Roberto, and Freddy were indefatigable, and wonderful to say the least. I think the train could improve the quality of their snacks given the 1.5 hour trip, but that is not the main reason for the journey.

A wonderful trip to Machu Pichu. If you can't walk the Inca trail, then this is the best way to get to Machu Pichu. The views are wonderful and the staff was great. PeruRail is conveniently located in Cusco's square.

Before you book a ride in PeruRail Vistadome read this.... We celebrated our 25th wedding anniverary, our son's university graduation (Berklee College of Music) and our daughter's 15th birthday during our ride to Aguas Calientes (heading to Machu Picchu) and our ride was just splendid!! Crew members: Linda, Carlos and Benjamin did a phenomenal job making sure that not only us, but everyone on the train was confortable. We have traveled to many places, but sehervice and ride was just out of this world...!!

Beautiful views, friendly staff, and on time!. It's about a 3-hour+ train ride from Cusco to Macho Picchu and it's worth every minute. Sit back, enjoy the spectacular views, and chat with your fellow travellers.

Fun and great views.. The train ride was great with great views and the staff put on a great floor show! They modeled several outfits and even had a character who was in costume dancing with the passengers.

A Great Way to Get to Machu Picchu. Getting to Machu Picchu from Cusco was quite the trip, taking a bus from Cusco to Ollantaytambo, then the train to Agua Caliente and finally another bus to Machu Picchu. By far, the most relaxing and pleasant leg of the trip was on Peru Rail, with the "Vistadome". The cars are clean and comfortable and the views are good. I would; however, recommend that you sit on the river side of the car, as the views are more spectacular.

The Vistadome is the way to go to Machu Picchu.. A wonderful experience all the way around. The scenery is spectacular, the wait staff were kind and attentive. The meal was a snack and delicious. We enjoyed a fashon show with fine alpaca garments - a bit pricey but so much less than in the States. We even enjoyed cafe con leches at the beautiful train station waiting to go back from Machu Picchu.

Emitted smoke on the faces of kids in nearby towns. On one hand you travel in this luxury train paying outrageous prices, and on the other hand the train emits so much black smoke. In one of the towns we passed on the way (Cusco to Machu Picchu), the smoke was thrown right in the face of kids walking nearby. These kids covered their faces and tried to run away. There couldn't run fast enough...What a shame.

Comfortable and Scenic. The Vistadome train ride back to Cusco was a pleasure. The seats were comfortable, the ride was easy and the views through all the windows was awesome. It was well worth the extra money over the standard train ride. The snacks and drinks were good and the staff on the train was charming. They put on a little fashion show that was entertaining and afterward, they did try to sell some apparel but if you said no, they left you alone. That didn't bother me at all.

Nice train ride, need to tone down the sales pitch. We took the train from Cusco to Machu Picchu and enjoyed the scenery and attentive service offered on the train. Like previous reviewers have written, the repeated aggressive attempts to sell passengers everything from DVD's to safari style vests to food to hats was very distracting and took away from the beautiful train ride.
Excellent service. Excellent service train was great food different but I liked, being a Peruvian my self I have never taste that food

Lovely ride and great service. I was in Peru in May which I think is the best time to go-right at the end of the rainy season so it's very lush, fresh, not too hot. Also during this time it is busy but not as busy as it gets in the summer. We took the vistadome up to Aguas calientes and back. It was such a scenic and relaxing ride. The staff were very efficient and welcoming to get us aboard. I had actually met one of staff members earlier that week, so it was quite coincidental I saw him working in the vistadome. His name was Alex and he was very accommodating and friendly! The service was great, and the food was nice. Not huge portions but nice size snacks to have along the way. There was also a little fashion show and traditional costume worn and danced in at the end of the ride which was fun! Although it is expensive, it is well worth it for an easy, relaxing, entertaining and scenic adventure:)
I love this train.. I love the way they designed the train. I love riding trains. They are very relaxing. The windowed roof adds to the appeal of seeing the Peru mountains while we travel.

Comfortable ride, great views and fashion show!. Daniella, Claudio and Amadeo made the trip fun for us and our 4 teen boys. During a longish wait for two trains descending from ollaytaytambo to aguas calientes to pass us as we returned, they put on a musical representation of a local dance and a fashion show of some beautiful alpaca tops and sweaters, exclusive to perurail. The boys dropped their card game and joined the dancing in the aisle!

Great scenery. We took a return trip from Ollantayambo to Aguas Calientes as part of our journey to Machu Picchu. The train runs alongside the river through the mountains and has magnificent views. The service was excellent with comfortable seats and a complimentary drink and snack. We even had a fashion show and other entertainment provided by the staff servicing our carriage. A very enjoyable trip.

Enjoyable and Entertaining Train Ride!. The vistadome train is comfortable ,clean and windows are large enough for viewing along with the rooftop.The staff quite pleasant and entertaining .I believe they can improve on beverages and finger food .One can enjoy a nice glass of wine on the way back and a delicious sandwich beside bread and cheese.This was my only concern,I have sampled quinoa creme caramel and a cup of coffee ,which can fit in on this return ride .

Surprisingly good. I took this train from Ollantaytambo to Machu Pichu Pueblo. It takes an hour and a half. It is the first railroad in which we were served a drinks and a snack. On the way into Machu Pichu, They also tried to sell hats, maps and vests that have a logo on it. On the way back, they tried to sell us wool clothes. No sale, but a great train ride.

Too bad NY trains can't be like this. The train ride from Cusco to Aguas Calientes was splendid. It is a long ride, approximately 4 hours but very comfortable. Be sure to show up on time, because it leaves on time. It is important to have your passport handy because they will check it upon boarding. The train is very comfortable with a lot of windows to view the beautiful landscape. Leg room can be tight especially if the person across from you is either tall or decides to put their backpacks under the table. The food is decent, but nothing to write home about. It is worth bringing your own snacks/drinks. The bathrooms on board are actually very nice. They have little entertainment segments to help break the trip up. They also sell products during the trip and can be pushy at times. Overall, sit back and enjoy the ride to a natural wonder.

Vista dome from auguas calientes peru. This was one of the highlights of our trip not only was the scenery stunning, there was a snack tray served a traditional dancer and fashion show on board made it unforgettable?

Comfortable and Entertaining. The Vistadome, is a nice, clean and comfortable train. The journey is a bit, takes around 4 hours from Cusco, so comfort and scenery are a big deal. The majority of the seats face each other, so leg room can be an issue. The food served is ok. But the best part of the train is the large windows, including the roof. The leg from Aguas Calientes to Poroy has a fashion show, selling authentic alpaca clothing. It was certainly entertaining.You can go cheaper with the expedition, or break the bank with Hiram Bingham, but Vistadome seems like the best option.

Nice Train - Expensive though. I took Peru Rail on my way back from Manchu Picchu (we hiked the Inca Trail). The train is really nice and the windows are really cool. I think if you are looking for a comfy way to see the sites in Peru then this is a nice choice. However, I do think the tickets are a bit on the pricey side - especially since you have to get to the train station which isn´t even in Cusco (the usual jumping off point for Manchu Picchu).

Entertaining Rail Travel. We travelled as a group of eight from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and return in March 2015. We were all very impressed with the service - food and entertainment. The scenery is beautiful and we were looked after by Maribel, Erick and Edson with snacks and drinks on both legs. The train left exactly on time and the boarding process is excellent. Train was very clean and comfortable. Aguas Calientes station has absolutely beautiful gardens and surrounds. Would highly recommend.

A great rail trip with entertainment to match. An unforgettable rail trip. We made the 3 hour rail trip between Aguas Calientes and Poroy, about 20 minutes from Cuzco with a group of eight friends. The very large glass windows make it easy to have a fantastic view of the passing scenery and activities. The glass roof enabled us to see the snow clad mountains and as night fell, the stars and moon. A light meal was included in the train cost and was very good. The entertainment was provided by PeruRail staff with one playing the part of a Saqra, an innocent mischief who performs a traditional dance in the Cusco Region. The staff then performed a fashion show when they modelled clothing (mainly coats, jerseys and ponchos) made from alpaca fibre. Great fun and well worth the cost.

fun. The vistadome was a fun experience and the views from the windows on the ceilings were incredible. Well worth the price. The food was less to be desired but staff was friendly and helpful. On the return from Machu Pichu they do a fashion show and have a typical dance during the ride. Met some nice people too. A great way to get to Aguas Calientes town.

Vistadome well worth it!!!. WOW!! My beloved Peru once again does NOT disappoint!! The service was phenomenal!! Edson, Milagros, and Carlos Eduardo put on quite a show for us and even modeled some very exclusive Alpaca clothing which I purchased for my wife. The food was great and their Pisco sour was on point!Thank you Edson, Milagros, and Carlos Eduardo for your hospitality and service!!

A Trip through the Andes. We took the Vistadome train from our hotel, the Tambo Del Inka in Urumbamba, to the base of Machu Picchu. The train ride was abvolutely the highlight of our trip to Peru. The views of the mountains as you take a slow train ride through the Sacred Valley were unbelievably beautiful. Don't miss this experience.
Very pleasant. The train ride to Machu Picchu was very relaxing the staff was very professional the scenary was spectular.

Amazing scenery on Train to view. Definitely surprised by interior of the train yes it is slow but more to see therefore and the Fashion show on board something different and friendly smiling personal. Worthwhile up to MACCHU PICCHU and down.

Awesome service. Boy has Peru upped their game! When I was visiting 8 years ago, the backpacker train had chickens in the aisles and holes to pee down. The Vistadome is nothing like the old train. The seats were roomy and comfy. The ride is so fun. Everything is clean. The scenery is great. The train is a great way to get to and from Aguas Caliente. The snacks were big enough to be considered meals and were a real treat--tasty! The best part about this ride is the service. Vera, Victor Hugo, and Amadeo went above and beyond to make everyone comfortable and entertained. They provided a fashion show and a mock celebration to exhibit some of the dancing and costumes from the Peruvian culture. You could tell that they really cared to give each rider a great experience and that they really cared about their jobs and sharing a part of their country. Thank you, Vera, Victor, and Amadeo for providing such an enjoyable trip!

Stunning scenery. The train ride to Machu Picchu leaves from Ollantaytambo. On one side of the train you get views of the glacier , if sittting on the other side you get views of the rushing Urumbamba river. It is a pleasant way to get to the ruins. On the way back you get a snack and a costumed performer as well as a fashion show put on by the attendants - the scarves , jackets and coats were modeled to perfection to show off these items that are made of very soft alpaca and specifically for this train. Be prepared and bring lots of money as the items are pricey but well worth it - one scarf was transformed into a dress ! This was a nice way to pass the time in the evening as it was too dark at that time to take in the scenery.

Slow train, not for tired hikers.. I'm sure this is a great way to see beautiful scenery on the way to Machu Picchu, but for anyone who has just completed a multi-day Sacred Valley hike and who has been taking in the scenery all week, it's just not worth the extra money. I was so tired, I slept almost the whole way. The train moved so slow and was an hour late getting into Poroy (the journey was 4 hours instead of 3 as we were told).If I hadn't been sick, I'm sure I would have really enjoyed the meal. It looked delicious! I saw many families on the train whose kids were delighted with the dancers and fashion show, so it's probably a good option if you are traveling with young children.

Great Train ride !. We travelled up to Machu Pichu last week, the views from the train were absolutely fantastic. The service and staff of the train were even more fantastic ! The detail of putting little pot plants on each table prior to the serving of the morning snack was a delightful touch. The entertainment ( Folk dancing and fashion show in the carriage ) on the way back made for a really fun and memorable train ride - would recommend it to anyone.

my husband become ill on the trip and the staff on board were awesome.......took care of us and the other guests... I would recommend this group to anyone....service, understand english, helpful, compassionate and caring

Awesome! Bang for your buck!!. We took the vistadome to Poroy around 5:30pm on May 24th. The staff was Amazing!! Extremely professional, nice and worked their butts off to provide an amazing experience. Ronal Porroa, Danesa Mora and Fredy Sihui made up the train crew and made our experience perfect. They were there when ever we needed anything and provide the best service I've ever had. They were entertaining and kind. The train itself was very nice, comfortable and the snacks were good. They had beer and wine for sale and we took advantage of that as well. The drinks were cheap and good. The views amazing and breathtaking. The only downside is that the train was SO HOT!! They need a better A/C. I would definitely recommend the vistadome. The staff rocked!!

Surprising service and ride.. I returned to visit Machu Picchu after more than 30 years, the train then, was called the Tourists Train, as there was another one for the locals, that was a horror, then. In fact the trains do not leave from Cusco anymore, you are picked up at your hotel and then there is a 20 minute drive to Poroy, that is the station they use now for all the trains, apart from Ollantaytambo. The Vistadome is a nice train, seats are comfortable and the surprising thing was the catering service you have, with some juices and sandwiches or quiche, plus coffee, in any case, I thought there will be nothing and all this is now included, it is a service like on a plane,and arriving to Aguas Calientes, they will try to sell you books or scarfs, in a nutshell, there are other ways to travel, but the ride is as pleasant as it can be, as the train ride is a very slow one, as the rails are old. Enjoy the view of the river or the snow-capped mountains and it also allows you the longest time in the ruins, and you will arrive past 9pm in the evening to Cusco. Also the toilets are kept clean, and the staff is outstanding.The ride is a lot better than 30 years ago.

Unforgettable experience!. The 3+ hour ride through beautiful Peruvian countryside takes you from the temperate Cusco climate to the cloud forests of Aguascalientes and Machu Picchu. It's magical. The glass-topped carriages make mountain-gawking a must, and service is gracious.
Fantastic journey.. Great train with fantastic scenery to look at. The staff were great and looked like they enjoyed their job. Very smartly dressed too.
Fun Fun Fun. We had the best time on this train. So much more than on the Hiram Bingham. The fashion show and the crazy creature dance and music was very entertaining. The snack was good too. Fun

My Legs Will Get A well - Deserved Rest. The train ticket was included in my Inca Trail adventure, a four day hike to Machu Picchu. On the fourth day, I descended a steep rock trail carrying my backpack I was thankful that I thought to bring hiking poles along. I tightened the pole straps around my wrists and leaned my upper body weight on the pole handles, the shock absorbing poles protected my knees from damage and discomfort on the way down. The sunshine warmth added more natural beauty to the Machu Pichu landscape. After walking and taking lots of photos of the Ancient Civilization, I took the bus to Aguas Calientes.I ate lunch, drank my first alcoholic beverage since I left the States, shopped for Inca Trail t-shirts then walked to the train station with a sigh that now my legs will get a well-deserved rest. My Inca Trail excursion included the Vista Dome train back to Poroy (Cuzco). I sat down on my assigned seat, no one next to me; I welcomed the freedom to sit next to the window or aisle using the Go-pro to capture the scenery and the comfort of the Vista Dome Train.A light Peruvian meal was served then Entertainment, a Peruvian folk dancer brought cheer to the passengers and later an Alpaca clothing fashion show was done by walking up and down the aisles.The train ride ended in Poroy where I was met by my driver to take me to the hotel. After four long days a hot shower with all the comforts of indoor plumbing was gratefully welcomed.

One of the best train journeys ever!. We took the train to Machu Picchu and back and had a fantastic time. The staff really made the whole experience - so kind and attentive. The carriages are very comfortable and the glass ceilings mean you see so much of the countryside. We had such a fun return trip - with dancing in the aisles, followed by a fashion show! Sounds cheesy but it was very colourful and a lot of fun. Helped we met two lovely Americans, Carla and Marty from Fort Lauderdale. Definitely recommend the Vistadome.

Expensive...but as fun as a train ride can be. If you don't want to hike the Inca Trail and you want to see Machu Picchu, you'll have to take Peru Rail. Your only option really is to choose which train. There's the super-luxe Hiram Bingham at almost $800pp roundtrip from Cusco. I thought about this for about a minute. I'm a picky traveler - I like nice hotels and generally to treat myself well. I just couldn't justify that expense on a train ride. Then there's the "backpacker train"/Expedition which I really didn't consider ($160pp roundtrip) or the Vistadome, the mid-range option at $180pp, which I ended up with. I was happy with choice. For an extra $20pp, there's no question that it's worth it over the Expedition for any bit of extra comfort you can get if you're riding on a train for over 7 hours in one day. And we passed by the Hiram Bingham - while it looked a bit nicer, I don't think it looked to be worth the extra expense. On the Vistadome, time passes quickly on the way to Machu Picchu. You don't really realize that it's 3.5 hours. There's pleasant Peruvian flute music playing in the background. Periodically, there are announcements about where you are or interesting facts. And you get a complimentary snack and drink (many people ordered cocoa tea) each way. The snack is a pastry with some fruit and a bit of quiche in the morning and in the afternoon, some candied nuts, tamale and a sweet. In the afternoon, your trip is broken up with some traditional dancing in the aisles as well as an Alpaca fashion show. It's a long time sitting down, but they do all they can to make it entertaining. Everyone is very friendly. And of course, the scenery is just fantastic. It would be nice to be able to select your own seats as you would on a plane. The seats are generally placed in sets of four, with two seats on each side facing each other over a table. It's somewhat awkward as you likely don't know the people in front of you and the leg space is pretty tight. I'd have much preferred the seats that are just two together (of which there are a few sets on the car). If this matters to you, you might want to send them an email to change your seat numbers (or visit any of the PeruRail offices in Lima or Cusco). The tickets advise getting to the station 30 minutes prior to departure. This is not necessary. 10 minutes prior is fine. But be on time -- because the trains leave promptly and you don't want to get stuck. My one complaint...near the end of the ride, after they brought out the Alpaca for sale, there was a large moth that flew around the car. It didn't seem to bother most people, but I have a really deep phobia of these insects. And none of the workers were really even paying attention or trying to get rid of it. At these prices, I really didn't expect to have moths flying around the car. We took a 6:40am train from Cusco, getting to Aguas Calientes just before 10am. Then we were on the 3:20pm train back. I found this to be the perfect amount of time to view MP. So overall, a really nice experience!

Perurail to Aguas Calientes. The train is magnificent and the staff are very cordial and helpful. Be sure to take the train from Poroy as the first hour is the most spectacualar! it is relaxing and amazing!

Not Your Ordinary Train Ride. We used this to travel from Ollantaytambo to Aquas Callientes. Not only were we very comfortable on the ride, but the service was excellent. They offered a variety of snacks and drinks that were complimentary along with the travel. The trip was full of marvelous scenery, following the River through the Valley. Many waterfalls, wildlife, villages, tunnels, etc. It was just fantastic. It was serene and there were many window seat photo ops. On the way back to Ollantaytambo, they held a fashion show which was streamlining their collection of mens/womens apparel made of llama/alpaca wool. I mean, they actually did a catwalk down the aisle. It was fun and energizing. This was after a traditional dance was performed up and down the aisle demanding audience participation. Some people on here are grumpy about it, after a long climb at Machu Picchu.....I say to those people.....it's a once in a lifetime opportunity to most of us.......pretend you're sleeping and get over it! It was fun.
Wonderful Trip to Machu Picchu. Thanks to Roxana, Leslie, Romulo, Jonathon and Grateda for excellent service on our recent trip. It was a real pleasure.

Great service from Rosario, Roberto and Gary on the VistaDome. Great train facilities, view, food and entertainment!. This was one of the highlights of the trip to Cusco ! Such nice view, entertainment and service with a smile! Rosario, Roberto and Gary really made the trip feel so lovely, lively and enjoyable. The train features large windows adding a unique scenery to the trip. Good food was served and followed by a nice fashion show. Cannot wait to go back!
Vistadome. This was a fun experience. Scenic and entertaining. Especially the trip back where we had a fashion show and a performance. Snacks served en route which added a nice touch.

Views, Glorious Views. The Vistadome has to be one of the more picturesque trips you can take. Although pricey, I felt it was worth every cent. The views unfolding out of the ample windows are breathtaking as you wind your way slowly through the majesty of the mountains and the raging Urubamba River. The service onboard is fantastic, staff are friendly, engaging and very efficient and its a nice touch to have your table set for you with locally made fabrics, plants and actual cutlery and crockery. The light snack is tasty and served with a smile. A couple of tips would be to try to be seated on the left hand side of the train for both ways of the trip - on the way up it seems to have the better of the views, particularly of the river and on the way back, you get to appreciate what you missed on the earlier trip. We were lucky enough to have a two-seat area for our trip out which was great for,our long legs. Most seating is in groups of four and it can be a little squeezy if you're tall. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend spending a little extra for the spectacular views from all the Vistadome windows.

Unbelievably worth it!!!!!. I took the train in the vistadome car to Macchu Picchu and it was one of the highlights of my trip. It was stunning scenery and the train was immaculate. the staff were great and we sang and had a fashion show in the train. It was a blast. I would do this train trip again in a heart beat.

room with a view. loved the vista dome! You sit back and watch the rushing river and high canyon walls rush by. The seats were comfortable but you face another couple so if you are long legged it might be a little tight. The windows are large and allow for great picture taking and views above your head of the tops of the canyon. Pulling off to the side track to allow passing trains is part of the charm of this train. It is one of the truly unique and comfortable train rides left in the world. Yes it is not cheap but you have probably traveled half way around the world see it all! Sit back and travel the Inca Train in style. The trip comes with a drink and a snack each way. The seats are all reserved by number so if you have a problem riding backwards get a front facing seat each way. Also there is one restroom on each car and negotiating the serving cart can be tricky like an airplane. However on the way back we were treated to a fashion show of local high end Peruvian fashions by the stewards. We were also playfully attacked by some sort of Peruvian folk entertainer. It kept us laughing.Go for it this is a great way to get to where you are going in Peru. The trains run on time too!

Pricey Yet Nice. Ok it's defiantly overpriced. Wasn't too happy paying close to $300 round trip, but enjoyed the ride. Views from the train are remarkable. Service is top notch. They also serve a light snack both ways. Highly recommend Perurail

Excellent service. Our party of six took the train just one week ago. The train departed on time. One of our members got to sit in the front seat, great views. Service was great. They served a snack, which we didn't expect. We sat on the left side going up and that was the best side for scenic views. Definitely the best way to get to Machu Picchu if you don't want the walk up. Save the energy for Huyana Picchu climb.

Outrageously expensive, but excellent. My wife and I took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. We love train travel, so we were happy to go by train. We weren't happy with the fare, of course. Having lived in Japan, we were used to train trips of 1000+ km for this price! Nevertheless, the other option was to walk, and we didn't have the time. Anyway, the journey was fabulous. Departure and arrival were on time. The seats were comfortable. The food was good. The staff were friendly. And on our return journey there was an interesting fashion show that was amusing and entertaining. Also, the scenery was spectacular. Overall, a great experience.

Excellent Service. My friends and I took the PeruRail Vistadome train from Machu Picchu (Aguas Calientes) to Cusco and were very pleasantly surprised with how lovely the experience was. The train departed right on schedule. The first little bit leaving Aguas Calientes was very scenic going through lush jungle through the mountains. They then served a very nice Peruvian meal with drink service. The countryside scenery was lovely the entire journey and the service aboard was outstanding.....very friendly and warm onboard attendants. Highly recommend this train!

Rolling along!. Great experience on the train ride - the staff was gracious and helpful & FUN! Ligeth, Rony & Edwin. They offered some light hearted entertainment. The fashion show was great and my purchase lovely!

Best experience/employees. I was on Aguas calientes with my wife and another couple and we forgot our video camera in the restaurant. I was really sad because I had to catch the train that was leaving shortly to Cuzco and I wouldn't of been able to make the trip and back on time. I told one of the employees,of PERURAIL, Alonso Saavedra v., about my situation and he told me to go to Cuzco and wait for the next train to arrive "the camera will be there". I must admit I wasn't feeling very optimistic at the time but to my surprise, there it was, waiting for me. He had gone back to the restaurant and sent it back to me. This man really reminded me that loyal/honest people are still out there.It was my fifth time in Machu Pichu from Montreal Canada and I consider this person as a perfect exemple of honesty! Alonso Saavedra you are great, thanksFebruary 2014

SUPERB EXPERIENCE. We went by vistadome train to macchu pichu. thoroughly recommended, excellent organisation, service, drinks and snacks provided free, fashion show and opportunity to purchase souvenirs.Really comfortable seating and great views of scenery.

great ride. Great ride. Very clean. Very nice food provided. It said you were only allowed 1 small bag but we didnt have anywhere to put all our stuff. So we took our suitcases and were prepared to pay a fine or be turned away but they didnt say anything and we gave them a large tip.

Peru Rail - Best Travel to Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome Peru Rail train to Machu Picchu. Our car servers, Nancy and Mario, were wonderful! We were served our choice of a soft drink or coffee as well as pastries on our trip to Machu Picchu. The service was wonderful. Toward the end of the trip we were offered to purchase a book about Peru and Machu Picchu. The book is comprehensive and has wonderful photos. We asked Nancy and Mario to autograph our book for us and they were happy to do so and allow us to take their photos. The train's very clean windows and Vistadome allowed us to take photos of the beautiful scenery we passed on our travel.On our return trip from Machu Picchu we were again treated to drinks and sandwiches and then to a fashion show. The quality of the merchandise was wonderful and very reasonably priced. We have wonderful memories of our entire Machu Picchu experience and the train ride in particular was relaxing and set the tone for that portion of our trip.

The ride to Machu Pichu. On the Vistadome you can see all around while travelling from Ollytaytambo. The service on the train was marvellous. We were seved soft drinks, tea or coffee and pastries on the way to Aguas Caliente and a corn husk wrapped appitizer and drinks on the way back to Ollytaytambo as well as entertainment and a fashion show. This was only one part of our t( day tour thru Peru.

Outstanding view from very comfortable transportation. We road PeruRail from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu Pueblo (Aguas Calientes) in amazing comfort. We were surprised by incredible views from start to finish of the 1+45 min ride over 27 miles of Peruvian countryside. The bucket seating was clean, comfortable, and spacious on the Vistadome 603. The service of beverages and a light but pleasant snack was delightful, with very attentive and cordial attendants (Roxana, Daisku, & Christrian were our servers). Highly recommend this method of travel.

Another interesting adventure on the way to Machu Picchu. So getting from Cusco to Aquas Caliente is a train ride or a hike. The train has 3 levels and the Vistadome is the middle one, if I remember correctly. The top of the line is a posh traincar like the orient express from what I understand. The lower one is actually still nice (I rode both the lower and middle).To match the times I wanted to travel, the lower grade train was only available for one way of the round trip but I rode the Vistadome for the other. The Vistadome, aside from being nicer with more room, has a greater view as the windows are larger and wrap around to the ceiling. This is important as the route the train takes is through some of the most scenic landscapes. The food offered in this level (Vistadome) is also better and to kill the time the staff does a "fashion show" with some of the alpaca knits they are offering for sale. This helps kill the time and depending on the attractiveness of your staff, can be quite enjoyable to watch :)With the fashion show there is also a member of the staff that dresses up like some sort of an animal man thing and dances around the car. This sounds strange, but it is entertaining and adds to the experience without crossing over into the range of annoying. All in all, a great experience and I would recommend it.

Great Views!. Took the PeruRail's Vistadome to and from Machu Picchu and it was great! The views were magnificent and the train was wonderful. The train doesn't go all the way to Cusco and if I had to do it over I would have arranged for a taxi to pick us up and take us the rest of the way to Cusco.The other thing to note is that they are "very clear" about only being able to bring on very limited luggage. We emailed them and told them we had luggage in addition to our backpacks and they said that their return email constituted permission to each have one extra bag. It was fine. Nobody even questioned our bags and they stowed them for us.

...best service I had in a train trip. Took the train back from Aguas Calientes to Cusco in order to save some time. Ticket was 106 dollars and was 2h by train and 2 by bus. They let you know in advance. The train is super confortable and the service is amazing. We got a small snack, then we we had some cool live shows. The service team was great, want again to tell thank you also through trip advisor to Daisako, Selmira and Juan Carlos!

Great trip. Brilliant alternative to hiking. Really enjoyed the vistadome train to aguas calientes. Great alternative to doing the hike. We were short on time so we opted for the train rather then the hike so whether your just short on time or don't fancy the long hike this is a great choice. You even get food, drinks and entertainment although this is in the rather bizarre form of a fashion show and some crazy psychedelic lion/cat creature performing a weird mixture of dance / mime / and general weirdness but this just made it even more memorable in a wayThe only down side is that seats are allocated randomly so you don't know if your getting a window or an aisle seat until you show up. Would be fairer If you could select seats when you book to secure the best seats. The best seat to get is a window seat on the left as they get the best views. I got allocated an aisle seat on the right but that didn't stop my enjoyment. I just stood in the exit alcove thing more or less the whole way up taking pictures and admiring the view

Vistadome experience to Machu Picchu. We loved our return trip from Machu Picche via PeruRail's Vistadome. The food, drinks and unexpected entertainment was a bonus. Carlos Ruben, Veronica and Victor provided an amazing dance performance, fashion show and sales pitch that was totally fun and interesting. Thank you for the surprise ending to a wonderful day!!

PeruRail earns top marks. We traveled as part of a tour through Lima Tours to Machu Picchu on PeruRail's vista dome to Aquas Caliente. Can we say fantastic? What a great relaxing way to get there and back. The train was fully appointed with comfortable, clean seating and dining, the food and beverages were delicious and the staff was friendly, entertaining and polite. The one hour and forty five minutes flew by between the eye candy out the window and the service inside. I would highly recommend PeruRail.

Excelent choice.. I can say that the Vistadome train to machu pichu is the best choice. The views are amazing and it only takes one hour and 40 minutes to get from the train station to machu pichu. It's 74 dlls one way from the Ollantaytambo station and most tours take you there with a small bus. The train is well maintained and clean, also they serve you a small snack on the way along with free non-alcoholic drinks. On the way back from machu pichu there was even a small show by the waiters and staff from the train.

Spectacular Views. Took the Vistadome to Machu Picchu as part of a tour. So glad upgraded to the Vistadome. The scenery was breathtaking. Snack and drinks are served. Very tasty. On the trip back to Cusco the employees entertained us and put on a fashion show. Really enjoyable trip. Would recommend as a nice addition to the overall experience of Peru.

Amazing views. We opted to take the train to Machu Picchu instead of the 4 day hike - and boy were we happy about it! The train is great, very efficient, you get a snack and a drink. It was packed though and unfortunately we got seated going reverse which sucked. Definitely try and book tickets going the direction of travel. That was the only downside. But everything else was great. The views are just amazing. The train follows the river which is roaring and beautiful. We were lucky to get a sunny day with no rain - which I was told is not the norm for November weather. We got to see the gigantic mountains which were absolutely amazing. The train goes pretty slow I will have to say because literally locals are walking next to it and it goes through small Inca towns. It is definitely a must-see in Peru.

Beyond expectations. When I first booked this train I thought it was very expensive, and didn't have much expectations of the service as it was in Peru (not sure why I thought that). However the journey was well organised and smooth from beginning to end and completely stress free. We has to use the 'bimodal' service (bus and then train) as the train doesn't run all the way in the rainy season due to safety. We took a cab to the bus station (Wanchaq station - about 5 min drive from main square in cusco). We were immediately met by a Perurail representative (from the door of the taxi even) and shown to our bus. The bus journey was about 2hours with no stops. The same Perurail representative accompanied us on the bus journey and even the train. On arrival at the train station, we were shown to our carriages by the same representative, and boarding was quick and stress free. We were in carriage A and had no problems with fumes, carriage was very clean, nice panoramic windows, didn't experience any misting up (but we went on a dry day). Snack on board included a pastry, fruit, spinach/cheese slice and soft drinks/tea/coffee. Similar snack on the way back. Was able to amend our ticket at Aguas Calientes (machu pichu) for an earlier train on the way back without any fuss. All in all, well organised, helpful and pleasant crew who accompanied us all the way and prompt, stress free service.

Vistadome was a rip-off!. PeruRail practically has the monopoly on the tourist route to Machu Picchu, so I had little choice but to take this train since I didn't have the time to hike the Inca Trail. I was assigned to Train A (I wasn't given any choice), which is apparently located right behind the engine, so my train car's air con/ventilation system sucks in the air right from the engine exhaust! It was nauseating!The larger windows of Vistadome supposedly give you a better view of the scenery outside- well, the windows on my train kept fogging up, and me and my fellow passengers couldn't see much outside! Also, the windows near the roof of the train car were too small to see much of scenery outside. (I took the cheaper Expedition train on my return trip and I had a more pleasant ride than Vistadome).The worst part was their food: their quinoa pancake was bland despite being served with fruits; and then I started getting bad diarrhea a few hours after I ingested their food on the this Vistadome train... Coincidence? The diarrhea pretty much ruined my trip.

Overpriced, disappointing.. In my experience, this service should be called "No-vistadome" because the view from my $60 (one-way) seat at the end of the carriage was terrible. In the online booking process, I was unable to select my seat and I was automatically put in seat 51 of carriage B. The view from the seat was of the end wall of the carriage, the service staff and the toilets. To enjoy any kind of view I had to turn all the way around and glimpse the view the passengers on the other side of the table were enjoying. This is obviously not the case for all seats in the Vistadome service - most enjoy a fantastic view of the scenery...just not the ones at the end of the carriage. My advice would be to book through one of the ticketing offices in Cusco (there is one on the Plaza de Armas) so you can request a decent seat in advance. But the view os not the only reason I'm giving this a bad rating. The food was poor and for $60 I would expect to be offered a beer. I was not. Also there was no entertainment onboard, which the website suggested there would be. The carriage was quite hot and by the end of the journey it was quite uncomfortable at my stuffy end of the carriage. i expected more for my $60. Peru Rail and Inca Rail are the only companies licensed to operate tourist trains on the journey from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, the gateway to Machu Picchu. Since there is no road to Aguas Calientes, they can pretty much charge as much as they like. Tourists aren't allowed to ride on the locals train, which costs a fraction of the price of these 'scenic' services. It’s also worth noting that you can no longer take the train all the way from Cusco – you have to get a bus, taxi or colectivo to Ollantaytambo first.In the interests of fairness, I should say that the train was clean and modern, and the journey was smooth and without incident. The boarding process was fine and the train departed and arrived on time.
Excellet Service.... Even though the trip is very long From Cusco to Aguas Calientes the service in it is excellent. Enjoy the return show and the interaction with the tourists...

3 years old twins going to Machu Picchu. travelling from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calients round trip.From the begging to the end, my experience with perurail was beyond any expectation.I got fast answers from Chrystell always very helpful. At Ollantaytambo station I got assistance from the supervisor Patricia with fast solutions to fulfill my requests . She was not at her office when we first arrived and she went after us on the street , out of her station, when she heard that we were looking for her. ( we are kind of easy to spot family with a 6.1 mother, a red hair son and a double stroller ). Coming from NYC, I was really surprised to see such a service... During travelling time, Blake made our trip really extra comfortable offering everything possible to please my kids.I am really impressed with the service and costumer assistance . post video on youtube http://youtu.be/0wO8EBYvRR4

Our day trip to Machu Picchu. What a "WOW" day to Machu Picchu....in no small part thanks to our experience on the PeruRail - Vistadome. The views were incredible, the train was ultra comfortable, even the snacks were a nice little tour. Our hosts Nancy, Mario and Raul were not only friendly and helpful but entertaining too. The 90 ride on the train to and from the bus ride that would take us to Machu Picchu was the perfect way to see the landscape and enjoy what was to come, and what had just fulfilled our lives. Thanks so much to Nancy, Mario and Raul for enhancing our day even more!

A wonderful train trip. We only booked vista dome for going up, but as we back at station a little early we got changed to another vista dome no extra cost. The views are fantastic on both sides. And on the way back the staff entertained us with a dance, which I was invited to join in, not easy on a winding train. Then the staff paraded various alpaca clothes available to purchase. We got off at ollantaytambo, as staying at the hotel on the station, so handy.

Just perfect!. We were travelling between La Paz and Machu Picchu within three days, and the train trip was essential to make it. We took the Vistadome for going and coming back, and the service was just perfect. Our conductors Jose Luis and miritza Velosques were super friendly and helpful all the time. We throughly enjoyed our trip, and we would recommend everybody who are thinking about this train trip for and from Machu Picchu to get tcikets and onboard. :)

Awesome views from Vistadome. We boarded the Vistadome at Ollantaytambo on a marvelously sunny, bright day in September to visit Machu Picchu. Our tour had been arranged by Gate1 Travel (www.gate1travel.com), which managed to make the trip from Cuzco to Machu Picchu a very pleasant and memorable experience. The train cars were modern and comfortable, offering views through windows on the side as well as the ceiling. The scenery of snow-covered mountain ranges in the distance was absolutely majestic. Highly recommend taking the Vistadome train to enjoy the views in a relaxed setting. Klara J.

Must do if you go to Machu Pichu!. I didn't do much research beforehand so we booked Vistadome for both the trips to and back from Machu Pichu. But it's true that you only really need to do it once and book the regular train for the other way.If you do pick one trip only for Vistadome, then book the trip back from Machu Pichu as it is the one with the little show (we knew nothing about this so it was a good surprise! But it's nice also to see all the scenery on your way up, which is why we didn't mind doing Vistadome both ways. The difference is only a few $ (or soles) so it did not matter much. Snacks were decent (better on the way up for us) and staff was really nice. If possible at all, try to get seats in the direction you're travelling.I definitely recommend it as part of the Machu Pichu experience!
FANTASTIC TRIP!!!!. It was fantastic to be there... I would like to thank the staff who were really nice. Maritza, Jose, Joel... thank you once again.I recomend Vistadome service.

Very enjoyable. I took the Vistadome back from Machu Picchu, having arrived on the Hiram Bingham. Peru Rail is an efficient on time service and generally well organised. The great thing about the Vistadome is the all round views it affords , best book seats in direction of travel. A light lunch was served followed by a traditional Inca dance and a fashion show. The journey went quickly, however worth noting during the rainy season the train cannot go all the way to Cusco and the final part of the trip is by coach, which is not ideal ( this is normally January to March)

Things are a bit nicer.. We took domecar one way and explorer the other. Spending a little extra for the dome service was worth it: better snack, more comfy seating, more polite staff, real coffeecups etc. The trip is so expensive anyway,might as well enjoy

Excellent Service. We definitely enjoyed our train ride to and from Machu Picchu. The views are incredible. Cristobel, Blake and Maribel provided some of the best service we had during our entire trip. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone traveling in the area.

Nice experience. We enjoyed our train ride (approx. 1.5 hrs.) to Machu Picchu on the PeruRail - Vista-dome. The alternative, 'hiker train" is less expensive but very crowded and on a regular train. The Vista-dome, includes a lite snack, fruit and coffee or tea. Going our train was air conditioned, but it was not working on our return trip so the opening the windows saved us. The seats are comfortable with a tri-fold table in front of you and there is a restroom in each car. The servers were friendly and helpful. You're a captive audience so during the trip, there's a sales' pitch to try an sell you sweaters, hats and such. A simple "no thanks" takes care of sales pitch and it's otherwise a very scenic ride to Machu Picchu.

Stunning Views. What an experience, the train hugs the valley floor zig zagging along the single track. Comfortable seats although leg room is a little challenging if you are tall. The snacks are ok nothing special but your not there to experience good food and drink. Yes it's expensive but apart from trecking its the only way up to visit one of the best places in the world.Sit back, relax and enjoy one of the most unique train journeys in the world.

Good trip. Around 2 years ago, we went to Peru for vacation, we made our trip and I read in a web page that if you take the train you could go one trip in Vistadome and other on Expedition, so we did this kind of arrangement and bought them http://www.perurail.com/.So one way you can enjoy the advantages from kind of train, at the end one is cheapest than the other.Make sure to book your round trip (as well Machu picchu entrance) in advance, because it could be full if it's closed the date.The agencies could make the arrangement for all your trip in Peru but it could be more expensive. So we made own main arrangements in advance (hotels, Machupicchu entrance, train), when we arrived to Cuzco, we booked a tour to Sacred Valley in an agency (there are many agencies around the plaza of Cuzco, (but you need be careful not all are good, so you need to ask to Tourism Office which is better at this time ,it's closed from Cathedral ) When we finished the sacred valley our last place was Ollantaytambo , so we took the train there (I don't remember well but I think you need to stay 1 hr around in train station before your depart ) the train goes to Aguascalientes (we booked a hotel there).Earlier Morning from next day we took the bus to Machu Picchu (around 5:00 am) from next day (don't eat a lot food and drink famous COCA tea). The suggestion is to be before 6:30 am to see Sunrise. In Machu Picchu, there're a lot of tour guides that can provide personal or group tour in different idioms , we choice group tour , it's cheapest , and when the tour finished we climbed part of Machu Picchu mountain. In afternoon (around 4:00 pm , after our lunch time) we took the train to go back to Cuzco (include the bus in your train ticket, but there're taxis outside of train station too, take one in group if it's possible.)BTW, your luggage can't be too big when you go at train , it need to be fit , read specifications. Although , There are special place in one of the car to locate your luggage.Amazing Tour. Amazing view!! :) I love Machu Picchu YOU MUST BE THERE..it's an adventure and more if you made your own trip! hey don't forget to get enough cash when you go to Peru. because Credit card terminals are connecting through modem ,so if the phone connection is not working you'll be on trouble, as we were because sometimes the ATM machines don't work as our countries or not provide enough money limited at 250 dlls daily depends of the bank.

Good Service but overpriced!. I think this Train is a nice way to go Machupicchu! But I requested an extra cookie and the attendant refused it to me. I was disapointed because I paid almost $300 round trip.

Pleasant but pricey. The train is good, the seats comfortable and we were provided with a light snack - pastry, fruit and beverage - on the way up, but nothing on the return.The large windows give good views as you ride alongside the river and through forest. The journey to Machu Picchu takes around three hours, and starts and ends at Ollyantaytambo in the Sacred Valley. After that it's a taxi, minibus or bus to Cusco. If you get a Vistadome ticket from Cusco to Machu Picchu (or vice versa), it inclues the bus fare. You can also get minibuses to Cusco very cheaply about 50m up the road from the train station in a parking area on the right - they leave frequently, as soon as they are full. We stayed at Ollyantambo for two nights on the way up and liked it very much. I should also mention that you can only take limited luggage (7kg), so leave any big bags in Cusco or Olly, even if you intend to stay in Aguas Calienta. We thought the train was probably a little pricey for what it is... but unless you wanna walk, it's the best (only) option.
A unique experience. Perfect train,perfect trip, perfect service!!All the staff were dedicated, kind and customer oriented!!!There is no way to leave disappointed!!!!!

Great Service (note the February BiPolar Service). We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. Having bought tickets online And received directions etc. In early January for travel Feb 16. Great seats. Great service on time and vista done is wonderful. The views of the Rio Urubamba and terrain are spectacular. If you want a real snack bring it yourself. They provide drinks though Peruvian coca cola is not good. I stuck to coca tea. Now for the bipolar part-- they call it bi modal. Second trip later that day was booked from MP to Cusco. I looked all over to see where they told us we would be bussed from Pashar to Cusco could not find it. So we get on the lovely train settle in for what we think is about 3 hours and are trundled off and loaded onto buses for a ride that ended in the ugliest part of any town I have ever seen and was Cusco the 3:20 train became the bus arriving at 7:35 or so. For our safety during rainy season. Fine.
Thank you everyone on Vistadome for an unforgettable journey!. My daughter and I truly enjoyed our experience on board with Blake and the rest of the crew! Lots of fun! Thank you!

Vistadome Train into Machu Picchu Puerto. The train ride into Machu Picchu Puerto is spectacular, running between high cliffs and alongside a powerful mass of water crashing over huge rocks. You are processed quickly and efficiently but they do want to see your passport. On board is comfortable with excellent viewing. The train staff must have been trained by airlines, as they offered us drinks, pastries and fruit. Unex po ected but welcome. A recommended ride.

Wow!. What a train. What a view! Such an excellent way to go to Machu Picchu.I took the train from Ollantaytambo so it was only 1.5 hour trip. Next time, I definitely want to take the train from Cusco as it will be 3-hour long. With the amazing andes mountains' view, I am sure I will enjoy the long trip.Very much recommended

"miracle" on a train. While Machu Picchu was on our bucket list ( and we made it)...we think others should add the Vistadome train ride to Machu Picchu on everyone's bucket list. To our delightful surprise the long train ride from Aguas Calientes flew by as our "miracle"stewardess"Milagros" and her team mates Roberto T and Mirko entertained us, feed us, educated us, indulged us in fun and frolics involved great snacks, friendly banter, super smiles and top notch service...as if this was not enough the ride back from Machu Picchu (fully satisfied and exhausted from our time there) was the over the top ending as once again fine food and service by the staff ( Milagros ( Spanish for miracle), Roberto and Mirko...provided great theater, with a devil dance to classic pan flute, and a top rated fashion show of fine alpaca items modeled runway style..all loved the show and the return trip passed to quickly ...many thanks for any incredible memorable trip..a must for everyone!!!!!!

Train to Machu Picchu. This is an almost completely glass enclosed train for optimal viewing while traveling from Agua Calientes to Machu Picchu. Right now you need to take a bus from Cusco to Agua Calientes. The train is very comfortable, serves an included snack, and even has some entertainment and a fashion show. The train takes about 1 1/2 hours and the views are great.

Comfortable train ride with a fashion show.. Caught the Vistadome train from Aquas Calientes (train station for Machu Pichu) to Poroy (train station for Cusco) after travelling on the Hiram Bingham on the reverse route. Train departed Aquas Calientes at 15.20 and arrived at Poroy station at 19.00 so journey was a little over 3 1/2 hours.Booked our tickets online from the PeruRail site which was easy to navigate.Train is fairly comfortable with the seating configuration being 4 seats in each row - 2 either side of a central passageway. There are another 4 seats directly opposite, facing these, with a table in between such that 4 people are facing in the direction in which the train is headed and 4 are facing backwards. We had seats 42 and 44 which were both aisle seats but facing each other. There was ample room behind each of the seats that backed against each other to store luggage.As the term Vistadome would suggest the carriages do have clear places in the carriage ceilings where you can admire the scenery, as well as through the large windows, until such time as the sun sets. A little less than half of our journey was completed after darkness had set in.Service was good. A light meal (vegetable pasty, corn, a slice plus a non-alchoholic drink/tea/coffee) was included in the price. Alcoholic drinks could be purchased.Perhaps though the best part of the journey was the show put on by the train staff - the same people who had served our meal and drinks. First a guy in a mask and dressed very colourfully danced up and down our carriage. This was followed by a fashion show with both men's and woman's clothes on display, principally jumpers, coats, shawls and capes being modelled by our male and female carriage stewards. There was music and all the passengers really got into the show clapping and whistling both models who did a great job sashaying up and down the carriage aisle way. The clothes were later offered for sale. Fun trip.One tip though. Recommend that you book a car or taxi to pick you up from Poroy Station which is approximately a 30 minute car trip away from Cusco. The train arrived in darkness and there were literally a hundred drivers jockeying for position as they looked for business. Many of them had to wait outside the gates to the station, which was on an extremely busy main road, and this just added to the chaos and difficulty in departing the station precinct.
Excellent! . Always on time. Train/bus combo from Cusco to Aguascalientes makes it simple to travel. Great food, nice staff. Excellent ride!

Unique, authentic experience. We travelled in October 2014 and thoroughly enjoyed the journey - it was so much more than we were expecting. Firstly, the views are breathtaking and the staff extremely friendly. Too add to this we loved the little snacks served to keep us going and, most importantly, the amazing little show performed by the staff. This was a surprise and made the experience so authentic. Actually, I have been dying to know the song that is played during the show (if it is the same all the time). If anybody knows if, can you please advise.Would highly recommend this experience!!! Please let me know of the song if you know it!

A okay. Took this train as part of a group traveling to Machu Picchu. Considering the American dollar is stronger than the Peruvian Sol I am glad I paid extra for the Vista dome. The train had some what comfortable seats and the service was very attentive. The attendents also held a small entertaining fashion show where they also sold what they were show casing. As well they had beverages and some food.

From Ollantaytambo to Aquas Calientes, then to Cusco, a fine trip. We flew from Lima to Cusco, then took at taxi to Ollantaytambo. After a few delightful days there, we took the train toward Machu Picchu. The service was great, the food was decent, and the view beyond spectacular.And the price was reasonable.Further, we decided to leave Aquas Calientes, from where we went to Machu Piccho, a day early. I found the Peru Rail staff in Aquas Calientes genial and helpful, and for a nominal fee we were able to leave a day early, and we ended up getting to Cusco earlier than we might have.I powerfully recommend Peru Rail as a means of transport around the country.The only reason I give four instead of five stars is that there was a commercial element to the trip; the lady who modeled the Peruvian garments was lovely and the show was good. But I could've done without it. (Ironically, I acknowledge that it might keep the cost down so, go for it! And we ended up sitting with a young Korean couple living in Guatemala and their company was delightful.Yes, I recommend it!

Sit back and have fun. This enjoyable train ride gets you where you are going in stylein a fun and enjoyable method.Great service and entertainment.Cars were quite and comfortableA taste of "lux" travel pastTake a picnic basket just in case

Great Experience. Hopefully you will be lucky enough to use the Vistadome to travel to Manchu Picchu and have Blake, Stefani and Edwin as your crew on your trip. This group made my trip a memorable one by catering to all our needs as well as giving us information on things to do in Sacred Valley and Cusco. Thanks again guys as I leave the Pisco Museum.

Incredible views and nice snacks.. The train has clean, new cars, incredible views through the overhead windows, and good snacks. Their is some loud and silly "cultural" entertainment on the way back from Macchu Picchu which we could have done without, but some seemed to enjoy. They say to arrive 30 minutes early, but if you have preprinted your ticket 15 is more than enough.

Perfect. My experience on the train couldn't have been better. It was impeccably clean, very spacious, and super comfortable. The complimentary meal was actually good (not "good" for being train food; just GOOD food period). I travel a lot for my job, and I'm used to seeing the rubbery, plastic-covered tv dinners they serve on flights. Vistadome's food was way better than airplane food! The fruit was ripe, fresh, local, and in season (my favorite part); and everything else was great too. There was music and dancing and entertainment, not to mention the gorgeous views passing by outside the glass. The stewards and stewardesses were attentive and friendly (I talked to one for over an hour). PeruRail Vistadome is the ONLY train I would take in the future. 10/10.P.S. If it's good enough for Antonio Banderas, Cindy Crawford, and One Direction, it's good enough for me too!

bought a train trip and got Half a bus trip. I disliked being cheated. After talking to people here in Cuzco I understand that Peru Rail have been doing the bus instead of train the last few years during the rainy season. i.e. they should have informed me about this when I booked in August last year!!!
train. very nice clean snack is served while enroute each way. very beautiful sceenery i would highly recommend spending the extra money it is well worth it.
Great train ride. Is was calm and peaceful. After hiking the 4 day in a train its the way to go. Slower pace and amazing views. Glad we upgraded to this.

Comfortable way back from Machu Pichhu. Took this on the way back from Machu Pichhu after the 4 Day Classic Inca Trail, and it was nice to admire the views, relaxed in those comforable seats, with the 'vista' windows. They have also tried to add to the service by providing snacks , and a short folk dance piece, along with a brief display (fashion show of sorts) of Alpaca wool products

Delightful. Rode on the vistadome to Cusco on the evening train after visiting Machu Pichu and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service, the well prepared and presented food as well as the Peruvian fashion and dance show put on by the same service staff. The cost is a bit more than the basic tourist train but if you include the almost all glass cpmartment, comfortable seating and the food and entertainment it makes for a very pleasant way to travel and experience Peruvian hospitality.

Breathtaking views in comfort.. We took this service up to Machu Picchu in the morning. As it was summer they run a bi modal form of transport - bus to Pacha and then the train. The bus was about 1 3/4 hours (and was comfortable) and the train journey was a little shorter. During the train ride we got to see beautiful scenery in comfort. The seats were roomy and the table between the seats folded down to be less intrusive. There was breakfast included of pancakes, fruit, juice, coffee/tea and savoury slice. It was all quite fancy and unexpected. The windows were clean and photo taking was easy. A hint for the best ride ... Ask to be seated facing in the direction travelling and on the left had side. You will have the river on this side for the majority of the trip, the other side is not as picturesque.
What a surprise. Such a lovely way to see the country side on your way to Machu Picchu. We were very surprised at the lovely snacks that were served both ways and fashion show on the return trip

Excellent service. We took the vistadome to Machu Picchu which gave us panoramic views. A meal was included which came as a surprise. The only problem is the distance of the station from Cusco - about 30 mins.

Professional Staff and Great Trip. Very professional staff and wonderful accomodations. If you are taking the Vistadome, suggest it for the trip to Aguas Calientes but not for the return (if taking in late afternoon) as the high humidity from the rain and wet guests fog all of the windows and you cannot see anything outside.

Very excellent service ����. We traveled from Machu Picchu to Cusco and let me tell you it was fun all the way. Great service fun show and yummy snack. Thank you Adrianna the hostess who made our train ride so pleasant.🚋🚃🚎🚌

Visitando de Chicago. Excellent service from friendly staff. Comfortable train cars with relaxing music and nice breakfast. Highly recommended. Outstanding employees Yamil, Nestor and Danesa. Great bilingual skills from staff. Yamil let me practice my Spanish while he showed me his English skills. Thanks for a great trip!

Only way to go. In the rainy season, this trip includes the first leg as a 2 hour bus trip. It would have been better as one train trip. The train portion was also about 2 hours. The main advantage on the train is assigned seating with no standing passengers. The regular train has standing room only and looked like a cattle car. A snack is served. The seating is comfortable. Bring only what you need as storage is limited. The overhead sky lights are a good idea as you get a better feel for the immenseness of the countryside. The train station at Agua Calientes is nice but small. A cafe is inside . A cappuccino is 8 Soles and a chocolate croissant is 3 Soles, so eat and drink your way into a seat inside while you wait on the train.

Excellent way to get to Machu picchu town. 4 of us travelled from olleytaytambo up to Machu Picchu town on the vistadome train. The scenery was magnificent and we all thought it was very good value for the price we paid and really well worth going on the train. I would highly recommend it

Nice ride. Sort of expensive, but worth it. Views are amazing and they serve tea, croissants, and on the return train, they do a little demonstration of the higher-end clothing made from alpaca hair. No pressure to buy.
Fantastic experience. Food was good, staff pleasant and views spectacular. Not a cheap experience but one to meet interesting fellow travellers.

Great trip with Vistadome. I booked tickets for my husband and I on the Peru Rail website easily. We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. The ticket prices were quite high. The trains were however of a high standard. The service on the trains was excellent. You are also provided with a snack and drink during the trip. The structure of the train with lots of glass windows allows you to take in the beauty of the landscape on the way to Machu Picchu.

amazing view from inside the train and kind crews. It was a wonderful time for me to have amazing scenaries of surrounding mountains from inside the train and kind services from crews. I remember their names; they were Rosario, Domingo, and Yanil who were very supportive of giving me travelling information on Peru had a nice conversation with me. It was like the ones you would have in good airplanes.
Last stop on our tour down the Andes. Great way to travel to Aguas Calientes , very good service with friendly helpful staff , and of course the views are fantastic

Reasonable Train. Vistadome is one of the best trains for MachuPichu. We could buy the tickets directly from Peru Rail office at Cuzco which is located next to Plaza Regocijo. Any travel agents charge you by adding their margin for the tickets. When you purchase the tickets at the office you need passport. Have it with you!   Currently most trains depart from Sacred Valley Ollantaytambo. So I recommend you to purchase 1) the transportation from Cuzco city to Ollantaytambo, 2) bus return ticket from Machu Pichu train station Aguascalientes to Machu Pichu and 3) Machu Pichu entrance ticket, through agent. 2) and 3) could be bought at Machu Pichu but you have to wait with long lines.

Grateful for the excellent care. Hi. My wife and I travelled by your Vistadome train from Cusco to Machu Picchu and back on 27th & 28th Dec, 2014. We had a very comfortable journey on both the legs. The crew treated us very well especially on the return leg on 28th Dec. My wife was experiencing the after-effects of altitude sickness and oxygen had to be administered to her. The crew on hand - Blake & Wilbert were very supportive and efficient and took really good care of her. We will be eternally grateful to them for their assistance and help.

Fun and Funky. I am glad we took the advice and took the Vistadome back to Ollytantambo and not Cusco. The ride had it's beauty and was just long enough at around two hours. The decision to spend the last night in Ollytayambo was perfect. It was the quaint and spiritual local place that left the lingering amazement of this trip without going back to Cuzco where we spent the first three days. While a little further for the ride back to the airport it was a glorious morning with a stop at Chincerro and a drive through Cuzco outskirts. Vistadome is a good experience. The on board fashion show a little contrived but training alongside the roarng Urubamba through the mountains is a spectacle not to be forgotten.

Beautiful during the day - at night - eh. We took the train to Machu Pichu - and the view during the day was phenomenal. The night ride back a little less so. Though we had entertainment on the way back. One of the attendants dressed up as a fox and danced through the car - then there was a fashion show of beautiful alpaca sweaters/ponchos/coats. My first ever fashion show on the train.
That is one fun train ride. Let's see--food is served, great scenery, atmospheric, fashion show of local textiles on the train.... lots of fun

Vistadome adventure. Thanks to our train carriage crew, Gladys, Domingo and Edson for making our Vistadome trip such an enjoyable one. The 3 hour trip through the Peruvian countryside and jungle is amazing and definitely worth the price of the ticket. Snacks are served each way as well as a beverage service. Our crew then put on a fashion show for us to model the Alpaca wool clothes they are required to sell after the meal service. The train is extremely comfortable and clean. Like another reviewer said, the windows may become fogged up in the morning as it will be cold outside and warmer in the train.

Better than Expedition. I went on the Expedition on the way to Aguas Calientes and Vistadome on the way home and DEFINITELY think that Vistadome is worth the extra money. They have food, and good food, also the constant entertainment numbs the pain of a long train ride! There are costume shows and even a traditional dance!Go vistadrome at least for one of the rides.

Peru Rail Staff at Machu Picchu Station. Vistadome 304I want to thank the staff of Peru Rail at Machu Picchu station, specially Felipe and Neizon for their excellent service and kindness.Good Job!!Quiero agradecer al personal de Peru Rail estacion Machu Picchu, especialmente a Felipe y Neizon por excelente servicio y amabilidad.Buen Trabajo!!

worth the extra. I debated between this and the cheaper version and went to Macchu Picchu on cheaper and back on Vistadome on the idea that I wanted more time. I have to say the food was much better, the train nicer, seats more comfy and bathrooms better and service awesome.

excellent experience. we had booked the expedition train for both to and fro MP. On Nov 30, we finished our visit at MP by 11 as we had gone by the 1st bus at 5.30am. we had booked the 4.30 pm return by expedition. we approached the officer and queried if there was any chance of swapping our ticket for an earlier train and guess what, they obliged... very sweet of them. we boarded the 1pm vistadome back to ollanta... loved their pancake sandwich and strawberries, washed down with some inca colathe dance and fashion show was interesting... i even joined the puma dancer on his request and had funthe views on the trip are of course greatall in all very enjoyable and special thanks for their generosity in swapping our tickets

Very comfortable and great viewing. We took the Vistadome train to Machu Picchu and found it to be a great way to get there. Very comfortable and great for sight seeing along the way. We took the early train and were served a meal on board. On the way back there was entertainment and the opportunity to purchase some lovely alpaca pieces. Was everything as advertised and more.

"Backpacker class" more like first class!. When I first booked this with my tour, I saw "Backpacker class" and was really concerned at the quality of the train. When I boarded I was pleasantly surprised! Leather seats that were very spacious. Large windows to the side and on the roof of the train. The staff were friendly. We have a nice breakfast meal on the way there and on the way back the next day they served us a mid afternoon snack. It was an excellent experience and it really wasn't even that expensive. The train does go quite slow though. On the way there it's lovely but on the way back you really would like it to go a tad bit more than 30 KMPH! On the train back from Aguas Calientes to Cusco they had a "fashion show" and they had a local dance routine as well. I would highly recommend using the Peru Rail Vistadome.

Train to Machu Picchu. The train was okay. Comfortable and clean. The windows tended to fog over making it hard to take pictures. The staff were great. They served a small snack both directions. The only thing I would suggest is for them to mix up the seating so you don't sit next to the same people on the way back. It would have been nice to talk to other folks.

Easy, with great service, train to Aguas Caliente. Booked PeruRail Vistadome/Expedition from Cusco to Aguas Caliente. Turns out it was a bus from Cusco to Puchar. In Puchar we boarded the train. Same with the return trip. The PeruRail staff is really nice. On the way there (6 am to 10 am), coffee and a muffin was served. On the way back to Cusco, a dinner was served (5 pm to 9 pm). These meals were on the train. The bus is a nice vehicle. One travels from Cusco through the outskirts (read: the poorest parts) and through the countryside to Puchar. Once on the train, it's a ride along the river leading to AC. The water is brown. The mountains are tall. Again, great staff. Very kind.

Great Service & Food On the Way to Machu Picchu. We traveled on Vistadome Dec 29th on our way to Machu Picchu. It's a very comfortable train with great service. We took the 6:40am train, which they serve a really nice breakfast on. We had small pancakes with a berry sauce, spinach pie, fruit, bread, coffee and juice. All of which is included in your ticket price.

PeruRail (Vistadome) to Machu Picchu. Traveled in December 2014 with two college-aged daughters and found the Vistadome train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes exceeded our expectations. Stations (Poroy - outside of Cusco) were clean and boarding/disembarking was organized, the train itself was clean, comfortable and allowed incredibly views along the way. The trip went very fast for us. The food was great and service friendly. Our train home was delayed but only for a short bit. Highly recommend this as a means of convenient, comfortable and affordable transport from Cusco to Machu Picchu. We did the trip all in one day as well (6:30 am train from Cusco; 5:30 ish train back).

This is a wonderful experience indeed. We used the Vista Dome train to go to Machu Pichu. Lovely train and excellent service. Staff are wonderful. They served us a snack in the morning and on the return journey, we were given a snack as well, followed by a delightful fashion show. The view from the train is breath taking asnyiu see the mountains and the Urubamba river flowing at rapid speed next to the train. Wonderful experience. Loved it.

Unless you are hiking, the train is the only way to Machu Picchu. People come from all over the world to see MP.
