A few hike in over several days, or hike just the last day.But the majority of them will be taking an overly long train ride on a rickety track, to a small town, and then getting on a small, packed bus going up a switchback road.There are a few trains to choose from; we chose the Vistadome. It is a pleasant train with lots of glass. Ideally, you want to be on the river side both to and from MP. If you are a party of four, some seats face each other with little tables. For example, travelling from MP back to Cusco, the seats 17,18,19,20 are in two rows facing each other with a table in between. 17 and 19 are windows looking out on the river side of the train (preferable) and 18 and 20 are aisles. If you are only two, 11 and 12 are two seats together (not facing other seats), and 11 is on the riverside of the train as you head back to Cuzco. I am not sure if the reverse is true on the way TO MP, i just noted our return seat numbers for this review.The tickets can be bought online via Perurail. It is a bit cumbersome with a lot of travellers because you need to type in a lot of data. Some fields autofill, be careful; mistakes are hard to fix and entail a penalty. Oddly, when you are done you get a receipt but not actual tickets (for fraud reasons), and you need to pick up actual tickets at the station, using your receipt. Like a lot of South American travel, their fraud problem with credit cards makes everything very cumbersome and time consuming. The train ride is quite slow, over flat terrain, but they keep it interesting. They play lively music, serve okay snacks, and have a goofy fashion show (which included a bit of selling pressure I did not appreciate). Overall though, it's fun, and while a lot of the landscape is boring, it does get prettier and more interesting the closer you get to Agua Calientes, the terminus.When you arrive at Agua Calientes, you are at the foot of MP. The only way up is by bus (Consettur, about USD 10). I saw no private cars or taxis (and we were staying at the only hotel at the top, so I imagine if there were a nicer way up, we would have known about it). Oddly, i thought, it is not immediately obvious how to get from the train to the bus stop, though a very high % of people are doing that. We had to wend our way through a market, over a bridge and down the street. Note, too, that if you do not speak Spanish it can be tricky; surprisingly few people speak English in the poorer countries of South America.
Excellent service and amazing views!!. Would highly recommend the Vistadome for their level of efficiency and service. Really enjoyed this trip!!

Dream come true. We travelled by Vistadome - the seats were comfortable, the journey idyllic and the service excellent. Worth the extra money but I still didn't think it was expensive. Big leather seats, roomy and warm.

Peru Rail excellent customer service. We purchased tickets on the Vistadome from Poroy to Aguas Calientes great customer service the food was great and the view was spectacular. We went on our tour to Machu Picchu but unfortunately my daughter got very sick after our Machu Picchu hike. We missed our train by 10 due to her illness and the long bus lines. Give your self at least 2 hours to wait in bus line to station. Maybe it was just the 31st was extremely busy! When we got to the station all the trains were booked! They knew my daughter was sick and the booking attendant talked to the train conductors! They didn't think they had anything available till 9:30 at night till Ollayantambo ! We were desperate to get her back to our hotel!Jorge our train conductor finally was able to get us two seats on the next train to Poroy It was on the Expedition but we were very pleased with that train as well! Blake helped take care of my daughter brought her special teas kept checking on her! I am so thankful to Peru Rail for their help and excellent customer service !! I give them 4 stars plus!

Amazing trip. Urubamba to Aguas Calientes and then back to Olayantambo Brilliant scenery smooth ride food and service was well done. The return trip with crew of Helen, Victor Hugo and Edwin was especially memorable. We especially loved the humour of Helen who kept our group smiling all the trip ( especially when it came to discussing guinea pig milk ) Will never forget the conversation. The dancing and display of Alpaca garments was well done and we were sorry to be leaving the train.

Comfortable and Scenic Ride. We left from Urubamba station at 6:50 am and the ride was very comfortable. The views as you leave town are just stunning. They serve a snack and drinks and the train staff are very gracious. Our only minor complaint about the trip was the pan-flute version of Sounds of Silence which blared at top volume the ENTIRE 4 hour trip. I will be happy if I never hear another pan flute ever again!
Great trip to take the kids. We went with our kids aged 3 and 7. It was really nice! Great views, nice meals and aovely experience

Comfort and views. We took the Vistadome from Poroy station to Aguascalientes . The train is very comfortable and the views were great. A snack is served and this was very nicely done. On the return journey, we had seats 1&2. They were right in front with a huge window, next to the drivers cab. We would have paid extra for those seats. Spectacular. There was a musical show on the return trip and a fashion show to sell local clothing.

Perfect complement to our Macchu Pichu experience. From day we knew the visit to MacchuPichu was going to be the highlight of our trip to Peru, little we knew about the train service though so at the time of booking we opted for Vistadome due to the good reviews and it paid off. The train is fairly comfy something you need in a 3 hour journey in the Andes, the train station at Poroy was nice and clean, the train had windows on the roof to improve the experience, the staff was pretty helpful and professional and put up a good fashion show on the way back. The only problem we had was the road from Cusco to Poroy something needs to be done by local authorities to improve these roads that sometime looked like horse tracks.... Despite this, Vistadome is highly recommended

Nothing special. Yes, it has bigger glass roof and windows. They serve better food. And the crew dances for you folclore dances. Yet, you are so tired coming back that you won't notice the difference. I took the Vistadome and the cheaper option and really, does not worth the extra bucks.
A great experience. This is a great trip! Very comfortable train, that operated exactly on time! Excellent views, and great service from very friendly staff. Strongly recommend.

Train to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome train ride to go visit Machu Picchu is a very comfortable way of doing it. The seats are very comfortable, they provide snacks and soft drinks on the round trip, plus the train has windows on the ceiling also so that visitors can enjoy viewing the surroundings more. The staff also put on a fashion show on the return journey to entertain the crowd. My only complaint is that this train goes very slowly, taking almost 3 1/2 hours to cover a distance of approximately 60 miles.
Fun on Vistadome. We traveled Vistadome to and from Machu Picchu. What a great experience! Gracious service, great food and delightful entertainment on the long leg of the trip!

Our Train ride to Machu Picchu on the Vistadome. We are 3 couples from NYC, who attended a wedding in Lima and then flew to Cusco to board the train to Machu Picchu.Our trip was made special due to the crew on the Vistadome, a beautiful oversized glass windowed train from Cusco to Machu Picchu Pueblo. We traveled in "C" cab and was serviced by 3, very polite and cheerful employees: Rony, Odelia, and Jose.They made our entrance to the train a breeze, gave us all kinds of information during the trip, served us a light snack after adorning our table with colorful placemats and a floral centerpiece.90 minutes into the trip, all 3 gave us a fashion show that was both entertaining and a welcomed way to shop for native goods.All in al,l it was the BEST way to get to the Inka treasures.I hope you make the Journey, Bon Voyage, Jim, "James Bond ", Pynn (as Rony called me), Brooklyn NY 11215
train like a dream ..... To travel by train is best choice ,very clean ,quality of service and trip was very comfortable.great trip and best time to spend on the road.

Comfortable but expensive cruise. A comfortable way to get to Aguas Calientes.Definitely quite expensive but it's clean and well organized. For tall people the distance between the rows is too narrow. There is only a small sliding window to open. Taking good pictures during the cruise is not so easy, even in Vistadome. The fashion show on the return is exaggerated.The food on board is tasty, the staff is very friendly.

Probably Worth It. All was good except for some chaos boarding on the return from Aguas Caliente. On-board staff were excellent. Fashion show was fun on the return. Snacks and presentation were well done. Vistadome is the way to go if you are taking the train. Tickets are expensive given the length of the trip but there is added value. Good to do once.

Nice but costly. Bought the ticket for this early November 15:35 Vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes just a half hour before-hand at the train station ticket office. The left side has the best views by far traveling Olly--> AC. Each train car has a toilet and we were given a nice snack and soft drink. It was just like an airline flight with at least 3 attendants. Yes, tickets ARE expensive.We took an Expedition train back and in my opinion the Vistadome was a much better experience with better seats, service and fellow passengers - but is very costly.

Peurrail's Vistadome experience. A very enjoying train ride!! Wife and I enjoyed the friendly servant staff of Claudio, Nestor, & Danesa as they put on a fashion show that got all the passengers clapping and encouraging them as they performed for us. The scenery was beautiful and magnificent as we caught glimpses of snow caped mountains in the distance. Was definitely one of the highlights of our visit to Machu Picchu.

Good way to get to Aguas Calientes. Snack service was good and the fashion show on the evening trip back to Poroy was memorable.Be aware that on the morning train from Poroy to AG, the train can get a bit warm with direct sun load.

Not just a train ride.... Four of us travelled on Perurail's Vistadome at the end of November 2014--from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes early one morning and then back to Poroy (Cusco) late the next day. It turned out to be an essential part of our Machu Picchu experience. Great views of the diverse countryside; clean & comfortable seating; we were served breakfast on the trip to MP & a light dinner on the much longer return trip. Panflute music & narration on the way; fashion show & folk dance on the return. And, of course, the opportunity to buy books, CDs & clothing... A limited selection of alcoholic beverages was also available to purchase during the dinner service.The Perurail staff were professional, personable and succeeded in keeping a train car full of travelers from all over the world safe, comfortable & entertained. Special thanks to Dayano, Balbino and Alan for their great customer service!It cost US$ 62 for the trip from Ollantaytambo to AG; US$ 72 from AG to Poroy--even though that trip was twice as long. No matter, this unique Peruvian experience is worth every penny!

Breathtaking views. Very comfortable, friendly staff, good food and they make time go faster, by doing a fashion show of alpaca products. They also put on a dance and talk about the history of the area. After a long day in Machu Picchu it was a nice way to end the day on the ride back to Cusco.

An excellent choice. The vistadome train was definitely worth the extra $15 USD when choosing between that and the expedition. The vistadome was a smooth trip with great food and friendly staff. The scenery is fantastic and the train trip was a highlight in my Machu Picchu experience!
Great way to get to Aguas Calientes. It is a long ride but they make sure you're comfortable and the train is also on time and very clean and well kept.

Great view of the Andes from all angles. When travelling by train you like to see as much as possible & the vistadome is a great way to see the Andes. Because the mountains tower above you it gives you great perspective & an idea of just how magnificent the Andes are. It's good to see the change in scenery from the often dry, stark landscape to the jungle as you pull into Machu Picchu Pueblo. Recommend totally.

Enjoy the panoramic view.. This option to travel to Machu Pichu may be a little more expensive than the regular train but totally worth it.The process to get in the train was fast and organized, you should have the passport available together with your ticket. It allows the passangers to bring small bags due to the limitted space, I brought my little Carry on and it was perfectly fine. The train is clean and confortable with glass ceiling and big glass, panoramic windows which allows the passenger to feel closer to the mountains, the sky and the river that goes along during the trip duration. They served food and drinks, enough to hold you until you reach the destination. The staff is courteous and diligent. On our way back, they presented a typical dance performance and a fashion show with the different Alpaca coats, it was a lot of fun and simply entertaining.Tip: The best side of the train to seat is the left when going from Cusco to Machu Pichu, you will be amazed by the view, the river, the mountains changing colors and forms and the foggy sky, I can't describe with words. Enjoy the view.

Great History. The train ride to Machu Picchu was just awesome, met many local people from Peru and other from around the world. The journey took us along the Urubamba River. You really get the sense of the mountain ranges and the climbs the Aztecs made to get to their crops from on top of these mountains.

Not worth the extra money. We traveled on the Vistadome this trip, will take the Expedition next time. It's not worth the extra money for the snacks they give you. The roof glass panels worked against taking pictures of the scenery without glare. The shows are a pain, would rather they be quiet and let me sleep on the way back.
Fun trip. Fun trip! Lots of attention to detail. Felt spoiled the whole way there and best use of time between Cusco and Aguas Calientes.

A very nice ride to Machu Picchu. The train was very nice, clean and comfortable. There are four people per table which allows for good conversation during the trip. Don't expect to have a decent meal. They feed you but it was blah and not very much food. The same was true for drinks. If you bring your own food and drink you'll be fine and enjoy the trip.

Great way to travel. What a great way to travel to Machu Picchu, the cars are clean and with the Vistadome cars you get a wonderful view. The employees are polite and well organized. You are served a small snack and beverage during your trip. On the way back we were entertained by the train crew with a fashion show of Alpaca clothing and one was dressed in a native costume.The crew was Juan Manuel, Sherli, and Oscar.

Fantastic train journey. We travelled from ollantaytambo to Aqua calientes to journey to macchu Picchu. We booked months in advance and subsequently had the seats at the front. The view from these seats were exceptional and the journey was extremely memorable. We travelled via visterdome and would recommend this journey to others.

Mardi Gras?. It was pouring when we left the station. Several windows leaked. Lucky for us, the folks across from us could move to a drier seat. This gave us more space and two seats away from the leaky window. The luggage was stacked up across from us and on the first turn is all fell. They didn't know how to secure the net. Luckily they figured it out after re-stacking. A small snack and beverage was provide. Then a staff member dressed in mardi gras clown costume and wolf mask danced the aisle. Then there was a fashion show followed by sales of llama wool fashions. For someone just down from Machu Picchu after 4 days of hiking and no shower, I was not at all interested in "fashionable" clothes.

train to Macchu Pichu. It was a pleasure to ride & look out at the scenery. There are attendants on board who serve beverages on the trip. While waiting for the train, there is a market in Macchu Pichu, and lovely restaurants nearby.

Nice . Comfortable train service from Cusco to Aguas Calientes... they serve a small meal ... beautiful view all the way .. they sell alpaca staff ... zigzag area was interesting .. good recorded guide at the train explaning interesting areas during the trip

Memorable train trip. We enjoyed our train trip from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes (and return 2 days later). I bought our tickets on-line. Good web site, displays the choices, simple transaction. There are 3 classes of travel: Expedition (which is OK), Vistadome (with a better view) and Hiram super-luxury. We went one way by Vistadome and returned by Expedition. In my opinion, the upgrade to VistaDome is worth the moderate cost increase. Both stations have a waiting room with plenty of seats, a cafe, and clean modern toilets.The train arrived on time. Our seats were clean and comfortable. The train resumed motion promptly, and the trip took two hours, moving steadily along a spectacular steep valley. Our staff served us tea and sweet rolls, and sold beer to the thirsty. The train toilet was clean and functional.Overall, a well-managed train operation. TIPS: Print out your tickets! An electronic copy displayed on a smart-phone will not suffice. (PeruRail booths at Lima airport will print tickets)Bring only a small case; leave your monster suitcases in your previous hotel secure-room.You need to be aware of the locations of the train stations. We chose Ollantaytambo (about 2 hours car-ride from Cusco airport) as our start-end point, mainly to get used to altitude for 3 days. Aguas Calientes station is embedded within its town, easy walking distance to all hotels except the mountaintop hotel.

スタッフの心配りで楽しい列車の旅. 往復とも、左側の席からの景色が綺麗です。アルパカ製品を売るための、スタッフによるファッションショーが面白く、スタッフの笑顔や片言の日本語での挨拶に、心が温まりました。重いカバンを持ってくれたり、列車の進行方向に席を移動させてくれたりと、スタッフの小さな気遣いが溢れていて、気持ち良く過ごせました。私のペルー旅行の中で、最もいいサービスでした。値段もそこそこするけどね、、、乗務員のChristian、Carmen 、Efrain ありがとう！We can see beautiful views from the left side of the seat.The fashion show by crews to sell alpaca products was very interesting.By the greeting in Japanese and smiling of crews, my heart was warm.Carry my heavy bag, move the seat in the traveling direction of the train, because of careful consideration by crews, I was able to spend comfortably time.In my trip to Peru, it was the best service. Christian, Carmen and Efrain thank you very much!

Comfortable and accommodating . We took the expedition from poroy to aguas calientes and the vistadome back. There isn't much of a difference except for a small meal (veggie empanadas) and a fashion show where they try to sell you alpaca clothing. Peru rail do a good job and are well organized. We had some language barrier issues with one of the staff when trying to change the time of our train back. The manager, Alfred Del Castillo stepped in and assisted us the rest of the way. He was extremely helpful and made all the difference in the world.

amazing journey. we left MP at the end of October for our journey back to Cusco, having travelled up by train from Olly. That ride up was beautiful and relaxing. The return ride was very different and equally exciting.The Vistadome train has incredible views thru the glass roof and wide windows.Seating is comfy and the scenery amazing. Then there is the on board entertainment. The train staff change into wonderful costumes and dance for ages..totally unexpected and great fun.they then proceed to sell Peruvian clothing, (which is reasonable value!) All very good.I have read some reports about late trains/temperature too hot etc.Please people you are in Peru, expect maybe a few things to be not as planned. Its all part of the experience.This was a great journey with incredible scenery. Enjoy it.And thanks to our staff on board, Edgar, Daniel,and Duyance

Great Vistas, Pay attention to the luggage restriction. Most people travel to Aguas Calientes and Machu Picchu on the Vistadome train service. It is a well run train service, and the seats are comfortable. Buried in the fine print is a notation that you are limited to one backpack of 5 kilos or less. As we were planning on two nights in Aguas Calientes, we weren't sure this would work for us and angsted over what the rules actually were. We asked two different tour guides, who each basically said, "You'll be fine." We squeezed the three of us into one small carry-on suitcase and three backpacks, and we were fine. They have a small rack that they store all of the small suitcases on, and if everyone took a separate suitcase, truly there would not be room. But, they had enough space to accomodate what people did bring.The VistaDome itself is an extra roof panel of windows on either side of the centerline of the train. This is helpful as the train winds through the Andes towards (and from) Aguas Calientes. The seating assigned and club-style, meaning that half the passengers will be traveling backwards. We were surprised on the ride back from Aguas Calientes that Peru Rail put on a fashion show, to sell some (beautiful) wool items, and also a dance routine by a guy in a harlequin-ish costume and mask. I personally don't enjoy these things, but there were some eastern european tourists on the train, and they REALLY got into it. To each his/her own!

Fun ride: MP to Cusco. Great views through the wide windows and sun roofs. Food and service was gourmet. The entertainment and fashion show was a lot of fun. Very helpful staff. Poroy station is somewhat away from Cusco - takes 30 more minutes and 30 soles to get back in a cab.

It gets you home an hour earlier. The fashion show and "entertainment" were loud, long and corny, but by taking the vistadome we got home more than an hour earlier than taking the regular train. After 4 days on the Inca trail, it's worth it.
The Best Way to go to Aguas Caliente. The Train Ride is Relaxing and the views are beautiful... this is for the full experience... better than a taxi

Vistadome adventure. Incredible journey with gorgeous views of the Valley as we made our way to Machu Picchu. The service was very good and the ride there comfortable. Unfortunately, on the way home my husband I (we are both tall) were seated across from a couple that did not give us much room. We were cramped for the 4 hour journey back to Cuzco. Ask for seats alone and facing forward if you get motion sickness.
Pleasant enough. Why complain about a timely schedule, decent food, nice staff and gorgeous scenery. But after hearing "El Condor Paso" five times in an hour, life got challenging.

Wonderful. We enjoyed the most amazing scenery aboard Vistadome with incredible views, terrific amenities, and fantastic service. Odelia, Edison, and Jose were wonderful hosts and made the ride a memorable and special experience. Thank you!

What a view!. Waiting for the train at Ollantaytambo was quite an experience. Here we were treated to many Peruvian sales ladies selling all the usual items plus any number of walking sticks. Great fun! The station seemed chaotic but we were soon settled on our train. It was very comfortable and we were served with complimentary drinks and snacks. The views were amazing and a great way to get to Agua Calientes at the foot of Machu Picchu.

Safe, clean ride with friendly staff. This was the median option between the very expensive luxury train directly from Cuzsco and Inca Rail. The service and trains were great, but the temperature inside the carriage was a bit too warm likely from all the windows. Our return to Oallanta was delayed by train malfunction then several waits for other train crossings. Fortunately our flight in Cuzsco was later in the evening.
Train travel with some class. A nice stress-free ride. Well organized and pleasant staff with drinks ans snack food. Too bad that the train station in Cusco is too far.

Great views. The train ride through the Sacred Valley was beautiful, relaxing and comfortable. The train staff told us a lot about the area and took great care of us. On a clear day the 20,000 foot peaks are amazing.

It's good. We caught the train from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. This was a shorter journey. Seating is allocated and satisfactorily comfortable. The views are comprehensive. Waiting on the train at Ollantaytambo was great fun with a panpiper playing his music, excited fellow travellers and local hawkers selling walking sticks, local style hats and various woollen goods.The train left on time and we were served beverages and chocolate pastries.We travelled back from Aguas Calientes to Poroy - a much longer journey. It leaves AC at about 3.20pm and gets to Poroy at about 7.30pm. They serve up beverages & a snack which was a vegetarian pie. A local "monster" or supernatural being dances up & down the carriage at some point followed by a fashion show - the garments are very nice but don't expect any bargains - they are not cheap.Arrival in Poroy (end of the line) is another bit of excitement. Transfer time to our hotel in the middle of Cusco was about 45 minutes. It all made for a long day!

You have to take this. I was contemplating between regular and vistadome train as this one cost approx. $30 more but it is worth it. You get 2 hot meals on your seat and a Fashion show on the way back. Views are amazing as well from extra large windows.
One of the best rail trips. Excellent service. You get 2 meals served on your seat if you are in Vistadome service. On the way back staff put together a Fashion Show in the moving train.
Good service and beautiful ride. The Vistadome was just what we expected. Clean and on time. The table seating is a bit cramped, but it is a minor nit.
Riding the rails. Took the 10 hour train and enjoyed every minute of it. Relaxation and luxury with breath taking views.

Scenic train. Great way to get to Machu Picchu. Leg room is cramped and I'm just 156 cm. Interesting fashion show on the trip back to Poroy. If you find an item iteresting, buy it on the train as several of the pieces are not available in the stores.

Very comfortable and great views. We got the Vistadome train back from Aguas Calientes after completing the 4 day Inca Trail trek.I felt a bit self-conscious being slightly 'dishevelled' and amongst much cleaner travellers, but it was worth it for the views. I would have given the fashion show a miss if I could have though!

Big windows, weird service. The Vistadome train has much bigger windows than the Explorer train, which is nice. Make sure to sit on the river side though, as the views are far superior. What I didn't like was that on the way back from Aguas Calientes to Poroy, they do a whole dance show and sell clothing, and basically make a ton of noise for almost 30 minutes. I just wanted some rest...

It's a scenic view of Machu Picchu region. It was a great view of the landscape leading up to Machu Picchu. They were really friendly and had presentations of Peruvian clothing during the trip. The downside was the windows fogged up and the "sandwich" they served was a tiny slice of tomato with a drop of basil inside... it would have been better to serve nothing.

Worth it!. I had hiked the Inca Trail so seeing the Vistadome at the Peru rail station was a nice surprise. It was a completely different vantage point, you get a 180 degree of what is going on around you from the comfort of your seat. Just be warned of the fashion show :)

Comfortable, clean and efficient. More expensive than the expedition train, this train is very comfortable, clean and well organised. Staff both at the station and on the train were very polite and professional. A light breakfast of coffee/tea and pastries were served on the morning trip to Aguas Caliente and then a small dinner on the 5pm return trip. The trip affords excellent views of the stunning scenery and flows the river. Occasional announcements point out main sights along the way. On the 5pm trip back to Cusco ( 3.5 hours) we were looking forward to napping as we had had a very early start, but after the food service there was some entertainment and "fashion show" of items for sale which though entertaining was not quite appreciated.

Great, depending on time of day. Avoid the midday train from Poroy to Machu Picchu Pueblo as the sun comes in right overhead & you may not be able to move, otherwise great. Late afternoon train back to Poroy has onboard entertainment 7 fashion show. Food is good too, light, but filling.

Good service but still expensive. A very well organized train station in Cusco and Aguas Calientes, staff was very helpful when boarding and disembarking. Service onboard was ok they gave us a snack, but no alcohol, but is on purchase if you want. Restroom are good, nothing fancy. Still think is too much for the price if you compare to the living standard in Peru, for such a short trip of 3 hours only. I was told by an agency in Cusco, you can go by bus from cusco to Aguas Calientes, and is about 120 soles, last about 4 hours and u still have to walk for about an hour. This seems a lot cheaper. Shame I couldnt do it to tell my experience but I got to know when I had my ticket bought already.

VERY slow but enjoyable. We took this train from Machu Picchu to Cusco (Poroy). It has to climb a long way up to Poroy and the trip took 4 1/2 hours!!There was some enjoyable entertainment on the way to help pass the time during the dark hours of travel.

Best train journey ever!. We took the Vistadome from Machu Picchu to Cusco. Scenery awesome, food ordinary, but then after Illantaytambo you are in for a great surprise - you just have to go to find out, but we can tell you it's fantastic entertainment and on its own worth the trip! One of the highlights of our holiday so far.

Wonderful Experience. We took the Vistadome to Machu Picchu and loved the whole experience. We met some nice people along the way. The scenery was beautiful and the trip relaxing. I enjoyed the choice of snack and drink. I would have loved to buy a book of Machu Picchu on the train but it was offered on the way to Machu Picchu and would have been heavy to hike with. I wish that I could have gotten it on the way back but clothes were offered at that time. My suggestion is when you see it buy it.

Perfect for the price...... Good views,confortable enough seats, good service aboard ....we were stranded 1 1/2 hrs in Pachar during our return trip to Cusco because of small land slide on the tracks. Were transfer to buses and arrived near midnight in Cusco.....information on board was sporadic and not precise enough ....understandable under the circumstances .....
One of those that must be done. If you are just thinking about it, stop thinking now and Just do it. Book it. Brilliant experience. Er, the food is not what you are on this for, so ignore it.

A Grand ride to Cusco. A very well organised trip.The food was good which was local andean cuisine. The stewards andstewardess were also very good and helpful throughout the trip.The journey is quite interesting traversing valleys with the mountains on each side.

Vistadome was a greatbtrainride.. A wonderfull expirience during my travel in Peru with Vistadome. Great train and very friendly and helpfull people. I had missed my train but Mr. Jairan Pareja the bording agent helped to get a ticket for the next Vistadome train. Thanks again Jairan.

Worth the few extra dollars. Went up to Agua Calientes on the Expedition train scheduled on our SAS short Inca trail package . We decided to return earlier to Cusco and our guide was able to book us on the Vistadome for an additional $5 per person. We ended up in Ollantaytambo instead of Cusco and caught a taxi for 70 soles to Cusco.Vistadome was very comfortable with larger windows, a snack and Some entertainment .Expedition train was fine but Vistadome was a nice treat after the trek for just a few more dollars.

Very comfortable train ride to Machu Picchu. We took the Peru rail vista dome and it was great. We saw a lot of breath taking scenery along the way. Train was clean and seats were comfortable. Snacks were served too. They also have a bit of "duty free" shopping on the train and entertainment provided by their crew.
Peru rail is great, comfortable,clean. Great trip from our hotel grounds through lovely scenery, to town at base of Machu Picchu . On time and good service.

scenic, comfort and excellent service. The Vistadome experience was more than I expected. From station to station and back, it was a stress free, pleasant experience. The views afforded by the large windows and dome enhanced the enjoyment of the 3 plus hour trip...The staff from station, to on board, was professional, courteous and helpful. On both, to and from rides, fellow travelers were also pleasant and interesting... without being overbearing. It was a wonderful way to prepare for the marvels of Machu Picchu!

Highy recommend for your trip to Machu Picchue!. The dome car was very comfortable with a reclining seat. There were many good views on the way to Aguas Calientes. A light meal was included. On the return trip, and after dark, a staff member dressed as a shaman and danced up and down the aisle inviting passengers to join in. This was followed by a fashion show with staff modelling various baby alpaca garments available for purchase.

Lovely train ride. The trip from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes on board the train was both pleasurable and relaxing. It's a very comfortable train, clean, and with great views. The thing I most appreciated was that everyone had an assigned seat, so no issues where to sit. If it's possible, they do have two seats facing forward at the front of the train. Not sure how to get these seats, but they are the coolest seats on the train.

A incredible experience. I strongly recommend the Peru Rail services. Me and my wife traveled from Poroy (about 30 minutes from Cusco's Plaza de Armas by taxi) to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu). The views are amazing ! The train had a mechanical problem in the back trip to Cusco but they solved it very fast ( in about 30 minutes minutes). It happens. The crew was great! They also help me with extra information about the places. They are very friendly .

Excellent views from this train. Aside from the amazing views of the countryside, this train also offered snacks, wine and a fashion show. For me it was a much better option than hiking the trail, jajaja

A great train trip. Very comfortable, great visibility and of course great scenery. Excellent way to get to MacchuPicchu, well organised, punctual and staff friendly and helpful. The food was was simple but enough-a very enjoyable trip.

Wonderful!. We rode the Vistadome twice. Both times we were served food and drink. The first time we had pancakes and fruit for breakfast and the second time we rode 3 1/2 hours from Agua Caliente to Poroy. We were served a delicious dinner and entertained the entire ride! First an entertainer in a mask representing the devil danced to music and then a lovely fashion show. Our three entertainers were Jose Luis, Zulma and Enrique. Wonderful!! The scenery was awesome as we rode through the country. We felt very pampered and totally enjoyed the experience! Highly recommend this train!!
Too fancy for me. Train for rich tourists wanting to show of their big camera's. The fashion show is funny but the clothes they sell are way too expensive. The food you get is average.

I just wanted to go to Machu Picchu. Not to pay 200 dollars for a 1.5 hour trip.. I felt scalped (like with most things in Perú, anyways: you're a tourist, pay!). I just wanted to go to the ruins. This was the ONLY way to go there and spend a decent amount of time in one day. I ended sitting in this fancy "speed train" (that runs at 30 km/h: over 3 hours for 90 km) and paying a lot of money for the service that I didn't want/need. If you just need transportation, this is not the option. But I don't think there are any other available. Never again (they know that; how many times are you going to Machu Picchu in your life?). The "show" on the way back was terrible (yet another way to sell you handicrafts; I just wanted to relax and watch a movie and ended listening to people screaming dressed up in costumes for 1 hour... while they tried to sell all kind of clothes). Not for me.
Great train ride to Aguas Calientes to see Machu Picchu. There were good views of the river and many Inca terraces along the route of this train that takes you towards Machu Picchu.

Great travel choice to Machu Picchu. We chose the Vistadome train for both our travel to and from Machu Picchu. This is really a great way to get to the ruins. It takes about 3.5 hours in each direction and the train is very slow but you get great views of the mountains and valleys plus they provide a small meal in both directions. They also sell tourist items like alpaca clothing. The upper windows on the train help you see the snow-capped mountains.

Great train ride to and from Machu Picchu. We chose the Vistadome for our train service to and from Machu Picchu. The train is a great way to get to MP. The ride is a bit long (about 3.5 hours each way) and the train moves very slowly but it does offer great views of the area. They even serve you a meal in each direction and offer items for sale (alpaca clothing and other touristy items). Our train broke down temporarily on the way back (at night) but the delay turned out to be less than 30 minutes. The Vistadome is great in that provides ceiling-level windows that let you see through the top of the train. This helps to allow for views of the snow-capped mountains.
Great experience. Very enjoyable and informative with great views. Nice to let someone else do the driving. Went to places cars could not go so that made it very interesting.

Best bargin we found.. Take the regular Vista Dome, not the luxury one. This train is wonderful, snacks are served on table cloths, the crew entertains and the scenery is amazing. Just do not bother to take it at night, since it goes thru dark areas, and there are not even lights to watch outside the windows, and you miss the vistas.

Look at the options before booking . We travelled from Ollantaytambo to Agues Callientes using Peru Rail's vistadome. Basically you have two choices Peru Rail or Inka Rail. The first is run by a consortium and all the money goes outside Peru, but we only found this out after booking and with hindsight would have preferred to book with Inka Rail. However, is all about the timing. The journey takes 1.5 hours. We paid $58 one way for the vistadome and choose the $63 Expedition back. Both were fine but the Vistadome is more comfortable. You need to be at the station 30 mins before departure. They give you a snack on the journey. You do this to visit Machu Picchu. Unfortunately you have to go via Agues Callientes. This is like 'Pottersville' from 'It's a Wonderful Life'. Horrid. Machu Picchu is wonderful though. Enjoy.
Nice views out of the train to Aqua Calientes. We took the train from Ollontaitambo to Aqua Calientes and it was a very pleasent ride even with a little snack .

Cusco to Machu Picchu. Clean, friendly, timely, professional and courteous. Rail service at it's best. I traveled with PeruRail Oct. 22-23. Along with the beautifully performed fashion show was a costumed dancer (Edgar) who rallied the guests and engaged us with his spirited dancing. I do hope I have another opportunity to travel with PeruRail!

NO RESPECT FOR CONSUMER RIGHTS.. My wife and I bought our tickets on the Internet, but due to a health problem we arrived in Cusco 24 hours later than expected, we had a reservation for the previous day on Peru Rail. We went to the train station and explained to them what had happened but they said we had lost our tickets and we had to buy new ones.How in the world can that be fair?. Flight delays, missed connections, weather problems and simple changes of plans happen everyday. But not in Peru Rail. You are not allowed any rights, We expected to pay a penalty for issuing new tickets but they would not accept any changes I have bought tickets for other services which are non-refundable and non reissuably, but they are real bargains at very low, low prices, but with Peru Rail their fares are higher than any other train in the planet.All airlines and train companies anywhere in the world will reissue a ticket (charging you a penalty) for an unused ticket. That is fair, but in Peru Rail fairness does not exist.So we lost $360.00. We bought our new tickets with Inca Rail, which has the same policy as Peru Rail but charges a little less than Peru Rail, for a comparative service.I have traveled with both companies before and neither one of them gives you back in service what you pay in cash.There are several agencies now offering to take you to Machu Pichu by bus for as low as $ 99.00 (including the entrance fee) which is about a third of what it takes to go by train.You cannot help but feel that they try to rip off the tourists, after all -they might think- if they are here make them pay. So one last Word of advice. If you are going to use their services, do not book Machu Pichu on your first day of travel, because if you have any delay and are not able to communicate with them you will lose the full value of your train tickets.

Superb rail experience. This train is ultra clean and beautiful, and the service on board splendid. The scenery is outstanding and gets more and more exciting the closer to Machu Picchu you get. The best side of the train is the left travelling in the direction of Machu Picchu.
From Ollanta to MP. Great train ride! Service was excellent and on time. Snacks and drinks were served on the train - included in the price. Buy your ticket ahead of time!
Great train ride. Clean, neat, good snacks, great views, friendly staff, on time, what more is there to say. The on board fashion show was lots of fun.

Excellent. From Canada on holidays..I am very glad to have paid a little extra to take the first class and loved the experience! Edgar, Carmen & Marco were very professional, entertaining and incredibly helpful. I was very lucky to get them again on the way back and experience more Peruvian culture:-) Thank you for wonderful service!!!! Gosia Croden

The only way to get to Machu Picchu!. The title is not strictly true but if you aren't trekking there you will be going by train on the Vistadome. This train is very slow but is thoroughly fascinating as it weaves it's way through the mountains to Aguas Calientes at the foot of Machu Picchu.

Friendly service. I chose an early morning journey because it was slightly cheaper. Some of the other companies seem to be more expensive. I still think it's not cheap for a train journey anywhere in the world, but I'm not sure what can be done.The service was good, I bought my ticket in Aguas Calientes the night before, no hassle.The train left on time and we were given a cup of tea and a muffin for breakfast.The staff were very friendly.And the scenery was spectacular.I'm not sure what the difference between the different service providers are (there seems to be 3), but I can certainly recommend Peru Rail for this journey.
PeruRail to Machu Picchu. PeruRail runs a first class service from Ollantaytambo, and Cusco to Aguascaliente. The service is excellent, and the whole experience was a surprise given the the difficult

Comfortable and recommended. Train ride is comfortable with helpful staff. There are toilets on the train and food is also served. On the way to Machu Pichu, look out for Sky Lodge. Take picture from the train. It's an expensive motel that is suspended on a mountain. It's stunning to see how customers get to this motel.

Unforgettable experience. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. It's definitely the easiest way to reach Machu Picchu, unless you really want to walk the mystic Inca Trail. The train remains a great experience. The on-line booking process is easy and well supported. Personally I still found it a bit too expensive, but you have to think to that as one of the few way to reach a unique place and probably a barrier to help keep Machu Picchu preserved.

Lovely trip to Aquas Calientes. Booked this train instead of the backpackers "Expedition" on the Peru Rail site. Easy to do and only $2 more than the "Expedition" at the time we chose to go. (Think early mornings are more expensive.) We departed from Ollantaytambo after staying there for 3 nights on arrival in the Cusco area ... excellent idea to stay in this lovely little town. The train trips were lovely big clean windows and food and drink served on a nice peruvian placemat. We did see the less and more expensive trains but this one was great. If you can be flexible in your times and would advise staying two nights in Aquas Calientes if you have time and take the afternoon train in and later morning train out. Train seemed full both ways in September so we were glad we had booked prior to arrival.

Views are nice during the day. Since I was traveling alone this was my best option to and from Machu Picchu. The afternoon ride from Ollantaytambo was pleasant and some pretty vistas. You ride right next to the river so it is easy to see how much you are dropping in elevation. The return trip to Cusco was mostly after dark and excruciatingly long. While the food was okay the "entertainment" was merely a foil for their blatant attempt to sell products. Having experienced similar in other countries I found it really annoying. We were a captive audience and no one at my seating table appreciated it. Overall, clean and relatively efficient but next time I would try to find a reliable driver to take me back to Cusco.

Andean view enroute Machu Picchu. Perurail from Poroy takes you to Aquas Callientes via Ollantaytambo through Urubamba valley. The three and a half hour train ride takes you through some breathtaking vistas at 20km speed. We reserved our tickets well in advance, however, last minute tickets could be expensive at the ticket window. Coach attendants are courteous and a a fresh snack is served with beverages. We were served Quinoa pancakes with Elderberry preserves. Unlike in the past where zig zag travel was a norm from Cusco, at least one zig zag pass is done from the train past Poroy. Hikers trek from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu, a four and one half day to Sunrise at the SunTemple point. On our return we got down at Ollantaytambo and drove to Cusco. Announcements on the train are both in Spanish and fluent English with some Andean music and mask wearing coach attendants to entertain you while a baby alpaca sweaters, scarves, and much more are on sale for those with an urge to spend. Overall the train ride on the Perurail Vistadome is a memorable experience.

Way overpriced journey. The vistadome trains are nice, clean and comfortable. The staff is nice and the trip, although long, was relaxing.However, $80 US dollars for a 90km journey in Peru is like a joke. We payed 160 US dollars for both ways afford each person. As the only other way to get to machu pichu is by trekking for 3-4 days, it seems they are taking advantage of the tourists and the monopoly they have.Wish we had other options. Although having nice service I would have taken another cheaper way to Machu picchu is there was one.
Great experience !. Great scenery, the staff (Yuliana, Roberto and Jinathan) were amazing ! They treated us like family!

Great experience. We really enjoyed this relaxing train trip with plenty to see along the way. Staff were friendly and provided great refreshments and the seats were very comfortable. Everything was well organised from buying the tickets online to boarding procedures.

The "best" way to Aguas Calientes/Machu Picchu!. The "vistadome" train is by far the best way to reach Aguas Calientes. The scenery is spectacular and the view from the ceiling windows and the large side windows only enhances your trip. The train is very clean, spotless washrooms, great food/snacks provided free of charge, and the train "attendants", (Judith, Domingo & Raul) were exceptional. Having booked seats is great so there is no stampede to find a good seat. There were 12 of us traveling together so it really didn't matter who we were sitting with (facing) but you might want to face whoever you are travelling with, if you prefer - it's also a great way to meet other travellers. There always is the "cheaper" train but this is well worth the extra cost.

Easiest travel and value. The Vistdome was a really great experience for us. The staff is so top notch and they serve various snack and drinks on both ways and have a show on the way back from MP. The train is spacious, clean and for sur the best way to get to MP.

A great view on the way to Aguas Calientes.. This train offers great views of the route to Aguas Calientes. The service is good, and there is a mobile shopping cart on board where you can purchase local handicrafts and clothing.

Beats the regular train. This is the middle of the road train travel the cheaper train could see you standing up for an hour and a half. This has booked seats but they face each other so you take pot luck as to who you will be facing for the journey. The seats are pretty comfortable and you are served a snack. There are also toilet facilities. The tracks are narrow gauge and the carriages fairly wide so there is a fair amount of sway and the train has to travel at a slow pace. The scenery makes up for any short comings however and the train seems to run pretty strictly to time

British Rail - eat your heart out!. A fantastic journey from Cusco to Aguas Calientes. Very comfortable and clean. Incredible views from the large windows. Nice little snacks on board (included) and entertainment (fashion show and then the obligatory attempts to sell the garments! Don't be tempted - better value elsewhere!). This was part of an organised tour so I cannot comment on the cost of it.

Nice ride, no problems. Purchased our tickets online and about 6 months in advance. We wanted to take trains Vistadome #501 and Expedition #504 so that we could carry a small suitcase with us as we were staying in Aguas Calientes 3 days/2 nights. They are the only trains that allow you to carry on a small piece of luggage (not sure if you still can). I read rumors several days before we were to leave that they were not allowing passengers to carry any luggage anymore. I emailed Peru rail to get verification that we could carry on small suitcase. When we arrived we did not have any problems about carry on a small bag plus our backpacks. There was a small storage area near the bathroom for extra bags. The train ride was very scenic from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes. We were lucky enough to get seats on the river side. The ride was about 1.5 hours long. The seats were comfortable. There served you a beverage and a roll.

Great return trip from Aguas Calientes. We took the Vistadome train from Aguas Calientes to Poroy and then caught a cab to Cusco. The train was clean and comfortable. We had a really nice snack served on actual plates and with silverware (as opposed to airline service). There was odd entertainment - a dancing shaman and a fashion show - that was more distracting and a bit uncomfortable for us, but it wasn't offensive.

BORING, but ok.... So there are two ways into Aguas Calientes- either hiking or taking the train. The Vistadome is a nice train. The ride is pleasant, the seats are comfortable and the service is decent. The only downside is that the ride from Poroy (near Cusco) is 3.5hrs long. It is slow and BORING. I would suggest touring sites in the Sacred Valley and getting the train in Ollaytambo where the ride is only 1.75hrs.Seat are four each, two pairs facing each other with a table in the middle. Be sure to request a forward facing seat if you get motion sick. Each car has a restroom, but patrons are restricted to the car of their seat (unlike Amtrak).
Worth the extra. Got served a delicious and classy meal of pancakes and fresh fruit. Service was great and the views amazing. A must do on your travel through the area.

Same view but better service. I may have been spoiled because we had the big window car on the way to Machu Piichu and took the Vistadome on the way back. I admit that this is one place where i had expectations and was disappointed. On other trains that I have been on the Vistadome was just that. A car with a glass dome on it so it was possible to see 360 degrees around. This was basically the larger window train car with glass panels in the roof. My wife thought that they might be larger than the ones on the first trip. But the service is much better. You get table runners and a much nicer snack, and I should have bought a beer. And each car gets a fashion show to entertain you when it gets dark. It was an interesting experience and I am glad that I did it one way.

Wonderful experience. I loved, loved, loved traveling on the Vistadome. Train travel is rare for many and this did not disappoint! We were served a lovely breakfast and staff provided information as we traveled. I would strongly suggest IF traveling to Machu Picchu to purchase the included buffet @ the Sanctuary Lodge.

Wonderful scenic trip. Part of our trip arranged by Kuoda Tours, this train is more than just a way to get to Machu Picchu; it is an experience in itself. Relaxed, wonderful views, great service and even complimentary food service (airlines take note). Enjoy the ride.

Highly recommended.. I can fully recommend taking the Vistadome train from Cusco to Machu Picchu. Takes 3 - 4 hours but well worth it as there is plenty to see and photograph. The entertainment on the return journey completed a superb experience for us.

Excellent experience. So here is the deal: getting to Machu Picchu is not as hard as the internet makes it seem. Step 1: land in Cusco. Sleep. Step 2: Board the VISTADOME train (definitely the best Perurail train) from Poroy Station to Aguas Calientes at around 6.30am. You will need to take a 20 minute cab ride from your hotel in Cusco to the Poroy train station to catch the Perurail. The train ride is around 3 hours. You will arrive in Aguas Calientes, which is a town at the foot of Machu Picchu. You will want to hustle from the train station to the bus stop (you'll walk through a market, over a bridge to get to the bus stop. just look for the big buses). Next to the parked buses, there is a ticket window where you will pay around $11 for a bus ride up to Machu Picchu that takes about 20 minutes. Board bus immediately. You'll have time to enjoy the little town of Aguas Calientes after visiting Machu Picchu. The bus will take you straight to the entrance of Machu Picchu, where you must present your ticket (purchased beforehand; it sells out) and passport. The return is easy too: get in line for the bus at the entrance to Machu Picchu, take it back down to Aguas Calientes, explore the town a bit while you wait for the departing train on Perurail. So much simpler than the internet makes it seem!As for Perurail: it is such an awesome experience. I took both the Vistadome train and the Expedition train and the Vistadome train is definitely worth the extra $12 or so. The seats are comfortable, they provide a small breakfast which is yummy, and the train has huge windows as well as windows on the roof to enjoy the view. The train experience was fantastic, and the staff was incredibly nice to everyone.

The Best Value for the $$. If your looking for relaxing luxury for a fair price, look no further. its a 3hr slow ride through beautiful countryside, awesome views, dotted with interesting culture.Do yourself a favor and plan your trip so that you start your trip in Aguas Caliente. You can if book your flight to coincide with the Vistadome departures from Poroy Station. You can sleep on the train. The sooner you get out of Cuzco the first day the better chance you have of avoiding Altitude sickness (MP is much lower than Cuzco). I suggest you fly from Lima to Cuzco, get a taxi from the airport to Poroy Train Station on the Vistadome (excellent service and comfort) to MP (Aguas Calientes). If you intend to go to Wayana Picchu (I highly recommend it) plan for 2-days in MP. On the trip back, Vistadome from MP to Ollantaytambo, spend a day there. its a great place to see a few more Inca Ruins. And get a taxi from Ollantay to Cuzco (80 Sols). Yes, its and hour and a half of beautiful countryside and the added benefit of taking you to your Hotel directly. It will cost you $40 Sols from the Poroy train station to your hotel anyway. This way, by the time you get to Cuzco, you have incrementally gone form an altitude of about 7800 (according to my phone App.) Ollantay is at about 9100, and Cuzco is at 11200 roughly. By the time you get to Cuzco you should be acclimated. I was one of 4 persons ranging from age 52 to 62, and we didn't experience any sickness at all. Have a Great trip.
Scenic train with excellent staff.. It was very scenic and a comfortable travel with very pleasant staff. I did not really dislike anything.

Excellent Ride. We are just back from an awesome trip to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome experience was exceptional. We took the train from Poroy to MP. If you are staying in Cusco, definitely choose the Poroy to MP service. I had initially booked from Olianta to MP - but when I realized later that we would have to travel 1.5 hours by car from Cusco to Olianta just to get to the train, i called up the PeruRail Customer service to change the start point to Poroy. they were very helpful, and after sending back a signed CC authorization, they modified the reservation to start from Poroy.The train experience itself was great. The views were magnificient and since all the coaches had open glass tops -we could see the cloud topped peaks all around us.The staff was extremely courteous, service was great. The fashion show on the return trip was great and we ended up purchasing a baby alpaca poncho, as the friendly attendant demonstrated more than 7 ways of wearing the same alpaca outfit.As they say in their advertising blurb, the Machu Pichhu experience indeed starts from the point we board the train!

Memorable trip!. What a better way than a Peruvian train to link Aguas Calientes and Cusco? It's a unique experience transporting you to different and amazing landscapes. The music and the food served during the trip participate to the atmosphere, as well as the staff on the way back when they present local clothes as a fashion show on the way back. Thanks to Carina, Paulo Vega and Rony for this memorable experience!!!

A slow comfortable trip. After walking the inca trail for 4 days this was a nice treat. A small meal was provided and some entertainment - a surprise fashion show. It's a 3.5 hour trip to cover approx 90 km though so don't be in a hurry.
Best ride to Machu Picchu. Make sure you get in the "A" car. A fashion show, dancing, and dinner served. The ride through the mountains was beautiful. Comfortable and lots of big windows.
Great way to get around.... The train is a great way to get around in Peru and the seating is very comfortable. A snack and tea/soft drinks are included. Wonderful views!
Stunning scenery. Really enjoyed the ride to Aguias Callientas on the Vistadome. The scenery was spectacular and ever changing.

Scenic. A lot better than expected. The train is clean and with plenty of windows to look out. They also give you a snack and drinks. Only downside is that you can only take a backpack and a hand luggage-size pack or trolley, so we had to leave our suitcase behind in ollantayambo and buy a smaller bag just for those few days.
Amazing views during the entire route.. The views were amazing during the entire trip. And the opportunity to view local communities was interesting.

Vistadome. We paid $17 per person and had our Expedition tickets upgraded. It's much roomier and more comfortable than Expedition. They serve a drink and sandwich for lunch. And they have some silly dance show popular with some passengers. Also there's a fashion show of sorts as they try to sell you some alpaca things

Enjoyable journey to Machu Picchu. The train is very comfortable with large windows for maximum enjoyment of the scenic views. We had an extremely pleasant trip from Cusco to Machu Picchu (Aguas Caliente) and back to Cusco. We were served a snack both ways that was quite good. The return trip features a show (I won't spoil it for you) but we laughed heartily. I had some breathing issues and oxygen is available on board. The staff is first rate. I recommend!

Wonderful & Comfortable Train Ride!. We hiked the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu and I could not have imagine a better way back down from the mountain. It was VERY beautiful and the train has plenty of windows to enjoy the view. I would recommend booking first class (I think it's about $20 extra but well worth it!), the staff (Rosario, Roberto, & Blake) is excellent and you receive a delicious snack/drink. My husband and I were getting off in Ollantaytambo and Blake offered to not only help us with our luggage but also informed us when we have 10 minutes remaining. It was very helpful!-Ash & Luke
In good weather it is worth it.. Leaves from Agua Calientes around 1:30pmish and gets in at a reasonable time. In good weather it is worth it. Be prepare

Nice view, comfortable ride.. We were staying in Cusco and wanted to visit Machu Picchu. Peru Rail made that possible for us.From Cusco we took a taxi to Poroy for about 30 Soles. Peru Rail departs from the Poroy station to Aguas CalienteS and the trip took about 3 hours.Surprisingly the tip back to Cusco was slightly different. It was from Aquas Calientes to ollantaytambo which was a shorter ride of about 1-and a half hours or so. From ollantaytambo we took a van which costs only 10 soles. Think the number of vans may be limited so its best to get off the train quick.There are also taxis avalaible but may costs more.The Peru rail trains are pretty clean and they have toilets. They also Serve a light snack and drink. Tickets costs about USD 60 or so one way. I would recommend using Peru Rail.
Comfortable Traveling. Took this twice - Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and then return to Cusco. Very comfortable seats, staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
Nice train ride. We traveled up to Machau Picchu on the Vistadome. The ride was very nice as was the scenery. If you are going to Machau Picchu I highly recommend the Vistadome train.

Great train ride. While taking this comfortable train ride from Cusco to Machu Picchu, we were entertained by a few young people who worked for the train. True they were trying to sell clothing etc, indigenous to the region, but it was a soft sell and done in a very fashion-show way. Also panoramic windows for taking pictures or just enjoying the scenery and decent leg room for this tall American.

wonderful scenic ride. My group really enjoyed the Vistadome ride from Cusco to Machu Picchu. The ride back was at night....so the staff entertained us with a fashion show of Alpaca products. This was a good idea, because it was too dark to see any scenery...and the trip was approx. 3 1/2 hrs. It made the trip extra fun.

worth the extra $. Our travel package had the two different train options, and we found it was definitely worth the extra ~$20/person (I think) to upgrade to the vistadome. It was relaxing and scenic, but also worth it they give you a mini snack/meal too (nothing big, but still nice to have a cup of tea and small sandwich vs. nothing). On the way back, it was a bit hokey that they had one of their staff dress in a costume to dance around...cute if you had kids, but random if you are one of the only females in the train and they try to get you to dance with the rainbow creature with an animal face :P They also had a "fashion show" where again the poor staff there show off various alpaca wool outfits. Apparently the staff do get a commission from the sales at least. We were suckered into some of the alpaca items, where we later found them for much cheaper in shops in Cusco...however, I would say, if you see a certain color or design you like, it may be worth the extra cost to just buy it on the train. We found some of the unique scarf/poncho things they had in one store in Cusco, but didnt have the same color choices. Same with a simple camel colored scarf, they had plenty of those around Cusco, but not the exact color.

Too expensive. This is a train...basicly should bring you to the destination (Machu Picchu village (Aguas Callientes)) and back. We went in the morning and it was eeextremely slow (OK, you can enjoy the sights), some 3 1/2 hrs for aprox 100 km. On the way back we had a show, fashion show and so on. All in all, even train was going fast (like a normal train), we needed more then 4 hrs....definitely too much, especialy if you are tired after getting up at 5 o'clock and hiking to Huayna Picchu and spend all the day in Machu Picchu....and then the price of more the USD 150. Not worth, in my opinion. Sorry ; Perurail :)
Fun ride!. Baggage limits not as strictly enforced as we were led to believe. Exceptional views and the afternoon ride offered entertainment!

Worth the extra money!. Be warned, the Vistadome is not very comfortable owing to the narrow guage railway. However, the scenary more than makes up for that and this version of the train has glass in the roof as well, so that you get good views of the mountains overlooking the rail. Lovely skies and snow scenes.

Softer ride than Inca Rail!. There are now 2 rail choices between Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes: Peru Rail and Inca Rail. We have used both of these rail companies. Peru Rail has a nice website in English where you can check schedule, fare and purchase tickets online. However, it's peculiar that my first attempt to buy Peru Rail tickets online was successful - yet the second attempt a few minutes later failed - the same credit card that was accepted on the first purchase was declined for the second try. Peru Rail did follow up with an email within 24 hours to instruct me to fax my credit card information to complete the purchase. If you prefer to buy your ticket in person, there are several Peru Rail (as well as Inca Rail) ticket locations in Lima (including the airport), Cusco and elsewhere in Peru. The staff at these places are English-speaking and friendly - albeit slow (typical!)The Peru Rail cars seem to be more modern - and they ride noticeably softer than the Inca Rail cars. Since they use the same railroad, the difference must be due to better suspension on the Peru Rail cars. Other than that, the service are of similar quality (very good) on both rails. The both offer some snack on beverage during the ride. One recommendation: when you purchase your tickets, make sure you ask for forward-facing seats!! This is important if you are susceptible to motion sickness - or if you want to take photos. Also, if possible travel during daylight hours - so you can see the beautiful mountains. The fare on Peru Rail is more than that on the Inca Rail - check both if you travel on a budget.

The only train to take to Machu Picchu!. You can really see the countryside and mountains from this train! It's very clean and comfortable and has toilets onboard. They serve snacks and on the way back from Machu Picchu they have a "fashion show" and entertainment and sell clothes! I loved it.

On Vistadome to Macchu Picchu and back. We really enjoyed our trip on VistaDome. the trip to Aguas Calientes was so beautiful and we could take pictures from our seat. The food was excellent...snack and drinks. The seats were luxurious with room for our packs and bag. We took only one bag as we were told space was limited but there was room. However it was easier to deal with one case. On the way back we enjoyed talking to a British couple, sharing a bottle of wine and playing games. It was so relaxing and the food was really a surprise...very tasty. We also loved the comfort and efficiency. And I want to mention our staff who were very friendly, helpful, and fun! We enjoyed the show that Zulca Luna, Cesar and Diego put on. They were gracious and attentive. Many thanks for a great journey.

Seemed to have cut back. This was my second experience with Perurail between Cuzco and Agua Caliente. On the return from Agua Caliente, I felt like we had less service. I did not think that our vegetarian empanada was so great. Two years ago we had a bar service before the meal. Leaving at 15:30hrs, no need to rush with food. Service was still good, but just felt like there was a cut back. Still a good way to go to Macha Picchu from Poroy.
Expensive. The tickets are expensive. Unfortunately it rained when we took the vistadome, so we could not enjoy the views. You receive a snack and a drink, but we found the tickets too expensive.
Great train to take to Machu Picchu. Pleasantly surprised with the breakfast/dinner snacks that were offered. There was some entertainment too! Comfy way to get to the ruins.

Flashy way to pass the time. That's all.. Through our tour company we paid 50USD more for a one way Vista Dome which was hardly worth it. Though I think Peru Rail only charges 14USD more which might be worth it. I found the Vistadome to be slightly cleaner and less cramped than the Expedition cars though not by much. Expedition cars also had great viewing out the windows. The food served on Vistadome was not a full meal - it was about half a meal (1 small empenada, 6 gooseberries, a small cookie, chulpi), see the photo I attached. You'd still want to eat another meal before or after the ride. The whole ride seemed like a ridiculous show to get you to buy Peru Rail items for sale (shawls, vests, coats, etc) though it does pass the time.

Nice comfy ride. The ride on the train is very pleasant, just a bit too long for me.Staff is very courteous and multilingual. Breakfast and dinner snacks are provided already included in the ticket price. My favorite part was the 'zigzag' zone when the train descends about 40 mts by moving back & forth in a zigzag quite ingenuous.My least favorite part was on the ride back, when we all are tired after a very long day and the train staff performs some dances (with very loud music) and a "runaway" show showcasing Peru's textiles made of local Llamas/ Alpacas. May be better to move the show for the ride going in when people is awake and may be a very good distraction to make time go fast.
Great Trail Ride. Just a really scenic ride, breathtaking panoramas, Nice way to exit Macchu Picchu. ( Agues Cailenties)

Beautiful!. You are on your way to one of the most fantastic sites in the world. This train ride will start that adventure the right way! Awesome staff, wonderful seating, beautiful views from the windows and excitement building! This is the way to go!!
Nice way to travel to Machu Picchu. The trip was enjoyable. I guess I did not read the fine print because I was surprised by the breakfast and dinner served each way (small portions but satisfying)
Super fun ride!. We loved taking the train to Aguas Calientes. We enjoyed the ride and the fashion show. All very tidy, clean and comfortable.

Very pleasant experience-Vistadome from/to Cusco and Machu Picchu. The trip from Cusco and return to Cusco were on time and very comfortable. The snacks were quite nice. The service personnel in our coach were professional, poised, and personable. Their ability to speak English was a plus for us. The 'surprise' on the return trip to Cusco was fantastic! Our car's service staff were exceptional: Veronica, Daysaku, and Osmoi.p.s. The English translation of this survey is TERRIBLE and several of the question make no sense given this review was of a train trip. Also, the error message says correct this items in red--there was only one and I corrected that MANY, MANY TIMES and still got the message! Please correct this.

DO NOT participate in fashion show. I was traveling with a friend and the attendants chose her as a volunteer for the fashion show. The male worker, (either Juan or Cesar - we didn't get the exact name), attempted to sexually assault her when she went back stage. It obviously goes without saying we'd never recommend this company to anyone.

Vistadome is the way to travel to Aguas Calientes but is too long and boring. We took the train in Poroy all the way to Aguas Calientes. Even though the train is nice and the seats are comfortable, the last hour and a half they seemed to have turned off the air conditioner and the train became a sauna. We were melting! Breakfast was nice: fruit, pancakes with elderberry sauce, coffee, natural juices. If they had not turned off the air conditioner it would have been a perfect trip.

Nice train trip from Machu Picchu. Took the Vistadome back from the town of Aguas Calientes after spending the day at Machu Picchu. It was an upgrade from the Explorer train we rode first . Good panoramic views from the ample windows on the train. I enjoyed the fashion show on board, and actually purchased a few things ! Overall it was worth the extra money.

Great service, comfortable, fun. The train has a fashion show heading from Aguas Caleintes to Cusco. The attendants model clothes and even get some volunteers from the passengers to walk the aisle as well. They serve drinks and heavy appetizers on each ride. It is nice to take it during the day because you can look up and see the mountains pass you by as you ride down through the sacred valley. If you can afford it, it is worth considering for sure!

Nice ride, but touristy. The train itself is nice - big windows, comfortable seats, decent snack served. BUT, the conductors put on a ridiculous dance and fashion show to hawk their touristy goods, complete with extremely loud music. Kind of ruins the peaceful scenic ride we were trying to enjoy

A disappointed ride to Machu Picchu. I had been looking forward to our train trip on the Vistadome from Poroy to Machu Picchu. I was disappointed at first as we had to share a four top table with another couple. I got over that quckly BUT found the space VERY TIGHT and uncomfortable. The seats were too close together. Then the man across from me, kept his feet over the halfway point so I couldn't even put both of my feet flat on the floor-not fun for 3.5 hours. Also on the ride up we had multiple hard stops and clanking-sometimes throwing the passengers off a bit. I could not wait to get off this train. When it was time for our return, I changed to the shorter route to Ollantyambo-only 1.5 hours-again, miserable, but for a shorter period of time. So glad we that as we took a taxi back to Cusco and were able to really see the Ururumba valley-which we couldn't really see on the train.Not to sound like a complainer-but my husband and I LOVE train travel normally-so we are experienced train travelers.

Excellent service, loved the fashion show. This train was the best I've ever been on, and I have travelled on the trains in Europe, USA and Canada. The windows on the roof make it easy to enjoy the views of the mountains, valleys and rivers. The best part of the train ride was on the return leg where the attendants put on a fashion show. There was even dancing at one point and this came as a surprise to me. I really enjoyed the warmth and hospitality shown by the Vistadome staff.

Not worth it. It's a nice idea but they are really just dressing up a train ride by adding an old Incan dance and fashion show (sound cooler than they were) and some snacks. Not worth the money (it's pretty expensive)Also if you are looking to get a nice nap in after a long day at Machu Picchu and even huayna Picchu, don't take this. Very loud with the dancing music and showS

Beautiful ride. As far as chair comfort in comparison to the Expedition, it is just slightly more comfortable. Also you get a meal rather than just a snack. The scenery is the same though so when it comes to choosing which one, it just depends on if you want the cheaper, average ride or a little more expensive and above average ride.

Cute railway. I was pleasantly surprised when we rode the Perurail to Machu Pichu. We had a small snack served and it was done in first class style although we had a coach ticket. When I read earlier bout buying the ticket beforehand. I found we really didn't need to since we could purchase it in the Lima airport. And although we got our ticket 9 months in advance. My sons friend got his then and it was the same price. Finally the ride back came with the crew putting on a costume and then a fashion show. Very entertaining.

Very friendly and hospitable. Wonderful view from the rail. Had a very nice meal on the train. On our way back from aguas calientes they even had a fashion show on the train. Never seen that kind of entertainment on a train. Very peculiar and wonderful service
amazing service¡. i took the train back to cusco from machu picchu, even is expensive ,it worth it,service,view,etc made it priceless ¡

The Way to Machu Picchu. Since PeruRail is the only way to Machu Picchu, it's nice to know that it's a beautiful pleasant ride. Not always on-time, but one can count on the scenery, nice clean equipment, and a crew anxious to please!

Comfy, beautiful view and entertainment. The seats are comfortable, and the view is incredible. The windows in the ceiling are really worth it. Also, on the way back, if you take a late train (after 4-5) there will be night, and the scenery will miss. But they have an entertainment show. There will be a masked man dancing, and also taking woman to dance (i was one of them). After, they will present their clothes collection, and in the end, you can buy if you wish. Best way to travel to Machu Picchu.
Nice train experience. Good foods and funny performance. First time been to a train with performance actually. Thank you Blake for the nice photos!

Great views! And a fashion show?. We took the Vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, and then 2 days later trained back from Aguas Calientes to Cusco (or actually to a town just outside Cusco, but that's as close as you can get). It is not cheap, but I think it's worth the upgrade from one of the other trains. The windows in the ceiling allow for amazing views of the Andes on the way, hence the name Vistadome. It was a smooth and relaxing trip, with comfortable seats, decent bathroom, and pleasant crew. They served us snacks and beverages on the way, and played some pretty killer pan flute music to get us pumped for Machu Picchu.On the way back, maybe because it was a longer train ride, the crew put on an alpaca clothing fashion show. It was hilarious, they used the aisle as a runway and really werked it. Of course the purpose was to get you to buy some of the clothing, but it wasn't high pressure and did serve to entertain us for 20 minutes or so. Then another crew member dressed up as a Peruvian folk character and danced around, taking pictures with everyone. Again, unexpected and entertaining. One thing to note - there is no luggage storage on some of the trains except for what you can fit under your seat. On the train back, there was just a little area at the front of your cabin.
