So we packed small duffle bags or backpacks for just the 2 days, and left our big luggage back in Ollantaytambo for our travel company to transpo for us back to Cusco.

A GREAT WAY TO GET TO ONE OF THE WONDERS OF THE WORLD, MACHU PICCHU. This train takes you from Cuzco to Aguas Calientes, next to Machu Picchu. The glassed roof allows you to see the beautiful landscape throughout the route. the staff is very helpful and they share tips about the places you're going thru. On the way back, they sell local crafts by modeling them (sweaters, scarfs etc). They even chose me to be a model, a superfun experience. Totally recommended

Relaxed ride to Machu Piccu. We enjoyed the lovely train ride to Machu Picchu. The staff were friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed the coffee and sandwiches for our morning ride, similar servings for our return ride. We were able to sit back and enjoy the views of the countryside. It was a welcomed, very pleasant and relaxing ride, after climbing through Machu Picchu all morning and afternoon.
Great train experience. When from Urubama to Aquas Calientes and back. Jerson was a wonderful employee and provided us with very helpful local tips.

Fun and Comfortable. We took the Vistadome round trip to Machu Picchu and it was a lovely experience. The views on the way to MP were incredible. The staff was attentive and we were surpised that food was served onboard. On the return there was entertainment (thank you, Blake) that was centered around the local culture and a fashion show. Fun, entertaining, and comfortable.

Fun trip to Machu Pichu!. We opted for the dome train to get to Machu Pichu. We are so glad we did!! The view is spectacular! There are many ruins to see along the way. The staff of the train keeps you entertained with selling clothing, a fashion show, dancing and more! They serve a snack both on the way up[ & back along with soda/juice/water or coca tea. I would highly recommend this train!

What a great way to see the mountains!. Great way to see mountains and enjoy the view on the way to Machu Picchu. Don't miss the view of the snow capped mountains in the distance. I loved it. One quick note is though is, sometimes train stops waiting for another train to pass by. When train stops, kids might rush toward the train waving at passengers. Please refrain from throwing snacks or food at the kids from the train. If you truly care, please find a proper way to give back. They should be helped to keep their own dignity.

Good service, great views.. We took the train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes and back again. The train was clean and comfortable and the servers were friendly. The views from the train were fantastic! The only downside for me was there was not a vegetarian option for the meals. (This may have changed since we went). What I could eat was good, but if you're a vegetarian or vegan you may want to pack a snack.

a really fun interesting train journey. we took the vistadome from urubamba to machu pichu then returned to Cuzco. The train is very comfortable and clean. lovely views. snacks & drinks provided. lots of space for luggage , we were told only hand luggage but others had more. the staff were really fun! They served food & snacks with a smmile then on the way back did a really zany fashion show. so funny lots of music and laughter & audience participation!
Fun great view. I was served a delicious snack / meal. Then we were entertained by the staff and a character from an old story. Music a fun. Take a train so you can see the view.

Great journey. We went up to Machu Picchu by Vistadome and back by Hiram Bingham. The Vistadome provides great views and the 6.40 am train got us to the site in plenty of time to have a day exploring. I was not expecting a breakfast served on the train and hot beverages, with real silverware and china dishes. That was a pleasant surprise. Really enjoyable ride.

Wow! Wow!!!! Loved the experience.. What an awesome ride to Machu Picchu!!! Our trip was extremely pleasant and without any incidents. The service was beyond words! From the moment you sit, very early in the morning you are greeted with smiling happy faces, from there on there is breakfast serve and a full ride of just watching the beautiful country side!! Upon our turn to Cusco, okay outside of Cusco much more surprises in stored!! Love the people do Peru Rail!!!

Long delays. I had the worst transit experience of my life on PeruRail. To get to Machu Pichu you have to either hike or take the train, and PeruRail is the primary train option.Our 1.5 hour train ride from Aguas Calientes (Machu Pichu) to Ollanta took nearly 5 hours. We were stuck on the train in the station for 2+ hours with no information about what was happening. Once the train finally started moving it stopped three separate times on the route that totaled about an hour. The staff provided no updates about what was happening. Of course everyone has delays on planes and trains but the lack of information was inexcusable. Passengers should have been afforded the opportunity to disembark given that the train sat at the initial station for 2 hours.
Highly recommend. The trains were comfortable and well staffed. Train stations were large and comfortable. I would recommend getting tickets in advance of your trip.
Nice crew. The crew made us feel like part of the family. Delicious snacks and lovely performance of the crew during the trip. With music and shopping.

Vistadome; do not miss this ride!. Took Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Poroy after my 4d/3n Inka Trek! The ride was very smooth and the seats comfortable. The glass dome and the large picture windows afforded me some fabulous sceneries when I wasn't napping. The food was very good. There was entertainment as well as a fashion show. The staff was excellent!

Peru Rail is Wonderful!!. We arrived at Ollantaytambo station at 7:40 for a 7:30 train departure due to a hiccup in our schedule. Sergio, our Condor Travel rep made several phone calls and with the help of Alfredo del Castillo, one of the Peru Rail supervisors, we were whisked onto the 8 a.m. train (we were able to get seats due to a no-show) and on our way to Aguas Calientes. We had barely pulled out of the station and were being served a hot cup of Peruvian coffee and a light breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The train was immaculate, the ride most enjoyable and the washrooms were also very clean. I have not had the privilege of travelling on European railways but have travelled extensively on Canadian railways in their day. Peru Rail and their Vistadome cars are a wonderful way to view the area as you travel to visit Machu Picchu. This is a 90 minute trip and worth every minute on board. I appreciated that they sold some souvenirs on board as at no other time did I find bandanas on my trip in the two weeks we were in Peru. I also enjoyed the show and seeing Moche on the return trip two days later. At no time did I feel obligated to purchase anything on board and the staff were all extremely polite and represented their company and their country very well. Thank you Peru Rail for adding to my fabulous vacation in Peru.

Took from Ollytaytambo to Aquas Calientes.. Highly recommend the Vista dome. The scenery is fabulous and one can only enjoy the peaks well through the dome version train. (If mealtime: bring your own food,the food service is not good. the total lunch was a dry roll w/ thin salami).
Great ride.. Smooth ride. You get a great luxury view of the mountains as you travel into Machu Picchu. Bring your camera on the ride, you will want it.

Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu the fun way. A great way to travel, enjoy and absorb unique, terrific, special environment. This is substantially less money than the other high end option. Get ready for a sales pitch both ways on the train though.

Very pleasant trip. The vistadome is very comfortable, the staff is very kind and it offers spectacular sceneries. When it arrives near Matchu Picchu, the view are different and teh Urubamba river is near teh train for most part of the trip.

Punctual, entertaining. The Vistadome was a really fun way to ride through the Andes. The views are great and the staff makes the journey go by quickly. You are served a little snack, there is a bit of entertaining dancing by a man in costume, and a little 'fashion show' by the staff displaying some Andean wares for sale. I found it to be adorable rather than overbearing; the staff seemed to really enjoy it and there was no pressure to buy anything. The seats on the train face each other in groups of four- keep in mind if you'd like to sit across from your companion instead of next to them. The train departed and arrived on time.

Take the cheapest train. Ive been to Machu Picchu a number of times.Train prices vary depending on the time of day. Inca Rail or Peru Rail ?? at the end of the day Id choose on price.The view from the train is ok but as someone said..its not Switzerland.Basically all its about is getting to Agua Calientes ..
This is the way to cruise.. Catch the train at Ollantaytambo and head into the valley. Lovely trip, glass ceilings, a riiver that runs next to the track and very efficient Peru Rail. Buy the hat!

Perurail. Quite the experience, not only did we enjoy the magnificent vista, but we were fed and entertained as well. There was a wide variety of handmade local items for sale on the train too! Very enjoyable!

What a great way to travel! We love Oscar. Took the train back towards Cusco after our Salkantay trek. After a long day at Machu Picchu, the train - with it's comfortable seats, snacks and cold beer - was a welcome respite. The fashion show, dancing and smiles were an added bonus. We had Oscar, our conductor, on the previous day's train ride from Hydro MP, and it was fun to see him in the fashion show. He is a good egg and didn't take himself too seriously... which just made the show that much more fun.The airlines should consider doing this kind of stuff! brings people together.

Comfortable ride. Don't expect too much for the view from train. There is no comparison between this train and othe scenic train such as the one in Switzerland. Other than that, this train is very comfortable way to go to Machu Pichu. It is clean, reliable and punctual. Also conductors are very friendly and attentive. On the way back, there is "fashion show", which I enjoyed.

Very nice!. This train is comfortable and the service is great. They serve a yummy breakfast and even bring out the linens. Great service! The views in the mountains are fabulous. It helps to sit facing forward for better views so try to ask about this when purchasing your ticket. My neck was strained because I didn't want to miss a thing and I was seated facing backwards. I loved the countryside and seeing how people live on the way to Aguas Calientes. The river was gorgeous and flowing fast. On the way back to Ollantaytambo, the servers put on an entertaining fashion show. If you show interest, though, they will focus on you and try to push their sales harder. Otherwise, watch with ambivalence.

Relaxing ride with great crew. We took the train from Ollantambyo to MP then back to Poroy the next day.It has great scenary. The morning ride consist of breakfast sandwich with a drink/fruit. The next day we took the afternoon train and there was gooseberry with a vegetarian pastry. When it starts to get dark, the crew started a fashion show featuring Sol brand alpaca wear and some entertainment. Particular thanks to Oddia, Cesar, and Manuel for making the return trip enjoyable. I'm not sure if I would recommend buying the Sol brand stuff on the train as we found that it was at least 10% more expensive.

A Most Interesting & Entertaining Journey. We had to take Peru Rail from Olliyatambo to Agua Calientes for our visit to Machu Picchu and do a return leg to Ponoy Station in Cusco after our visit.The onward leg was done during the day and the sometimes even spectacular.views en-route were very interesting and sometimes spectacular. The fact that our carriage had sun-roof made the viewing even more enjoyable.During the return leg to Cusco at night we were suitably entertained by a fashion show. Most exciting and enjoyable. My congratulations to Peru Rail for keeping the passengers suitably entertained during what could be a rather boring trip back to Cusco

Great train, unsettling entertainment. We took the Vistadome from Cusco (Poroy) to Machu Picchu and back. The ride out was great - attentive service and amazing scenery, plus really comfy seats and the opportunity to chat to fellow passengers if that's your thing. The breakfast was nice too.The way back was ok until the 'entertainment' started. We found the whole thing a bit much. The traditional folklore character was really creepy (judging by my photos, everyone else in the carriage felt the same) and we thought the fashion show was all just a little awkward, for both passengers and the staff. You really are a captive audience on the train and whilst it wasn't a particularly hard sell, we just found it all a little uncomfortable.I'd still recommend doing the journey as the pluses by far outweigh the negatives, but just be prepared for the return journey to be a little weird.Oh and bring headphones - the 3 pan pipe songs on repeat start to get tired after the second hour :o)

Nice Train Ride. The is a very well appointed service. The views are spectacular and you see many Incan ruins along the way. We even saw hikers on the Inca Trail.They provide a food service. On the way up, they provided a light meal and drink. Beware, if they run out of your drink choice, they don't have more, like on an airline. They don't offer a lot of choice for drinks either. On the way to Macchu Picchu, they sell souvenirs like guide books and travel vests. On the way back, they have a fashion show and sell alpaca clothing.

Clean train with great views and good service at an affordable price. My husband and I took the Vistadome train from Poroy to Machu Picchu and the Hiram Bingham train from Machu Picchu to Poroy (see separate review of Hiram Bingham).This is advertised as a more affordable option but it is still relatively luxurious. The train is pretty much like any UK long-distance train. It was clean (didn’t check out the toilet, though), the ‘snacks’ served on board turned out to be a tasty breakfast with a greater level of service and attention to detail than I had expected and the views were just gorgeous. They played Andean pan pipe music throughout the trip. My husband, who was trying to sleep, found it annoying but I thought it contributed to the atmosphere and was a great addition.We took the Hiram Bingham train back in the evening from Machu Picchu and of the two options, I thought the Vistadome train was definitely much better value for money. If you want to try both options, I would take the Vistadome to Machu Picchu in the morning and the Hiram Bingham back to Poroy in the evening since the Vistadome had much bigger windows (also up in the ceiling) so it would provide a better view since it will be pitch black once you start your trip back to Poroy. Also, the Hiram Bingham train has a lot of drinks that are included in the price and I felt that it was nicer to enjoy those on the way back than to arrive to Machu Picchu completely hammered. The Vistadome train was also quieter and did not rock back and forth at all as much as the Hiram Bingham train did (this might partly also have been due to it being dark outside). I had to take a seasickness pill on the Hiram Bingham train because I got nauseous (and this was before the alcohol!) whereas I had no issues on the Vistadome (and I get motion sickness relatively easily).

A fun and unexpected experience. Enjoyed the trip on the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes back to Poroy! The train is very clean and modern.. the seats are quite comfortable. Four seats share a table, so unless you have four people, you will be pared up with others.. a nice way to make new friends. We took the evening train back to Poroy, so lost the light a bit into the trip.. I would have enjoyed watching the river the whole way back. Instead, we were given a nice snack.. I'm not sure I'd call it a meal.. there were corn crunchies (popular in Peru), as well as raw gooseberries (delicious!), a vegetable empanada and a really yummy short bread sort of desert. Not a huge meal, but enough for a decent snack.After our meal we were treated to a fashion show for one of the Alpaca clothing companies. The stuff was quite nice and the models (the train personnel) looked like they were having a good time. Unfortunately the products they were showing are ridiculously expensive, but it was still quite nice and a good diversion.Then they put the lights out and this crazy character came through the car, dancing with passengers and just being crazy... it was quite funny.The Vistadome is certainly nicer and much more comfortable than the backpacker train, and worth the cost to take it in the day, when you can see everything. The evening trip was enjoyable, but you don't see much of the countryside.

Wear a hat during the day!. We boarded the Vistadome in Poroy. Poroy is about a 20 minutes from Cusco. The train ride from Poroy to Aguas Calientes is 3.5 hours. This is the slowest train I've ever been on. But The seats are comfortable. they serve a small snack and a drink.Before you enter the train you must show your ticket with your passport. Your luggage is loaded on by the staff in the same car that you are in. Once you arrive at your destination your luggage is unloaded by the staff and placed on the platform for you to grab. We were in car A and the exhaust from the front of the train kept coming in. It was pretty nasty. The other annoying thing is that the horn is sounded every 5 minutes. There's a lot of people that walk along the tracks and that's the reason for sounding the horn so much. Annoying!The sun shines right through the vistadome so wear a hat if you are sensitive to the sun. Despite some of the cons this is still the best way to get to machu picchu.

Fun way to travel back from Machu Picchu. My family and I rode this train back to Ollantaytambo from Machu Picchu. We hiked the Inca Trail on the way out so it was nice to be able to enjoy the train on the way back. We found the train comfortable and enjoyed the views. After we were served a light lunch, the train staff morphed and treated us to cheesy entertainment and an alpaca fashion show with opportunity to buy. Was it touristy and a little over the top, yes, but it was also fun and made the trip pass quickly.

Nice train. Comfortable, clean and entertaining for the whole family!!! The trip from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes is 90 minutes. However, the trip back to Poroy is about 3 hrs long. You will get your money's worth.

Comfortable Return Trip from MP to Ollantaytambo. Travelled on Vistadome Train on return trip from AC as part of our 2Day/1Night Tour package to MP (from Llamapath). Scheduled by our tour company, we had went on Expedition train going and then Vistadome on our return trip. The Vistadome train employees offered a 30 min. fashion show featuring alpaca products on the return trip. I'm not sure if our tour company had booked these tickets late, but we ended up in seats apart from one another. 3 seats together and 1 solo seat elsewhere. Our teenager happily took the solo seat and was happy with it (ha, ha). Family of Four (2 adults, 2 boys ages 16 & 11). Clean bathrooms on board, and snacks and drinks offered. FYI: Some seats are arranged in groups facing one another. Since we had departed in the afternoon, I'm guessing most people were leaving after visiting MP -so, the whole car of people seemed a bit more chatty than compared to our morning train trip going to AC. The train stopped in Ollantaytambo, where we had a private taxi (arranged by tour company) waiting for us to drive back to Cusco.From what I understand by asking others (including a taxi driver)...train service does not go to Cusco, but rather passengers would need to depart from either Ollantaytambo or Poroy stations.

Perfect, fun and awe inspiring. The vistadome is the mid level of travel for the Peru rail. There is the Hiram Bingham, first, and the expedition 3rd. The vistadome has the best of all, less expensive than the HB, but great views, snacks and entertainment of the way back.

Good value, great views, worth it. The schedule fit ours the price was within our budget and the value turned out to be a good one. Food and drink are served, the views are great, seats are a little cramped but overall it was a good experience. We took the train from the Poroy station to Aguascalientes round-trip. The biggest downside was on the trip back to Poroy there was a 40 minute 'fashion show' where the staff danced up and down the aisle with loud music playing while trying to get the customers to buy relatively very expensive shirts jackets and hats. Take a movie and headphones for something to watch and enjoy the trip and the views. definitely worth it!

Best Way From Poroy to Aguascalientes stations. Most peoples travel budgets can't afford the high end Hiram Bingham train, however the Vistadome train is a great alternative. It was worth the few extra dollars to have better seats and better views than the lower priced explorer where all the backpackers jam in. The seats recline slightly and you can take a nap or snap pictures of the country side. It is a 3.5 hour ride but doesn't seem to long. Staff is professional and train was clean.

A MUST on the way to Macchu Picchu. The main difference between this and any other train is the glass panels in the ceiling. A small difference, you may think. However, it makes all the difference in the world because most of the train's journey is in a narrow river valley with towering mountains on both sides.You also get complimentary tea/coffee/snacks, but that's not really the point.

Excellent Experience. If you want to go to see the Machu Picchu it is worth and smart to use (or add) the service of the Vistadome. This is the section of the train where you can have breakfast and late snack, show and music. It is very relaxing and comfortable. The service is good with clean area and clean restrooms.

Great train to machu picchu!. We took the early train and this fit in our schedule. We were so glad it did. The views were amazing and the food service was first class. We took a different train back and it didn't have the dining service. It was a really nice way to start an early day.

Fantastic views. We travelled on the early morning Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguascalientes and back again in the afternoon two days later. The train is very comfortable and the huge windows provide all-round views of the most beautiful scenery. The staff were friendly and efficient, serving food and drinks on a moving train with skill! We were fortunate that the train was not overly-crowded on either journey and so the experience was totally pleasant. Later in our visit we travelled on the Andean Explorer and personally I felt that the scenery on this Vistadome journey was much more spectacular.

Entertainment while you travel. We wish we could bring back the staff of the Vistadome to the US for train travel.....they dress so professionally, serve a snack and then entertained us all with a fashion show of alpaca wool goods that had audience participation and quite a lot of enthusiastic support. Shout out to Wendy, Carlos Ruben and Edgar for making this an experience of a lifetime!

Great way to do the MP trip from Cusco. We enjoyed our day excursion from Cusco to Machu Picchu travelling there and back on the Vistadome train. Comfortable seats, good service and entertaining trip home. I am not sure this is a daily occurrence or whether we were lucky... but I wont spoil the surprise!!
Very nice trip!. Great view from the vistadome, especially when having the back seats that can be turned around to have the back window view!

Great view from Poroy to Aguascalientes. Great view to enjoy and for picture taken when we took Vistadome 31 from Poroy to Aguascalientes, the breakfast was regular but the service was very nice.The staffs even tried to accommodate some passanger's requests to be seated together with their Family, including us. The way back to Poroy we took Vistadome 604, it was raining that evening so we almost see nothing on the window view and then getting darker. So Vistadome provided a Fashion show and dancing with quite loud music. Before the fashion show, the dinner was served, I asked for a glass of water and as soon as I finished it, I requested the second glass of water, and the staff ( Erick Leonel) replied, "We have no more water" while showing me the empty bottle so it's fine for me but then he moved to the next row to serve, and the gentlemen asked for water for their drink. So Erick told them that he will bring water in a few minutes, so he ran by himself to get the new bottle of water. My Husband saw that there was still water available, so he asked Erick to serve him and me a glass of water each of us. He was not happy about it.

Take the Vistadome train..... it is the best!. We took the Voistadome Train on our way from Cuzco to Machu Piccu and back to Cuzco again. The distance between these tos towns is aprox 55 miles and it is a 3.5 to 4 hour trip as the train goes around the mountains and by the river wich offers a beutiful scenic trip. This train has winodws also in the ceiling so you can see better and take nice pictures. Plan to take jacket early in the morning and late in the afternoon, but forget about it once you are in Machu Piccu. Don't worry, you can leave your bags in a storage location in the rail station for just 3 dollars.They will serve a nice complementary breakfast in the morning as well as coca tea and other drinks. In the way back in the afternoon, they serve complementary snacks and drinks; but also there is a tipical show and pasarella in every wagon of the train where they present and sell different clothings mostly made from Baby Alpaca. Feel free to buy if you like, we bough several clothes and tan compared the prices in Cuzco town and there was no difference at all.So seat back, relax, and enjoy the ride!
First Class with a view!. This is the way to go! First class service, the views were astounding! And even entertainment, Peru style on the way back to the Sacred Valley.
Lovely train. This is an amazing trip. The train is lovely. Very comfortable and nice. And the view on the ride is incredible. To die for. Love it. Definitely would do it again.

Just Perfect. We started our adventure in the Vista Dome in Ollantaytambo with final destination Aguas Calientes. Our experience was very good, the train was pretty comfortable and gave us excellent views of the sacred valley, the service a board was very friendly we got snacks and drinks, and we even bought a souvenir. The only negative point is that we find the prices very high, and is a shame because many people wanna go to machu picchu and some just have to do the inka trail walking because is just out of the question to take the train.For the ones who can afford it just do it , it's great.

Fashion Show, Costumes & Great views. The views from the train were fantastic! Also we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food It was not gourmet dining, but definitely better quality than U.S. airplane food. On the trip back to Cusco they had a fashion show and a dressed up character that made the trip back to Cusco seem very quick.

Ryanair on rails. Crowded, noisy, commercial. If we had known, we would have gone for the backpacker option. We were unfortunate to be given backward seats and no way to change them as every seat was booked. After some snacks they started a show of ponchos and sweaters, very noisy and obtrusive the whole thing. We did not enjoy it and would have preferred a simple train ride without "entertainment".

Enjoyed the views. We traveled from Ollantaytambo station in Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu during the morning (2.5 hours) and then back to Poroy station in Cusco (4 hours) the next afternoon. The Vistadome train rides in both directions provided outstanding views of the river and mountains. The Vistadome's large windows on both sides and overhead enabled us to absorb the panoramic views. It was very interesting to observe the transition from the more arid region around Ollantaytambo to the beginning of the jungle near Machu Picchu in such a short distance. We also enjoyed observing the locals in their daily activities and farming as we rode along. The train staff were very friendly and service oriented. They provided drinks and snacks on both trips. The train ride was comfortable and a great way to travel to Machu Picchu.

Gracias for the lovely train ride to and from Machu Picchu with Wilgert, Rony, and Maritza. We took the train from Cuscos to and from Machu Picchu with Go Ahead Tours via Condor Travels recently. Many thanks to Wilbert, Rony, and Maritza who helped us purchase baby llama jackets, sweaters, and scarves on our trip from Machu Picchu on the Harold Bingham train. We had a wonderful time and it was very enjoyable. We loved the fashion show and bought quite a few lovely ítems. The service was outstanding in all aspects.. Please send our thanks to Wilbert, Rony, and Maritza who did the fashion show and helped us purchase presents for our families and wonderful things for souveniers. Warmest regards, Deb KimJeff KimMartha SmithBecca KingJim

Great train ride!. Great service ( Milagros, Sergio and Ceson were very attentive and friendly)and a comfortable ride to Machu Picchu.I always take the Vistadome when I travel to MP.Ride home is fantastic and fun!

Great ride back to Cusco. My partner and I along with my Mum and Dad caught PeruRail back to Cusco after finishing the 4 day inca trek to Machu Picchu. We had paid for the upgrade through the company we booked the trek with and had a great trip back.The train was very comfortable and had plenty of space, also the food was great.What we didn't realise was that we were also getting entertainment which was fun, with dancing up the isles. Before the fashion show, with the llama products available to purchase. Thanks again it was very relaxing after a hard 4 days.

Went on this to Macchu Pittcu. On my bucket list I have included a great train journey and I have used this as one to include on my list the other on this tour to lake Titicaca both wonderful experiences

Sacred Valley and Machu Pichu. The vistadome is an excellent option for getting to Machu Pichu. Actually there are only two options, the train or the 4 day Inka trail. For the money, this is your best best. We received a nice snack with beverages on the trip to Machu Pichu and a very good dinner with beverages for the return. On the return the train staff also presented a fashion show.

Over rated and overpriced. Take the Vista-dome train for the hour and one half trip to Agua Calientes. You get a meal and entertainment and a fashion show too if drive from Cusco (Poroy train station) and the views are wonderful. Save your money. If you want a special trip take the ten hour Andean express from Puno to Cusco. The scenery and local connection is worth the trip.

The Way to Go to Machu Picchu. There is no getting around the fact that there are limited venues available to get you to Machu Picchu. With that in mind, PeruRail's Vistadome is one of the best, most comfortable, and most imaginative options with the most hard working and considerate staff. This is a four hour ride each way and the trains are always full, so these employees go above and beyond patience and maintaining a positive attitude. PeruRail has a less expensive option, and also has a train that costs as much as a five star hotel, but just like Goldilocks, this one is just right.

La vista es bello y los que trabajan alli son super nice!!!!!. What a great experience!!! The attention , the food, drinks and entertainment were excellent !! It was great to have met some amazing people too , especially some that work on the train , Rosario, Alexander and Franks..

Great scenic trip. I did the trail so only caught the train back.very nice comfortable and relaxing ride. Good to see the mountain range from a different perspective. Professional and efficient company

very nice treat. The train was a nice relaxing treat...slow enough to sight see and get a idea of the terrain. Take a daylight train and make sure you check about luggage.....my train you were allowed 1 bag

One of the most horrific experiences of my life.. I was so excited to take this train ride. Vistadome. Just sounds cool doesn't it? Windows at every angle for full sight of the incredible views? In one word...? HORRIBLE. Not only is this a nearly 4 hour train ride (each way) leaving from Cusco at an unGodly hour in the morning, it is expensive, the employees are not friendly, if you aren't lucky you could be sitting BACKWARDS the whole way, and if you have even the TEENIEST propensity towards motion sickness this train ride will be a living nightmare for you. They play this horrid cheesy Peruvian music at the same volume as a club (at 6 IN THE MORNING??), and the best part you ask?? The train JERKS from side to side SO VIOLENTLY that your drinks and belongings will fly off the table in front of you. This is like a roller coaster ride from the depths of darkness. WHAT KIND OF TRAIN SWINGS FROM SIDE TO SIDE? FOR THE ENTIRE RIDE? The guy across from us got scalded with hot coffee as the waiter slipped and knocked over his coffee cup after the train THRUST him about as if he were a rag doll. They served food and drinks but I was so sick I couldn't even look at it. After arriving into Aguas Calientes my entire body was vibrating. Even with a double dose of Meclizine I felt awful! Then...I got to get on a bus for another 25 minutes up the side of a mountain around hair pin curves, on a road only wide enough for one vehicle and having to pull over to let other busses pass. FUNNNN! Finally...to top it off, after a completely ANTI-climactic experience at Machu Picchu, the train ride home was even WORSE, if you can believe it. Same deafening music but NOW they had people dressed up in costumes like Peruvian folklore characters RUNNING UP AND DOWN THE AISLES SCREAMING and getting in people's faces. All the while, they had a fashion show of insanely overpriced clothing and goods that they were aggressively trying to push on to everyone. I was nearly hysterical by this time. I just pulled my hood over my head and prayed for it to be over. I have never experienced anything quite like this in all the travels of my life. I wouldn't do this again for a million dollars. Horrific experience.
excellent. travel daytimefood and refreshment servedbring cameracomfortable seatsair conditionningplace to bring bigger baggage onboard
Not truly a luxury train, just average. The views are great from the windows, the train is average, not luxurious and the sandwiches included were very average, homemade

great train- lovely views. Very enjoyable. Served a nice light meal. Entertainment on the way back was a bit overwhelming. I actually liked the modeling of very expensive clothing but the dancing was a bit embarrassing.

No heat on the train. The morning departure was MISERABLE. There was NO heat. It was in the 30s outside. The windows were full of condensation from the temperatures making it impossible to see anything. The snack was COLD and they had no beverages left when they reached us. As a seller of travel for the past 21 years, I probably would not use this train again or at least warn my customers of the challenges.

I thought I was going to pass out. DO NOT SIT IN THE FIRST CAR!! We sat in the first car and the diesel fumes and smell were overwhelming and I got very sick. When the train finally stopped (hours later) the very accommodating staff let me move to the second car. It was better but not great. I would have given the train a one star if it wasn't for the lovely staff and the comfortable seating.

A very scenic train ride through a beautiful valley, with snacks and entertainment to boot.. The scenery is beautiful; the train is comfortable (European style, with 4 seats facing each other over a narrow table), and the staff is helpful (loading and unloading all luggage) and makes every effort to make sure you have a good time. On our trip, we had a fashion show of high quality, high style alpaca clothing (for sale, of course, but entertaining nonetheless), as well as some dancing in the aisles by the crew. Quite a pleasant (albeit slow) way to travel.

Loved the scenery. It was a very relaxing mode of travel. Try to get an early morning train so you can take all the time you want at Macchu Picchu . Entertainment on the return train was a nice surprise!

Vistadome was totally worth it!. We took the Vistadome train to Machu Picchu and it was one of my favorite things we did in Peru. The train itself is very nice, very clean and very comfortable. We travelled from Poroy Station to Machu Picchu which was a 3 1/2 hour ride. They gave us breakfast in the morning and a light snack on the way back. The scenery was fantastic, its a wonderful way to take it all in and with the andean music playing you just get the feeling that you are on a great adventure! The service was great and there was entertainment on the way back to Poroy station.

A little bit disappointed. On the way up to Michu Pichu things the train looked as beautiful as advertised. If you look carefully along the way you will see stone fort and old ruin up on the hills , but on the way back the train doesn't look like the vista domethat's another story. It's a little bit disappointed.

Great experience on Vistadome. Me and my girlfriend were pleasantly surprised from time that we had on the way from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes.Besides that we were greeted with such a nice crew: Sergio Asfete, Enick Afonso Cossio and fantastic Milagros Choqur, who BTW spoke a little Russian. Unfortunately we traveled late hours so it was too dark to enjoy scenery but we were well entertained by cute fashion show and eclectic festival dance. Go for it! =)

Urgent message: Checked Baggage Service has been Dropped. PeruRail's Checked baggage service on trains 501 to Aguas Calientes and the 504 return to Cusco has been Suddenly Dropped. My travel agency today forwarded a letter from PeruRail with the announcement which said baggage must not weigh more than 5kg and the checked baggage service has been Cancelled Immediately. It also gave an email address if you needed to contact them to discuss this sudden change in policy. My travel agency sent an email to the address given and it Bounced Back.I've purposely bought my tickets on the 501 and 504 so I can Check my bags. The 501 leaves from Ollantaytambo, my Sacred Valley hotel is near the train station in Urbamba and so I gave up the location convenience to be on the trains that allowed Checked baggage. My small group and I are staying in Aguas Calientes for Three nights, not the usual one night, so a small overnight bag won't do.I have contacted PeruRail today and so has my travel agent - we are waiting for a response. It will be interesting to see if they will Honour the Service they Advertised at the time I purchased my tickets and allow me to bring my over 5kg luggage. According to Wikipedia 50% of it is owned by the international company Orient Express. If you have bought tickets on the 501 or 504 Perurail trains and expect checked baggage service I urge you to contact them.I will keep my Tripadvisor readers posted on the service I ultimately receive.As of today, I am giving them an average rating which I will change in a few days, up or down, based on their response.

Wonderful. At first I was confused between the Hiram, Vistadome and Backpaker train. The Vistadome is the one you want, unless you require afternoon tea and a stay at the Belmond in actual Machu Picchu.The Vistadome is clean, polished and your seating table even gets a table cloth and center piece before the complimentary lunch/dinner is served. There are attendants in each coach and the entire experience is restful. The scenery is spectacular, as well.Easy and organized boarding. We purchased our tickets through Magical Cuzco Tours ( I do highly recommend this group and all their services).

Relaxing Journey Through the countryside to the sound of Andean music. We travelled on perurail to Machu Picchu and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.It was well organised, on time with a verv good service.It may well be slow but I enjoyed taking in the scenery as we passed through the countryside and small communities on our way to machu Picchu with an on time arrival.Liked the music, drinks and snacks
Fun trip. After our visit to the sacred valley, we took the train from olyumtambo, nice afternoon and great views. On time, and got us where we need to be while having a great view.

A mixed bag. There is little to see in the Poroy- Ollantaytambo portion of the train ride. I suggest spending a bit more $$ for car transport to and from Ollan. Less travel time. Ollantaytambo-Aguascalientes has great scenery which takes advantage of the Vistadome cars.

Great fun. We caught the Vistadome train from Aguascalientes to Cusco after the Inca Trek. The view was fabulous and the train was comfortable. It is a very slow trip but once the light faded the staff entertained us with dancing, shows and a fashion parade. We were given a snack with the food a little below the usual Peruvian standards. Wine was available for purchase which we enjoyed after 4 days of trekking. The staff, Karina, Pablo and David, were excellent - very friendly and efficient.

Experience depends on the train. Our experience was very different the trip to Machu Picchu and then the trip back. The train to Machu Picchu was below expectations for the Vistadome. Yes, it had big windows, but was nothing to the luxury level that we had experienced on a Vistadome train in Alaska the prior year. Seats were adequate, but my guess is either it was very old, or they had tried to pass a backpacker train off as a Vistadome. A cold snack was served and the attendants lug a cart around trying to sell you things which is annoying. On the way back the train was a significant improvement. Truly a Vistadome roof and a seriously upgraded interior. Food served was a hot snack with linens and silverware. The staff performed a fashion show - which was fun (despite the fact they were again trying to sell you stuff). It was disappointing that the seats were all set in groups of 4. Not that we aren't social, but this means that 1/2 the folks are traveling backwards which bothers many. Other trains like this i've seen have the seats all facing forward and then if you want you can turn them around to form a group. Overall a decent experience. The view is amazing, the train good, the food so-so.

Excellent Service. Enjoyed our PeruRail Vistadome experience from Aguas Caliente to Ollanytatambo with Milagros choque, Julio Cesan Huqman, and Juan Alberto! These three were professional and made for a wonderful experience. Muchas Gracias!

Nice train ride. Get a good window seat!. This train meanders through a breathtaking valley ,surrounded by high mountains. Get the camera out. Stop chatting to strangers. Absorb the heights, the river, the terrain. Imagine 500 years ago, hiking this to the Inca home of Machu Picchu. A 90 minute pleasure. The food is AWFUL, and the coffee service, adequate. The sales pitch on Alpaca clothing , on the way back, is to be viewed as funny, and quaint.

A little luxury after a day of climbing stairs at Machu Picchu. We did the upgrade to Vistadome and it was worth it. You get more room, more comfortable seats, a hearty snack and non- alcoholic drinks, a fashion show and end up closer to Cusco than on the regular train. A nice touch after a warm and tiring exploration of Machu Picchu.

Great Trip with Excellent Crew. We are a family of four [all adults, I might add] that took the Vistadome from Poroy to Machu Picchu (and back), luckily with the same wonderful crew (Julio C. Huamon, Koizen Dueñas, Juan Carlos) and we couldn't be more satisfied. The trip back was particularly pleasant - I'm not going to spoil the surprise to anyone who might be reading, but it is enough to say that the crew went out of their way to make everything perfect for us. I do hope the wonderful workers are valued as they should - the whole show they put on the way back was incredible and I was surprised and completely enchanted. Congratulations on the trip and the fantastic crew. I do have one complain: the music should not be playing non stop. There might be people who prefer the sound of silence. Otherwise: very cool train. Saudações do Brasil.

Average...nothing special. Took the train to Agua Calliente, as I did not have a spare 4 days for the Inca Trail. Figured it would be okay, as images of amazing scenery and a quaint little train came to mind....this is not the case. As I was seated on the right hand side of the train, for most of my journey I just saw rock face very close up. The people on the other side, had sweeping views of the Urubamba river. Also the train is a regular train...nothing cutesy or quaint about it. It is worth it, if you are also short on time, but don't expect old world charm

Amazing views, good entertainment.. Worth the extra price. Meal is ok, views of the mountains and Sacred Valley, just gorgeous! The entertaiment ( fashion show) made the 3 hour train ride back from Machu Picchu more fun.

Be ready for the selling staff on the way back. I used this train to travel to Aguas Calientes and the way back. The journey takes around 4 hours, its a nice view along the journey. The food is not that great specially for the price of the ticket paid. On the way back we had a delay because the train had to return to the town because the engine of the machine was not working properly. On the way back many of the people is tired from climbing the machu pichu mt. And staff of the train decide a bad time to start selling staff. I was sleeping since had passed 3 hours of the journey and suddenly the staff turn the volume of music up and a guy came dancing amd waking up every one and then the other staff started modeling the staff that they were selling. I understand that this is part of their job but suggest that they choose another time to do this since many people is tired and this is annoying after a long way.

Too slow. 3.5 hours for 90 km...on the way to Machu Picchu it was alright since the views were nice...on the way back it was dark and it was a bit boring...they do serve a nice snack...almost a meal...they also sell clothing on the way back...clothing was good quality but expensive..so consider it...
Lovely trip!. Great service and great scenery! We need more trains like this! I met fun people from all over the world.

Nice transport. Enjoyed our but of time, but food was not anything I cared for at all. The corny entertainment was fine to pass the time on the return trip to cusco.they did not do a hard sell on the items they fashion showed.Overall better than a bus.

Nice train ride back from AC to Cuzco. Better than the basic Explorer class. Hiram Bingham is too expensive and practically empty because of it. Vistadome - snack, beers for sale, ok service, good views.

Travel in comfort / Enjoy the view. We rode the VistaDome from Aguas Callientes (Machu Picchu) to Cusco. The train is a wonderful way to see Urubamba River. The train parallels the river, dotted with small farms and towns. The snacks were okay. Know the timing when your train reaches its final destination and plan to have a light snack before boarding. The staff doubles as attendants and performers. Tip: Carry small change for the second beverage.

Great Experience!. It was a fantastic experience. The Vistadome far exceeded our expectations - it was fast, reliable, comfortable and offered great service including entertainment. We loved our experience.
Nice scenery, comfy travel. Enjoyed being able to sit in comfortable seats and see the scenery as we travelled. Snacks provided were underwhelming.

worth the cost?. We took the Vistadome train from the Poroy station, about 20 minutes outside of Cusco to Aguas Calientes, located at the foot of Machu Picchu. Although the train ride was scenic, I was slightly annoyed that we were not seated “together” on either leg of the trip. Unfortunately when booking tickets, you have no control over the seat selection. The train ride can take up to 4 hours as it travels very slowly through the terrain and makes one seemingly LONG stop along the way. The seats were comfortable leather but had limited leg room. I say this because if you’re seated at a 4-top you are sharing leg room with the person in front of you and if you’re seated in the aisle seat, your legs straddle the table support. The Vistadome train included a tasteful light breakfast in the morning (quinoa pancakes, spinach torte, with fresh fruit) as well as a light snack (small slice of cold pizza with fresh fruit) in the evening. Ambient Andean music played throughout the trip but appeared somewhat loud and repetitive at times, or maybe it was the lack of rail noise that amplified this change. The train staff; Wendy, Erick, and Jose, were very friendly and provided representative dances of the Andean culture as well as a fashion show on the return trip to the Poroy Station. Both designed to engage the passengers as it was too dark to see the passing landscape.Be sure to plan ahead and arrange a taxi to drop you off in the morning and retrieve you in the evening. Each way shouldn't cost more than 30 Nuevos Soles.
What a train journey !. The train ride from cusco to Aguas Caliente is filled with great scenery and amazing floraThe train itself is very comfortable and spacious there are spectacular views

Great ride! The view and the service was excellent.. The trip on the Vistadome was great! There are windows on the side and on top that allowed us to have a great view of all the mountains. Also, they serve you drinks and a sandwich during the ride and they are very good. The staff is very pleasant and they make your ride enjoyable. Very good ride!
Fun and view. Had a little entertainment on the train on the way back, with native dance and historic relevance, and a short fashion show demo'ing the woolens for sale on board. Thoroughly enjoyable.

A bit over-rated. I was disappointed with the Vistadome. The views were not quite spectacular. In fact taking the bus up from Agues Calientes to Macchu Picchu is more exhilarating and breath-taking. I have taken trains in Switzerland that offered better viewing opportunities of the landscape and surrounding. The vistadome glass windows are not quite clear for views and had obstructions from various angles. For just the experience of riding on the Vistadome, perhaps a one way trip is sufficient. Overall the ticket price is also quite steep for the value.
Comfy, Clean, & Convenient. First time on a train like this, and it was very enjoyable. About a 40 minute ride through the brush, and along the river. Great views, comfortable seats. Very nice.
Beautiful Scenery - Fun Crew. Very nice scenery, mountains, rivers and fun crew made this train ride great! Nice fashion show! Great entertainment!

Good way to travel. Beautiful views. Hands down that was my favorite part of the train ride into and out of Machu Picchu. The train was on time, the staff was pleasant. However, the "snacks" left a lot to be desired.

Great way to go to Machu Pichu. If you are pressed for time, vistadome would be the best way to go to Machu Pichu. We booked our train ride thru viator.com. Boarded the train from Cusco (Poroy) which is the highest point of the journey -11, 000 feet above sea level . The train travels zig zag to descent to sacred valley of Incas. Machu Pichu almost 8,000 feet above sea level. Very comfortable seats and excellent service. They served breakfast in the train and on our way back a snack and a fashion show/dance entertainment. We enjoyed the soothing music played. It was so relaxing and enjoyed the breathtaking views. It is truly a journey for your senses.

Return from 4d Inca Trail. Only half the trip from Machu Picchu is pretty, then the landscape turns pretty ordinary. However, the train company makes up for this with a fashion show and music and dancing. A great way to finish our Inca Trail and Machu Picchu experience!

Charming!. Aside from the fact that this was one of the most picturesque train journeys I've ever taken, the thing that really blew me away about this trip was the quality of the service. Allocated seats, bags carried on/off the train, trolley service with drinks and a snack included for free and really friendly and polite staff. UK train operators take note!

perfect way to get to Machu Picchu. We bought our tickets on Peru Rails's site online 3 months prior to our visit. I haven't realized until boarding that our seats were 1 and 2 in carriage A. The best seats by far as you can enjoy not only the benefit of side-to-side and overhead windows but the biggest one in front of you. As you were driving the train. Unbelievable! My advice is to buy your ticket directly at Peru Rail as early as possible that you might be the lucky one as we were!

Beautiful views!. The views from the train were amazing! Seats were comfortable, with plenty of room! Staff was very attentive. Enjoyed the snack and drink service, and the fashion show on the return trip!
Peru Rail Vistadome to Machu Picchu. The Peru Rail staff were very helpful and friendly. There was entertainment and shopping on the way back to Ollantaytambo! What could be better!

Great train trip. We enjoyed our trip on the vistadome, great views of the surrounding countryside, comfortable seats with a drink and snack included. The staff were friendly and helpful and put on a show on the return trip. Relax....there is a toilet on board.

Quite an adventure. We took the Expedition train to Machu Pichu at the Poroy train station. It wasn't the top of the line train but was quite elegant anyways. The attentandants in our car were very kind and friendly. Their names were Judith and Rogelio.It's a beautiful scenery on the way to Machu Pichu. On the way back, it got dark early; so, there was not much to see but we talked a lot with people we net from Spain, Brazil and Argentina.They were very punctual on both ways. No complaint at all.
vistadome was a great experience. The train was clean, the staff friendly and helpful. well organized.They served food on table runners with flowers.
better than the explorer. We had a blast! Our girls helped model the alpca wear with Oscar, Yuliana and Juan. I'm sure we were the most obnoxious passengers ever.

The Perfect Train Ride, Cuzco to Machu Picchu. A train with vistas from side-to-side and overhead is the ideal method for traversing the Andes enroute to Machu Picchu...and superb meal service with scrumptious food was provided. Modern, clean and on time.

wonderful way to get to Macho Piccho. We had a driver pick us up in Cusco and drive us to the train station in Olly. We boarded the train to Macho Piccho on time and the trip took about an hour and a half. The views were spectacular as the train had windows in the ceiling and you could see everywhere. The staff came around with soft drinks and snacks and were very professional. A very enjoyable way to get to Macho Piccho.

Expensive, but good.. A very expensive (about $80 p.p. one way) but enjoyable way to travel from Cusco to Aguas Calientes. (not Machu Picchu as they constantly announce on the train - that is still a short bus ride, and another $19 (return) away. Tickets can easily be booked in advance via the Peruvian Rail website but it's not possible to book specific seats, so it's pot luck if families/friends are allocated seats together. Be aware that there is also a baggage allowance of 5 kilo p.p - we only noticed this at the last moment in the small print on our ticket. There is limited luggage storage space on the train, but some people did have large cases - the rule didn't seem to be enforced. There is a left luggage facility at the station. A snack is also served and is included in the ticket price. Again, there is no choice of food, so veggies may miss out. Staff are very courteous, and go out of their way to ensure that passengers have a good trip. The train is comfortable and large windows afford fantastic views, although if you are seated at one end of the carriage, depending on the way the seat is facing, you may miss out a little on the 'Vistadome' experience.

Nice train ride down to Machu Picchu Area. We took this train from Urubamba Station and it was a nice but a slow ride for the first 45 mins until the ollantambo station. Great views of the Urubamba River and valley. Enjoyed the included free snack service too.

Beautiful scenery. This was a lovely train ride, but fairly slow, like most transportation in that area of Peru. We enjoyed the relaxation and spectacular scenery. Have your camera ready for beautiful landscape photos.

Great views but bumpy ride. if your travel during the day, the views from the train are great (no matter whether you sit window or aisle), but the ride is slow and bumpy. I was trying to write my travel diary and gave up after less than 10 minutes and it never got better. The fashion show from the staff on the trip through to Poroy was good fun but the clothing was expensive.

A 5 * trip. We took the vista dome both ways to and from Machu Picchu and had a great time. Very clean carriages with good snacks and the most helpful staff I have encountered on a rail trip yet. On the way back the three attendants ( Miguel Angel L, Rosmery C and Clever L) put on a great fashion show with other surprise entertainment. They were the best! We will be back to visit again.

For that price, employees should speak proper Spanish. I am a native Spanish speaker. And I found myself translating for pretty much everyone because half of the announcements were only in spanish. Overall slow and overpriced. Having said that, take the Vistadome, best view.And I really do not appreciate the fashion show and dancing. After a day on Machu Picchu I want to relax with a book in the train and not watch people act like morons.
Great train ride. Brilliant experience the only way to see the countryside of Peru from Cuzco to Machu Picchu. Passengers are treated like royalty amazing food, staff and entertainment.
Great train. On time. Clean. Free snack on board. Great windows. Great views. Clear announcements. (I was lucky to be on the new trains. Some are older.)

Nice ride, but definitely on the expensive side.. I rode the train from Poroy (Cusco) to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu), and then again from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo. The train was very comfortable, and the large windows afforded great views. Both times, we were given meals which were delicious but quite small. On the ride from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo, the train staff gave a fashion show marketing Peru Rail's proprietary clothing line. The staff looked slightly pained the whole time, and the merchandise was, for the most part, similar to what could be found in local markets, only much more expensive.I wish there had been a more affordable way to travel to Machu Picchu.

Magnificent Views of the Andes Mountains!. Taking the Vistadome train from the Sacred Valley and/or Cusco to Machu Picchu is an awe inspiring experience. The windows on the roof of the train let you experience the ruggedness of the Andes without craning your neck. The train is clean, comfortable and you meet very nice people sitting at the same table. Couldn't take my eyes off the craggy spires of the Andes for the 2 hour trip from the Sacred Valley. On the return trip from Machu Picchu to Cusco, the train attendants put on a style show displaying lovely alpaca products including capes, sweaters and ponchos. A wonderful experience!

Train ride was good but hated the sales pitches. The train was clean and comfortable, but in humid weather the windows fog up and obscure the view. The food service was very nice. What we really could have done without was the sales pitches. On the way to Aguascalientes Calientes they try to sell you guide books and clothing. On the trip home they pushed pisco sours, and then they put on a fashion show of expensive alpaca clothing. They were a little too pushy with their sales pitches and it made us uncomfortable.
fun train ride. We took the Vistadome from Cusco to Machu Picchu- roundtrip - amazing views, great service and a fun fashion show on the return trip!
Worth the extra money. It is definitely worth the extra money to take this train to M.P. My only complaint is the strange "fashion show" in an attempt to sell alpaca items on the return trip.

A fun train ride. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to AC and back. On the way to AC, it was during the day and got the most out of the glass top as I was seated on the aisle. The way back to Ollantaytambo was at night so I think the "Vistadome" was a moot point. If you get a window seat on the Expedition, I don't see the Vistadome being much of an upgrade. Though I'm not sure what the price difference is between the two. The trains seemed to depart very promptly. Our train stopped for 1 hour on the tracks on the way back. This was a little annoying as I was so beat after 2.5 days of hiking around Machu Picchu. As we were stopped, the crew had some sort of fashion show where they were pushing Peru Rails wears. This is a Chilean owned company so I thought that was funny.

There was drink service!. It's pretty amazing there being a train through this valley. A surprise was the beverage and snack cart. Nothing great but it was a nice treat to have something hot drink during the ride.I wish I could say the views were fantastic throughout but I fell asleep both ways going to/from Aguas Calientes. There were some ruins and snow-capped mountains.

This train adds to Machu Pichu visit. This 1.5h train ride each way through spectacular scenery makes the visit to MP even more special. The crew took on a number of roles from serving snacks, selling Perurail merchandise, to giving a fashion show on the way back! They were very pleasant and the whole carriage joined into the fun- very enjoyable. Sit on the far side of the carriage (not the platform side) for best views of the river and mountains.

May 2014 Trip to Peru. A great train ride to MachuPicchu. The train ride takes you through some of most spectacular scenery I have ever seen. Although the seating is a little tight and the snacks and drinks are fine the crew does the best they can to make your trip enjoyable. Really enjoyed the trip and would recommend the train ride.

Fascinating ride in Peru. Its an efficient service with all right snacks and drinks. Great views all around. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to the Machhu Picchu terminal and all facilities within the train functioned well and the staff spoke good English and were very helpful
Slow but nice views!!!. Nice train ride to and from Machupicchu. On the way back very entertaining. They serve snacks, Alpaca fashion show and typical dance.

Wow what a train!. I've traveled on a lot of trains but this one was something else. Firstly we had stayed at the Sanctuary Lodge so were able to use the special lounge with free drinks and snacks which was great. When we got on the train the views were amazing as most of the roof is glass. In just over an hour, we were served a sandwich, a drink, had a fashion show of local clothing and were entertained by a dancing jester/clown in a local mask. It was a really nice journey. Quite surreal, but very entertaining. Not sure if we got all of that because of the Sanctuary Lodge stay or if everyone gets it. Whichever way, the views and journey were stunning and everyone will enjoy it,

Expensive, but lovely train ride. Very well appointed train with wonderful staff. Meals included. Definitely get the vistadome up for the panoramic views. On the way back there is a scary colorful dancing man and a silly fashion show beware

Lovely!. We were fortunate to have seats A 1 and 2 with a panoramic view in both directions. You do get a small sandwich and drinks on each ride. Had a dance and surprise as well as a fashion show on the ride back to Ollantaytambo.
Comfortable with good service. Great views and good service by staff. I would reccomend this method of travel. Free drinks & snacks included.

Gorgeous Scenery, great service!. We recently had the opportunity to take this train ride from Macchu Picchu back to Poroy (just outside of Cusco) & can definitely recommend it as an alternative to flying back to Cusco. The beautiful scenery you can experience from the large VistaDome car was spectacular and coupled with the wonderful service and the comfortable seats it made a delightful way to see life in Peru. Our trip was booked through our tour agent so I can't speak to the problems in booking that I have seen on trip advisor but whatever the hassle, it's worth making the extra effort to take advantage of this mode of travel. Our train crew Giulissa, Alexander & Roberto attended to all our needs and put on a fun fashion show when it got too dark to enjoy the beauty outside of our windows. Don't miss this opportunity to experience the beauty of Peru.

Awesome way to travel!. From Cusco to Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu) - wonderful way to go. The scenery is breathtaking! Side note - during their rainy season, our winter, the train doesn't go all the Cusco for safety reasons. There is a two hour bus ride from Cusco to the beginning point of the train to get to Machu Picchu and the same for the return. This bus is not comfortable...you will be eating your knee caps. We caught the train at Ollantaytambo on the way up after visiting the Sacred Valley and this was a great option. However, we hit the bus on the return and wish we had done differently. There isn't anything they can do for safety reasons, but you may want to plan accordingly if you wish to avoid it.

Ho-Hum but Necessary. The best thing about this train is the friends you can make. That's after moving your seats away from pushy tour guides, nosy nasty old lady travellers form Canada, and obnoxious spoiled teenage travelers who insist on putting all of their bags where your feet should be. We don't really recommend taking the Vistadome "upgrade", this is not a dome train as all travellers know it, the vista part is simply smaller windows along the roof line of the train which do not add much to the trip or view. Make sure your booker or you determine which direction your seats face, you want to be facing towards Machu Picchu going up, and towards Cusco going down. If you don't select your seats you may get seated at a 4 table with people you don't know across or next to you. We moved our seats going up, and met amazing folks, and rode down facing a great couple we met while hiking on Machu Picchu so all ended up ok. Also, the 13lb bag limit is a myth, some on ours trains had huge roller bags, the 40lb variety, and none of the train personnel cared. Note that they try to sell you anything and everything going both ways. The return trip is basically a bad cheap stage show with dancing, singing, and attempts at parading "alpaca" up & down the aisles for sale, plus pisco sours also for sale. Most of it is laughable, except for watching uneducated tourists buy "alpaca" which is clearly acrylic and wool or alpaca mixed, for inflated prices. When you get off of the train, you won't want to feel like you've been had, so keep your cash in your wallet. Also be careful about your belongings, things move around and so do you, smaller items can get lost or end up under the seats, and you will find it nearly impossible to retrieve them. This is an ok way to get to Machu Picchu, however keep your expectations real.

Excellent service, a great experience!. Taking the afternoon Vistadome from Machu Picchu to Ollantaytambo was a great experience. After having hiked Machu Picchu mountain in the morning, the attentive staff, the comfortable seating, and the spectacular views were so enjoyable... And then there was the entertainment and the fashion show! What fun!! Deynis, Rosmery, and Domingo were wonderful and provided excellent customer service. I have also taken the Expedition train by Perurail... spend just a little bit more and take the Vistadome - it's worth it.

Fine but not good value for money.. This expensive train is still worth it as it takes its own swwet time to reach Agua Calientes or go back to Ollantaytalbo. Super views of the surrounding landscape and good on-board service. Better buy ahead as it is often full.
new, comfortable ride back to Cusco. The announcements were both in Spanish and English. The view were un surpassed. They also us a small snacks.s

A wonderful way to travel. This was an unexpected treat. We were travelling from Machu Picchu to Cusco.This train journey was a delight, we were given a light meal, served on table mats with flowers and waiter service. Then entertainment and a fashion show!!!The carriages had large glass windows and ceiling, giving a majestic view of the passing mountains.wonderful way to travel..

A great train trip. I thoroughly enjoyed the train trip, the views along the way were spectacular, which helped to set the scene for the visit to Machu Picchu. I was pleasantly surprised when we were provided with a lunch in the morning and a snack in the evening on the long return journey.

Great Service--Efficient, Fun, and On-time. We took the Vistadome both ways to/from Cusco/Machu Picchu and were impressed by the professionalism of the crew on the way to MP, but were blown away by the ride home--music, costumes, a fashion show, and a snack--what more could ask for?! Giulissa, Luis, and Julio Cesar were the crew in our car and were the absolute best ambassadors the Vistadome could offer. We will recommend to all.

Comfortable journey. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aquas Calientes and then back to Cusco (Poroy Station). The train is moderately expensive but cheaper than the Hiram Bingham. Unfortunately when you buy your tickets you are assigned seats and some seats face backwards which may be uncomfortable to some travelers. In addition, those on the left side of the train going down to Aguas Calientes had some great vistas of the powerful Urubamba river. The train was on time and the staff help load the luggage onto the train. We had a medium sized roll away and did not face any questions by staff. Seats are comfortable and there are two seats across a table from another two seats. This means that you are generally looking at and across from two people you do not know unless you are traveling in a group. We were served a snack and drink on the train ride to Aquas Calientes and enjoyed the views from the windows along side and above our seats. The return to Cusco was longer and more tiring (about 4 hours). We were served a light dinner and then there was a "fashion show" with the train staff modeling Alpaca wear for purchase. They also had a member of the staff dress up as Chupacabra and do an Andean dance for the entire train! For the better part of the ride, there is music playing in the train car and sometimes quite loudly. For the longer journey home, the music repeated itself until someone actually asked the staff to stop repeating the same sound track again and again. The music did impact our ability to rest on the way back home especially since the evening train travels in the dark to arrive in Poroy around 9 PM.

Our fun train ride. Myself and 2 friends took the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Cusco. We were thoroughly entertained. Giulissa, Yamil Carnival Devil and Julio Cesar put on a great show and had the train rocking. I definitely recommend this trip. Well done guys.

Beautiful scenery, superb staff. We took the 3:50 pm Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo. The seats are more comfortable than the lower priced Expedition train but the food service was about the same, just a bread roll with a piece of cheese and tomato. However the staff on this Vistadome train were exceptional. Rosemery was informative in discussing the Incan culture, and Rosemery, Domingo and Denys were all very attentive to providing good service, even though what PeruRail offers for this upgraded price is very basic, nothing extra in the way of food or drinks. What really made the Vistadome a more enjoyable experience was the staff and the entertainment. Domingo, dressed in a costume, was charming and entertaining with his dancing, Rosemery and Deynis modeled beautiful alpaca clothing and were very helpful in showing us how to wear the different items. We had no intention of purchasing anything but they were such charming sales people we ended up buying two alpaca shawls!

Fab train journey, best ever!. We took this from Urubamba to Aguas Calientas and then Aguas Calientas to Cusco. On the first leg you get the most amazing views of the magnificent Andes. The train goes quite slowly but its supremely comfortable and beautifully finished inside. The staff are great and you have a reserved seat. Sit on the right if you can, the best views!They give you a commentary of interesting things along the way and serve you refreshments. I wont say any more but there are some fun surprises on the journey back to Cusco! Enjoy!!!

Must try. We travels from agua calientes to cuzco on vistadome, and I am so glad we did. out train is at 3.20pm and arrived at cuzco around 7.30pm. the speed for the train is about 30 mph. The sky went dark around 6pm so after dark there is no point to be in the vistadome since it's very dark outside. But I really enjoyed the train ride, the seats are comfortable and spacious, I sat with a local andean lady and a brazilian tourist, we had wonderful exchanges on our peru experience. The train is very clean and beautiful. I enjoyed the snacks on the train and all the shows, although the guy in the mask is a bit disturbing looking lol. I really enjoyed the alpaca fashion show, it is a great idea.The only down side I think is that the music is way too loud, but apart from that everything is top notch. It is quite expensive but it is a once in a life time experience, so it's worth it.

Really nice train. We loved all the space we had to stretch our legs. The windows on top allow you to see just about everything. The food they gave us was good. In the evening train they will set up the table that sits in the middle of the seats with table runners and real silverware, you feel very special. The train personnel were very friendly too. The train does not have a lot of storage area so a carry on size bag is good.

Peru Derailed. The only reason I didn't give them a "terrible" rating is because our ride to Machu Picchu was nice. However, on the way back to Cuzco, the train derailed, not enough to tip us over, but enough to be quite scary. On top of that, they would not let us get off of the car while they were trying to fix it(at least I assume that's what they were doing but all we kept seeing was men bringing rocks over to the tracks) we kept asking to get off or stand on the other cars since ours was the only one with a problem but that was apparently deemed unsafe for us to stand on other cars while we sat in the derailed one which shook back and forth every time they tried to fix it. It got dark and it was not pleasant in the least. They did bring the alcoholic beverage cart back out, but you still had to pay for drinks. Eventually they gave us free soft beverages or beer or a tiny cup of wine.  We ended up sitting on the train for two hours before they had us evacuate, at which point we found out that they detached our car and the rest of the train went on back to Cuzco. Meanwhile it was pitch black, luckily I had a flashlight, and we had to walk back down the tracks with our luggage to ollantaytambo where we were put in buses to take us back to our hotels. They took our hostel/hotel names and addresses and then still just dropped us off near the plaza. It was only a few blocks to walk but after all of that, plus being two females at night in a foreign country, we were not happy at all. I tried emailing and calling and have gotten no response.

Lovely Train. Highly recommended for the train trip up to Machu Picchu. Comfortable seats with large windows, including ones in the roof to give you a good overall view of all the scenery on the trip to Machu Picchu.

Train to Machu Picchu. This it's a very expensive train and unluckily some of the sits are located on the bad side and facing against the direction of the train ride which makes it very uncomfortable on regulates to the ride back they make a fashion show but they play a very loud music in or other to self clothes not so fun and very expensive clothes

The VistaDome is required if you want the full scenery. And a word on Luggage.... Ideally, one should pay the slight extra for this train and plan for at least a one way trip during daylight hours. You are traveling thru a valley, which is exceedingly tight and narrow in places, coupled with tall growth on one or both sides of the train at times, so the roof windows allow you to see what will otherwise, at times, not be viewable from them side windows. Additionally, when you get the wider openings, the roof windows really shine as the view is almost 180 degrees from side to side.The roof windows also allow you to get a preview of what scenery is coming, and lets you see the tops of the mountains, some snowcapped, some shrouded in the mists of the clouds. It truly is quite the sight! However, if you are traveling when it's dark, I doubt there is much advantage to this train, and personally would save the money and take the Backpackers train.As for luggage, I heard many times you may not bring more than X weight/size/volume on the train. I have not read the ticket rules and restrictions, but don't doubt that there is something in there about that, technically. My experience, from two trips on the VistaDome, was that large, oversized baggage and luggage rules were not enforced whatsoever. As a matter of fact, they even made announcements upon station arrival to wait to disembark until they could offload the large luggage! And some people had quite the collection of full on traveling luggage. in both the trains I was in. There is no additional storage by your seat for it, so it goes in the center by the entrance to the carriage, all stacked together- although some backpackers were putting their large packs inbetween the seats, in the space where their backs were adjacent to the next seat backs.

Should ride at least once. Costs $69 one way from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, the place from where you go to Machu Picchu. It's a scenic ride and the train travels slowly giving you an impressive view of the surrounding mountains. Sit on the left side while going to Aguas Calientes to see the Urubamba river flowing by the side throughout the journey.They allow only a back pack and a luggage weighing not more than 10 kgs.

Best way to get to Machu Picchu. This train is well operated and organized. The boarding can be a little confusing until you find your car and where you are supposed to be fro boarding, but it's all good after that.Beautiful sights through the skylights above every seat on the train and huge windows keep you looking outside the entire trip.
