see the sky. Can you imagine travelling through the mountains and watching it as if it was a movie? As if you were actually inside there? This train allows you to see everything that is outside, for it has a transparent roof!! And the service is great with foods and drinks!!!

Vistadome Experience. Vistadome is a train from PeruRail. I had a great experience. The train is quite spacious and the food was good. They offer a fashion show. If you are short on time, this a good place to shop for Alpaca clothing.

Outstanding service. Perurail Vistadome is highly recommended for the Cuzco to Aguas Caliente and return trip. Even though the actual trip was slow and took a loooong time, Perurail has managed to find ways to give very good service and entertain passengers.

Peru Rail comfortable and entertaining!. Great clean comfortable trip with some extra special surprises! Folklore interactive show and fashion show on train. Surprise and helps pass the time when it gets dark. Beautiful view of the river and the sacred valley

It is always the people making the difference!. As already stated by many travellers, the train drive from Aguas Calientes (Mach Picchu) to Cusco is a great experience. If you are travelling during winter time, you should take the first train in the afternoon which is late enough to see everything of the lost village of Machu Picchu and early enough to enjoy most of the sacred valley before it gets dark.I would like to highlight the service and the entertainment offered by Giulissa, Julio Cesar H. and Luis angel during my ride on Sunday, may 18th, 2014. They were very committed to their job and they did an excellent job!

Very nice experience. I suggest to all the people who wants to have a very good train experience to visit Machu Pichu to book the Vistadome train. Staff on the train is very polite and professional. People enjoy the beutiful view, from the train, of the surrounding. They offered us a snack and fuits together with cold or hot drink. Very nice experinece

A Pleasurable Ride from Machu Picchu. Even though we thought the price for the Vistadome service from Cusco to Machu Picchu was high, we were pleasantly surprised with the level of service provided by the company and staff, specially on the way back to Cuzco. After a very long and tiring day in Machu Picchu, we boarded our Vistadome coach at 5pm and were treated to a show of Peruvian Folklore and a beautiful fashion in Alpaca designs. Worth mentioning are Mirta, Manuel Azurin, and Nestor who made sure we were having fun and fully enjoying our trip. Time flew by and when we arrived in Cuzco, it felt like we had just left Machu Picchu.
Great views from the windows. The train is a great way to relax and site see while on your way to Machu Picchu. The staff are friendly and they really work hard to make the trip a good one.

Amazing train and service. We loved our trip on Peru Rail. Special shout out to Alfredo del Castillo Cuba, On Board Supervisor, for his incredible service when we missed our return train to Cusco. He went out of his way to ensure we got rebooked and even helped contact our tour agency to make sure we had lodgings for the night. A superman!

wonderful views acrooss Vale Sagrado. Top class tourist train, excelente servisse, fun and nice surprise on the way back. The scenery out of the Windows (on the roof of the train too) is spetacular. Not only a transport but a Must go attracion in itself.
beutiful. the ride on this train was the most scenic I can imagine. waterfalls, inca ruins, flowers, rain forest. Comfortable and clean.

Lots of Vistas!. We rode the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo....so scenically beautiful! Nice entertainment of a fashion show featuring alpaca-made sweaters, scarves, ponchos, coats, etc....paraded by the train staff. Thought they wouldn't have enough space for our carry-ons and backpacks, but they did. We did the Hiram Bingham Orient Express going to Aguas and the Vistadome on the return.....altho' different trains, both were excellent rides! Glad we did it that way! HIGHLY recommend!

Relaxing ride. We did the Inka Trail to Machu Picchu, then took the Vistadome back to Ollantaytambo. Since we left later in the afternoon, we only had about 45 minutes to enjoy the view before it became too dark to see. However, what we did see was great, and I can understand how this would be an excellent ride during the day. The evening ride did come with drinks, a sandwich, and snacks. There was also some dancing and a "fashion show" where there are some alpaca products for sale at a good price after the show. Overall, a very nice experience, and oh so comfortable after a 4 day trek.
Very good ride. It is a three hour train road. Motion sickness is a possibility for the weak. However no one seemed bothered.

Excellent. Very friendly staff, beautiful views, super clean bathroom and perfectly on-time! Also, the "snack" service in the morning was a great surprise. A lovely little meal with placemats, real silverware...a nice touch.
relaxing trip with Vistadome. Good snack, good seats and wonderful view. Our train left on time and when we came back from Machu Picchu the staff made a little show for all passengers. Very nice
Nice train. Train took longer than expected and thought there was a dining car but since this is the only way to get to Machu Picchu there is rosaLy nothing to complain about!

Add on to the excitement!. This train ride add-on the excitement to Machu Picchu. Vistadome offer an excellent view of thesurrounging mountains and river. The seats are comfortable and perfect for four to share a table. Forward facing is ideal . On board service was ok .... small snack , fruits and drinks. There is a small area for carry-on type luggages or big duffle bags. The pricing is less if you take the afternoon train and it is less crowded. Tickets are limited per day so purchase tickets ahead on-line before goiing.

Fanstastic experience. We were very lucky as the weather allowed blue sky during the 1h30 min trip. The glass ceiling allow the passenger to have a priviledged view of the surroundings. The service is excellent: it was served sandwiches, snacks and drinks. On the way back, the waiters did a folk performance on top of a modelling of the local clothes they sell. It was a real fun. If you can, on the way to Machu Picchu, try to pick left side, forward- facing seats.

A Little Disappointing. We paid to go on the Vista Dome from Cusco to Machu Picchu but were taken by bus from Cusco to Urubamba to meet the train that was not even ready. To make matters worse even though we were 4 couples not one of us was sitting with our Spouse. I think it is only common sense if people have the last same name and are in the same group, seat them together. This is probably once in a lifetime trip for most people I think they would like to sit with there spouse. Heading back a mother of three was sitting at one end of the car and her husband and children were at the other end.Otter than that, the views are spectacular, the cars are super comfortable. The staff were great. Nice day all in all.

In my opinion worth the extra money but mostly if you sit by the window.. I preferred the ride to MP then the way back. The way there was May so it was a bit slower and we got a four seater to ourselves. There is a star missing for the snack, it's very small and I eat like bird, it also pretty awful in taste, quality and quantity, but I am picky.The view is spectacular and the coffee was tasty. When we travel we like to decide what to splurge on and what to save. We felt like this was worth the splurge even with the bad food.

Good service. We had a seat at the front of the train going down to Machu picchu which had great views, and staff were very helpful but no dining service, coming back on the return trip, had the works, food, entertainment .and all, and seemed no time getting back to the station.

Well done, affordable ride. NIce breakfast snack in the morning and a small snack in the evening. Entertainment on the way back to Cusco included a costumed native and a fashion show by the train attendants selling alpaca wear. Nicely done.
the scenic route to Aqua Calienta. easy, relaxing route to Machu Picchu. And the views were spectacular! So nice to be off the beaten path.

Extraordinary. I could have still been in a cloud after wandering MP but our ride back was superb. Where to wait in the station, and easier procedure signage would have helped. Just made our train. On board we were treated to drinks and snacks and a coca leaf inspired fashion show with lovely young Peruvians - Mario, Mishel and Manuel - making the trip seem like minutes.

A train is not a train. We travelled on the Vistadome from Machu Picchu back to Cusco, which wasn't Cusco but an hour bus ride to Cusco as the train station was closed in Cusco due to landslides. The Vistadome offers two seats facing forward and two facing backwards with a table in between. They serve you coffee/tea with a snack meal consisting of pizza, fruit and nuts. During the ride back to Cusco, they put on a fashion show with the alpaca/llama wool products which is quite funny, and a dancing/music show which was totally unexpected. It's all part of the experience.We travelled on Expedition 33 train to Macchu Picchu which I actually preferred. Two recliner leather seats facing forward only - no rear facing seats and they also serve a snack with coffee/tea.

Great Train Ride. Pleasant reserved seating with table for sections of 4 people. Great for paying card games while traveling. Included food snack and drink were just right. Lots of windows at side and above to view the scenery. Great way to meet other interesting travelers.
great train. Perurail is very organized! the workers are very nice and the train ride is beautiful! alot of great ohot opps!

Slow but great ride. It doesn't go very fast, but it is a wonderful way to see the countryside on your way from Cusco to Machu Picchu - about the only way to get there. On the way back we actually had entertainment and a fashion show.....

Very Nice Train. We took the Vistadome train roundtrip from Poroy to Agua Calientes. Poroy is the closest stop to Cusco, a 20 minute taxi ride. Agua Calientes is the train station for Machu Picchu. It's a small interesting town on the Urubamba river and nestled in the rain forest that supplies lodging, restaurants and shopping for the thousands of tourists that descend here. It's also where you catch the bus up to Machu Picchu. (You can walk up or trek but it's an extensive uphill climb). The Vistadome train exceeded our expectations. We sat in the first class cabin which was very clean and comfortable. We had waiter service and a light meal was served on each route. In our case this was breakfast (fruit, pancakes, coffee, juice) and an early evening snack (pizza, nuts). The trains large windows look out on the countryside surroundings and Andean music is piped in through speakers. The staff has a bit of fun by putting on fashion shows and modeling the local Alpaca woven clothing, which is of course for sale, or by dancing thru the aisles dressed in Incan costumes. This was silly fun for the passengers, and revealed a light side of Peruvian culture that helped pass time during the 3.5 hr ride.
beautiful trip. very well equipped, the personel very simpathetic and the trip is relaxing. the first part from cuzco on bus is not so good

great train ride. a bit slow, but you enjoyed all the surroundings. The food wasn't bad. The employees put on a fashion show (they were selling yes, but at least they made it fun), kept us entertained on the way back to Cuzco.

Great Choice of Train to Machu Picchu. Vista Dome train is comfortable with great visibility of the surrounding country side. They serve a snack on the way up and a meal and fashion show on the way down. Very comfortable train.

Great ride but too Expensive. This is the mid range option. Most people should take the Vistadome.If you are local, you pay around 10 soles ($3.70) each way to get to Machu Picchu. Travelers from out of country pay $70-85 each way. Most things in Peru are really cheap. The exception is your trip to Machu Picchu. We paid $165 for the train, $20 for the bus ride up and around $45 to get into Machu. Don't get me wrong, it was well worth the expense. It's just annoying.

My Birthday Celebration in Machu Picchu. The train it was a great experience for me. very easy to book it. Once we arrived in Cusco we just take a local taxi for like 15 minutes in order to get the train station in Poroy.the snack on board it was good enough, so the crew round-trip it was the same people named " Tripulacion or Crew DAISAKU" it was amazing, very friendly and professional.

Relaxing journey. Relaxing and comfortable way to make your way to Machu Picchu or other destinations in the Sacred Valley. Clean train and on-board amenities, food supplied was fairly average though.

Enjoyable train ride. We caught a 5am flight from Lima to Cusco then headed to Wanchaq station by taxi to catch an 8am bus. The taxi ride will take you 10-15 minutes and cost about 30 soles. We actually organised the taxi through one of the hotels that had a stand at the airport. This seemed a much safer option than randomly picking one off the street. At the time of our holiday (just after rainy season) they were using a bi-modal method of getting you to Machu Picchu, the journey from Cusco to Aguas Calientes was made up of a 90 minute bus ride from Wanchaq station to Pachar station and then a 2 hour train ride the rest of the way. The bus ride was a bone shuddering experience over windy mountain roads. Quite a few of the passengers, myself included, were feeling quite sick by the end of the journey.The train ride however was very enjoyable. It travels quite slowly giving you the opportunity to take in all the scenery. I recommend that you have a hat and sunglasses and either long sleeve shirt or sunburn cream. There are very large windows on the train as well as a partially glass roof making it very hard to escape the sun.When we purchased the tickets online you are allocated seating numbers. On both occasions my husband and I were not seated together. There seemed to be quite a few people in similar circumstances and everyone was happy to swap places. The upside to this was that it did quite a good job of breaking the ice and made for a very relaxed train journey chatting with fellow passengers!As part of the cost you are provided with a drink and a light lunch. It was a very pleasant way to try out a few local foods.The only trouble we had was with the baggage. The expectation is that you stay in Cusco, store your large suitcases at the hotel and just carry bags similar in size to plane carry on luggage. However, because we were coming direct from Lima we did not have this option. Our two large suitcases each weighing 20+ kg (plus an assortment of hand held luggage) were definitely frowned upon but not refused.You get dropped off at the train station in Aguas Calientes and will generally be met by someone from your hotel. The majority of the town streets are for foot traffic only so a porter will collect your bags and wheel them to the hotel in a cart. The town is quite small so this is not a long journey. On leaving the station you get to walk through the markets giving you a quick glimpse of some of the merchandise on sale. It is definitely worth coming back for another look.
Great ride and Service. Lovely train ride! ON time, Clean, great service and stunning views. Haven't been on a train in years, this was fun.

Very entertaining ride from Machu Picchu. After trekking for four days into Machu Picchu, this train ride to Ollentaytampu was a cultural delight. What a beautiful narrow gauge railway experience. We were treated to traditional dancing, a fashion show exhibiting gorgeous alpaca shawls and sweaters, as well a a light snack. ( Airlines definitely pale by comparison!) Very fun.

lots changed with Perurail!. Many reviews I read seemed on the negative, it's all based around the bus + train. As from the 1st of May according to an email from Perurail the train journey is now from Cusco to Machu Picchu. We had the bus part way 1.50hrs on a new bus the journey was fine. On board it's very professional. The return was fantastic with a meal, we arrived just outside Cusco and was given a taxi ride back. Loved the whole experience!

A great way to travel to Machu Picchu!. What a stunning train ride with excellent vision from windows and ceiling panels for photos of the surroundings as they gradually changed from snowy peaks to vibrant rain forest at lower levels. We were even served complimentary snacks and drinks and treated to a fashion show and colourful dancing on our way back to Cusco.

Adventure to Machu Picchu. The train ride to Machu Picchu was enjoyable. when tickets are booked you are assigned a specific seat number in a specific train compartment. seats were very comfortable with scenic skylight windows overhead, as well as large windows on the sides. Attendants serve hot and cold drinks and snacks included in the price of the rail ticket. The train ride took one and a half hours and came to the station exactly on time. The washroom was clean and shakey. Our attendants were Henry and Krishna and made the experience more fun.

slow slow but you get there. Gosh traveling in a train for the first time ever was pretty cool. Especially when we are on our way back to Cusco and our wagon's light never turn on, that was even better. We traveled in the dark for hours and that was just so relaxing. Service is great.

Riding the Vistadome. An excellent way to make a train ride enjoyable. If you can, reserve seats 1 and 2, which are in the first car (A), facing forward with views through a picture window. I snapped some excellent photos on the ride from Machu Picchu to Ollentaytampu.

Superb. Porky station has now reopened and it is only 20 minutes out of Cusco. Easy check in but please remember a passport or ID card. The journey there was just spectacular with a new view every few minutes each one better than the last. A light snack was also served. The return journey was in the dark but after about two hours music started and an animal character appeared dancing to the music. All great fun. Then after a further 10 minutes we had a fashion show carried out by the young train staff which was terrific. They were showing Peruvian fashion. It certainly livened up a dull return journey. All trains were on time.

Well worth the small extra. Fantastic views, especially of the river on the side. It felt wonderful to see the views on the sides of the top, something you can never see if you are on a regular train.

Builds the anticipation. Start with a coffee at el alberque in the station and enjoy the ride, as you go think....how did these explorers ever find Machu Pichu doing this journey by foot. The train ride is just another part of the magnificent journey to get there but it's only 90 minutes and not the orient express

A beautiful train ride to Machu Picchu on The Vistadome!. Prior to our trip,I had many emails with Daniel Calderon of PeruRail (We had to switch trains because we added my children to our trip after I first booked my ticket) . Daniel was very helpful and switched us easily to an alternate train which had space for my entire family.We left from Ollantaytambo which is a great city to visit. The train station there is just off the main street and the ruins of Ollantaytambo. Check in was very easy for our trip and , as they really don't allow a lot of baggage on these trains, we checked our bags at the station and left them there for 2 nights while we were in the Machu Picchu area. Although we were a little concerned about leaving our bags there, we had read many reviews that this was perfectly safe and we had a fine experience with their storage center at Ollantaytambo. When we arrived back in 2 days, we showed our luggage claim tickets and our bags were quickly located.The ride on Perurail to Machu Picchu is beautiful and the service is much like you would receive on an air plane. The attendants on the train serve drinks and sandwiches (included in the ticket price). The Vistadome has windows on the side and ceiling so that you can see the beautiful views all around. On the way back from Machu Picchu we were entertained by "Representative dances of the Andean Culture" by a character dressed in brightly colored clothing... I think his name is "Sacra" or he is doing the Sacra dance. Also, throughout the trip there is peaceful peruvian flute music playing. It was a very enjoyable trip. One tip, if you can get seats 1 and 2 in the "A" car, they spin around once the train starts and now you have a front row seat with a glass window. My two young daughters had these seats on the way back. What a view!

train up to machu picchu. I think the whole taxi to train station, if you stay in urubamba they charge about $35 us from the hotels to ollantaytambo station, we got our own back for $5, the train up you have to book a specific time??also exspensive and then another cost for the bus up after the 1.30 min train $20 each, then the tickets in to picchu.... think its all way over prices, beautiful but way over prices o and you'll need to stay in a hotel at least for one night, best place and closest to the train is olllantaytambo town....the sacred valley is beautiful from afar, but once down into it, its run down and very dirty...we did get a great honest driver from cuzco and he even came back to pick us up to take us back to the airport in cuzco, he did speak a little english, but was so kind, he charged 100 soles the hotel wanted 250 to get us back...1.30min drive...his name was fredy email poly2205@hotmail.com he is based in cuzco area, you will need someone you trust there...there are a lot of very shady cab drivers or fredy m.s. on facebook didnt try it but this is the contact he gave.. cell 980 362016 or 989724095

Worth your money!. We took this train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes (the route was shortened due to the rainy season) and had a good experience. We knew that a snack was included but were pleasantly surprised with breakfast during the ride. The staff was courteous and helpful. Overall was our preferred train while on the area.

Nice train, but super pricey for what it is. Nice train, but super pricey for what it is. The company has a monopoly on transport in and out of Aguas Calientes, so it is what it is. A complete omnimodal experience from Cusco airport to Machu Picchu (taxi, bus, train, walking).

Great views - well worth the extra $$. My friend and I debated about what train to take when we visited Machu Piccu. Many of the reviewers said that the Adventure class was fine not to bother with the added expense of the VistaDome. But I have to disagree. We ended up taking the Adventure class on the way there and it was fine but hard to see the spectacular views unless you were sitting by the window. Then we took the VistaDome on the way back and it was amazing. It was great to be able to see the snow covered mountains easily. The seats were set in groups of 4 and seemed to have a lot more room than the ones that all faced forward on the other train. We got served drinks and a snack which was a nice surprise.There was even a fashion show where they were selling alpaca wool clothing- little odd I thought but people seemed to be buying up a storm!
Great train ride. We enjoyed beautiful scenery on the way up to Machu Picchu. The train is great and we enjoyed it. Food is available on the train

Great train, less great bus. We were heading from Aguas Calientes back to Cuzco. The Vistadome portion of the route was lovely. The scenery is beautiful and the train is very comfortable. They should skip the native dance and fashion-show (clothing sale) and let the passengers enjoy the ride.Because of the time of year, the train does not go all the way to Cuzco. Instead, the passengers must transfer to buses for the second half of the route. The bus was crowded. When we boarded only the last row was available, and it was uncomfortable. None of the interior lights worked, so reading was not an option.

VistaDome was very enjoyable.. The Cusco track is under repair, so they bus you from Cusco to the Pacha station. This takes about 1 hr 45 min to 2 hrs. And then when you return it is the same. Other than that inconvenience the train is very clean. The views are incredible. They also serve a snack. We were very impressed.
great service and view. It is the best option. it is very comfortable, good service and food is good, not much but tasty. the windows on ceiling help to have a better and clean view.
Long train trip. Scenic trip with some entertainment and snack provided by the staff. Bus connection to Cusco was long and windy.

Worth the upgrade. We took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Caliente. We were offered a "snack" tray which was more like a small meal. We had fresh fruit, Quinoa pancakes with a berry syrup, cactus fruit and, what I think was a spinach quiche.All was very tasty.The seats were oversized and leather. Plenty of elbow room for everyone.I think the star of the train is the large windows on the roof that allows you a great view as you travel through the Andes.The return was a little different. Same big seats and lighter snacks. A pesto sandwich and dry cinnamon roll. All the seats were facing forward on the return. Yes, they do a little fashion show to sell their alpaca products,but it was fun and the train crew were having a good time. Buy, don't buy...there is no pressure.

Comfortable ride with excellent views. We rode the afternoon train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and were surprised that we were offered complimentary coffee/tea and fresh fruit. You can also purchase hot food at the station and the restrooms there were clean. There is a large handicraft/souvenir market at the Aguas Calientes station. We purchased some good quality embroidered pillow covers there.We also rode the afternoon train from Aguas Calientes to Cusco (the last segment was via bus). We were served focaccia bread with pizza type topping and a yucky dessert pastry. The selection food at the Aguas Calientes station was limited (sandwiches and empanadas). There was a fashion show which we enjoyed. Our train car was a bit rowdy so it was fun. Be sure to use the restroom on the train if you will travel by bus for the last segment since you will want to go immediately from the train to one of the buses.

Comfortable ride to Machu Picchu town. most comfortable train i have been on, food was just OK and the entertainment cheesy, plus you have to sit thru a fashion show where they try and sell you Alpaca stuff, but the comfort and views are incredible. only issue is that these trains run on different times than the normal express ones, so if timing is critical, maybe suffer the lower class train for a better commute time

Extremely helpfull staff. We arrived two minutes late at Macho Picchu station because of the long buses lines (it was Eastern holiday). As we were informed that we had missed the train, Perurail staff immediately calm us down. Thanks for Jorge Rojas that in spite of the busy day w/ full trains was able to find 4 seats for us in the next available train w/ no additional costs.

The right way to go to Aguas Calientes. If you can't do the Inca Trail, this is the way to get into Aguas Calientes. The train was very clean and very comfortable and it's wide open windows allow you to see the amazing views of the Inca landscape.

Fantastico!!. Was on the tren from MP to Ollantaytambo and it was clean, efficient and the staff of: Sergio, Sixto and Michell were amazing! One of the chicas in our group was placed in another coche and Sergio did everything he could to help place her with us! The food, dancing and fashion show were entertaining and really helped to pass the time. You could tell that all three of these incredible ppl enjoyed what they were doing. Gracias Sergio, Sixto y Michell for making this a memorable experience!!

Nice train ride. At a cost of just $10 more than the expedition train, the vistadome is worth it. It's more spacious seating with seats that recline and a meal service, with a nice table fronting your seat. The staff will load and unload your suitcases for you, which is something you have to do yourself on the expedition train. The windows are much larger on the vistadome as compared to the expedition, so enjoying the views is much easier. The only downside is that a seat is assigned to you at random; it would be nice to choose seats yourself, especially when traveling as a couple or a family.

The Perfect way to see the route to Machu Picchu. This service was the perfect way to see the route to Machu Picchu. The train runs on schedule and during the trip you will be entertained with a fashion show.

it's worth it!. really enjoyed the service on board while admiring the beatiful scenery, sitting in comfortable seats... a bit expensive, but worth it (for now it is a bimodal service will be even better when its the train all tthe way)
Great train ride!. Beautiful views as you go to and from Machu Picchu! Wonderful staff on the train who are most helpful with your luggage.

Great Service and Comforts. We took the Vistadome to Agua Calientas for our day trip to Machu Pichu. If possible take the first train out. Arrive early at the station as you can purchase steaming note coffee and delicious empanadas at the coffee stand in the waiting area. The train itself is spotless and offers reserved seating. The seats face in both directions. If you are someone who gets motion sick, make sure to book a forward facing seat.Once on the train you are offered drinks and a snack (similar to a flight). Bathrooms are large and clean. The windows are spotless and allow you to enjoy the changing scenery as you head to Machu Pichu.The ride home offers its own rewards!!! The snacks were plentiful, including a "pizza" slice as were the drinks. There was even a dancing devil and a fashion show featuring some of the nicest alpaca shawls / sweaters we had seen.All in all a wonderful experience

Great way to arrive @ Machu Pecchu. Well worth the extra $$$ to take the Vistadome train to and from Machu Pecchu. It was very comfortable and provided excellent viewing of the Inka sites as well as the Andes mountains.

Great Ride but Fashon Show is a Negative. We took the Vistadome one-way from Aguas Calientes to Cusco. The scenery is amazing, the service is good, and the seats are more than comfortable. The only negative was the fashion show in the middle showcasing overpriced Alpaca garments.

Enjoyable ride. We took the train to Aguascalientes caliente which is gateway to Machu Picchu. It was a very pleasant ride. I bought a very nice photo vest on the train with 18 pockets. Ride took 1 1/2 hours.

Rail tickets. I had to reschedule purchased rail tickets due to sickness and Kirvi Mendoza at Perurail was very helpful with this process. I had to pay a small fee, but it was definitely worth it. The whole process took about 5 minutes. Thanks again for your help.

Great views - but the in the aisle sales are terrible.. Took the luxury train up the hill. Was fine going up - nice views. BUT the coming down, they stop the train and provide so really stupid entertainment and then they have a "fashion show" and try to sell you products. You are a captured audience. If you do not like this sort of stuff - take the other train. Next time we - would just to avoid the distraction. Would have had a higher rating except for these items.

A Good Way to Go. Traveled on the Vistadome from Cuzco to Machu Picchu (took the Hiram Bingham back) They serve a nice snack (included), service was punctual, no problems. Lots of huge windows to enjoy the scenery. No complaints.

Just perfect. When in doubt of what train I should chose I finally decided for the Vistadome which was quite perfect. The seats were comfy and spacious, the food was delicious, the people working were very kind and the view was breathtaking!

OK experience, with some caveats. Since the train is the only way to get to Machu Picchu if you do not hike the trail, and Peru Rail was the service that offered trains at the time we wanted--Peru Rail it was (we took the Vistadome). When we visited they were running the "bi-modal" service, which involves catching a small shuttle bus from the Cuzco train station, driving to a temporary rail station, and waiting for a train there. My understanding is that this had to do with persistent flooding, but it was something of a pain. The train itself was clean and there were small bathrooms in the car. Service as attentive and drinks and snacks are served at no cost. Be warned that the train moves fairly slow, though the view is enjoyable. On our trip from Machu Picchu to Urabamba, we were subjected to some sort of entertainment from an attendant in costume, followed by a fashion show by another attendant of Peruvian goods for sale, accompanied by loud music. Could have done without that. The train stopped for quite a long time in Ollantaytambo on our return trip. The service was probably overpriced, but nothing that shocked an American used to Amtrak pricing.

Beautiful views and great service. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and it was worth the extra price. The views are gorgeous, the seats are very comfortable and the staff is friendly. They offer a snack and a drink on the way. If it is daytime, the Vistadome is well worth it!

A really special experience. Never to be forgotten!. We started from Cusco by coach as the first part of the track is closed in wet season due to the risk of landslides. We boarded the train after 8am. We were served a very attractive tray of food after clothes had been laid on the table. The scenery is amazing, interesting and varied. It includes mountains, villages, streams, waterfalls and raging torrents. The hotel bell boys meet the train and take your luggage so that the afternoon can be spent at Machu Picchu.On the return journey food was again provided as well as a fashion show and the opportunity to purchase garments but there was no pressure to buy

Clean trains and nice views. We took the bus from Cusco and jumped on the train in Pachar. All in all quite a hike to get from Cusco to Machu Picchu. The train worked nicely. We booked tickets online months in advance and when we had a problem with payment Peru rail was very responsive, with personal emails from a staff at Peru rail. The train is clean and one can see well from all places. On minus: unlike airlines, Peru rail does not allow you (or at least it did not allow us) to pre-select seats. So our family of 5 was scattered around in the car.

Enjoy the beauty of the river valley on your way to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome train is the only way to go, when it comes to your ride to Aguas Calientes. We boarded the train at Ollantaytambo for the 1 1/2 hour ride along the river to the town at the foot of Machu Picchu. Keep your camera close to get great photographs of the amazing scenery as you travel by.

Great experience and ride. Just got back from Peru. We took the Vistadome both ways from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu. Originally we were suppose to take the Vistadome to Machu Picchu and Expedition back but due to a mistake on end for our tickets to Machu Picchu, we had to change to the service to Vistadome on both direction. The change fee did cost us $15 each plus the additional fare. For us, we really enjoyed the Vistadome. From Ollanta, there was only two train cars. Our train departed at 8:10am (Sun) and there was maybe 35 people in both cars. On the return, the Vistadome service maybe had 15 people (6:10pm). The whole second car was empty. Compared to the Expedition, the cars were empty. The Expedition service departed before us and it appeared very popular with tour groups and was full. Same on the return. Also it seems that Peru Rail attaches Expedition cars to their regular domestic cars. For our times, the cost difference between Vistadome and Expedition was about $12 each direction. I thought that price was worth the extra relaxation. I guess seat assignments were also randomly picked. Because the cars are random and attached randomly, nobody seems to know in advance which side you are traveling. The seat numbers cannot be changed. However with an empty car, you can move around and the staff was able to give their advise on which seats provided the best views. We were able to secure seats 1,2 on both direction. Those seats are the first row and provided excellent views, same as the conductor. So essentially you have the front view from the train. For seat 1,2 , be aware the seat back on the seat can be switched to the direction of the train. If you are unable to secure the first or last row, then the left side has the better view to Machu Picchu. In case anyone wonders, the snack going there was a small meat sandwich, cookie and non-alcoholic drink selection. On the way back, same drink service and some spinach roll with desert pastry. The service was great and we definitely go again.Oh I forgot to mention: If you sit towards the rear of the train in the second car, there could be a distinctive smell of diesel fuel. We had to move closer to the middle after one hour sitting in the last row because she was becoming nauseous.

Excellent ride through the mountains!. We took the Vistadome train one way and Expedition the other way. The trains go slow enough that one can enjoy the sprawling greenery and the beautiful views of the mountains and the valleys. They served some snacks which were quite good and the train staff were generally very nice. I would recommend going to Poroy from Cusco by cab and taking the train to Machu Picchu. The views are gorgeous and the ride is so relaxing. The Vistadome that is slightly more expensive has glass roofs as an added advantage.Pros:- Gorgeous views of the mountains and the valley. - Trains have good seating and clean restrooms.- Complimentary snacks provided although it won't suffice for someone who is hungry.- The train staff are warm and welcoming.Cons:- No cons really, but to throw something out there, train moves slow so while the distance isn't much it feels like it's taking forever.

Good train ride. Took the bus/train ride from Cusco to Machu Picchu. Since it was the only way to get there, it is priced that way. The train is comfortable with seats facing forward and reverse. We shared a table with a mother/daughter from Chile. My husband speaks spanish so it was not a problem for us, but a 2 hour train ride could get uncomfortable if you cannot converse with your seat partners. The sights were amazing along the river. We had questions about the plants and found out the employees can take classes about the plant life to answer our questions. Great service that PeruRail offers. Our train ended up being a hour late as the engine had problems. There were no offers to allow us extra time or a partial refund as we only had a short amount of time to get to Machu Picchu before we had to leave.

all aboard on the choo choo. We took the Vistadome Train as part of our tour and were pleased with the experience. Since we were staying overnight in Aquas Callientes, we just carried two backpacks. Others brought along roll-aboard size suitcases. The scenery is great and there are many opportunities to snap photos, but train does not make any “photo opportunity” stops. On the return trip, several of the train staff dressed in costume while others modelled various Alpaca clothing. We found the music during this catwalk experience to be loud, so we glad that we had some earplugs.

Beautiful Journey. We took the Vistadome to Machu Pichhu and the Hiram Bingham on the way back. The Vistadome train itself was very comfortable and the large glass expanse allowed for great viewing of the spectacular scenery on the way. A small meal was provided as well. Right now they are providing a bimodal form of transportation with a long, almost two hour, bus ride half of the way there with the Vistadome only providing the final half of the trip. The benefit of this is that the bus departs from the main train station in Cuzco and we could walk to it from our hotel, the JW Marriott. The normal train depot for the Vistadome would be the Poroy Station which is over a 30 minute drive outside of Cuzco so one would have to pay for a long taxi ride to get there. That being said the bus ride was very uncomfortable. The bus was not air conditioned and the roads were horrible with all sorts of construction. Unfortunately we were sitting in the rear of the bus and were severely jostled for most of the bus journey. We couldn't wait to get off that bus.

Fun experience, great staff. We visited Cusco and Machu Picchu during the rainy season so we had bi-modal transport experience: bus halfway and train the other half. The staff on the train were very professional and pleasant. The food served on board was delicious and fresh tasting.We went with the vistadome car and it was great seeing the whole perspective. The transfer from bus to train was smooth and effortless. The trains ran on time as well.

spectacular journey. amazing views between train station and machupichu. people very nice offering food and beberages. Additionally there was a cultural show inside del train including local songs, dancing, and even a improvised runway offering local made clothes.Congratulations

too touristy, slow and expensive. since there is no other alternative going to Machu Picchu we had to take this train. It was expensive at $70 pp one way for a 1.5 hr journey. They had some entertainment with local dancers on the train but in my opinion not worth the money. The meals are small and inadequate with no vegetarian options. The train is too slow considering that the distance covered is only 50 miles. I wish Perurail is reading this and can offer a faster, cheaper, less touristy alternative to Machu Picchu.

Travelling to (Aguas Calientes) Machu Picchu in style. We were lucky enough to have the front seats on this wonderful train. the trip follows the Urabamba River which races through the gorge and continues through the centre of Aguas Calientes. An enjoyable trip.

More than expected. The train was very comfortable and with all the windows, always a good view. The staff set a lovely table using native design woven place mats and a small container of flowers. The snack was more than expected and just enough. The airlines could take a note from Peru Rail.
awesome views on the way back. we used this train because we hear so many thing about the train and we really enjoyed they offer a show and music.very nice esperience after Machupicchu

Interesting Train Ride. One reaches Machu Pichu only by train. This is the middle priced option and the cost is reasonable. There is a luxury train, whish is very expensive. And there is a so-called backpackers/locals train which is considerably cheaper. This is a 3 hour train ride. Be sure to get seats on the left-hand side in the direction of travel to Machu Pichu. The views will be substantially better.  We were served a small meal and drinks for our 8:30 departure, like a mid-morning snack. A shopping cart is wheeled through the cars for sundry purchases. Quite unexpectedly, my wife found a photographer's/safari vest with large,multi-pockets which she bought. She had been looking for just this kind of vest for years.  BTW, luggage space is limited on the train, so you'll want to take just enough clothes for your few days in Machu Pichu.

For the non hikers who want to see Machu Picchu. Taking the train to Aguas Calientes at the base of Machu Picchu, not from Cusco but from Ollanyatambo cuts off a very long ride. Take the first leg of the trip from Cusco on a bus, then the train with its skylights and be sure to allow at least an extra hour or two or maybe even an overnight to enjoy the Pueblo before taking the bus up to the ruins.This pueblo with no motorized vehicles is full of great restaurants, a wonderful market, steep hill sidewalks and a hot springs spa at the top. Enjoy.I had the luxury of a full day there to appreciate the daily life of the hard working locals.

Very Nice Trip. The view was nice and the tables for groups of four and small table for two was nice and spread out the number of people in a car so did not feel crowded even when full. Half of the people travel in reverse which was a negative for us since we enjoy watching the country side.

A Right Priced Option for Getting to Machu Picchu. We were staying in Urubamba at the Tambo del Inca. This excellent hotel has its own train station for the Vistadome, which departs once a day in the morning. The station is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel and the bellmen carry your bags to the station. There were only 6 of us departing from the hotel. After an hours ride, the train stopped in Ollantaytambo where the rest of the passengers boarded, filling the train to capacity. If you can book seats 1 and 2, you have the added bonus of sitting at the front window of the train, and have views to the side, above and front, offering an unparalleled ride to Agues Calente. The alternative is the Hiram Bingham train which is more luxurious, but extremely expensive. The Vistadome offers better views, simple complementary snacks, and is a much better value. On the way back from Agues Calente, the Vistadome Staff do a silly fashion show of alpaca wool items available for sale, and have recorded music and a local legend jester dancing around the train and engaging the riders to dance in the isle. The best part of the ride is the view along the way, which the Vistadome delivers the best. On the way back to Urubamba, after all of the other passengers got off the train at Ollantaytambo, my companion and I had the train all to ourselves on the last leg of the trip back to Urubamba. The Tambo del Inca bellman was waiting for us at the station to carry our bags back to the hotel.

convenient and easy way to see Machu Picchu. Great way to see Machu Picchu in one-two days. This time we were returning from Inca Trail (in January), and it was just a comfortable train ride. However next time I will surely take the train once again, and surely during the day - to see the mountains from the windows on top of the wagons.I also wanted to say tremendous thank you to Arnaldo Ponce de Leon, the train station manager at Aguas Calientes, who really went out of his way and made everything to help us when we missed our train due to timetable change. He helped us a lot, and was able to accomodate us on a later train, and our whole group is extremely grateful to him for that.
Great Train Ride. I had a blast, Great service from Michelle and Paulino and great experience overall. They feed you, which is more than most airlines will do, and the scenery is fantastic.

Comfortable with a fantastic view.. We took the Vistadome up to mucchu picchu. The seats are comfortable and service on board is excellent. The glass windows and glass roof provides a wonderful view of the andes mountains on the way up.
Great experience.... Great service...the Vistame crew, Juan Manoel,Yulianna,Julio cesar,Daisaku,Mishel and Raul made our trip fun....

Great way to travel to Macchu Pichu. A lovely start to our visit on board this train setting out from Ollantaytambo which is a delightful village in the Sacred Valley. The on-board music helped to create a great atmoshere as we travelled alongside the river.Make sure you have seats on the left facing the engine to take good photos.The station at Agua Calientes has a huge craft market to visit before/after Macchu Picchu everything reasonably priced.

Great views, good ride and good service. I rode the Vistadome as part of a tour that went to Cusco and Machu Picchu. It was a comfortable ride with on time departures, great views and very good friendly service. In one way the attendants offered diferent articles (I bought a DVD with a book of Machu Picchu) and in the return trip they put a "fashion show" displaying typical Peruvian made clothing. These were very nice and many passengers bought some of the clothing articles.

Great help from the staff!. A friend and I were coming back from Machu Picchu on the train and had a problem with our tickets. Everyone was very helpful in fixing the problem, but one of the staff was especially helpful. Alonso Saavedio Valiente went out of his way to talk with the ticket counter and with others to solve our problem. He was exceptionally helpful and kind in solving the problem!

Outstanding!. Delightful staff: stunning scenic journeys: perfect organisation. Very clean and comfortable. Tasty snacks and drinks served free. Arranged from the UK everything worked perfectly even down to the printing of the seating cards!Repairs are being made to a part of the line at present (March 2014) but even the bus part of the journey had incredible scenery. It is about a three and a half hour journey in total, currently half by bus, but the time just flew. The 'fashion show' was fun and taken as such! A very pleasant and comfortable journey both ways to and from Machu Picchu through the valleys amongst stunning Andean scenery and raging rivers: not to be missed.

No complaints. We took the 3pm train from the Hydro Electronico to Aguas Calientes. We were the only ones in the carriage, which was dedicated to tourists (cost was US$22), with the other carriages for locals who obviously paid less. It was a nice comfortable ride and the train left on time. We had our own conductor who took care of us.Coming back from Aguas Calientes to AllientoTabo on the 6.10pm, the train was full, and we were entertained by a fashion parade and a dancing clown (see my pictures). Snacks and drinks were also provided. The cost was US$82.

Train is nice, dances/sales pitch is ridiculous considering the price. With the caveat that I used to live in Peru when rail service to Aguas Calientes existed at a fraction of the price...(which, for the record, was nothing fancy but just fine.)The sticker shock of the new train prices was a little hard to swallow. We took the vistadome train to Aguas Calientes. This time of year (wet season), they shut down part of the rail line so we took the "intermodal" service --ticket includes a bus leaving from the the train station in Cuzco that you take all the way to the station outside Ollantaytambo where you get on the train. [If you want to take the competing train services this time of year, it's probably a bit cheaper and Inca rail runs a deal with bus line Cruz del Sur that connects to its trains, or you can just spent a night out in the sacred valley.] Vistadome does have lots of windows and a decent view. It was a clean and modern train. We were unfortunately not seated on the side of the train nearest the river, which I wish we had requested. My husband is a nature nut so basically got up to stand elsewhere to take pictures of a few birds and animals along the way. There wasn't much space for him to do this. They also serve a breakfast and a return snack on the Vistadome (included in ticket)--not amazing but if you are hungry with the early departure, it's a welcome addition. For the money, it'd be nice if they also had a snack on the bus ride and didn't charge ridiculous amounts of money for coffee/tea at the train station where you have to wait between the bus ride and boarding the train. A day trip to MP is about a 12 hour endeavor.On the way back from Aguas Calientes, they did this stupid song/dance/style show thing on thr train where they made Peru Rail employees model various types of Alpaca clothing--scarves, coats, etc. We were all exhausted and would have appreciated peace and quiet to nap vs another sales pitch, especially considering how expensive the train ticket was. (And they were pressuring the nice couple next to us to buy something, outrageous!)And no folks--this expensive train ticket isn't doing much of anything to support Machu Picchu. Peru rail is privately owned these days so we're just lining someone's pockets (I believe Orient Express Hotels Ltd. to be exact--also the owner of El Monestario in Cuzco and a bunch of other fancy hotels worldwide.)In short, the train was just fine, but very expensive. The competition is slightly cheaper but not a whole lot either. I'd appreciate cutting the sales pitch, especially considering the ticket price.

A little corny, but provides good views. Wonderfully comfortable ride to Machu Picchu. Bring your own snacks. Oddly, there is music playing during the ride. So, be sure to bring your headphones just in case. The ride back had a fashion show wheee they were promoting Peruvian made shawls, scarves and sweaters. Totally unnecessary. At least they were pushy when you said no thank you. Use the time to organize pictures and write in your travel journal.

Unbelievable views. The views of green velvet mountains, glacial lakes, and the Rio Sagrado were breath taking. My camara just kept clicking. The snacks were interesting but the service was lack luster.

Narrow Guage Railroad Trains Run Slow. I took a Vistadome train from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu (MP) and back. We traveled along an angry river on our way to MP. Make sure you sit on the left side of the train on the way up and on the right side of the train on the return trip. The views are exciting along the river. This river has class four or five rapids almost all the time we were on the train. Due to the narrow guage tracks the train ran rather slow which was fine because you could enjoy the Andes Mountains as were traveled up the Sacred Valley. We were exposed to very impressive eye opening and brain teasing views during the hour and a half train ride. The dome windows were an asset because we could comfortably see the high towering mountains that we were traveling through. The Andes dancing troupe on the return trip was almost worth the cost of a train ticket. Their fashion show and dancing was awesome.

Vistadome does NOT look like this picture. Round-trip was NOT on the train pictured here or on PeruRail's website. I don't know how many "Vistadome" trains there are, but we did not see any train looking like the above either going to or returning from Machu Picchu. I wish I had purchased tickets on the Expedition train instead to save money. :(To add insult to injury, on the return trip not only were we not in seats facing one another as shown in the pictures (though they did exist in the car), I had to sit in a row separate from my kids! One of two major disappointments during our Machu Picchu trip. As the person funding this trip on a small budget, the expense of the "Vistadome" train really bothered me. The kids still had fun.

Unique forget the orient express. What a great train I wanted to take the Hiram Bingham train but my tour advisor Hernan at Pachamama Expeditions persuaded me to take the Vistadome. He was right. The Hiram Bingham has small windows the vista dome has huge windows both on the sides of the train and on the roof. The staff are amazing. On way to Machu Picchu they served a lovely meal of pancakes and fruit and on the way home we had Andean costumed dancing and a fashion show! Excellent

rains & landslides in the rainy season. I had purchased the tickets in advance on the "Peru Rail" web-site. Just before I was to fly to Cusco and take the train to Aquas Calientes, that is the town at the base of Machu Pichu, I got an e-mail from Peru Rail, that we would have to be taking the train at another station. In order to get to that station I had to take a bus from the outskirts of Cusco and travel an hour to catch the train. I later discovered that they had actually thought of canceling the trip. It looks like they had had some landslides and some of the passes were blocked. So we took a taxi from Cusco Plaza to the bus meeting point, then meandered through many little villages to get to the Train Connection. Once on the train we were in luxury with food and drinks and enjoyable conversation with passengers, on the way to Aguas Calientes. The trip took longer than planned, but they got us there! I am impressed with "Peru Rail". By the way, at the Lima Airport there is a "Peru Rail" office. If you have questions about your ticket and times, better to ask them there. They also have a great map of the area.
No place to hide from sun. The staff tries hard - on the way from MP they were fun. Not so going to MP, sour bunch. The tourist groups are loud and take over spoiling the fun for the rest.

Fabulous views and far easier than walking. The trains are efficient and comfortable. It is a narrow gauge railway and the train has to go quite slowly as it winds it's way to Machu Picchu. You are served snacks and drinks and the windows in the roof allow you to see the scenery from all angles. It is a great way to travel to an even better sight in Machu Picchu.

Very comfortable train. Great windows in the ceiling to see all the countryside on the way to Machu Pichu. Book ahead at any Peru rail keyosk. Avoid travel agents who add all kinds of extras that you can do on your own for free.
As Good as it can be. With The Small exception of timing issues and bimodal service handicap they are very hospitable. Trains are very well maintained. Staff is perfect.

Best ride for the buck!. As fellow travellers agree, if you're going to go from Cusco to Machu Picchu return, the added comfort this train provides is very welcomed, knowing we had to do a taxi from the hotel to the train station, a 2h bus ride to the actual train as it was rainy season and the train doesn't make it all the way to cusco… From there, another 2 buses after the train, which includes a transfer mid-way up to Machu Picchu because of a landslide… So again, Vistadome; meal, entertainment and added comfort are well deserved on your way to and from this amazing place!!! Hope this review was helpful!!!

Excellent way to head to Machu Picchu!. This was a great way to view the scenery enroute to Machu Picchu. We had a bi modal experience due to landslides in the rainy season. The bus and train experience was flawless. Perurail linked the services and there were buses waiting at the destination points for easy transfer of entire trains. They were magnificent.The lunch or afternoon tea food and beverage service is a nice touch as you happily snap photographs all the way to the final destination. On the return journey fashion parades and amusement occurs within the carriages as a way to entertain whilst waiting for trains to pass as it is a single track with passing loops.

Very nice trip. Very comfortable and pretty trip. We had a great view of the raging river. We had to sit with strangers who did not speak English or Spanish, so ad bit odd, but we ignored them. Decent onboard service, nothing overly special, but meets needs. I would have rather have taken the Hiram Bingham tran round tirp. I took the Vistadome to Aguascalientes and the Hiram Bingham back.

Comfortable and relaxing. We caught the Vistadome from...Olante station to Machu Picchu in Peru ....the train ride was in the first carriage, comfortable seats, staff on board gave us beverages and a lunch bread roll.Scenery along the way was absolutely beautiful....so a very relaxing train ride.

Another Fabulous Rail Journey. This is the upmarket train provided by Peru Rail, well worth taking as it's definitely one up on the ordinary Expedition train, you even get entertainment from the staff and a fashion show as well, best thing? seeing the sacred valley again on the way down from Machu Picchu

Great way to get to Machu Picchu. Loved the opportunity to ride this train as part of our Machu Picchu adventure. Our group enjoyed the sites along the way. Interesting to pass by farms and homes, etc. to see rural Peruvian life. Very relaxing. Food and beverages were provided as part of the ticket price and were tasty.Fashion show was OK.-- could have done without it. Resented the "hard sell" of the staff. They had a difficult time taking no for an answer.Would recommend the Vistadome as a great way to get to Machu Picchu.

What an Experience!. If you have daylight to travel to or from Machu Picchu, spend the extra money (@76.00 PP) to take the Vistadome train. The views are magnificent plus, there's entertainment, elegant table settings, above- average food-truly an experience in itself!
Train to Machu Picchu.. You pay an extra 100 dollars but it is a must. The ride is beautiful, following the very fast moving Urumbaba river.

Great Train Trip. That was a great trip, slowly defending from Cusco to Machu Picchu through some quite poor villages showing normal Peruvian life, and really fantastic vistas across beautifull jagged mountains and fast moving rivers, a great eye opener. We were presented with some small but tasty dishes for the journey and a fashion show, they have learned about service probably from the Americans who travel there.

The Fashion Show Was A Riot. Took the Vistadome with my 2 daughters up and back to Machu Pichu. This is a must do activity if you have the cash and are not keen on the Explorer version of trekking and roughing it. A nice breakfast service was offered as part of the ticket. My daughter loved the spinach quiche. Overall very comfort transport, although they do stop the train in both directions to sell local and train line wares to the patrons. The fashion show is a hoot, with some crazy character jumping around and dancing before the attendants don the make shift runway to exhibit and sell Peruvian coats and such. It was really fun!

Fantastic Train!. We decided on the Vistadome instead of the Hiram Bingham mainly because of the price. It's a good thing we did! Part of the route was closed due to the rainy season and the mudslides. So, we had to go to the bus station (instead of the Poroy Train Station) and board a bus that took us to the train station in Pachar. So, the bus cut 1.5 hours off of our train ride which would have been horrible if we would have gone on the HB. Of course, there's no guarantee when you do book the train as to what tracks will be available. On the way to MP, the train was superb and very comfortable. They had a nice snap on board as well. On the way back, we also went on the Vistadome, but for some reason we had an older train and not as appealing. Still, we would go again on the Vistadome without fail!

Nice Way to Relax after the inca Trail. We took the Vistadome home after our 4 day Inca Trail hike and enjoyed it. They provide a nice snack and a little show, scenery is nice and you get a little more room than you would on the regular train. I wish you didn't have to take a bus for the final leg of your journey though....why do the trains only go so far?? The 1 hr and 40 min bus ride was a little painful. We made it though!

Wonderful views. We had to do the "bi-modal" trip - part bus part train due to the raiany season. Both parts were very well coordinated. The views from the Vistadome are excellent and the seats comfortable. Staff is attentive, unfortunately (for us and them) they are asked to try and sell you some PeruRail stuff.

The way to go.. We opted to start at the stop closest to Cusco and are we are glad we did. The 3 hour trip goes by quite fast, its very scenic and comfortable.They served us coffee, pancakes, and a small quiche. It was all good (but small potions) You can also buy coffee and food at the private train station you start out from in there Starbucks style cafe. Its all rather pricey but everything about machu picchu is... You also will meet some good people on the train as most seats are set up in a diner booth style with two seats facing each other and a table in between you.We did the entire thing as a day trip from Cusco and didn't feel rushed at all.
What a view!. Take the train! It's an experience in itself! Try to make sure you get a window seat! The views are amazing...train is very comfortable and they even serve a snack.

Comfortable scenic ride!. We enjoyed the slow, winding train ride in a vista dome cabins, watching the scenery. They served some snacks. Return ride had a fashon show and expensive dresses to buy. Glad that my wife did not fall for that.

Major delays, but nice trains and good service. Our vistadome train had major delays due to landslides from rainy season - but they gave us complimentary breakfast to help make up for it, and the service was otherwise wonderful. Very helpful and responsive. They did try to sell stuff often though - going through the cabins with different items.

nice trip through a spectacular area. After having travelled on the Andean Explorer, the Vistadome was not as impressive. However, it was certainly comfortable and the Sacred Valley offers unparalleled scenery. Remember that you can't bring any big luggage with you (although I saw some people do so). A knapsack was all we brought. Also know that if you want to get on at Ollantaytambo, you can take a Cruz del Sur bus from Cusco to Ollanta. This route just started recently and is great if you want to travel using this route.

Train, ushers, and attendants very good, why to have a bus ride?. We took Vistadome because it's the only option you have to get to Macchupichu as a foreigner. It is pretty pricey, but unfortunately it's the only way to get there. My husband and I had done this trip many years ago when the old trains were running. We were certainly amazed by the views of the mountains from the train . The food is nothing crazy and a little small, but it's local, and if you ask they will explain what it is in it and you will understand why it is being served... all Andean ingredients. The ushers were really accommodating... our friend and us were sitting in different cars and they accommodated us to be sitting next to each other both ways. The attendants on the train were fun and responded all of our questions. Ambar Moscoso, Carlos Ramirez and Rogers Miranda entertained us with dances and music, and then a "fashion like show". At the end of the show they offered alpaca items... it's entertaining considering it's pitch dark outside, and you are stuck in the train. I am really sad that the train doesn't go all the way up to Cusco... the zigzag of the lines was very original. I am also kind of upset at the inefficiency of the travel agencies to coordinate the minimum amount of buses to go back to Cusco.... some of the buses and minibuses carry 2-3 people which is a waste of resources and definitely an increase carbon footprint.

Excellent views cheesy fashion show. Clean, relaxing, decent food, INCREDIBLE VIEWS! All was wonderful until a guy in a crazy costume started to dance up and down the isle's before a cheesy fashion show. Keep it classy Vistadome…ditch the show!

Loved it!. Good seats and views, they serve hot drinks and a snack (although we didnt get any veg options), There is a hilarious fashion and dance show halfway and it was nice to have a few laughs after a hard day of trekking.
great views.... we had great time, we just order the upgrade to our company and they provide this train for a few extra dollars, we think we enjoyed better.

A Really Fun Time. On the return trip from Machu Pichu to Cusco not only were we treated to a comfortable ride with a light, but pleasant meal the crew then did a traditional dance with costumes for us. It was then followed by a Fashion Show put on by Crew Members: Gina Huay Tara, Fredy Fernando, and Alexander O'Viedo. Of course they were looking to sell some items, but I have to say they didn't apply lots of pressure and it certainly made the time pass. Great Fun!!!!

Fun way to get to Machu Picchu. Leaving from Cusco it is a three hour plus train ride to Machu Picchu Pueblo, but the time flies. The seats are comfortable and each four have a table. The table is put to good use when the very friendly staff serve you a tasty, small meal, both coming and going. On the return trip we were treated to a fashion show, the clothes in which were later carted down the aisle for sale. The views through the large windows and curving roof panels are lovely. It is a small gauge track and on our trip out, in which we were in the last of four cars, the sway was quite noticeable to someone like me who is prone to motion sickness. Although I never got ill it is something to keep in mind when you make your reservation.

Good train for Machu Picchu. Very comfortable and clean trains for macho Picchu. Took the train between Ollantaytambo and Aquas Caliente. On time service, clean cars. AWESOME views from the large windows and roof windows. They serve a snack and drinks on the train. Worth the little bit extra for the comfort over the Expedition class service.

Demons, dances and a runway? In a train? Really?. People complain about how expensive is this service. I don´t agree. Although the Vistadome is focused on tourists, people have other options more affordable, especially people who live and work in the area. Also tourism is the main source of income for this region so it´s not a bad idea to keep the business running.Said that, the Vistadome is a great experience. You have a great service and they provide entertainment (in the returning train). Local demons, dances and even a model runway is performed (I really appreciated they didn´t press people to buy).The scenic way is beautiful and I recommend to grab seats in the left side when you go to Aguas Calientes, so you can check the river all the time.I´m thankful to Rosmeri, Domingo and Carlos Rubén for making me laugh and have a great time.Muchas gracias amigos y os deseo mucha suerte. ¡Lo hacéis estupendo!

Not just any train ride. We had expected our train ride to be like any other form of transportation, but were quite surprised to find it so enjoyable and unique. We took the Vistadome to Aguas Calientes from Cusco (and back) and had great views, excellent service, and a fun trip.The train departs from Poroy station outside of Cusco, which is a 20+ minute taxi trip from the main square, but you can try counting stray dogs to pass the time en route. You'll need your passport and ticket to board the train. The Vistadome offers wide windows (including some on the ceiling) and plays interesting music the entire trip (including some catchy Andean flute songs that get progressively more like EDM as you get closer to Machu Picchu).A decent-sized meal is served on the train, and you'll pass through dozens of little towns, picturesque moments, and incredible views and before you know it you'll arrive in Aguas Calientes. On the return trip, there's a special performance that takes place after the Ollantaytambo stop, but I won't spoil the surprise.
Great Way To See The Canyon. The canyon walls are very tall and steep. The Vistadome allows you to see right through the roof. Great, awesome views.

Part of the experience, but way overpriced. The train ride was really nice with spectacular views! But, because they have such a monopoly there, they can charge whatever they want. So, be prepared to pay way more than it is worth. I should have bought my tickets ahead of time and booked the train that is a little less pricey. But, it's all part of the experience and in the end, I'm glad we got to ride it!

My Anniversary Trip. Train leaves on time. Be there with your passport and ticket. Train station gets pretty crowded. They provided us with a great meal on our way there. We were late by an hour as we encountered problems with one of the train compartments. Great views from the glass covered dome. On our way back we were provided with supper and drinks. Live entertainment in the form of dance and music and a fashion show.
Worth the Upgrade!. This is a lovely way to get to Machu Picchu!! The train is comfortable, well-maintained, clean, and affords beautiful views to its passengers.

Nice train but sloppy logistics. Comfortable train with high windows for stupendous views en route to Machu Picchu. Pleasant staff serve tasty snacks. We also took this Perurail train in july 2013 and experienced same problem. Rather than depart from Cuzco, we were advised to meet at another train station in order to catch a bus to Pachar, some 80 kms. Away, where we would board the train. The same procedures were employed on the return trip to Cuzco. The explanation given was that the rainy season affected the train's course, however in july there is no rainy season. The train fare is high, so one would expect premier service to and fro. Apparently there is a glitch which has not been repaired and is inexplicable. I would recommend travelers hire a car or van from Cuzco to Ollantaytambo and board the train to Machu Picchu from there. The same procedure for the return trip, but allow time to visit wonderful Inca ruin in Ollantaytambo.

Best train ride ever and fun from MP to Ollantataytambo. We had our best train ride ver from MP to Ollantataytambo(I hope I spelled it right). Train # 606, coach A, on January 3, 2014,many thanks to Esteban, Maribel, and Eufele for making it such a wonderful ride, teaching us about the Cusco region fashions and the culture of masks and what they mean. They took people dancing though the aisles, including our two daughters which enjoyed it tremendoulsy. Good Show!

The slow train to Machu Picchu. More comfortable than the backpackers' train though it takes the same length of time to get from Cusco to Aguas Calientes. The bigger windows afford a better view of the stunning mountain scenery.

Fabulous train ride, fabulous helping staff, mesmerizing journey. One of the best train rides I have taken. Comparable or even better than any of the several train rides I have taken in Switzerland. The staff is much more friendly and the ride through the mountains is mesmerizing. Also, they hold special events on the train... on our way back on Christmas, they had organized a fantastic fashion show with Peruvian costumes. Also, a free hot breakfast or snack (depending day of time) served in great style with linen & cutlery was a pleasant surprise. Must for every traveller
No vegetarian food. I took this train on the way back from Machu Picchu. There were no vegetarian options so be sure to bring snacks!

Wonderful experience!. Everything about the experience was worthy: the impeccable cabin service, the tasty food, the comfortable chairs and the amazing view of the Andes thru the windows and the glass ceiling. Just wonderful!!

Great views on the early train. The ride to Machu Picchu in the morning was great. The train had huge windows and we enjoyed the amazing views all the way through.However on the way back we were a bit disappointed. We were in a Expedition (lower tier) wagon instead of in the regular Vistadome we paid for. Also there was a fashion show that was somewhat loud and annoying after the long day of sighsteeing.

Excellent customer service. We've travelled on many trains all over the world. The Vistadome has been the best due to the exceptional service we received from the staff. In particular we'd like to give credit and thanks to Arnaldo Ponce de leos and his team. Fantastic service!

The best way to get to Aguas Callientes. The trip from Ollantaytambo to Aguas was very nice. They served a small snack on the train & the seating was comfortable. The trip from Aguas to Cusco was very long and arrived nearly 1 hour late in Cusco - I believe it is to allow to allow time for the selling of goods/ clothes on the train. The modelling of the clothes by the staff was very entertaining. On both trips there were a lot of unhappy customers with regard to the seating & staff had their hands full trying to organise alternative seating arrangements. Somehow as a party of 3 we did not have any problems. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Sit Back and Relax!. The Vistadome train provided a nice opportunity to sit back and relax while enroute to Aguas Calientes. First class seating with view out the sides and the top of the train. Most comfortable with superior service. Tasty snack took the edge off any hunger.

Great way to visit Machu Picchu - if you're friendly. We took the Vistadome train (PeruRail) from Cusco to Machu Picchu after having previously taken the normal rail cars. Vistadome is nice with the large windows and I believe upgraded service, but with few exceptions you will be staring across a small table at the people in the seats in front of you. If you're friendly (or family), that's great. Otherwise the 3.5 hour ride could be a bit annoying. You'll also be playing footsies. Next time we might take the regular cars (all seats facing the same way) instead. Also - the big Vistadome windows aren't much value if you take the last train back from MP in the dark.
Train to Machu Picchu. This is a very comfortable train and there are spectacular views of the valley heading into Aguas Calientes. They serve a very nice meal also.

terrible train ride. Our ride from Ollantaytambo to Machu Pichhu was fine. The train was full, but that was fine. There were 2 annoying things here. (1) It was an older train, so I don't think the windows were any bigger than the regular train. (2) They didn't seat me with my husband even though we bought the tickets far in advance. The ride from Machu Pichhu to Cusco was terrible. It was a newer train, so the windows were bigger, but it was dark out so that didn't matter. The train was really unstable though so it made me incredibly car sick. It was an awful 3 hour ride. Awful. The "entertainment" was also bizarre and not that enjoyable. They serve food, but it is pretty gross. I'd rather a cheaper ticker or an option to buy something better.

Relaxing. What a great way to come off Machupicchu, relax on the train and take in all the sights that you have missed on your hike up. I recommend the dome cars for another look at the sights. Very clean and food and drink and restrooms are available. There is a silly fashion show, they want you to purchase items. The train station is also nice and comfy.

Great experience and worth the money. After trekking the Inca Trail, 'sleeping' in a tent and not showering for 4 days, it was pure luxury to take the vistadome train from Machu Pichu to Cusco. Fantastic views through the glass panels in the ceiling, snacks provided, entertainment and wine for sale! Didn't want it to end!

Two Different Trips. Our trip from Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu was early and on the quiet side. It was a little dreary out and the Urubamba River alongside us was raging. The views were good from the train and we could see hikers on the Inca Trail from time to time. The way back was completely different - there was entertainment! Staff in costumes danced in the aisles and put on a show. Later that turned into a bit of a fashion show with the staff modeling Alpaca clothing which was available for purchase. We had been warned that the trains didn't run on schedule, but we found them very reliable. It was a lot of fun.

Only way to Aguas and Machu Picchu. Unless you have money to burn and can go on the Hiram Bingham the Vistadome was excelent. They entertained you, the view outside was beyond imagine, and it was great to have a table to rest on and write notes of your travels. I would recommend the little extra to take this train back and forth from Cusco to Machu Picchu.

Comfortable and fun ride. We rode Perurail on our way back from Machu Pichu and the train was much nicer. The gave you nicer food, and set the table with Peruvian textiles.
