There was also a fashion show of things made of alpaca wool, which was fun even though the prices were quite high. I would definitely select this train both ways if I had to do it again.

A fun way to travel to Machu Picchu.. We took the Vistadome by Perurail to and from Aguas Calientes, and it was a lot of fun. It takes 3 hours to go 57 miles, so the train travels slowly for great views of the Sacred Valley and the Andes. Pictures are hard with reflections from the glass though. We were certainly pampered with food and drink at the beginning of the trip. On the way back, there was a masked Peruvian dancer and a fashion show. Crazy but interesting. My only issue is with booking of the tickets. It seemed everyone on the train had to switch seats, because despite buying their tickets together like my husband and I, no one was seated together. It was frustrating. On the way back my husband and I were seated on different cars! We had to wait until everyone was seated before we could get seats not together on the same car. Luckily a few others had the same issues and we all worked out our seating as it should have been to start.

Great service to and from machupichu!!!!!. My wife and I, Phil and Rolly Dobbins, Aurel and Daniel Viregan took a ride to Machupicchu today Decmber, 8, 2013 on Perurail. We enjoyed a pleasant ride, and a tasty breakfast served to us by two fine young men, and a beautiful young lady named, Dinora Ferro. Dinora stood out in every way, her grace, her elegance, her appealing smile, mingled with warm and attentive service, made it an extra special journey. It was the same wonderful service on our return trip by Dinora, with an extra treat. She participated in an Alpaca fashion show. Every garment she wore looked fabulous on her. She bid us farewell when we exited the train with her stunning smile. We recommend that Dinora Ferro should be acknowledged for her representing perurail in such a positive and outstanding manner. We vote for Dinora Ferro for Miss Peru!!!!!
excellent views - smallish seats. really excellent views - mostly comfortable ride although seats are slightly cramped lengthwise - with 4 people sitting around a table - nice snacks -

A ride with a view!. This was the best train experience ever. The seats were comfortable and we had lovely food service complete with table-clothes and napkins. Food was good and the view could not be beat. On our return trip we had a fashion show and a late lunch. Wonderful!!!

Great ride. This train ride is total pleasure. The seats are big, comfortable, leather. There is a breakfast service that includes a fresh fruit choice. The orange I selected was enjoyed on Machu Picchu. This train was extremely clean. Service was quite good. The return trip included a fashion show in addition and a snack. The scenery is unequaled.

Great ride. The vista dome service was great. The train was comfortable, good ride. The staff was awesome. The ride back and fashion show was awesome. Nice little snack, little nap…..way more than i expected

Well, it's he only way to get to Macchu Picchu. You're supposed to get breakfast, but eat before...it's not much and you only get one beverage and they charge you for more. Bring water or something else to drink. The seats are uncomfortable when sitting across from strangers so get seats facing each other so you can put your feet up or get two seats not at a table but with pull down trays. Bring a hat because if it is sunny it gets hot. For luxury consider the Orient Express train from Cusco to Aguas Callientes, about $15 more, or value just take the cheaper train (about the same comfort as the Vistadome) and bring your own food.

Worth it. Vistadome was great! It was a pleasant surprise when they brought us drinks, gooseberries, mini pizzas, and desserts to start off the ride. They offered alcoholic drinks later as well.The train itself is gorgeous but Peru Rail puts a lot of personality into their train rides - it's not just a train ride, but also a dance party and fashion show! The 3.5 hour ride went by really quickly. Especially after riding into Aguas Calientes on Inca Rail, I really appreciated the caliber of Vistadome

Great views on the way to Macchu Picchu. We loved this train, great service, and the staff were really good. Online booking was easy, but we were all allocated separate seats, even though we booked 9 months in advance. We had to sit apart on the train, but it's only a 3 hour train.The views were good, and the ticket price included a breakfast (fruit, panckaes and spinach pie with coffee/tea) and on the way back was dinner which was a slice of pizza with a drink. There are snacks and additional drinks available for purchase.On the way back from Macchu Picchu, the staff provide a fashion show of Peruvian clothing.All in all, a good way to get to Macchu Picchu!!

Amazing Experience and Top Quality Service. Travelling on the vistadome service was a real good way to see some of the most amazing scenery cuzco has to offer . The train was quite luxurious and spotless clean . The seats are really comfortable with windows above your head so as you can enjoy every bit of the panoramic view from which to enjoy the scenery and is also great for taking photographs... the service was very good and of high standard I must mention a special thanks to attentative Sra. Analy for her kindness and good service. When we arrived in Aquas Calente we realised that we were supposed to have given our hotel (The sanctuary Lodge) our arrival time so they could collect us. We never did and this hich meant that we were stuck in Aguas Caliente. Sra Analy was really helpful and tried to call our Hotel to inform them that we had arrived. Unfortunately she could not get through to them so she then helped us to get a bus to the hotel. While were with her we mentioned that me and my partner were getting married at Machu Piccu. Sra Analy was working on our train on the way back and remembered that we had gotten married and presented my wife and I with a present of Strawberries in Caramel, it made a once in a lifetime experience that little bit more special. Massive Thank you to Analy and Peru Rail :)

The train ride was incredibly good. The Vistadome has large comfortable seats and wide viewing windows which allow you to see the spectacular Urubamba valley and river all the way to Machu Picchu. The train attendants served snacks both directions and even provided a fashion show on the return trip to Cusco.

Best way to get to Machu Picchu. Good comfortable seating, large windows. Tasty snack served both coming and going. The fashion show on the return trip features some great Alpaca items that my wife is kicking herself for not buying
Divetido/funny. Na ida falhou o aquecimento e passamos frio.Na volta todo OKOn the way failed heating and we were cold.In back all OK

Wonderful Ride!. I have been looking forward to this trip for a long time. The Vistadome is a great start as it offer a view of the terraced landscapes along the Urubama river and the hikers on the Inca trail. Drinks and a snack was part of the ride, which was passable. I thought there was a weight limit on the train, but no one checked. On the way back there was a dance number performed by an Inca costume character. Also there was fashion show of alpaca clothing. They also had one of our travel companions model an alpaca ponchos. It was a fun ride back!
Scenic train ride. Enjoyed our train ride to Machu Picchu in the Vistadome. Windows provided great views and there was a snack and beverage service each way.

Very nice. We enjoyed the views, food, comfort and pampering on the way up to Machu Picchu. On the way back, we were put in a slighly less fancy car, but still with nice, full windows. There was a fashion show of up-scale wool and alpaca clothing and scarves which distracted tired returning travelers. Most people would have been fine with the view and their own thoughts, but some guests made purchases. (Heard from our tour guide that Peru Rail pressures these staff to make sales quotas from their captive audience so it makes me a little more disinclined to buy.)

Train to and from Machu Picchu. We bought our tickets in advance from Peru Rail. We received an e-mail reservation and were able to get the tickets at a Peru Rail office in the Lima Airport (they also have offices in the Cusco airport and in Cusco). We took the taxi from Cusco to Ollantaytambo and caught the Vistadome train there. It was a nice ride and they served a snack. The views were spectacular!! When we left Machu Picchu, we took the Vistadome train to Poroy - it was comfortable and they served a light meal. It was easy to get a taxi into Cusco from Poroy.

Trip to Macchu Picchu on Vistadome train. It was a lot of fun while watching the beautiful scenery on our way to Macchu Picchu. It was my birthday and the staff on the train made a beautiful dessert and brought it over to me singing happy birthday. It was really special. The staff wereDaisaku MonterrosoGina HuaytaraEfrain Lipa

Train to Agua Calientes, base of Machu Picchu. Great way to see the valley, you travel through several different eco systems, with striking mountain ranges in the background. Many terraces and ruins along the way. The Incan trail is along a portion of the trip. We lucked out and had the best seat in the house, the first seat in the first car, the entire front of the car is glass.

"What a Way to Travel!". We enjoyed everything about "Vistadome"! We boarded the elegant, comfortable train in Ollantaytambo, and it took us on a great journey along the upper Urubamba, in its lush, green valley surrounded by high mountains, on our way to Aguas Calientes and then to "Macchupichu", the lost Inca sacred citadel, discovered only in 1911 by American explorer Hiram Bingham. The staff on board was very kind, and fun to watch as they performed for us, including a fashion-show of some fantastic baby-alpaca clothing. We ended up buying some soft, colorful scarfs.All in all a unique experience worth doing!

Amazing views and great service!. I thoroughly enjoyed this journey. The views were captivating and it was fascinating to see the small towns and villages who live in this amazing environment. I wouldn't worry too much about seating especially if you are travelling with a group. We were a group of five and other passengers on the train were willing to swap seats so that we sat together.The service on the train was fantastic! The staff are very kind and helpful. I felt spoilt both on the way there and back. Special mention to Fabrizzio and his team.We went on the 8.25am train to Machu Picchu in carriage A on 14th November. There was one stop which allows you to stretch your legs which made the journey 3hrs and a half. There is one toilet per train and it was in good condition. The journey was relaxing and calm.Many thanks to Peru rail and their staff on this day.
Great comfort. Great comfort to go to Macchu Pichu. Absolutely recommended! However, I would say the best choice is to make sure that you sleep in Aguas Calientes to have an early start at MP
nice train ride. the sales pitch on board was a bit much on the way to macchu picchu, though the little fashion show on the way back was very enjoyable.

Peru Rail Derailed Our Honeymoon. This was the single worst experience that we have ever had overseas. This experience even surpassed the evacuation from a labor strike in Puno that we experienced 2 days later. The train ride (at 17MPH) is an overwhelming 3 hours and 40 minutes. If that was not enough, we were delayed 2 additional hours after our train hit a bus about 30 minutes into the trip. We were given absolutely no information until a Peruvian Tour Guide kicked up a fuss. One of the porters advised that we had hit a bus, the driver had been removed by the police, and the driver was on the way to have his blood alcohol tested. He never made it back. I will let you all figure out why. After about 90 minutes it occurred to Peru Rail that maybe the driver was not coming back and they finally sent a new driver. As a result, we missed the English speaking guide and had a whopping 2 hours at Machu Picchu. We were told that we would get an extra hour (delaying the return train and hour) and then Peru Rail just took the extra hour away with no explanation, no apology. To add insult to injury, the Peru Rail staff was very rude and openly hostile to Americans. They would pretend not to speak English when you asked them a question and then you would hear them speaking English to the German and French tour groups. They ignored us when they took orders for food and drinks asking everyone else at our table what they wanted. They also seemed more interested in selling us CD’s and clothes than making our journey an enjoyable one. The CD was of the ANNOYING music played for the almost 6 hours we were stuck on the train. Machu Picchu was the reason we picked Peru and we spent a great deal of money to get there. We felt cheated by only having 2 hours to look around.

Hop On The Machu Picchu Vistadome Train. We have done both the vista dome, and the backpacker...If you have the money and want to have a nice relaxing trip then take the vista dome. We enjoyed the fashion show, and the food was not great, but it's a train not a 4 or 5 star restaurant.The backpacker ride can be smelly....that's all I have to say!Enjoy the ride in the train, chat will fellow travelers, take some pictures out the window, and relax!

Best view of the scenery. We took the Hiram Bingham train to Machu Picchu and the Vistadome back. On the Hiram Bingham train we had private seating in the dining car, a live band in the back bar car, and lots of space to relax. And, pretty much everything was compted. We came back on the Vistadome. It was a lot more crowded, expectedly, with much less leg room. But we had an Alpaca fashion show and everybody seemed to be enjoying themselves. In fact, the Vistadome offered better viewing of the local scenery because of the vista viewing. If money is no object, go with the Hiram Bingham train.

A Great Way to See Rural Peru. Sit back, relax and enjoy the beautiful ride through Peru's countryside. You will see snow-capped mountains and feel like you have flashed back in time to the 18th century as you watch the local peasants working in the fields. Entertainment is offered in the vistadome and you will be pampered throughout the entire trip.

A great trip to access one of the world's most special places.. Really enjoyed this journey. The seats are very comfortable, the food a little minimal but good and the journey a delight. The double seats not facing others give you much more leg room and a little more privacy. Fabulous scenery and very good staff. The entertainment on the return journey was very enjoyable and our carriage responded enthusiastically. All in all a great experience.
Excellent Train Trip. From our Ollanta departure the service was 1St class the views amazing one of the highlights of our Peru travels

awesome ride. I thought this three hour ride would be boring and I would nap on the way to Aquas Callientes but I never closed my eyes.The breakfast service is amazing and the sites ( snow peaked mountains, terraced hills) amazing. Its comfortable and one unique thing.. when the train lowers it self it does a zig zag that is pretty cool... Great experience. I can't imagine what else the Hiram Bingham train could do for so much more cost...

Fantastic views.. Took the visadrome Train back to cusco. Scenery fantastic. Even though journey took over 4 hours. The time went fast. There was even a irritating fashion show and fairly hard sell of clothing.

Take the cheaper train. After reading how wonderful this train is I was disappointed Its comfortable and you can see out of the windows. The hot and cold snacks turned out to be only cold and were stale. We were entertained by a Shamin character on the return trip and a fashion parade The staff were not friendly. Take the slightly cheaper train the experience is the same we were told

Large windows, leg room and comfortable train. We decided to take the Vistadome on the way back from Macchu Picchu. It did cost more but was worth it for us. The windows were larger. The seats were a little more comfortable. The snack and drink service was nicer. The extra leg room was great because I had twisted my ankle that day and could stretch out a little more. The staff also did a music and fashion show with the opportunity to buy alpaca products.

An entertaining journey. Make sure you travel during the daylight hours to get the full benefit of this trip, about 4 hours from Aguas Calientes. The staff serve a nice meal, complete with table cloth and real cutlery, included in the ticket price, and there is drinkalbe wine to be purchased. And after the meal the staff put on an entertaining little show for the passengers. The train moves slowly through the countryside along the banks of the river before climbing over the mountain range to end up at Cusco.

Great ride. Left on time, ride is a little bit shaky, but ok got an unexpected light meal, only one restroom per car be prepared to wait and it might not be the cleanest one.The ride slow but beautiful , very enjoyable.

Beautiful views. The vista dome is a nice way to travel to Machu Picchu, a step up from the expedition with better service and snacks, and roomier seating. It was odd that the automatic ticketing system seemed to consistently separate couples when assigning seats so everyone was trying to switch on both our rides.
Fun trip. The service provided by Peru Rail is very good and the dance and fashion show on the return trip was fun.

Wonderful way to get to Machu Picchu. The Vistadome rail trip was a wonderful trip from Poroy station (20-ish minutes outside of Cusco) to Aguas Calientes. The seats are comfortable, the windows are huge, the staff are wonderful. The service is great, they come around with snacks, drinks, and even put on a fashion show rather than just walking up and down the aisle offering to sell beautiful alpaca clothes. Granted they are expensive, but it's a fun distraction. The views are really great from the cabins, you go through mountains, valleys, past streams, woods. In addition to huge windows on the side of the car, they also have windows on top so you can get some really nice views. The staff went out of their way to help us. All in all, highly recommended way to get to Machu Picchu.

Arduous, hot, noisy...why the good reviews?. Yes ok, I am in full agreement with other posters here that this train is spotless and newish, the service polite and the food OK (but yes, also unexpected). However, this is a long 3.5 hour trip. If you're in a group or you're a gregarious extrovert that might sound like heaven, but seating that arranges two people facing two others can pit you against some people you'd ordinarily never spend such time with. I was lucky enough to have an older English gentleman opposite me who kicked me under the shared table numerous times shortly after we left Poroy. I assumed it was by accident but when I returned from the toilet I found he'd moved my backpack (very small and tucked under my seat) and was slouched in his seat with his legs stretched under mine. He reluctantly moved them as I sat down and told me to please put my pack on my lap. I asked why as I couldn't see how it bothered him and he said it did as he wanted to stretch his legs out. Now I won't go on but he tried the whole trip to get his legs under our seat any way he could. I'm 5'10" and I could easily fit in my allotted seat with my feet not encroaching on anyone but I agree it was tight. So my advice is try to book the very rare two seats facing the backs of the seats in front if you can. There are only four per cabin and we negotiated a swap in the return leg for seats 39/40. Gold. Secondly the ceiling windows let in a lot of sun and the air con can be slow to respond. Window seaters will be hot. Finally the scenery is boring. It's farms and modified landscapes until you're about 30 minutes from MP Pueblo so don't get too excited about great views. Take a book. Any rail trip in Japan offers more at a cheaper price. Of course my attitude us coloured by the fact that our train hit a bus at an unsecured level crossing and we had a 2 hour delay making it a 5.5 hour trip. On our return it rained and my window leaked all over my seat and everyone's windows were fogged up. Again, great vistas!! When you include the unbearable 'fashion show' and accompanying nightclub music this is hardly a trip I'd advocate to anyone, but you have to get to Machu Picchu somehow.

Very Scenic Ride. Great train ride. It doesn't go very fast so the 57 mile ride to Machu Picchu takes 3.5 hours. Luckily it is very scenic almost the entire time. Food is served along the way and the seats are pretty comfortable too. It's worth the small upgrade.

How well organised. This journey up to Machu Picchu is such fun and really well organised. Refreshments are served during both legs. The staff (and some very happy Americans) model alpaca woollens on the return journey. Be warned!! You can only take a carry-on bag for your stay at Aqua Calientes. Large cases not allowed.
pleasant way to travel. The vistadome is a great way to see the sites as you travel along the Urubamba River and inside the Andes to MachuPicchu!

To Aguas Calientes on Peru Rail. Clean with attentive car stewards - gave nice snacks, had other things for sale--on the way back they even had a (little bit strange due to the length) fashion show up and down the railcar isle! They sold the items at the end of the show before we pulled into the station. Quirky and kind of fun.The VIEW is wonderful!!!!!!
Comfortable way to get to Machu Pichu. This was an enjoyable experience. The train was comfortable and provided a light sncack and beverages.

"wonderful prelude to the wonder of Machu Picchu". The memory of our trip on the Vistadome is one of the highlights of our visit to Cusco. The PeruRail station at Poroy is small yet comfortable. The train is immaculate and spacious with unobstructed views. Breakfast was served which we did not expect, but welcomed. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The star of the show "The Scenery" was spectacular! What a wonderful prelude to the wonder of Machu Picchu. On the way back, we were entertained by the music of Peru while watching a fashion show of Peru's Baby Alpaca wear and costumed Peruvian dancers. We definitely encourage everyone to take this trip to Aguas Calientes even if they are not planning to go to Machu Picchu.

A great way to get to Aguas Caliente/Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome from Ollytaytambo to Aguas Caliente in the morning at 8:30. We were pleasantly surprised to be served a small snack with coffee, which I declined (already having eaten breakfast) but my husband indulged in, and said it was tasty. We spent most of our time looking out the window (the view is wonderful= and talking to our seatmates. The next day we took the 5:30 pm train back, and it was a memorable journey. We had a wonderful team comprised of Milagre Cheques Ffifo (not sure how to spell it), Esteban Pimentel and Erick Leone. They gave us a light snack, and then there was surprise entertainment of someone dressed in a traditional character costume dancing in the aisles. After that there was a brief fashion show with some lovely items that I wish I was able to buy, but I can`t wear any type of wool, even alpaca. In addition to being talented, the staff is very warm, helpful and accomodating. Both of our 90 minute journeys were very enjoyable. Vistadome is a great way to get to Machu Picchu Pueblo in comfort, style, and with a bit of fun thrown in.

Clarify the services.. We booked Exploration train to Machu Pichu and Vistadome service back but the Vistadome was even more cramped as it is just a DMU with the Excursion seats and no tables and I am quite sure it wasn't air conditioned. It doesn't represent the level of service that is advertised and I find it misleading. Comparing prices I don't feel I was overcharged, just mislead.

Wonderful trip!. Our group of 14 family and friends traveled round-trip from Poroy to Agua Calientes for our trip to Machu Picchu. The staff was very polite and professional, greeting us in the early morning chill dressed in smart dark blue trench coats. We were served a substantial snack on linen runners as we enjoyed the spectacular views of farms, Incan ruins, aspects of the Inca Trail and snow-covered mountains from our clean, modern Vistadome car. A voice-over in English would occasionally interupt the quiet background music and point out important sites along the way. On trip back to Poroy/Cusco, there was a repeat of the same impeccable service by Horem, Sixto, and Gibers, including a surprise "show". One of them dressed in a colorful, Carnival-like costume and mask and performed a native dance, pulling a couple of the female passengers to dance with him. It was charming. This was followed by a fashion show of lovely (and VERY reasonably priced for the quality) items made from baby alpaca. I found the softest scarves for $30 that would cost more than $100 in a Stateside department store. One reviewer that it was strange to "peddle" goods on the train, but what I think he/she missed was the pride the local population (and all Peruvians) have for their culture, and this includes sharing their music, food and handicraft traditions with visitors. The only hiccup was a clogged toilet, but the capable staff quickly fixed the problem. I wholeheartedly encourage traveling by Vistadome train to Machu Picchu.
Vistadome Train to Machu Picchu. The windows in the roof make for fantastic views of the scenery, which is breathatking. We enjoyed the "show" by the staff on the return trip!

Nice train journey. We traveled the Cusco-Aqua Calientes -Cusco trip with Vistadome. It was a great trip. The scenery was great: snow peaked mountains (Veronica which is about 5500 meters) and the nice villages of the Sacred Valley. I thought the service was really quite good. The stewards and hostesses were friendly and helpful. I must say, the fashion show, on the trip from Aqua Calientes to Cusco was corny and didn't do a lot for me. The Vistadome is highly recommended for your journey to Machu Picchu

Nice train- good view, not sure its worth the extra $. I took this train from Aguas Calientes to Ollataytambo. A bit of an odd set-up: 1/2 the seats are set up facing each other and half are not. The ones that face each other have no tray tables. Also, i found it strange to have "fashion shows" to peddle llama clothes during the ride. I'd probably just take the "normal" train next time, and save the extra $20.

best train ride. the trip from Cusco to Aguas Calientes was great, lots of room to sit, with a table for your food and drinks, and large windows on the side and roof, the view of the mountains, some with snow at the top was just unforgettable some were so close and high you had to look out through the roof to see the tops, the train follows the river all the way, a trip well worth taking.

train with a difference. This train has very large windows on the side and even windows on the top, so you can have a great view from your seat. Food is served during the ride, and in the evening there is a fashion show.

Awesome day trip. Enjoyed the trip from Cusco to Machu Picchu and return.On the return journey the crew put on a fashion show modelling outfits made with Alpaca wool which made the return journey fun.

Interesting train ride!. This was the first time on the Vistadome train from Aguas Calientes to Cusco and what an experience! The staff: Jorge, Gina and Victor kept us well fed, entertained with a fashion show of Peruvian alpaca clothing and made the 3 and a half hour journey go quickly. Would definitely recommend to take the Vistadome train during the day to enjoy the lovely scenery too.

trip of a life time. My wife and I traveled on the Vistadome and it was excellent. We had great service a small lunch on our way up and on our way back had a great show put on by the staff. We had a brief history of Peru with costumes and a fashion show for both men and women showing off Peru's fine cloths and of course you can buy the items on the spot. I would highly recommend the experience, it will cost a little more but it is worth every penny.

Memorable train trip. The train itself is very comfortable. It is a steam train and travels very slowly, hence the more than 3 hour journey for a relatively short distance. Scenery is fantastic but, as it was dark on the return trip, we were feeling bored until the hospitality staff provided a fashion show. Really made the journey go faster. You do get a light meal included in the price.

Worth the upgrade. We upgraded to this train after our Salkantay Trek to Machu Piccu. I would say it as worth every penny if you do it during the day and you can enjoy the lovely view. Service was outstanding. The snack left a little to be desired, but we had eaten in town before we left, so it wasn't a big deal. Everyone on the train is in a great mood, because they have all had the most amazing day at Machu Piccu, so the vibe is great!

Comfortable and modern trains. Very good and comfortable train. Safe for tourists! They serve you breakfast or snack, according at what time you will be on board. It stops at Aguas Calienta or Picchu Pueblo. Then you have to walk down from the station and over the bridge till you arrive at the buses to take you to the ruins. It is only a short walk.

Vistadome Train. It is a good and comfortable train for travelling. Much safer for tourists. Left from Poroy, Cusco.They serve you breakfast or light snack, according at what time you will be on board. It takes you up to Aguas Calientas, then must get on a bus to reach Machu Picchu.

Expedition and Vistadome. We went to MachuPicchu from Cusco by train and it was a very nice trip.We took the Expedition train in the morning and it was on time.The trip was comfortable and they offered food and drink on the train.We came back by VistaDome, next day, in the afternoon and again the trip was very comfortable. They gave us a show with dancing and a fashion show where they sold peruvian chothes. We were enjoying ourselves so much that we didn´t see the time passing. Peru is very well organized for tourists.Congratulations.

Wonderful ride and service. A group of three, we rode the Vistadome train on 9/25/2013 from Machu Picchu to Auguas Calientes. Our crew was wonderful, and offered excellent service and a fun fashion show. A big shout out to Miguel Angel Lozano, Rosario Ustoz, and Wilbert Delgado.

Great experience, unless the trains strike!. We traveled the Vistadome on our way to Aguas Calientes and were treated to a wonderful surprise when our friends were seated in the very front seat of the train with a window in front of them allowing us to see ahead of us as well as out the window next to us. The service was excellent, and the views were gorgeous. The train never goes too fast, but rather makes it way at a lazy pace through the mountains passing tiny villages and popping in and out of tunnels along the way. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience until the trains went on strike the day we were supposed to return. I'm not sure how frequently this happens, but they halted all trains in and out of the city for the day. Around 3-4 in the afternoon all of the tourists began to congregate at the tiny train station for "updates". They seemed to handle the situation in as orderly as fashion as they could, and understood that many of the tourists needed to leave AC that evening for fear of missing connecting flights out of Cuzco that day. I feel terrible for any of the people who had booked day trips via the train into AC that day to see Machu Picchu, as they most certainly were cheated out of their experience. But hey, in the developing world one must realize that you're at the beckon call of the transportation systems. After a relatively stressful afternoon of uncertainty, they sent several trains to pick up all of the tourists later that evening and managed to just barley avoid an angry mob. We departed AC around 8pm that evening and arrived in Cuzco around midnight. It would behoove you to allot two full days to Machu Picchu just in case there is a freak train strike so that you can ensure you'll get to visit the gem of Peru!

nice and well organized. I went from Cusco to Machu Picchu by Expedition train and come back by VistaDome train. I was expecting a good service but it was better than I expected. Everything was perfec:both trains were on time and the boarding was very well organized.The entertainment inside Vistadome was fun and the staff was very nice indeed.An excelent experience.

Amazing. This was a long day..traveling to and from Machu Picchu. We went by bus, then train, then bus again to reach the ruins. The bus trip was long! The train trip relaxing and nice.. Then another bus trip to the ruins.. This bus trip was unnerving..very narrow roads with steep cliffs. We were glad to be back on the train. There are no words to adequately describe Machu Picchu. The Peruvian government is considering closing it to walk in tourists. Get there before they do. majestic, spiritual, educational. Very expensive, but worth every cent.

Very wonderful travel. it's a beatiful way to go to Machu Picchu.... Very nice,very confortable, and very funny... thanks to much to Sixto - Danae - Alex , for giving us entertained with excellent dance performances and fashion....Mauro A.
Great Train. Wonderful train, very scenic. Served small snacks both ways along with drinks. Seats and interior very nice and comfortable.

STAFF MEMBERS VERY HELPFUL. We wanted to thank all members of staff at Perurail for their assistance in Machu Picchu when we missed our VISTADOME service and they managed to allocate us into another one. They bended over backwards to make this happen because all trains were fully booked but ALFREDO, the supervisor of Perurail, took charge and made what seemed to be an impossible task into a reality. Thanks to him we met our next connection and made it to our flight on time. A big thank you to him and his team who made us feel like if we were at our private lounge. The entertainment was great and the views breath taking. A real must if one wants to finish a brilliant experience in style and comfort. Thanks again and keep up the good work.

Very nice.. For the difference in price between the Expedition and Vistadome ($8 each way) we took the Vistadome train from Poroy (outskirts of Cusco) to Aguas Calientes (Machu Pichu). Tickets can and should be bought online beforehand (directly through Peru Rail website or a travel agent) as they sell out very quickly. I can't speak to the other options (Expedition and luxury Hiram Bingham luxury option), but the Vistadome was the perfect option for us. It's a newer train, very clean with fantastic service, and also with a surprisingly good breakfast and dinner. The train has windows cut into the roof, which is key to appreciating the spectacular scenery that you go through, particularly because the track gets quite narrow at times and you wouldn't see much if you couldn't look up through the roof.The train leaves from the outskirts of Cusco (Poroy) or Ollanta (2 hours from Cusco), although the Poroy station is closed during the rainy season (Dec - Feb) and you have to bus the first part. Getting to Aguas Calientes, you take a 20 minute bus ride up the mountain. Buses leave every 5 minutes and tickets can be bought onsite for $18. Machu Pichu entrance tickets can also be bought at the Ministry of Culture (very close to the train and bus stations) for about $40.You can buy all of this as a package or do it yourself. We did it ourselves and saved between $100-$150 pp by doing so. The only thing that has limited space and must be booked in advance is the train. Be warned, you need to bring your passport to get on the train and to get into Machu Pichu. You cannot use another person's ticket. Also, trains leave right on time, so be there a half hour early as they suggest.

Train to Agua Calientes and Machu Picchu. This is the way to go. The seating and amenities on the Vistadome are well worth the upgrade form the standard train cars. The windows are extensive and continue overhead. Snacks are part of your fee and very nice. Wanchaq Station is about 25 minutes from Cusco. Transportation to and from the station can easily be arranged by your hotel for a reasonable fee. The return trip includes a local show and fashion show of Alpaca items.

Only way to go!!. The train to Machu Pichu was very comfortable with large windows so you could see the many ruins in the countryside! They even served a snack! On the way back we enjoyed a fashion show of alpaca sweaters & jackets!

Misleading pictures - careful on what you buy. I will be very short, we bought a ticket from Ollanta to Machu Pichu, VISTADOME. On the day I boarded I found it a bit strange, it was not like in the pictures, anyway, had Machu Pichu ahead. Few days later in Cuzco I went to a Peru Rail office, pointed to the pictures all over and explained that I might have boarded on EXPEDITION train instead, I had pictures to show. They kindly recommended me to write a mail with detailed information to PeruRail, what else could they do? I did send the email on Sep 5th, clear pictures showing what VISTADOME and EXPEDITION are in their website, my picture and I clearly boarded EXPEDITION paying the price of the first.Not surprisingly there was not reply to my message.I did wait a good time for this reply, the cash difference is small, but details like this just shows how some people in the company treat their customers.

Bloody expensive train ride. Usd75 for this one way ticket. Bloody expensive but compared to the low process for most other things in peru it is the only way to twin to civilisation from macchu picchu. The show ix nice but v being after Sunday no vista was available

Nice views. We chose the vistadome because it fit better in our plans (and looking back, it was actually cheaper than the Expedition because it was at an odd hour). The views are nice though you don't get to see a lot more through the top windows (which we had in the expedition train as well anyway). One thing, be VERY careful with the tables, don't put anything on the folding part as it is inclined and it might fall. I had the hot coffee spil on my lap (and consequently had a wet butt all the way to MP!). And a few minutes later I saved my neighbor from the same fate. That was really a bad design and PeruRail should warn people about this.

Pay a little more and enjoy the Vistadome experience!. We took the Peru Rail Vistadome train from Cusco to Aguascaliente. Great service and very social experience. Met people from all over and had some fun! I booked this on line and it was easy and the experience was wonderful. Enjoy the experience!

On the way to Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome to the 104 marker to begin the short trek on the Inca Trail. It's a very comfortable and scenic train ride that includes a meal. If you don't want to hike - not to worry - you can take the train all the way to Machu Picchu.

Scenic trip back from Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome on our way back to Cusco and had a great trip. The train has large windows to enable passengers to enjoy the scenic views. Light refreshment and snacks are provided and during our trip, the staff performed some entertainment (local traditional dance and a fashion show). The trip was a bit long and slow, especially towards the end, but it was an enjoyable and comfortable trip.

Great experiene. We had a surprisingly nice journey with Peru Rail Vistadome.The views are very nice and the train in confortable.The is a act while waiting for the other train to pass...Special thanks to Sondro, Milagros and Manuel. You did really great!

Trip from Aguas Calientes to Poroy. We traveled on the Vistadome service and it was a fantastic trip. Not fast but entertaining. The snack offered was really good and then they provided entertainment and a fashion show of llama wool clothes. It was a great party atmosphere with the entire carriage joining in. Highly recommend this service.

Nice ride, beautiful views. It isn't that much more than the regular train, but looked much more comfortable. It was interesting that although we bought our tickets together, we were not seated together.

Great experience but little leg room. We travelled from Cusco to Machu Picchu and back on the Vistadome.As with all our experiences in Peru, the staff were very friendly and efficient. Thankfully for me, they also spoke English very well!The train was clean and was on time going, though 30 minutes late on the return leg.Most passengers seemed to want to sit somewhere else and I really didn't like the haggling that ensued. Legroom is pretty tight on most seats but you can always get up and move around to stretch your legs. The views made up for any minor inconvenience!Finally I would say that the Cusco station (Poroy) is a good half hour from the center of Cusco - a small station gets very busy when the trains come in. I would recommend pre-booking your transport back to Cusco.

Beautiful scenery. We travelled from Ollantaytampo to Aguascalientes, the train was punctual, the left hand side of the train is the best as the track follows the river for a long way, we also travelled back from MP to Cusco, the snacks were better than the first time, but the fashion show was strange followed by the hard sell, which we did not like. One thing to mention is that if you are a couple make sure you are seated together, as I know there were some people who were not.

Beautiful, scenic travel to and from paradise. This is totally the way to travel. The views of the mountains and cloud forest really set you up for your journey to Machu Picchu. The whole trip is slow, steady and calming.

The train service is quite good, the booking not so good. We took the VistaDome twice on our holiday this year, once from Cusco to Machu Picchu and the next journey from Machu Picchu to Ollyantaytambo.First, let me say that we booked online and so were a little disappointed that we were seated apart from each other in groups of four, two facing two. We were lucky to have found someone to change with, but clearly they didn't get a good deal out of it besides being able to sit together. We were happy to be sitting on the left side of the train, for the most part out of the sun coming in the right side windows. We had incredible views of the valley and the river and they on the other side had great views of the mountains, The seating looked a little better on the Perurail Explorer with more seats facing in the direction of travel and less facing each other. The Explorer also left a half hour before the VistaDome and I believe is cheaper.We really enjoyed the trip back from Machu Picchu getting seats together on the front of the train sitting facing the front window and so were able to video tape the journey up and out of the valley. We got some great views of the journey, we have since posted to YouTube.The service was great, they looked after us very well for the short hour and a half trip to Ollyantaytambo.They do have a limit to the amount of luggage being brought onboard, which is another inconvenience if you are going for a couple of says. Many still had large suite cases and so it's hard to know how the rules are enforced or applied.Clearly the whole visit to Machu Picchu is a big ticket item for anyone and so having this very well run service to make the whole experience amazing is just a part of what it takes to have made this one of the Best Wonders of the World experiences in the world..

It would have been better if the train tracks hadn't been washed out and caused us problem - but that isn't their fault!. IMHO it was worth upgrading to have the entertainment and the beer. The food is so so. But you sure can't beat the views!

Beautiful ride to Machu Picchu with stunning views.. It's quite a spectacular ride. The views out of the train are great, especially if you can get a seat on the left side of the train. Seat 1 and 2 are by far the best with a glass window right out the front of the train. Pack a lunch as the ride is only about an hour but they only give you a gross white bun with a Kraft cheese single slice and a slice of tomatoe. Its pretty bad. Overall it's a great ride.

MACHU PICHU AND PERU RAIL. The train moves slow and let's you see all the mountains. You get a free meal on the way there and back, albeit a small one.The staff put on an entertaining"fashion" show to show us the clothing for sale. It was very entertaining and helped us to stay awake. Staff was very nice, the we're Selmira,Yolre, and Luis F.I purchased a lunch ticket but ran out of time. Between the free meals you can also purchase food and drink in the town below machu picchu. It would be smart to get a sandwich to go for train ride home. Even though this is your only choice of getting to MC if you don't want to hike, the staff made it fun. MC is breath taking!I hiked from town to ruins and it was tougher than i expected. I would recommend to take the bus.

Beautiful Panoramic View to Machu Picchu!. The Vistadome train to Machu Picchu is absolutely the way to go. The panoramic view made my 3 hour train ride to Machu Picchu a very pleasant journey as Peruvian music played gently in the background. The stunning scenery is easy to enjoy with comfortable seats and tables with leaves that fold to give you more room. I can't imagine a better ride when traveling to Machu Picchu as I highly recommend this unforgettable experience.
A surprising treat. We didn't think taking a train to Machu Picchu would be so delightful, from the cleanliness, the friendly staff, the lovely meal served and of course the fabulous views!

Worth the exgtra dough....... Great way to see the Sacred Valley for the first time. Leaves on time, do not worry if you arrive minutes before departure. Nice breakfast service with good coffee, so do not waste time or money on early breakfast.

Great Experience with great hosts!. Train's on-board entertainment is worth the price of admission. We were on the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo and on the short 1.5 hour trip we couldn't ask for better way to cap off our Machu Picchu visit. From the time you board the train, our hosts, Fabrizzio, Rosario and Henry were there to serve us with food, live music, dance and fashion show. Excellent ride! Would recommend to friends.

Take the Explorer. Train ran on time and seats were comfortable. The extra pricing for a cold drink and a small snack in each direction and strange entertainment just are not worth the pricing upgrade from the Explorer/backpacker to the Vistadome.

Nice end to the Inca Trail / MP Adventure. The Vistadome was a nice upgrade for a return from Machu Picchu (Aguas Calientes) to Cusco. Great food service (not expected) and the added benefit of meeting some very interesting people on the trip. Highly recommend!

Basic Requirement not met!. We took this train having the option to travel via a much more affordable route because we wanted to enjoy the comfort and perks that come with paying a little more. There was five of us. We booked very in advance. Our train left very early in the morning however the ride is supposed to include breakfast. Because we were on one end of the train, by the time the server got to us they were out of coffee, orange juice, etc! How can you "run out" of the basics?!? This is a very low requirement that should at least be met by this company that is making soooooo much money ( we are peruvian and could have travelled on a train that is ridiculously MUCH cheaper!!) I was very disappointed.
Scenic beautiful trip. A great way to head up to Aqua Calientes to see Machu Picchu. Took Vistadome up and Hiram Bingham back. Try to get seats on river side of train, views are much better

Comfortable train ride. the train travels to Macchu Picchu, about a 3.5 hour ride from Cusco, along the way it traverses farmland, mountain slopes and runs along a river with rapids. Food service was good with superb views from the large windows on the side and roof of the train. On the return to Cusco the conductors became models and held a fashion show with a court jester type entertaining.

The Vistadome Vista. I have traveled to Machu Pichu on both the Vistadome and non Vistadome trains. I preferred the Vistadome train for better views of the mountain peaks, especially if you do not have a window seat. The ceiling windows also make the train car feel more open and certainly brighter. Though the Vista coach ride costs more, as an introduction to the sacred valley and Machu Pichu, it was worth the extra expense.The food seemed like airline fare to me; nothing memorable. The service was both friendly, efficient and polite. The native dancer on the return trip was interesting for a while but the same movements and gestures over and over got old fast. The fashion show on the return trip was interesting for the many, varied ways demonstrated to wear the same beautiful garments. All of the items were for sale, of course, to a captured audience on the train. All in all, perhaps a nice diversion during the 90 minute return trip from Machu Pichu back up the sacred valleyPiper

Worst part of our Peru trip. It's beautiful and that's the one star.Going up, the train was very late. Turned out they had cancelled the Vistadome train without telling anyone, so the VIstadome train was in fact one carriage hitched on the back of another, later train. Together with a number of other anxious tourists we eventually worked this out for ourselves.Coming back, they rushed through the meal and then embarked on a deafening "fashion show" aka hard sell of clothes modelled by the train crew. Requests to turn the music down were ignored. All they were interested in was making sales.We were tipped off the train before our destination, which would have been a relief except we were then bussed back to Cuzco, took over 2 hours in the traffic.You can hike up and avoid the train, but I don't think you are allowed to hike back. So you have to submit to this treatment. It's a shame because almost everywhere else we went in Peru was charming, if not a patch on Ecuador. And Machu Picchu is unmissable. But getting there and back is not fun.Tip - take earphones and block out the world, except for the views!

Few Options. There are not a lot of options when traveling to Macchu Pichu. I would say just about any of the trains would be fine, the vistadome is not necessary. The side windows are really where you will see the scenery. The seating is uncomfortable since you share space with another couple, the 4 of you facing one another at a table. The prices are way too high.

Overpriced, tacky tourist attractions. The train to Aguas Calientes and back is very pricey, though the service is adequate. Except for the 'folklore' show on board, which is hands-down stupid and as un-Inca as imaginable...Passengers in wheelchair need to be carried on board and seated in regular seats, which is not exactly easy, but doable. The staff is helpful, assistants are required.

The only way to travel. It was a great trip to Machu Picchu made even better by utilizing Vistadome. The ability to see out the windows including the roof made pictures vary easy to take. Add in a great snack along the way and this was a very relaxing and enjoyable way to travel and help give us the added energy to spend hours at Machu Picchu

Very entertaining. It is worthwhile to do the Vistadome trip. Great seats and view and they serve a snack on board that was very enjoyable. The staff entertained us with a fashion show of some really nice Alpaca products.

Loved watching the snow-capped peaks. Took this train round trip Ollantaytambo to Machu Picchu and enjoyed every minute of the 1 1/2 hours each way. The seating is comfortable and train porters serve light refreshments, including coca tea for those of us who are still experiencing altitude sickness. There was no entertainment on the train but none was needed. The mountain views are simply spectacular! And, this train runs exactly on time so don't be late.

Beats walking.... Really loved the train ride. The food is very scant, so make sure you bring some with you if you are traveling at mealtime. You only get what they serve you (small snack), with no option to go to a cafetria type car. Having said that, it was a wonderful ride, and definitely beat walking! Especially with 3 kids.

Easy travel. Very comfortable, our return from Machu Picchu they did not serve us as well as our trip up they were a bit more interested in selling alpaca garments than service. They were really nice, very clean and wished the trip back had better service. Too bad. Would travel vistadome again. Hiram Bingham is very expensive if you want bar scene and fine dining book the Bingham. If you want to sit back relax then book the Vistadome.

Good service, still expensive. Took the Vistadome train from Urubamba to Aguas Calientes and back. Comfortable, fast, clean but overpriced. The service included a snack on each way... a beverage plus a sandwich and a fruit... not expected so was good! On time. The glass ceiling allowed us to see all the panoramic view... breathtaking... but the sun was really intense and there where nowhere to protect from the sun.

Beautiful train!!. We took the Vistadome to get to Machu Picchu from Ollantaytambo. The train is super super clean, they gave a nice breakfast also. You can see the high mountains through the windows located in the ceiling of the train. In our way back, the had a cultural and fashion show on board. It was so fun dancing with el Diablo!! The best option you can have to and from Machu Picchu

Took Vistadome back to Cusco from Machu Picchu. It was a lovely train to take back to Cusco. We had hiked the Inca Trail to get to Machu Picchu. We took one of the latest trains back, and I would recommend trying to leave earlier in the afternoon so that you can enjoy the views from the train. I greatly enjoyed the dancers onboard the train (my husband probably would have passed on that).

Excellent service but overpriced. The Vistadome train between Ollantaytambo and Aguas Calientes was very comfortable, the service was great and the views were superb. However the price of the 27 mile, 90 minute journey was truly eye watering! If it wasn't for the cost then I would have been happy to award five stars.

EXCELLENT!. It is worth to pay the extra money for Vistadome - not just for the views (which does make a difference since awesome to see the snow capped Andes) but also there is a restriction on luggage (in pounds) on the Expedition vs. Vistadome (they do allow you to bring more than one backpack as long as it's small). The seats were comfortable (4 to a table) and the food was yummy (it's practically a meal) and on the train ride from Macchu Picchu to Cusco, they entertained us with dancing, a fashion show (we did end up buying a scarf haha) and great service of these members: James Rivas, Dinora Ferro and Alex Cayo. Thank you for making our train ride memorable :)

Fun train ride to and from Machu Picchu. Great view ,smooth ride, fun food with modeling show included!! My kids had a blast! on the way to Machu Picchu you could see parts of the old Inca trail if you paid attention.

Well worth it!. The Vistadome train was definitely worth it. I was not expecting breakfast on our way to Aguas Calienties, and it was incredibly delicious. The bathrooms were clean and the staff was very pleasant and helpful
Travelling in vista Dome Train. Very pleasant experience. Magnificent scenery. Good snack service. Comfortable seating. Slow enough to appreciate vistas.

Awesome views, entertaining at night, but FREEZING COLD!. The first thing to note, is that they don't have heat on this train. It is so so so so cold. Had I known, I would have dressed warmer, but I was traveling to a warm place, on a train that I assumed was heated based on the price. We asked for blankets, which were being distributed, but were told they were only for children. Aside from the cold, the train was great! The views were wonderful. The food was nice, too, although the food that should have been warm (pancakes in the morning and pizza at night) was freezing cold like the rest of the train. At night, it was crazy. They do an alpaca fashion show. It was entertaining, but a little irritating since I had been sleeping, and I didn't actually want to buy their alpaca wear afterwards and they were rather pushy.

A Relaxing Way to visit Machu Picchu. Getting on the train was rather like catching a plane, needing to arrive early and show paperwork. It was all efficiently done though. Once on the train it was totally relaxing. There were views all around, even through the glass roof of the train. There was an enjoyable light breakfast served which just kept us going for a busy morning. The train travels slowly and steadily which enables you to fully take in the views of the mountains, Urubamba River and some fantastic vegetation, such as Bromeliads growing on tree trunks.The outward journey had a lot of Machu Picchu merchandise being pushed by the train staff, but as long as you were clear that you were not interested they immediately moved on.The return journey was fun with a scary Peruvian monster appearing out of nowhere. The train staff then put on an enjoyable "catwalk" fashion show. The female staff seemed to be enjoying dressing up and parading around. The one male member of staff clearly felt rather awkward about the whole idea. The alpaca fashion items were well designed but very expensive. It did get our eye in a bit when we did our own shopping for alpaca goods later on in a more conventional store.It is important to note that there is very little luggage space on the train. We could only take on our overnight bags and our main luggage had to taken separately to our next destination.

Machu Pichu to Cusco travel. Was very nicely done, the service was great - they even tried to entertain you with dancers. Overall enjoyable way to travel to Cusco - but if you are looking to sleep - don't take this train.

great.. but check sunset times. The train looked awesome and for the first ten minutes out of aguas caliente it was extremely scenic... then the sun set and the panoramic views went with them. My advice, before you spring for the vistadome, make sure you will be travelling in daylight, otherwise, its just as pleasant to sleep on a non-vistadome after u spent your day hiking mountains

Great entertaining on the way back. On the way back from machu picchu we took this train back. Seats were very confy, and one of the crew member dressed up like a clown? that keep us amused. They also did a runway show to promote the alpaca products, which was very interesting.

Without exceptionally helpful Perurail staff I would have missed Machu Picchu. I and my school friend are on 2 week trip visiting Lima, Cusco, Machu Picchu, Foz do iguazu and Rio. We had a very tight schedule and missing any one leg could have unravelled the trip. That is what I feared would happen when we arrived 2 minutes late (scheduled departure of 13:27) at Ollantaytambo station for our Perurail Vistadome train to Machu Picchu on 7th Aug. However the staff at the Perurail ticket booth contacted the Perurail manager Mr Alfredo who was a star of the day and perhaps of the trip for us. He understood our situation, told us to wait at the waiting room on the platform and that he would check on availability of seats on the 15:30 hrs train; which he promptly did and we were able to reach Agua Calientes and visit Machu Picchu on the 8th Aug as scheduled. The staff also advised us to leave our heavy bags at the 'Left Baggage' at the station which saved us from lugging it around. Kudos to Mr Alfredo and his team at Perurail in Ollataytambo- Great job and thanks a lot.

Excellent. Set of from Cusco at 7am to Macchu Picchu.It was great to see the countryside early in the morning in the mist and frost !The train and service were excellent.Breakfast was served on the way and consisted of fruit, cake and a choice of drinks.On the return trip there was a fashion show and music performed by the train stewards which was very entertaining. To experience the magnificent scenery was fantastic. Would recommend this train without hesitation.

Nice Views!. We took the VistaDome train back from Machu Picchu after doing the IncaTrail. The views were incredible and the service was really top-noch. They even brought around a little fresh-flower centerpiece for the table during the meal. There was a dance and Alpaca fashion show during the trip from Ollyantambo to Cusco. Given that it was getting late, I think the show was a bit long and the music a bit noisy. It was kind of hard to relax and look out the window with all the jumping around. This is the only reason why I'm giving the train 4 circles instead of 5.

Not worth the extra $50. This train is an additional $50 from the standard train, which happens to be operated by Peru Rails as well. Included is a little ham and cheese "sandwich" and a cinnamon roll. Both cheap/tasteless so eat before or bring something aboard. Water/soda/coffee included. Beers/alcoholic beverages more money. Really not sure where the extra $50 goes.... Definitely not to the 10 minutes of horrific dancing. Also not to the "fashion show" of overpriced alpaca put on by the attendants. Really just felt like a scam. All trains have good windows for scenery. Also, there was no air conditioning or circulation and everyone was complaining.

Good train to visit Machu Picchu. Not the greatest, but the staff is very friendly. There is a small breakfast in the trip getting there and a snack on the return, with an option to buy drinks if you want. The train is well kept and clean.

Perfect ending to a 4-day trek to Machu Picchu. After painfully hiking the 26 mile Inca Trail, my husband and I hopped aboard the VistaDome Train by PeruRail. What a pleasant experience. We met a couple who will be lifelong friends. We enjoyed awesome food and Pisco Sours. Best of all was the impeccable service. Gina Hoaytava, Daniel Rodriguez and Olivius Escalante attended to our every need. The fashion show was a plus as was the dancing clown and the fun music. Thank you.
Panoramic travel. This train leaves from the station in Ollanta to go all the way to Aguascalientes. This is the final stop from where you will continue your journey by foot to get to Machu Picchu.

Sit back and enjoy the ride!. In recent years the train ride Cuzco - Machu Picchu – Cuzco has seen a huge upgrade! Without going all out and fancy on the “Hiram Bingham” luxury train, one can now enjoy a beautiful ride on the Vista Dome. Modern wagons with glass ceilings, souvenirs sale, tasty snacks and even a fashion show on board will make this ride unforgettable. Of course, the views are also spectacular and will be engraved on ones memory, further helped by the Andean music in the background. Truly sit back and enjoy!

Scenic. I usually hate trains but the Vistadome was hassle free and the views incredible. The seats are assigned, and there are porters to handle luggage, so no need to search for seats lugging around suitcases. A beverage and snack is included. The ride back from Aguas Callientes had a bizarre little show put on by the stewards, with dancing, then a fashion show down the isles, in an attempt to sell alpaca products.

Beautiful scenery -- a bit expensive but unique. We took the Vistadome between Urubamba (Tambo del Inka resort) and Aguas Calientes (Machu Picchu). Views are terrific and our kids really enjoyed it. It's a bit pricey, but so are all things Machu Picchu. We had great customer service from Harem and Claudia Valdez, who helped get us onto an earlier train than what we had reserved. Very much appreciated!

Insider Secrets of PeruRail. MachuPicchu shouldn't be missed, but unfortunately you will have to take either PeruRail or InkaRail to get there or back.We took PeruRail round-trip Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, staying overnight in Aguas Calientes. We generally agree with the recent comments. The cost is too high, and the “VISTA” dome is over-hyped. We expected a glass dome train, like those on TransCanada….but found essentially elongated windows with very limited view. In retrospect, if not for the schedule we wanted to keep, I would have chosen the cheaper train. The people selling tickets both in Cusco and Ollantaytambo apparently have never ridden on one of their own trains, as they couldn’t answer basic questions about seating. Just so you know, seats are assigned automatically when purchased, and from what we could tell, passengers riding together, more often than not, are assigned seats that are not adjacent to one another, or even in the same row. Our seats were not together on either leg of the trip. Staff is unable to even tell you where your seats are based on your seat numbers (really?)….but here’s a hint: If you seat number is “odd”….it’s a window seat. We were both assigned window seats on both trips, but on opposite sides of the train, on different rows. Meanwhile, every PeruRail representative we spoke with assured us that our seats were adjacent. We are both fluent in Spanish…and there was no language issues here….just a lack of knowledge by the people selling the tickets. Let me emphasize that, despite being an “Orient Express” owned company, don’t expect the high level of service you get in North America or Europe. The people we dealt with were clueless, borderline incompetent.Here’s another hint. PeruRail staff won’t help you rearrange your seating on the train when you get on board…that is up to you. It really helps to be multi-lingual, because with luck you can work with the other people in your general area that also aren’t sitting together to switch seats so that you can sit with your own family or friends.Another hint: If you sit on the right side going towards Aguas Calientes or left side headed to Ollantaytambo, you won’t see much. The view is really only on the “river” side of the train.About PeruRail’s wonderful luggage policy, which is clearly posted on all materials and is stated to be very strict, with no exceptions….you are LIMITED to only 1 bag on board the train, with a TOTAL WEIGHT OF ONLY….11 POUNDS! If you have more luggage….it can be shipped to Aguas Calientes on a train that travels once per day, which most likely won’t work for your schedule. We questioned the ticket agent, and of course she said there were no exceptions. OK, here’s the tip….although we saw most people actually abiding by this policy (we foolishly did)….there were a number of travelers taking large and heavy luggage, with no problem. NO ON from PeruRail questioned the luggage these people took on the train. Of course, like most places in Peru, if you have a ticket on the train, you can check your luggage for free at the station in Ollantaytambo, which is what we did, picking it up when we returned the following day.The food is ridiculous. Dry, inedible sandwiches on both trips. Beverage is supposedly included. When I asked what I could choose from, I was told anything offered. Ready for this? I asked for a beer, and was told that wasn't included. Really? Everyone around me laughed and rolled their eyes at the irony.The negative comments in the other reviews about not knowing there was a transfer to a bus from Pachar to Cusco….that is unfair, and only shows that they didn’t do their homework. The train hasn’t left from Poroy (Cusco) for several years, due to damage to the tracks and bridge from El Nino flooding. That information is available in English and Spanish. Our assessment was that it was much easier to hire a driver to Ollantaytambo and catch the train there rather than from Cusco…especially if you are intending to overnight in Aguas Calientes. If you are doing a day trip to MachuPicchu from Cusco (in that case, god help you, expect a very long, hard day), you don’t have much choice due to scheduling of trains, so good luck with that.

Please be a good tourist!. The train is impressive with staff to help. BUT please be a curtious and aware human being. My boyfriend and I saved up to come here like many travelers And the train is something both of us haven't had much experience with. We had the misfortune of sitting behind an arrogant American family. My seat was 6 and his was 8. Another families nanny was nice enough to speak three languages to make it so we could so together. Imagine that! A teenage brat was moved from her window seat And this American family proceeded to make a big deal about how it's a once in a lifetime experience. WELL it was for us too!! We had front row seats and moved to the back to be away from this awful priviledged spoiled family! This was the 1pm-ish train, vistadome 303, aug 4th 2013. We are two young American newylweds and they almost ruined our train ride. We all need to step back and realize how priviledged we are to travel and to afford this lifestyle! It wasn't really worth it to pay more for the vistadome so save some money for yourself.

Great ride. The train ride from Ollantaytambo to Aqua Caliente (Machu Picchu) and back again was arranged by the tour company I used so I have no idea how much it cost but it was wonderful!! On the way to AC I sat on the mountain viewing side and on the way back to O I sat on the river viewing side. The train to AC had a configuration of 4 seats facing each other with a wooden table between us. We were served a very nice snack of fruit, pancakes, etc. The train has a partial see thru top so you can really see the glaciers and mountains while relaxing. On the way from AC the views of the rapids of the river are breathtaking. Both sides offer wonderful views o the surrounding mountains. The station in O was clean and quite spacious, the station in AC was clean and our hotel was within easy walking distance, as is the bus to Machu Picchu. There are many restaurants and shopping nearby. The train I took from AC also offered entertainment in the form of a guy dressed rather garishly and jumping around to traditional Peruvian music, quite funny. We were also given a fashion show and were able to purchase the items being worn by the models although they were quite expensive. The snack from AC was similar to the one we received on our way there. We did not take the train from or to Cusco because our guide advised that it would add more than an hour to our trip, we were taken by bus from our hotel to the Ollantaytambo station and when we came back to that station we were taken by bus to our hotel in Cusco. The bathrooms in both trains were clean.

Amazing Train!!!. Liked: Amazing views, friendly staff and the food is extravagant! (Also its destination at Machu Piichu obviously)Disliked: the repetitive music with the pan pipes, though this is my bpersonal taste.

Great train ride. We choose the Vistadome as it was luxurious but not ostentatious. There were light snacks served on board and even a fashion show which was fun and hilarious. The 4 hour ride from Machu Picchu to Cusco went by quite fast as we were provided with snacks, entertainment and could also enjoy the amazing scenery.
July 2013. On Time and great experience on Perurail. Clean and great snack service. The staff is friendly and it was a scenic great ride

Get Rid of the Fashion Show!. I cannot compare the windows or the seats to the backpacker train, but I have heard rumors that the backpacker train does not include the fashion show. All I wanted to do was sleep on the train ride back to Cusco, but it was impossible because of the ridiculously loud music. If the backpacker train does not include the fashion show, I strongly encourage taking that train back. It will be dark and you won't be able to enjoy the views from the windows anyway.

Train ride to Machu Picchu. We took the Vistadome train from Ollanta Station to Aguas Calientes. It is a 90 min train ride with the most breathtaking views. The train has windows on the ceiling as well as the sides. This gives you a full panoramic view of your journey.The service is excellent. On the way back they have a lovely fashion show of Peruvian clothing. It's done by the train staff and they make it fun by having the passengers participate. Our attendant Sixto was really good and got the crowd to partake in the show.

Nice journey, but.... Whilst this is a very pleasant and relaxing trip, with great views, the whole Macchu Picchu experience left me feeling a bit like the Peruvian authorities had a drip line into my wallet, ie everything is very expensive, ie $77 for the train each way, $62 for MP/Wayna Picchu, $10 for a sandwich, $10 each way for the bus. Of course you want to experience the whole thing, there's only one MP and it is magnificent, but you can't help thinking that that you're being taken advantage of. Hope they don't kill the golden goose, such as with the Puno-Cusco train which now costs about $300, forcing most tourists to travel by bus. However it is very well organised and it runs on time. Bear in mind that you are only allowed hand luggage, but some bring the whole caboodle and it's juts a matter of chance which type pf train you get and whether there is sufficient storage space. On our return trip they just stacked it all up against the emergency exit so no problem space wise.

Choose another provider. We travelled on the vistadome from macchu piccu to cusco. collecting our tickets in the cusco main square office was an ordeal. The girl we were dealing with was short tempered, rude and very unhelpful. My bank changed the card I purchased our tickets with just before leaving our home country which meant I couldn't provide her with the last four digits. In her defense their paper work does state that you need this, however we had three other cards with the same name, passport, international driver permit, home country drivers lic for ID. She was 100% unwilling to budge despite me clearly being the correct person. Some may call it fraud protection, but for a domestic 4 hr train I call it belligerent. I had to phone international just to get the last four digits of this old card - as if that's got anything to do with ID checking next to the several other forms we had there I mentioned.The train itself may have windows in the roof but lets be honest, what is seen through the roof 95% of the time - that's right, the sky. This is the only difference between expedition and vistadome trains structurally. The food was a major let down. We received one plate with (seriously) about ten peanuts, three slices of cheese, a few raisins, some tomato with a drink of water/soft drink/juice etc. no further food was available. Also, beer or wine were not available. Then the fashion show. They dress up their staff in different alpaca tops and parade them down the aisle for about 20-25 mins as a "fashion show". It was funny, as intended, but you can't miss the real reason for having this show - which is to fleece the customers further with those extra things they failed to purchase while on their wonderful holiday. Very very tacky, and prices of these items are, of course, highly inflated. After the show you can forget about getting any assistance from the staff (not that they can give you anything other than coke or juice anyway) as they are tied up with transactions of alpaca tops for quite some time.Is a four hour trip total macchu piccu to cusco, the last 1.5 hrs of this were spent on a bus. This is unavoidable due to track maintenance after the wet season. All in all yes it's a reliable service, but don't swallow all the "luxury" statements so easily. Vistadome is heavily advertised as luxurious but it sure as hell isn't. Peru Rail is also foreign owned, not by Peruvians. Try Inka Rail.

Don't think this is worth the extra. This train ride is only about 2 hours long. The seats are comfortable but is having a sheet of glass above your head plus a snack meal (similar to airline food) really worth the extra fare? I don't think so. The train is no faster and if its a sunny day (as it was on the day we travelled) you have to put on a sun hat. They also play piped Andean music on the carriage which is to loud so you end up shouting at your neighbours and soon the carriage is too noisy.Save your money and take the standard train.
Definitely worth the extra cost. The windows in the ceiling make all the difference as you travel through the Sacred Valley! A fantastic ride.

Vista Dome Machu Pichu to Cuzco. The train facilitie it's excellent and confortable. You can see the view outside from your chair. The price it's a little bit expensive for backpackers, but it's an excellent opportunity to come back from Aguas Calientes. They have some attractions during the trip. Very funny.
See my review on the Hiram Bingham....total rip-off. If you are time poor, then you unfortunately have no other choice than being terribly ripped-off by Peru Rail...well at least the view it nice.

Great ride out there. The ride to MP was great--luxury all the way, friendly staff. On the ride back, there was a problem along the line and we were delayed by a few hours. Instead of explaining the problem, the staff hid in their back room and refused to answer any questions. I was really disappointed with Peru Rail for the poor customer services.

An awful experience. This review is the same as I gave to Peru Rail. Earlier this month, we boarded the Vistadome in Aguas Calientes, having had a wonderful time, the previous 10 days in Cusco and on a 6 day trek through the Salkantay pass to the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu. The ticket we bought was for the destination Poroy, right outside of Cusco. After an hour and a half, without warning, the train stopped and we were all made to disembark in Pachar, and board buses for an uncomfortable two hour ride (without toilets) on buses to Cusco. The conductors did not even attempt to give us an explanation (though my grown daughter asked, in fluent Spanish). On the bus we heard a canned announcement that it was "for our safety" (No live human being talked to us the entire time). When I asked a Perurail official, taking down our passport numbers (the fourth time this happened on the trip) he said it was because it was "the rainy season in Cusco". But it is the dry season there!. Finally, a fellow trekker on the bus told us that they were working on rails outside Cusco, so that we couldn't take the train the whole way there. It would have been nice for them to tell us that, before we had the tickets, before, or during the train ride! Even before the sudden departure from the train, that lengthened the trip by well over an hour, this expensive trip was a disappointment. The snack was peanuts and raisins spilled over a tray; just hope you're not allergic to peanuts!. After a traditional dancer mugs for photos with travelers, and a little fashion show is given, the majority of the trip was spent trying to sell these overpriced alpaca textiles to the American tourists who fill the trains. Instead of getting to relax and enjoy the views, we had conductors turned peddlers pushing their wares in our faces the whole trip. They were so busy that I couldn't even get them to bring the change on a beer I bought for over an hour, and then he said I would have to accept dollars because he had "run out" of soles.
