Very nice presented and good flavor.Super worth it!

Terrible experience for canceling. For some accident about my family, I canceled my tickets on Sep 17th, and just got one email "Please let us inform you that your refund is being processed by our Countable department, once we have a confirmation with accreditation into your credit card we’ll let you know, the process will take 02 weeks from now"After three weeks, I didn't receive any more information, so I tried to write email to them. But I got nothing. They just ignore my email. I used the on-line service on Nov 4th. The lady helped me to reach the refund department. And she told me "that, they are verifying the case and they will write to you. if you do not receive a message in the next three days please do not hesitate to write me"And I thought I will get the refund soon. But I was wrong. The refund department didn't write to me. I told the lady on Nov 11th. After that, I got the email from refund department finally. And the email said "Please let us inform you that we are verifying with the credit card payment administrator why there is a delay on your reimbursement. Once we have news from the referred area we will let you know as soon as possible."After this email, I got nothing again. I haven't received my refund until now. It's almost 4 months after I send my request. I doubt whether I can get my money back. I am very disappointed about Perurail. I won't recommend any friend Perurail.
Worth the extra 30-40 bucks. its nice because its comfortable and they have panoramic views from the roof top of the train so you can see the mountains while traveling the 3 1/2 hrs to Machu Picchu

Vistadome back to Cusco, not necessary after 6pm. After 6pm , it is not necessary to pay extra for Vistadome train back to Cusco, as it is will night at around 6.30pm..As well avoid trains finishing at OLLANTOYTOMBO, as the car transfert from there to CUSCO is extremely long (2 hours)

Good views, but hot on a sunny day. It is a 3 1/2 hour ride from Poroy to Aguas Caliente. The train moves pretty slow, but there is beautiful scenery the whole way. The extra windows on the roof afford a nice view, but it got quite warm when the sun was shining.

Very bad!!!. Sat in the front wagon, and all the smoke from the locomotive went directly in to our wagon... For three hours the air was full off smoke, and we all arrived to Aguascalientes felling bad! Not the best start to our visit at Machu Picchu. According to the staff on board, this was not unusual?

VERY comfortable, excellent attraction. We've traveled to many corners of the world but, never have we experienced a Fashion-Show put on by the staff. What a great experience. OK food, great drinks, good value for money, fabulous entertainment and great scenery. A "must" for any trip to South America (Peru) when going to/from Machu PichuThe staff is VERY friendly, accommodating and just plain fun to experience.

Satisfying Transportation to Aguas Calientes. I traveled via Perurail as part of a group, which meant I had no opportunity to review and compare other train options. Considering it was my only choice, I was satisfied with my ride. We picked up the train in Ollantaytambo and rode less than two hours into Aguas Calientes.Here are a few of my pointers. #1 I didn't realize until after I boarded that the seats are actually assigned. Be sure to request a window seat on the left as you head into Aguas Calientes. The Urubamba River is on your left and offers the best views throughout your ride. #2 I was so tired on my return trip to Ollantaytambo that I had no preference. #3 The train served a snack on the way there and a slightly heavier meal on the return. If you're a picky eater or simply require decent portions it wouldn't hurt to walk with your own snacks. #4 The train has luggage restrictions you must consider. My group handed out duffel bags and required everyone to pack for two evenings and leave their luggage in our Cusco hotel. #5 The Perurail employees perform a fashion show on the return trip, which is obviously intended as a sales effort to have you purchase exclusive alpaca products. #6 There is a traditional dancer who wears a costume and goes back and forth in the car. Some people found it annoying while others found it charming. #7 The train plays folksy music over the loudspeaker throughout the ride. Some people can tune it out while I found it annoying. #8 If you don't expect too much and your main objective is to arrive/depart Aguas Calientes safely, on time and comfortably, Perurail is a good choice.

train to heaven. Traveled day after summer solstice. On the way to Macchu Piccu, I took the budget train but returned on the Vistadome.Definitely worth the difference in price.Comfortable seats, great service and a view to die for.

A great way to travel to Machu Picchu. Very time efficient, comfortable and comfy seats. Food served and additional snacks can be purchased. Also souvenirs sold on the train too. Provides awesome scenery of the country side with large windows. The zigzag railway was pretty unique too.
So long as it does not rain. Take the Orient Express if you can, if not then this is the next choice. Food is ok, the most fun is that the staff do a fashion show... no truely... they do.

Diesel fumes inside our train car. All the way from Cusco to Aguas Calientes our car was intoxicated with the fumes coming from the train engine. I got a headache and my eyes were red. If you take a reservation don't take the first car (A). It was a nightmare.

Majestic sights. The ride to Machu Pichuu is an adventure. It takes you through beautiful scenery of the Andes and the river that runs next to the tracks. It was a little off putting that they spent so much time selling wares during the ride.

Good views but slow!. i took both the vista dome and expedition trains for our trip to and from Machu Picchu. A few suggestions- I would not recommend the vista dome over expedition. The tickets are more expensive for little incremental value (bigger windows and slightly better snacks). - on your way back from Machu Picchu to cusco get off at ollantayambo and take a taxi from there. You will save quite a bit of time (about 30 to 40 min)- make sure you check luggage restrictions. Only one piece of hand luggage is allowed (was 5 kg each for us). We were able to squeeze in two mid size suit cases in addition to carry on....but I think we got lucky as the rest of the passengers did not have too much luggage with them.
good value for money. excellent view of the scenery, superb and nice service, no need to the fashion show but nice try, excellent value for money
nice train ride. Not as luxurios and the Bingham but very nice ride, good snack and very on time. Has large windows that go up to the ceiling so you can admire the astonishing views.
Nice trip, too long and expensive. Took 4 hours to get from Machu Picchu to Poroy (Cusco), but its the only option, ie Monopoly. Its only 60 miles, but the train is super slow.

Enjoyable Ride. This is an enjoyable ride, it's a comfortable train, and a good way to get to Machu Picchu. However, we took the Hiram Bingham train back (it was booked going to Machu Picchu) and the experience was so amazing, that the Vistadome ride pales in comparison.

Excellent view, comfortable journey. There's really not much difference between the Expedition and the Vistadome train except the Vistadome is more comfortable and there is more room. A meal and soft drinks were included and it was good too.Book in advance if possible so you have more options. If you take the Vistadome one way that is enough, save yourself some money and get the Expedition back. Sit back and enjoy the view.

Not a lot of options to Machu Picchu-this one does pretty good. Having not taken the other trains to Machu Picchu, I can't really comment on their views/services but Vistadome does a pretty good job not just getting you where you want to go but trying to let you do it in style. The Vistadome views are amazing. The whole sides of the train are basically windows and about 2/3 of the roof. Amazing views and picture opportunities! The food is only "eh" but seriously, you're not taking the train for a gourmet meal. It's a snack and as long as you don't expect more than that, you won't be disappointed. The seating is pretty tight so yes, you will be getting cozy with your neighbors. It's set up around tables (for the food service) so you will have a person next to you and 2 across from you. Tough not to play footsie with the guy across as there isn't much leg room. There is a fun show on the way back. They can be a little pushy with the products they are trying to sell but just politely say no a few times and they should move on to the next person. You can get the same quality for much cheaper in Cusco. Oh and the one con was that on the return trip my wife and I were seperated. This was a last minute change that was not passed on to my travel agent. It kind of put a bad spin on a great trip as we had to spend the 3hr trip back with strangers rather than be able to talk about the magesty of what we had just seen at Machu Picchu.

Nice views - Would you like a souvenier with that?. I thoroughly enjoyed the food and service on the Vistadome train. The windows surround the roof of the train so it helps to see the peaks of the scenic mountains. I did not expect a snack to be included on the train. The servers lay out table runners and flowers before they bring out the snacks which is a nice touch. The train is a little commercial. On the way up they sold souveniers and on the way back there was a fashion show designed to sell alpaca clothing. It was however entertaining! The train plays music but I think it is the same music for the entire journey. They might want to switch the tunes.On the way up to Machu Pichu the bathroom was a bit dirty and the floor was very wet. It wasn't cleaned at all for the trip.

Great views. Very friendly service, fine new and well-equipped train. Steward and stewardess put on fashion show on return trip that featured beautiful Alpaca clothing, invited daughter and granddaughter to join as models!
Beautiful views. The view and the trip up to Machupicchu was spectacular ,look at the mountains throught the windows in the roof of the train were priceless

2nd visit to Machu Picchu. I was happy that the seats were very comfortable this time round. The river was raging and I had plenty of opportunities for some good photos. Overall the 2 1/2 trip was enjoyable.

Enjoyed the scenic train trip. The vista dome was a very beautiful scenic train ride from Ollantatambo to Aquas Callientes. The train was comfortable. I took a small carry on suitecase which was put in a luggage area by the train staff who were helpful. It was comfortable and roomy enough. The Vista dome train is a much smoother ride than the back packer train. Worth the price difference.

Scenic ride to Aguas Caliente. Although we missed catching our Perurail Vista Dome Train by 5 min (cancelled flight out of Lima to Cusco), we had our cab driver take us to Ollantaytambo, the next stop for the train. Once there, we enjoyed the local fanfare before taking the train to Aguas Caliente. The staff was very pleasant and apologetic that we had missed the train (not their fault!). An Andean snack was served, potato/cheese skewers and something like couscous with carrots... all delicious! On the train ride back to Cusco, traditional Andean table runners were laid on the table and we had more Andean Cuisine along with a bottle of wine. Very relaxing! The staff put on a fashion show (beautiful Alpaca garments) and a traditional dancer dressed in costume entertained us as well. We took the last train out of Aguas Caliente so it was dark when we arrived in Cusco. The scenery on this round trip was fantastic!
Very tiring trip. The staff was great. HOwever, they could add some tv or some type of entertainment. It is a 3 hr ride.

Nice trip to Machu Picchu. Comfortable with great windows. Meet folks from all over the world. Loved fashion show on return trip. Husband received baby alpaca sweater he liked for Christmas. Attendants charming.

Nice fashion show. Yes, am aware it is the train but they do have a fashion show on the train...... initially i thought OMG how cheesy is this but trust me the staff make it so cool that in the end you are clapping hard and having too much fun. This is on the way back from MP to Poroy. So after a tiresome trip, you literally let your hair down!The main thing to remember is on your way up to MP, try getting seats on the left side if you want some great photos.
Views and comfort. What a great way to get back to Cusco after hiking for 4 days. The views were amazing, the staff was very friendly and the entertainment was great!

Not a bad trip but not what we expected. For the high price for the train we expected a little more than what we got. However, our return trip from machu Picchu was MUCH better with better food and a fashion show as a way to show off the products for purchase which was a laugh and a great way to sell the products rather than just having then on a cart. The service was fine although seat allocation is automatic when booking online so if you book in person request a lake side seat - the view is much better!
Really cool. This train ride was awesome. it follows along the Rio Urubamba and its beautiful. during the rainy season its raging super hard. pretty cool stuff.

Overpriced ride to Machu Picchu. Peru Rail seems not to care about customer service, and their near monopoly control of the train service to Machu Picchu allows them to charge whatever price they wish. The Vistadome, which we took from Aguas Calientes back to Ollantaytambo, is much pricier than the Expedition, which we took from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes, and yet the service is only ever-so-slightly better and the view is basically the same--the windows are only slightly larger.

Comfy & Clean. What a comfortable train. We were server drinks and food and never before have I seen a fashion show on a train. Of course they were selling the the llama & alpaca made goods. Not cheap but very nice pieces. But you do have to be very careful not only on the train but in all of Peru they try to sell you llama &alpaca made things and say it's baby alpaca(which is much more expensive). If your looking for baby alpaca buy in a store that sells baby alpaca.

Only way to reach Macchu Pichu!. We took the Vistadome from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and had a most amazing train trip. We sat in the very front of the car and it felt like we were driving. The windows are large and you are able to see in all directions. The scenery is beautiful as you climb towards the mountains and Macchu Pichu. It is not worth taking this particular train at night since you can't see but during the day when you can see all, it's the best.

Beautiful train ride, not sure vistadome is worth extra $. The train ride is exceptionally beautiful, passing through the Urubamba valley with glimpses of Mount Veronica towering above. However due to the hillsides the rails are cut into the vistadome windows are very seldomly useful. Most of the time the windows are overshadowed by trees or high hills. Probably an equally beautiful ride on the regular train for cheaper.

It's a train. I travelled to Machu Picchu on the expedition and came back on the vistadome. No real difference other than the vistadome has leather seats and a little more leg room.It left on time, got me to the destination fine and the onboard service was friendly.The best thing are the views.

Fun!. We took the Vistadom from Machu Picchu to Cusco. The best part of the trip was the fashion show and the crazy clown that entertained us throughout a portion of the trip.The cons to the Vistadome are: inadequate leg room (its not too bad, but be prepared to get comfy with whoever is sitting across from you!), poor food (they really try to make the food very fru-fru including its presentation, but they could really save some money by giving people something they will actually eat... I can only imagine how much time, money and food is wasted.), and the hard sell of the items that they wore in the fashion show.There is a cheaper train, with better snacks and no selling of items... that might be a better bet. Overall, this is a good option. I have called this average, but only because it isn't "Very Good" and there isn't a "Good" rating.

Very entertaining. Well, I have never taken a train ride like this before. Not only great scenery, but couldn't believe it when a colourful masked man started to dance along the carriage to loud music - this was great fun and gave a real holiday feel. This was then followed by a fashion show... couldn't believe it but very entertaining! :-)

Getting to Machu Piccu. The vistadome is just fantastic with outstanding views through the glass roof. Well organised and punctual. Snack served on the train. Not sure about pasta at tea time, but thats personal. Would have preferred a train to Poroy on the outskirts of Cusco rather than road from Ollantytambo, but there are fewer trains which go right through.

GOOD SERVICE. We used this service last week and was very good. I liked the lovely snack, very traditional and delicius. Staff were very friendly and will take care of you. The view is excellent. In brief, I recommen to use this train.

OK. Nothing super special, in my opinion. You don't have many options to get up/down to Machu Picchu, and they're all pretty overpriced. Moderately comfortable seats, pretty good views if you're out during the day (useless upon descent from Machu Picchu come late afternoon). It's a long ride, so be prepared.

A Train To Heaven. The vistadome on the Perurail allows you to enjoy the Urumbamba Rivier alongside, and the majestic mountains of the Andes jutting straight up to the heavens. A comfortable and relaxing part of the journey. Be careful to check their baggage limitations as they are minimal (think back only)

Vistadome not worth the extra money- take Expedition. The views are the same & the trains are the same too. We thought the Vistadome would be windows all around but they were the same as the windows on the Expedition. The difference between the 2 are the seats (leather vs cloth), the snacks (a bit better in Vista) and the show you get on the Vista (no show in the Expedition).

AmazingStaff. Really comfortable train with exceptionally efficient and friendly staff on both journeys. Ther enthusiasm and willingness to share knowledge really made the trip. Of course, the scenery was great too.

Helen above and behond. Took the train to Machupicchu last week and the trip was wonderful, customer service was superbe and Helen contribution to the fashion show was the piece de résistance.Congradulation to the company for employing such wonderful and haaapy employe.Everyone from the Linblad/National Geography group enjoyed it and at least 4 beautiful shawls where purchased thanks to Helen gracious elegance.Richard

Comfortable ride to Machu Picchu. A wonderful and comfortable train ride on the way to Machu Picchu. Peru Rail was the best. They had wonderful staff and the views were out of this world. The only negative is that you are limited to an 11lb backpack so if you are plannign to spend the night in Machu Picchu you would scramble to fit all that you need into the backpack but then they don't weight it ... The ride was very comfortable, they served a snack which we did nto expect and covered the table with gorgeous runners. Enjoyed it.

Fun experience. We took the Hiram Bingham out to Aguas Calientes, but alas our travel budget couldn't afford the return trip on the same, so we took the Vistadome. It was a pleasant experience. The train was clean and the service impeccable. Don't expect to be full with the food offering, while it was elaborately presented and delivered, the portions were meager - if you're hungry after hiking Machu Pichhu, better bring something to augment the service. There was a fashion show of Alpaca knitwear that had everyone on the train clapping and laughing. Overall a very nice way to transit to/from Poroy to Aguas Calientes.

Excellent!. Took the train from Aguas Calientes to Ollanta and had the best experience. The views are beautiful, the food is delicious, the service is excellent! The best is the entertainment! Celmira, James, and Erick feom the 13:37 train on 6/10/12, carriage A gabe the best entertainment with fashion show and dancing in the mask and colorful costume. I will definitely ride with Peru Rail again and also recommend it to all my friends and family that will travel to Peru. Thank you for the best experience!

Great service, great scenery. This is the most popular way to get to both Aguas Calientes and Machu Picchu. My ride was amazing with scenery and the staff couldn't have been nicer. One supervisor named Alfredo went out of his way to point out interesting sites along the way so I wouldn't miss taking photos of them. I would recommend taking this train every time you wish to visit this part of Peru.

Jaw-dropping scenery and price. The train ride from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes is one of the world's great rides and the Vistadome shows it off beautifully. Add a tasty breakfast and comfortable surroundings and you've got a classy and romantic package.The only only thing that spoiled it slightly for me was the generic pan pipe music played on loop for the whole trip. Nothing against Peru's national heritage, but surely the country can manage more than one CD for all the buses, trains and public spaces?Sad that all the train prices on this route are pitched so ridiculously high. There are plans for an airstrip close to AC which may bring the rates down some.

amazing experience!. We took the Expedition from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes and the Vistadome for the way back. The trip was amazing compared to the last time I went to Machu Picchu 7 years ago (local train with lots of people standing, bags and chickens), certainly a different experience. The difference between Exp and Vis are the seats, the snacks (ok in both cases) and the show (typical dances + fashion show on Vis). Definitively recommend it!

Nice trip!!. We took the Vistadome train to travel from Aguascalientes to Ollantaytambo, and it was very good; the train left on time, and the service was excellent and fun because the staff made a fashion show with fine textile of Cusco made with Alpaca, Lama, and Vicuña . The snack were tasty.

Tres Amigos Expedition. Our experience of Machu Picchu would not be complete without this amazing train ride. In addition to stunning scenery, the staff was extremely, smiling and created a very unique atmosphere. Our special thanks to Francisco Soraya and Yonel for making our return journey a truly magical experience.
Love it!! I will come back!!. we had a fantastic experience, the service was excelent , the trip is wonderful and the show on our way back inside the train was wonderful
The best Train to MP. Its a nice and probably the best ride to MP for the cost, in comparison to the other possibilities being offered

Excelent service and view. The experience of visiting Macchu Pichu wouldnt be the same if not riding this train. The service was really good providing a harm service and trying to make every detail unforgettable. When we were returning to Cusco they showed us very nice Alpaca cloths and they put us to model in the train.

Maybe should refocus on the fundamentals. Loved the seat, the atmosphere, the music, the service, the fact I could see the canyon we were going through, everything .... but.... i think i'd be happy to trade the music against actually leaving on time, or being given a clear ETA when the train suddently stops for 10 minutes in the middle of nowhere, and other basics of a train services.I love when train services go the extra mile but the extra perks are only worth it if the basics are there. Otherwise the value for money just isn't there.

Not a great experience at a hefty price-tag. Initially I have to say that we had our arrangements booked quite late which made things a bit stressful but the PeruRail train ride was the worst bit of what I experienced as milking the tourism around Machu Picchu (which is an amazing site I would not want to have missed) to the maximum.As Swiss citizen, we are used to a very high quality of railway service, hence the contrast with PeruRail was quite stark. While the "cheapest" option costs around USD30 one way, we had only the VistaDome train option left (due to our late booking among other things) which comes at USD 50+ one way. We ended up paying USD 120 per person both ways (Ollantaytambo - Aguas Calientes) which compared to other means of transport in Peru but even by Swiss measures is a very high price for a 1.5hrs train ride. Admittedly the ride is impressive from a view perspective, however, the VistaDome rooftop windows do not enhance the experience so much. Further to that, we were crammed up into a 4 people compartment without any space to stow luggage. Throughout the ride we were exposed to the diesel exhaust of the train rendering us nearly unconscious and with a serious headache once we had reached Aguas Calientes, not sure if this is better in the other carriages however avoid carriage C to avoid the worst. In order to justify the horrendous price (in my eyes) RailPeru is serving a crappy snack and a beverage (classical airline food, alcoholic drinks cost extra).Due to a technical issue our train was delayed by half an hour on top which did not contribute to the experience.In a nut-shell, given there is no "real option" to the train (unless you are opting for the Inca trail or the luxury train) book the cheapest train and do it as early as possible to obtain lowest fares. Otherwise pay up for the luxury train or go for the Inca Trail (given my experience f the vast offerings in the Cusco area will be subject to similar treatment).Unfortunately, PeruRail is to me the spearhead around the Machu Picchu tourism industry (given the very poor value for money) which is seriously milking the cow and left me with a bad after-taste - Galapagos and other South American tourist attractions are also expensive but done in a much more sympathetic way giving the impression money was well spent.

Best seats on Vistadome. Carriage A - Seats 1 & 2.
Sit right at the front next to the driver looking forward along the track. Not sure how you would go about booking them as the web site does not let you choose seats, but it would certainly be worth going out of your way to get these seats.

Reserve online, pay in Lima, avoid lines in Cusco. The town of Aguas Calientes is at the foot of Machu Picchu -- and this train is the only way to get there. PeruRail's website didn't like our credit cards (even after signing up for MasterCard SecureCode etc), so we made a reservation online, then went to a bank in Lima to pay for the tickets prior to flying to Cusco. On the journey there, we took the backpacker train, which was full of backpackers. :) We picked up the train in Ollantaytambo because we wanted to see the Inca ruins there as well. On the way back, we took the Vistadome all the way back to Cusco, which was almost like flying business class (the snack was served on china with actual utensils. The train was super comfortable after a day of hiking in the ruins!

Difficulty purchasing tickets. PeruRail practically has a monopoly on the trains to Machu Picchu -- there are two other companies that run infrequently -- so you pretty much have to take this train unless you're doing the Inca Trail. Fortunately, it's a nice ride with breathtaking views. The only knock on the ride itself was that the staff puts on this tacky "fashion show" where they walk up and down the aisle wearing expensive alpaca products and then try to sell you on it after the show.My main problem with PeruRail is the website. If you're American, you will not be able to buy tickets directly through the website. You will get blocked by something called Verified By Visa, and when you call your bank to ask what the heck that is, you'll get ten different answers that all end with you still not being able to buy tickets.So what I did was contact PeruRail through email and ask for suggestions. They sent over a form where I was able to buy tickets by providing my credit card number. However, it was a worrisome process because they have slow communication. After I paid PeruRail it took a while before they sent the e-tickets, which was pretty nerve wracking. They really need to upgrade their system so non-Peruvians can purchase tickets with ease and security.

Fair, but not earth-shattering. OK service - but despite a seat right at the front I was stuck with another (empty) carriage blocking my view for most of the trip. The front is really the only place to get a view for most of the journey, with the side and top windows offering limited scope. The train was on time and a fairly tasty snack was served. On the way back to Cusco there was a fairly irritating fashion show.

Take the vistadome train. When me and my mom took the train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes we chose the Vistadome it has nice comfortable leather seats, panoramic views and on board service of snack tray and beverages. I highly recommend anybody interested in going to Machu Pichu to take a taxi from Cusco to Ollantaytambo and the vistadome train vs the expedition from Ollanta to Aguas.The price difference is not that much higher than the expedition and is well worthy. The vistadome doesn't make any stops and the expedition stops all the time to pick up the locals who travel in a different portion of the train, but all of the stops are a hassle and it makes the trip about 45 mts longer tna the vistadome. The expedition seats are not as comfortable and the onboard service is very basic, coffe or water and some peanuts. I am telling you take the vistadome is worthy to pay the extra, and is really not that much. You can go on the perurail website and plug in your route and dates, and a chart with prices and times will appear, then you will see the price difference is not that much more. I took the expedition from Aguas calientes back to Ollantaytambo and I won't do it again.

Comfortable rides between Aguas Caliente and Cusco. I took the Vistadome train in from Cusco to Aguas Caliente (both ways, return) and found it to be a very comfortable ride. On Day 1 and not wanting to lose out on time at Machu Picchu, I took the Vistadome that departed Cusco at 6.59am. I boarded with coffee and croissant in hand, only to realise that there was going to be breakfast served on board. So much for fearing that there was not going to be food. The Vistadome crew was efficient and set about their meal service, entertainment and on board shopping cart service professionally serving a full carriage, and probably a full train. As we chugged along the rail lines towards Aguas Caliente past rolling vistas and streams along the way, the highlight (for me) came when the train went on the exaggerated zig zag down to allow our descent into the sacred valley. (I had read reviews that the zig zags were closed but perhaps this was a later set of zig zag switches, cos we definitely zig-zagged our way down and the announcement was also made by the train operator to proudly announce that we would be zig-zagging soon, a very Peruvian innovation to have trains scale mountains)The return journey (the next day) left around 5pm and we got in to Cusco around 9pm. Unlike the morning ride in to Aguas Caliente, the passengers on this evening train back in to Cusco were a little more boisterous (but not in a bad way), probably just happy from their Machu Picchu experience! And just for fun to toast to our Machu Picchu experience, we ordered a Pisco Sour from the bartender to enjoy on the journey back to Cusco too.Train departure and arrival times were punctual, no issues there. I booked the Vistadome tickets online on Perurail’s website and it was a very easy site to navigate and use as well.

Skip the Vistadome! Otherwise, okay.. It's hard to complain...if you don't hike the Inka trail, you've got to get there somehow! The trail ride was pleasant enough. I took the "backpacker" class train on the way there, and the Vistadome on the way back. The two trains themselves are nearly identical. Both are overpriced, and for the extra 10-15 dollars, in the Vistadome you are subjected to a "dancer" and fashion show, all designed to take advantage of the captive audience and sell you expensive alpaca knits. I'd rather have been on the less expensive train and not trapped into shopping. The train ride itself and scenery were just fine, and I enjoyed comparing notes and plans with friendly fellow travelers on The way.

Enjoy the View. The Perurail is what it is. We only took the short trip from Ollantayambo to Machu Picchu, which was fine, as the views were magnificent. The staff was kind and friendly, providing good service to make the trip enjoyable. A few notes when traveling by Perurail. The seats are close together and you may be sitting face to face with another pair (as the seats are two by two). This wasn’t a problem at all for us, just be prepared that it may happen depending on how you book your ticket. The stations can be very crowded depending on the time your train is, so make sure to get there early and be prepared to wait. On the plus side they do have snacks and drinks at the station, so site back and enjoy another pisco sour. Enjoy the ride and take in the scenery, remember you’re in Peru on your way to Machu Picchu.

Overpriced and a long trip. I like trains but this made for a long dreary 2 rides, getting there and coming back. Having to be at the Train Station at 5:30am means getting up at 4am in the morning at Cusco. It is a 30 minute taxi ride from Cusco to Poroy (where the station is). Odd thing is that the attendants showed up at 6am. Only people at the station were me and 2 Japanese Tourists along with the coffee bar attendant! Brazilians and Argentinians showed up at 6:05am. The train is relatively comfortable but man it takes long to go 90 kms even if it is difficult terrain. Scenic vistas are OK, you probably will not get to see much with the early morning fog and constriction in the valley.Returning, this was early May it was dark by 6pm so most of the ride is in the dark, forget any scenic vistas. It gets back at 8:30-8:45pm.In comparison a cab from Cusco would take 2 hours at most. I suggest visiting Macchu Picchu after 1pm when the sun pops out of the winter sky and the tourists are losing their enthusiasm. On my next trip I wll stay in Ollantaytambo and take a taxi from there. Should be no more than an hour and leave leisurely at 11am. Return to Ollantaytambo at 6-7pm after Macchu Picchu closes at 5pm.

Vistadome is OK. If you have trouble riding backwards be warned that you could easily wind up sitting that way for 2 or 3 hours. We appealed to the conductor who managed to get someone to switch with us as I get nauseated riding backwards. Your ticket does not indicate if you wil be sitting backwards or not. Vistadome is OK - but it is basically transportation - not a high-end experience like the Hiram Bingham cars. They did serve drinks (for a fee) as well as free soft drinks and little ham sandwiches. On the ride from Machu Picchu to Cusco we had a show (a clown/dancer type and a fashion show of Alpaca wear). Our seat mates were fun and we chatted with them much of the way. There are basic toilets on the train as well.

I enjoyed the journey. I travelled one-way from Aguas Calientes to Cusco. The Vistadome train left Aguas Calientes at 15.20 and we arrived in Cusco at circa 19.00. The train followed the River Vilcanota for about 90 minutes, then in Ollantaytambo we off-loaded onto coaches to take us to Cusco. I was pleased I was able to open my window and take photos while the train was moving. A nicely presented snack on the train followed by a light hearted but quite nice fashion show. The transfer to the coach was pretty seamless. In Cusco you’re dropped off at the station where there are plenty of taxis waiting – negotiate the taxi fare before getting in; I’d be happy to do the same journey again.

Beware their strict policies. Although the trip to Machu Picchu and back on PeruRail was comfortable, you should be aware that they are not very accommodating when it comes to changing itineraries.I just got back from a 10-day trip to Peru with three friends. Due to unforseen circumstances, we wanted to change our afternoon ticket on the return from Machu Picchu to Olly to a morning train. We had been told that for about $10 U.S. we could make the change if there was availability.However, when we arrived at the ticket booth in Aguas Calientes, the ticket agent, Alina Choquehuanca Luna, told us the only way to change our itinerary was to purchase new tickets. She said there were seats available, but she could not exchange our afternoon tickets for tickets on the morning train. At no time did she even offer to make the change if we paid the additional $10.When we told her that we needed to make the change due to an unforseen circumstance, she basically told us that we should have "planned our emergency better."

refreshing and comfortable. We ( me and my wife) reached the Bus Station at Cusco at 5:30 AM to board our bus to go to Ollanteytambo to take train to Aguascaleintes ( Machu Picchu) at 6 AM and afetr 2 hours of eventless travel in teh bus, reached teh train station and boarded our PeruRail, Vistadome to go to Machu Picchu. The train provides you a frugal breakfast and hence recommend you to take your breakfast at the hotel itself ( we took our breakfast at 5:15AM!) if you are one of those types who live on Breakfast! But this will be compensated by the scenery surrounding you! As we were traveling during the rainy season, the river Urubamba was flowing, ferociuosly in full swing and you will travel along the river for most part of your journey. This is similar to the Trans Siberian Rail along with lake Baikal This journey takes around 2 hours plus to reach Aguascaientes. While returning, we were treated with some folk show and fashion show (?). The worst part in the whole program is the bus journey from Ollantaytambo to Cusco which is a bit boring. More so, because, we did the same route previous day on our excursion to Pisac and Ollantatambo attractions.

Great experience. A step back into time. The vistadome was the ideal way to travel through this narrow canyon shared only with a raging Urubamba river and a thickening blanket of green. They served us a meal and entertained us with a masked dancer and a fashion show. Marvelous!

The Vistadome is good .. but lack of information at Machu Picchu station was appalling. We travelled on the Vistadome to and from Machu Picchu. (Because it was the rainy season, the first part of the journey from Cusco to Ollantaytambo was by bus). The good: The train itself is very comfortable and the service is better than on most short-haul flights (you're served a small meal and a soft drink). Email correspondence while planning the trip was quick and efficient.The bad: I had a lot of trouble using the Perurail website. Every time I tried to book a train, the session would time out once I had filled in all the details, so I ended up having to book by email (which thankfully, as mentioned above, was easy to do). The biggest complaint involves our return journey, though. We arrived at Machu Picchu station in good time. Shortly after arriving, a member of staff approached us (seemingly at random) and asked if we wanted to go on an earlier train. When it turned out it was an Expedition train, and not a Vistadome (which is what we had booked), we turned it down. What we didn't know at this point (because there weren't any announcements and this member of staff hadn't told us either), is that there had been a mudslide and that some of the trains had been delayed. Our departure time came and went without any announcements being made about our train, and then they suddenly called passengers for the Vistadome service that was due to leave about an hour after ours. When we went up to staff to find out what was going on, we were told our train was delayed - yet somehow this next Vistadome service (to the same destination) was leaving on time. It was only after we got a bit stroppy that they eventually found us seats on this train. (Goodness knows how long we would have waited for a train if we hadn't spoken up). Now I realise that mudslides are beyond Perurail's control but what is totally unprofessional is that in the 90 minutes we were at Machu Picchu station there wasn't a single announcement to explain to passengers what was happening or to inform us that our particular Vistadome service had been delayed. The bizarre: The piped music throughout the journey gets a bit much after a while. Also, the fashion show on the return journey was a bit surreal, although it did seem to be a big hit with at least some of the passengers...

Decent views. This was a bit more luxury than the backpacker train, but not as good as the Andean Explorer.Sure you get food/drink and good views, but it is dear so if you're on a budget then you could afford to miss this one out.Good journey all the same.

Great views!. It's definitely worth the extra money to take the Vistadome from Cusco to Machu Picchu. The train was comfortable, the service attentive, the food was good, and the views along the way were spectacular!Due to a mistake on the part of our travel agent we had the pleasure of riding in the luxury class train back to Cusco. The atmosphere was quite soothing and the service first rate!

Review of Peru Rail. We did not take the Hiram Bingham train, but our experience with Vistadome was the worst part of our whole stay in Peru. At the price of $35, we traveled the 43km between Ollantaytumbo and Machupicchu village for 2 hours, and for 3 hours on the way back! Additionally, in the rainy season (Jan-Mar), they replace train with vans (they call buses) from Ollanta to Cusco, and that portion is $50 per person. So it is a total rip-off compared to $5 for collectivos. I am not sure there is a paved road between Ollanta and Machupicchu, but do yourself a favor and find an alternative to Peru Rail.

a perfect way to travel through the Andean mountains: great service and a speed that allows great sight-seeing. The Andean Explorer is definitely the best was to travel from Cusco to Puno: The scenery is breath-taking and majestic; and the service and the meals are impeccable. It is a one-in-a lifetime experience.Thanks for a great travel!

Incredible experience. It was a 10.5 hr train ride from Cusco to Puno which travels through mountains along a river and stops briefly in a market - the journey went really fast, after breakfast (which you pay for ) is welcoming drinks, live music, then lunch and tea then afternoon tea and bartending classes.. The service was incredible from everyone and particularly my host, Elmer, who made sure I had everything I needed and was incredibly helpful to everyone in the carriage.

An Amazing Experience. In my opinion this is the only way to travel from Puno to Cusco in luxury and well worth the cost.You relax in style in comfortable chairs with a table in front of you, and are served an excellent lunch and afternoon tea. There's even a Pisco demonstration in the bar.The service is excellent and you pass fantastic scenery on the way.

The Best Experience Ever - More than just a train. The Andean Explorer was a fabulous train. The 10 1/2 hour ride to Cusco went by so fast. The service was excellent and the food was great. What helped make the time go by fast besides the multiple food servings and service was the train itself and the entertainment. In the train you could walk through the other cars and go to the bar or observation car. Even the train Supervisor came by multiple times to see if we needed anything and if our expereince was enjoyable. I can't recommend this enough. Much better than flying. You get to see the Peru countryside along the way.

A Unique, Fun, and Colorful Experience . Wow! I took the Andean Explorer train from Cusco to Puno. The entire trip was a celebration of Peruvian food, drinks, music, and landscape! The train itself (including the bathroom) was clean and the atmosphere was pleasant. Although it was a 10 hour trip, there was so much to do! The wonderful staff put on Andean music, dances, a fashion show, and a Peruvian drink-making tutorial. Everyone was friendly (and bilingual in for any non-Spanish speakers). The food was also perfect. I especially loved the chocolate dessert that went with the complimentar lunch! For a wonderful trip through Peru that is filled with exceptional service, choose Andean Explorer, PeruRail!

LUXURIOUS RIDE, SUPERB SERVICE: THANK YOU ARNALDO!. World seasoned travelers, we hesitated between train and bus to reach Lake Titicaca from Cusco, and finally opted for the train since the length of the ride is similar, and we did not want to be stuck on a bus with rushed stops here and there. This was a highlight in our vacation, not only for the comfort, old world, luxurious, Orient Express atmosphere but also for the amazing service and care we received when we experienced a rather serious problem : Arriving in Juliaca, about 1 hour away from lake Titicaca where we were supposed to sleep on a floating island, the weather changed for the worse, and we noticed snow/hail on the ground (unusual in October, spring in the highlands). 10 mn later, it was pouring cats and dogs (which, we later learned, is somewhat usual at night around lake Titicaca, as the days are gloriously sunny which makes water evaporate and form clouds in the evening). Panicked at the idea of sleeping on a floating island in pouring and freezing rain, we tried to use our mobile to cancel it and book a room in the Libertador on the shore of the lake, to no avail! Between my poor Spanish skills and the choppy communication, I could not get anywhere. Fortunately, Mr. Arnoldo Ponce de Leon De La Cruz, on board supervisor, took things in hand, and swiftly cancelled my reservation and made a new one with the Libertador, even using Trip Advisor to get us the best rate, and finally got us a taxi as soon as we arrived. Mr. De La Cruz, thank you for all your help! Without you, we would have been stranded on a cold and wet island! Yes, we loved everything about our ride on the Andean Explorer, but it is people like you who make it even more enjoyable! You are professional, highly efficient and caring!! We cannot wait to return to experience next year the new sleeper Andean train between Cusco and Lake Titicaca (which are our 2 favorite places, Cusco being a vibrant, interesting city, and Lake Titicaca being the most beautiful and serene place on earth, with lovely Taquile island as well as the tiny Titinos island, one of the last authentic and lived-in Uros island, where children come back from school by canoe and play with you)The 10.5 hours trtain ride from Cusco to Puno flew by, and I did not even have time to read any of the magazines I took along! By the way, If you are on a budget, be aware that the return ride on the Andean Explorer, going from Puno to Cusco, is nearly half the price...
Puno cusco trains. Yes its expensive but when you look at cost of plane and spending 8 hours on a vomit inducing bus over the mountains, its a total win

Don't take the bus!. What a great experience. Time flies by and then you are in Puno. The staff give first class service and our group of four just loved the entire day. Spending time on the open car in the back is a highlight we will not forget.

Wow!. We booked on this train as part of a tour from Cuzco to La Paz, The train journey from Cuzco to Puno was brilliant - a highlight of our four weeks in South America. One of our party was suffering from the altitude and the on board service supervisor, Arnaldo, was kind, caring and helpful. Plus I left something behind and Arnaldo went out of his way to help.The journey was brilliant. Lots to see from the observation car as the landscape changed plus great food, pisco sour lessons. All in all, utterly memorable.

Loved every minute. I felt like a kid again. It was such fun. Never a dull moment. The seats were comfy. The little walk to the bar and the welcome drink with the song, dances and modelling gave us a taste of the Peruvian culture. The food wasn't the greatest though. we have tasted far better in Peru.The service was a little lethargic...could have been they were short-staffed. We traveled from Cusco to Puno...a little over 9 hours...the scenery was a little stark but beautiful nonetheless! The markets so close to the railway tracks was so quaint near Juliaca. But it is an experience when in Peru for sure!

Fantasic! Not as expensive as Lonely Planet says!. This was fantastic! The Lonely planet says it's overrated, but it's not! A bus is fine and does the job, but this is a wonderful day! With a glass coupe, free pisco sour, live music, high tea, and a 3-course lunch. Clean, beautiful and the service is great! And it's not as expensive as the LP says! (its not cheap, but worth it!) really!

Don't Miss This!. What a ride! We did the trip from Puno to Cusco which took 10h. At first we were worried to be bored with such a long journey, but it is totally awesome! We were in Peru for almost 2 weeks with such a busy schedule and this day was fully relaxed. No places to go, you just wonder the train, checkout the views, take pictures, drink at the bar, and eat a great meal of 3 courses.We took great pictures because in some parts we just cross by the middle of the towns, including through a Market where you can almost buy stuff from the train - so close that you are! The landscape is awesome.Tip: from Puno to Cusco is half the price than Cusco to Puno - take advantage of that if you can!

From Cusco to Juliaca. We were 3 friends on the train.The best experience up to now.We were very imprest and pleased.Perfect trip and service.Lovely food,entertaiments and views.Special thanks to Edwin Villafuerte!

An unforgettable experience. Having travelled to a lot of places around the world, in different modes of transport, THIS IS ONE FOR THE BOOKS!!The whole experience exceeded my expectations that if I ever wish a day to last longer, this was it.We were served with Peruvian gourmet, entertained by a bartending session in the morning and a mini fashion show in the afternoon. And oh how can I forget the unique taste of that lime juice!! The journey itself .. I'm speechless.I cannot close my eyes to the beauty of it all. My camera, GoPro, and mobile phone memory cards were full to the brim. Every crew onboard were stars in their own right and the one who served us this peculiar tea is a comet!

Excellent way to cross the country. The Andean Explorer made our trip from Cusco to Lake Titicaca such a breeze. The service on the train was non-stop-- we were very well taken care of with food and drink. It definitely took more time than a plan trip but well worth it. It was nice to slow down for a day and watch the country via rail.

Great experience. . Travelling on the Andean express is a great experience. Already at the check in at PUNO station we experienced a warm welcome by Mr. Arnoldo Ponce de Leon De La Cruz, the on board service supervisor. Our train waiter picked us up in the waiting lounge to bring us to our seats and gave us, in a very professional and friendly way, all information about the train and the service provided. We enjoyed each minute of the 10:30h trip. The food,which is prepared fresh on board, was excellent. The lavatories were cleaned in short intervals so that you always found them in perfect condition. Our stop at LA ROYA was very interesting, the market is colourful and it also gives you the possibility to take nice pictures of the small church, the train and the locals dressed in their colourful dresses. Before arriving in CUSCO, Mr. Arnoldo Ponce de Leon De La Cruz came to each of us to say goodbye and give last information about the city of CUSCO and how the reach easily our hotels. We thought that this is what we would call a personalised 5 stars service. Thank you very much to the entire Andean express team.

You MUST experience this!!. This was one of the most amazing experiences we had! Boris and Carlos made sure that we were taken care of throughout the entire ride. This is not cheap, but I am so glad that we splurged! We went from staying in cheap hostels, bus rides, and budget restaurants to this gem! The food was excellent and the sights were gorgeous.

Ten quick hours. This journey was a part of our overall package and it did not disappoint. We thought that the time was going to drag but far from it. It all started with being served coffee in the waiting room in Cusco. Once on the train there was breakfast, followed by lunch and ending with afternoon tea. This was interspersed with music and dance throughout the journey. The scenery was fascinating and we stopped at a couple of places along the way, especially the highest point which gave a chance to sample the wares of the locals (how fortuitous!). The opportunity to observe the countryside from the rear carriage is not to be missed. We passed through a town which was reminiscent of the old Wild West whereby the train goes down the Main Street. The locals have market stalls along the track and raise the awnings as the train goes through then put them back up after it's past! Fascinating. By the time we reached Puno it was dark and we were getting a little weary but overall it was very worthwhile.

First rate/silver service. This trip was part of a tour. Perhaps we weren't expecting much but I was amazed when we arrived to find that we were going to be travelling in luxury! The staff were outstanding right from the start. When we checked in we were informed that we would be sharing a table and travelling backwards. The lovely guy asked if we'd like to be moved to a similar class. The only thing was that by changing we travelled with a German speaking group, but that wasn't an issue. While the trip is 10 hours, the time flew by and it was so comfortable. Our every need was seen to. I was a bit worried about the food because I need gluten free. I wasted energy worrying, I was so well looked after. The corn bread was not only beautiful to look at but was delicious. The rest of the food was outstanding as well. The whole experience was amazing. Really interesting to see the changing landscape, interesting townships and markets passing by. There's entertainment but apart from the Pisco Sour demo we didn't bother because we were entertained in our seats sufficiently.Cannot thank the amazing staff enough, it was a highlight of our trip. (One small hint - don't let the baggage crew take your bags if you don't have money to pay them. We unfortunately had a guy grab our bag and even though we asked him to leave them he insisted on carrying them out for us. It was awkward when we didn't have cash to give him the expected tip. Just left an uneasy feeling after such a wonderful experience)

Great ride. The trip is expensive but also very nice! It is much more comfortable then the bus, having nice seats, great service and excellent food. And of course a good view.Only after disembarkment we were appointed a taxi that ripped us off; would be nice if the train staff managed the taxis a bit more.

Not to be missed. A lot of the guide books seem to dismiss this trip as being slow and bumpy and say that travel by road is preferable as it is quicker and the route very similar, well they are wrong!!!The train is now run by Belmond and has that luxury feel from the moment you arrive in the station and are shown to your seat. For us the first highlight was the traverse of the street market in Julianca, the stalls open up in front of the train, in some cases the goods for sale being left on the track as the train passes, and then the market closes up on the track again after the train has gone by so that looking back you cant see where the railway line was.The train line does run parallel to the road at some points but diverges for long distances as well passing through a range of scenery from the Altiplano to mountain passes to lush arable land, between mountains, alongside rivers and through towns. A constantly changing panorama. There is a short stop at the highest point where you can get out and then on to Cusco travelling through the city.All the way the service is attentive the meals are good and the views spectacular. The carriages and observation car are vintage with wood paneling and brass fittings and the toilets spotless. If you look at the price it is less than a 3 hour intercity train in the UK so what more do you want?Dont miss it

Worth the Soles!. Ok it is not cheap, but considering the extreme comfort, the quality of the service, included foods and drinks, the viewing / bar carriage, the genuinely helpful and happy staff (who really only help, at every stage from check in to advice at the station at disembark, and never 'hard sell') this ride was a key part of our adventures.The incredible views, the style of the train (our seats, carriage and all areas) and how the staff looked after the 2 and 5 year olds we were travelling with - brilliant!This is the final leg of our Peru adventure and this train and its staff continue to provide this country has some of the friendliest, happiest and sincerely helpful people who always seem to love what they do and their country.

Andean Explorer. Really enjoyed the trip from Cusco to Puna in the very comfortable carriages. Great entertainment throughout the trip and enjoyed the scenery along the way. The open carriage was great for taking photographs. Food and service was tops. The only down point for us was having to sit in the carriage for half an hour on arrival in Puno while bags were unloaded. Was slightly disorganised and time consuming when we were keen to get to our hotel

Fantastic way to see the andes!. Beautiful train, amazing views, a lovely bar and panoramic car in the back! But the best thing about this train is the food, simply outstanding considering that it is at a train! This would have been a solid 5 if it hadn't been for where I was seated! I sat next to the door in the wagon next to the wagon with the bar so there were a lot of traffic wich led to a lot of cold air during the ride!

This train journey is fabulous. This totally exceeded expectations. The trip from Poray near Cusco to Machu Picchu is a spectacular experience through the high plains of the Andes and several small towns. Viewing car makes for better photography than the usual in-seat efforts.Food and service excellent. 2 sets from local musicians and dancers made the journey shorter and more pleasurable.This is a Peruvian experience to rival the Orient Express but at a tiny fraction of the cost.One caution, the Ts and Cs say that if numbers are low, the train may be replaced by busses. This would be a big negative, but I guess is a buyer-beware risk.

Train from Cusco to Puna. A great way to travel and see a wide range of country. 11 hours in the train passed very quickly. Comfortable way to travel, clean and tidy. Good food and drink. wonderful journey.We were part of a group, so all our ticketing etc was done for us in advance.

Best train I have been on. This was include as part of our Peru tour and was a superb experience. The train is beautifully appointed comfortable and the food was very good. There is much to see en route. Well worth it.

Fantastic journey and top class service. This is a not to be missed trip from Cusco to Puno. The train meanders through the Andes with fantastic views while being served in a style from yesteryear. All takes ten and half hours. You do travel though some poorer areas, especially towards the end of the journey.

Defintely worth it!!! . We did the trip from Puno to Cusco in September 2016 and we really appreciated it. The equipment and service were amazing. We highly recommend this trip and having a place very close to the observation deck at the end of the train. The observation deck is great for catching amazing views of the landscape you pass through.

World-class experience from Puno to Cusco. The Andean Explorer is a not-to-be-missed experience. From the waiting room in Puno to getting a taxi to the hotel in Cusco, the level of personal service, professionalism and attention to details is about as high as one can achieve in the hospitality industry anywhere in the world. (A special shout-out to Elmer who took really good care of our car.) Aside from the train itself, the ten-hour ride offers a travel through time with glimpses of highland communities which had changed little in centuries.

A trip back in time across a wilderness. This journey took 10 plus hours cusco to puno (or reverse) which might fill you with dread but time flew. The facilities on board and attentive staff never stopped entertaining or feeding us! Comfortable chairs (even for my 6ft 6 husband) helped tremendously but with a panoramic viewing carriage and bar.. this really was my best train journey ever!! Beautifully fine peru rail!!

Honeymoon Perfection. My husband and I celebreated our honeymoon in Peru for two weeks. After a homestay experience in Lake Titicaca we took the Andean Explorer experience to Cusco. Plus: Costumer services was great, staff was friendly and attentive. The food was amazing. The Andean terrain was beautiful and amazing to see from the train.Cons: We were not fully acclimated so the ride was was difficult at time. The company could use images of tourist that are people of color in their advertisement. Completely recommend if you are able to splurge.

Excellent staff. A fantastic experience, with interesting and varied views for all of the journey. The staff were very helpful and were very attentive to my wife who was suffering from altitude sickness. Tasty food. The observation car could have been bigger in the open part as many people were wanting to take photos without a window being in front.

Andean Explorer. A great experience from start to finish. The train and the staff are absolutely superb. The only downside is the keen photographers did hog the back of the observation car and sometimes made it difficult for other people to take photographs.
First Class Travel Puno to Cusco. For over 10 hours we had the most relaxing and comfortable travel with fine dining and entertainment

Absolutely Amazing!. The train ride from Puno to Cusco was a highlight of our 2-week Peru trip. The day-long trip was incredibly comfortable and fun. We boarded early in the morning and spent the day looking at the beautiful scenery from our seats and the open back car, making fiends at the bar, eating, and enjoying the entertainment on board. I can't imagine a better way to arrive in Cusco. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend!

Great team work for happiness of everyone. Arnaldo Ponce de León is a great master in charge of this wonderful train to make impossible things possible!Together with his team all of us felt like kings and queens. Thank you!

Wonderful!. It was a very enjoyable trip. The seats were very comfortable. The entertainment was fun and interesting. I bought a CD from one of the entertainment bands. The food was delicious and served in a very decorative style. The train stops to shop and see a little of the countryside were appreciated.

Best way to travel from Machu Picchu to Cuzco. Lovely train ride with beautiful scenery. Very comfortable seating and large windows including windows on the ceiling. Excellent service from crew onboard. You get a drink (tea, coffee, soft drink, juice) and snack (inca corn). The train is very punctual. They usually only allow hand luggage but allowed my 15kg backpack after emailing them. The train stops at Poroy station a 20 minute drive from Cuzco but there are lots of taxis for 30 Sol and white mini vans for 10 Sol that will drop you off at your accommodation in Cuzco.

Exploring the Andean in Style!. We did well in choosing the Andean explorer to travel from Cuzco to Puno as it was a great experience. The Andean mountains were stunning! The food was good and the staff very helpful. We also had entertainment in the morning and another in the afternoon. Highly recommended.

Most pleasant way to get from Cusco to Puno. This must be the most pleasant (and expensive!) way to get from Cusco to Puno. While it's cheaper and faster to take the plane to Juliaca and then hire a driver, you miss both the scenery and the experience of this unique train trip. This trip is comfortable, scenic, and pleasant. The meals (lunch and afternoon tea, which is served while going through Juliaca) are tasty and filling, and there's live music and dancing for entertainment as well. When touring the area, I do recommend starting in Machu Picchu, then Ollantaytambo, then Cusco, then Puno, in order to ease oneself into Puno's very high altitude. If this train trip is within your budget, I recommend this delightful way of getting to Lake Titicaca. The Puno train station is right in the center of town.

Stunning. We travelled from Lake Titicaca to Cuzco on Peru Rail's Andean Explorer. It took 10 hours and was quite simply stunning - the scenery, the food, the carriages, the purvian pipe players and dancers, and the lesson of how to make pisco sours. The journey was part of a tour that included Machu Picchu so everything was organised for us but I think it would be possible to book independently as there were some spare seats. Make sure your camera/phone is fully charged as you will be taking lots of photos. The train stops at La Raya which is 4,300 metres above sea level so you might feel breathless and not just from the views!

One of the highlights of our visit to Peru. From entering the waiting room in the train station, this trip was special. We were greeted with smiles and very attentive staff, if we had wanted it there was coffee available too. We were keen to get on board and we were not disappointed. Everything about the experience was first class from the comfortable seats, attentive staff, the viewing carriage, the spectacular views, the pisco sour demonstration, music entertainment, food onboard, visit to the small market just outside of Juliaca at the highest point and the journey through the centre of Juliaca which was breathtaking. Without reservation I recommend this trip.

Wonderful Experience. I hesitated taking this train instead of flying because of the length of the trip from Cuzco to Puno. I'm always for saving time to "see and do things" instead of time "going" from one place to the other. I had it all wrong. This train trip is not just a transportation medium, it IS a destination in itself. Time flew by and each minute spent was full of surprises and new adventures. Service was excellent and the camaraderie among the travelers was superb. I'd do it again!

Probably the best way to get to Puno. This was an activity day for us rather than a wasted travel day. The train is amazingly comfortable with great entertainment and 10 hours went by really quickly. The music and dancing was a real surprise and we all got into it. We were really well fed and probably didn't need dinner upon arrival to Puno. The staff arranged taxi transfer to our hotel upon arrival. Overall, a really great experience and highly recommended.

See the Virgin of Candelaria Feast then take train. We visited Puno in the beginning of February, during the Virgin of Candelaria Feast. This is an incredible event, with thousands of people in amazing, colorful costumes dancing and playing traditional instruments, both in street parades and in the stadium. Because it is the "rainy season" there were very few foreign tourists. The participants were grouped in teams, I gather from communities in the region, and competed in the stadium, and then marched through the streets. The next day they carried the giant Virgin statue from one church to the other through the streets, dumping tiny baskets of flowers from the upper stories of the buildings as the Virgin passed. The Virgin statue was so tall they had to lift the overhead phone and cable lines up to let it pass. Really, go to Puno, see the Festival. Take a raincoat, as there could be occasional showers--not a big deal if you are from Michigan.As the many reviewers have stated, the train ride from Puno to Cusco is wonderful. The high plains scenery was spectacular. The food was great; the bar car empty because it was the low season. The back of the bar car is an open platform, which was fun to ride on, out in the breeze. The highest elevation of the ride was 4312 meters; if you have breathing difficulties this could be an issue. I was told they have supplemental oxygen on the train, although none of passengers on our trip experienced difficulties.

Great experience!. Comfortable trip. Great views through the Andes and wonderful access for photos from scenic rail car open at the rear of train. Beautifully restored and maintained old style carriages. Well trained staff and delicious food and drinks. Staff spoke good English. Local entertainment was provided during the journey. Staff very willing to organise a taxi at our destination to take us to our hotel. A very relaxed way to travel between Puno and Cusco. I can highly recommend this train journey.

a must. It'is an absolutely fabulous train ride. !0 hrs went by quickly. The price is half of the Hiram Bingham but it offers a similar experience. The food is excellent, just like the service and staff. We took both this train and the Hiram, and my family couldn't decide if one was much better than the other. I would take this train again to go between Cuzco-Puno, much more pleasant than the plane!

I hope they continue this service because I may want to do it again. This was the highlight of my trip to Peru...well worth the cost. I only wish I had been feeling better so that I could have enjoyed it even more. The service was first class and the staff was friendly and attentive. I particularly enjoyed riding through the market place in Juliaca, second only to the quality of the food. The next time I'll be sure to bring someone along.
Incredible. Its an expensive jouney, but it is worth every penny. Amazing, views, incredible food, fantastic staff.

A day to remember. We've spent our lives living abroad and travelling and we know there are some experiences you treasure in particular. Our day on the Andean Explorer will be one of these. We simply couldn't fault it. The train has the old world ambience of the Orient Express. The service was excellent. Edwin and Wilfried looked after us and let us practice our Spanish although they speak English very well.The food was well prepared, very tasty with lots of herbs. The entertainment was very good. Of course, the scenery is superb, travelling through a variety of areas. We highly recommend this trip.

The highlight of my trip so far!. After a long but luxurious ride from Puno to Cuzco, I cannot praise this experience enough. Arnaldo and the team, including John and Flor provided impeccable and attentive service from welcome, optional breakfast, lunch and afternoon high tea.From the moment I stepped on board, I didn't want the journey to end. I know the coach does the trip in four hours less, but you would be missing a once in a lifetime experience. Time flew by too with the meals, the entertainment organised on board and the regular visits to the observation deck to admire the changing landscape.

Travel in style!. With so few trains in Peru it is apt that the Andean Explorer is so special. The 12hr journey from Puno to Cusco winds slowly though the amazing Andean mountains. This is a luxury train with a view dome roof which enables you to enjoy the scenery from your seat. The on board service is second to none. There are waiters in every carriage to see to all your needs. The three course meal served for lunch was excellent and that was followed by a delicious afternoon tea. This was a memorable trip - The Orient Express of the Andes!

Unique experience!. I was lucky enough to travel on this train from Cusco to Puno with my family in August 2016. It ranks as one of the best experiences of my lifetime and is not to be missed. The staff could not be more helpful. The lunch and dinner were absolutely delicious. The armchair seats and vintage atmosphere of the train added to the magic. And finally the scenery never ceased to amaze. This journey is worth every penny and it felt like the shortest 10 hour journey I have ever experienced. Well done Peru Rail. A real treat!

Fantastic. What a fantastic day, although the journey takes 10 hours it seems to go by very quickly. The food is excellent and so is the entertainment. A fashion show, local musicians and a lesson in making Pisco Sour all make the journey fly by. There is a stop at the highest point of the journey and a stop when the train coming in the opposite direction passes. A brilliant day from start to finish.

THE TRIP OF A LIFETIME. I rode the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco. From the time one sets foot in the Puno Train Station, the passenger is pampered. The staff serves the passenger coffee or tea at their seat in the waiting room. The train is magnificent, and with well appointed decor. The on board service is superb . The food is wonderful. The selection of liquor on board is truly remarkable. The staff on the train is ready and willing to accommodate the passenger in any way. I wanted to purchase a Peru Rail vest, which was not sold on the train. I mentioned this fact to one of the train attendants, and he asked the size of vest I wanted. The train attendant then radioed ahead to the station, and while i was claiming my luggage, my vest was delivered to me. Highly recommend this trip for traveler who wants to be pampered. Also, I recommend taking the trip from Puno to Cusco, as there fare is less than half of the Cusco to Puno fare.

Wonderful Day. This was a wonderful,, gorgeous train ride in such luxurious accommodations. The service and food were all wonderful. Staff was great. Quite an experience! We would highly recommend this activity.

Fantastic. Wow. The scenery on this trip between Puno and Cusco was incredible. The meals on board were very good and there was fabulous entertainment in the form of Peruvian musicians. It didn't seem like a ten hour journey!

Lovely way to travel from Puno to Cusco . I don't know how we found out about this train but I'm so glad we did. It is a wonderful way to cross from Puno to Cusco (or vice versa but I gather the Cusco to Puno route is much more expensive). Service was great, ambience and comfort were great and food was great. They do have musicians and a dancer who give a show for about an hour which is a bit touristy but hey, no-one makes you go to the bar carriage to watch it if you don't want to. My favourute bit was the viewing platform at the back from which you can take some great pics. Highly recommended.

Unique & magical add on to your trip! . I only heard about this through our travel agent recommendation - she told us it was a bit pricey but worth it and she was right! It added such a unique element to our trip. The carriages were comfortable and spacious. Staff were extremely friendly and efficient. The entertainment on board, stops and food service made 10 hours pass very quickly. The panoramic carriage was great - it can get busy but equally there were times when I was the only one in it snapping away at the beautiful vistas. The alpaca items that they sell on board Peru Rail are actually really reasonable - I held out after seeing a lovely poncho on our Macchi Picchu train as someone told me about an outlet in Cusco but a similar item was way more heavily priced. Luckily I picked something up on the Andean Explorer and the quality has been great - it saw me through the winter. As long as you go on board aware that it is 10 hours, it is thoroughly enjoyable and I'd highly recommend!

Really nice but not worth 180$, panorama is nice, but only in the last wagon. The staff was really nice, the lunch was really good. The company knows its customers: rich white europeans. The Track is beautiful and this sort of travelling is really chilled down. But the company also thinks that a brakefast in south america can cost 50 soles, which is honestly said an impudence. all the prices of things that are not included in the 180$ train price, are like this. Additionally i felt ashamed for the people who were on the same train, for how they looked at and treated the peruanian staff. it feels a little bit like on a cruise trip with old rich white aristrocratic europeans.

A must do. If this isn't on your 'bucket list' it should be. Everyone visiting Peru should make this train journey part of their itinerary (unbeatable value for money). The service and food were exemplary and the onboard entertainment by the Peruvian dancers and musicians whilst travelling through the breathtaking Andean countryside is something we will never forget.

Well worth it !!!!!!!!!!!. 10 hour ride in a vintage diesel. Well appointed. Lots of wood and brass. Elegant old style train. Excellent service. Good food, nice seating. There is a general car for seating with Queen Ann chairs and a formal table setting. Comfortable bar car. Very spacious and open observation car at the end. Absolutely worth doing. The train , the views and scenery will be memorable. Only complaint : There is a stop at a artisan market about half way, in the middle of nowhere, beware of polyester being sold as alpaca. Look for the shine, take a lighter and burn some fibers if you're really that interested.
Enjoyable and unique train journey. Incredibly comfortable 10 hour train journey south from Cusco to Puno. Beautiful scenery, good food and unique activities.

very comfortable train ride with great service. I really enjoyed this train ride. I thought that a 10-hour train ride would be unpleasant, but this ride was very nice. The seats were very comfortable and spacious, the food was excelent, there were interesting views from the train, the entertainment was enjoyable, and the service was fantastic. The specific employees who provided service for my traincar were Boris, Bornao, and Carlos, and they really did a great job.

Luxury with tons of panoramic scenery!!!. From pre-boarding to disembarking....A+++ service from the staff, especially our coach attendant Freddy. We traveled from Puno to Cusco and the 10+ hours went by so quickly with gorgeous views from the sightseeing coach. Highly recommend doing this train ride....Best Ever!!!!

An absolute must!. Like others, I wondered if this would be really worth it - and 10 hours! But after traveling all modes in Peru, have to say this was spectacular. What a relaxing journey - but also incredibly stunning. Would never have seen the diversity from the Andes to the altiplano - and then all the culture they weave in as well. My niece spent nearly 6 hours in the observation platform alone. And the service was just tremendous. Agree with everyone - this is a true EXPERIENCE. Can't recommend it enough.

Train ride of a lifetime!. Andean Explorer was our first 'First Class' Train Ride, and it exceeded all our expectations!
