Upon arrival at Wanchaq station, our bags were collected from the Taxi by porters and we were escorted to a Lounge where we were checked-in and served Tea/Coffee. Then we were shown to our seats. The train started on time and made it's way through beautiful Andes Mountains. The Train consisted of 3 Carriages, one Bar/Lounge and and Observation Car. There was a 3 Course Meal with Wine (With Vegetarian Option) served. The Train had only one stop, at La Raya - highest point on the route. Also, a group of musicians performed folk music and couple of dancers performed as well in the evening. Towards the end the Train also passes through crowded markets near Juliaca, and it was an interesting sight to see local vendors making way for the train and getting back to business once it passes. Upon arrival in Puno, the luggage was unloaded in advance and sorted neatly for us to collect without any delay. It was very courteous of the Manager to enquire regarding our onward transportation. When he realised we had to find a taxi, he himself arranged a safe and standard Taxi for us at standard rate to our Hotel. It was an experience of a life time and really worth it!

Fantastic!. We had a great time. A relaxing day. First class service. I imagine it's like the Trans-Siberian (I wouldn't know because I haven't done it - but it seemed to be like what I have seen on TV). Felt really pampered. Great value!! Great way to have a relaxing day watching the Peruvian landscape in its many varied forms waft past. Observation car at the back is great for taking photos.

Good trip but food a real let down. Beautiful views and great way to travel, however the food was a real let down especially considering price. Beef was over cooked and hardly resembled bourguignon more like weak stew.
Luxury train travel thru southern Peru. Fabulous way to travel, first class all the way. Great service, food and entertainment. Highly recommend it if you visit Peru.

Luxury train journey from Puno to Cuzco. Very comfortable and luxurious journey; beautiful scenery; the observation carriage provides wonderful views; great service and delicious food. Highly recommended.

Brilliant. Travelled as a couple in June 2016 and thought the 10 hour journey would be dull - how wrong were we! We were entertained with a fashion show, a pisco sour demonstration, lovely 3 course lunch, afternoon tea, a local band in the morning and afternoon with dancing girls!. We were well looked after by the team of Carlos, Mario, Boris, Wilbert, Julio, Flori, Ingrid, Cesar and special mention to Bernow who was very informative! We sat in the lounge and the observation car for the whole trip so didn't miss any of the beautiful scenery. The tain going through the local market is not to be missed. Don't miss out and book this wonderful trip today.

Luxury Experiance. This was a pleasant Experience. Was not expecting this to be only about 30 or so passengers every group had their own table and only one coach for the few passengers aboard. Had the bar car and the viewing car very accessible to everyone and not crowded at all very scenic. Crew was excellent and very friendly.

Scenic and entertaining. We took the train from Cusco to Puno. The journey is around 10 hours long however the time went very quickly. The journey is very beautiful and the viewing carriage provides an amazing view with its glass panels. Entertainment is provided on the train and the atmosphere was great. Everyone seemed to have a fantastic time during the dancing and music band performances. Food on the train was also very good and presented like you would expect in a top restaurant. I would highly recommend taking this route when travelling to Between these cities.

One day from puno to cusco on the Andean explorer.. Great train, service from all the staff , and food. Almost like being on the orient express with bar car and observation car. Armchair seats v comfortable.Worth it for the crawl right through the town of Juliaca with the market stalls inches from the train. Stunning views of the country.

I can only add one important point to all the other wonderful reviews. . . .. All the wonderful things people say about the coach, service, food and scenery are true. However, there is no air conditioning and the temperature will vary widely -- hot during the day and cold in the evening. So WEAR LAYERS. If you don't need them there is plenty of room to store your extra clothing in the coach.

The best attraction of our peru trip. Imagine u are riding the orient express, but in the andes. Terrific food (food, dessert, breakfast, drinks), terrific landscape and awsome services. Cant find any negative point.

On day in a train from Cusco to Puno. I travelled with my 11 year old who luckily slept for 3 of the 10 hours ride.The setting of the wagons was really well thought, we even had plugs to charge the appliances...The food and service were really very good.We even had entertainment as of one band before lunch and another one after lunch.There was a panoramic wagon at the end of the train that enabled taking great pictures..Except, it may be a little small for all the people onboard... The area without glass only allowed 8 people at a time. The rest of the wagon had glass and reflections...All the teenagers on board were playing on their devices, including my son!!But all in all, it was a positive experience and I took great pictures and videos..

Train journey. Very comfortable train journey- best way to get from Puno to Cusco. All the staff were friendly and efficient. Scenery unbelievable. Never been through the middle of a market on a train before - nearly took a stall with us.

Very relaxing luxury train. Ok so this train is expensive. BUT, it is the most comfortable way to get to Puno from Cusco. The staff was excellent, including the maitre d Diego, our waiter Elmer, and the friendly bartender. The staff was very attentive throughout the trip, although they were a little too eager to sell you extra things. Lunch is included, which was very good, and you have the option to buy various breakfast items, although they were a little pricey by Peruvian standards. Afternoon tea with sandwiches and whatnot is included. The lounge was comfortable and the viewing car was cool. The train company even arranged for a taxi for us to our hostel at the last minute, and it only cost 5 soles. If you want to avoid a twenty hour bus ride and travel in comfort, this is the way to go. Also, the bathroom was nice.

The peak of our Peru trip, the Andean Explorer is a MUST DO.... It's not a train ride, it's an EXPERIENCE that you will remember for ever. Everything is carefully planed to make it amazing: the A-class hospitality from all staff (especially the Head Conductor), the local music and entertainment, the fine dining, the wood crafted interior of the train, the open end-wagon making you an integral part of the scenery and much more ... Everything was PERFECT making this 10 hours trip seems like 3! Bottom line: a MUST DO experience if you visit Peru.

Awesome scenery, dancing, music, Pisco Sour lessons. This train is a luxurious way to see the countryside of the high Andean plains. Live music and dancing if you want it. Pisco sour lessons. This is not British Rail. An interesting stop at the market at the highest point to stretch your legs. A truly unique experience. 10 hours just flew by.

Real Value Added!. Have you ever had a merchant drive hours out of their way and pass through picket lines in order to provide you with merchandise you ordered? Cesar Sotomayor from Perurail did! While riding Perurail, “Andean Explorer” from Cusco to Puno my buddy and I each ordered products that were only available at the main office. Problem was that we arrived at night and the office was closed. Even though our hotel was an hour outside of Puno, Cesar promised to deliver our merchandise to our hotel. An even larger problem was that during our stay at the Titilaka Hotel, the transportation workers were on strike and worse yet they barricaded the roads into and out of both Puno and Juliaca (see attached photo). In order to get to the airport, we had to take an hour plus in detours around the strike. True to his word, on the way to the airport, our driver presented us with a package from Cesar. How did he get it to us? I do not know, but believe me, it was not without a lot of effort. Thank you Cesar and thank you Perurail for having such wonderful employees!Bruce Hebel & Gary Nelson

Best train ride in Peru!. This train ride is definitely worth the money. The service is top notch. The accommodations are excellent. The views are amazing. Seriously, this train ride is worthwhile. Some people will tell you to take the bus instead, but having taken the bus before, I can tell you that the bus ride does not even come close the quality of this train ride. There is no comparison at all. You will be uncomfortable in the bus and you will be disappointed at how many things you'll miss because the is driver is in a hurry to get to the destination. This train ride is as comfortable as it can possible get and more. You'll even get a couple of shows. The staff is incredibly well trained and you will feel like you are in a 5 star hotel. If you like to take pictures, then this is definitely the best way to go. What can I else can I say, this train ride is fantastic!

Wonderful Train. I was not bored for 10 hours on board from Puno to Cosco. The scenery was fantastic. The train passed market of the town and beautiful plateaus. In particular, the observation car was wonderful to see and enjoy. Lunch and afternoon tea were all excellent. Staff’s service was professional and nice. I recommend this train highly to travel in Peru.

Wonderful journey. This is a really nice experience. Lush and comfy cars with nice seats and delicious food. There's entertainment and great views from the observation car and rear deck. It's not quick with a maximum speed of 48kph but the scenery is awesome. The ride through the streets of Juliaca is particularly fascinating with market stalls right up against the tracks.
Fabulous in every respect. Absolutely loved every minute of the 10 hours on this amazingly comfortable train. The scenery was stunning and varied, food outstanding and service excellent

Luxury in motion. I KNEW as soon as I saw this train and the carriages, I was sure it was going to be a great 10 hours from Cusco to Puno.The accommodation was luxurious and the service matched. Breakfast was an extra option and, had we known, we would have partaken of it but unfortunately, we didn't know and had already breakfasted in our hotel. However, that was the only, very slight, negative.The scenery and lunch (included in the fare) were excellent and we even had a shopping stop along the way. We also passed through a nuclear disaster area - at least, that is what Juliaca looked like to us. It is a sprawling town of some 250,000 desperate-looking inhabitants at the main cross-roads for major towns in Peru.Anyway, we eventually arrived in Puno for the next stage of our Peruvian adventure on Lake Titicaca and I cannot recommend this means of getting there highly enough.

The Heart and Soul of the Peruvian Cordillera. If you have the time this is must ‘experience,’ while travelling through the Cordillera of Peru. I was surprised there were so few tourists on the train when I travelled with my 22-year-old daughter who happened to be the youngest traveler on board outside of the year old baby. I think there may have been at most 40 passengers. I did not encounter one Peruvian or Peruvian American on the train. All the other passengers were Americans, Canadians or Europeans. If you are a Peruvian living outside the country and can afford to take this indulgence which is approximately$325.00 per person (May 2015) then I would pay for it as it well worth the experience. This is a wonderful way to see and experience the heart and soul of Peru. The service is first class. You sit in these big comfy seats and are provided white tablecloth service. We were served a beautiful lunch by young Chef Pedro. Our server was Eduardo a young man that had just started working for the Andean Explorer. It takes about 10 hours and the train makes a couple of brief stops along the way. One being La Raya, the highest point in Peru, 4,319 above sea level. During the 10 hours, one is entertained by musicians from Cusco and later in the day by musicians from the Puno region. In addition, Bar Master, Marco Omar provides a a lesson on making Peru’s famous ‘Pisco Sour.” Passengers are welcomed during the course of the day to see the view in the last railway car that is partially exposed. My daughter and I travelled from Cusco to Puno and left approximately 8:30 a.m. and arrived in Puno around 6:00 p.m. The experience is simply luxurious. As you get closer, you pass Juliaca, which is the industrial engine for the region. While passing the busy market in such close proximity, the train inches through this heavily busy part of the city. As first glance, the area seems a bit run down or poor through Western eyes, but look closer, it is a bustling market made up of small micro-enterprises. Honestly, as I sat with white table cloth in front of me amongst the number of hardworking businesses I felt a little out of place but this is the side of Peru worth seeing as well. If you go, I would recommend that you inquire which side of the train one should sit on to get the best view (east or west side depending where you are travelling from). Also, please be sure to not only tip the server but the young lady that spends her entire day cleaning up the bathrooms, cleaning up the mess the patrons may leave on a moving train.

Good but didn't live up to my expectation. I took the train to Puno as I thought it would be a good way to see the country, which it was. However having already done 2 weeks around Cusco, the Sacred Valley and Machu Pichu the scenery looked pretty familiar. I didn't have any wow moments. The service was good and the food was decent (if a bit rich). You can have tea, coffee or water free at any point throughout the trip. It was a long trip and good that some entertainment was provided (two sets of music and dancing, one from Cusco and one from Puno) and free pisco sour lessons after lunch. The observation car was nice. It was a pleasant way to spend the day but I'd think twice before doing that kind of train journey again.

FUN TRAIN RIDE. We traveled with another couple from Puno to Cusco on the 10 hour Andean Explorer train ride. We were worried it would be a long day, but it was so much fun! The food was excellent, the entertainment great and the scenery was gorgeous - the day just sped by. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this trip to anyone....a very memorable day!

Like Agatha Christie and the Orient Express. Excellent service. Great atmosphere of a time gone by. 10 hours passed quickly, with entertainment, drinks and very good lunch and time in the open observation car.

Great way to travel.. A great train with super carriages. The seats are very comfortable and the viewing platform super. The first part of the journey out of Cusco is the most enjoyable as the views are spectacular. The Alto Plano is not quite as interesting.The food was excellent and the Pisco Sours super.

Memorable . We took the train from Puno to Cusco and it was fantastic! Beautiful old carriages with comfy armchairs, immaculate service and great food. We were entertained with live music, dancing and Pisco Sour making lesson. All this while watching stunning scenery roll by. I wouldn't have missed it for the world and can't recommend it highly enough :)

Wonderful experience. This was an absolutely wonderful experience that I would recommend to everyone. We did this after hiking the Inka Trail so it was nice to be able to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and wonderful service. The shows are a bit hokey but still very fun to watch.

The way train travel is meant to be. We used the Andean Explorer from Cusco to Puno, expecting it to be a 'third world' travel experience. How wrong can you be?(We hadn't read any reviews before we went)The train may take 10 hours, but it's a first class experience throughout. From the waiter served 3 course lunch, to the upholstered armchair type seats, to the bands in the bar/ observation coach it is a relaxing way to see the amazing scenery.The first half of the journey rises through the mountains to a half way stop at the high point (where there are local crafts to be bought) and then the track crosses the altiplano where llama and alpaca herds graze. Beautiful.

Wonderful Experience. Unexpected luxury and fantastic service from Boris, Mario and Carlos. The 10-hour ride from Cusco to Puno passed by quickly. Good entertainment and great food (3-course lunch with menu options + afternoon tea). The carriage was beautifully set up. The bar coach and the observation coach were at the back of the train, they were beautifully appointed. The scenery was awesome. I highly recommend this experience to anyone.

This is the way to travel!. Went from Cusco to Puno. Quality experience throughout with superb comfort, food and service. Long day but you are well looked after and the views are fantastic. Recommended travel method to get to see Lake Titicaca, however would have preferred reverse direction for the Peru tour starting the round trip from Arequipa instead of Cusco

A slice of luxury on our trail!. Arriving a bit tired and weary after our Macchu picchu trail, this train ride was SO rejuvenating. The ride was comfortable and the food was sooooo tasty! Better than alot of restaurant meals weve had. The route was so beautiful and we stopped off at a market to buy local handicrafts. With a local band and dancers entertaining us, the journey sometimes got a little touristy but with free bar snacks on tap, a beautiful open back carriage to watch the views and great great, we cant complain! A shame it lead to Puno! If you can get it from puno instead you will have a perfect trip!

A thrill!. We took the Andean Explorer to really see as much of the Andes as we could -- while relaxing in luxury. The train trip certainly didn't disappoint! Not only are you TAKEN to your seat by the train staff, the trip begins with a mimosa in your seat! The train starts off in Cusco and you are able to stand at the back of the open train as it leaves the city -- an experience itself. The train then winds its way through the mountains reaching a height of 14,000 feet. It then proceeds close to the shores of Lake Titicaca having gone through a bustling market town where stall holders actually sold their wares right up against the train tracks!! What an experience!!

The most amazing way to see Peru. The Andean Explorer train is one of the Orient Express routes, and every effort has gone into making it very luxurious. The journey from Cusco to Puno takes 10h30 yet flies by as you drink in the scenery and the many Pisco sours... The food served on board (lunch and afternoon tea included and a delicious and huge breakfast available at an additional and very reasonable cost) is of extremely high quality and the carriages are dressed beautifully. There are only two carriages for passengers so there is plenty of room to move about the train and enjoy the view from the last carriage, which is open at the back to allow for some amazing photographs as you wind through the Andes and the Altiplano. There is some on-board entertainment which is fun but not intrusive, with local bands and dancing twice during the journey and also a lesson on how to make the perfect Pisco sour. My boyfriend volunteered immediately to be the bartender after the wonderful actual bartender, Marco Omar, showed us all how to do it, and he had a great time. In our five week trip through South America this is one of the things we were looking forward to the most and we were even more impressed with the reality - wish there was a longer option with sleeper carriages! Thank you to all the staff on board who made it such a special experience, and especially Marco. p.s one tip - take cash because understandably a moving train through Peru doesn't have the best signal for the card payment system and this didn't work too well when we came to the end of the journey and had to settle up for the extras we'd had.

An ideal way to travel from Cusco to Puno. A day of contrasts - magnificent views of plains, valleys & mountains alongside glimpses of village life, markets & busy town centres ..... punctuated by refreshments, well-prepared meals & entertainment (music & dance - participation was all but complusory). Everything was as described in the PeruRail publicity & more, with attentive staff at stations & aboard. Not a cheap way to travel, but we have no regrets at including the trip in our itineray.

Outstanding. We took the train from Cusco to Puno in preference to the road trip without being fullly aware of the superb quality of the Andean Explorer or the excellence of the experience. Two passenger carriages in the middle of the train, very well furnished in wood and with very comfortable armchairs and proper tables, are supported by a staff/kitchen car to the front and a bar/observation car to the rear. The last is split into a bar area with armchairs and occasional tables and, at the very rear, an observation platform with an open rear. There's a clear reflection of the Orient Express in the style and quality. The service was superb throughout, with excellent food and drink and very helpful staff. The journey takes about ten hours (the train isn't fast) but the scenery is glorious and the whole experience outstanding. Being picky, it would have been nice to have the morning coffee on the house but, other than that, I can't fault it.

Not cheap. Time consuming. But worth it!. The trip from Cusco to Puno takes about 11 hours by this train, when a bus can have you there in 6... So why bother? Because it's about the journey not the destination with this type of trip! Best food I've had in South America thus far. Brilliant/interesting views. Comfortable seating. Excellent hosts, what more could you want? As I mentioned in my title, it's not cheap, so budget travellers might find better value elsewhere. But I can tell you that after a few hectic days at Machu Picchu and Sacred Valley, this relaxing train journey was just what the doctor ordered!

It's long, but it is worth it. Beautiful views fo the high Andean plains from your luxurious train. Like I said, it's a long train trip. But it passes quite fast. The scenery is great, especially as you "steam" over the Andean high plateau. There are views of herds of llams and alpacas. The food is great, and there is an observation car at the rear, though it can be crowded. There is a stop at the highest point, La Raya, for photo-opportunities. There is not that much information about what you're looking at. We see villages and towns, but have to guess at where we are, based on a free map that seems not all that accurate.

Great experience but..... I cannot fault the Andean Explorer in any way. On arrival at Puno station we were offered tea, then shown to our seats. Comfortable and plenty of room. The station staff take care of all the luggage, which goes into a separate luggage car.The service was very attentive - we were served an excellent lunch and afternoon snacks. Great views from the observation car, and even just from your seat. Bar near the observation car. Dancers and musicians gave shows during the journey (morning and afternoon). The train does not go particularly fast, which means you can observe the changing scenery. However this means it is a long journey. the train leaves at 8am and it is dark by the time you arrive in Cusco or Puno (depending which way you travel).There is only one stop - at the highest point, where the locals have stalls etc. Mind you, going through Juliaca is an experience as the train goes right through the main market.BUT... at 10h 30m the journey was just too long.

A touch of refinement. The whole experience was pleasant enough and on time. The meals were beautifully prepared but as ever, be mindful of extra expenses when you order drinks. A suggestion for improvement would be to provide us with a brochure outlining the route, times between major cities, major landforms, stops etc. No information was provided. The stop at the highest point was a highlight, yet we did not know we were stopping here and that there were brains to be had from the little market stall and those selling quality goods. We had used moat of our soles and were were leaving Peru for Bolivia the next day. It was a most welcome touch for the concierge to arrange transfer from the train to our hotel.

Great "Train" Experience. We travelled from Puno to Cusco on the Andean Explorer in April. We booked the trip on line directly through Peru Rail - a seamless experience. Upon arrival at Puno station, we were seated in a pleasant waiting room and served tea. Groups were then taken individually to their comfortable seats on the train. The interior of the train is delightful and just as in the pictures!. The observation car was terrific as well as the bar/lounge area. It was very easy to move between the carriages. There were two groups of Peruvian entertainers - both were great and had the passengers enthralled with their performances. The on board staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. The lunch was wonderful and there was an endless supply of snacks. The scenery on the journey was spectacular and the 10 hours just flew by. Unfortunately the train broke down about an hour from Cusco. I have to commend the staff of Peru Rail (especially the On Board Services Manager, Arnaldo) for his communication to the passengers throughout the delay. We were eventually transferred to buses and taken to Cusco. This entire operation was done speedily and efficiently. There wasn't one grumpy word from any of the passengers.We would not hesitate to recommend taking the train either from Puno to Cusco or Cusco to Puno. It was a great day - despite the bus trip at the end.

Amazing experience !!!. This trip from Cusco to Lake Titicaca was stunning.It took eight hours and none of them was similar.We were seated in a three star restaurant car, with service to your table, while looking at the wonderful Peruvian Altipano.And at the rear of the train you have the last car, which is half a bar, where you can taste the national Pisco cocktail, and the other half, there is no roof so you can see everything. Truly amazing.

Fabulous experience . We arrived at the station in Cusco to be shown into a waiting room where hot drinks were served. About 7.45am we were shown to our seats. What a treat. Similar to the Orient Express and the staff were outstanding. Breakfast can be purchased at a cost but cold drinks and tea coffee were served free of charge. We had a delicious 3 course lunch included the ticket price of smoked trout followed by beef bourguignon and a chocolate dessert. We were then served petit fours and coffees There was local music and a dancer in the morning and afternoon with a Pisco Sour demonstration also in the afternoon before afternoon tea was served. With nibbles served throughout the day in the observation coach there was certainly plenty of food. It's a 10 hour journey from Cusco to Puno but the time went quickly and we throughly enjoyed the experience.

Vacation in South Peru. Very luxurious journey between Puno and Cusco. The best part, of course are fantastic, breathtaking views from the observation car in the back of the train. 3 course lunch was delicious and complimented very well the rest of the ride.I even liked the entertainment, although not as much as the views of the nature.It might look somewhat expensive, however, I believe was worth every penny.

When you're just a little bit fond of trains this is what you want to do in Peru.. Two friends and me were in Peru for three weeks and we decided to take the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco. And what an amazing tour that was!The service is really, really good (the coffee is so delicious!), the food on board is very tasty and you also get to expirence a bit of peruvian folklorist music. By far the best thing during the tour is experiencing the andean landscape when the train travels through the markets of Puno, highlands, and canyons.I highly recommend to take this unique train (did I mention the luxurious interior?).

Fantastic rail journey from Puno to Cusco - A must do. From the greeting at the station in Puno to arrival in Cusco, the 10+ hour journey on the Andean Explorer is a delight. The train is very comfortable, with large widows as well as a separate bar/ observation car. Lunch with wine, afternoon tea, two Peruvian musical & dancing groups are all included in the ticket price.

Great Pisco Sour on the AndeanExplorer. My wife, one of our best friend's and I travelled on the PeruRail Andean Explorer from Cusco to Puno today.To be quite honest, we weren't sure what to expect from our 10 hour journey through the Andes. But we had nothing to be concerned about!The railway carriages are beautifully finished and take you back to a bygone era of train travel.The service from start to end was fabulous, the views were stunning, it was fascinating to watch the locals going about their daily business as we passed through their towns and villages. The staff couldn't do enough for us and the other passengers on the trip.The highlight for me however, was being taught by our wonderful barman - MARCO, how to make the famous Peruvian cocktail Pisco Sour. Gracious Marco!

A journey too short. I was a bit worried when I first knew that it was a 10 hour long train journey. At the end, it was a journey too short.At first, we were warmly greeted at the Cusco station where our heavy luggages were quickly being taken care of with luggage tags. We were then being shown to the classy waiting room and offered with tea and coffee. When we were ready, we were being escorted to the luxurious train with individual sofa seats where welcome drinks were served. There was a bar and a observation coach at the back of the train.The service on the train was just like that in a 5 star hotel. The waiters were professional and friendly. The food was delicious. It was like being prepared freshly from the a full restaurant kitchen. Something completely over my expectation.The scene on route was beautiful and the sunset view was great too.It was a enjoyable journey which I highly recommend to everyone. It was a quite an experience.

Not in my top ten . Whilst this train travels through some picturesque countryside, the train itself is well below the standard of a top 10 train journey . The seating is poor, service is average & so is the food. Traveling 1st class is average at best. "You may have 1 glass of wine with your lunch, sir"! The train takes 10 hrs to travel 218klm.
Puno to Cusco on the Andean Explorer. This is a rail journey with everything. 10 hours of scenery, entertainment and relaxation all with To top great food and personal service. Throughly recommended.

Superb Experience. An superb experience from Cusco to Puno. 10.5 hours of luxury. This train is run by the same company that runs the Orient Express. Wonderful service throughout the journey. Very special indeed. Lovely 3 course lunch and afternoon tea. But the best thing are fantastic views from the rear of the observation car.

More Fun than I was Expecting. It is a long train ride, bring entertainment and visit the bar car. These are restored Pullman cars and were beautiful. The wait staff was very attentive and the food was decent. I had heard the ride was bumpy but I would call it a rocking motion, it was fine. The scenery was varied and interesting, seeing the little towns and the shepherds watching over the flocks of sheep and llamas (or alpacas). Best tip: Be in the observation car when the train rolls through Julica, the train goes right through a open market for the local people with inches to spare. The children were all waving to us and even one baby in the papoose was waving. Wish I had the picture to post but my brother-in-law has yet to send it. So much fun.

This is a hard one to review.... I had wanted to take the train from Puno to Cusco but it was really expensive. I decided on a whim to just do it and booked my ticket the night before. I had had a terrible experience with a 10 hour bus ride earlier in my trip and really liked the train option. For me, the train was great. It was the slow season so we were only one car of tourists. The food was good (I'd been in Peru a while beforehand) and the service, excellent. The bar car was fun and the bartenders friendly. I especially enjoyed the open air car in the back and spent most of the ride there, practicing my Spanish with fellow passengers from Mexico or exchanging USA stories with others. The train passes through some spectacular scenery, even while it rained a bit. Since it's clearly catering only to tourists, there were two different bands playing local instruments and a pisco making class. Of course, the bands offered to sell their CDs at the end of the program but every tourist attraction in Peru has this distraction. Now, for the bad parts of the experience. The train is ONLY for tourists. There is no way Peruvians can afford it. The tracks go through very poor pueblos in Peru and, right outside Puno in Juliaca, through the center of a market. I took a video of the townspeople setting up their stalls again as we passed and of fruit laying inside the tracks to be sold. We rolled right over it. Since I usually like to travel as a local as much as possible (taking colectivos and buses and staying in cheaper accommodations and homestays), I felt like a spoiled American the entire time. Since I usually travel in a more local way, I understood the fact that there is no air conditioning on the train (the only place I'd seen it in seven weeks in Peru was at the school where I studied Spanish while in Lima) and preferred that the servers spoke with me in Spanish (So I'm not sure about their English anyway).

Great experience. We traveled from Puno to Cuzco on the train. It took 10 hours but was a great way to see this part of Peru. It is very comfortable, the seats are like armchairs. The service on the train is excellent and you are well looked after. There is plenty of space to get up and stretch your legs, there is a bar in one of the carriages and the last carriage is an observation car which is open at the end. I spent at least a couple of hours in the observation carriage watching the world go by spotting the wildlife and waving at the locals as you go through each village. One of the great railway journeys of the world.

Great way to see the Peru!. I travelled with my family and friends, including two 6 year olds, from Cusco to Puno and it was an amazing experience. When you arrive to the station you are greeted with a tea or coffee and the service only improves from there. Once on board the train you are greeted by the friendly staff and are quickly given options for breakfast (not included in the cost of the ticket). The food, entertainment and staff were all lovely and exceeded my expectations; we even got to see the kitchen and meet the chefs who graciously stopped food prep for a photo. The children in our group were served their lunch first and the waiter was more than helpful and very patient when one of the children spilled a drink. The scenery from Cusco to Puno was breathtaking and the views were easily enjoyed from any car on the train. The 10 hour trip was a pleasant way to relax after a few days of hiking the ruins.

Excellent. Voted the best way we have ever traveled. For the same price as a plane ticket we were able to travel in high style across Peru and after several days of touring Cusco, the Inca ruins around the Sacred Valley, and Machu Picchu we were ready for a day of relaxation. We started our day off in a beautiful waiting area filled with soft couches and winged backed chairs being served coffee and juice to a immaculate train coach. For those who hadn't eaten breakfast prior to arriving at the station al la carte full breakfast service was offered. Shortly after we started our journey a troupe of musicians playing traditional flutes and guitars entertained us in the bar/observation car. After our 3 course lunch, included in the ticket, a second group came aboard to entertain us some more.In between these two groups we stopped at the highest point in the journey to allow the returning train to pass us and do a little shopping at a track side market.Ten highly restful hours later we arrived in Puno.

Family voted--favorite part of our trip!!. We always want to travel like it's 1920!! Beautifully restored Pullman cars, white-glove service, bar car, open-air observation car, 2 music/dance shows during the trip, one (short) stop in the high Andes, plenty of room to stretch out and roam. Yes, it takes 10 hours to get to Lake Titicaca (rather than the 90-mins by plane), but this is the BEST way to see the country. If we ever go again, we will DEFINITELY repeat this trip.
Beautiful. the trip in train is so beautiful and relaxing, we traveled during the day and was so nice, we saw the mountains, rivers, nature, etc.

Delightful experience. We were a family of 6 adults traveling through Peru. The travel agency had recommended this elegant train ride from Cusco to Puno. The staff on the train were very friendly and provided flawless professional service. The food and wine selections were excellent. The scenery was beautiful. Musical performers and dancers provided a lot of fun entertainment. It was amazing how quickly the 10 hour trip went by. We would highly recommend this excursion as part of your Peruvian experience.

Amazing experience!!!. Worth the expense of experiencing the train ride on the Andean Explorer. Excellent all the way. Classy Service from check in at the station to the elegant waiting room right up to the entire journey. Great Service, Food, Entertainment, Friendly, attentive & very helpful Staff, etc., including receiving one's baggage on the station at the end of the trip. Not enough can be said of this almost perfect ride.Even was a volunteer to demonstrate the preparation of the famous Peruvian Pisco Sour. And naturally got to drink my own concoction! Will not hesitate to recommend this experience.Also met with two Directors, who were on an inspection tour - great guys. Regretfully misplaced their Business Cards and unable to mention their names.

So Much More Than Just A Train Ride . Talk about a wonderful way to travel to Puno!! The Andean Explorer is a fantastic way to pamper yourself after several hectic sightseeing days in and around Cusco. The train is beautifully outfitted; the staff attends to your every need; you are treated to live music, cultural dances & even a class on how to make a Pisco Sour! Lunch & high tea are included along with a mimosa in the morning & a glass of wine with lunch. Breakfast is available for purchase & it was excellent. The landscape is ever changing during the 10 hour ride, pretty stunning overall. The time passes quickly given the four activities & meals. Well worth the money. There were only 36 passengers on our ride.

Unforgettable Cusco-Puno journey by train. If you can afford it, this is a must! You can see the landscapes change between the lush sacred valley to the dryer Altiplano during this 10-hour journey, probably one of the most beautiful routes I've seen. The train is furnished in early 20th century style, and has very comfortable seating. Service is absolutely outstanding, always offering complementary water and tea, and happy to accommodate if there is something on the menu that you can't eat. You are received with a welcome drink and folkloric animations at 10am, and the day is punctuated with delicious food, drinks, music, dances and even a bartending class in the afternoon. There's an open view car at the end of the train from which you can take pictures. The arrival into Juliaca's busy street market along the train tracks is also impressive! Compliments to Perurail for offering such an amazing experience!

Fantastic way to travel. What a marvellous experience this train trip from Cusco to Puno was, the carriages are luxurious and I felt very spoilt to be able to travel in this civilised manner. The beautiful individual arm chairs are very comfortable to both sit and sleep. Within the first class carriages the configuration consists of a single seat on one side and two seats on the other side of the aisle. Each configured in a single seat facing each other and double seats facing each other. The toilets like the rest of the carriage are nicely decorated and cleaned very regularly, they are not like ordinary train toilets.The wait staff are very attentive and any request is soon completed. The saloon car at the rear of the train has a bar and some seating, with an open section right at the back for photographs and taking in the beautiful scenery. In regard to the scenery, doesn't matter where you are, you will be able to take it in, whilst you wind through the beautiful mountains and along the backs of the river.The three course meal for lunch was excellent, the Chilean wine was very good and afternoon tea topped it off. The journey provided entertainment in the form of singers and dancers and also a demonstration of how to make Pisco Sour. I thoroughly enjoyed this journey and would highly recommend it.

The only way to Macchu Picchu - unless you hike!. Very well organised, comfortable and efficient. The train provides wonderful views along the way, abd a simple meal is served en route. It takes about 2 hours and it is highly recommended.
Trip from Puno to Cusco . What an amazing trip. You MUST do this. Once in a lifetime time type of opportunity. Also thank you to our server Ingrid. You provided excellent service! Thank you.

Unforgettable experience - just do it . We traveled on the Andean explorer from Puno to cusco. Our hosts were Ingrid and Julio.Let's keep it simple: it was an amazing and unforgettable experience. As part of the journey/price you get:- transportation to cusco in a beautiful and very comfortable train (think orient express). You have your own seat with a personal table.- great food: welcome mimosa drink, 3 course lunch (michelin star level), snacks throughout the train, hot drinks, tea snack ('high' tea) later in the day- entertainment: 2 live music and dancing sessions, pisco sours lessons- a beautiful open carriage at the back with glass ceiling: here you can experience live the scenery you go through (amazing). E.g. We went through the market in Juliaca connecting with the locals waving at us as we passed through.Don't think of it as an expensive train ticket: think of it as a day tour in the cusco/Puno area... That also happens to take you to your destination. Highly recommended.

Watch out for your personal belongings the whole journey!!!. The scenery was stunning, and I also like the food and service very much.BUT there are two things which ruined our good feelings:1. There is no air conditioning, so almost whole journey the windows were opened and the engine smoke was coming in.2. Someone has stolen us. We realized only after the journey (at the hotel), that we missed our external hard drive to the computer. (Yes, it was our mistake, that we didn’t check, if we had had everything right on that place.) We thought that it had fallen down under the chairs and went to the train station and into the train the next day. We searched everywhere in our car, but nothing. We also wrote an email to Peru rail with our problem, but they did nothing except general answer to our email.So it was extremely expensive journey for us.

What a great way to travel. We were expecting bench seats and were seated at a table with a tablecloth and fresh red rose. Lunch was included in the cost of the ticket. We had to select among two entrees and you couldn't go wrong...gourmet either selection. Plent of snacks throughout the 10 hr train ride from Cusco to Puno. Live entertainment made the time fly by

Fantastic way to travel. We travelled on the Andean explorer and had a great journey. The scenery is great and the staff could not be more helpful. The meals were of a high standard as was the entertainment. We had a short stop at the highest point to go to local craft market or local church both excellent. Fantastic journey.

First class. From the moment to you arrive in the luxury carriage in Puno , you are thoroughly spoilt. Excellent service and delicious snacks and meals. There is live entertainment in the observation car but just sitting and observing the amazing and varied countryside from my quiet coach was bliss. You really do see a lot of the way people live and servive and it made feel very greatfull and humble.

A luxury train ride from Puno to Cusco. Was very impressed at the interior of this train. Beautiful wood paneling and large upholstered chairs to sit in at table clothed tables set with real roses. Lunch and afternoon tea were included - had 2 choices to pick from for lunch. Very good meals. Had 2 bands play Peruvian music throughout the journey accompanied with dancing, also the bartender taught us how to make a pistol sour - the nation's cocktail. In addition to dining car they had a bar car and an observation car. This is a must do in Peru.

The Only Way to Travel from Cusco to Puno. This was definitely one of the highlights of our Peru trip, especially for our son! The whole journey between Cusco and Puno is about 10.5 hours; but you do not even realize that in the Andean Explorer. The Andean Explorer checks all the boxes for a wonderful train - the carriages are elegant, with comfortable seating and tables covered with white tablecloths. Gourmet food is served, and they provide a complimentary drink on arrival and wine with the lunch. The staff and service is excellent - they are well trained and they make an effort to ensure that you are taken care of. Bathrooms were clean and well-maintained too; and they stayed that way for the entire journey. It is a long journey, and it was great to see that the staff had taken care of all aspects.Onboard entertainment was interesting - you could sit in the bar car and enjoy local music played by a live band, you could take a class to learn how to make Pisco Sour and off course, there was the fashion show. But what was most fun, was standing at the open viewing car at the end of the train taking in the Andean scenery and also watching local life, when the train passed towns.The train stops at a La Raya, which is the highest point on this route. Almost everyone got off - you can just walk around, or buy sweaters and trinkets from a local market (right where the train stops!).It is 10.5 hour, when you just relax, enjoy the wonderful service, sit around watching the landscape go by and take pictures - many, many pictures!
Worth Every Penny. I took this train from Cusco to Puno. It's first class all the way. Great food, drinks and entertainment. Would recommend as the only way to make this journey.

Fabulous!. We left Puno on the leisurely 'Andean Explorer' train, a luxury train co-owned by Peru-Rail and apparently the Orient Express. After handing in the luggage, we boarded the train, not quite knowing what to expect. The journey took 10.5 hours at a maximum speed of 40km/h, and it didn't seem to drag at all, with comfy chairs, white tablecloth-covered tables, welcome drinks/snacks, lunch, afternoon tea - like a Rovos Rail day trip, through the Andes! There is a viewing car at the back, and the 3 main carriages have huge windows where we watched the world go by - literally - in some towns there are markets taking place on the tracks, so the train hoots to get everyone to clear the tracks - even when people moved off the tracks, if the windows were open we could have picked up anything from food and clothing to tyres, engines, nuts and bolts! We went sedately past villages, herds of llamas, alpaca, cows, sheep, with beautiful snowcapped mountains in the distance the closer we got to Cusco.There were various 'activities' on the train over the day, in-between meals - Peruvian music and dancing, Pisco Sour demos, fashion show (i.e. trying to sell me more scarves).Well worth it!

A complete and varied journey. We made the trip from Puno to Cusco with the kids and though it was going to be a bit hard for them considering the 10 hours but we really enjoyed the comfortable carriage, the open deck bar at the rear, the live music, the excellent cuisine, great service on board, dances, stunning view from the lake, puna, snow mountains, valleys to reach Cusco...details that made our trip unforgettable.

Hell of a Train Journey. The carriages are divine as you would expect once you discover that PeruRail run this with help from the same company that runs the Orient Express. The journey is on one of he highest altitude set of tracks following a river line for long distances up into the peaks and mists. Ten hours from Cusco up to Lake Titicaca is a long journey made possible by the comfort of the carriages, the food and refreshments and the viewing platform at the rear of the train affording views to rear, sides and overhead. It is supplemented by a bar and is a natural meeting place for passengers from all walks of life. This was an impressive journey and a great way to travel up to the lake.

Not as scenic as Perurail Andean Explorer. We traveled on Perurail Andean Explorer from Puno to Cosco and thought it was a wonderful trip through the country side, definitely recommend this trip, excellent service, folkloric entertainment and fabulous scenery. All that said save your money and get a cheaper rate on another train from Cusco to Aguas Calientes Machu Picchu. Service is very average, a lot of waiting which wastes too much time. Food is mediocre. Train is extremely slow! Day scenery is not worth it, you will see better scenery on the bus ride up the mountain.

Train gives the tourist a more realistic peek into daily life. I recommend this trip for the opportunity to see a different side of Peru. The train meandering through the country side shows you the primitive agricultural methods, the beautiful nature, and a closeup of village life. Board the train in Puno and arrive in Cusco 10 hours later. Staff on the train was very well trained. Baggage is stored and quickly unloaded on the other end. Comfortable seating with the option for sitting in your assigned table chairs or sitting in observation/bar car. Considering the space of train kitchen the food service is excellent. Breakfast is served, lunch is an option of two main course. Tea service is served late afternoon. Wine, hot chocolate, juice and soft drinks are available. Entertainment is done in the observation car which included two cultural music groups and Pisco sour class. Entertainment is not mandatory so it does not interfere with your quiet time. The landscape will forever be etched in your memory. Train gives you a closer less confrontational peek at daily life than being in a car.

Expensive but worth it. This rail trip was expensive but worth it. We did the cheaper ($164 US) from Puno to Cusco trip. Agreed with the comments from others - lots of entertainment, great sights, luxury travel. Rather than read a heap of crap I have summarised some main tip below:1. The literature states that you need to check in and get your tickets 4 hours before departure - well, this is South America!!!!2. Stay a night or two in Puno before / after the train journey. Puno is surprisingly pleasant and is located on Lake Titicaca if you want to do a tour.3. Don't buy the drinks too early - happy hour is at 3.00pm (2 for 1)4. Train stops half way at the highest point where there are some local markets - haggle and grab a bargain!!5. sit back and enjoy a thoroughly relaxing rideOverall, we had a great time, service was excellent, and a comfortable journey to Cusco. We would recommend you do this once in your life.

A Spectacular Day. This was a most enjoyable adventure. The train was beautiful. The food was excellent. The staff were polite, attentive and very professional. They provided live entertainment with cultural music and dancing. Also a less on how to make a Pisco Sour in the beautiful bar car. The observation car at the back of the train was so nice to watch the scenery go by. They did not forget one detail on this journey. Everything was check-in to leaving the train was incredible.

Like Royalty!. As part of our trip through Peru it was entirely by chance that our itinerary saw us on this train on my 50th birthday. From the moment we boarded until the moment we got off I truly felt like royalty, reminiscent of the "days of the Ray", I can imagine.Not only the train, with one carriage available to us for our meals another carriage where we could have drinks and a final carriage with a viewing deck, but also the staff and food and drink choices on offer, coupled with some of the most stunning scenery imaginable on this 11 hr train journey, contributed to making my birthday something I will cherish for the rest of my life.Along the way, whilst riding through towns and villages, you are greeted and enthusiastically waved at by the local kids. In the bigger towns, it is magnificent to see how the railway has been incorporated into the market with the stall holders temporarily collapsing part of their stall to give way to the train.For those who were fed up with the scenery (how could you!), some local entertainment was provided by troops of musicians and dancers.Although the weather during the latter part of the day turned rather overcast, this could not detract from the sheer beauty of the countryside and the journey overall.

A Nice Highlight and touch of luxury. Despite the considerable cost for a family of 4, this was a highlight of our 2 month trip to S America. Great to see the country side in this luxurious train, with good food and service.

Memorable Ride. We travelled from Puno to Cusco by PeruRail Andean Explorer. It was a memorable ride though the scenic route. This train runs only on specific days in a week. It starts at 8 am at Puno and reaches Cusco by 6.30 pm. Welcome drink, 3 course lunch and High Tea are served as part of the package. There were good options for vegetarians also. Seating is very comfortable and there are common areas like dining room and observation deck where passengers can relax. Music, dance and fashion shows are performed to keep everyone entertained. Though the fare is expensive ($ 160 ) compared to Bus it is well worth the cost.

Really wonderful experience. We have long hesitated whether to travel Andean Explorer issue.He betrayed little high price.Finally, we decided to enjoy this experience, and we did well. The train itself is very luxurious and breathtaking scenery road leads.11 hours drive runs like water in the river Urubamba. Book a place as close to the last scenic car.

A great experience! The whole family greatly enjoyed it.. It helped that we had a sunny day on this 10.5hr deluxe private train ride from Cusco to Puno. Getting up and going to the bar car and separate viewing car, complete with open back end, was a treat. We got to meet a lot of travelers, all in a relaxed state of mind as we traveled through wonderful Peruvian countryside. And the entertainment was well received: 2 bands, and dancers, and those in the bar/viewing car actively participated. The trip was an "Orient-Express" 'lite', in that in did not entail and overnight or sleeper car. A just-right journey on a classic train. Just sit back, meet some fellow travelers, have a nice meal, a good drink, and let the scenery pass you by.

A great train. We went on this from Cusco to Puno. A very long journey, about 13 hours, but very interesting. It is a bit like the Orient Express. We were given meals and had lots of entertainment. Fashion shows, singers, dancers etc. The scenery, from the train, was also entertaining, from beautiful to interesting, when passing extremely close to market stalls!

Exquisite moments of reflection. Quite simply one of the best day’s travel of our lives! Between departing Cusco at 8am and arriving in Puno at 6.30pm, this was the Orient Express transplanted onto the Andean plateau. Service was exemplary, the on-board entertainment (two bands and a fashion show) was riotous fun, and the food was first class. On this journey it’s impossible to not make new friends, and irresistible to marvel at the passing scenery from the open-ended observation car. It comes with a decent price tag, but it’s worth every cent. Be sure to take your place at the back of the observation car as the train approaches Juliaca. The city market straddles the railway line, and you will find yourself immersed in the mayhem, as little kids wave at the wealthy passengers passing by... one of many exquisite moments of reflection on a dream day trip.

Train journey of a lifetime. Brilliant train journey from Puno to Cusco.Luxury travel with great service and food. You need to be into train travel as its a slowish 10 and a half hour ride. The views are magnificent and varied ranging from the mountains with alpaca herds to driving through markets in the town stops en route.The booking process is clunky with unnecessarily confusing emails about the need to validate etickets 4 hours before travel.
Comfortable. Customer service was great, performances were entertaining. The food was delicious. Toilet was clean and the seats were comfy.

Much better than a bus!. We were a bit diffident about taking the train, having read a few not exactly glowing reviews. We travelled from Puno to Cusco and it was absolutely brilliant! Very comfortable, good food, a wonderful observation car. Even some entertainment. This is absolutely the best way to travel between Cuzco and Puno.

One of the World's Best Train Rides. A wonderful 10.5 hour journey in luxury through stunning scenery with fine food, excellent service and plenty of on-board entertainment. The ability to take photographs from the open-ended lounge/observation carriage was a great feature. The halfway stop was appreciated - a welcome leg stretch and a chance to buy souvenirs from the locals. On line booking before my departure for Peru was simplicity itself and the $164 single fare was excellent value for money. Arrival at Cusco was 30 mins late but no one was complaining. Definitely better than the slightly quicker road journey.
Great trip from Puno to Cusco !. The hours went by fast. Gourmet food and excellent quality service made for a memorable trip. They are very prompt so don't be late !

Worth every cent!. This was our one splurge of the trip. The steep price tag had me expecting to be disappointed, but this 10 hour train ride was an amazing way to travel from Puno to Cusco. The views along the train are gorgeous! And there is almost always something going on on the train, so you are never board. Two live bands, and fashion shows. A complimentary pisco drink in the bar cart, three course lunch, and afternoon tea. The viewing car in the back was also a wonderful way to view the scenery. The train never felt cramped, even with several cars full of people, and you are free to move around as you please. Oh, and the restroom was lovely and spacious! First class transportation for sure. For the price, the food probably could have been a little better, but it was above average, and the rest of the trip makes up for it. Just don't go on the ride if your sole purpose is an excellent meal. Cause you can find those elsewhere all over the country, in buildings that aren't moving!
Amazing. Took the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco. It exceeded my expectations.The service was really good and the scenery was gorgeous.

Slow but interesting. This trip took us relatively slowly (average under 40km/hr) from Cusco to Puno. It travels from 3000 to 4000 meters with a stop at the highest point of the journey at 4319 meters above sea level. Try to slow your walking at these high altitudes so you don't run short of breath.The fashion show was entertaining and food and drinks were also included. Traditional dancing was also on the trip as entertainment. Good seats. The rear carriage has a part glass roof which is a bit of a novelty. Overall it was a slow, reasonable picturesque trip taking in the changing landscape as you rose up onto the high altitude plateau.Recommended if you have plenty of time.

Along trip by train but they keep you fed and entertained. Lots to eat and drink with a a comfortable chair. There was a show at 10 and at 3 as well with local singing and dancing. A fashion show for alpaca garments as well, lunch was very tasty.

Long, but an Amazing Jurney..... The best way to describe the Andean Explorer from Cuzco to Puno is to say that this is a long 10 hour ride but in which you will not reach out for the tablet, the phone, the laptop or even a book because you will have so much to see, to enjoy an to photograph that the only times you will be in your seat are for meals and a quick nap after lunch at the highest point in trip.The quality of the train is "luxury" with seats that remind you of being in a great old living room, beautiful set tables and a luxury bar. Quality of food and drinks is very high during the whole trip.Entertainment in the bar was great with two folklore musical groups and dance shows which are great for passing the time sipping some Pizco Sours, the staff i great and the barman provides some tips make real Peruvian Pisco sours.But the highlight of the trip and the ride has to be the open ended last train wagon after the bar, there is nothing like standing here with a camera while you go through and actual market that gets our of the way while the train passes ever so slowly o while arriving to Lake Titicaca.

10 Hours - But It Goes By Quickly. This is the Peruvian version of the Orient Express - from white gloved tea service in the reception area to the white table cloth service on the train. The whole trip is elegant, interesting and has great service. There is entertainment and a fashion show. The bar car was unfortunately inadequate for the number of cars as it was the best place to view the scenery from and take pictures. It is also the main place for entertainment. The scenery was not as varied or dramatic as I expected. It is mainly the upper plains of Peru and various forms of agriculture. It is fun and interesting to see, however after all the mountains we saw to date in Peru. Definitely part of the "experience." Do take card and/or a book to read though.
train to Machu Pichu. Short ride, but good service and nice views. Nice chance to meet others and learn of their adventures.

Fabulous journey. This train journey is great. We travelled from Puno to Cusco, a journey taking about 10 hours, and enjoyed every minute of it. The train is elegant and comfortable - a kind of Peruvian Orient Express - with only two passenger cars, a bar, and an open observation car. Drinks, meals and snacks were served throughout the day by extremely charming staff. Entertainment in the form of pan pipe music and dancers was provided both in the morning and afternoon, but the best entertainment was standing in the observation car watching the stunning Andean scenery roll past.

No better way to celebrate my 60th birthday!!!!. February 18th 2015 saw us board the Andean Explorer in Cusco bound for Puna on my 60th birthday and what a day. The train is 5* all the way great views, scenery, staff, food and wine. There can be no better way to get between the two cities, up there with the Tren Curcero in Ecuador.

Forget about cost, this is the only way to travel between Puno and Cusco. My wife and i were on our honeymoon and i booked this to take us from Puno to Cusco. We were staying on Lake Titicaca (uros aroma uro island - wee my other review for this place because it was amazing) up through the andes to Cusco. The train service is very professional and very much 5*. The seating arrangement is spaced out and the last two carriages are lounge areas that people are free to get up and socialise. We made friends with 6 others on the day we travelled just by drinking and chatting all day - coincidentally we bumped into them a week later up Machu Michu.Train journey is a comfortable 10.5 hours, with food and entertainment and a half way stop it really does just float by. The sights from the windows and the back of the train are amazing, especially the huge open landscapes. The train reaches the half way point at about 4,200m - we didn't notice anyone had breathing issues. The air is fresh and cool.One thing I was a little disappointed about was the food. I expected a little more, the portions were al la carte, but still very small - this didn't take too much away from the experience but i would have preferred normal human sized portions and more opportunity to eat. To paint the picture i am a 28yr old, 12 stone, athletic runner and even I got a bit hungry. Because the train leaves early we didn't have breakfast, i would get it on the train...Once we set off i ordered the 'traditional american breakfast' from the menu....what i got was two eggs. That was all, i thought they were playing a joke with me and asked where the rest was, that was it. Hugely misleading, they should have names it 'two eggs on a plate' then i would have ordered 6 of them. Peru Rail if you are reading this, please add other items to this breakfast option because two eggs is not a meal.Would i recommend you to take this train - certainly! Yes it cost more, big wow you'll only ever do the journey once in your life probably. Everytime my wife tells our story she loves talking about the train we took from Puno to Cusco, no body loves talking about the cheap bus they took with 40 others squeezed in with all their bags that saved them 4hrs on their trip.
Puno to Cusco. Very much enjoyed the trip which enabled us to see a lot of the agriculture and way of life along the way. Special thanks to Julio Cesar and Pamela who provided excellent service.

One of the best holiday days. Ever.. Our agent booked this for us in the UK: Allegedly one of the "Great train journeys of the world". I was a little sceptical due to a poor experience on the Trans Alpine in New Zealand. But this was outstanding. The first thing I thought when I boarded was that it seemed similar to the Orient Express. Indeed, the manager advised us that it is owned by the same parent company. The carriage was very comfortable with armchairs as opposed to regular train seats. The food was first class and excellently served. There is a bar car and an outside viewing car at the back which was great fun and not hogged by selfish passengers. The ten hour journey just flew past. If you have to travel from Cusco to Puno or vice versa you must give this serious consideration

Unmissable part of any tour of Peru. This trip on the Andean Explorer is a must do on any tour of Peru. I took the journey as part of a trip with Titan Travel and it was better than anticipated. My journey was from Cusco to Puno (lake Titicaca). Obviously the weather can play a part in the views my trip was at the end of the dry season (October) and had clear blue sky's throughout. One word spectacular. The train itself is very comfortable with single tables, doubles (facing and side by side) and foursomes. The staff will do their best to suite your requirements for travelling with friends partners etc. You sit in armchairs that to me were very comfortable.You wont sit for long however as a visit to the observation car is a must, with large glass windows and open viewing platform at the end of the car. On the way you pass through the lounge car with a bar. As its a ten hour trip you may wish to avail yourself of its facilities at some time during the journey.Lunch and tea were provided and of excellent quality.Drinks at the bar were not cheap but for this type of train not outrageous (15 Sol for a beer).As its a 10 hour journey you should also be aware that the toilets were clean and spacious and comfortable, an important factor for many people.To sum up a must do if you are travelling in Peru not cheap but worth the price.

Best Way to Travel Puno/Cusco. It takes longer and is more expensive than the bus but you get so much more in return. A very comfortable journey with great views from the train, particularly the observation deck at the back of the train. Plus great service, fine food, and Peruvian entertainment - a real cultural experience which you just cannot get on the bus.

Magic train trip from Puno to Cusco. After a beautiful stay in the Alti-Plano of Peru we took the Hiram Bingham train to Cusco the scenery is just magic. The train trip well entertained. Best train trips ever.

The Best Experience. This is one of the best option for going from Cusco to Puno. The landscapes are very beautiful, the staff is really nice with a great show on board and the food were great. I think this is the best option for travelling. I highly recommend this service.

Great Experience. This was a very well run operation.Great way to start exploring Peru...a slow leisurely 10 hour train trip from Cusco to Puno (Lake Titicaca). Sit back and enjoy a few drinks (moderation suggested due to the high altitude...you pass through 4,319 metres at "La Raya") a nice lunch and arrive at Juliaca relaxed. It's worth while going to the bar and observation car to listen to the music and get absorbed in the whole experience.For reference: Caught the Hiram Bingham from Cusco to Machu Picchu so I'm able to make a direct comparison...The HB is obviously the HB...however the Adrian Explorer is certainly up there and worth doing.
Very relaxing luxery. Beautiful train with first class service and entertainment. Fantastic scenery. Much more relaxing than travelling by bus/car on a road crowded with lorries.

A good experience. The Andean Explorer is not a cheap way to travel from Puno to Cusco but it is a great way to see the country side between the two stations,a 10hr journey covering approx 300km.Starting from Puno the first point of interest is travelling passed Lake Titicaca and on to Juliaca with its large market spread out either side of the railway track and in some cases between the tracks.The scenery then changes to the plains where you can catch a view of llamas.The next stop is the highest point of the journey at 4319m there are also market stalls selling the normal souvenirs plus a small church,from there the scenery gets better as you follow the course of the Huatanay river where you can see plenty of wild life especially birds until Cusco is reached.The train has a observation car at the rear where there also a bar,during the journey there is a dance show so get there early for a seat as it's not a big space, all staff are very polite and friendly, water is available at all times,the food portions are small and in some cases not that hot,for those people suffering with altitude sickness the train also have oxygen bottles available,all in all a good experience

Comfortable rail journey. Not the Orient express but still a very comfortable journey. Meal served on board was good and staff very polite and friendly, One way to see the countryside where you can get up and walk to the observation car, have a drink and stretch your legs on the 2 stops we had. Recommend this rather a coach trip

Memorable Experience. The ten hour journey from Puno to Cusco was a joy and a more pleasant way to journey than by road. There is some theatre at Puno station to set the mood of the journey, and soon after it left cameras were busy taking photos of the lake. The train then squeezes slowly and literally through the middle of a large market and the scenes of every day life for the local residents were very interesting. Scenery changes as the track climbs and eventually reaching the summit at 14,000 feet, it then stops for ten minutes to allow the travellers time to view the local church and buy yet more alpaca scarves from the market. The observation car allowed everyone to take many pictures of the impressive scenery and of people working the fields and carrying on with everday life.The lunch, afternoon tea and dinner were very good too. Waht a joy, this is one of the great railway journeys of the world and if you are on the well trodden route towards Machu Picchu via Puno, thsi is an absolute 'must do' only bettered by the Higham Bingham train on the final leg to the lost city.

Hiram Bingham TrainTrip Macchu Pichu Peru. This has to be one of the most enjoyable old style train trips...with a guided tour to Macchu Pichu includee (not cheap BUT you may only do this once in your life time!). Fantastic start with dances and entertainment....then ..Rocking and rolling along to on board music (live band)...gret commentary...lovely meal on way up and GRAND four course meal on way down! If you get to do it....do it in FULL style..you will never regret it!!!

Luxury train travel. Pricey, but well worth it. This is certainly the best way to travel from Cusco to Puno. Just unfortunate that the high altitude made us feel a bit unwell, so we did not appreciate the journey to its fullest. But one really feels like one is travelling on the Orient Express. Five star service, good food, entertainment provided, beautiful scenery, fantastic sunset - what more could you ask for.... One recommendation - book your tickets by yourself, and book early. We booked six months in advance, and made the booking ourselves, since our travel agent said they could not yet guarantee that we would be able to get a confirmed seat. As soon as we received that message we went on line to Perurail and booked immediately, no problem. The result was that we got excellent seats, right next to the lounge car and observation deck. Suppose that if you are seated near the front of the train the exhaust fumes might bother you and it would be a longer walk to the lounge car, but we did not have that problem. Booking by yourself might perhaps be costlier than having a travel agent make the booking, but worth the extra cost.

Luxurious way to watch the Andes Mountains change character. What a delightful way to travel from Puno to Cuzco! Great service, comfortable seats and the ability to slowly watch the majestic Andes landscape change from the Altiplano to alpine and finally to jungle during the 8-10 hour ride. As you sip your Pisco Sour or Cusquena beer, listen to a band of talented Peruvian musicians play different songs in the bar. While this train trip is more costly than by bus, you can walk around and be in the observation caboose to take great photographs of the incredible scene that is unfolding around you. Also, lots of fun waving to the children who come out in droves to watch the train pass through their town.

Relaxing trip. A highlight of our journey. Wonderful views make sure you are on left hand side! We were not but you can move to the bar and observation car. Fashion show, excellent musicians, food is good, staff very helpful and very high standard. The seats are not too easy to sleep in. We were up at 5.30 to get 8 am train at Cusco travelling with APT.

A slower way to travel. Without doubt 10.5 hours on a train is a long time and you can certainly complete this journey quicker by other modes of transport. However if you like slow meandering journeys, with some beautiful scenery, then this is a fun day.Book way in advance as tickets do get sold out and the train doesn't run every day! The seats are reasonably comfortable and you may end up on a table for 1 2 or 4 people. Depending on the size of your party.Food was OK, nothing special, which was a shame for the price of the ticket. Plus it was served at odd times e.g. lunch at 3pm.I'm pleased i've done it and it was certainly memorable. I wouldn't rush to do it again, due to the cost and value for money

Andean Explorer Train Trip. Just newly arrived in Puno aboard the Andean Explorer from Cuzco. Thoroughly enjoyed the trip, not even noticing the 10 hours slip by so quickly. The service on board was fantastic with all our thanks to Julio Cesar and Kharen, who both worked tirelessly to make us comfortable and meet our every need. On board entertainment was also a joy with the two bands, dancers and fashions all appreciated. Highly recommend this experience.

A nice way to unwind. Costs a packet compared to local trains & buses but well worth the slow 10 hour train ride to see the countryside between Cusco & Puno, experience the luxury, have a pisco sour or 2 and see the dances & fashion show on board. Check out the items on the track for sale at Puno as the train goes over them (at very slow pace), well worth taking photos. A nice way to unwind after a 4 day Incan trek. Not for people saving money or wanting to get to the next destination quickly.

Classy Train Ride. We travelled around Peru using most shapes and forms of transport but have to say this is the classiest way to travel, taking in breath taking scenery from Puno to Cuzco. Once checked in at the station we were greeted by a Peruvian band playing on the platform. Our larger cases were loaded on the train by the porters and we just took our essentials on board. It was just like the Orient Express with wonderful friendly, attentive staff who showed us to our carriage and worked very hard the whole 10 hour trip. They never seemed to stop serving food and refreshments brought to our table which was decorated with a rose in a vase and a little 1920's era lampshade on crisp white table linen. We even got a free glass of wine with one of the meals and a free Pisco Sour cocktail at the back of the train where the bar was located. One lady got quite tipsy - luckily I'm a hardened drinker!The 10 hours flew by as we were entertained by Peruvian dancers and a fashion show during the journey. It's best to get into the bar at the back of train before any of these events start so you get a good seat which are limited. You also get the best views from here as the carriage is open at the back. I loved it when we slowed down to a snail's pace and went right through a local market and could almost touch the people selling their wares! You'll be amazed at what some of them sell. We also stopped at another market for 15 minutes where we had a chance to get off the train for some retail therapy. The elegance, comfort, service and whole experience was fantastic,it's just a shame I didn't have the elegant clothes to go with it. A lot of the other passengers also wore hiking boots so I didn't feel out of place. All in all I would highly recommend the Andean Explorer, one of the highlights of our trip.

For Andean Explorers. Start the adventure in Cusco City and finish in Puno City.As far as the professional experience of the Peru Rail crew, we have to compliment in our best way that we can. They were extremely meticulous and sensitive to every detail regarding our comfort, safety and requests etc.In short the 10Hrs trip was a gift for us filled with entertainment, good local food, traditional local snacks, local drinks, and amenities galore.The main crew member asked if any of us had any special request before reaching our destination, I said I do...
