It’s our anniversary!.The musicians dedicated “El Condor Pasa” song as per my request, soon after they prepared a nice present…I’ll not say what it was…we were very surprised and we are thankful for what they did.These is the way we would describe our experience:• Exciting• Entertaining• Fascinating• Intriguing• SurprisingWe thank you Peru Rail for your High Standards, at least it's our experience.

I Loved!. We loved the fact that one could move freely, excellent food and drinks all entertainment and much more comfortable than taking the bus.A great way to experience the different landscape of the Andes while being treated like royalty, We traveled from Puno to Cusco - this is definitely the best way to go. Uncomplicated and relax, sit on the couches or the observation car and enjoy the spectacular scenery of the Andean highlands, being attended by Dear Eufracio and his colleague were attentive at all times of our trip!Highly recommended!

A must do. We have just got back from Peru and one of our high lights was our 10 hour train ride on the Andean explorer.From stepping on board and seeing the elegance of the interior,the food,the service,the entertainment,and of course the fantastic scenery going by.It was great to go to the back viewing carriage ,open ended and lean out over the brass rails and watch everything go by. in our opinion the only way to travel from Cusco to Puno BRILLIANT
Another great rail journey experience. Wonderful experience. Great views and the open air rear carriage is a bonus to view the countryside.

Ten and a half hour train ride that I did NOT want to end :-). When I bought the train tickets I thought they were expensive for just going from point Puno to Cusco. However, we were so surprised when we realized the trip was much more than pure transportation. As soon as we got out of our taxi, someone jumped and grabbed our luggage and took it to the section where they tagged the luggage to be handled by train staff. No more dragging of the heavy luggage around. Wow..Then we showed our passport and ticket to very well dressed/well mannered train employees who pointed us the way to our car. Live Peruvian band was playing at the station. At each car another very well dressed employee welcomed us on board and showed us to our seats. These were not your typical train seats. They were more like a living room chair. We had a table with a white table cloth with a white vase that held a beautiful red rose. The inside of the train looked beautiful with wood panelling and crystal light fixtures. As soon as we sat another employee asked us if we wanted any tea/coffee/water (which was included for free during the entire trip). About an hour into the trip, we were invited to go to the Bar car. We were served a welcome drink and a few appetizers while the Puno band performed live music accompanied by their beautiful dancer. After an hour or so, we were invited to go back to our seats to order our 3 course lunch (which was included in the ticket). There was a lunch menu that contained a couple of appetizers and three Entrees and a dessert. A glass of wine or soft drink was also included with the lunch. All were served in nice china and were decorated like a high class restaurant. Wow...Once we got to the highest point of the trip, train stopped for 15 minutes so we could take pictures and visit the local market. We then continued on. At 3pm there was a demo at the bar on how to make Pisca Sour and then happy hour started (buy one get one free drink with plenty of munchies). After that another band from Cusco started to play music and they had their own dancer. Then it was the tea time where we went back to our seats and were served tea/coffee along with a plate of goodies. After that there was a fashion show to display the beautiful shawls and scarfs made from Alpaca wool. By the time we made it to Cusco station, we were actually upset that the trip was over. We had so much fun and the staff made our trip so enjoyable. Thanks so much for all the ones on board who made it such a memorable trip. My hats off to the PeruRail for offering such a wonderful service.

The Peruvian Orient Express. We traveled from Cusco to Puno as part of our tour. This wonderful train journey takes you through spectacular scenery in old-school comfort reminiscent of the Orient Express, with armchair seats, linen tablecloths and silver service. The whole journey was fantastic, with non-stop food and drink and great service. Even the toilets are impressive! You can sit back and enjoy the scenery, take photos from the open-air observation car or sit in the bar car and enjoy the entertainment. You really feel like you're embarking on a special journey throughout Peru.The only thing they could improve is the ventilation. There is no air conditioning and the windows were hard to open, so it got very hot inside the train.

Excellent Luxurious Train / the WORST Karina experience on car.. Our journey took nearly 10 hours, the scenery is lovely but this is only fascinating for a few hours. Besides being a luxury Train providing comfort and entertainment unfortunately a hostess seemed chaotic. At the beginning, we highlighted before boarding on the train that we are intolerant to lactose and ordered without it, I told her again. She put a potato cake on the table and we ask to change it. Nevertheless our drink got 1 hour later. The hostess not seemed more interested in trying to do her work. She didn’t hear very good English; hostess service was a mess by KARINA. She did what she could but overall the service was rather poor. Culminated the journey, we arrived hungry and had to search for food.

Breathtaking journey through the Andes!. Our journey was from Puno to Cusco. The trip, stuff and the train itself was of superb quality and service! The views are breathtaking, the shows and drinks on board are splendid! The journey lasts for 10 hours and it's too short! The ticket is a bit pricey but totally worth the trip. Book it, you won't regret it! Sincerely, Andrea A

Great Experiance and wonderful views. We enjoyed the ride and the views it offered to us. The staff we very hard working and extraordinary. They make this trip all the better with all their efforts to entertain the guests. Thank you

Excelent Service!!!. Very good experience I would recommend to all travelers so they can enjoy the beautiful scenery and the quality of service is very good. The boy Eufracio very attentive, friendly throughout the day;We thought it would be a long trip when they said they were 10 hours, but the hours were shorter with all the activities offered on the train. Very good

Personally disappointed slow train ride toooooo loooong. I found the trip good but too long in duration. I expected to see more snow capped mountains and as this was rated one of the top 10 train rides I was personally disappointed. Most of the ride was through arid farm land. Seats were not overly comfortable for a tall person. The crew tried to keep every one amused but to do a show on the run cramming all of the passengers in one sitting in two carriages could have been improved upon.

Toxic Trip. Imagine driving for 10 hours behind old diesel truck... The air inside of the train was toxic for the whole trip. Sometimes the black smoke that is passing outside was so thick that it casts shadow - sun eclipse... check attached image: through clean window against the blue sky... But must say that service is excellent: crew works extremely hard throughout all 10 hours ... Scenery, the first half of the trip from Cusco to Puno is stunning... Second half is rather boring... But no matter what the service is, no matter how beautiful the outside is, everything's very much spoiled by the stink you have to breath for the whole trip. Would not do it again or recommend to anyone... One can take a bus through exactly same road, make the trip much faster, save money and not get poisoned by carbon monoxide...

Superb experience. I can only say that you have to experience this rail journey in your lifetime! We were met at boarding by a smiling lady steward and then taken to our seats. I was spellbound by the sheer luxury of the carriage, it was the Peruvian model of the Orient Express, and something I was not expecting. I knew we were going to be experiencing something very special and the whole journey was exceptional. Some reviews said the price was expensive!!!! No way! We had spent the best money of our trip.We were on a group tour and had seats in the carriage next to the bar and viewing car at the back which meant we were well placed for the fabulous Andean pan pipe music and singing group which entertained us. The atmosphere was fantastic, everyone was joining in and the carriage was packed with myself sitting on the floor having the time of my life. The service was fabulous, the food very good, we just felt it was the most pleasurable day. The time flew past even though the train travels quite slowly allowing you to soak up the wonderful scenery. I spent some quiet moments at the back of the observation car on my own thinking I was the luckiest person to be watching the Andean scenery float past on this superb journey. It was one of the most memorable days we have had on our travels and a must do on your bucket list.

To add to others' comments..... Like some others, I was daunted by 10 hours on a train with 3 children. But the Andean Explorer is a joy if you take a book, a pack of cards and put yourself into the right gear.The website gives you a pretty decent idea of what to expect. I would only add that:- They give you a lot more food than just lunch- The sophisticated pictures of the train on the website are spot on…. Except you need to replace the gorgeous Peruvian passenger models with assorted international tourists in leisure wear. Our train has one tour party of Australian seniors, complete with name badges. I would not have like to share a carriage with them but you can tune out your fellow passengers if you don’t have a party in your carriage.- At times, the observation car is packed. Other times it’s empty. Being in coach A (next to the observation car) is great as it allows you to pick your time. It is THE spot for photography (the back in open – no glass)- Pay attention to the advice from others to be in the observation car for Juliaca market. An incredible 15 minutes of people watching. Peru clearly has no translation for ‘Health and Safety regulations’.If you fly, you can probably shave 4-5 hours off the journey. So think of it as a 4-5 hour journey rather than 10.

Luxury Andean Explorer on board to Cusco City.. We took Andean Explorer between Puno and Cusco. It's so much fun that the 10 hours or so just flew by, but it’s a little expensive. The trip includes food, drink and fun; there is an observation car; as the journey continues through a catalogue of different terrains. Staffs were the top class, Rosita lady hostess was great! She was helpful. The train stopped at the highest point on the trip so that we could take photos of the mountains and look round the market that was there. A great journey in sheer luxury. Amazing day, it is well worth it.
Expensive one way ticket, but worth the spending!. Great service, great atmosphere, unique landscapes, average food on board, spacious train and interesting music shows on board.

Fantastic rail experience. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip on the Andean Explorer. Pamela and Jhojhan were awesome servers who met our every need. The luxury of this trip is unparalleled at least in our opinion. We really liked the décor, entertainment, meal and the open air car off of the bar car. The stop at the Andean Continental Divide was worth it. We would definitely do it again!

Excellent way to get from Puno to Cusco. If you are travelling from Puno to Cusco then I would say this would be the way to do it. The railway is very efficiently organised and you are entertained and fed on board. It's quite a long journey (probably even longer by bus) but you can relax and enjoy the scenery. If you are anxious to see the musicians perform then you need to get down to the bar carriage some twenty minutes before they start otherwise it's a scramble for places once it's been announced.

Fantastic way to travrl. From start to finish, our experience with the Andean Explorer was first rate.At Cusco station, there is a dedicated lounge and toilets.Once on board, the decor, furnishings, service and attention to detail are spot on.The food is good, and they really look after children as well, with a separate kids menu.The bar is a great place to hang out, with live music, dancing and cocktail making lessons.The observation car is awesome, with open 180 degree views from the back of the train, and near 360 degree views through the large glass windows.The scenery is wonderful in the first half f the journey, while in the second half it's a little less so.Some things cost extra, such as breakfast, cocktails, beer and wine, but there's no need to pay for extras if you don't want to.A great way to experience a lovely country.

a disappointment. The train itself is lovely decorated in the traditional "Orient Express" style. The service was good with plenty of entertainment to keep you busy over the ten hour journey to Puno from Cusco. We chose this as a means to see more of the Andes...unbeknownst to us the ten hour ride was completely flat and boring..My suggestion would be to fly from Cusco to Puno via Lima but it is very expensive to do so.

A perfect day after a 4-day trek to Macchu Pichu. Just got back from an epic, almost life changing trip to Peru during which my three children (20, 16 and 14), my wife and I experienced trekking over the Inca trail to Macchu Pichu. The 45+ km trail is demanding but very rewarding.What better than to sit comfortably on a luxurious train for an entire day after such a trek? From 8am to 6pm, the train took us from Cusco to Puno through mountains and meadows where Alpagas would roam freely. Each wagon's interior is covered in rich dark wood paneling and we sat on chairs that belonged more to a living room than a train. We were facing each other, separated by a table covered with white linen, a table lamp and a flower vase with a fresh cut rose in it. Very classy.We were served a pisco sour with a few amuse-bouche at around 10am. Then we were presented with a "fashion show" - very tacky - followed by live peruvian music performed by a fun and friendly group of musicians. The train then stopped at the highest point of the day - 4319 metres - where we got off the train to visit a small and lovely church and shop at the artisans' market. Make sure you carry soles (local currency) with you as we found better quality wool products at better prices there than about anywhere else in the country. Time is short, but you can make some great buys.Bck on the train, we were then served a 3-course lunch. While the food wasn't exactly perfect, the service, attention and presentation were impressive. They work hard to make you feel like you are very special. During the afternoon, another music show and a short demonstration on how to make a good pisco sour were presented in the bar wagon which doubles into the panoramic one. Being the last wagon on the train, the open balcony with brass railing at the very back of the train is the best place to take pictures of the constantly evolving scenery.Later in the afternoon was tea time with yet again a few bites to complement the hot tea.While the train is much more expensive that the bus alternative, we found that it was a great way to recover from 4 demanding days on the mountains and the quality of service we received throughout the day in a setting that could easily make anyone feel they have gone back 100 years in time was simply delightful.If you plan on traveling between those two cities and want to experience what the Orient Express might have been like, the Andean Explorer is simply a must.

A truly amazing experience. This was one of my highlights of our travels across Peru. We travelled from Puno to Cusco. Beautiful train, luxurious inside, very ornate with delicate light fittings and tables laid up with lovely white linen tablecloths. You are shown to your specific table which, is yours for the duration of the trip. You also have access to a lovely bar area with comfy arm chairs and occasional tables, laid with a single rose which, serves a good selection of drinks, cocktails and hot beverages. There is also an observation carriage with seats and an open balcony at the back. The food served throughout the duration was quite a surprise, we had breakfast, lunch, served with wine and afternoon tea, served with a champagne bellini and it was absolutely superb. It was first class service all the way. The scenery all across the snow topped Andean Mountains was breathtaking. The 10 hour trip was well worth every penny.

A Great Ride from Cusco to Puno. This train ride, from Cusco to Puno, through the mountains, was way better than I had hoped. This turned out to be one of the highlights of our entire trip to Peru. The luxury service, great food, wonderful entertainment with dancing and cultural drinks, made the 10-hour long ride go by smoothly. The open air car at the rear of the train was the best place to hang out and watch the countryside float by. The small villages and farmsteads along the way were endlessly intriguing. Herds of alpaca and llama were fun to see. I would travel this way again in a heartbeat.

Amazing experience. In july 2015 we had the pleasure to experience the Andean Explorer train from Puno to Cusco. It was a fantastic emotion to cross Peru with such a nice train. We were entertained and catered very well. Our train hostess Rosita was very helpful and caring. We definitely recomand it.

cusco to lake titacaca. being gluten free thet rain asigned a waiter for the whole journey . JOEL was the waiter and was very helpful and attentive to all my needs ,being on a special diet  JOEL was there throughout the day on long trip excellent service plesure to have joel serve me ,well done JOELi would highly recomded this waiter thanks again

Puno to Cusco in style. Worth every cent. A fantastic way to experience the different landscape of the Andes while being treated like royalty. Excellent food and drink throughout, fun entertainment and far more comfortable than taking the bus. We cannot recommend this highly enough.

The only way to go!. The thought of a 10 hour train journey was quite daunting, but this was one that could have gone on longer! Such a fabulous experience to cross such magnificent countryside in such luxury and comfort.From the moment one checks in, the service is excellent. The seats are actually very comfortable chairs, and it is a pleasure to be served at a table with linen cloth and good cutlery. Besides a constant stream of snacks, the food was really tasty and there was a good choice.We loved the fact that one could move around freely, enjoying both the lounge area or the open car at the end carriage, where one could enjoy the stunning and changing scenery as we moved across the countryside. The staff have such lovely personalities, putting on a little fashion show, and providing dancing and entertainment along the way.The day went so fast, was so relaxing, and in my opinion is the only way to go!

Indulge yourself it is well worth the cost.. Cusco to Puno is cheaper by bus.... but it is nowhere near as indulgent!This train is run by the same company that runs the Orient Express in Europe and it shows, service (Ingrid) was impeccable, food excellent - just how they manage this quality on trains is beyond me.My photos show the food and the seating style but they cannot do justice to the service and the ambiance.The rear car is a large open veranda to the bar. The photo opportunities are excellent if it is not too crowded, my tip is to get there early.The bar area has a number of Peruvian dress/dance fashion shows during the trip and it has live music. On my journey a group of Australians steered the music from traditional Peruvian to a sing along - OK if you wanted that sort of stuff - I returned to my seat and enjoyed the scenery - added bonus was the dancers passed through my carriage so I could get better photos than in the bar!The train stops at the highest point of the line - 4319m - and there is a small street market and a great opportunity for photos.Finally arrival in Puno is in the dark.Decide on hand luggage to take with you as the bulk is stored for the duration of the trip, but it seemed to be well looked after and all divided you by carriage number to collect at the end. Again service was key to a VERY enjoyable trip - pay the extra and go by train.

Luxury from days gone by. We travelled on the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco; it was a magical journey. We were thoroughly spoiled - the scenery was breathtaking (especially from the observation car), food was good, entertainment great and staff attentive and very cordial. We were mostly attended to by a very nice young lady called Rosita. The train is very comfortable; great to experience such old-world charm. Ten and a half hours went by in a flash and, before we knew it, we were in historical Cusco.

Journey of a lifetime!. If anyone had told me I would enjoy every minute of this 10 hour journey I wouldn't have believed them. What a perfect day! Far too much food (you get breakfast, lunch, and tea), fashion shows, live music, an open air observation deck and a bar. And views to die for! The stop at La Raya, the high point of the journey was a wonderful photo opportunity but for me the highlight was the journey through the middle of Juliaca watching the locals moving their market stalls out of the way so the train could pass through. The trip was so engaging I had no time to read my book.

An luxury train, Excellent Peruvian food and Rosita was my hostess!!!. One of my best experiences. Although I will be repeating the train ride, I feared an 10 hours train ride , but what a delight !! No problem, every mile of the way was full of fun, luxury train that was not only comfortable, the food and service was excellent, with fun and entertainment on board also fantastic scenery of the Andes from an observation car ! . I am a food taster and I loved Peruvian food, I could not say thanks to the chef but I would love to do. I was a lucky, Rosita was my hostess, after reading Rosita Review, I was feeling treated, She is too helpful and she gives a smile. Upon arrival all luggage had been unloaded and neatly arranged for collection before we landed. This experience will leave a lasting impression on me Peru.

What a fabulous experience!. This trip was something I had been looking forward to for a long time, and it did not disappoint. From the moment you arrive at the station in Cusco it feels special. The staff are very professional and very welcoming. The train is beautifully appointed and charming. The whole day was a joy from start to end with wonderful food and drink, excellent service, and fun entertainment, which you can skip if you wish as it takes part in the bar. The Peruvian musicians are great and create a wonderful atmosphere to accompany the spectacular scenery as you pass through the Andes and climb to Puno. The observation car is the icing on the cake and where you will probably spend most of your time marvelling at the scenery, the sunset, and friendly locals who wave you by. There is nothing I would have changed or missed on this trip, I loved every moment. Don't hesitate to book.
Not to be missed. Step back into the 19th century in this wood-panelled glorious train with the bar and observation deck at the back.

High quality experience. We wanted to visit Puno and thought traveling by train could be a nice experience. We were no disappointed, the service is top quality, the comfortable seats, snacks, drinks, lunch, live entertainment, bar and a half open wagon to take scenery pictures makes worth the fare payed. The ten hours trip past fast and soon you realize the train is crossing trough the middle of Juliaca market. Highly recommended

A great experience!. Our travel agency booked this train trip from Puno to Cusco. It was a great experience. We loved this trip in the luxury of a train like in the good old days. I read somewhere that this train was rated the 2nd best touristic train in the world and I think it deserves it. The service on board was absolutely perfect, there were plenty of animations and also good food and drinks.

Great train trip!. We traveled on the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco. This is a whole day trip 8am-6pm...and very pleasant experience. Luxurious train carriages with separate lounge bar and observation carriages...so you are able to move around. Great food, live band entertainment, and scenery all included. It's not cheap but worth the price!

An experience not to be missed. This was a trip splurge that I hoped was worth it. And it truly was wonderful. It's a long 10 hour ride but with amazing views the entire time. And regular entertainment music groups in the bar car. The meals were excellent and able to accommodate vegetarian and gluten free requests. It was truly glamorous and like going back to the golden age of train travel. There are limited options on how to travel from Cusco to Puno/Lake Titicaca. The train is a bit longer than bus (especially as it will take a full day of your trip) but allows you to enjoy food, music, views, and walk around during the journey. You aren't stuck in a seat or cramped. It's a splurge, but worth as an experience.

A lifetime experience. What a way to travel! From the moment you take a seat on the luxuriously fitted out train, you relax and watch the world go by. The 10 hour journey really flies by. You can be entertained throughout your journey or just choose to relax. Entertained by live singers and dancers singing traditional songs and Pisco Sour lessons there is no time for boredom. The open back carriage allows you a great view of the scenery and a chance to stretch your legs. The scenery starts as if you are in the wild west - flat open plains and ends in the complete hubbub of Juliaca where market stalls are moved out of the way of the train, as you drive over food and other items, perfectly placed on the track so as not to be disturbed. Breakfast is available on board (small muesli and fresh fruit), which you can supplement if you like. Soft drinks available all day. Pisco Sour at 10:30am - if you are up to it. A three course lunch and then tea and cakes later on in the day complete with Bellini. All superb. A very special trip.

An unforgettable journey. The Andean Explorer is a must for any South American experience to be complete.With beautifully appointed carriages, spacious dinning cart, delightful traditional dance and music performances, your 10 hour journey across the top of the world is a unique experience.Service Manager Joel and his team pay attention to detail and make you feel as your comfort is their priority. Many thanks Andean Explorer!

Where did the time go?. What are we going to do for 10 hours was our thoughts. It went in a blink. The most entertaining 10 hours you could experience. We boarded in Puno to go to Cusco. The service and food was second to none. We felt like royalty. All through the trip there were local musicians, fashion shows, local dancers, pisco sour making demonstrations and the most amazing scenery constantly passing you by. I had mentioned when booking the trip some 5 months in advance that it would be my wife's birthday on the day we were travelling and during one of the local band performances they sang happy birthday and brought out a cake with candle for her. An absolutely fantastic and personal touch that made it even more special for us. Do not miss this great train journey!!

An extremely pleasant & memorable journey from Puno to Cusco. A very long pleasant journey lasting almost 12 hours - through very lovely pleasant mountain areas - including in-train entertainments- drums, songs and dancing with typical Peruvian costumes. Food was excellent and staff are very well equipped with knowledge of the areas. Pleasant staff have been very sensitive to the needs of the passengers.

Sit back and watch the world go past your window.. What an amazing experience, right from when you board the train in Cusco until you get off in Puno. 10 hours of being waited on, entertained on board and outside the train. You pass through magnificent mountains,valleys and plains and get to see lots of wild alpaca and vicuna. People working the fields without the use of modern agricultural tools and machines.The train rides straight through the towns and markets and you get to see everything close up. At the highest point-La Raya- you can get off to admire the scenery or buy souvenirs from local women. The whole train is first class, comfortable seats and incredible toilets. If there are just two of you ask if you can have your own table.

All aboard the fun express. This train trip sounds horrific. Eight hours sitting on a train?! Who'd have thought it would be such fun that it would pass so quickly?The train is attractive and very comfortable. The food and drinks are really good (considering you are sitting on a train) There is an outdoor car which provides fresh air and amazing views of the snow capped Mountains. The scenery is to die for!A bar cart provides live music, dancing and drinks. Staff dress up in costumes and entertain the passengers while they dance through the aisles of the train.The service is excellent.We are SO glad we did this train ride through the beautiful Andes Mountains from the Sacred Valley to Puno.Just DO IT!

Comfortable-Scenic. ROSITA the nicest hostess on board... My wife and I used The Andean Explorer heading to Puno a fascinating 10 hours traveling over the Andes, the service was impeccable this train ride is a true luxury like quality of the food, staff and the decoration touches made it fantastic. My wife had a dificulty with altitude sickness and I was concerned, Rosita met us and gave us the necessary attention, she is very helpful and thanks to her improved my wife. Peru is an amazing country, where I found a hostess friend on board. We would greatly recommend this trip for lovers of the requirement.

10 hours goes so fast. Who would have thought that 10 hours on a train could go so fast - watching the countryside from your seat, the bar or the viewing carriage at the back. Eating and drinking - coffee, lunch and afternoon tea - not to mention the lesson in making Pisco Sours. Watch the fashion show or the live music. Or just sit and watch the world go by - so much more enjoyable and relaxing than flying.

Memorable experience travelling in style. We took the train from Puno to Cusco and enjoyed every moment of it. The style and service was a refreshing contrast to the other options for travel in the Puno region. The food service was really great in terms of quality, freshness and presentation, and the refreshments just kept coming.The on board entertainment has been carefully thought out and made the time pass very quickly.As we were on honeymoon, the staff provided complimentary champagne which really made the trip special.

A long trip!. We agree with the previous comments about the length of the trip. For the first few hours it was great. Brilliant scenery, excellent service and a great atmosphere.However, when you travel from Cuzco to Puno the really interesting scenery is in the first half and the second stage drags a bit. Going through Juliaca was crazy....make sure you are in the observation carThe whole atmosphere is great. The chairs look good but by the end you could use a recliner.If we were to do it again we would go from Puno rather than to Puno

Worth the experience. You don't take this train purely for transportation purposes. You can fly in a fraction of the time it takes. The landscape you pass through though is very impressive, and the train experience lovely and make the 10 hours pass quite quickly. The only downside we experienced was that something they served us for lunch (I think it was the chicken) did not sit well with our stomachs.

V nice but LOOONG way to get to Puno. Word of advice: Fly out of Arequipa NOT Juliaca. It was a nice experience for about 5-6 hours. but 10-11 hours for 400 km is just too much. I couldn't get it out of my mind that the train was deliberately going slow to prolong the trip. It was very expensive per kilometer of travel. The train was comfortable and the staff seemed attentive and we got to see gorgeous views. I wished the train would have moved faster and stopped a couple more times. Just some extra advice for planning this journey (DO NOT fly out of Juliaca):If you do take the train form Cusco to Puno, you can take it 1 way. However, based on personal experience, do NOT fly out of Juliaca. The day we left, there was a strike in Juliaca, The people in Juliaca blockaded the streets with glass /burning tires and made their roads impassable. Our driver got us to the airport after 2 hours of nerve wrecking travel through the back/shanty town streets. The streets were unpaved, and gory. We were afraid of driving into a mob and the driver was clearly worried at the van being stoned (or worse). We were all worried that the tires would be punctured and we would be stranded in Juliaca. It is much better and ( i believe safer) to take an extra to see Arequipa and then fly out. I am not going to comment on the politics of Juliaca, but the town is clearly run down and not well maintained.

A highlight from Puno to Cusco. We took the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco and we were completely satisfied with this wonderful 10-hour journey. The service was excellent and we enjoyed very much the outsideplatform of the last car. The landscape during the trip is so beautiful. The 10 hours past really quickly.We bought a backpacker ticket (169 US Dollar) and I was very surprised that all the food was included except the coffee at the bar in the panorama car. This journey was one of my Peruvian highlights. I generally like to go by train and was therefore very interested in it instead of taking a bus. I can highly recommended it.Arriving in Cusco please keep an eye on overpriced taxi drivers. We paid more than double of the "right" price.

Don’t miss the Andean Explorer to Cusco – Highly recommended. Our Andean Explorer experience harked back to the golden days of train travel. In the spirit of the Orient Express, we took the luxurious Andean Explorer to Cusco. Often referred to as one of the best train journeys of the world, the ten hour journey took us through spectacular changing landscapes passing steppes, nomadic tribes, deep gorges shouldering the river alongside the railway line and snow-capped mountains towering above us the whole way. It turned out to be one of our highlights on our trip.The day was about the journey, not the destination. With plush surroundings and an army of meticulously dressed waiters, our every need was met as we slowly chugged through a fascinating and everchanging landscape. There was so much to see and photograph!A tip – be at the back of the train on the viewing platform as you leave Juliaca. Our train slowly moved through a busy market that occupies the narrow space between the tracks and the buildings that back on to the line. From the outside observatory we got a great view of the various stalls and watched with interest how the stall holders abandoned their market between the tracks, then quickly restored their stalls over the tracks once the train moved through! Terrific photo opportunities.

Amazing trip over the Andes. A fascinating 10 hours traveling over the Andes , the train was very comfortable and the staff attentive. So much to see in terms of rural life and changing landscapes. Great observation car with a nice bar. There is some entertainment en route some of which was a little bizarre but credit to the effort that was put into it. There is a stop at the highest point and a walkabout with local crafts to see and buy . A highlight is the train going through the market at La Raya where the stalls are literally a foot from the train !! The food is OK but maybe worth also taking some snacks with you , overall good value.

Luxury train- really enjoyable trip to Cusco- not to be missed.. We went from Puno to Cusco and had a great time. It is a pretty scenic route and there was tasty food served along the way. This is a pretty plush experience and is worth the expense when compared to taking a cramped bus. We arrived in Cusco and were not tired at all.

Excellent lazy journey through the Andes. Six of us took the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco during our two week trip to Peru. This is a great option to relax in luxury while making your trip to Cusco or Puno. It is certainly not the fastest way (Train probably averages around 35-40 km/h) but it's all about the journey. Miles and miles of fabulous countryside to view. The open air observation platform is a great way to view the scenery. The entertainment is very good. ( Two different bands played.) The lunch served was excellent on fine china in beautifully preserved rail cars. Our trip took 10.5 hours but seemed liked half that time as we enjoyed the whole experience.
Wonderful. Magical trip with excellent service, not to mention the spectacular scenery. Good value for the price.

Enjoyable must do activity whilst in Peru. Wow, went on this train trip from Puno (Lake Titicaca) to Cusco whilst on a 2 week holiday in Peru. Ok, its a little expensive, but so much better than getting a coach or plane between the 2 locations, Its an activity in itself. The trip includes food and drink, there is an observation car and bar car where you are free to sit or stand at the back of the train watching the world go by They alsos put on eg peruvian music and do things like pisco sour cocktail demos. Overall, really worth it, and great watching the scenary go by, Tip- stand in the observation car when going through Julianca and watch all the street traders putting back their stalls over the train track as soon as the train passes ! Amazing day, it is well worth it and does represent value for money.

Stepping back in time. A little luxury here. I would have liked a little more food (any extra had to be paid for) but otherwise a truly memorable experience. Staff were top class, the band were enthusiastic and the scenery was something you only see in movies!!Expensive but try to make the trip if you can. I doubt you'll be disappointed. I went from Cusco to Puno

Exquisite Explorer. We travelled from Puno to Cusco on this fabulous train. From the outside it looks nothing special (apart from its rather fine blue and yellow livery) but inside is a completely different story. The carriages are simply stunning - fine wood panelling, antique wall lamps and lamps on each table. The individual chairs are high backed and comfortable; we had single seats opposite each other. The washroom in each carriage was equally grand and clean with soap and hand lotion. As if that was not enough, there was a bar with lounge seats and tables and an observation car (with an outdoor viewing platform) at the back. Once again, beautiful wood panelling, comfortable seats and gleaming brass fittings were the order of the day. Soon after we left Puno we were offered tea, coffee, etc and muesli with fresh fruit. We were then asked to choose from two starters and two mains for lunch with a single dessert to follow. Lunch included a complementary glass of wine and coffee. In the afternoon we were offered a Bellini before being served afternoon tea. Additional drinks were available throughout the day at extra cost. Everything was served 'silver service' with immaculate attention to detail by the friendly and helpful staff. Other entertainment on the trip included two separate bands performing live traditional music, an exhibition of traditional dances and a fashion show! To cap it all, the train stopped at the highest point on the trip so that we could take photos of the mountains and look round the market that was there. A great journey in sheer luxury.

Wonderful way to enjoy Peru's scenery and culture. We used this service (Cusco to Puna) to get to Lake Titicaca. The journey takes around 10 - 11 hours, but there is plenty to see and do along the way. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner are served en route and there is a bar with waiter service for the duration of the trip. Between meals, there is live entertainment available in the bar car which takes the form of local musicians playing traditional Peruvian music with dancing as well – there are different groups in the morning and afternoon. There was also a fashion show on the trip we made and a lesson on how to make Pisco Sours (the ‘National Cocktail’ of Peru). All the entertainment is of high quality and is worth seeing, although you can choose to remain in your seat if you want to.There is also a stop at about the halfway point of the journey to buy souvenirs from local people selling traditional handicraft products.At the very rear of the train is an area that is open at the back which can be used as a photography platform – you will want to this use at several points along the way. The views across mountains, rivers and plains are spectacular for much of the journey.Staff are courteous and friendly and provide excellent service.This train represents considerably better value than the Hiram Bingham train, being roughly half the price for a much longer trip with the same standard of décor on the train and almost the same (very high) standard of food. If your trip includes a trip to Machu Picchu and Lake Titicaca, the this is an excellent way to get from ‘A’ to ‘B’, via Cusco and Puna.

A fabulous day. The first impression when you board is very good and it just gets better. It's a great scenic trip, (once you leave the outskirts of Cusco), the train crew and the entertainers are great. You also get fed and watered. Definitely the best way to travel from Cusco to Puno. The trip is over 10 hours, so don't expect to do anything else that day.

Andeanexplorer train trip from Cusco to Puno Peru. the train trip was a surprise. The seating and service was great My partner had such a good time, especially with the fashion show. Then the food was superb. The staff charming and friendly. I strongly recommend this trip.

Highlight of our trip. We took Andean Explorer from Cusco to Puno. It's so much fun that the 10 hours or so just flew by. Beautiful scenery of majestic mountains and rivers, passing by little towns where you could get a glimpse of town's life, live entertainment and beautiful food on white linen! The workers and kids in each town would drop everything to wave at you when the train passes by. Some towns would even centre their market along the rail with stalls literally by the rail lines. Quite a sight. Lots to see and do, unless you want to nap which is of course possible. Food and drinks were excellent, served inside bygone era carriages. What a treat! This is not to be confused with the Vistadome train trip to the base of Machu Picchu and back. That was also a lot of fun but a relatively shorter ride in a very different train.

Stunning views on this fun train journey. Fascinating journey by rail between Puno and Cusco, reminiscent of a bygone age.Right from the beginning of the journey, as the train ambles through the middle of the markets on the outskirts of Puno (where traders and punters are going about their business, literally right next to the railway line) it starts to captivate you.As the journey continues through a catalogue of different terrains, you get to enjoy lakes, waterfalls, rivers, alpacas, fascinating locals, mountains and plains.On board, the seats are comfortable and the food is good, as is the service.The open air viewing platform at the rear of the train helps to further enhance this great scenic experience.There is a bar and live Andean music too.Not the quickest or smoothest train you are likely to ride on but a lot of fun and certainly beats coaching it or flying!

A real treat. Took the train from Puno (Lake Titicaca) to Cusco - also goes in the other direction.My wife and I are fans of train travel and while "in the neighbourhood" couldn't resist this one. While luxury and a full day the price is reasonable. I tried to book way ahead of our travels before the date they accepted reservations. A nice touch is the person who emailed me and informed me this emailed me back a couple of weeks ahead of the reservations opening date and assisted me. Good customer service.Be aware Peru is a poor country. However, the people one passes in what can only be considered a dream palace to them are wonderfully friendly. It's very touching to see all those smiling faces waving at you, especially the cute kids.Search Google "Andean Explorer Youtube" and you'll see piles of stuff.Great scenery, people, servcie, food, and atmosphere.Do it!

Amazing rail journey. We travelled from Cusco to Machu Pichu by train. It was an experience to remember. The route had magnificent vistas. The quality of the train was excellent. We would greatly.recommend this trip. Machu Pichu is one of the wonders of the world. Take bottles of water with you.

A fun train ride!. Who would have thought a train ride could be this much fun?? In addition to the beautiful scenery you are experiencing, the friendly attendants on the train not only serve you snacks on the way up, but a light dinner on the return trip, complete with a fashion show of some beautiful alpaca fashions, both for men and women! The food isn't bad, the fashion show is a blast, and it makes the time pass quickly - - not that you need it to with the beautiful sights! The train left on time, is clean and efficient and easy to get to and from,. A really enjoyable experience!

A fabulous day!. We loved every minute of our day on the Andean Explorer. It was fabulous. We went from Puno to Cuzco, and from the moment we arrived at the elegant station in Puno, it was all wonderful. A real journey of a lifetime. Anyone complaining about cost and conditions should try British Rail!! The train and meals were beautifully presented, the staff friendly, the scenery stunning, and all such fun. Amazing experience.

Good for once. Although this was one of our most expensive activities or way to travel in Peru and was a very pleasant experience and a welcome change to the busrides. Enjoying the spectacular views, and the bar, it was a real once in a lifetime thing to do.

Excellent trip. We travelled from Cusco to Puno - this is definitely the way to go. Hassle-free & relaxing, sit back in the armchairs or observation car and enjoy the spectacular scenery of the Andean highlands whilst being looked after by the ever-attentive staff. One of the most memorable parts of the journey was passing through Juliaca where the market traders pulled back their stalls from the line to let the train through then carried on as soon as it passed. Well recommended

Way to travel. From our research prior to going to Peru, this trip seemed just prefect for us to get from Puno to Cusco. We were not disappointed this train journey was one of our highlights of the holiday. The quality of the food, staff and the personal touches made it fantastic. Of course you had wonderful country side to view. The day just drifted along a truly wonderful day.

Wow! Amazing! Incredible!!. I'm not usually a train enthusiast but I thought this train was incredible! Beautiful scenery, great food and was very well looked after. Definately an incredible experience and would strongly recommend it

Fantastic trip. Although I had the most fantastic day on board with excellent service and spectacular views, I would like advise people to ensure they carry enough soles for all their needs. They do not accept credit cards and the exchange rate from dollars is not good. This may be contradicted by a member of staff! However an adventure not to be missed.

Fantastic. After a looooong week in Puno, the train ride to cusco was like springtime after a long bleak winter. It took 10 hrs but I was wishing it would never end. After a 4 days of hiking Machu Pichu trail, the vistadome ride to oyantambo (sp) was a welcome return to civilization.Take the train anywhere you can in Peru, esp if orient express affiliated.

Great alternative to coach or flying. We travelled from Puno to Cusco and whilst check in was a long snaking line out the door, we were processed quickly and on board a lovely wagon with large armchairs instead of the usual train seats. I was able to change to a more comfortable setting with just us 2 opposite one another and if you don't like travelling backwards it is wise to request a forward sitting place in advance. Service was excellent, food was terrific, entertainment was accomplished in a cramped area - how the dancers and musician did it, I don't know! There were stops along the way which were very welcome. The one criticism I have is the heat and lack of ventilation. There were a few ill people who suffered and I also found it suffocating with only a small sliding window at the top for a little air. No air conditioning or fans! Incredible oversight.The observation car was crowded and it seemed every time I tried to get air out there, they released the toilets so the stink was awful (other people mentioned this also) so being out there was no relief. We met people later who had come up with the luxury bus and said it was great with regular stops etc so you have to decide which option will suit you better.Through no fault of the train's, we were held up just outside Cusco and had to shunt another train that had broken down in front of us so we were very late arriving and after such a long hot journey, it didn't come a moment too soon. Pity.

best way to travel from Cusco to Puno. If you try to travel from Cusco to Puno (or other direction), you should use the opportunity to go with the Andean Explorer from Peru Rail. Even as a flight is shorter, you should go by train as you have the whole day an exciting view to the Andean highlands. Never seen so impressive views. We booked the trip online on http://www.perurail.com as a one way trip which was very easy and works fine. After arriving at the train station we were at the waiting room which looks like in a historical movie. A traditional band was playing folk music on a high level and therefore we felt very welcome and comfortable, so everybody was pleased about the upcoming trip. the coaches are really beautiful and conveys a feeling like you are in the former century. On the trip you get a full service, including meals, tea, wine... and at the end of the train there is a coach with panoramic windows and a bar, where you can enjoy the journey.I wouldn't miss this exciting trip which is each dollar worth.

Luxurious train ride. We took the Andean Explorer to go from Puno to Cuzco in August 2014. This train ride is a true luxury! Service was impeccable, food was decent and they had great cocktails. The highlight was of course the observatory car-bar, which allowed us to make the most of the fantastic scenery. The only (relative) downsides were the price and the very touristy shows taking place on the train. We would have preferred to stop to see major cultural attractions along the way.

Cusco to Puno by train. Very nice way to travel from Cusco to Puno..relaxing..great train with an observation car and bar..Good food,(most drinks and all food included in your ticket)friendly service and some entertainment(dancing) included.Highly recommended.

Loved the whole ten hours. we were in one of the two first class carsAwesome just walking into the car, decor exquisiteThe bar car and observation deck at the back of the train awesomeFood excellentMusic from live Peruvian bands excellentScenery to die forBeware, you spend a couple of hours at extreme altitude and breathing can be difficult. Avoid doing this if you have advanced heart or lung diseaseOtherwise, you need to put this trip on your bucket list

Beautiful views and a smooth ride! - July 2013. The service was perfect, the ride was smooth, and the views outside were unbeatable. We rode the train on our way to Aquas Calientes, passing several Inca steppes and temples on the way. The river ran alongside the tracks for a while and the mountains towered above us the whole way. I've taken several train rides in Europe, but this one may have them all beat simply due to the scenery. The music playing over the speakers was a bit cliched and repetitive, but peaceful nonetheless. The ride back down - after we'd conquered Machu Picchu - featured a fashion show on the train, during which a man dressed like a goblin would dance around while trying to get women to dance with him. Enjoy the ride..it's worth every second!
Fantastic! . Best way to go from Cusco to Puno. Good service, good food, friendly and kind personel, good entertainment, very comftable! Congratulations to PeruRail!

Do this...train buff or not. Once again I'm impressed by PeruRail. Punctual, friendly, efficient service.On this trip from Puno to Cusco, there was only about 15 passengers.The ambience of the carriage takes you back in time, with a lamp and a fresh rose on each table.The food was plentiful and tasty.Probably the highlight (apart from the out of this world scenery) is the Lounge car with the open observation deck to get right into the scenery.My advice is to be sure to be on the viewing deck with your camera as the train passes through Juliaca. The market is amazing.This was a great days travel.Highly recommended.

A trip go back in time!. This is the best train trip I have had so far, a sort of a modern version of an Oriental Express. You can purchase the ticket on line yourself or you can have a travel agent do it for you. The seats are rather roomy, or at least for a tiny person like me, but compare to any British trains it is, and not too back with Amtrak or Eurostar...etc. There is an observation carriage at the end of the train where the bar is and where there is open space you can take photos. There is free entertainment on board, with some traditional dance and so called fashion show, where they try to sell you products. The food and drinks are not free so you will have to settle the bill just before you get to Puno. Rather pricey, but it is good. I am glad I did not pass up the opportunity to take the coach instead, this is a great way to travel. However, just be sure you have luggage allowance and if you carry more then you have to pay .....

Best way to go from Puno to Cusco. Magnificent scenery in the Andes, excellent service, a sense of former glory - like the orient express, but still very Peruvian. One of the highlights on our trip to South America. Only wish it lasted longer!

Something different - a great way to travel. It begins like a step into the past, boarding this charming old style train destined for Puno from Cusco. The whole train is devoted to making the 10 hours onboard a memorable one. If viewing the soaring Andes as you glide by is not enough then there is a stop to stretch your legs, a delicious lunch and other snacks/drinks. Then there is entertainment with local musicians, dancing and even a Pisco sour lesson. The time flies. Service is excellent and staff engaged. Only strange thing (very small) is that if you want milk in your tea or coffee then there is an extra charge for it. Very strange in what is a first class event. You should also consider carefully what you do at the other end - Puno (a grubby town with only very touristy islands to offer). However this is another story - the Andean Explorer is enough in itself.

Something different from flying. We took the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco - travelling in a very comfortable stylish carriage. We enjoyed the sit back and relax kind of atmosphere, looking out large windows at the changing scenery - grabbing photos of whatever took our fancy (try doing that on a plane!). The meals were very pleasant and the service was friendly and efficient. There was some on-board entertainment in the lounge throughout the journey - though we chose just to relax, take a snooze, read and generally enjoy the quiet and absorb the fabulous scenery.This train trip made a very pleasant alternative to the frantic pace of flying - the train station in Puno was quite relaxed with some local Andean entertainment provided to while away the time waiting for the train to depart.We would thoroughly recommend the Andean Explorer for its service, ambience and comfort. A great way to see the land from Puno to Cusco without the hassle of having to drive yourself.

Back from the Inkas. Really loved the relaxed - slow journey back....in comfort on time and with great service from the porters - the sky roof is also wonderful to get a real feel of the scale of the Andes around the train...

Front seat. I had the front seat, so looked out the front window of the Vista dome all the way to Aguas Calientes (Macchu Pichu). It was an amazing trip up and nice to get a small snack for afternoon tea. Staff were friendly and helped with luggage. The trio back was less interesting, but still pleasant.
along the urbamba river. great way to get to Machu pichu along the rapids of the river on a 1940s train...very cool indeed. Would do it again

Best way to go from Puno to Cusco (or vice versa). My Partner and I took the train from Puno to Cusco and were highly impressed. The cabins were roomy and it was beautifully presented- lovely chairs, table cloths, red rose, lamp on the table. The service was excellent, warm, friend and attentive. Food was good, considering it was served on a train. Lots of attention to details. They spread out entertainment throughout the day, and the observation deck was great to stretch the legs and watch the day go by. One tip, head to the back of the train as soon as morning tea is finished. We did and were spoilt with the view of going through a market which is set over the train track. The sellers grab their goods, umbrellas to move out of to the trains way as it goes through and then put everything back straight away. Some even leave things in the train track for the train to roll over the top. Lots of locals also stop and wave as the train comes past. You get lots of smiles as you wave back.

A pleasant way to see Lake Titicaca. Trains are not my favourite way to travel but the entertainment, observatory car, food and environment allowed our group to relax and enjoy the 9 hour journey. Yes, the last hour or so was rather tedious but the change in scenery and observing remote communities was really interesting.AND of course when you get to Lake Titicaca you will be dazzled by its beauty!
The Andean Explorer. From Cusco to Puno, this ten hour luxury train journey is fantastic! The scenery is awesome. The food superb. The entertainment is fun. Ten hours fly by.

Great scenery, comfortable & good food but wish it was quicker. We travelled from Cuco to Puno in November. The train's fit out is 1st class, the food and scenery very good, and the service good albeit a little slow at times.The are tables of four and two so if you're traveling as a couple you may want to see if you can get a table for two to avoid the risk of being stuck with someone you'd rather not spend 10 hours.Are only real concern was the length of the journey as the last few hours did seem to drag on but not being train enthusiasts we may be in the minority here.Would we do it again? Probably not. Would we recommend you do it once? Yes.

Amazing experience and even more amazing staff. We took Perurail from our hotel in Urubamba to km 104 to start our Machu Picchu trail hike and then the following day we took Perurail from Aguas Calientes to Cucso. The trains were clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.Most noteable however, was the service provided by the Aguas Calientes Perurail director, Arnaldo Ponce De Leon. Our tour operator had mistakenly booked our train to Cusco for November 28 instead of December 28th and when we got to the station in Aguas Calientes we learned that there were no spots on any Perurail train for the next 4 days. While this was a problem, the bigger problem was that we were scheduled to leave Peru in 3 days. We then met Arnaldo who worked tirelessly to find us 4 seats on a later train where there were a few no shows. I should point out that there were 2 other families who were in similar perdicaments and Arnaoldo was able to help them out as well. Arnaldo literally saved our vacation and for this we cannot thank him enough!

good seats + nice views. Took that train when coming back from Machu Picchu after walking on the Inca Trail. Scenery is nice and the train is comfortable. I went with my girlfriend in backpackers class as it was booked by an agency. Very comfortable but long ride back.

An outrage!. I'm very dissapointed in Perurail after seeing that locals can take the train to MP for just 20 soles. While the tourist pays almost 10 times as much. I'd like to hear something about that from Perurail. Sorry but half the people wont probably even need a snack,a drink, service and overpayed tourist books if that cuts the price alot. You already have 2 types of trains with a good service. At least make the cheapest train alot cheaper. Remove all the service and give the backpacker and budget travellers what they want. A real backpackers option!In my opinion it really ruins the name of Perurail.

Vistadome. I traveled on the Vistadome from Aguas Calientes to MP on December 16. My experience was very pleasant and the staff (Felipe, Nancy and Gilbert) were super helpful. They managed to reassign us seats 1 & 2 which are right next to the driver at the front of the train, this made the experience even more memorable.

Great way to travel. We took the Andean Explorer from Puno to Cusco on our recent trip to South America and also the Peru Rail vistacom train from Aguas Calientes (Machu Pichu) to Cusco. The Andean Explorer had its observation carriage unavailable on the first of our trips which was a shame. But the travel in both cases was a great experience - there's great food and entertainment included on each journey so well worth the experience!

Entertaining travel!. We used PeruRail for our travel from Aquas Calientes back to Cusco. There were four of us and we were seated at a table for four. They served drinks and a small lunch. The best part though was the fashion show in which the train attendants were the models! It was so entertaining and then you can purchase any of the items right there. They also had a Traditional dancer on board.There is a toilet on board with TP.There is also a plug in your section to charge your phone.The price was $106.00 pp. You will need your passport and picture ID for travel. I also suggest purchasing them in advance. They do fill up quickly. We purchased ours online. You will need your passport # ,CC# & birth dates to purchase online.

Preferred Vistadom over Expedition. Bought the ticket for this early November 15:35 Vistadom train from Ollantaytambo to Aguas Calientes just a half hour before-hand at the Olly trainstation ticket office. The left side has the best views by far traveling from Olly--> AC. Each train car has a toilet and we were given a nice snack and soft drink. It was just like an airline flight with at least 3 attendants. Yes, tickets ARE expensive.For the return Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo route we bought the tickets online a few MONTHS in advance for the 18:35 Expedition train as we had heard that trains departing AC tend to be busier - and were glad we did as it sold out a few days after we purchased them. The Peru rail waiting room in AC is just okay and in the late afternoon / evening is packed with very loud people (tourists) catching trains out of AC. There is only one attendant on the train car but the drink and snack was free. Luggage could be brought aboard. There were lot's of back packers. The train seemed to be more rocky then when we went the other way but maybe b/c we were coming down compared to climbing up, I don't know. If you can afford the difference then the Vistadom service is the way to go - in my humble opinion.

It was a wonderful train ride!. Took the train from an outlying Cusco station to Aguas Calientes and back again. Very helpful staff and comfortable seats. Very clean, even the bathrooms. Served a nice little snack. Passed through some beautiful scenery and the train was going slow enough to capture some good video footage. Enroute back to Cusco the train staff gave us a fashion show! All Peruvian products! I do believe this company has the best looking Peruvians of any firm in Peru! They are not only great looking/ handsome folks, but they give great service as well. 5 Stars for them!
nice tranquil ride. I took the ride back from Machu pichu to Cusco. I was fortunate and lucky enough to have a panoramic view. i took some amazing pictures, Very clean, fast ride.

Pricey but Pleasant. Our family traveled from Cuzco to Agua Caliente. The journey was beautiful but overpriced. Blake and Oscar were very helpful with ideas about places to see in Cuzco. If we were in the mood to buy more things, Blake's charm would have swayed us. The vista dome provides great views and is more comfortable than a tourist bus.

Great sleep. The train gently rocks back and forth in a swaying motion that since it was dark put me to sleep, lol A nice oriental woman sat next to me, we chatted for a while. She slept also. Perurail has two trains, one for the Peruvians (cheaper) and one for the tourists (you guessed it) I rode from Aqua Calentes to Ollytombo. Forget about riding the Peruvian scheduled train because your not allowed.....just the one for tourists.

Do your research. I unfortunately didn't do my research before I arrived at Cusco, and got stuck paying $300 USD for round trip tickets for 2 people from Ollanta to Aguas Calientes, and Aguas back to Cusco. I've read other reviews here saying this company and IncaRail are monopolies, and it definitely seems to be that way, I should have read up on it before I went to explore other options. The service itself was fine, there were drinks served on shorter route from Ollanta to Aguas, and then a full meal service (I guess I'd call it a snack, it was just a little empanada and a cookie) on the longer route from Aguas to Cusco. It just seemed way too expensive when a 5 hour bus ride in Peru costs $20, again back to the monopoly issue, there might not be any other choices than these rails so you'll get stuck with whatever they charge you.

Perfect train trip. Great service & fantastic scenery. We've travelled to Machu Picchu 3 times & from Cuzco to Puno & the reverse trip & have constantly recommended both these trips to everyone. The Andean Express to Puno is a fabulous journey - you must try it!

Just Amazing. One of my best experiences ever. Although I don’t mind rail travel, I did wonder how I was going to endure a 10 hour journey. No problem, every mile of the journey was full of enjoyment, from the lunch service by friendly and very hard working staff to the unforgettable sights along the way. The carriages are well-appointed with tables seating 4 in large armchairs on one side and 2 on the other. At the rear of the train is a fantastic open observation car which gave great opportunities for photographing the stunning scenery and every day Peruvian life, as we passed through towns and villages. On arrival all the luggage had been unloaded and neatly arranged for collection before we disembarked. This experience will leave me with an enduring impression of Peru.

This is a monopoly. And the government do nothing, is the must expensive train I've ever take, obviously is a tourism train but is also the only choice unless you are really full of time, I hate to pay for something that you are obligated to pay for.

Great experience. PeruRail was a great company to work with. You can find schedules and purchase and print tickets on-line. I had to change our tickets twice and was issued prompt refunds with friendly and efficient communications. The trains were on-time and comfortable. I have nothing but good things to say about PeruRail.

Nice Ride to Machu Picchu. Took the VistaDome from Urumbamba to Machu Picchu the first week of December. Did not know what to expect from Peru Rail, but needless to say I was not let down. Although slow (it's a narrow guage line and moves through many rural villages) it was comfortable and the views were fantastic out of the huge windows (and we were lucky to get a front row seat on the way up (although it rained)! The service was excellent and I no more expected to be served drinks or snacks prior to the trip so what a wonderful surprise!! Cars were clean and comfortable and a lot of fun! (if only AMTRAK could be so nice)! Peru Rail rocked.

Take the Vistadome. We rode the Expedition 81 to Machu Picchu from Ollantaytambos and the Vistadome from Machu Picchu to Cusco. The experience on the Vistadome was much more enjoyable. They served a meal and cocoa tea and coffee. The views out the windows are amazing

Train Ride of a Lifetime-Orient Express!!. Was dreading a 10 hour train ride but what a treat!!! Luxurious train that was not only comfy, food and service was excellent with fun entertainment onboard besides fantastic scenery of the Andes from an observation car! The 10 hours went by so fast and was not even tired. If you have ever seen the Polar Express, this train ride really reminded me of that movie!! The entire staff lined up at the end of the trip and applauded all the passengers who rode on the train and I felt like we were the ones that should have been applauding them for their superb service that was most memorable on our trip from Puno to Cusco.
Lovely Train Ride. This was a great experience. We enjoyed the view through the large windows. The train was very clean. We even got snacks and beverages on the journey! Recommend the Perurail train.

Pleasantly Suprised. This is the best way to travel to Machu Picchu. Unless you really want to spend 3 days hiking the Inca Trail. You can take the train all the way from Cusco to Machu Picchu or from the Sacred Valley. My tour picked up PeruRail in the Sacred Valley since there was much to see there. The seats were comfortable and I liked having a table to write in my journal. Also, they have beverage service and sell items on the train. Highly recommend it.
Comfortable, great way to see parts of Peru. The train was extremely confortable and clean. I Loved the windows on the roof of the train so you can really see the gorgeous Peru landscape

Enjoyable way to travel. I don't know whether I have to have an unexpected fashion show, performed by the staff, on a train ride but it certainly was a fun experience. Both trains to and from Aguas Calientes were clean, warm, comfortable, on time, service very friendly. We went one way with the Expedition train (a bit cheaper, snack and tea or soft drink included, panoramic windows), the other way, because of the schedule, with Vistadom (bit more expensive, panoramic windows, nicer meal with table sets and a little plant decoration on each table as well as the above-mentioned fashion show). An unusual, enjoyable way to travel.

Comfortable journey to Machu Picchu. Peru Rail is the dominate rail transport to Machu Picchu. I took Vistadome both ways and it was comfortable enough. A complimentary snack and drink was provided during the journey through the landscape. The one thing I will warn travelers on is the baggage policy. You are not allowed to bring large suitcases with you as Peru Rail is unable to properly store them on the train. I did not know about this and had to frantically change my train route on one segment in Ollantaytambo's Peru Rail office (thankfully no change fees or paying the fare difference) so that I could allow my hotel to store them away until I return. The maximum weight you can carry is 5 kilograms or 11 pounds. Please plan accordingly before you leave for Peru.

Fun trip by rail. The service on this round rail trip from Ollanta to Aguas Calientes exceeded our expectations. That may have been helped by the fact that we had the front seats on the Vistadome. Scenery was fantastic and the views from the train were excellent. Staff served refeshments and were very courteous.Other than trekking, this is supposedly the only way to travel to Machu Picchu, although google maps suggest that there is a road. This must be right since there is clearly road traffic in Aguas Calientes (the nearest town to Machu Picchu).

Good service to Machu Picchu. The train trip is slow and steady. Announcements of the stops (and info about them) are in Spanish and English. There was space on my train, during off season. They were very accomodating in helping me change my seat. Service was good.

Wonderful trip to Aguas Calientes. You can go by Expedition or Vistadome cars. Either one are good but Expedition is cheaper than Vistadome. Both have panoramic view. Expedition has a simple meal during the trip and if you are going to do Inka Trail you will have do get off at 82 km or 104 km depending if it is going to be the short or the long trail. Vistadome has a little bit more on the meal and has a small peruvian presentation of dance and clothes.

Take it!! You won't regret it!. Very scenic ride with great service! Got to see parts of the country that we wouldn't have if it wasn't for the train. We left early in the morning and brought the last one of the day back. We even had entertainment on the way back.

Expensive, poor service at ticket sales. Outrageously expensive! It is indeed one of the most expensive train rides by distance in the world and the service is really not great. 3.5 hours to travel 92km? Booking the ticket at the office in Cusco was not a smooth process either. The ticket seller managed to book the wrong train, input the wrong passport details and then charged too little on my credit card making me pay an additional charge by cash. I took the vistadome to Machu Picchu which left at 08:25. It was already quite warm at this time and the air-conditioning barely seemed to work and alternated between too cold and too hot. I requested a window seat and even though two were available, they did not allow me to change seat. Of course with all the glass around the views are not too bad even on the aisle seat, but it does make photography a lot harder. The background music is a bit too loud and incredibly irritating. The meal provided was 3 cold mini-pancakes, 2 strawberries, 1 small banana and a warm mini spinach quiche. Also consider wearing sunscreen and a hat etc since the sun is quite strong with all the glass windows on the roof. On the return I took the expedition train, which seemed very similar inside, also with poor air conditioning. They provided one free refreshment and a bun or muffin. Same irritating music throughout. Overall the service was unfriendly with one or two staff members making an exception and genuinely trying to interact with passengers. Considering that this is a foreign investment and that most income probably leaves the country, it is quite appalling.

Good service, but don't like the selling of product part. We took the train from scared valley to machu pichu. the train was very comfortable. they serve snacks during the trip. I didn't like the fact that they were very pushy for selling goods. there was a fasion show to sell alpaca product. they stopped the train to do this fasion show and really pushy asking people to buy stuff.

just ok. excelent service, very expensive train ride i did only ride the train on my way back from machupichu the views from the train is just of the river, i had amazing views from my bus ride going to machupichu thru santa teresa
Horrible air quility inside. Own train engine smoke is directly coming in, no air conditioning.. horrible 10 hours in "jail" with almost same scenery. The worst experience in my life.

Best customer service!. I had several changes that needed to be made to my travel... I changed my travel dates... I missed my train and needed another alternative to get to Aguas Caliente so on and so on... PeruRail handled everyone of my problems and for that I am truly grateful...

Great service. We took Peru rail from ollyantaytambo station to Aguas caliente station to go to macchu Picchu. The train was on time, clean and service staff was very polite and service in total is good. The trains runs smoothly and no hiccups.

Now THIS is a train ride!. The train ride from Aguas Calientes to Ollantaytambo was remarkable! We had taken the train at night to Aquas Callientes and although there was food service, it was pretty quiet and most people slept. On the way back, it was during the day and we could see the lovely views through the mountains and were treated with culinary delights! There was also music and dancing as a prelude to a fashion show put on by the crew that was quite entertaining! The purpose of the show was to sell clothing and I believe that mission was accomplished. It made the 2 hour ride go very quickly!

perurail. Nice experience were we can find people from around all planet!!!We enjoyed board service, seats where clean like all the train and the entertainment offered by the staff was fun and relaxing.The landscape on the trip is amazing.

Trip to Machu. The train service was excellent and the timings were good. The only issue was the leg space between the seats. I am average height person and legs were hurting after this 3:30 minute trip

"Slow coach " but lots of fun!. I travelled from Cuzco to Puno by Andean Explorer managed by Peru Rail. The train had a similar feel to the Orient Express with well trained staff looking after the passengers. I had a table to myself and a very comfortable armchair to relax on. Well presented, tasty Peruvian food was served a few times during the journey, accompanied by fine wine and champagne. Peruvian musicians and dancers entertained the travellers in the last wagon of the train, which also served as a viewing gallery for those wanting to watch the ever changing,diverse scenery. The train stopped a couple of times along the way, letting us visit a small church and a local arts and crafts market. The journey was very long, lasting nearly 12 hours,but I chose this mode of travel for its charm and the fascinating outside scenery. The length of time that it took to reach the final destination became only a "moment in time" when compared to the lasting memories of the overall experience.

Magical amazing experience. We travelled from Cusco to Puno...from beginning to end this train journey was world class...it offered first class views, gorgeous food, great comfort staff were lovely. Good value for money, there is no other way to travel between these two places. You won't be disappointed!

Transportation to Machu Picchu. PeruRail is one of two options to travel to Machu Picchu. It is a 3hr ride and a roundtrip ticket cost as much as my one way plane fare from Lima to Cusco. They say that you must be there 30 mins in advance and there is absolutely no reason for this. The station was packed, we stood around simply waiting to board and for no good reason.
